reviews.review: Table Mountain Adventure. This was quite an experience particularly if you'd not been on a cable car before. From we left the lower station the cabin began to revolve. It was a very good idea since all the occupants got the opportunities to see the views as we traveled up. The scenery was breathtaking. It was a very smooth sensation all the way up. Being on the summit was fantastic with panoramic views all around. Also a very nice restaurant serving food and refreshments. All in all a great day out.
“Incredible from start to finish”. A must visit! You will not be will not be disappointed. Its fun and safe. And something you'll remember for a lifetime.

Wonderful view of Cape Town. We lucked out with no clouds on the tabletop until we left. Not always easy to get a clear day when the mountain is not covered with clouds. Beautiful walk around the top.

Excellent service. I would like to thank the staff at the cable way who went out of their way to help, I was there with my sister and her partner, who is paralyzed and in a wheelchair - from when we were looking for parking already there was someone helping and directing us. I was so proud of everyone that works there and super proud to be South African as my sisters partner is from the UK and couldn't believe how helpful and wonderful everyone is here in our gorgeous SA. Once again thank you.Kind RegardsKaren
WOOW!. a MUST while in CAPE TOWN! definitively have to take the cableway up to TABLE MOUNTAIN to get to see Cape Town from the air.

Great way up Table Mountain. Probably one of the smartest cableways I've been to. With a circular shape and revolving floor you get a true 360 degree view of the surrounding area while enjoying the ride up and down.
Amazing Service. Great ride.. Always recommend to do Internet booking to avoid the long que at the ticketing counter. Number 1 place to visit in cape town.

Must do in Cape Town. This is a wonderful feat of engineering. Views from the top are magical.On a clear day you can get uninterrupted views of greater Cape Town or at other times the misty clouds remind you just how high up you really are.There is a coffee and gift shop at the top.Check before setting out that the Cableway is open.Closed due high winds. No view if heavy clouds.

Just an ok experience . We really waited to get to table mountain, but the truth is that it was quite disappointing. You spend a terribly long time in lines, even though we bought tickets online and than you get to the top and it is so crowded that it's hard to even find a place to take a picture.Yes, the views are spectacular, but as an overall experience (including the really bad restaurant there), it was just ok.

A must see! . Long queues to get to the cableway but worthy! Make sure to buy your ticket before you get there otherwise you will have to wait a long longer... We took the sightseeing bus to get up there and then you can get the ticket in the bus. The restaurant up there was nice too :) you will spend almost the whole day on this activity.

Fantastic views. After reading reviews on here we pre-booked our tickets for the cablecar. We still had to queue for nearly an hour before reaching the top of the mountain, however this was still quicker than buying tickets on the day, as after spending an hour and half on the top, we met people in the non ticket queue just arriving at the top.Be prepared to walk to the cable car station, as parking is limited at the station area. We parked further down the hill and had a 10min uphill walk.The cable car is modern and spins 360 as you go up, which is a full turn giving everybody a view at the open window at the front and rear of the cable car. We stood by the opposite door, by the time we had spun to the open window it was perfect for photos.Once at the top you can walk around a smooth footpath, with various places to go off the path and walk over rockier parts to get better views/photos.There are toilets, cafe and a gift shop.Despite queuing with hundreds of visitors, once your at the top it feels spacious and less busy. The views are amazing and well worth a visit. We lucked out with the weather , the cloud lifted and showed Cape Town in all its finest.Would defiantly recommend

Worth doing for Great Views. We went up to Cable Car at 9am on a Saturday. There were long queues and there was cloud on the mountain so we left. We asked the bus driver and he recommended going between 3 -4pm. We went back on the Sunday at 3 pm - no queue at all. Walked straight onto the cable car. It is really great because it rotates 360deg as it ascends so everyone gets to see the views across the bay. Great views from the top of Table Mountain in all directions and paths laid out to do different walks.
Great!. The revolving cable car has wonderful views of the city below. Great experience! The cable car didn't go up in the morning because of strong winds but luckily that died down around midday.
Be prepared for a disorganised queue. Queued for about 90 minutes in the sun with not much segregation of ticketed and non ticketed guests. Bring water

Amazing view . It's a good way to go down with the cable car when you finished your hike or start with the cable car and hike down. If you are in the cable car, the thing you are standing on is going around. So everyone get's a great view and the change to make pictures. They can take a lot of people @ the time and it goes pretty fast. Great way to see the view of the city and the mountain if you have problems with walking.

Excellent Service Standards. My father's birthday fell on a Saturday and he was able to get a free cableway ticket on that day as a result so I decided to take him as a birthday treat. My mother is a pensioner and she could get pensioner's discount but only on a Friday. I contacted the company and they not only allowed him to use his birthday comp a day early but also fully comped my mother's ticket. I was amazed at the effort they made. I paid full price for my ticket.On the day my mother was too ill to join us but we decided to go anyway. When we arrived there were no more wheelchair parking places available but a member of staff moved some barriers to make a space for us. We were greeted with smiles and helpfulness every step of the way. When my ticket wouldn't scan they simply let me use my mother's rather than spoil the outing. Despite the wheelchair, we were able to navigate everywhere he was curious to explore. We enjoyed a wonderful, hearty, affordable, tasty and nutritious lunch with the most helpful and cheerful of service all the way. Ten out of ten!On our return to the lower station we were assisted through the waiting crowds and to the lift.I wanted to write this review because I couldn't fault the service at any stage. They even refunded my unused ticket in full! I am involved in the tourism industry and can honestly say that I am proud of the international standards that have been set and put into action at one of our international icons!

Great view, frustrating experience . Having done table mountain before, we knew to do it as soon as you have a clear day in case it is closed due to weather. We had about a 1hr wait at the bottom which is to be expected. There are great walkways up top. However when we finished the walks and decided to go get a drink and ice cream to watch the sunset, we were surprised to find no shops open- they all closed at 4pm!! You could aonly buy water and coffee from the coffee store.Then the real frustration began- getting back down! Last cable car is supposed to leave at 7pm. We lined up at 6:15pm and did not get down to the bottom until 8:45pm! Tour groups kept getting priority which meant we kept getting pushed further back. Didn't make for a nice end to the table mountain experience
Wow!. Well worth taking the cable up Table Mountain. Very fun afternoon. Make sure a day with blue skies and no to little clouds or your view will be blocked. Parking can be tricky.

Great view of cape town. We took the cableway up to the top. The lines are pretty long. Supposedly you can walk up to the top of cable mountain but we decided not to choose that option. The view at the top was amazing. It was worth the trip up.

Best cable car trip in the world. For many reasons, too many to mention, I went up and down with the cable car about twelve times over two days - what a wonderful experience with very knowledgeable and friendly staff.

A wander indeed!!. Table Mountain is God's wander and you've got to be there to understand. it is better to plan ahead and give yourself at least a day on Table mountain to enjoy the magnificent view, flora. you can also just enjoy lazying around on the flat top in between the rocks. there are always friendly staff to assist just in case you end up on the wrong side of the mountain on your way back. The weather in Cape Town can change quickly most of the times from foggy to clear, cold to warm, so with enough time up there you may still catch good views in between weather changes. One thing for sure, Cape Town never disappoints!!

The roof of capetown . The all way up slowly the view become more and more beautifull !The view and the colors that you can see from the top of table mountain is with no dout the most beautifull view on Capetown ! Love it

Loved the cafe, awesome ambiance and great food.... Come one, come all if you have not been, this is one of the highlights of your trip, definely worth flying to see, they have a great food selection at the cafe and awesome staff as well, but please follow the rules, check ahead of time if there are any clouds which may obstruct your view, but this is a champion of a experience
GR8 Engineering. It was wonderful to go up the cable way...though i recon that the trek up wud also be wonderful...the nature lovers will relish it and there are some wonderful trails....

Amazing views, but make sure you are well prepared. This is a top attraction and it gets very busy so plan ahead and aim to go early. Although it's a little cooler up there make sure you are completely covered in sun cream and wear a hat. I forgot mine, and although it was a cloudy morning the sun came out when we were up there, and you have to queue outside to take the cable car back. In only 15 minutes I suffered some sunburn that was sore for days later. Make sure you are prepared, but the trip is worth it for the incredible views.

Worth the Ride. One of the most sought after attractions in Cape Town..more than 50 years old, if I am right. We took the Cable car to the mountain top.... it took about 5 minutes and does a 360* turn during a trip which gives a panoramic view of the place.It is well managed and the rush is properly contained..... The restaurant up the mountain is well designed without distrcting the views.
Stunning views. We experienced a breathtaking view of the mountain in our ascent to the top through the window of the cable car.The mountain has a majestic view that spans the peninsula

Long lines are worth the view. You have to go to the top of Table Mountain if you are in Cape Town. The views are absolutely spectacular! The lines can be rough and make sure you keep an eye on the weather, because if it gets too windy, the cable car will stop running and you will have to walk down.
Pleasure. Enjoy the visit.If possible book the tickets first so you dont have to line up to get one.Check the weather so you can get a clear view once you are up there

Amazing. Although the vista was terrible as we couldn't see much because if the fog (which we have been told to be very common) and our was very cold (in July) we have an amazing time. Once in there too of the mountain we had hot chocolate.

Table mountain . I went up on Valentine's Day. It was an after six ride during summer. It was an amazing experience. The views are breathtaking. I have been on cable cars in other countries nothing beats Cape Towns one. For the simple reason it combines awesome views of the ocean and the city alongside one another. As dark falls the views become even more amazing.
A must. The most beautiful mountain with astounding views. The ride up and down is a fun fantastic experience. Would go up every day if I could.

A view to die for!. first check for bad weather, if it rains they shut it down, if its too cloudy you miss the view, but once you are up, enjoy the view, walk around as there is a nature trail, grab some souvenirs, take lots of selfies, hot coffee or a meal. Loved it!
Incredible views - top of of the world - tip of Africa!. You need to work out where you are in Cape Town, where north is and relative to Cape Point. This is the place to do it!

The natural wonder of the cape. Ascending to the top of the mountain in the ultra modern cable car is a truly magnificent experience. The 360 degree views given by the rotating car helps to enhance the experience. The natural beauty and the impressive views make this an all round exciting experience.

Queuing spoiled it. Although we went in the quietest afternoon period, it took over half an hour to buy tickets so that we could join another queue to go up. The ascent in the cabin has a rotating floor so everyone gets to see right round. When we got to the top which was very warm, we looked at the stunning views, found that the cafe had closed at 4pm and that there was a tremendous queue to get down again. All in all we spent 2 hours for 10 minutes looking at the views.We won't bother again.
it moves. When getting in, don't worry where you stand as the whole Gondola rotates, so you can all get good photos of the trip up and back. it is a good trip

amazing views and a great hike to do up to the top of the mountain. It takes a couple of hours to climb to the top of Table Mountain but the views on the way up make up for it all.Its an amazing place with amazing views as you walk throught the fynbos, proteas and heather. There is a restaurant at the top and you can get the cableway down. Its a great day trip out.

Truly deserves the title of one of the new natural wonders of the world.. Despite industrial action taking place, the members who were working made sure everything ran as smoothly as possible. The queue was a little slower but the staff polite and apologetic, and got as many people through as humanly possible in the shortest space of time. At all times keeping their cool, and being extremely friendly. In fairness to the strikers, they did not interfere with the tourists and at no time did we feel threatened. Although the mountain has hike routes and you can also ride up walk down,for us the cable car is was must to get to the top. It turns very slowly giving a good 360 view, and it feels as if it is over far to fast. This is a national park, not a fake Disneyland, so the top involves lots of walking on well planed routes, wooden bridges and walkways,, that have minimal impact to the natural environment. This is not the EU, there are barriers at points but the natural feel and surround has not been marred by man made blockades to stop people going to the edge or climbing over rocks. . Watch your children. Teach them to respect the natural flora and fauna. On a clear day the view is amazing, the air early morning crystal clear, the walk exhilarating. Poor weather could prevent the car going up so always check. Low cloud or a table cloth could change your experience,so try to have a few days ear marked and go the first time you see the mountain clear. There is a web link and fb page to check. The cable car ride is around 5 minutes either way,the time needed at the top is up to you but, don't rush, budget at least half the day sit back relax and enjoy the view. This truly deserves the title of one of the new natural wonders of the world.

Cape Town's Natural Wonder. I was taken up the mountain as a birthday gift. Free of course, because that's how nice the people of Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is. Were treated to wonderful breakfast on top of the mountain, followed by taking breathtaking photos afterwards. Every picture taken on the mountain has a spectacular backdrop with the beauty of the Cape behind. A must for every South African and anyone visiting Cape Town
AERIAL VIEW OF THE CITY. My wife and I took a trip up Table Mountain; it was both exciting and a sense of being very vulnerable and exposed.

Cape town. from the cable car. Great views, cold at the top in October, be mindful of the clouds. We were almost caught. Lovely at the bottom, clouds coming over the top very quickly, just got photographs in time before total white out. We purchased our tickets from Australia which gave us 7 days to pick our day to travel up the mountain.
Cable Car. Awesome views, experience, and good food at the restaurant. Take jackets along as the weather can change I I instant.
Wonderful scenic experience with the cable car turing around. One of 2 cable cars going up and revolving in the round for a view for everybody. The other is the one in Palm Springs California
Fun!. If you're going up Table Mountain, you're taking the cable car. It's a lot of fun, and the views up and down are as spectacular as Tom the summit.

Fantastic View point over Cape Town. The Cableway is something you have to take when you are in Cape Town, it can be busy so choose the good moment. Once on the top you can take a nice walk and be amased by the views you get.

SPECTACULAR VIEWS. On arrival at table mountain a photographer took photos of us ,photos were excellent.Views from the cable car was wonderful but you must try to get into the cablecar first to get upfront to the windows to get a better view.

A Beautiful Day Makes All the Difference. Very cool that the cable car turns 360 so you can appreciate the entire vista. Really enjoyed the well laid out trails on top with pretty good signage as to what you were seeing.

Unforgettable experience. A great way to experience one of the worlds most outstanding natural features. Allow time to explore the top and drink in the expansive views across the surrounding countryside. Time it right and the ride down can be preceded by the sight of the sun sinking beyond the horizon

Awesome Views!. What wonderful views! The cable car can be a bit crowded. Try to stand near a wall...doesn't matter where as the car rotates slowly on the way up so you get 360º views. Go later in the afternoon for fewer crowds. Taxi drivers will wait nearby and you can call them to pick you up when you come down! The views from the top are spectacular and there are lots of walking paths and vantage points. Don't rush! Take your time and enjoy!
Table Mtn, Cablecar. 360 degree views on revolving floor.. Smooth ride. Don't lose your ticket so you can go back down. Great

Just walk up and avoid the ridiculous queue!. We booked online and arrived early only to have to queue for almost two hours. To be fair the cable car had been closed for maintenance the previous two weeks but even so tour companies etc seemed to get fast tracked in front of us. I would walk up next time!

Well worth the long wait even when purchasing tickets online. This was our second visit to Cape Town and all six previous attempts to use the cable car had failed because of poor weather. We purchased our tickets online to "jump the queue" but still had to wait for over an hour before were we able to get into the cable car. The wait was worth it as the rotating car provided wonderful views of Cape Town and its environments. Whilst we we on the Mountain the clouds came in and obscured the view but we saw enough to justify the trip. The restaurant on top gets very busy with long queues even for drinks so is best avoided.

Great views and it rotates!. First cable car I have used where it rotates as it moves giving the same views to everyone. It's a nice easy way to the top of table mountain or a one way trip if you climb up or down - I suggest up by the way. It's around £7.50 one way, little less than double for return.

Awesome Views. The view from Table Mountain was breathtaking but make sure to wear warm clothes and a scarf as it is quite cold and windy at the top. Also prepare to wait in long lines to catch a cable to the top. If you are physically fit and up for a challenge hike up to the top. My friends did and they said it was unforgettable.....

A must do in Cape Town . I'd recommend buying tickets in advance from tourist offices as there are often queues at the base of the mountain, but this is a really worthwhile experience.The cable car is real well organised and the base rotates so it really doesn't matter if you have a window view when you get in. The walks on the top are suitable for any fitness levels and there are opportunities for abseiling etc for those more adventurous.There are facilities, restaurants, wifi rooms, toilets on top and opportunities to engage with local flora and fauna including rock hyrax who are quite tame! The views from Table Mountain are incredible and not to be missed!
Nice way to finish a hike!. We took the Cable Car down to Finish our 4hr long hike. it was a nice way to see down town Cape Town overview, with amazing views as far as the eye could see!
Great view. Amazing view but hours of waiting. Of the queue is long make sure you buy your tickets online. However if the wether is nice and there are no clouds, it is absolutely worth it!!

Good experience . There is a discount ticket for senior only on Friday. Return ticket is 255 R, make sure to keep ticket safely otherwise you might need to walk down!! The cable's floor are moving so everyone can see 360' view.

Much better than hiking up!. 360 degree view of Cape Town, with views that are eye popping. We road the Hop On Hop Off bus to the location and had purchased tickets in advance. My best advice: BUY TICKETS IN ADVANCE! The line to buy tickets on location was very long, and you go from there to a long line to enter. We waited ~30 minutes to board, which wasn't too bad, and only 8-10 minutes for a return car. Up top, there are facilities for food, drink and restrooms. We took advantage of the wifi bar just to enjoy the AC and cool down.
Amazing ride. Well worth the queues and going up to the top. Get your tickets online and it will reduce the length of waiting time.

One big reason to visit Capetown.. You have the option of hiking up the mountain or taking the cable car, I have done both, and both are great options to getting to the top. Hiking is longer and it is quite a steep climb. The views are spectacular

Nice and windy . Do it, because It's a natural wonder. But It's often closed because of weather conditions - check online before! You are getting a fantastic view over the cape, but it is very windy there to - don't forget a warm jacket and somethink to protect your ears. It's just a 5 minutes ride up and/or down, but you have to wait normally about 30-45 minutes (down waiting is usually longer).There is a free parking area just next the circle, when you enter the street - use it and the free bus shuttle to the upper Tafelberg station. The walk down is a great experience, but even takes 2hours!

Sunday Morning Fun. We arrived with our tour group around 10 a.m. on Sunday morning. Had to stand in line for an hour and we already had tickets. The line of vehicles going up the mountain was endless. Then, when we were ready to come down, the line was long, long again. Recommend you go during the week and even at that go early. The farther into the day you go, the longer the line gets.

Saves the hike!. The weather is always tricky when it comes to table mountain. The day we wanted to go up the mountain was fairly cloudy and not very clear. Decided to do it anyway so took the cable car up. The cable car was pretty quick and the views on the way up were amazing. The floor of the cable car rotates as you go up so you can see every direction. When we got to the top after a while the clouds parted and the sun started shining. Would recommend taking the cable car as it means you have the energy to walk around on top of the mountain. Make sure you pay for a return ticket to get back down!

A most unusual mountain top.. As there is no vehicular access to the top, you would be well advised to keep at least the whole morning or afternoon for the trip. The Gondola, although large, has limited carrying capacity, and on the day we visited, due to the crowds, we had to stand in one for 40 minutes for each trip. As the cabin spins slowly 360-degrees as it travels up/down, it is not at all necessary to make a rush for the windows.

fantastic view. Visited Table Mountain with my family, definitely a must do in Cape Town. The day we visited the queue was quiet short so hardly no waiting time. A quick trip to the top and what a view when you get there. Well worth the trip
Smooth and well run. Perfect way to reach the top without huffing And puffing your way up. 2 cable cars alternate and the capacity of each is around 25 or so. Takes you up in about 5 mins.

Bucket List Experience!. For most visitors to Cape Town climbing the majestic Table Mountain is just not an option so what a blessing it is that one can still experience this wonder of nature with the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. To avoid the snaking queues I recommend you try getting there as early as possible. Enjoy!

A must do when in Cape Town. I live in Cape Town! One never grows tired of that mountain especially on a beautiful summers evening, no wind and you take your picnic basket up there and picnic on the rocks with a glass of bubbly and watch the sunset.Be aware that it could get very cold as soon as the sun sets so make sure you pack in a warm jacket.A long walk along the mountain will take you to see the other side of the ocean to Muizenberg. Just be very careful where you walk and have sunscreen on.

As a visitor to Cape Town, this is easy, fairly quick and an absolute MUST DO. Its a quick ride up to the top of Table Mountain from where there are vistas over Cape Tpwn city and harbour, across to the rest of the City, and also around to Twelve Apostles/Camps Bay side. At about 1000m, your viewpoint is high above, yet close to the city below. Take a jersey in summer or a coat in winter. Especially when the wind is blowing it can get really cold up there. When the wind is extreme the cable car shuts down, but they give you plenty of warning before the last ride down. There is also a restaurant up there as well as places to buy cold rink and snacks. I last went to the restaurant many years ago and it was awful. Find out when sunset is, and the time of the last ride down, during your visit and see if you can time your visit to ride up just before sunset, watch the sunset from up there, view the city lights after dark, and then come down
Table mountain outing. Good visit with family. Liked the outdoors experience and the efficiency of the staff. Beautiful tranquil surroundings and lots of hiking opportunities
Stunning views. A great way to reach the summit of Table Mountain. We booked online and saved time in the queue. Check to see how long the wait time is.
Don't miss the opportunity to view Cape Town from the top. An absolute must if you visit Cape Town. Take the first opportunity to go as the wind can come up quickly & the cable car won't run.

Spectacular. Brilliant experience. Must be one of the world's best landmarks. Absolutely loved it and if you come to Cape Town and miss out on the spectacular views and breathtaking scenery that Table Mountain offers then you really have missed out!

Worth the wait!!!. This excursion is very weather dependent and was closed for 2 days due to high winds. Managed it on the morning before leaving and although we had to queue for 90 minutes ( with prepaid tickets) it was worth it. Ride in the cable car is unusual as the floor rotates as you travel up, allowing everyone to see all round. On arrival, trails around top give spectacular views. Just remember the queue to go back down if you are on a time limit.

Astounding 360° views if the weather is right. There is no better way to see all of Cape Town than from the top of Table Mountain. We lucked out with an excellent clear warm day. We could see for hundreds of miles in every direction. There is a café at the top and a guided walkway. Lots of photo opportunities. If you want to hike to the top, that is also doable. I hear it takes about an hour.
Sunny Holiday Sunday. Lovely views but horrendous views turned our visit into a marathon of waiting in queues - whole experience took almost 5 hrs

beautiful views. The table mountain aerial cableway is a safe and quick way to experience the beauty of table mountain. The cable car floor rotates 360 degrees en route up and down the mountain. The panoramic view over the city bowl and table bay is splendid. The cable car is well maintained and is up to date with the latest technology ensuring a safe and reliable ride. Enjoy the restaurant and the viewing platforms on the maintain, activity ideally suited to fair weather days.
360 degree views add to the beauty of park. Quite efficient service and nice ride. Amazing 360 degrees views on way.Better on pre book tickets online to avoid long queues.

Must see sight; must-do instructions!. If in Cape Town, and the weather allows, you must go up Table Mountain. While some people are fit enough (and have the time) to walk up, for most taking the cable car up is the best and easiest way. It's become super popular, so you will have to queue, but it is worth it. Some tips:- Do purchase your tickets online, and come in the afternoon or *very first thing* in the morning if your schedule allows. Of necessity, we arrived at 9:30am and the wait was over an hour (10 mins on the way down)- Take the time to really walk around up on the mountain. Yes it's nice to see the view and take a photo near the upper station, maybe grab a coffee, but the really special thing to do is to go on one of the hikes up on the mountain, anything from 20 mins to 2 hours. You'll get away from the crowds quite quickly.- Be prepared (dress/weather). It's written all over the place, but still many people came in flip flops and t-shirts and then were freezing up at the top. Recognize weather up there may be different than down below, and may change in flash. Be prepared.- Watch out for poor queuing behaviour. A bunch of locals(?) tried to cut in front in line and we had to send them packing -- after at least a dozen people pretended to not notice or otherwise wanted to not be confrontational- Uber it. Parking near the lower station is very limited. An uber cost <$5 each way to downtown Cape Town. We left our car in the hotel and were happy for it.

Breathtaking . Wonderful activity to do whilst in Cape Town. The cableway is well run, the staff are funny and helpful and the views are spectacular. They do fit a lot of people into the car so enter quickly and stake a spot at a window otherwise you can be crowded out from seeing the amazing sights.
great views. great views in cable car , very well organised , can be long queue to get onto cable car outside so prebook ticket on line

Must do on a clear day. On a clear day, Table Mountain offers spectacular 360 degree views. The Aerial Cableway can get crowded when the buses arrive so plan to get there early. Parking is along the road as there is no proper parking lot. Best to but tickets on line and send to your mobile as well. Once on top of the mountain, there are many different walks you can enjoy. If you venture far enough, you will see the trail where the adventurous hike up to the top.

Late-day visit. I am usually the type of person who enjoys looking up at a mountain rather than going to the top of one, but this is pretty spectacular. It's more than just a ride to the top: there are really nice walking trails once you get up top and magical views of the city and harbor. It's also fun to see the cute rock hyraxes (dassies) sunning themselves on rock outcrops at dizzying heights. Your experience is highly dependent on the time of day you arrive. We went up around 3:30 pm, which gave us time to walk the trails and see the sunset. But, beware of long wait times to get down! We stood in line for an hour waiting to get down. Also, if you have parked along the roadway near the ticket office, it could be totally dark when you return. We needed to use our phones' flashlights to light our way.
Easy . For someone who is afraid of heights the cable car was not bad at all. Before you know it you are up on the mountain.
Best way to get to the top of table mountain. Spectacular views from the cable car. I was a bit disconcerted at the number on each cable car but it was well managed and I didn't feel at all unsafe

Must do. A beautiful ride on a clear day. Wonderful view of the city and the 360degree rotation of the car gives you a complete view. If you are health conscious then one side of the trip is adventure if done on foot

Unique!. The cars hold about 60 people, if memory serves correct. The operator is in the middle and the car is round. Once underway the floor starts to rotate, so during the course of the ride up or down, you are given a 360 degree view. Very cool!

Breath taking views. Best visited when the mountain in not covered in cloud, so make sure you are flexible as to when you can visit. The cableway ride was faster than I thought and the cabin rotates 360 enabling everyone good views as you ascend and descend the mountain. Not for those who are scared of heights!
poor only because too popular . I had paid in advance to go in the cable car but unfortunately there was a queue approx 1.5km long. we didn't have time but they did refund us straight away
360 degree views. The rotating cable car is an excellent way to see the views, no one can be in your way, a steep climb at the end. Very friendly, helpful staff.

Fast and efficient with great views. We took the cableway as I could talk my wife into walking !! Dont worry about jostling for position to get views back over Capetown as the car rotates throughout the journey so everyone gets a great view. We only had to queue for 5 minutes before we were ascending. Really worth the money

Exciting, a must do!. The cable cars take aroumd 60 people, so the lines move quickly. Unparalleled views at the top, as well as flora. This is a must, so go the first chance you have when the sky is clear, as the weather can change quickly up there.

Great day out. Amazing view of Cape Town, pre book & pay your ticket online - else you que (wait in line twice) Once to buy ticket and again to get onto cable car. Great combo to also buy 2 day city sightseeing tour bus (hop on hop off) since the cable car departure point is a stop on the bus route

Great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. We chose to use the Cableway to reach the top of Table Mountain, partly because we were not sure we were up to the walk in the very warm weather and partly because we wanted to enjoy the time at the summit and do some other things during that day. Especially for the cableway, it is very important to chose to visit on a day that is not too windy (and of course you don't want a really cloudy day because you want see anything at the top) because the cableway cannot run if the wind is too strong. I would also advise buying you tickets ahead. When you arrive, there will be two lines - one for people with online tickets (you can also get these on the Hop-on - Hop-off bus) and one for people with no tickets. The one for "no tickets" is much longer. The ride to and from the summit is quick but offers really nice views and you arrive refreshed and able to enjoy the many walks on the summit.
Great views!. We travelled down only but from the hike we could see queues forming at the bottom quite early so get there early. Good way to see views over Cape Town!

Best way to get to the top of Table Mountain! Great views on way up!. This is definitely the best and fastest way to get to the Top of Table Mountain. Hiking is not for the faint-hearted as the steps are very steep! You get to enjoy great 360 degrees view of surroundings as the base of the cable car rotates as it goes up.1. Do check online prior to going as the Aerial Cableway is closed during bad weather.2. You can buy tickets online prior to going (or when you're there) and join a shorter queue.3. If you drive there, there are parking attendants that would direct you to park at their lots. If you park too early, you'll have a long walk. One tip is to get to the Cableway station to drop off passengers and then turn back down and park at the nearest available lots.

A GREAT EXPERIENCE. We queued for an hour and the rip took just a few minutes but the ride was worth the wait as were the views at the top. The staff were fun on both journeys telling jokes and singing songs like "Don't worry be happy". As you travel up the floor rotates so every one gets a good view of the scenery and the mountain. At the top there is a good café and shops and great views.

Incredible view of Cape Town. My wife and I rode the aerial cableway to the top of Table Mountain. It was outstanding. The view was incredible from the top, and the facilities on the mountain (restaurants, gift shops, bathrooms) were excellent. Don't miss doing this when visiting Cape Town.
What a view. Can't go to Cape Town w/o seeing this spectacular sight. 360 panoramic view. Nice walking paths. It would seem a bit challenging for handicapped people.
Fun!. It was really fun riding up to the top of the mountain on the cable car. You don't have to worry about where you are in the car because the floor rotates, giving you a 360 degree view.

A great place for a view of the cape, and a "don't miss" experience!. We did this as part of a tour which gave us a bit of an advantage. We went in the morning before the crowds plus our guide handled the details of getting us on the car. The view is breathtaking and the area rather expansive, so you could easily spend an hour or more hiking the plateau, but on a tour this isn't possible. So it's a toss up. With a guide it is a quicker transition from ground level to top, plus someone local is giving you a commentary of what you are seeing, but your time is brief. Whichever way you choose just do it, it's a must see.

Quick trip to the top.... ... Otherwise get your walking boots on and ready for a lot of steps!Expect the queues to be busy as naturally there are lots of tourists that want to head to the top of Table Mountain. The cars fit 65 people and there are two; one goes to the top as the other returns to base. It takes around 5 minutes and the car has a revolving floor so you get a full 360 view and there's no need to shuffle around. Also, be aware that if the weather is bad or visibility is poor the cars may not be in operation so if you are in Cape Town for a few days plan your trip early so that if the weather turns you are not disappointed!

An exhilarating ride to the best tourist spot in CT. It's school holidays and the weather was mother top notch Cape Town day.Be sure to buy your cable car ticket before you arrive. We suggest buying this at the Red Bus ticket office at 81 Long Street. They open from 8.30am day.The best way is to get there via the red bus.Our wait was 1.5 hours in the end. There are two queues for those that had tickets and those without and the one with tickets was slightly faster. All in all the wait didn't seem to bad.When you arrive at the too of the stairway to take the cable car you are split into groups of about 65 people. The cable car rotates so be sure to be by the window if you want to get a 360 degree view.The ascent is about 5 minutes. It exhilarating, beautiful and a nice ride.Once you get to the top it's amazing. Excellent vistas and well worth the wait. I've been up most of the tallest buildings in the world and this experience is the best.
Nice ride up to Table Mountain. The Aerial Cableway only runs if the winds are less thaa 30 km/hr. The cab rotates giving everyone good views.

Awesome view on a nice day. First attempt to get here was blocked by the employees protesting instead of working. The attraction was closed. Second attempt was successful. Beautiful day. Get there early to avoid the crowds as it queues up pretty quickly with some people waiting over an hour to buy tickets, then waiting for over an hour again to get on the cable car. Car ride takes about 4 minutes. Views are incredible if the weather is clear, take a jacket as it can get cool up there. Must do.

Super efficient. Apart from queuing (even after buying tix online), it all went smoothly. Too many people with selfie stix but that's the way we roll now. Pretty pricey for SA but pretty reasonable compared to say Sydney for somethong similar. Floor rotates on the way up which is pretty cool.

It's about the views!. Although I am afraid of heights, this smooth ride both up and back down was easy. Make sure you check the weather in advance and take a warm jacket and your CAMERA and/or binoculars.

Well run. This was a great experience! Of course, most people made a beeline for the open windows of the car, to get the best views, but once the car sets off, the floor revolves so everyone gets a panoramic view. Genius!
Knee trembling!!. What a great excursion ...... If you visit Cape Town do not miss this...... It feels like flying up the mountainside...... Spectacular views...... Make sure you pick a clear day!!

The higher you go. Part of the Big 7 .... It continues to be a draw card of note.With electronic equipment compliant to wifi, it offers instant communication with the outside. Revellers have three choices, return ticket, single or full hiking ( to and from).
Ideal for all ages....students are discounted on Fridays only!!!!

A MUST EXPERIENCE Trip. It was great trip to Table mountain Top.I had never seen a mountain that is so very steep an the top is also so flat.It was a great view of the Robin island and the Atlantic Ocean.V&A way bay was looking great from that height. Even the cost is not exorbitant,A safe trip to Table mountain top by rope car/ cable- way

Breathtakingly Beautiful. I was lucky and did not have to wait at all getting up Table Mountain. For sure one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen.Make sure to go up TM at least once while in Cape Town. You'll never forget this experience.The cable car cabin rotates around itself while going up, good views guaranteed!

Convenient way to get to Table Mountain. This is a must do , at least for 1st. time visitors to Capetown. But it would be wise to pre-book your tickets and to tfy to go on a weekday to shorten your wait in the long queues that form.

Table Mountain was beyond beautiful. I visited Capetown in September and Table Mountain was a must-see on my itinerary. It definitely lived up the hype. Views were absolutely beautiful. The ride up was smooth and the entire experience was amazing.

Very good view. The aerial cableway is a way to go up to the top of the mountain. It is a good way to see the city while the cableway climbs. It is great because the internal part of the vehicle spins, so everyone has the 360 degrees view.

Great view of Cape Town!. A steep ride up the cable car to the top is a great way to see Cape Town. The lines are long, so be advised to get your tickets ahead, they are available online. There is still a wait with tickets, but totally worth it for the view.
Legendary Moments. You should get one of the top of the rock and get your wine and feed the birds while watching magnificent view

book online in advance. We checked the forecast before we arrived and booked online. Your ticket is valid for a week so if the weather changes which it does quickly you can go another day. We went in the afternoon directly after landing in Cape Town as it was a lovely sunny day. As I'm disabled I took my blue badge with me and parked right outside the entrance. A lift takes you to the cable car. The views from the top on a sunny day are awesome. The restaurant and shop closes at 4.

A way to get to the view. It's the easiest way to get to Table Mountain e for sure a good one. The only complain was that who didn't went with ticket bought managed to get in quickly then the ones that got the tickets before.

Amazing views. We did not buy our tickets beforehand which was a mistake as the we queued for over an hour just to get tickets!!! The system they have in place to get a ticket is really poor and is just up to the person working on that day to how to manage the queue. I had to go over and complain that we had been waiting for 30minutes without the queue moving and all the ticket offices where free!A real pity as once we got the tickets and up to Table Mountain the views where amazing and thouroughly enjoyed our trip.

Awesome day out. Amazing views from all angles. We bought annual cards and go up the mountain as often as possible, there are also lovely hikes on top of the mountain. Otherwise, you can walk up Platteklip Gorge and get the cable car down.

A Must & Well Worth the cost. A beautiful sunny and clear day allowed us to get a great view on this excellent cable car. The car rotates to give you the full 360 view which is a great facilityWe arrived early - thanks to good planning by our guide Jarred from PG Tours - and didn't have to queue at all!

Hard to Stop the Pushing In. We were lucky to make it into the aerial cable on the last run up for the day. We had pre purchased our tickets so we're able to head straight up. The establishment has quite a good set up to get people on and off quickly but it is still up to individuals to do the right thing.We had several groups try to barge in front of us to make sure they wouldn't miss out. Luckily our local guide was quick to intervene. So unnecessary!

Wow. You get to the base of the cable car and look up and it can be intimidating. The cable cars are large and round, holding as many as 65 people. Interestingly, the reason they are round is because the car spins on the inside to allow for you to get views possibly...though with that many people in the car, that can be tough. Expect long waits as this is probably the thing to do in Cape Town, especially once people see a clear day

Must do!. Probably the main attraction in Cape Town and for obvious reasons. The views are absolute gorgeous, great infratructure, good staff hellping around. Try to go during sunny days. The lines could last a little long but is worthed the wait. Get your camera ready and try to walk away from the main spots. The mountain is huge and so are the scennery you can get. Enjoy!

get your tickets in advance. and when I say advance, I mean the morning of because strong winds and poor visibility will have the cableway closed. The City Bus does stop at the entrance and the wait can be long, hiking to the top is always an option.

Convenient access to table mountajn. Recently took the cable car round trip to table mountain. Make sure you buy your tickets online before going, as there is an additional line you have to wait in without tickets, and on a nice day the lines can be very long. Great views going up (the floor rotates so everyone gets views all around). Taking the cable car allowed us to do our hiking from the top of the mountain where we had the most amazing views!
Rotating platform. The view is spectacular especially when nearly everyone has a 360 degree view because of the rotating platform. It does get crowded so try to be one of the first to get in.

Takes soaring view to new heights. You can hike up or you can "hop the cableway"! I suggest the latter. The ride is smooth and the views of Table Mountain, the sea, Robben Island and the city are amazing. Pictures will turn out great. Watch the weather, they will stop running if wind picks up drastically and they sound a horn as a warning to you.
A must do. Make sure you go on a good day, it's often cloudy and they stop the cart. Once the 5 minute trip is complete, being on top of table mountain is a bucket list item, and blew us away

"Only way I can do a 360". The cableway is an excellent operation that provides an easy way to the top of Table Mountain and back. The car spins 360 degrees so everyone gets a great view at some point. The area is busy but the wait wasn't long since we were there on a weekday. I would think weekends are much busier. Purchase your tickets early and check the weather for windy conditions and have a great day.

Great views - buy in advance. This is a very quick route to the top and the car revolves giving you fantastic 360 degree views of cape town. Well worth booking in advance though as it cuts down your wait time (though you will probably still have to queue)

Saved by the staff. Hi guys i would just like to say thank you to Rieyaaz and Nicole for helping me and my brothers out today, we hiked up the back for the first time and when we got to the top we could not purchase tickets we did not have money or cards on our persons but with the help of your staff them especially we got to go down the cable car. i did end up paying, but without them we would have been stuck up there or had to hike back down, please put an ATM up there or snapscan and zapper facilities because we only had our mobile phones on us. Thank you to those staff members for being so helpful even though it was extremely busy today. Thank you again. please let this reach them some how.

Quick Ride with a View. A quick way to get to the top, 4 minutes total ride. The base of the cable car rotates to allow everyone a chance to see some of the view, but it gets quite crowded so if you aren't near the outside (windows) it can be harder to see out.
Up, up and away. To get a fabulous view, take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. It can be a long line but it is well worth it.

BEST FIRST DAY IN CAPE TOWN BECAUSE OF THIS MOUNTAIN. We landed in Cape Town after a 21 hour traveling journey and we went straight to see this breath taking wonder of the world. All my fatigue left my body when I saw this. IF YOU GO TO CAPE TOWN I SUGGEST YOU DO THIS.Also, buy tickets online to avoid long Queues... part of the waiting is just lining up to pay for tickets... if you do that online you just go straight up to the mountain!
Nice Experience.!. Loved the view. A must visit place. Online booking is a must if you don't wanna spend time standing in a queue.
Beautiful views. The weather changes quickly here so if you have a perfect day to go to the top, do it. Don't put it off until another day. We DID have a perfect day and the views were spectacular.

Must do. A must do if you are in Cape Town, take the cable car to the top of table mountain, only takes 4 minutes to get to the top, when entering the cable car proceed to the right of the cable car for the best view. The cable car eventually starts rotating when going up. Free wifi throughout the cable car station.

spin. As a person who is trying to overcome a fear of heights I viewed this ride with trepidation, but I couldn't walk up Table Mountain so had to go on the cableway. Once on I grabbed on tight to a bar near to the window, and then was horrified when the operator said to let go as the car was going to rotate! To my delight I loved it, so if you are like me then just try it you may surprise yourself, and the views are so worth it.

Despite my fear of heights, a comfortable ride up and down the famous mountain. The waiting line for those with internet tickets was longer than the for those without. After a few days of fog, we clearly were not alone to use the Cableway. The start of the line was a bit confusing, but the proces went smoothly and took less time than feared. The cablecar is large, taking 64. Being allowed to stand on the fixed platform, instead of on the rotating floor, did help in keeping my vertigo in check. Thanks to the operators I felt completely safe.

Best experience of nature. Must visit place for everyone . Ride is well managed and amongst 7 wonders of nature . I never seen such a beautiful place like table top . The cable car had a capacity of 65 ppl / 4.8 tonnes . Mountains and blue skies merging with sea of green and blue color . Aerial view of Camps bay and entire cape town . Its like Mt Titlis ROTAIR . It Rotates and its very fast . takes you up by around 3000 ft in around 5 minutes .

Ride to the Top. The Aerial Cable-way designed by the Swiss is a superb way to view all of Cape Town as you ascend. The cable-car rotates so everyone receives a full 360 degree view. Very exciting ride.
Beautiful views!. Wear comfortable shoes, uneven grounds, lovely experience! Run pretty efficiently, so not too long a wait. Depending on which route you take, you can walk for over an hour.

Stunning views from the top!. We took the cable car up and back which gives great views from the tram. The floor around the perimeter rotates about 180 degrees during the ascent/decent to give perspective. Buy your tickets on line to have a quicker experience through the lines and I believe it was also slightly less expensive. There are lots of walking options at the top from short and easy to the walk around the top that we took which I would say was moderate in difficulty. Some scrambling up and down rocks and parts close to the edge. The guide map indicated 45 minutes however it took us 2 hours to do the loop out McClear's Rock.

Great Engineering. This cable car spins as you go up and down so there is no bad place to stand. Get your tickets from the concierge at your hotel so you do not have to wait in line. Also, you get your photo taken before you go to the top in front of a green screen. The pictures are available for purchase when you come back down. The pictures were very good except we had on olive drab hats and our heads were cut off!

Horrible que time in the sun!. We bought tickets in advance, but... the que for those without tickets was much faster! So buy your ticket and get in the other que... thats what many people seem to do...

Not Disappointed. Too often one can be disappointed after hearing the claims of others. But on this occasion it wasn't to be. Truly amazing vistas. We got lucky with the weather - clear blue skies. If the sun is out make Table Mountain you first call.

Amazing Views.. Went up to Table mountain on the local bus when you get off there is a shuttle bus to the cable car.We had to wait about 10 minutes to get to the payment booth and then had to wait another 15 minutes before going in to the cable car.The car moves around so yo get some excellent views of the mountain and of Cape Town

Fast, frequent easy trip to the top. We went in mid september, a little before peak season. Not crowded after noon. We wished we'd had more time to hike around. Beautiful, wild, but well cared for. Bring good walking shoes.

Awesome!. Be prepared to wait in long lines, unless you purchase tickets prior to your tour time.. The cable car actually does a 360 as it makes the ascension up the mountain, so you have an opportunity to capture photos at every angle...very cool!
Got to be done - view from the top!. This is a must when visiting Cape Town.The view is simply amazing it feels like you are on top of the world!

cloudy but great. The cable car and team that worked there were great.We went up early in the fog. Still loved the experience. Got breakfast at the restaurant at the top. Food was ok , service was fantastic. I dropped my plate of food after i had paid for it and the lady quickly said not to worry just get another plateful, nothing was a problem. The rock formations were amazing and totally worth the trip up. We did get a peck through the cloud to cape town below . It would be amazing on a totally clear day. A must view.
On top of the cape. Great,ride up the mountain. So well done once you get to the top. Easy walking routes and stunning scenery make it easy to spend hours up here.

Quick ride to table mountain. The cable cars are the most efficient way to get to the top of table mountain if you don't want to hike. It takes mere minutes to get to the top and the internal floor rotates as you go up giving everyone in the cable car a perfect view over Cape Town on the way up so it doesn't matter where you stand. It is closed in high winds and when cloudy so if you have a good morning in Cape Town make sure you go up. Check the queue time before you go too as it can be extremely long in summer!!

Birthday wishes . That's one my favorite places in earth! I just love the peaceful views, the flowers and just the feeling of BE. Table Mountain once stolen my heart and I am a regular visitor with a big smile and a light heart.This time we took a picture of a special friend and sing Happy bday to her. She will come someday, but for now, she got her moment up there, close to the sky.A place to visit, to love, to really be in Africa.

A must do if staying in Cape Town. Very well organised so all the queues pass quickly or buy the tickets online. Fantastic view on the way up and stunning views from the top. Got cafeteria at the top reasonably priced. Prepare for any sort of weather before going up as it is very changeable very quickly
Trip up to the top. Haven't been here since they renovated the aerial lift or the restaurant on top. Loved the way the inside of the car revolves giving everyone a 360degree view .
Amazing view of the city. One of the best natural wonders I have ever been too, hiking is the best way to go up and relax at the cliff. Amazing spots to sit down and enjoy nature.
Great day . After being advised that it would take us hours to get tickets we defined odds and went. The services was top class and we enjoyed the visit.

Spectacular Views. Make sure you book prior to your arrival in Cape Town, the tickets are valid for a week in the event of bad weather.The queue's are fairly substantial so advance booking is a must. To further beat the long wait, arrive when they open at 08.00 hours. The Café at the top however does not open until 10.30 hours though.

Most comforatable. The easiest, most comfortable and safest way to go up and down the Table Mountain. It keeps rotating so you get a 360 degree view. The pane glass was pretty clean and could get decent snaps.

Swiss technology at its best!. I must have travelled on most of the different types of gondolas used on this cableway since the 1950's, but I can confidently claimthat the current "goldfish bowls" are certainly an improved development on the earlier gondolas. The rotating floor gives you a full 360 degree panoramic view as you either ascend or descend.Whilst good views can beobtained from the station at the base of the cableway, better ones can be obtained from the summit.It is just such a pity that the price of a ticket is just so exorbitant!

So beautiful at the Top!. A great outing. Check the website for timetables/weather conditions/potential waiting period. Book tickets online - they reflect on your smartphone and this is scanned at entry.In the day I'd recommend going very early to avoid waiting in long lines; choose a clear crisp day (so your view is best); and if you can go without small children try as they tire so quickly and get bored up top. Apparently going in the evening and seeing the lights come on in the Cape Town city below is lovely.
Exciting experience. This was much more enjoyable / less scary than expected. Beautiful views all round, good customer service. A must-do for travellers to Cape Town.

“Highlight of Capetown ”. Beauty is that MountainTable, and viewed from all sides and come up with Aerial Cableway a wonderful experience, all very carefully very responsible. When we see the whole city going up because the capsule is rotated 360 degrees. Top this all very clean and care. The nature shines in all its splendor.
So fun!. Had an amazing day with beautiful weather at table mountain and using the cableway was fantastic! Can't wait to come back again.

Round and round down Table Mountain. This cable car has a nice feature ... the outside moves around the inside, giving al the 60 people that fit in a nice view of the environment on the trip up or down and giving you great opportunity to take pictures. One way trips are possible.

Highlight of Capetown . We booked online!! Do the same. The queue moves fast. The cable car rotates and you can take in all the views.The top is well paved and signposted with little eco and historic facts. There's some lovely platforms for photos. The restaurant on top is about 10% above the market price but your on a mountain top so it's grand. Had a beer and a mixed buffet. You could easily spend the whole day up there looking at views.

Natural wonder indeed. Fantastic experience to go up in the rotating car and then enjoy the views from above. If possible, try to time your visit for early to mid afternoon as it gets very busy in the morning when the tour coaches stop there as a first attraction for the day. Always take a wind proof jacket as it gets cold and windy on the mountain and the wait to come down again could see you standing outside in the queue for a very long time while you wait. Car parking is a major issue that should receive urgent attention, as it the absence of a safe pedestrian walkway if you have to park a distance along the road. Pedestrians have no option but to walk in the road, where normal road traffic has to pass. Very dangerous and unnecessary. All personnel were extremely friendly and welcoming and it's obvious that some investment is being made in training them well. Good job to all!
so organised. From the 360 degree view in the cable car onwards, this is just fantastic. walkways forever and well sinposted

And the floor moves!!!. On visiting Capetown beginning of September,one of my main aims was to be able to go to the top of Table Mountain.This was achieved in the afternoon of Sunday 4th on a beautiful day.I took the shuttle bus from the Table Bay hotel where I was staying together with a couple who were also doing the same Saga trip as me.We arrived at the end of a long que(we hadn't pre bought tickets)but eventually got them and joined the next que for the lift that takes you up to the cable car station.Once inside you automatically hold on to the rail round which you are then told not to do as THE FLOOR REVOLVES!!!quite a strange sensation but everyone can see the views from all angles as you go up and come down and what a sight from the top-not to be missed-an awesome experience.

A Unique Cable Car Ride. Once you get your tickets you will take an elevator up to catch the cable car platform. When you enter the car, just go the nearest edge. Even its not facing the way you would like. Because when it departs it will start to rotate so everyone will have a good view.

Nice Ride. While you can walk up and down Table Mountain, only the hardiest should attempt doing so. Meanwhile, this is a fund cableway ride. It's a large circular car (capacity is 64 passengers) with a rotating floor so you'll get to see a 360­° view on your way up and down. Swiss-built, so you know it's high-quality and safe. About a 3-1/2 minute ride.

Sunset experience. Visit Table Mountain via Cable Car during the sunset special in December 2015 with family with a teenager son and it was a wonderful experience. Although the queue was quite ling to purchase tickets the experience was definately worth the while. I can recommend this to every visitor visiting Cape Town. It us a must on your bucket lust.

Fantastic views. Woke up to a clear sky so up to table mountain we went. As did everyone else staying in cape town... Queued for just over an hour and we had already got tickets so this was the fast queue.The floor on the cable car moves around so don't worry about standing near an opening.The views up the top are amazing. Fantastic views over cape town. Worth the trip 100%.

It's a long way up!. If you can choose your time to avoid the lines, we went up in the late afternoon when there was no mist and no queue! The cable car revolves so everyone gets to see the views. A must do place to visit in Cape Town.
a must see. breath taking views amidst clouds, change of atmosphere and also season, and an UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Mind blowing views. This is an absolute must for everyone visiting Cape Town. The vews are mind blowing and the experience is one if a life time. Tickets are better being booked online as it will save time when u get there. Get a warm jacket with as mountain is very high and it gets chilly on the top.
Could be a long wait. Advice, if possible, book prior to visit, could save a lot of time waiting,and remember, RETAIN your ticket, you need it to return otherwise a long walk down!.

A must do!!!. The cable car is a reasonable price but for free you can hike to the top! We opted for the cable car!!Spectacular panoramic views of Cape Town can be seen from the top of the mountain. Easy hiking trails. There are easily accessible trails for those who might have accessibility concerns ... No worries!!If you are in Cape Town, this outing is a "must do!"
Great view. A great experience having wonderful view of the mountain range and the Cape Town, unfortunately weather keeps troubling the operations frequently. Great experience
Not what I expected. The aerial cableway was not what i expected. There is a huge glass box that people are loaded in, and it slowly turns as it makes its way down the mountain. Pretty neat!

Indescribable . What an amazing experience! The view was indescribable and we got so many amazing photos! We took the cable car up and down but we saw people climbing as well. We only waited about 30 minutes to go up but it took over an hour in line to come down. We went during their "off season" but we were told the wait was usually 2 hours for the cable cars. I guess we got lucky! I recommend buying tickets before hand, it saved us about 30 minutes!

Great views, cablecar spins as you go up so you get 360 degree views. Great ride up to the top of Table Mountain. It's the only aerial cableway I've been on that spins 360 degrees on your way up so you get to see all the views. It's a special place.

Easy lift to the top. Cable car is fast and efficient, but plan for long lines in the morning. It appeared at the lines were smaller in the afternoon, but don't wait too long as the cable car will not run if there is wind. Best to go early and wait out the line. Be sure to buy the ticket online before you arrive to save some time.

A must do in Capetown. This was one of the highlights of our Cape Town trip. You need to make sure to go when it is completely clear. In fact we ended up going on our 6th day in Cape Town because conditions were not great. It was a perfect day when we went up and within 25 minutes you couldn't see anything. The cable car rotates so don't worry about your position in line everyone will get a good view. The views after going up were out of this world. Make sure to get your tickets in advance. We got ours on the sightseeing tour bus office. Otherwise you could be in long lines to get your ticket while we went up immediately.
long queues. We visited here on a Sunday morning--arriving about 10.30--although we had bought our ticket in advance we still had to queue for over an hour to go up Table mountain
Must see!. A visit to cape town is Not complete without a visit to table Mountain. Very busy But Worth the wait. Fantastic views And an experience of a life time.

Worth the queues. This is a fantastic way to get to the top of Table mountain. The queues are horrendous but worth the wait. The car floor rotates 360 degrees during the trip so everyone gets a good view

Exhilarating Ride. Fortunate to avoid the usual long queues Had a walk around the top taking in the magnificent views of CapeTown from one side and Camps Bay to the other - quite spectacular. Table mountain is one of the ne seven wonders of the world. On the top there is lots to see - plants/flowers, animals. This is a must for anyone who visits Cape Town

A must. Try to do this on a clear day. The views were astounding. I did not realize there were as many trails up top. We thourghly enjoyed walking around on top admiring the various views. Definitely recommend this attraction

Must see . You cannot go to Cape Town without going to table mountain. And what better way to get up the mountain than the cable way. Everything is run efficiently, queues are quick despite the amount of people, and staff are friendly. I would recommend hiking up the mountain (if you have a moderate level of fitness) and taking the cable way back down.

Stunning views!. Truly a must. There is nothing better than to see Cape Town from a top on a beautiful sunny day. The trip to the top is fantastic as well. Buy tickets in advance to avoid ticket line.

Must do. You must do this to see and understand the topography of Cape Town. Very good views of all sides of the mountain. Be careful - it may be sunny on the bottom, but my the time you get up to the top it could be cloudy. Just have a cup of coffee and the weather will change again.
Great half day trip. Great relaxing active trip. Astonishing view, great walk. Great for getting orientation about Cape Town and surroundings.
Long wait. We waited a hour an half to buy tickets for the cableway. There is also a lot of people in the cable car. Its very squashed inside the cart.

Great but pre book. We were on second cable car after arriving but had pre booked tickets. Glad as queues at ticket office were long! Efficient and unusual with rotating base so get a 360 degree going up and coming down

Amazing views. Amazing views from the top of the mountain, make sure you bring a jacket as it can get chilly in the wind. The queues can sometimes be quite long so it's worth getting a ticket in advance if you can. If you're scared of heights, it might not be for you! The cable car revolves as it goes up so everyone gets a good view, and you can spend as much time on top of the mountain as you like. Does close on windy or bad weather days so be prepared to go another day if necessary.

Great way to see the best view of Capetown. Easiest way to see the best view of Capetown if your not in the mood of a good hike. We didn't reserve and only waited five to ten minutes. However I would reserve ahead in case it's a busy time.

Gorgeous. I could have spent a day hiking around Table Mountain. If the weather is clear, get up there as fast as you can. Heed warnings not to travel alone, and bring plenty of water and snacks. The views are incredible, the paths numerous!

A scenic ride to Table Mountaim. The aerial cableway is an efficient way to get to the top of Table Mountain if you're not upto a long hike or aren't feeling adventurous. You can book tickets online or via your tour operator. The cable car has a rotating base which affords you a 360 degree view of Cape Town as you get to the top. Of course, keep an eye out for bad weather as the cableway will not operate if it is too windy, misty or rainy.

Amazing views. When we visited early this month. We went early, around 10am and though there was a bit of a queue we managed to avoid massive queue's. In their summer (Oct -March) I can see it getting very very busy & hence horrendous queues.... The earlier in the day you can go the better.You have to go as soon as you get a good day. If it's windy they shut the cable car & you may have to walk up. It's a very long steep walk.Once you get to the top the views are fantastic.There are ramps for wheelchairs & we took my mums with no problems. There's a couple of shops & also a cafe/restaurant at the top as well as loo's. We got there on the open top city tour bus with no problems. It's well worth including this in your itinerary of things to do in Cape Town.

Well run tourist machine . The cableway to Table Mountain is very well organized. You either queue in the fast lane if you have prebooked your tickets online (recommended) or in the slow lane to buy tickets first before proceeding to the cableway. Waiting times depend on day of the week and weather conditions. Children until 4 years ride for free. Once at the top, you can walk around, there is a restaurant and a souvenir shop. And of course you have the beautiful view of the city. This is a half day activity altogether. Wear comfortable shoes as up there the paths are not paved. And always bring a sweater or jacket, even if it's hot at the bottom.

Fabulous. This was such a great day out. Evening actually. I took cable car after 5pm and returned at 7pm. I went for a walk and was quickly away from the crowds. One thing I'd recommend is taking a warm jacket and wear good walking shoes as the terrain is quite unevenGo enjoy the spectacular views, I'm very certain you will enjoy it

If your short on time or don't want to walk up. This is a great way to access table mountain of you are not a walker or short on time. We were the latter, it gave us the chance to see as much as we could at the tip without using a whole day. I would recommend booking online before and getting there early as it can get very busy with car Peking. We ended up about 500m walk away and got there for 930. I would also recommend following the cable car on Twitter as they regularly post the view and conditions from the top and more importantly if it's open! Great views the whole way up, don't worry where you are once in the car as it has a rotating floor so you will see everything!
Long wait but worth it. Long wait but queue kept moving. It was first sunny day for about 3 days and it was a Sunday. The view from the top was out of this world and we saw Dassies

Must do when visiting Cape Town. This cable car is one of only three in the world that has a revolving platform within the car so that everyone gets a good view. The view is fantastic. Like most of these facilities it is not cheap but still worth it.

Smooth Ride. The Aerial Cableway greatly simplifies visiting Table Mountain. The ride is smooth and relatively fast. It's also handicap accessible. (There's plenty of room for wheelchairs in the cablecar with some nice accessible viewing spots up top as well.)And what a view it is! The view from the top is spectacular! There is also a restaurant gift shop, and restrooms at the top. What more could you want?
Stunning views!. Very efficient way of getting to the top of Table Mountain - the option is hiking! Great views as the cable car rotates so that everybody gets a good view wherever they are standing.

Must visit when in Cape Town. The first day we arrived at Table mountain the cable car was closed due to winds. We decided to try on the day we left and as the weather was perfect it was worth it. The views on top are absolutely the best every. We arrived at 09:15 and the sign said 45 min wait. At exactly 10:00 we got on the cable car. The floor rotates so everyone gets a view no matter where you stand

Amazing views. It was a bit costly to go up in the cable car - 3 adults came to about R740, but the view was stunning. The cable car has some windows and then just openings, which is great for snapping pictures as you go up. The floor turns so everyone has a chance to get some snaps out the openings. There is plenty of curio shops, however for a South African the prices were a bit expensive. The restaurant up on the mountain was just as expensive. We didn't eat, as it was just to expensive. But the view was amazing, they have a Wifi Lounge on the top of the mountain that has lovely couches and seating ares as well as a little coffee shop/refreshment shop. The staff were super friendly and very helpful, one even gave us a hug as we got off the car. She also told us where to get Malay style food and was generally very informative.

Best place for a sundowner!. Friends visiting from Germany were as amazed as us about this wonderful view! Most beautiful sunset, perfect weather and clean air! We enjoyed every minute of our picnic in the sky.
What a View. Fun ride to the top of Table Mountain. The view was just gorgeous. Wear good walking shoes, take a camera and be prepared for quickly changing weather conditions. Must-do.
Up up and away. Great experience and especially good to do with a bunch of friends or family. Once getting to see the views it's great being able to walk them too

Magnificent views from the top of Table Mountain. Spectacular views on Cape Town and its surroundings from the top of the Table Mountain. Examples of plants and dwarf bushes (Fynbos) that can be seen only in that region. Possibility of walking around for up to few hours. However, a good and stable weather is a precondition to enjoy all these attractions. An hour of waiting time to get there by a cable car and another one to get back must be taken into account. Buying a ticken in advance helps to reduce the waiting time.
quick and painless. Takes around 3 minutes to get to the top and didn't cost much at all. Lovely views and everything was very clean and we'll operated
Must do. a Must do when visiting Cape Town. See the world from above, enjoy the wildlife and plants with a glass of wine.

Lovely way to see the mountain. What a lovely way to see the mountain. The rotating cable cars ensure that everyone gets the full view of the mountain and the city and bay below. Highly recommend to anyone coming to see this natural wonder! Make sure to turn up early to avoid the big crowds (and make sure to stay for a glass of wine at the wifi lounge before the trip back down the mountain).

One of the must sees in the world. I'm sure it's all been said before, but the panorama is magnificent and unique. It was the first fine day in four and Sunday when we went, so we had to queue for 1.5 hours at about 10:00, but it's worth it

Wonderful views and walk at the top. The cableway was closed for week because of strong winds, so we were really blessed that it opened during our stay, and we had a lovely sunny day. We were surprised to find such a large area at the top and to be able to walk beyond the crowds of visitors and appreciate the scenery and wildflowers. You could easily spend all day up there. But allow plenty of time to queue to get down if it's a busy day - took us 45 minutes - and the cafe closes early so no chance to buy some food and drink while you wait.The information boards around the summit are really informative
Exciting with spectacular view.. Rotating floor of the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway's cable car gives everyone's chances to see spectacular view along the way.

Incredible sights on a clear day!. Great experience looking over the Cape Town area, views of the ocean, mountains and various sights. Be willing to wait in the queue to go up and longer queues to go down if you leave it till sunset time. Certainly worth the trip! (Don't look down in the cable Car!)

This is an absolute MUST for anyone visiting Cape Town. The views from Table Mountain are breathtaking and the wildlife is really unique. Everyone visiting Cape Town should make sure to have a couple hours to go up Table Mountain. Try to go on a sunny day, because the views are limited when it's cloudy and foggy.There is often a queue of 30 to 90 minutes both the way up and the way down, so be prepared. The top is actually much smaller than one would expect, 1 hour on the top should be enough. The fee was 240 ZAR each.

A great half day trip. Check the weather forecast before you book. Afternoons often offer better views than the mornings, and are generally quieter too. If you want to avoid the ticket queues buy your tickets on-line, they are valid for several days after the booked dates. great views from the top. take your binoculars.
Mother /daughter visit. This place was unbelievable! The people in the gift shop upstairs were a blast! Beautiful scenery! You can see Robben Island from here also. Mountain views, stadium views.
