Stunning views, easy access to Table Mountain. We were advised by the owner of the guesthouse...aim for the afternoon, and miss the crowds of school children. We were very lucky- no queues to purchase tickets and less than 5 minutes to board the cable car. I hadn't expected the 360 rotation. Great views on ascent and descent.

Great. We got here really early about twenty minutes after cable car was open and there was already a queue but it moves pretty quickly. Really well done and views are incredible. The moving floor was different and gave you views all around. Would recommend.

Sunset spectacular!. The view from table mountain is fantastic anytime But I find that in the day it can get a little crowded. We took my dad the cable cart when he was visiting from the UK just before dark and the sunset was utterly breathtaking!Plus the crowds had disappeared so we felt like we had the whole mountain to ourselves, wonderful!

Must do in Cape Town!. Table Mountain's views can't be missed while in Cape Town. It was frustrating that the cableway was closed for the first 4/5 days of our trip, but the wait was well worth it. Definitely get there early, because the lines get long, especially after being closed for several days. We got there at 9:30 and waited for 1.5 hours. Getting tickets ahead of time definitely saved us time, but lines were still long.

Do not miss this natural attraction!. We went up Table Mountain on a group booking. Make sure you get your ticket before you join the queue. As the queue is very long with a lot of pushing in. The cable car is clean and rotates so everyone has a wonderful panoramic view while going up and coming down. It feels like you are on top of the world when you step out of the cable car! We could see for miles as it was a very clear day. You cannot go to Cape Town and not go up Table Mountain!

Ridiculous Views!. Had the chance to ride the cable car for a second time and it was once again spectacular. The fact that the floor rotates gives you multiple perspectives of the mountain and the city. A just do while in Capetown.

Incredible views . Go on a clear day and you could probably see Antarctica! What a view. The cable at facility is excellent too. All very well managed. Just a tip: make sure you get there before the cable at opens (8.30am) to avoid the inevitable long queues
Fun, great views to the top of Table Mountain. Long lines but quick and easy trip to the top of Table Mountain where one can enjoy views and easy hikes across the top of the mountain.

Well worth the time.. You certainly have to pick your day as the cloud cover could make this a non-experience. We had a day where the clouds moved in and out and did limit some vision. On a clear day it would be spectacular, for us it was really good but we did fight with the clouds. The actual Cableway was great and even one of our friends who is terrified by height seemed to cope really well. The views and photo opportunities were fantastic and it is certainly worth spending a bit of time up top once you got there. The lady in the shop down the bottom of the Cableway was worth the experience by herself. A real character and a great ad for South African tourism. Overall worth the money and the time.
A must do if the weather is good. The rotating floor was freakier on the way down than going up but certainly something to talk about. Great views from the top on a good day
Smooth and good. we took the cable way to reach to the top. it was smooth ride. they have continuous service of the cars. clean and nicely managed... its also wheelchair friendly

What an adventure!. The cable car revolves which was scary for some individuals. There is an extensive waiting line. Had to return in the afternoon due to the wind velocity in the AM. No one will regret going up the mountain in the cable car!
Great view. We did this tour with a group of 8 friends. Great view and goes slowly so even for a person like me who is scared of heights I was ok. Cafe up the top where u can get a roll and coffee.
Great view, only 5 mins. The floor of the car rotates, so you get to see all around. Buy your tickets online to avoid the que.
The only way to see Table Mountain.. The only way to see Table Mountain. Very efficient, clean & safe. Prices are reasonable, parking could be challenging in peak times. Best advice go early.

It's a must!. You can't go to Capetown without visiting table mountain! We didn't book in advance we just turned up when the weather was good. Amazing views and you can spend as little or as long as you like up there( I think)! We spent about an hour. The cable car turns slowly round so you keep getting different views.

Wonderful experience. We went in the morning on a clear day and had to line up for nearly two hours. When we went past in the afternoon around 2 there was no waiting at all. But the wait was worthwhile. The ride included a 360° rotation of the carriage. I felt very safe inside even though there were some nervous moment while waiting.

Breathtaking views!. I prefer hiking all the way up, but taking the cable way at least once in your life is an absolute must!! The car becomes a bit overcrowded at times, so but you still get to enjoy the beauty of Cape Town. Be sure to take along a jacket as it is quite colder up there.... Hat, sunscreen and picnic basket is a must!
Freezing! But the view is worth it. It was a beautiful day on the ground, but freezing up top. The queue to come back down was long. The views are beautiful!

Rode down. The queue was pretty long to go up so we hiked, but coming down the line moved quickly. Even though we could have hiked back down, it was a nice ride and worth the experience to be in the cable car with the rotating floor.

Well organized cable way. The queues weren't too long but recommend you buy your tickets online. The cable car takes approx 4.5 min to reach the top and the views are spectacular, an absolute must if you in the area. We all loved it.

Great experience. At the recommendation of friends, B&B, and guidebooks, we took the cable car to the top on a clear, wind free morning as a stop on the red bus tour line. Grand views. Busy but pleasant crowd. Efficient. Interior of car rotates 360 degrees so there are spectacular views for all. Vegetational zone is remarkable.

Good speed, impressive views.. It is the only way to go up to the Table Mountain if you are not going by foot. Good speed, some times a bit overcrowded but it is spinning so you will surely have the same view with everyone!Price around 8 euros one way.

Very nice !. Decided not to do the trail but wanted to go to table top mountain and this was a great middle ground. The cable itself was very short and not so thrilling but the view at the top was amazing !! The mou yuan we were on was humongous so better wear your walking shoes for the full experience . Walked over 2 hours and still not sure I covered the entire stretch ! The paths were well carved out and still lots of dangling and risky bits for those thrill seekers should u feel the urge to tilt over the mountain for that picture. Loved it!

Enjoyable experience . We had a great time using the cable car to go on top of table mountain in Cape Town. The lines appeared a bit long for the entry point but as we did buy tickets in advance, it's highly recommended you do the same to avoid waiting in long queues.

Very organized. I tried it when I visited table mountain site. it was very organized and has a souvenir shop at the exit too which is very convenient if you forget to buy anything from the table mountain

It has to be done!. I hate queues and I'm scared of heights, but both are worth the discomfort to do this trip. You can only really say you've seen Cape Town and the Peninsula once you've seen the spectacular views from the top of the mountain.Take something warm though, even on warm days the wind can be chilly up there, and don't feed the dassies and meerkatte which tend to be quite tame.Once you've done the cableway trip, plan your next one on foot :-) Great hikes all over the mountain, but don't do it alone; there have been several incidents of hikers being robbed on the mountain, especially near the cable station.

Don't think twice, just do it!. On the rare occasion that I am a total moron, I usually regret it. I arrived at Table Mountain, looked at the cableway, and thought, 'Forget this, I am going to hike. I am not taking the stupid cableway!' Three hours later, when I arrived at the top a giant sweaty mess, I realised that one should obviously take the cableway up and hike DOWN, if hiking is on the agenda. Anyway, that's nether here nor there, as this is about the cableway itself, and all I can say is that the ride is amazing. You go up/down so fast, and the revolving floor ensures everyone gets a 360 degree view. The scenery is absolutely amazing! I came back two days later just to ride the cableway up and down one more time, before I left amazing Cape Town.

Breathtaking views. We chose a day when the sky was clear blue to visit Table Mountain and were rewarded with breathtaking views. We were visiting in the low season and yet were not able to find a car parking space closer than around 300 yds. from the cable car station so be prepared for a some walking even though you intend to take the cable car to the very top! There was only a short queue to buy tickets but I imagine this will not be the same in summer and the advice to pre-buy tickets could be worthwhile. The cars run to the top at a steep angle, the trip only lasting 5 minutes. They are shaped like a donut and revolve horizontally 360 degrees around the central hub so you get to see all sides without having to move about in the car yourself. 5 minutes is not long enough to take it all in! Do choose to do this trip as soon as you have a clear day because very often a cloud seems to gather and hang over this iconic mountain and, if dense enough, the cars do not run.

Must do activity in Cape Town. Ensure to check the weather forecast before driving up there if you wish to buy an advance ticket. Otherwise be ready to stand in line for up to 45 minutes but trust me, it's well worth the wait!! Carry a good camera, because the views are absolutely breathtaking. Stay until sunset when the sky turns glorious with tones of fiery orange. Can get windy so better be warmly dressed and wear comfortable shoes.
Excellent service. Arrive early to avoid queuing. We were happy to discover that there was a childrens event on so all children travelled for free.

It was breath taking!!. It is the second time i have been to the top of the mountain....it was very misty the day we went up but still beautiful none the less.... We had Coffee and Milk Tart in the restaurant and it was divine. We took loads of photos before the mist took over.... it was awesome.....

Stunning views. I can remember the days when we used to go up Table Mountain every Friday afternoon to enjoy the sunset and start our weekend. Not possible now due to the cost - but worth a once off visit with my 9 year old. Whole experience very professional. Views incredible. But phew - if it was more reasonable would go up more often.

Very exciting, a perfect 360 view. Table Mountain is the most iconic landmark of South Africa. It is also the country’s most photographed attraction and its famous cable car took millions of people to its top. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway Company is by far the fastest and easiest way of reaching the summit. Getting to the cable car is easy. Best option is to take the bus as parking spots are hard to come by. Cable car tickets can be purchased at the station or at City Sightseeing Bus drivers.Table Mountain is a terrific scenic photograph background or a place from where you can take a breathtaking photo of Cape Town, and from 2004 was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Consider that the journey to the summit lasts not more than 5-6 minutes, and that the floor of the car rotate through 360 degrees during the ascent, giving passengers a panoramic view and a great emotion. It's really worth to get up!!!

expect long waits. We went there twice. The first time there was a two hour wait so we just walked the park and left. The second time we went there on a weekday there was another two hour plus wait even though we had tickets. We waited and waited. We went up the cable car. In my opinion the ride is not worth such a wait. The park itself is a 5 star visit. You can skip the cable car if there is a long wait.

A bit expensive but beautiful . A must for every Cape Town visitor. The view from the top of the mountain is outstanding and gives you a great chance to orientate your self in the city. There are different hiking routes for different level of hikers. These ones could be marked a bit better

On Top Of the World!!!. Table Mountain Cableway was on my short list of things to do in Cape Town and it did not disappoint! Purchase tickets ahead of time to help avoid some of the lines but it would still be worth the wait. We visited in the afternoon and had a very short wait. Try to get a spot in front of the windows. The rotating floors will give you amazing views all the way to the top!

Great View!. The cable ride was fun! The gondola spins as it descends/ascends so riders can have a 360 view. There is an open window as you rotate so that you can have a clearer view for shooting pictures. Plenty of fantastic views. We went up around 4pm, so the lighting was not too harsh. Take your time to explore and enjoy the fresh air. It's breezy, so bring a light jacket. There is a cafe and a souvenir shop to check out. Table Mountain is a must-see in Cape Town.

Could have been better! . The cable car ride to the top is superb, we were luck to find s cloudless opportunity to ride to the summit to be met with unrestricted views, we looked forward to enjoying the views from the cafe only to find that it was shut, closed at 16.00. For a site so internationally famous its disappointing that the facility at the top shuts so early

Absolutely Stunning. We took the sunset tour and it was the most beautiful ride up Table Mountain we ever had, the cable car driver was an entertaining host and the whole staff of the Cableway gave us a memorable trip up and down.

The long ride up!!. I was so amazed by the spinning of the cable car going up, slow and steady. This gave me the opportunity to see the full view of this wondrous place. Incredible and sensational. The ride was smooth and easy.

Stroll in the mist. A must-do when in Cape Town. Fantastic views on the city side and the cliff side. Have a stroll at the top in the mist. It is spectacular! Don't have lunch there, cheap canteen food.

Misty but still worth a lot. I love this attraction in Cape Town, actually my first visited attraction there. Nicely organised, however queue may be long so DEFINITELY BUY TICKETS IN ADVANCE. This will save you more time for sure. Beautiful view from the top, I spent 2-3 hours as I was waiting for clouds to move and show the view. Amazing...

Sweeping view of the Mother City. The Table Mountain cableway ride to the top is a must-do while in Cape Town. It took more than an hour to get through the queue to buy the ticket and get on the cableway. The ride, which rotates 360degrees during ascent and descent provided a panorama over this beautiful city. It was a perfect daywithout any cloud cover . The view from the top of Table Mtn delivered beyond expectation asfar as the eyes can see.

Brilliant. If you wish to experience Cape Town in all it's glory this is a must!However make sure you miss the ''Table Cloth' which can hinder clear observations. Be careful about transportation as it would seem that some taxis have a private system. So ask your local hotel etc for advice.

Great ride up Table Mountain. The gondola ride up Table Mountain is well worth the time and money, assuming the weather is decent. Check beforehand, as wind and/or clouds can halt operations for a while. The gondola rotates while making the steep ascent, so everyone gets a good view during the ride up.

Long wait, but worth it. Had a wait of about 1 3/4 hours but we were aware of the queues before going. Not surprising for a sunny Sunday. Plenty of shade to stand in for people and queues managed very well. Cable car itself was spacious and quick with the rotating floor giving everyone a view of the stunning vista below.

Unbelieveable view of Cape Town!. If you go to Cape Town, the aerial cableway is a must for everyone. Breathtaking views from a aerial cable car that slowly rotates as it makes the trim up and then later does the same thing on the down trip. Everyone gets a great view.

First visit. First trip up on Table Mountain and it was amazing! There was a bit of confusion with the the online tickets, as the security still had us stay in line and had the non ticket holders go first. Was not sure if this is standard procedure as all behind us also complained. The Mountain was very busy and we were just concerned about tourist ignoring multiple signs requesting various safety measures. The view was perfect though and we enjoyed every second!

Great views but can be a long wait.. So we booked tickets thinking it would be quicker, we booked a morning trip. The first thing is if you're driving to the base station, parking can be a nightmare but if you drive all the way to the station and drive past it you can sometimes find parking on the road beyond the drop of point.The queue was very long, even though we had pre-booked, it took us an hour before we were on our way up.The cable car rotates as you travel so you don't need to rush to board. Once at the top there are lots of walks around the edge both facing Cape Town and also Camps Bay. Lots of photo opportunities and if you took the Robben Island trip like I suggested first you know have beautiful photos of Table Mountain from the sea and Cape Town from Table Mountain.Be sure to check the weather forecast a few days in advance and try and avoid a cloudy day as you wont see anything from the top.

staff who put themselves before customers. After a long wait while we watched people who had come in after us go up we finally reached the top. It was very cold and cloudy so we decided to go back down fairly quickly. We joined another long queue which had young children and disabled visitors in it. After about 45 minutes we were able to see that the descending cable cars were being used by staff to load tables and chairs. After 2 cars had gone down the mountain with furniture and no passengers a 3rd was half filled by staff who meandered about laughing while the onlooking customers shivered in the cold. All the while the 100 or so people who queued were left to their own devices. The queue was completely unsupervised. Some customers took it upon themselves to help out by shouting out that there were many people still outside in the queue. We really enjoyed Cape Town but this place was definitely the low point. Customer service was zero.

If see top cable station go up. Although often the mountain is covered in cloud, if you just want a "tourist type" visit (ie not walking around the top too much) then go up if you can see the top cable car station and you will be fine because we didn't walk more than 200m from there. That said, there were lots if walking options if you want to do more.
Fantastic view of the city. You get the best view of Cape Town from the mountain top. Be sure to check the daily weather report as the cable doesn't run on windy days.

Incredible view of Table Mountain. Has to be done! This should be at the minimum of the things that you do, such incredible views of cape. Make sure you book in advance as it will cut your waiting times. No camera can capture the beauty you see with your own two eyes
Awesome. we went up in the cable car and back down. with a slow rotating floor you could see all around without moving at all. Not pricey either but around hour wait.

Spectacular . The cableway is the sole way to reach the top of Table Mountain other than walking which would not be for the faint hearted. The process of ticketing and queuing is well organised, swift and the journey only takes about 5 minutes to the top. The car itself revolves which us an awesome idea and stops view hogs from securing and keeping the best views on the way up and down. Everyone gets a view !The trip is a must do on a clear or high cloud day.

Awesome view of Cape Town. This was a marvelous experience for us, out of all the 7 wonders of the world we managed to tick one off our list. It was truly amazing, the view from the top is just breathtaking

You have to check it out!. Even though it was an okay trip to the top, it is something that has to be added to your list when you visit Capetown. When we went, it was too cloudy to see the ground, so our pictures did not turn out. It was a nice sight to see, but wouldn't have to try it again.

Cable car trip. Nice ride up, not too expensive, nice views of Cape Town. It is cold on top of the mountain so a jacket is advised. Also try to go when there are no clouds on the mountain, makes for poor visibility if it is not clear.

Great experience but aviod busy times.. By South African standards it`s expensive but, unless you walk, the only way up and down the mountain. The arrangements at both ends are very efficient but sometimes just overwhelmed by sheer numbers of tourists. Buy your ticket on line first and get there early doors; that way there`s less of a queue both up and down. The website says it`s quieter later; that may be true going up but you`ll queue for an hour or more to go down with all those who came up earlier. Avoid fine Sundays like the plague as everyone tries to use the cableway then! Also the café at the top shuts at 1600 which is RIDICULOUSLY early.

Nice view. I once took the Cable Car up to Table Mountain and once started the hike from Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. I would definitly recommend hiking up the mountain as you have stunning views of the city and can walk around the Botanical Gardens first.
A good view on a good day 360 degrees. Amazing place to visit. The cable car is smooth with good views. Be prepared to queue though and pre book your ticket.
Awesome View of Cape Town!. Visit on a clear day to have a breathtaking view of Cape Town. However it could be rather disappointing if the weather plays foul and the skies are not clear...

WOW!. What a view although if you are afraid of heights you might have to hold your breath for a few minutes. The interior of the cable car rotates so you have a great all round view going up the mountain. It's a lot higher and steeper than it looks like from the bottom. It's a large cable car so it feels very sturdy and holds at least 20 people so you are not alone.
Mr Farouk Khan . A very good tourists destination. Even if for fun , it's worth every penny . A can be vey cold during the colder seasons , but during summer , it's a blast .
Worth doing if it's clear. Beautiful views and a lovely sunset. Well worth the trip if it's clear of clouds. Make sure you dress warmly though, the wind is cold!

Unaccomplished visit. Unfortunately, the day we planned to go to the table mountain aerial cableway, it was closed due to strong winds. But with no doubt, the vue from there was fantastic. It should be better during spring time to Check their website to see if they are open in order to avoid any change in plans

Wonderful way to spend a morning - or a day!. You would not be doing Cape Town justice if you don't go up our iconic mountain! Take the revolving cable car up and enjoy panoramic views as you ascend, then spend a few hours leisurely walking across the top to Maclear's Beacon - the highest point of the mountain - before returning to the coffee shop for a snack. Or pack a picnic and enjoy it outside on a path, while soaking up the peninsula spread below, from Cape Point to Hangklip on one side and Hout Bay to Saldanha on the other.Opt to either walk back down or take the cable car. Or hike up and then cable down - the combinations to get to the top are varied. Either way - it'll be a highlight of your visit to Cape Town - and is indeed something that every Capetonian should do at least once.
Cool ride. If you hike up one way (or unable to do the hike) the cable car ride offers some great 360-degree views of the city so that everyone in the car can see what is around and below them.
Easy access to Table Mountain top.. A must for Cape Town Visitors. Efficient access to Table Mountain top where you can enjoy excellent bird's Eye views of Cape Town & more.

Not to be missed. Book in advance if possible and hope for a clear day. At the top you can walk all the way across the mountain top, but allow plenty of time and take lots of water. If the wind pick up the cable car stops running, but a siren will sound before it shuts down. However if you are at the other end of the mountain you will not get back in time. We only just made it. Fantastic views and an essential experience if you visit Cape Town.

Spectacular Views. As long as you get a clear view from any window, you will have blast as the cable rotates as it goes up. So everyone has a chance to get the great views. Check the weather as if it is too windy the cable car will not operate. I would therefore suggest that you not leave this to the last day of your visit. This way if the weather does not co-operate, you still have another chance the next day. The same would apply for the visit to Robben Island. The Cape Town coastline is to known as the Cape of Storms for a very good reason.There is also a great restaurant at the top so go hungry and spend a few hours up there. The views from the restaurant as you can imaging are unbelievable.
table mt. This is an amazing attraction. Great view. Must go when weather is good. Try for morning, if not go in afternoon. Great for all ages.

A must have.. Table Mountain aerial cableway is a very "simple" effective way to have a great trip. A free bus takes you from your car to the lower station. You wait in line for a short while, then get a nice turning 360 view on capetown and the mountain as you climb up. The view up there is very nice, almost 360 aswell, and even though there are many tourists, it's very calm.

Amazing view. Our guide rearranged our tour to make sure we got up the mountain as it was going to rain the next day. The view was incredible. There is a large area on top of the mountain to go around and see many different viewpoints. The only bad thing was that we had to go late in the day and as it was closing we had to wait in a long line to get back down. Took about an hour. Well worth it though.

Table Mountain. This is a great way to visit Table mountain in Cape TownThis must be a "must see place" when in Cape TownThere are beautiful flowers here, amazing flora and also we'll sign posted walking trails.

Table Mountain . Taking the cable car is wonderful and easy. See if you can process tickets to go up and down beforehand as lines can become long and in hot summer weather children can become agitated waiting. However it is more than worth the wait. The view from the top is absolutely spectacular !

Stunning views. We had a super afternoon at table mountain. Book online and avoid the queues. Stunning trip on the cable car up the mountain which only gets better once you arrive and see the views. Take a picnic.

Visit to the Table Mountain. The Aerial Cableway is a nice experience, only if the weather is good with clear skies !!Unfortunately, the day we visited the Cable Mountain, the weather was cloudy with low level clouds. So the view was not that great !!

Stunning trip to top of Table Mountain. Table Mountain, recently a claimed as one of the seven wonders of the world, towers over the city of Cape Town.. A trip in the cable car to the top of this iconic feature is a must if you are visiting Cape Town.Queues to buy tickets can be very long, with a wait of hours..It is best to book and pay for your ticket online.. you can take the Red City bus tour which will drop you off at the Lower Cable Station and save you the search ( and corresponding long walk) for parking for your car.. Remember to take something warm to wear as it gets cold, a hat and a bottle of water. There is a restaurant at the top - though a picnic overlooking either the city and Table Bay,or the Atlantic Coast on the other side, this takes some beating!
A must visit. The weather was not that great... clouds appearing and disappearing... but still a must see! Every now and than the sun allowed us to have that perfect view.
A must!. Definitely wait and book when you get to cape town as you have to have clear day. We only decided to do it about 3pm and we spent about an hour at the top. Views are amazing!

Proudly SA. Been a long time since I went up the mountain in a cable car (26yrs). The big change for me was the revolving cable car. It is a bit strange at first because it is the floor that turns so this can be a bit disorientating as everybody tries to keep their spot in front of a window that they are actually moving away from. However sanity soon prevails and after a few apologies for toe stepping one can enjoy the view as the car moves up the side. Very polite 'pilot' looks after you while you are in the air and opens doors when you reach your landing. The views are spectacular and if you feel energetic you can put in quite a workout walking around the top. Looking down onto the city and the harbour and out to Robben Island are views that are difficult to forget. On the other side one can see off to Constantia and below is Camps Bay and Clifton. Ideally the trip up the mountain should be done on a clear day with as little wind up top as possible. Any visit to Cape Town must include a trip up the mountain to validate that visit:).

Flawless. We hiked up and then took the cable car down. The car just flowed down the mountain and we had such a view of Cape Town! It wasn't too packed and if you didn't like heights you could sit in the middle and ignore the sights.
There's no better way to get to the top!. This is a must see, but I recommend buying your cable car ticket in advance. If you're scared of heights, like myself, just stand towards the middle. Enjoy!

Afraid of heights.... This isn't a bad attraction. You have the option to not look down while the cable car goes up. It's a fairly big car and standing room only. There is a gift shop at the end if the ride as well.

What a View!. As a part of our SmarTours trip Table Mountain was included. The roomy cable cars with mainly standing room gave an ideal view up the side. The car was set-up to rotate one complete revolution on the ascent (and descent), not uncomfortable at all.At the top Table Mountain opens up to many viewing areas all the way around. We were blessed with crystal clear skies and pleasant weather.Would highly recommend, plan on an hour and a half for viewing. There is so much to see on top.
Go round and round. You can hike up or down table mountain but...... So take the cable car and be in a car that rotates 180 degrees on the way up and another 180 degrees on the way down. Great!

"GREAT VIEWS". We Visited table mountain in early April.The weather was good,the queuing was bad,but well worth it when finally got on cable car.Book in advance online to beat the queues.The ride up was good as the cable car revolves all the way up so everybody can see all the same views.Well worth a visit

Table mountain cable way. We travelled twice near table mountain and rerurned back due to weather it was not operating. The third visit we were on the cable car which was a great experience. On the top after reaching we have many information boards to read and know further more. The same cable car drops us back to the bottom of mountain. Great viewing the mountain and best experience.

Great View. A comfortable rotating cable car to the top of Cape Town's iconic peak, we took it on the way down after hiking Platteklip to Upper Cableway Station. The views are stunning out to Cape point and beyond.
Great views. The run up to Table mountain in the cable car was amazing with great views and the rotating floor ensuring everyone experiences the view.

Thrilling. The ride up is always a thrill. Something about being up in the air and seeing the beauty of the surrounding countryside laid out before you always makes you forget your troubles and just revel in being on holiday. Not for those with vertigo. Get your tickets in advance - there could be a 2hour wait on the queue at the venue.

enjoyable cable car ride. A must to do. And on your birthday you can go for free. Lovely to experience the ride up. Just felt too quick. Also the cable car gets filled with many people. Not over their capacity though. Just I would have liked fewer people on the ride...

Footsteps to Freedom tour company. A great private tour with Garth of "foot steps to freedom" a private tour company located in Cape Town. of table mountain..he really knows his history and botany of local plants. Although we love to hike. I have a sore ankle so we went slow. He was very accommodating and informative. Is also an expert in some African history. Very kind and patient gentleman. I warmly recommend him to anyone interested in Cape Town attractions.

Avoid the queue!. Arrived at cable car on a hot day, thankfully with boots and sticks, because we hoped to ride up and walk down. The queue at the bottom was terrible with a two hour wait! We took the nearest path up, which turned out to be the difficult one, and it was very hard work but we did it in three hours and it was brilliant! Fell running trainers would actually be better than the stiff soled walking boots we had.

A must. We ordered our tickets via the Internet which saved time queuing on the day. Be prepared for changes in weather , we went up in July and had sun, rain and snow! Also if travelling to Cape Town in July, check which week the cable car is closed for maintenence.

Amazing views. Table Mountain cable car is an awesome experience especially on such a perfect day as today. Unlimited 360 degree views to the horizon. Still a wait even with pre-paid tickets but worth it.

Can't be beat on a clear day!. Waited for four days for clear weather to visit Table Mountain. Bought tickets in advance using WebTickets and this saved us waiting time. Visiting Table Mountain is a must see when visiting CapeTown. Well worth the hassle of dealing with crowds.

Views views. Excellent service and vey well managed, from the restaurant staff to the cable way crew. Truly world class standard. Well marked pathways and attention to safety. Will certainly recommend as a must see location in the Mother City.

Stunning vista. This truly is the way to capture the stunning vista of Cape Town, and it is indeed STUNNING. My only recommendation is avoid going when the mists of early morning and late afternoon are present as although you will see plenty on the cable car, you really want to experience the lay of the land when it is not clouded in. Take a wind break jacket cuz it sure gets chilly up in the sky.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. If go to Cape Town your visit won't be complete until you explore Table Mountain. A wonderful view 360 degrees. Hundreds of different vegetations, some of wich can only be seen here. Check the weather forecast to make sure to visit it in a bright sunny day!

Beautiful views of Cape Town - go early on a sunny day. Booked ticket online before arriving in Cape Town. It was a sunny day, so got there early. Cableway was closed at first due to cloud and gail force winds but after 30 mins, cloud / wind cleared and they opened up the cableway.Recommend booking online prior to visiting. You still have to queue up but if you go early the lines aren't long and there aren't too many people on the cableway and up at the top. Stunning views of Cape Town!

Quiet when cloudy, busy when sunny. We had a set itinerary when visiting Cape Town which meant that we were scheduled to visit Table Mountain on a day when it was cloudy. We knew it would be cloudy at the top as we could see the cable car station from our accommodation.Because it was cloudy, there was no queue to go up on the cable car, so up we went. It was about lunch time so we had our lunch in the café/restaurant at the upper station, which was tasty but cold. Outside, visibility was poor and it was damp, so we didn't linger and came down in short order.A couple of days later we had a gap day and as Table Mountain looked clear we went up again. This was such a different experience, where the queue to go up was an hour (because we hadn't bought tickets in advance). We tried to book whilst in the queue but the Wifi they provide is really weak and incapable of doing much at all. So book you tickets online or on your mobile before you get there if it is sunny.When we got to the top it was, again, so different. The dassies were out (google them!) and there were lizards too. We had a good walk around before coming down, but no lunch this time!Absolutely not to be missed, but if the weather is poor and cloudy you will have to decide for yourself how important it is to go up the mountain, because you really won't see or experience much apart from the cold and the wet.

Stunning view. Woaw!!! The cableway is safe and suits everyone. buy your tickets online to avoid waiting too much. View from the table mountain is just fabulous. We can stay there for a whole day. This place is very inspiring :)

Safe and scenery ride. 5 mins ride in this cable way is awesome. Cable car rotates so that all can get the complete view of the table mountain and the Cape Town city.Good and helpful staffs.Very clean place.There is a free bus service from Kloof nek to the cable car stationjust 4 km from the city.There is a good restaurant on the top of the mountain.Can walk alot and enjoy the cold wind/mountain view
Fabulous!!!. Absolutely funny way to reach the top of the mountains and enjoy the stunning view of the nature and the Cape Town City. Wow!!!

Amazing!!!. The table mountain is a must do in Cape Town. We were fortunate to have visited on a sunny day and the views from the top were stunning. We spent a little over an hour on the top savoring the beauty of nature.

not for the fainthearted. the cablecar is from Victorian times and the ride up to the mountain top can be hairraising but there has never been an accident in over a hundred years so that is reassuring the price was reasonable and if you do get coldfeet you can always take the walk back down although you would have to watch out for the mist the view is breathtaking you can see all of capetown and tablebay theres rare monkeys inhabit the high parts of the mountains forget there name and also some rare types of flowers if in capetown this attraction cant be missed oh and theres a nice café at the top plus a souveneir shop enjoy

So happy to be there. Even though I am afraid of heights, it's totally worth it. Once I conquered my fear I had an amazing time. The installations are first class and with good safety measures. The ticket office was very effective, the line was not bad and moved pretty fast. The ride up only takes four to five minutes, you can spend as much time as you want up there, my 6 year old had a great time looking for Table Mountain’s unofficial mascot called dassies, they are extremely cute and friendly little creatures (please be discouraged to feed them). The view of Cape Town is incredible, I am so happy I did it.

So lucky with the weather!. This is the second time I have done this and it is as amazing this time as it was ten years ago! It is a must do when in Cape Town. One of my friends is scared of heights and he coped with the cable car up and down. Beautiful views.

A Review of my experience only. I really disliked the aerial cable way. We had walked up table mountain and got the cableway back down. Obviously it's basically the only way down if you want to protect your knees, but it was three minutes of horror for me. However, this is simply because I get claustrophobic (so being shut in a overcrowded metal box where you can't move wasn't great) and the spinning made me feel very travel sick. This rest of my party loved it though, as did everyone else in the carriage. So I'm just saying this as a warning for people with claustrophobia/ travel sickness to be prepared.
Beautiful day. The best thing we did was go up TAble Mountain, it was a wonderful fun day of sightseeing. We got a perpective on all of Capetown.

Spectacular if a fine day. A must. This is a must on any Cape Town visit. A view to kill for! Watch for the fog to clear and do it as a priority if the fog clears. Note if you take a taxi back down they are dearer if it has table mountain on the side. ( only table my taxis allowed to pick you up at the cable car) Take free shuttle down further and get a taxi from there. They are much cheaper or take a bus down town. Allow time to explore the top of table mt. Note if taking photos the floor of the cable car turns. It can be quite cool/ cold depending on time of year and day (AUSTRALIAN mature couple)
Nice views. Beautiful views, friendly personel, not very expensive, quick transportation.It adds a lot to the Table Mountain experience!

Top of the world . It's spectacular up Table Mountain. If you can, aim for a clear day, pre-purchase your tickets to avoid waiting in two lines, while waiting talk to those around you and then enjoy the ride up. Take a jacket as it'll be cooler up there (or cold in the winter). Enjoy the view, the flora and fauna and don't forget
Don't miss!. Amazing view of the number one attraction in Cape Town. Went up there 3 times already and it always takes my breath away. Must.

Scary if you don't like heights!. A must do while in Capetown. However, i'm not great with heights and got very scared at the top. My husband and kids loved it! Also, it's about 20 degrees colder at the top (and windy) so bring a jacket or you will freeze! View is breathtaking!
Table mountain. Wonderful. Spectacular. A must see. Views of the whole of cape town. Very pricy for locals, however the view is worth it.

Breathtaking and Memorable. A very professional operation. We were fortunate not to have to queue for too long. You can however buy tickets on their website. The website is also very informative on queue times and visibility. Parking along the road can be an issue - with up to a 2km walk, but at the entrance off the main road there is a huge parking area with a free shuttle bus directly to the lower cable station. Go on a clear day with good visibility. The view is outstanding. Well done Cape Town on running a very slick operation.

Up and away. An absolute must for first time visitors to Cape Town on a fine day. This city is a feast for the eyes and must be appreciated from all its vantage points. The cable car experience was an exceptional way to see the city in all its glory. Highly recommended!!!

Top of the world. Efficiently organised; good value for money; unique, world famous views which are even more spectacular than you imagine beforehand; the two minute ride on a rotating floor within the cable car gives everyone a chance of getting great views. Highly recommended - but, really, if you go to Cape Town and don't take this journey up Table Mountain, why bother going in the first place.

Not to be missed!. As someone whose biggest fear is going on cable cars, this was the most amazing experience and I loved every second - the cable cars are new and never once did I feel unsafe or scared. I was even practically hanging out of the window to take pictures! The views on both the way up and at the top were fantastic. At the top there are good facilities and several paths you can take, as well as a large number of information boards. I would highly recommend this as a 'must-do' while in Cape Town.
Best way down. Save your knees, use the cable car to get down, it's fun too! It's travels fast, and slowly turns one revolution, so cool!
One of the seventh nature wonder's...+ beautiful views.. I recommend to do the reservation before Going from the website and enjoy the view from the cable car it's really amazing.

The fast way!. The fast way (and best way unless you want to hike for an entire day) to visit the Table Mountain. PS you can buy your tickets on-line via the internet so you don't have to queue for that upon arriving.

Woow that was fantastic . A must to do the Cable lift. It spins around so you can take in the views 360 degrees. You don't even feel like your moving. My husband is scared of heights & he was very relaxed & felt at ease. Great views & make sure you have a sunny day without wind. Our day was absolutely perfect.

Rotating cars.. The cable cars had undergone maintenance and had been closed for a few weeks when I got there. This had built up a number of people waiting for it to open and when it did, there was a waiting for two hours in line to get up. Fairly effective organisation though so it wasn't a big problem. I liked the idéa of having rotating cars on the tour down so that everyone got a chance to see the full panoramic sight.

Good views (if you're lucky enough to see them). Cable car is a short 4min journey with a rotating view of Table Mountain but with up to 60 people in the car it's unlikely you'll have the window spot as they're very crowded.
High cable car ride, excellent view lovely ride. the ride was smooth and straight up pretty much, very exhilarating. the walk at the top also great with rock hyrax greeting us. Windy, foggy, lovely.
Worth it to get the views. try and get a window spot, floor rotates on both assent and descent giving you a 360 ° view...... And once on Table Mountain you will be impressed.

table mountain cape town. cable car to table mountain cape town experience was superb. View of the city from the mountain was like a dream state. i have experience of many cable cars in the world but unique feature of this cable car was internal rotation giving equal chance of view by each passenger. Thumbs up.

Beautiful Views - Buy Tickets First. We bought tickets online. I believe they have a seven day window based on your start date. This was needed since most of the trip the mountain was in the clouds. On the last day before our 1:00PM flight out we arrived at about 8:00AM. WE waited the half hour before it opened with the other 100 or so people who arrived before us. However, when it opened at 8:30 we were up at the top by 9:00am and able to quickly see the views before rushing off. It would have been nice to explore more.
Nice views. Great way to quickly get to the top.Mountain is about 1km high and cable is about 1.2km long. Beautiful sights there!

Get there early!. Opens at 8:30am, get there at 8am and there will still be a line. But by 11am the wait is normally around 2 hours. When you get to the top, take the path that loops all the way around the table to get the best panoramic views. A must in Cape Town.
A highlight of visiting the mountain. I love the way the floor rotates around so everyone gets the same view. I took way too many photos going both directions, but worth it!

Great way up the mountain!. I really wanted to hike up but my fiancé is afraid of heights so we used the cable car. We happened to get there when there was no line so it was really easy to get up and magnificent views!!! It's constantly turning so there is no bad seat in the house.

7th world wonder. The joy of seeing how much our Italian guest enjoy the view from the top of Table Mountain, was wonderful. The view of the Atlantic sea as well as towards the northern suburbs, was spectacular. We saw lots of birds, lizards and the flora is amazing.

Must visit! . As soon as I arrived in Cape Town I was riding the cableway before I'd even unpacked. The cost is fair and the service is great. Take your time when you're up the mountain, don't spend your whole time looking through a lens! There's cafes, toilets and gift shops, even a wifi bar at the top too. A must see for all tourists coming to Cape Town!
AWESOME CABLE CAR RIDE. We had an awesome experience and it was really exciting. The view from the top is world class and therefore is recognised as one of the wonders of the world.
Fun and a nice change. After hiking up the mountain with a bad knee it was very nice to take the cable car down. To our surprise it started spinning and you got a 360 view of Cape Town. Amazing!
Awesome, a real must see bucket list special!. Just wow, everything so well organized, professional, friendly X this is my third visit, you can't get bored of his trip!

Quick Ride up or Down Table Mountain. Cableway is a great way to get to top or bottom of Table Mountain if you are pressed for time or have limited mobility. The wait can be a bit lengthy but service is very good.
Breathtaking . Worldclass Attraction, worthy of its international accolades. Fantastic outing for young and old. Must see for every adventurous heart.

Great views - you're packed into the cable car like a sardine . Headed up the cableway today. Fantastic views & if you don't enjoy hiking it's the only way to get to the top. If you're not a fan of heights then this will be terrifying for you. They really pack everyone in like sardines in a can. The staff member sits in the middle of the cable car on a fixed position & the rest of the floor spins around so everyone gets a good vantage point for the views. Don't try to get a pic when it stops at the top as the staff want you out ASAP so they can load in the next lot of people - to the point that today there was a lady trying to get a selfie at the top & the staff member whistled at her (in the Same manner that you call for your dog) saying to get off. If I had to deal with tourists everyday I'd get a little frustrated too but I found that instance this afternoon to be pretty average.Heaps of staff on the top of the mountain in the main area. We asked a heap of questions & all were super helpful.We caught the cableway up & hiked back down (very steep, rocky & uneven) a great hike but super hard on your knees. We're not super fit & we made it ok- took us 2.5-3hours. Once at the bottom of the trail you then have to walk back up to the lower cable station along the road & down to your car. For where we parked it was roughly 2km further up Hill.Defiantly take water with you & good walking shoes - even if not hiking - there's a heap of paths along the main top area of the mountain. A must do if you're in Cape Town - just for the views!!!

Nothing special. I did not really enjoy the table Mountain Aerial Cableway. I think that it is too expensive insofar 125R for five minutes of journey is insane.The fact that the cableway turn around itself is quite scared for my point of view.Disappointment.

Beautiful View. This is a great place to start a visit of Cape Town. The tram ride is short and the inside of the car actually turns so everyone gets to see the views even though you're packed in, as a typical for cable cars, just minus the skis and the snow. Plan to spend an hour at the top touring around. I was with a tour and had to go back down on the cable car, but you may wish to hike back down. Say your prayers and night before for a clear day and you'll see a beautiful view of the city below.

great trip. Don't miss this. The first few days we were in Capetown the tram was closed due to wind. Take advantage of the first calm clear day to do this. We wanted to hike up but with only 2 of us is was not safe (and was also hot!). We took a short tour at the top and also walked/hiked to the beacon. Spectacular views, great scenery.
Very nice scene . It is a very nice scene, I recommend it for any Cape Town visitor/tourist.مشهد جميل لمدينة كسب تاون من الأعلى مكان ينبغي لكل زائر لمدينة كسب تاون من المرور عليه.
Best view ever. It is a must if you go to Cape Town! Buy the ticket online,so you can skip the line. Funny "drivers". Amazing view.

Bit Disorganised. The views were great. We waited quite a while to get up, and the whole thing seemed very disorganised - a few times we were shuffled around, and were rather confused about the process. It was a random Saturday afternoon out of season too.Waited for almost an hour at the top to get the last rides down (we only made it up at around 4.30pm - and rushed around only to find a massive queue to get down again). Be prepared for waits at both ends of the Cable Car.

Cape Town visit . What a great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Obtain your tickets on line and you have no queuing to contend with. The staff on duty at the station are friendly and very efficient. The cable car holds 65 people and rotates on the way up. It's a fabulous experience and that gets better when you see the view at the top.

Outstanding !. Amazing views as you are elevated by the cable cart up the mountain, it takes a few minutes and you're on top.From the top you'll have a bird's eye view to a certain extent of Cape Town from all directions as far as your eyes can take you,i.e The Ocean, Robben Island, the Waterfront, the Locations, the CBD etc. On the mountian you'll enjoy viewing beautiful flora-look for our endangered and national flower- the Protea; you will walk on paved pathway that is a long stretch. If you didn't pack a meal on your backpack no worries there is a restaurant on top of the mountain for snacks,places to sit and admire the beauty and/or take pictures to capture the moment. It is up to you how long you wanna stay on top- the cable cart returns regularly picking and dropping people.I have made several trips to this beautiful wonder since young, to date it never ceases to amaze me.N.B Choose a clear day otherwise access is not allowed once weather changes.Oops too long,sorry!

Spiralling up Table Mountain. The reception area at the Lower Cable Station is excessively busy during season. The Southeaster may also be problematic during high summer- January to February. The journey is quite magnificent as it offers a 360 degree view of sea, city and mountain. The view from the top is absolutely great, often tinged with a breath of crisp air, is quiet and allows for reflection, contemplation while viewing one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The view of Fresnaye, CBD, the Cape Flats and adjacent mountains are fantastic. The flora and dams on the mountain top make for great short excursions. The restaurant has seen a number of upgrades in terms of service, food quality and room. Additional indoor/outdoor spaces add to the charm and experience.
Ms. Its just a spectacular experience. The view is breathtaking we had a wonderful time, the only negative is that wifi was not working at all.

Long waits and expensive. . You should just hike up the mountain, because that comes way cheaper than the cableway. Although the sunset drives are supposed to be very nice. Best pick a Sunday, otherwise you will wait more than an hour to even get a ticket, let alone fetch the cable car up.

Bucket List. A must visit if you are in Cape Town. One of the new 7 wonders of the world. Go early to avoid the queues & watch the weather forecasts, as if its cloudy, no point in going up!Very good, cold, fresh beer in the Cafe up the top!

Amazing. Get there early !! The lines were pretty long !! maybe took about an hour to get to the cable car. But when you get to the top it is well worth the wait. The views are beautiful !!! On one side you can look out and see the whole town but then on the other side you see the ocean. Make sure you go on a clear day not cloudy!!

Great experience. A must do when in Cape Town. Spectacular views on a clear day. Best to purchase your tickets online to avoid the queue although there is still a bit of a wait to get on the cable car.
Awesome place. Even if you are scare of heights (like me) it defintly worth it. Its really not just a mountain it's a mudt in Cape Town

wow. the cable car is the easier way to get to the top of table mountain.. it only takes a few minutes but the cable car revolves so you get to see the wonderful views. the queues sometimes can be long so might be worth checking ahead. weather conditions too can affect the running of the cable car
Awesome. The experience is just so awesome. The waiting is really worth the while. The staff is very polite and friendly. Beautiful all the way to the top and back.

An easy but expensive way to visit the top of the mountain.. A really interesting accent (and decent) in a revolving cable car, giving excellent views as you travel on a 5 minute voyage.However you must arrive early if you are going to use this facility otherwise you can expect a long wait in a slow moving queue.

Amazing views . This is a must do in Cape Town. The view from Table Mountain is jaw dropping as you can see forever and the view is spectacular. So glad we made sure we did this during our stay. Highly recommend getting tickets in advance to avoid waiting in line and we took the Hop on Hop off bus which dropped us off right at the entrance.

New 7 wonders of the World. The Cableway deserves its spot as one of the new 7 Wonders of the World. Excellently maintained and well managed entry into the cableway. The staff are friendly and knowledgable.The rotating car gives you superb views of the city centre and of the ocean on your way up. You also get to the wave to the more energetic who are hiking or rock climbing. There are well marked and laid walkways at the top. Wear suitable shoes as you will want to walk to take in all the viewpoints. In some instances, you will be able to veer off the pathways and these are best handled in sneakers/ walking shoes.Binoculars could be useful.Have sufficient space on your camera for the pictures you will want to take.Good informal restaurant at the top, as well as a decent (though slightly expensive) shop for trinkets.Take a warm top as it can get cooler there, even if it is a hot day in Cape Town. Parking can be difficult to get, so I would suggest getting here earlier. Alternatively, you will have to park further down the winding, steep road and walk up to the bottom cable station. This is mildly strenuous. You can alternatively park you car at the very bottom of the mountain at the parking lot (this is a smaller parking lot) & take a myciti bus up to the top. I am uncertain of this cost.We go up to the top via the cableway at least 3 times a year & obviously enjoy it. Recommended for tourists and locals

An experience you will not forget. The trip to the mountain via the cable car only takes a few minutes. It is always best to go as early as possible as there are always queues. There is a free mycity bus that takes you to the lower cable station. Yes! Free!! Many people do not know about this and rely on other methods to get to the lower cable station. We had our breakfast on the mountain which was an absolutely stunning view. The weather changes without warning so always take a sunhat, a thin jacket and make sure you are wearing comfortable walking shoes. There isn't much to do on the mountain, except take many photos, walk around and search for dassies. Try to make the most of the trip on the mountain - be adventurous and walk further over the mountain. It is lots of fun, just be careful and do not attempt alone. We walked to the other side of the mountain and then down past the gorge to the other part of table mountain. Follow the signs and guidelines. It is tranquil and has more gorgeous views. Enjoy!

You just have to do this. Book on line to avoid queuing for a ticket, but be still prepared for a queue for the cable car. Prove it is your birthday and your ticket is for free - but you cannot then book on line! At peak times take the the bus or a taxi, or be prepared for a long walk if going by car. Don't park beyond the Lower cablecar Station, to avoid traffic tickets &/or your car towed away! Phone before leaving home, the weather on the top is often not what it is in the City Bowl.

Worth the wait...... Well worth the fairly long wait in the queue (even though we booked our tickets online beforehand). Cableway ride was fun and the views at the top were spectacular! Not too crowded once up there either.....

Bring wine an cheese for a sunset experience. With continuous visitors, this is now my capping moment- bring them up the top (online pre-bought tickets to skip the queue- keep an eye on groupon.co.za for winter specials) bring some wine (nb screwcap easier than cork) some glasses and cheeses..grab a seat on the wall (far away from the entrance) and watch a sunset spectacular. Go up a wee bit earlier for a walkaround 360 of Capetown..and then grab teh last car down- horn will sound so you cant miss it..

Breath taking views. If you do this trip on a clear day, you won't be disappointed....I rate this as one of the most beautiful views in the world.If you only have one day in CTown and it's not clear, I wouls still recommend going on this trip.

Ausome views and exciting cable car ride.. The cable car ride up to the top of table mountain is exciting with the rotating cable car giving you all the awesome views as you travel to the top of the mountain.please bring along your camera as you will see some of the most amazing views of Cape Town whilst traveling to the top of the mountain. Also wear some comfortable walking shoes as the various walks on top of the mountain are fantastic.If you go up just before lunch you could have something to eat when you reach the summit and then take some or all of the walks and end up with an amazing sun set before you return to the bottom.
Table mtn cable way.. Excellent service.fantastic experience on top of wonder if the world.food good at the top too.walk across down to kirstenbosch gardens

Great views. Wonderful views of the city! Good food options on top of the mountain with wi-fi access. Ticket price is reasonable. The best part of the trip is going up with a rotating cable car. I recommend start off by facing the mountain & by the time you reach the top you will be rotated to see the city via the 360 rotation.

If you are only going to do one sight see this is it!. First the cable car experience is really exciting with its revolving floor so no worry which way you get in and face. Secondly on top the views are magnificent and there are some fun walks. Restaurant not back but basic fair.

Birthday Treat!. We had some UK visitors who wanted to walk up the mountain and catch the cable car down again. This reminded us that on one's birthday you're able to ride free! As it was my birthday the next day we had a spectacular ride and caught the last car down as the sun was beginning to set. What a great birthday gift!

Breathtaking . This is a must do! Definitely with the wait in the line. Strongly recommend you buy tickets online to avoid one of the lines. We went up in the afternoon and stayed for the spectacular sunset. Simply amazing
Breathtaking Birthday!. Perfect way to celebrate your birthday... the view from the cable car and Table mountain is absolutely gorgeous. Watching the sunset was breathtaking!!!
Great on a clear day. The attraction is not cheap but the view you get is quite impressive (on a clear day).The cabins turn 360 so everyone can get a good view.

A bucket list must do. A world heritage absolutely must do at least once in a lifetime experience. Make sure that you time your visit with the weather to maximize your enjoyment.Allow time to explore the upper area of the mountain, at least 2 hours
Unmissable. There's a reason why Table Mountain is South Africa's biggest tourist attraction. Even if you're only in Cape Town for one day, don't miss it.
Mr. One of the must do activities in Cape Town. The cable car has a panoramic view and rotates as it ascends and descends
Amazing. If you have time to do just one thing in Cape Town the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a must do!! The ride to the top is awesome and the views from Table Mountain are spectacular!!

Breathtaking views. You see it all from the top of Table Mtn. The city.ocean,Robben Island and surrounding areas. The cable car is wonderful. There are walking trails and food & beverage places at the top. Also you can climb to the top if in shape. No special gear needed. Visit on a clean day for best views. The "tablecloth" fog that rolls over the top can void the view.
Mrs. Spectacular view of Cape Town. Great service. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Sunset is really amazing from Table Mountain. Great coffee and good food.

Patience rewarded. Stopped there last week. Great day for visibility and no wind. We bought our tickets from the hop-on hop-off bus driver so we skipped the purchase ticket line. Our line was long, but moved quickly. Views at the top were unreal. Such a beautiful city. A must do activity when visiting Cape Town. Make sure to check the weather, especially the wind when considering this as high wind will close the cable car.
Table Mountain. Always wonderful! Book online and go at least an hour before it opens for the least standing in line. Marvelous views and exhilarating ride up. Allow an hour up top to walk around

Vacation . Buy your tickets online BEFORE you go. That'll speed up your wait. Cable car was way too high for me but my wife and son went up and fully enjoyed the ride. Once on top of Table Mountain it is very windy so dress accordingly. Go early in the day.

ONE WORD "AWESOME". It was one of those clear days!! First time one the cable car! Did not know that the middle (or is it the side!!) is turning!! Had to wait for my parcels!! It was an awesome experience!
Great cableway. We loved the cableway - especially the revolving floor. A must do in Cape Town. It's worth booking online to get a discounted ticket

Value for money!. Steps have been taken to ensure that tourists do not have to spend their time in the queue. The Cableway is a fantastic addition to the Table Mountain attraction. And it ensures that you can spend most of your time in experiencing the nature at the top.A hassle-free online booking system and some very helpful staff make it an experience worth remembering. The cable car rotates during travel which ensures that you have a 360 view of the scenery around.Only negative is that it is unpredictable and they stop the service if the winds get stronger. So, there is a possibility of you getting stuck on top of the mountain, or of turning up at the location to know that the service has been called off for the day!

Beautiful views of cape town and the cape of good hope. The cableway takes 5 minutes to whisk you on top of table mountain and give a 360 view of the area. One of my favorite experiences in Cape Town.
Great views. A must do in cape town on a clear day. The ride up to the cableway is also amazing. Dont miss out on this one

Obviously on any Cape Town bucket list. Table Mountain is such an icon of the city that a visit is an absolute must. The tickets were fast and convenient and we were very lucky that we went on a day where the weather was forecast to be overcast but turned out to be great so I think the crowds stayed away. Amazing views and a nice walk from the top. Highly recommended.

Like the rotating floor. When the mountain is clear of crowd, this is the best way to rise to the summit. In the afternoons in particular, queues were not too bad and as well as the stunning views awaiting you at the top, the rotating floor during the ascent was a nice feature.

At long last - after 4 visits over 13 years. I've visited Cape Town on three previous visits and failed to get to the top of table mountain on each. This time I took my lucky charm in the guise of my wife on honeymoon.Was it worth the wait, no & yes....No, because we were largely covered by the legendary Table Mountain Tablecloth which was cold, wet and made viewing impossible.That said, we did enjoy some intermittent breaks in the cloud which, when it wasn't there, allowed the views the mountain is equally famous for. I've marked 4/5 simply because of the length of time we could see nothing. The views, during the clear patches were pretty spectacular and worth waiting for ( though not for 13 years).If you're in Cape Town, you must make the effort to get up "that bloody mountain", you won't regret out opportunity.

Good views but big queues . We use the cableway to descend Table Mountain after a hike up. It's quicker and obviously easier. An adult ticket is R135 and can be bought at the main shop or online.The only problem you might have is the queue. It can be huge at peak times.The views are amazing, enjoy!

Extremely long wait!!. We visited Cape Town recently and of course Table Mountain was a must do on our list. We were there during the winter (just last week) and so this is considered a low season time. Wow. We lined up for 2 hours before we finally got to the cable car and up to the mountain. Even people who had bought their tickets online had to line up, but their line was definitely quicker, so get tickets online is what I'd advice. They only have 2 cable cars, so the wait is long anyway. I can't imagine what high season looks like. I think they need to rethink their system of moving the line somehow. The wait was quite ridiculous! These comments aren't related to the cable cars themselves. These are really nice and when we were there they'd just done an annual safety check. Plus the floor rotates as you go up which was neat; you can see all around you as you travel up. Just figure out a better way to deal with the line up!

Stunning vistas. This is an absolute must do activity. The views from the top of the mountain are fantastic. You need to get a clear day for it though and as cape town has some changeable weather,you really have to go for it as soon as you seen the clouds lift.We didn't buy our tickets beforehand so had to queue but it was not a long wait. The actual cable car ride took about 6mins,and was very smooth. We chatted to the two drivers to take our mind off the height!There are a few walks you can do around the top,and a cafe too. It's really worth doing and I could have stayed up there all day.

Great view overlooking the land and sea. Great opportunity to view the landscape of Capetown, South Africa. Plan ahead and be prepared to detour if it's raining or too cloudy. We had a blast!! Perfect, clear day!! I definite must do in Capetown.

Very good . It is a great way to experience table Mountain. The view at the top is worth everything. Queues can be a bit long and there is not an easy way to by online and just show your phone at the entrance. It has to be printed
Perfect View!. If you are at Cape town you must go Table mountain and must do it with cableway very nice view and when you are going up floor starting to turn so you can get better view.

A view unparalleled . Expect a long line in the morning if recent weather has been cloudy. Otherwise, fantastic. Great views from the top of the world. Rock dassies, birds, and incredible cape fynbos flora. A rare place of beauty.

Gorgeous view from high atop Table Mountain. The view of all of Cape Town in addition to the city is unmatched from the top of Table Mountain. The cable way itself has a floor that turns 360 degrees to allow full disability while going up/down the mountain. Cloud cover was heavy during our trip, but it didn't dim the beauty of this area. Highly recommend going to Table Mountain if weather permits.
A lot of people(. Table mountain is great, it is worth visiting, but lines are to big( cabins are perfect, but too much time was spent in line

Quick, efficient and great views enroute. Took the Aerial Cableway up to Table Mountain earlier today. Was a very pleasant, relatively quick ride. The staff were quite friendly and efficient at moving the lines along. If you're stuck inside with a view you don't like, no worries, the floor of the cable-car rotates as you climb or descend and you will at least get a quick shot at your desired view. Highly recommend getting on-line tickets (follow the link from their website); we displayed the tickets right on my smart phone. Took an über up there and back, parking is a challenge so avoid driving up there yourself. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway website lists other public transportation options as well. Word of caution, do check the weather forecasts and the cableway web site before buying your tickets. They shut down for low visibilities and or high winds. Tickets are "timed" (afternoon or morning of that specific date).

Quick trip to the top. The cable way is really good and rotates through 180 degrees as you ascend and descend the mountain. It is recommended that you book tickets prior to visiting the cable way especially at busy periods. The team are really friendly and you can get a picture of your trip up the mountain.

Easy access and excellent views . Ease of access for all to the top of table mountain with the rotating cabin so everybody gets a good view regardless of where you stand when you enter the gondola. Ride is very smooth and quite fast (8,5 m/s). Highly recommended to book via Internet prior of showing up to avoid lines at the ticket office. To get there, also recommended to use the city tour buses, taxi or Uber as parking is limited (parking along the access road is subject to payment). Recommended for all ages!
Beautiful views . The cable cars take you to the top of the table mountain where you will find astonishing views... Change your camera

Amazing Views!. The day we planned to go up the Cableway ended up being a holiday, and it was quite a popular thing to do. We were glad we bought tickets online, as they have a buy tickets and already have tickets line. We still waited just under 2 hours to get on the Cableway, but from the top we could see a person who was next to us in the other line, and was still a way away from buying her tickets. The ride is fairly quick, and if you are not good with heights you can stand in the center of the car. The car holds about 65 people for each trip, and there are 2 cars that operate. At the top is a cafeteria type restaurant with some hot and cold choices, pizza, wrapped sandwiches, desserts, beer, wine and cider. There are paths to walk, and some charts showing courses you can walk that are 15 min to I think 2 hrs in time. Lots of look out points and areas to take in the view all around the area. The line for the ride down was much shorter, about 10 minutes, so that was a bonus. Cabs do wait at the top to take you back to town, just ask one of the employees in a vest, they will call you a cab.
Awesome views . Staff all very friendly and professional, had an awesome time. Views are breathtaking .You can take your time and relax ,walk around on you of the world.

A cable car with spinning floor. We took the cable car down after hiking to the top of Table Mt. The views from the cableway are equally spectacular and you might even catch groups of climbers on the steep sides of the mountain. Oh yeah, the floor spins.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Amazing experience. Weather was superb, which helped. Although we were there in August there was not a cloud in the sky and it was not cold, in fact it was warm. No wind either and the visibility was incredible.
Great views from the top. Great way to see Cape Town from the air... the ride is short and the views are spectacular. Clouds passing by below you!.

Family visit with grandparents and kids. The cable car ticket queue was very long. We find it easier to purchase tickets online - we did that on our mobile when we got there and waited another 20 min before getting onto the cable car. One of the cable car's 360 degree turn was not working that day. But you still get a spectacular view in the cable car. We had late lunch at the restaurant on top - the food wasn't that great. Some were nice but some were awful. Then they didn't have cutlery and said we should use a spoon! Eventually they washed some cutlery and provided to us. The view is amazing and always lovely to be on top of table mountain.

Awesome!!. My friends and I are in Cape Town checking out the best sites. Table Mountain is breathtaking. You can get pictures from all angles in high places. I recommend arriving there early as the line forms quickly before opening time. The Cable Car was an amazing view as we ride up, a much faster way to get to the top. Would do it again!
Need to improve on the queues. Long queues but good value as kids go free at the moment. It seem to take ages to get the tickets needs to improve.
Most see. A most seen attraction at cape twon . Lovly place and better to book online one night to monimise the waiting time

Mountain climb . We climbed the mountain and took the cable car down. Was a great experience. Lots to see from the top. The hike up is hard and takes about 3 hours. But the view from the top is worth it. Make sure you go on a clear day but wow it's spectacular. I loved it me and my fiancé love going up the mountain. Make sure you do this if you visit Cape Town. You have too

Family breakfast. Enjoyed our annual visit to the top of table mountain. Breakfast at the cafe is decent enough and the kids enjoy the goodie bag they get every time. Amazing views - never fails to take my breath away.
Amazing views and must see attraction . If it's a clear day, you have to go up the aerial tram to Table Mountain. A definite must see in Cape Town. The lines can be long, but well worth it.

LIFETIME EXPIRIENCE IN CAPE TOWN. what an expirience to be on top of mountain in the cableway looking at the landscaping of Mother City, the Table Mountain is the must see when you visit South Africa.
Do not visit in winter. Exellent place although the cable car was operational but limited view due to clouds, I recommend to visit in spring or summer that is from Sept to Mar.

The best mountain views ever. The cable car ride itself is awesome - the floor rotates so you get 360 degrees of view. The views were stupendous. If you are in Cape Town this is a must-do if the weather is good. We got there via the Hop-on bus and then travelled onto Kirstenbosch and the wineyards. What a great day in a great city.

The table mountain experience. I have visited table mountain on many occasions. Once with my husband, twice with my kids, another with my mom and lastly with my bff. I must say that each time I go up, I have a truly uplifting experience regardless of having visited so many times. I think it's just the feeling of being with loved ones on one of the most beautiful mountains in the world makes it different each time. For me, I take the spiritual upliftment of appreciating God's work and it's truly the most astounding views. The food at the shop is also quite good however a bit pricey. Very well maintained though. I will definitely visit again

A must see. When in Cape Town, going up the Table Mountain with the cableway is a must. You have a great view on both ways, and the cableway turns 360 degrees, meaning you have a great view from all around. Great experience.

Good views and stable. I always try and go on cable cars whilst visiting the world, although I am usually very nervous whilst on them, I was even more wary when I read that the floor revolves but its great, everyone gets a view and chance for some great photos and you feel very safe and its cool and comfortable. Didn't walk much around the top as too much else we had to get through on a flying visit. Worth getting your tickets online beforehand to avoid queues, you can always get a refund if you don't make it. We got there early before 9 but still short wait in the sun. If you have time do spend more time at the top though.
