Bucket list stuff. One of the natural wonders of the world!! This is not to be missed if visiting Cape Town and should be the top of your list. The views are absolutely heart stopping. I've been up a dozen times and its never any less enthralling. I think queues can be avoided if booking in advance or organising through a tour company.

Crowd vibe not for nature-lovers. IT's a tough compromise: wanting to skip the gruelling hike, but spending the majority of your time at Table Mtn crammed in by humanity. The line and the crush in the tram is like Disneyland. For those of us who seek the quiet and peace of the outdoors, this is not so great. If you walk a bit on the mesa, you can get some freedom from the crush of humanity. but then, you have to deal with it again going down. this was a once only thing for me. id rather hike the lion's head.

Amazing!!!. You cannot go to Cape Town without heading up Table Mountain. The views are spectacular. I would recommend taking a good guide with you who can make the views come to life when you are at the top.

Get there early at busy times. The cableway had been closed for two weeks for annual maintenance and we were leaving for home on the day it opened. It was a fine day with no cloud so it was very busy when we arrived at 8.30 a.m. The queuing system was a little chaotic with supposedly two separate queues for pre-booked tickets and those with no tickets. How the two eventually combined I don't know. It was an hour and a half before we got in a cable car. They each hold about 60 people and leave at 6 or 7 minute intervals. We spent just over an hour at the top and had no problem getting a cable car down at about 11.30 in time to return to our hotel, clear our rooms, store our luggage and grab something to eat before heading to the airport. It was not high season when we went up Table Mountain so I imagine it might be even busier in the summer. It is pretty pointless going up when it is cloudy so this tends to concentrate the passengers.

Great service well worth the spectacular views. Table mountain is an absolute must - the views are phenomenal. The cable car gets understandably busy and the queues are much shorter if you buy tickets online instead of on the day. However long you have to queue though - it is absolutely worth it!

View to kill for. Went on a cloudless then cloudy day. Beautiful views with cloud below. There are walking paths at the top to give a 360 view. Restaurant at the top reasonable price. Definitely worth 2to 3 hours. Book online to save some time

AMAZING. The mountain was great! Had an amazing time up there exploring and getting amazing pictures. The ticketing system for the cable car needs looking at, it took far too long and people pushing into lines left right and centre

Hiked up and took the cable car down...awesome view if the day is clear. Our last stop in Cape Town...literally we climbed up the mountain in the morning and flew out that evening! If physically able to do so you should climb up...such a nice climb, a little tough but worth it at the top. Plan to get there early, like 7:30, It took us just under 2hrs to get to the top, if it's a little cloudy don't worry because it usually clears up from 10-1. But if it's rainy and forecast is cloudy all day don't do it because you won't see a thing. If climbing up, bring a fleece because it's about 8C/45F at the top. The cafe is always busy because it's the only one but it's nice to be able to get a hot drink. This is a must do while in Cape Town...we really enjoyed it.

Table Mountain. We enjoyed the cable car experience to the top of Table Mountain. We loved the revolving pod. I would suggest you pre book your ticket and be aware that there are long queues. We were told that mid afternoon around 3.30-4.00 was a good time to go. The views from the top were spectacular and you can spend as much or as little time as you like there. There is a cafe and rest rooms at the top of the Mountain. The paths at the top are clearly defined and not a problem for your child. Pushing a buggy with a young child might be tricky at times due to some unevenness of the paths.

The easy way up. The cableway is the easy and fast way up Table Mountain. It is a fun element that the inner part of the cableway turned around so everyone could enjoy the view 360 degrees. Unfortunately you can't take good pictures from the cableway due to the plexiglass. Make sure to check the weather and dress accordingly, the winds can be chilly on the top. If you order your tickets online, you can skip the queue for the ticket counter.

Amazing views. I would pre-order tickets online to save waiting at busier times. Great view as you going up as the cableway turns 360o so you don't have to fight for the best view when going up. Once as the a the top the views are fantastic, lovely place to have a picnic and relax and enjoy. One person was scared of heights but they left safe going up the cable way.

Perfect day on the mountain.. The weather was perfect for a trip up the mountain. I took my mother-in-law and Autistic son up the mountain (both of them for the first time) and my daughter. We took our picnic basket and extra clothing just in case the weather was a little different up the mountain. The Q to buy tickets was not to long (expected it to be longer, were still partially in tourist season). When you go to a huge tourist like Table Mountain, expect to wait, be prepared, don't spoil for yourself even before you get up the mountain. Service at the station and inside the cable car is fantastic. Well organised and perfectly safe, in fact 110% safe. Once on top, you are on your own and should really take responsibility for those with you. There is routes that one can take to get a good view and enjoy the scenery and everything the mountain has to offer. We walked all the way round the longer route and had a wonderful time. (Take your camera) We ate our picnic goodies undisturbed and soaked in the sun while a cool afternoon breeze started blowing. (Luckily we were prepared) The area around the cable station is the busiest and also the place for the best views and photos. The Toilet facilities and restaurant/ shops is also at the station. All in all a great experience and real value for money, something one should do at least once a year if you are lucky enough to live close to the mountain.

A "high" light in Cape Town. Although I live in Cape Town, I have not been up Table Mountain for a couple of years until we had family visiting and wanted them to experience it all. It stays one of the most breathtaking experiences I have ever had and is a sure way to get people to fall in love with Cape Town. The Cable Car is well managed and safe - truly world class.

Above Heavan. No one can go to Cape Town without conquering this magnificent Mother Mountain. On a clear day you can see forever. Cars and people become Noddy characters, the blue of the sky and sea mound into each other in wisps. Get a coffee muffin or even a meal with a Beer or glass of wine and settle outside and enjoy the calm, the great Flora and the quizzical looks of the Dussys. Then either catch the state of the cable back down or take your courage in your hands and hike down.

Must see!. We were lucky that the weather was on our side. It was a beautiful, sunny and between 21-23 degrees Celsius at the top of the mountain (around midday). And with hardly any wind. The wait to get on the gondola to head up to the mountain was about 2 hours but apparently this was an extra long time and due to 1) the first day Table Mountain was open after being closed for 2 weeks' maintenance; 2) it was the start of a long holiday weekend and; 3) the weather was amazing. It was well worth it though. The views from the top are AMAZING. There's also a free wifi lounge at the gondola entrance including USB ports to recharge all your smart devices. And yes, food and drinks also available.
Table Mountain Cableway. the family enjoyed this outing. the children aged 4 and 6 as well as grandma who is afraid of heights. It is very safe.

Fantastic views but very disappointing cueing management. The aerial is great, but cueing management is really unfair. We bought tickets on line, what supposedly is a way to save cues in relation to those ones who buy the tickets in the site but the surprise was that we had to cue together and although the cues splits in two rows (one for online buyers and another for in site buyers) at the end the cues merge again. It took us two hours to reach the summit.

Braeth taking views - rotates so everyone gets a full view. Check the website, the cable car was closing for maintenance a couple of days after we arrived so you don't want to miss out. Great views, reasonably priced and it rotates so that everyone gets a chance of taking in the view, although you may have to nudge onw or two people who hog the open window with their camera even though it is all glass from waist level

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. I have to say I never quite managed to go up the cable car. I tried twice on 2 perfect clear days but was confronted with queues and a wait of almost 3 hours each time. I opted out of even trying but I'm sure the view would be worth it if you could be bothered wasting half a day trying.
Lovely View. Make sure you have a clear day in order to see the city below. Actually, there is a lot to see on top of the mountain. Lots of signs to read and photo opts!

Scenic Views. For those who do not want to climb up the mountain (and there is a nice pathway, you can take the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. It is a nice trip that gives you scenic views of Cape Town and the Atlantic Seaboard and gets you to the top, where you can walk around and view the area in all its majesty and glory.Be sure to go online in advance of your trip to the cableway station as the cableway is often closed, either for maintenance or due to high winds.
Walk up, cable down. Take a hike up the mountain (and avoid the lines) and take the cable down again. Spectacular views, and a little thrill!

Fun way to the top. Bar the ridiculous queues to get up and down (1.5 hours wait both ways) despite arriving late afternoon and with online tickets, the actual trip on the cableway was breathtaking with stunning views all the way around up top. The coolest feature is the cable car has a rotating platform so everyone gets to see 360 degree views. Point of concern: on our way back everyone was clamouring on to get down since it was late and the queues were nearly 2 hours, despite the maximum capacity being 64 ppx, I was pretty sure there were more people than that (I counted). Now I don't know whether this compromised safety or they had an internal weighing system that calculates the collective weight onboard, but I felt safety should never be compromised irrespective of the demand of queues waiting to get down. Other than that we had a great time!

Quick way up the top. We took the cable car up the mountain as we only got there right before gate closure time, it was quick and easy to get up. On the way down, due to overwhelming numbers of visitors, we had to line up and wait in the cold for nearly two hours before we board a cable car down.
Well organised. Massive queue that moves quickly. Great customer service from all staff. Well worth the 240 rand return in the cable car.

Pretty cool and quick way to the top. The cable car was a cool fun way for us to get to the top of the mountain. The floor rotates so no worries if you didn't get a window view when you entered. As we rode up we saw people hiking, jumping and climbing the mountain. It was pretty cool and of course the view is amazing. The car sometimes closes for maintenance and if the weather is bad so its best to check the website before booking tickets. Tickets are valid for 7 days and if you need a refund due to bad weather, its an easy enough process.

Holiday visit to table mountain. Awesome views. Cableway super safe and rotates so u have awesome views. Lovely restaurant at top. Walking trails to die for.Only negative very busy n looking queues to cable way.
Simply a bliss. Long queue but it was worth waiting. Wonderful views atop. I recommend one of the proposed guided walks.

Good service throughout the experience. We really enjoyed our trip up Table Mountain. It's important that you take any opportunity where the sky and mountain top is clear as it's very fleeting. Luckily, we dropped on a good day where there was little cloud and good visibility. The whole process was well planned, and the cable cars were (thankfully) not overcrowded. The view from the top is absolutely unmissable. Even the views from the constantly-rotating cable cars are spectacular.You can't really visit Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain and this service really does make it easier to view and ensures you get up before the cloud consumes it all again! All the best in your Travels

Interesting information by a great guide. Travelling to a destination is one thing, however, when you have a guide that makes the trip even more interesting it becomes a blessing. we had a young Indian gent who told us all the ins and outs.

Don't miss this amazing site!. We spent a morning hiking up to the summit...not too strenuous and then a few hours at the top taking in views before heading down via cable car. It is breathtakingly amazing and the views are ones you will never forget. I recommend hiking either up or down as both ways may be too much and can be time consuming as well. Be sure to also check out Lion Head. Remember to bring water and some cool weather clothing/layers as weather can literally change in minutes from sunny to cloudy/stormy. Grab a Cadbury treat to help push through the tough part :)
Lovely trip on a sunny clear day. Quick and a short rather dizzying ride. But what a view on the way and on top! Suggest you wear warm clothes.

Breathtaking ride to the top. As I was only in Cape Town fo0r a few days I though the cable car was a good option. You need a good head for heights as the gondola goes straight to the top with no intermediate pylons so it sags and the last part is almost straight up. The gondola also rotates as you go up so you get to see the view from all angles - a nice touch.

Beautiful yes, but waaaaay overpriced!. Yes, the view is beautiful, and Table Mountain is great, but the fact that a 3 minute ride to get up to the Table Mountain is an attraction in itself is a joke. It's the only means of transport up, so views are better from the top of the mountain, but the cable car is waaaaay overpriced and they are cashing in big time being the only ones up...I live in Cape Town and I can tell you the only reason why they keep raising the prices is because tourists support it. Not many locals pay to go up anymore...

Book online. If you're not one of those looking to hike up the the mountain, the cableway will get you there in minutes. Everything is well-organised. Buy tickets online in advance to avoid the lines.

A beautiful 369 view of Cape Town and surrounding area.. If the weather is bad or very windy, Table Mountain aerial cable shuts down. So prepare that if you can't see it one day then try another day. Recommend going at the opening of the day otherwise it will be a long lines for waiting. Beautiful view.

Beautiful views of Cape Town and the surrounding area. We took the cable car to the top and hiked for about two hours. Breathtaking views of Cape Town and an easy hike on the flat rocks at the top! Worth the trip to the top!

Spectacular view. The ride up is amazing, 360 degree view over Cape Town. Once at the top spend as much time as you like. Enjoy the view out over the Indian Ocean or over the city of Cape Town and surrounds. Definately worth a visit
Awesome view!. Travel up The Mountain in good sunny weather. You will not be able to take great pictures on a cloudy Day.
Check Your Dates. Disappointingly, it was closed on my visit to Cape Town. Seems to happen July to August. When they do the maintenance on the thing. Be prepared.
Work Wonder. Seeing is believing. No photographs can do fair justice to the unique abs exceptional Beaty of this wonder

Cable car . What a view, you can't visit Cape Town without going up Table Mountain. You can buy tickets before but we didn't didn't and it wasn't a problem. Great views on the way up and down and obviously at the top too. Great day

Amazing Trip. We were very lucky this trip was booked for the first day of our holiday in Cape Town. Apparently the cable car had been closed for 2 days before due to high winds. We had beautiful sunshine although wind was cold. We had to queue for approx one hour to get tickets because the next day it was closing for annual maintenance - we were lucky. It is phenomenal. It is a must do.Well organised, just be prepared to get there early and still queue. Views are out of this world
Amazing View. Never saw anything so majestic and beautiful in my life! Short wait for cable car, comfortable journey up the mountain and back down. Highly recommend!
what a view. viewing nature from the top is unbelievable, the plants, the sea, the sun, the wind... the experience of nature

Old favourite still new. The first time I went up was in 1978 at night. It was breathtaking. Nowadays it is one of the New 7 Wonders of Nature and it is closed at night. It is also very popular with tourists. As a result the cable cars get really crowded and everyone can`t get such a perfect view when they go up or down. Unfortunately we pick a day with clouds over the mountain in the hope that it would clear. It did not and the fog caused zero visibility and very cold conditions for most of the day. Needless to say that the restaurant was overflowing. Also there was a group of very noisy rude people shouting and singing all the way. I am afraid to think what it will be like on a sunny day. Still it stays a most beautiful place for a day outing. The views were fantastic when the fog lifted for a while. Robben Island is clearly visible. Don`t go up when clouds hover over the mountain and be prepared to park far away from the lower station.
Long lines. It took an hour in queue each way when going up and coming down. This was the worst thing about Table Mountain.

A true piece of heaven. The most wonderful and beautiful experience anyone could hope for, this for me was God's window. the rotating cable car ride up was clean, safe, efficient and cost effective, with well managed ques there was not much waiting , and the ride up was exhilarating! the walks and views at the top of the entire cape town can keep you up there for so long , as there is just so much to see! I will keep going back as much as I can
Great ride. Had a great time during both -up and down rides.This ride gives a great view of the city. The rotation thing is also unique.

Closed in July!. OK, it's a machine and machines break down, but WAS it broken or just being maintained? Very disappointed that it wasn't available at exactly the same time the Robben Island trip was booked out up to 10 days in advance. People: ask ahead for both of these trips - we were told that in July there would be no problem getting on to them. How wrong was that? Missed out on both.

Great way for people that are unable to hike up. It's awesome to do this when you are in Cape Town! But, best thing to do is actually hike up Table mountain (platteklip gorge is most popular route) but if you are with a group that is unable or unfit to hike, this is great way to go up.Instead of hiking Table Mountain, I would suggest going up Lions Head! Same views, easier and shorter hike and good for families. Also, you actually get a good view of table mountain. People forget you can't see Table Mountain when you are on Table Mountain...!
Great experience . The cable car ride is breathtaking. Very organized and you feel safe at all times. The views of the city and surrounding mountains are amazing. Definitely make time for this view!

Stunning view and a must visit in Capetown . Table mountain aerial cableway and roaming at the plateau top is a must for any visitor to Capetown. The view from the top and through the cableway is stunning. Since the cable car rotates, view is amazing all over. The weather at the top is windy and chilling but worth roaming. There is provision for snacks and beverages in a restaurant. The only issue is long queues and unpredictable weather, which may lead to postponement , but it's beyond human control.

Day trip. Well it's table mountain and a must. We used the hop on hop off bus. Get there early as the traffic is chaotic. Weather permitting take the cable car to the top. Views on a clear day are amazing but weather can change very quickly.

A must do. Even if you climb up Table Mountain for the exercise or whatever reason, you must experience the ride down the aerial cableway. Apparently you can book on-line for a cheaper price. Also if you go to the Table Mountain website, you will know if the cable car is operating or not. I don't know if the restaurant on top is part of the whole system, but the food was merely average. The cable car itself rotates 360 degrees, so there is no bad standing space...just get in early enough to stand by the glass.

this needs no introduction. a wonder of the world is a title well earned. high five mother nature. come rain or shine, this mountain has everything. including the most magnificent view of the Cape. don't do yourself a disservice -get there.

Amazing views. Amazing views here, but gets very very busy. The lines were over an hour long to get the cable car up, and back down again! However, staff are very helpful with a discreet little tip ;)Depending on when you go, you should be aware that it is significantly colder up there then at the bottom. Take a jacket with you. There is a cafe at the top, but I didn't eat there, so can't comment..
Ride is thrilling and cabin turns for 360 degree views. Magnificent Swiss cable car that revolves as you ascend to the top. Go early to avoid crowds and long lines.

Fun Ride. This is a fun ride. It was reassuring when the guide told us they had never had an accident. Great views. We had a very short wait both going and coming as the ride is fast and cars hold quite a few people. A great way to see Cape Town from above. Get your tickets ahead of time to save queue time.

Hold your heart. The ride is sensational. Not for the faint-hearted as you soar up the cables to reach the top. The view is amazing and it rotates 360 degrees while going up and down. The easy route up the Mother Mountain.

One of the 7 wonders of the natural world!. Got to the cable car station by 'Hop on Hop off bus' we bought our ticket for the cable car on the bus which saved queuing, the ticket cost R240. We spent 4-5 hours up there. There are 3 different walks you can take ranging from 15 mins to 45 mins duration, there is a cafe, souvenir shop - and great views!

Another Weather Dependent Attraction. Only one larger cable car seemed to operate both up and down from table Top Mountain. Trip takes about 5 minutes with the floor of the cable car rotating so most passengers (about 20 maximum?) had a chance to take photos out the few open windows available and to see the view in all directions.

You have to be at the top of the Table Mountain . The cable car is very safe. The mountain top gives an unforgettable aerial view of the City of Cape Town and the surrounding areas. You can also fill up your tank in one of the restaurants up there. Their prices are reasonable.
Great views of the city . On a glorious day it is a wonderful outing with spectacular views of the city beaches and mountains. Nice walking trails upto as well.

End of the Continent but Top of the World!. An absolute must if you are in Cape Town. Taking the Cable way to the top of Table Mountain is an absolute breeze with the reward being a panoramic view of an Iconic City!

Amazing views and a wonderful perspective on Cape Town. The cable car and Table Mountain is a 'must see' for anyone visiting the Cape. The trip up in the cable car takes 15 minutes and there are plenty of opportunities to take photos. Once up there you can actually walk along the mountain and you will see it is not as flat as it looks from below. However, well paved pathways take you through the brushland to points of interest. There are plenty of signs with information about the different views and places of historical interest below are indicated. Look out for the little rodents that live up the Mountain, they are really cute! There is a shop and cafe at the top of Table Mountain.Be aware that if you get a good day then its a great time to go up the mountain, if the wind picks up the cable car does not run and for some tourists this means they never get up the mountain on their visit. You can walk to the top but I was told it takes 2 hours and is quite a climb - so when you get a good day get yourself out to the cable car asap!
Over came my fear of heights. I could not believe the view from the top of the mountain.I felt so safe in the Cableway.Had an awesome experience.
cable car ride down the mountain. the ride down the mountain was quick and quiet. our car was clean and filled with many tourists who were polite and friendly.

Winter visit was excellent . Had a great time. Winter is the best time to visit as there are no quest at all. The coffee at the top was great after the harsh winds outsideCarry something warm even when it's a warm day!

Goes without saying. I nearly didn't write this review as I cannot imagine coming to Capetown and not going up Table Mountain! We arrived early in the morning as part of our tour. It was relatively quiet so no waiting for the cable car. The cable car is ideal as it rotates giving everyone on board a view. At the top the view was relatively clear, last time we came it was really misty, so this time we could appreciate the 360 degree views on our walk around the top. There is a cafe on top and a rather nice gift shop. It was interesting to read in the toilets how they bring water etc to the top! As I said at the beginning a must do!

Zooming 360 Bird's Eye View. Such an exciting trip to take especially for children to be taken up the mountain and to see the view below as the cable car rotates 360 before you get to the top. Well worth the trip ALWAYS take a warm jacket as the weather is unpredictable and the wind is chilly on the top. Nothing a lovely warm cup of coffee doesn't fix ENJOY!

Worth doing, but book online.. The views from the slowly rotating cable car and especially from the top are spectacular, well worth while. However, it will save you queuing time if you book ahead online. If you do this in the summer months be well prepared for the sun exposure too particularly if waiting in line outside. Plenty of human lobsters on display, better not to join them! Take a note from the Dassies; generally found in shady spots.The cable car only runs when visibility is good and there is a warning horn for those on top to return if the fabled 'table cloth' comes in.
The world at your feet. Horizons that stretch beyond all expectations - this results in highlighting the beauty of our world without curtailing the self-made problems that WE have to solve.

Kidz season on Table Mountain. We used the Kidz Season special to visit Table Mountain cable car. 2 Children travel free with one adult. This makes the trip very affordable for South Africans. I suggest you get there at opening time if you can, as the queues (we visited on a Sunday) can become very long. If you buy tickets online your queue will also move quicker.That said, there are a lot of friendly and efficient staff around, who are happy to direct you, so don't get put off by the queue.Once on the mountain you will be in a wonderland. The views are amazing and the photo opportunities wonderful. Be warned that it is very cold on the mountain, much colder than at the bottom. So in July, even on a sunny day, bring an extra warm layer as well as a beanie.Enjoy.

Drifting to the top. The queue to buy tickets went very swiftly and the clerk was so friendly and helpful. The cable car itself is a comfortable size and the rotation is a lovely experience. The trip up the cable is too quick - I would have liked to have more time in the cable car - but still very good.

super view form a super attraction. great views from a high up place above the sea , town and other moutainsgreat trip up, no big waiting times, quick ride up and down walk around the mountain to see the city and sea from different angles

What a remarkable experience . I have to say that this was one of the highlights of the trip for the family. We took a sightseeing trip using the city sightseeing bus service. A double decker bus took us around the city and we were allowed to stop at various locations to get a better view of the sights. We got on the tour with the sole aim of stopping at Table Mountain. We were advised to buy tickets at the city sightseeing stand to avoid queues at the mountain ticket stand which we gladly did. It wouldn't have been fun waiting in line with 2 kids under the age of 6. As we climbed higher and higher towards our destination, I must say I was a little intimidated. I don't like heights but it was very safe on the bus. Once there, we went straight to the elevators which took us up to a landing to get on the Aerial Cableway. It was a hitch free accession to the top of the mountain on the cable car. Once we arrived, we passed through gift shops before we were finally let out to an open space on the mountain top. The views were spectacular. There's also a cafe where you can sit to enjoy a small meal with the family. After that, there isn't much else to do but see the cape from various angles. We got some beautiful photos as well.Going down was more eventful. Our cable car driver was quite entertaining and made us laugh almost the whole way down. I highly recommend this activity. It's a once in a lifetime thing you don't want to miss out on. Side note, we had a stroller for my 2 year old and we were able to take it with us every step of the way. It's a family friendly attraction.

A Wonder of the World in the Mother City. having climbed the mountain on numerous occasions, My recent trip in the Cable Car to the top was really awesome , because I could then identify with the route we trekked going up. the rotating floor also gave such stunning views of the city and its surrounds...breath-taking with the sunset in the distance.

World Class facility. Everything you should expect from a world class service. Must have one of the most majestic views. On a good day be sure be at the base early as this is a very popular destination for international and local tourists !
Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Views views views....from the top of table mountain you get a 360 view of the sea and Cape town. awesome awesome awesome

An absolute Cape Town must-do. You cannot visit Cape Town and NOT do the cableway. Naturally, a clear day is required and make sure you take a jacket. Because of the popularity of this attraction queues can be quite long.

breath taking view. Went up on cableway which revolves. Great views of Cape Town. Table Mountain is a must see in Cape Town.Take a jacket even if it is warm out,it very cold on top of yhe mointain. We climb the mountain down by foot, that was an amazing experience.

A view from the top. Access to this awesome attraction was via a sightseeing bus, we hopped off there and hopped on again. The cable car gave us a 360 degree view of the mountain and the surrounding areas. It was a clear sky, with a view to die for, from one of the seven wonders of the world. At the top of the mountain, the food at the restaurant was reasonably priced. The staff was also friendly. This is a must see attraction and I would recommend the use of a red double decker sight seeing bus.
Mr Gordon Bell. A wonderful way to get to top of Table Mountain with it's stunning views of Cape Town and surroundings. Make a great day out of it.

Great day visit to the top of Table Mountain. Check the weather before planning. Get there early if your looking to buy a ticket at the Cableway. Beleive you can get VIP tickets prior to your visit, and you don't have to stand in long lines. Take your camera and someting to keep you warm/dry as the weather can change quickly ontop.Views going up, on top and coming down are great. Ticket a bit expensive, but worth it.

Go when the weather allows . So far I was fortunate, every time I came to Cape Town I was able to go up Table Mountain. Not everyone will be that fortunate because the weather in Cape Town can be unpredictable. So when you have a nice day don't think, I can still do this tomorrow, tomorrow you might not even see the Table Mountain. You might stand in line for a couple of hours, but one you made it to the top you will get the most stunning views of your lifetime. Always pay attention to the weather. At the cable car station you can get information about the weather up on the mountain. Parking is a bit of a problem, you might have to walk a while to get to the cable car station. Bat as said, it's all worth it.

Table Mountain tour. I visited Table Mountain in June of 2013. The baboons were numerous because this is their habitat. They are very conditioned to tourists so they think they are blending in. lol The view of Capetown was truly breath taking. As the saying goes Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but the moments that take our breath away. I was in Capetown South Africa for three weeks from May 13th thru June 1, 2013

Is a must . We went up in poor visibility which was a shame but still very worthwhile to get the perspective and see the views. Would highly recommend and would like to go back in the summer and spend most of the day wandering around the vast area to see the wonderful views.

The only way to Visit Table Mountain. Recently visited Cape Town the Mother City. In Cape Town i visited Table mountain cable way. The Cable way is very safe and its feature of rotation of 360 degree is excellent. It gives a breathtaking view of Cape Town. The management can be improved but the cable way is excellent experience...

Fantastic views. Went up on cableway which revolves. Great views of Cape Town. Walked around the top of table Mountain and could see the beaches below at Camp Bay, Robben Island etc, just before the clouds closed in

A Great View of the City. Table Mountain is a must see in Cape Town. Check the forecast as clouds can roll in quickly and shut it down. There were long lines at the cable car and it was recommended to get there early. Traffic was awful getting to the station - we hired a private tour guide and he dropped us off and picked us up at the station but there were many people making very long walks. Take a jacket even if it is warm out - the weather changes reminded me of San Francisco.
Amazing views but..... From my point of view is very expensive, if you have time and you are in shape go up walking !! Os course it is no easy so the cablecar is a good option and fast ... No more.
Okay!!. Just like any other tourist place, views from the top are great provided the day is clear.Nice cafe up there and the lines were too short since we were in lean season.

A must seen visit. While you visit Capetown, you have to visit the tablemoutain spot as it's the number one attraction there. Nevertheless, be prepared to wait and line up for the ride ( both way!). The ride is 5min. In a twirling cabin. The view is amazing but the waiting Time spoils the experience. Cafés and curio shop with restrooms available. Wifi also in the lounge. Fare one adult ticket, free for child when we were there. Taxis, hip/hop red bus at the entrance.

Great views! Time your visit with lower traffic flows. The views are worth the hassle of the queues. Go in the afternoon to avoid queues up to the top but the queues down are lengthy. If the mountain has been closed for a few days expect a HUGE influx of visitors the next clear day.

360 Degree Tour of Capetown / Mountain. Get there early so you can miss the queue! Otherwise I could not fault this attraction. The cableway offers great views and the floor itself turns so you also get to appreciate a 360 tour. I posted a video of this experience to Facebook and received a record number of views. Better in real life!!

At last a clear day. We had a three day window and on the third day it was clear so up we went, it was great the views were spectacular, if you wanted you could absail down, but buy your tickets on line before you go they are valid for seven days and you beat the queues

It turns as it rises!. The cable car is on a pivot and has one panel open to allow for good photos without the glass. As you rise, it slowly rotates so that by the time you get to the top, if you have held a single location at the window, you will have turned in all directions to see the sights. The rotation is relatively rapid so it can still be challenging to get the photos that you want. The cable car is not unusual, but it is in a beautiful area.

Amazing cableway!. A popular attraction and a must whilst visiting the Mother City. If the weather allows it, you can enjoy breathtaking views of the whole cape peninsula. There are several walks/hiking trails of varying difficulties, a refreshment outlet and a souvenir shop. Book online to get jump the queues, the system works well and it's hassle-free. The 360 degree rotating floor offers extraordinary photo opportunities! Don't forget to take warm clothes :)
Great view...beautiful place!. It costs about $20, but it's worthy. You can stay up as much as you want! It only opens if the weather is good.

Awesome!. Everytime I am in South Africa I ensure that I visit the Table Mountain. And its as mystical as my first visit. Table Mountain cable car, though a short one, gives you an superb view of the mountain and the Atlantic Ocean. Visit during the evening. The sunset is one of the best time to get great selfies
Table Top Mountain. Great experience, don't miss this opportunity. Inexpensive, able to drive right up to the ticket office, get right on the cable car and go to the top of the mountain.

Great views. Buying a ticket for cable car prior saves a lot of time as there is always a big queue for tickets and another big queue for cable car.The queue for actual cable car moves fast. Cable car is rotating so everyone gets nice view as going up to Table Mountain.Staff is efficient and friendly. Cable Car is perfectly safe.
What a great view!. If you come to Cape Town, this is one of the highlights which you should not miss. Highly recommended!
A Must for a visit to Cape Town. Beautiful day to go to the top of Table Mountain and see Cape Town. Enjoyed about an hour visit up at the top.

Went in the winter so things were speedy. This was my third visit to Table Mountain and the first time I went in the winter time. It was less crowded and the lines moved very swiftly. The only issue we had was going down on the cable way as it was close to the last one and everyone on the mountain began to form a line about an hour before the last car was scheduled to travel back down.

excellent. The weather was glorious on May 22nd when we landed. We knew it’s ideal for taking the cable car up Table mountain. We drove straight up with the strategy: we’ll come down and park and ride the shuttle if there is no parking up, luckily got a parking spot. We joined the few people at the counter and got our 20% discounted tickets with our Wild Card, after showing ID and receipt. It’s a five-minute cable car trip to the top of Table Mountain, 1089 meters above Cape Town. Each of the two cable cars can carry 65 people. The floor of the circular cabin rotates to allow 360° views. Interesting tidbit: The cable car base is a water tank with a 4000 liter capacity. This provides fresh water for visitors, and is used as ballast in windy condition! We enjoyed the views and explored the summit. There are numerous hiking trails. We came down by 4 PM.

Great Experience. I booked the tickets for the Cableway via the internet and that was so simple to do! Tickets arrived in my in box within 5 minutes. I was surprised how big the pods were - they take 50 people at a time. As the pod rotates as you travel up - everyone gets to enjoy the 360 degree views. Well worth experiencing.
An experience. Everyone rushes to get the best view.No worries as the floor of the cable car resolves, an excellent idea so everyone can get the view.

So beautiful . If you're afraid of heights the cable may be an issue but once you're at the top it's The most amazing view. Give yourself a few hours as you can walk all around the too if the mountain and the view from all sides is spectacular. Don't plan on as long if you have young Children as you will only stick to the main area as there is no protective framing on most parts. Worth a visit

Breath taking views. Breath taking views from the top of the mountain.Well organised attraction.Would recommend pre-booking tickets. One can purchase tickets if using the Big Red Bus to avoid queues/delays.
Vacation in South Africa. The smooth ride up the cable way is very exiting and worth the money paid. The base rotates for all the viewers to get an equal chance to get a view of all sides

A must visit for a beautiful view of the city and the ocean . I have been to the Table Mountain twice. Once in day time and second in the evening. Both the times offer a very different and a equally amazing view of the city. Moreover the mountain walking area in itself is very beautiful. The weather up there is always perfect. All in all I would rate a lot better than going on the Eiffel Tower or the Empire State.

Beautiful . Beautiful views going up and coming down, the cable car itself is very roomy and very nice, it has a rotary floor that keeps turning so you wouldn't miss the views all around, very nice touch! If you are going during the high season, plan on being on line for a long time to ride it!

Amazing . We took advantage of a clear day and took the cable car up table mountain. The cableway is very well organised and we were lucky that we didn't have to wait too long to get tickets. The trip up ( and back down) is surprisingly quick. It's a very smooth ride and you don't even really notice how quickly you are climbing through the clouds - until you look down. The views from the cable car are great. One benefit is that the cars rotate so everyone gets to have good views on the trip. Once you reach the top of table mountain the views are spectacular. You can spend as much time on the mountain as you want ( as long as the cable cars are still operating). A trip up table mountain is a must do when in Cape Town and I would highly recommend it.

Great Experience. This was a great day, really enjoyed the cable cart and its so well engineered and set up to deal with big crowd numbers.. Saying this on one of the days we did the cable car the lines were very long
Mrs . Great experience .Children loved the Dassies. View is breath taking from the top of the mountain. Very friendly staff. On top of the mountain there are trails for walking.

Family Day Out. Along with a grandmother with agrophobia and a little girl not used to such heights; our trip went off really well. The staff are incredibly friendly and all amenities including the cable car are made from the Future. The 360 degree views are out of this world!

Definitely Worth It. I decided to go up Table Mountain on Good Friday. There was more than a two hour wait for the ride up because I think some locals decided to visit that day, which made it busier than normal. The organization for a large line-up was impressive. Just as for Robben Island, do Table Mountain on your first day in Cape Town that appears to have good weather. The weather changes very quickly and dramatically but try to get a good feel for it before committing. The tram still runs if it is foggy, but you won’t see a thing. However, it shuts down if it is windy, which doesn’t affect the experience as much. Tourism Cape Town will know whether the tram is currently running, or check online. This was basically a full day experience for me because of the long wait (not so long on the way down) and because I walked around the scenic pathways and savored the spectacular unique views and fynbos vegetation. The paths are easy and you won’t get lost, but watch out for uneven footing surfaces in some areas.

A must in Cape Town! . You can't miss this! Long line but worth the wait! Amazing views!! Go earliest in day as possible but have to plan around weather/fog etc to get best view. I can't imagine going to Cape Town and not seeing this.

Best way to get up and down Table Mountain if you have small children. We have small children, 5 & 7, and decided to go up Table Mountain. Walking isn't an option, so we used the cable car. Be warned, this is an extremely popular activity and the queues can be very long. We came early morning and missed the mad rush. The views from the revolving cable car are breathtaking. A must do when in Cape Town!

You won't miss a thing. Ever been on a cable car with a revolving floor? 40 rand per person will get you to the top of table mountain in style. The rotating circular floor in the cable car means you will be able to see everything as it happens on the way up (and down)The cars run every 15 minutes and are a great opportunity to take pictures and take in the landscapeLast car down the mountain is 17:30

Better than expected!. We hiked up and took the cable way down. The trail was more well marked than I expected. We were once tend because I couldn't find many trail descriptions of the hike, but it was very well marked. I'm from Colorado so the hike was challenging but basically our version of the "incline". We hiked up and he views were spectacular!!! There is more to do up top than I ever thought possible to see. We paid for our tickets I our phone while waiting in line instead of paying in cash. I highly recommend this to all guests. Loved this!

Comfortable Ride. Was a little hesitant to go on this ride but it was surprisingly comfortable! Maybe the rotational movement as the cable car goes up served as a good distraction for me. It was really pleasant. The car felt sturdy. This is about the best cable car ride I've ever had.

Fascinating and magnificant. The cable ride was the smoothest and safest cable ride I've been to. It is an experience not to be mossed while in Capetown. You can enjoy walking around on top of the mountain which takes about at least 45 minutes if not more because you will be stopping every once in a while to take pictures and enjoy the view.

Great views. This was our first stop on our visit to Cape Town. Beautiful views in every direction. We had purchased tickets in advance, but the day we went there was no line. We went the day we arrived because the weather was good and would recommend this approach, because the tram was often closed later in our trip due to weather. If you purchase tickets online they are good for a 7 day period.

Amusing. Efficient and clean. Humour added by an alpha male giving it the 'big one' about the altitude to be experienced.I am not to keen on heights but couldn't help smirking as he collapsed to his knees, clutching the centre post, as the capsule started slowly revolving.

Buy in advance and skip the line . Buy these tickets online. The ticket line at the base of the mountain is usually way longer than the line to get into the gondola. The ride is fast and the floor spins en route so that you'll get a nice view no matter where you stand.If the weather is bad (windy) the gondola will be closed and it's better to wait until later in the day or the next day. Otherwise you'll be hiking up and back.
Fast and efficient. Aerial cableway rotates 360 degrees so everyone see everything- quick and efficient --incredible views- a must if the weather is clear

Worth a visit. A fun cable car ride up, bringing you within feet of the sheer rock wall, leads to amazing views from the top of Table Mountain. Weather is notoriously tricky - updates are posted on their Facebook page.
360 degree view. My first time to ride this kind of cable car and I must say I thoroughly enjoyed the ride and the view.

Doable for those that are scared of heights!. The ride up is beautiful. Stay to the middle if you are scared of heights! At the top we had clouds move in but was still lovely flora to explore. View when clouds are gone is amazing.

Save some sweat!. This cable car is quite interesting as it not only saves you a fair hike ~700 meters, but it also rotates while ti ascends and descends. This provides some great views across all aspects of the scenery. I really enjoyed this part. Make sure you buy the tickets beforehand as the queues can be rather long.

Fabulous views without having to climb the mountain.. Getting parked nearby was not too difficult. A parking attendant on the road pointed us to a space. We walked 200 or 300 metres to the lower station and were luck to find there was no queue to go up. This was early May. I think were were lucky in a way because the cable way had been closed due to high winds and unexpectedly the winds dropped and it opened but fewer people meant no queue. it is impressive especially the final few metres in front of steep cliff. The views from the top really do have to be seen to be believed.

Mountain-top Picnic. This was my second time going there and the weather was perfect, however you should always take a jacket with and some snacks. I love the idea of pre-bought tickets getting privilege because the lines can get crazy long. The staff is always friendly and full of jokes.The views you have to see for yourself. Being a photographer, i loved it

Beautiful view. The cable way is one of the ways to get to the table mountain top (other way is to use one of the many trekking routes) The service is good and the view from the top is really nice. Especially in case you are travelling with kids or anyone who cant trek.
Fabulous!. We booked our tickets online while we were waiting for the cable car to open. Everything was well run although it was cold and we were disappointed that the main restaurant was not open.

Well worth the ride. I'm scared of heights but knew I had to do this, and it was worth every heart palpitation and bead of sweat. The people who work the cable cars are informative, friendly and a little bit funny.Don't worry about getting a great place to stand inside to see the views on the way up as the inside of the car goes around so you get a peek at the views from every angle. Make sure you go early in the morning. We arrived at 9am on a Saturday with rain the day before and there was no que. By the time we came out a couple of hours later the que was up the hill!Enjoy!

Good view of the Beautiful city of Cape Town. Visited in September'13. Cable car provides smooth hassle free acres to the park. Teaching the top provides great Bird's eye view of the city. It was winter months in SA so not much flower could be seen. Day was foggy as well. Stroll around in the park on the table top mountain. You can take your moment photographed with a copy delivered once you Climb down.

A circular tour, straight up!. The views from the Gondola are amazing, but the views from the top are stunning. City views one way, twelve apostles another, Camps Bay, Clifton, Beaches one two three etc. Coffee and cake facilities were very good too!

What a view!! . Came here during our first day in Cape Town and was absolutely blown away by the view and park. I would recommend going earlier or later in the day to beat crowds, but know that you are really at the weather's mercy. I would STRONGLY suggest buying your tickets online to avoid the queue, you just walk right into the cable car and they scan your ticket there. There is a restaurant up top, but I also suggest bring snacks and enjoy several of the hikes they have, this is a once in a lifetime experience that shouldn't just be regulated to a cable car ride. A highlight of the Cableway are the adorable dassies that walk around the area!! Such cute animals!

Table Mountain a great day. Beautiful view all around . Sunny days are best for this. You can hike or take the cart up and down. Nice small shop at the top. Cute animals to see and really nice birds. Cafeteria is okay

Great family day out.. We visited Table Mountain on a Sunday morning & can highly recommend the cableway.The red sight seeing bus dropped us right at the lower cableway station. As it was SA school holidays, the kids aged 11 & 14 were free on the red bus which was a lovely bonus!We got a family pass, (only available at the cableway ticket office) which allowed the kids on for free again. Queues can be very long at times I believe, but at 9.30 on a Sunday morning we got straight through. The cableway staff were all very courteous & helpful & all the equipment / facilities were very clean & well maintained. The restaurant/ gift shop were fine, but souvenirs are approx twice the price as those at the V&A waterfront.There are free short guided walks available on the hour & well worth doing- just ask staff where to join. The views from the top are truly sensational & the ride up & down in the cablecar is an amazing introduction to Cape Town.

Get the tickets in advance at hotel or online. Get ready for wind and in July cold. Awesome views. Go counterclockwise along path to avoid crowds. At the end buy a hot chocolate inside. First funicular 8:30 AM. Down on the 9:45 funicular.
Exceptional view. This view should not be missed. The floor of the car rotates so you get a full surround view of everything. We got lucky and it was a crystal clear day with breath-taking views.

Stunning views made effortless. The cableway is an easy and convenient way of seeing the stunning views over Cape Town.I would recommend getting a ticket in advance as this helps to avoid some of the queue at the cableway itself.The status of the cableway can also be checked at #tmweather which we found helpful as the weather can change quickly meaning the cableway can be closed in the morning but opened up if/when the weather improves. If you are going on a winter afternoon it's worth taking a jacket as the temperature is slightly cooler at the top and also there can be long queues to get back on the cablecar as everyone seems to head back down at roughly the same time.
South Africa for the first time. A must do, if you wake up to find you can see the top of the mountain get up there asap. It is a good idea to pre book your tickets as queues are long.
Spectacular!!!. Absolutely breathtaking!! Spectacular views from a rotating cabin. A definite 'must do' for anyone visiting Cape Town!!! Buy your tickets online in advance and avoid the queues!!

Cannot miss this. The sort of thing you have to do if you visit Cape Town! It was a great experience and efficiently run albeit quite expensive in relative terms. nevertheless very worthwhile for the wonderful iews from both the cable car and the top.

Waiting, waiting and waiting. What is the point of buying a ticket on line and then the people without tickets get to go up at about the same time??? Had to queue for 2 hours to go up, had to queue for something to eat at the restaurant and had to queue to come down again.
360 Views. The line moved quickly, it was helpful that we arrived on an early HOHO bus. No need to push for a window view as the platform moved!

TABLE MOUNTAIN - THE LOVELIEST OF THEM ALL. The best way to see the Mother City is from this infamous landmark that Capetonians proudly call their own. Well worth a visit for an unforgettable panoramic view of Cape Town from one of the oldest mountains in the world. It's also one of the seven natural wonders of the world. Why on earth would you want to miss this!!!??

Extraordinary, just extraordinary!!!. First of all, Cape Town (second visit here) is one of the most beautiful cities in the world! Secondly, the view from Table Mountain is simply breathtaking. You must not miss this while visiting this remarkable city! Sometimes weather prevents the cable cars from functioning; ask at your hotel; sometimes the queue can be long --- but it's worth it. Don't miss it!
Must do if you visit CT. Great experience. Go on a clear day when its not too windy and spend some time wandering around on top of Table Mountain.

Beautiful . If we had the time I would arrive earlier and enjoyed the numerous walks up on the mountain! It's truly beautiful up here!!!And if your fit enough walk back down and if your game do the walk up!!! This is a must do attraction in Cape Town
Good but pricey. Excellent way to get up to table mountain without effort and enjoying 360 views of mountain and bay.The price is quite high.

Amazing views and friendly staff. We went up Table Mountain on a beautiful winters day! The lines weren't that long and the whole experience was great. I would recommend visitors buy their tickets online to skip the queue for the ticket office.
Buy your tickets online!!!. Often large cues and you can only go up if weather permits!!!! To cut cues buy your tickets online and check the table mountain website to see if its open
Lovely from the top!. Well worth the cable car ride up the steep sides. The view from above is spectacular in all directions. We also had lunch in the cafe which was very nice!
Mr. Well run operation with friendly & informed staff who are very willing to assist bewildered tourists!!!Advisable to book cable car tickets online to avoid the line at the ticket sales office.

All of Capetown at your feet. Taking the cable car up to the summit beats hiking up! Although I saw rock climbers descending this past year. It is a beautiful view and a nice shop at the top to cool off

An easy up but big queue down . I am so glad we went to Table Mountain. The views were spectacular and so were the flora / geological formations. The cable car with revolving floor was excellent and we had a fabulous journey up.However the queue for the journey down was horrific. The timetabled closure of the cable car was 17:30. We started queuing at 16:40. We sneaked on board eventually at 17:27. The attendants assured us that everyone would be transported down (there were some frantic parents in the line behind us).However we had used the red city sightseeing buses to get to table mountain. But after a 47 minute queue we were not prepared to wait another 50 minutes for a bus. So against all published advice we 'caught' a taxi. Arriving safely back at our hotel.
Great outdoor. Great to go with family and young kids. the cable car is free on your birthday for a return trip, so no excuse not to visit.

Quickest route to great views. The platform inside the cable car rotates a full 360 degrees on the way up and again on the way down, ensuring that all passengers get a great view. The lines were a little long on a clear day, but the trip is quick and the view at the top is definitely worth it!

The best way to view the Mother City!. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is an amazing way to view Cape Town.Make sure you check online to see if the Cableway is open, as we had to return for a visit on another day due to high winds causing the closure of the service for the day.Once up on top of the mountain the views are unbelievable and were well worth the wait. Definately one of the top attractions in Cape Town.
A definite must when you visit Cape Town. If I wasn't so afraid of heights, I would definitely do this more often! Spectacular panoramic views along with indigenous fauna and flora.

Beautiful views. Great place to view the city of Capetown and the surrounding areas. You can walk/hike - but it's pretty steep from what I could tell. So, I recommend taking the Tram. It's not expensive and well worth it. There are several walks around the top (short, medium, and long).
Table mountain is a must!. Loved it there with stunning views. Wish there was more write ups on the rock formations and history of the Table mountain with info on guided tours up above as an option.
awesome. Wonderful view, awesome experience, worth every cent you pay. will definitely do it again and reccomend to others

A great experience. This is a must do in Cape Town. There are magnificent views of Cape Town and the surrounding vista from the top of Table Mountain. You can be unlucky and there are days when for part of the day the mountain top is enveloped in mist and cloud. Loved the experience, even tho it was only 4C when we arrived at the top.

Go on a sunny day. This as well as Roben island are probably the most "expensive" tourist attractions in CP. That said, if its a nice sunny day, buy your ticket ahead of time with hop on/hop off bus, which will take you right to the summit. From there head straight to the Cableway and enjoy the 360 degree views of CP

View Worth Every Cent. Although from Cape Town originally my had never been so this year we came to Cape Town and did all the tourist things. Even though it was fairly good going up table mountain is something you must do when in the Cape. The views from up top are something you will not forget. Worth every cent and cheaper if booked online. Just keep eye on the weather. Go up on a clear day.

Great. Had a great time, touristy but it's a must see a great memory for the family and a great thing to say you have done. Great photos. We just took a little time out of the day and did this. Would recommend

Wow, what a view . We were lucky to have come during off season/ winter. We had to wait on a couple of queues until we reached the top. Altogether it took us 25min with booked in advance/ online tickets. We can't imagine what it is like in high season. But it was so worth it! What a view! It takes your breath away! We walked around for 3 hrs and didn't even get a chance to see everything... The cute dassies made a special appearance for us, posing happily for the cameras. Visiting Table Mountain is a must in Cape Town.

A great cable car. My low rating is because it was perfect weather for viewing from the top of the mountain and the queue was unending . It was so disorganised as they were having trouble with the credit card machine , moved people paying in cash into another queue , then the credit machine must have become operational so they moved that queue on and left the cash queue standing . It took us 2 hours to reach the top . We would have abandened the queue except 4 of our party had climbed the mountain and were meeting us at the top . I recommend you buying cable car tickets online .
stunnung backdrop to the city. Great cable car ride, amazing views unfortunately very unpleasant weather for our visit but still a great experience and not to be missed

Amazing views. Beautiful sunny day, hopped on the "hop on hop off bus" and arrived st 10.30, very long queue but moved quickly. Loved the revolving cable car to give excellent views on the way up and down. Very cold despite the sun, come prepared. Planned to do the quick 45 minute walk on the first plateau but managed to go via the gorge to the larger plateau, 90 minutes later we finished an amazing walk with fantastic views and very few people. If we had of had more time would have loved to walk from the bottom up!

Twenty years later a visit to Table Mountain.. After so any years we visited Table Mountain again via the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway.It was a fantastic trip up the mountain in the cable car as it rotates Everyone inside the car gets an opportunity to view different views and areas of the mountainYears ago it used to shake around and had no windows. Not anymore.I have a fear of heights but this cablecar is really stable and I did not feel any fear.Looking forward to another visit to Cape Town and using the cableway again.
What a view. The cab was big and felt strong and secure. The views were absolutely delightful since the cab even rotates slowly. Completely worth visiting.

Best and the longest cableway I have been in. If you are going to table mountain you need to go in the cableway or you have an option of 4 hour trek. The charges are 1600 INR and they run a discount of 50% on saturday

Beautiful scenery. Table mountain is definitely worth visiting. It is a little on the expensive side. The cable cars are in well working order and view from the top is great! A great aerial view of Cape Town. Gift shops are on top and bottom of the mountain.
Fantastic Cable cars. Great way to view and explore top of mountain. Check with tour services that rain and clouds will shorten tour schedules.

Make sure you prebook. We arrived at 10am without tickets to find the queue was at the 1hr wait but the way it moved it looked like it would take 2hr. We tried the local wifi to get tickets but it didnt work very well so we used our own data. Got the tickets on our phones and got into the cable car within 10min. We had a great time on top but it was cold so take a beany and jumper
great view. a must see in Cape Town, with excellent views on the journey. It can get quite busy and you may have to wait for a turn, but it is worth it.
Just wow!. Beautiful beautiful beautiful! Make sure you get a professional camera to take a snap of possibly the most beautiful view ever

Amazing views, but go when clear. I'd originally wanted to hike up the mountain but was not feeling well enough to do so - my friend and I took the cable car, which was fun. However, do try to go on a clear day - at the top, we mostly saw clouds.

"make hay while the sun shines". I love the unpredictable Cape Town weather in winter. If you see the sun shining, get moving to make it to the Table Top Mountain before 9am. Enjoy the fresh morning air and no queues! I did the complimentary tour with Tony and enjoyed the knowledge shared in the easy 30 min stroll! Can't understand why more people don't do the tour but alas I was lucky to have a private tour! there's great walking / hiking options too if you're up for it! This experience is a must! Ive been twice, in mist and sunshine ❄️☀️

Fantastic!. Yes yes yes!!! A must do when you are I. Cape Town. A very quick but scenic trip to the top of Table Mountain. The floor rotates when the cable car is moving so you get to see the scenery at different angles or your way up and down if you booked a return

Great Views. We did the tourist thing and purchased a ticket at our hotel, then redeemed it at one of the booths near the aquarium in capetown and went on the hop on, hop off bus which takes you there. We went up and down the cableway, more crowded going up and didn't get to see much, but the views on top off the mountain are great.Had a bite to eat at one of the two cafes and then went down again.It was good for the experience, but wouldn't go again.

Unmistakable. Unmissable. Unforgettable . This is the one thing you absolutely have to do as a visitor to Cape Town.In fact, if you're a local and you still haven't done this then you simply don't know the city you live in. Arrive early in peak seasons. Expect long queues. But it's worth it. The ride is unfortunately very short. So enjoy every moment. Don't rush for the windows. The floor rotates. So everyone gets a turn. And the view from the top is unlike any you've ever seen before. There's a restaurant at the top. Their offering has improved lately, but they are a bit pricey. Also remember that the cable car does not operate in inclement weather - especially when it's windy. And one last point. The cable car has an impeccable safety record.

View from Top. Amazing place, one of the new Natural wonders of the world. Cableway ride is of great experience and offers amazing thrill. View from top is great. You can see the whole Capetown from there. Also has a coffee shop for refreshments. Hop on Hop off bus service is available to reach the starting point of cable ride.
Fantastic. A spectacular experience I will not forget. Get there early to avoid he queues, but well worth the effort with amazing views around Cape Town
The views are priceless . Must do in Cape Town. Make sure to check the weather first and see. If the cable car is in service . Get ready for the beautiful sights at the top of Table Mountain.

Great views and spinning standing platform. Took the cableway down after climbing Devils Peak and Table Mountain. Fairly expensive but definitely a good view. I am not generally afraid of heights but this cable car sure does come down a steep cliff.

Great views! A very mooth operation!. We had been out and about all day and we wanted to get this in and not have to go the following morning. We were told that the cable car and the views from atop Table Mountain-there was nothing like it! We only had about 15 minutes before the last ride went up [a good time to go if you do not go early in the morning] It was not as crowded as the staff told us it would be at midday. The lines can get to be very long.You can buy your ticket once you get there and get on the line and up you go! the view from the mountain of the city is spectacular. Since we went at this time, there were also fewer people up there. if it is very windy, they may close for a while but then open later in the day. You can also walk up the mountain [there are small stone paths to use] and then take the cable car down. The floor of the cable car turns so you get a full 360 view-it is great! I would recommend highly! {the hop on hop off bus also has a stop here-good to know!
Beautiful . It's crowded, the queues are long but it's worth the wait. Amazing views and scenery from the cable car. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Cape Town

Views views . Excellent service and well managed. From the restaurant staff to the cable way crew. Truelly world class standard. Well marked pathways and attention to safety. Will certainly recommend as a must see location in the Mother City.
Efficient and good. We're were second car up today and it was an incredibly smooth process. Weather was crisp and clear and Cape Town was magnificent. Certainly a must do in the Mother City

awesome. we are there today! well the queue is not long, we had our breakfast then only we go , reaching at 9:30 where we got our ticket online, so the queue is about 30-50 so the second cable car took us up( maybe its winter , the crowd is not that much) we enjoyed the moment where the cable car will turn 360deg slowly , that's impressive and its takes care of our needs for photo taking, good job!!
Best cable way. The revolving cable car is the best attraction of the ride. you can enjoy the view from all windows.

Beautiful Views!. We were very fortunate to enjoy the Cableway during beautiful weather. The trails on Table Mountain were well marked and maintained. The views of the harbor and The Cape of Good Hope were spectacular! Well worth a visit.

Awesome. You get a very nice view over Cape Town and its harbour! Prefere to go when clouds are absent. You cannot leave cape town without going there!Tips: order the tickets via the website to avoid queue! You can use the entrance during 7 days and obtain a refund if you dont use it.

One of best cable ways on the planet. One of Cape Towns most famous tourist attractions and activities is a trip up or down Table Mountain in the cable car. It is a highly popular attraction. The most important point is to check the weather forecast and only use the car when the weather is good and when cloud on the mountain is not forecast. Also to dress in layers and to ensure that one will be warm enough. The weather on top of the mountain can change in almost minutes. So even if you go up on a hot day, take enough warmth. When up on top perhaps take a walk around always observing the safety instructions and advice. Keep away from the edge of cliffs. When up on top consider eating or having a drink at the lovely restaurant. Or perhaps take along a picnic and have it on top of the mountain while admiring the stunning views of the Cape Peninsular and surrounds. Parking at the foot of the mountain can be challenging and the lines can be long. Be preparedness for this. Try and go early if you want to minimize crowds or time spent waiting. Alternatively, take a late afternoon trip and watch the sun set out west over the Atlantic Ocean.
Good . We used the cable way to go to the table mountain. The cable way is OK. Nothing great. The good part is the floor rotates so where ever you stand you get a360 view.

Spectacular views with the rotating cable car. Everyone aboard gets a great view with this rotating cable car. I highly recommend taking this cable car at least one of the directions to or from the mountain.
Best view in the world. It is worth a visor. Get the best view on cape town and one of the best I've ever had.It is preferable to buy tickets in advance as big lines are usual

Serene place with beautiful view. The view from the top of Table Mountain is breathtakingly beautiful. Took the Hop on Hop off bus from the city center to the base of the cable way, which was very convenient and cheap. The Cableway is efficiently managed. Although there was a good crowd of people the wait time was really short.
On top of the world. You cannot go to Cape Town without going up Table Mountain...what a wonderful experience with amazing views
Try to be flexible. Don't miss this but go when you see it is clear rather than to a set schedule as you may be in the clouds and see nothing.

Stunning - queues. A must for any traveller to Cape Town - always check the weather though as if it's windy or too cloudy the cable car doesn't run.We booked online but still had to queue for about an hour and a half - so plan ahead and get there early. Free Wi Fi !!The views are stunning from the mountain, and there are some lovely walks to be done. We decided to stay for lunch, which turned out to be pretty good and reasonably priced.
Great views . Very nice experience. Not nearly as good as hiking up Table Mountain. You can access Platteklip Gorge from the same location for a hike

Beautiful . Indeed fit to be selected as one amongst the 7 natural wonders of the world. A breath taking view Very well planned cable way , totally comfortable and nice. Can spend hours admiring the different views
A must do!. Great way to overseeing the city. This is a must if there is good weather. If you are lucky to have a sunny day, go for it since climate changes so quick!

Amazing views from the top of Table Mountain. We enjoyed a very lovely morning exploring the top of Table Mountain. The staff from the ticket office through to the cableway were friendly and professional. It was an awesome experience to view the sights below. The weather was good and we had a really nice time high up above the city of Cape Town. Just remember to take a warm jacket with even when it is a beautiful sunny day, the wind seems to bite through you when you are so high. A stunning sight for breath tacking views especially if you love taking photographs.

Awesome . Went up with the baby while the rest of the family climbed the mountain. Everyone was very helpful with getting the stroller and baby up on my own. I managed to go all the way around the top of the mountain with the stroller (except for 5 steps where someone helped me). Great fun. The restaurant and restrooms however are now wheelchair or stroller friendly.

The World at your feet.. A trip to the top of Table Mountain on the cable car is definitely for overseas Tourists rather than the locals of Cape Town as the cable way to carry one to the top is very pricey, but then again one must consider the upkeep of the cable car - better safe than sorry - but the view from the top is fantastic. The restaurant is also pricey - again a tourist attraction,

Okay way. It's an okay way to get to the top if you do not want to climb up the mountain. However, the windows are really dirty, so it is not easy to take pictures. Also, at 240R roundtrip, it seems a bit steep for SA prices. When you get to the top it can be just a really foggy cloud, so the view was disappointing when it was otherwise a sunny day.

The weather will determine the day you can visit Table Mountain (TM).. I believe TM is a must do when you visit Cape Town. Having lived in Cape Town for three years we shared the TM experience with almost every visitor that came to South Africa. I recommend that the first day you have a clear mountain top you make immediate plans to go. The tour is free and worth the 30 minutes to learn about the views and plants that you will be seeing. If you are healthy and fit you can climb to the top and ride the Cable Car down but you should do this with a local. There are frequent visitors who get stopped for their cell phones and wallets. We enjoyed eating at the top so if possible allow time around a meal time. If you hike it is FREE but allow several hours each way and know that if the fog rolls in you will have to hike back down.

It was pretty incredible. During my first two days I wasn't able to go to the Table Mountain as it was very windy and they closed down the Cablecar (I'm not much of a hiker, especially not alone...^^)But on the third day it finally opened and it was incredible! Such an amazing view from up there...just breathtaking!

Up! the easy and safe way!. On the day we used the Cable Car it was overcast and so ignored the Mountain. How wrong they are! There may not be the stupendous views, but the atmosphere is sharpened and the cable car staff saw to it that efficiency and courtesy wereb as efficient as ever.

A must do in Cape Town. You can't visit Cape Town and not go up Table Mountain. It is a very strenuous walk so the Cableway is a good option. I caught the MyCiti bus from the Civic Centre to Kloof Neck (about R7) and then took the free bus up to the Lower Cableway Station. This worked very well. Even at about 9am in the morning in off season there were cars parked a long way from the Cableway station and people were having to walk long distances. You can also use the parking at Kloof Neck and table the free bus up to the Cableway. It is worth walking away from the main area on top of the mountain to the less developed paths were one can enjoy the peace and the scenery better
Breathtaking View. Definitely one of the most breath taking views in the world overlooking the Atlantic coastline and 12 apostles
An amazing experience. I am in complete agreement that Table Mountain is indeed one of the Seven Wonders of the World. The Cable Way is certainly a very great experience too.
Breathtaking. Seeing Cape Town with a birds eye. Dont go on a cool day as it is 3 times colder up there unless you dress warmly enough otherwise the chill will make you wanna leave.
Tourist in my own city. Have always been amazed by this natural wonder on my doorstep. A must do for anyone visiting Cape Town
Amazing experience. Its an amazing ride up and down the cableway. The rotating platform inside allows one to get 360 degree views of the city.
An awesome day up the cableway. Had an exhilarating experience with my daughter. The ascent and descent was nail biting but absolutely worth it
A Definate must Do. If you visiting CT, you have to go up Table Mountain with the Cable Car, very safe & definitely spectaculare

A must. You have to be careful with the weather to make this visit. We saw some people walking up but I was glad to be in cable car.
There are 3 walks around the top of the mountain. Lots of interesting fauna.
Views were tremendous.
An amazing half day.
