Beautiful Design. The Cable car is a worth while local adventure. One pays so much money overseas, when we have the beauty all around us, on our very own Table Mountain excusion. Well worth the investment and very enjoyable.

Cape Town Beauty. breathtaking, viewing that brings calmness to the mind, body and soul.
must experience first hand to appreciate.

Incredible and convenient : massive bang for buck . Taking the cable is an incredible quick and efficient way to get to one of the greatest spots in the world. Because I intend to do it often as a lil escape from the city I got a loyalty card at the little shop there. Massive long term discount and most importantly you skip the ticket queue.

Great way to get to the top of Table mountain. Easy way to travel . The cable way runs continuously up and down except in high winds situation . The floor spins so you will get 360degree views and you are transported up and down the mountain. Make sure you hold on to your return tickets as they are needed to be scanned on return. Great view from the top but you do need to be lucky to get a good day as weather can change very quickly

Must-do in Cape Town. If you find yourself anywhere near Cape Town, you will not want to miss a trip up Table Mountain via the cablecar. It offers a breathtaking view of the city, the oceans, and all of the area. You will not forget it! Hike down if you have the stamina.

Enjoyable trip up table mountain by cable car. It was very enjoyable. The views were INCREDIBLE. It is much better to book online in advance, that way you will avoid the long queue upon arrival there. And take a good camera with you.If you're scared of heights I would not recommend this. The cable car ride is great. It lasts 4 minutes each way. The last 90 seconds going up are a bit scary as it's steep. Apart from that it was a wonderful experience.
FUN TO USE. The cableway is not only fun but also provides a panoramic view to the users. It is safe and added experience going atop the table mountain.
Outstanding View. Once you get to the head of the line, it is a smooth trip up. The floor rotates so every one gets an equal view.

Fantastic! Go early to avoid the rest!. We took the trip via the City Red Bus and we were thrilled. If you go early, guess what, it's not that crazy and you get to enjoy the mountain with far fewer people than the peak of midday. The process is very simple, and you can book your cable car ticket via the bus company. The views on the cable car (which rotates on the way up) are great, but when you get to the top and see the cloud billowing over the mountain, it is a fantastic sight!The view of the city from the mountain is great...and the little rodent chaps are very cute! Give it 1-3 hours to get the most...there is a good walk on the top!!
A great view!!!. If it is a nice day be there first thing in the morning, or be prepared for a long queue if you go later. Going up you get a good view of Cape-town.
The easy way to Table Mountain. The cable car is great on a windy day, but is a bit expensive. We walked up and took the cable car down and the walk was amazing and highly recommendable.

Easy way to reach the top. We got here when it opened after being closed for several days due to bad weather, but the line moved quickly, so in no time at all, we were boarding the cable car. The car rotated so everyone got a good view. Very quick both up and down.

''The easier way but exhilrating view and experience''. The traveller would jhave seen many cable cars but this on e is not so long but gives wonderful view of the city and mountain while going up and down, it takes water while goin g up for the facility at the table top, the roatatng cabin is quite different from the rest of the cable cars, by the time you start getting used to the ride you are their at the top. One can view the entire city from all the angle while going up/down.

Best experience ever. Omg I have so many wonderful memories. Don't rush just soak it all in a take a bunch of pics b/c they are priceless. Get there super early otherwise it gets crowded up there. DO NOT miss this attraction.

almost didn't go....glad I did. exhilarating viewstried twice to take the cable car up - cancelled due to windFYI - the floor of the cable car spins while going up. Great fun if you don't get motion sick like me!
Cooles and easiest way to get up the mountain. Cool experience and great views going up. Get your tickets online and avoid the cues at the ticket office.

The only way to travel. Great fun and good value for the experience. You CAN walk up or down Table Mountain if you wish, but it would be a shame to miss the cable car ride. The cars rotate as they ascend/descend so you get breathtaking views.

360 view of Capetown!. Used the cable car to go up Table Mountain and as it went up, it went round giving us a 360 view of Capetown and it's surrounding. Was quiet an experience and would recommend to everyone!

Cloudy With a Chance of Brilliance. We all know that table mountain is the biggest attraction in Cape Town, we also know that the Cableway is the simplest form of traversing its height. I have lived in Cape Town for most of my life and can tell you that you need to pick your time carefully. You have winds from the oceans behind pushing moisture above the mountain, where it supercools and forms the 'tablecloth'. On days like these, you'll find terrible visibility. As a rule of thumb, mornings are better than afternoons, the earlier, the better. The difference between taking the cableway on a clear or overcast day is immense. It is one of the most beautiful places that one can visit, but don't be stuck at the top, unable to see 2 meters ahead of you.I would advise waking up, looking out the window at the mountain and then deciding then and there whether it's a great day for it. Rather postpone it for a day then go up and not enjoy yourself.Hope this helps!
Easy and fun..... The ride up is half the fun! Have your cameras ready! The ticket process and lines are easy and quick. Well organized. We didn't use a coupon but others did so look for those.

A must do when in Cape Town. We took our kids aged 10 and 11 up Table Mountain. You can park your car in a parking area at the base of the road leading to the cable car and hop onto a free bus which will drop you right in front of the ticket office.Cable car rotates slowly while ascending the mountain and the floor to ceiling glass provided stunning views.I believe it will take about 2 hours to walk the loop of path ways on top of the mountain. Our kids were cold so we just walked a shorter 30 minutes route. Views are spectacular.There is a small restaurant and bar but prices are rather steep as expected. Kids found cute souvenirs in the shop.Highly recommended activity.

Easier than an 8 hour hike!. It can get very crowded, there is an app that lets you know the wait time. We went late morning before lunch and it was a perfect time to visit. The lines can be long during holiday periods, I missed going at Christmas.

Great view . Sunny day in Cape Town winter! A little wing but perfect afternoon to ride the cable cart up and wonder around table mountain. The grounds are kept clean with a toilet at the top and bottom both Eco-friendly.The views are breathtaking! A must see
It is a cable cart. We went with the cable cart up to the top of Table mountain. I think it was a bit overpriced, but at least we did not have to hike, since it was a spontaneous action.
A must do. Great views and experience to ride the cableway. No queues in June and easy close parking on the road. Benefits of winter.

Worth the wait. Visited here January 2016 , drove in hire car and found it best to park in lower car park which runs a shuttle bus up to the cable car entrance ,every ten mins or so and no charge .It would be easy enough to walk but quite a busy road so we used the bus .Got of bus to see a large queue waiting for tickets and then to access the cable car itself ,I have to say it was very well managed and within half an hour or so we got into the car itself .The cars hold 50 odd people who all want the best view at the rear......or that's what we thought but as we set off the floor began to revolve very slowly giving everyone a chance of the best views which was great engineering .As you'd expect stunning views but pick your day as mountain can be covered in cloud.

Spectacular Views. Arrived early and avoided the queues. Having pre-purchased tickets also helped. The operations was efficiently run and the trip on the gondola to the top was spectacular and exciting. Need to be sure of the weather for the best views. Once on top the walks around the area are well sign posted and take you a number of great vantage points for views over cape town and surrounds. Recommend walking quickly away from the top station for best views and also out of range of the annoying selfy stick brigade.

Not your typical aerial cableway. Only because the weather did not cooperate, the ride up to the top of Table Mountain was the highlight of the visit. The thing that is cool about this aerial cableway is the it rotates so that everyone gets a great view on the way up and down the mountain. Pretty cool.
Amazing views of this world class city. Plan your trip carefully so the weather will be clear and beautiful when you are atop the mountain. The view is like nothing else.
Quicker than walking . It wasn't busy for us so was able to get a nice view all the way up, even with the floor rotating....

MY ONLY WAY. It was my friend's birthday(on 16 June) and she wanted to take advantage of the free ride on your birthday offer. It was also her very first time, like many Capetonians. I have been several times even in the old car. When we arrived at the lower station we could see the mist coming in. I bought my ticket and she sported her no charge one. As a Wild card holder I also enjoyed 20% discount but that is only when you purchase at the Cash office. My friend was thrilled and going up into the mist didn't shake her one bit. She just said take my photo. She couldn't thank me enough for her birthday unbelievable first experience and is still talking about it.

Awesome cable car experience.. This is the most popular tourists attraction site in Cape Town, the trip by cable car is very exciting, your photo is taken on your way up and on your way down, once on top you'll have the opportunity of viewing the entire city of Cape Town, restaurents are available if you want to have a bite, Table Mountain rets are a common site on top, beautiful site indeed.
Don't miss!. Very epic views and the cable car was a quick ride up! I'm glad we took it but im sure the climb is awesome but surely exhausting and a whole day affair!

Great way to the top, super easy and convenient. This was a great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. The trip takes about 5 minutes in total and provides some stunning views-- the cable car rotates as you go up and down so you get a 360 view of the city and mountain. Make sure to go when its nice out though, we tried to go up 3 times before making it up finally and it was either closed or too cloudy to see anything.

360 degree view. It's a very nice experience. The entire cable car rotated 360 giving everybody a chance to have nice view of cap town city. Avoid going during bad weather, as you may missed to see the wonderful town from a height.

To the top. Finally had a sunny day and made the trip here. Had a bit of waiting to buy tickets but not too bad. Probably a good idea to buy them online before you go. Nice shops at top and bottom...cold on top so dress appropriately.

Dont buy the two way ticket, only for the way down...... The cable is a great way to quickly go see Table Mountain, and i made the mistake of not realising you can also trek up the mountain. After getting up there, everyone i talked to was so pleased with trekking, that i was slightly upset i took the cable up. Once you are there, then its great views, amazing pictures to be taken and very nice walks. Good place for a lunch, read a book, and just relax/unwind.One the way down, take the cable car, as its great to be down in a few mins.Best advice - buy a one-way ticket and trek up.

Amazing Experience. Cableway trip on the top of the mountain is something no one should miss in Cape Town.... 65 people travelling up the mountain with a rotating floor for 360 degree views is a out of the world experience...

Great day on Table Mountain. They say that if you see Table Mountain without cloud then you better go up and that is exactly what we did. A $70R taxi fare to the cable car from town and then the $240R pp return trip were more than worth it. I had little expectation but the ride in the 360 degree rotating floor cable car, the views from the top and the sheer drops were stunning and for me a must do on a nice day. You can get to the cable car on the hop on hop off city tour bus so that would save you taxi fare.

Take the trip up to Table Mountain, it's an unbelievable experuence. I was reluctant to take the cable car up to table mountain, but so happy I decided to go. The views are spectacular, it's so worth the ride! We went as a group and everyone with us felt the same way. I must have taken at least 50 pictures from the top of table mountain. It was an unbelievable experience I will never forget!

table mountain, what can we say.. one of the only wonders of the world. absolutely magnificent view from all sides on a clear day. the expanse of water seen from the top is incredulous to say the least. one feels the presence of the almighty, and one wonders can there be anyone else that has created all this water, and the great gigantic mountains. a sense of peace, calm, warmth and total piece of mind envelopes you as you just enjoy the table top. do yourself a flavor, go there and you will enjoy more than just the view; you will enjoy such inner contentment that nothing else can give you, because you will experience something out of this world.
Thrilling Ride. The cable car's floor rotates 360 degrees as you climb up to the top of Table Mountain!! You can't believe how awesome the view is on the way up and then it gets better at the top!

Make sure you visit for the most amasing aerial views. The aerial views from Table mountain are excellent. It is well worth the long lines. More accessible via the hop-on-hop-off red bus (from the aquarium at the V&A Waterfront). Don't miss out on this 7th wonder of the world!

Peace and quiet with great biews. Had to wait a day because of winds. When we finally made it there you get a majestic view of the city and surrounding areas. Hiking around the top was scenicWhat was most striking was how quiet it was

Awesome views as you go up the cable car!. the cable car rotates round up the mountain allowing for amazing views.... don't forget to get the best pictures as you ascend or descend...... you will need a bottle of water!... the top of the mountain allows for a greater sense of awesomeness, tranquility and an even greater appreciation of Gods beautiful creations such as the lions heard, great ocean views.......... Capetown central town....... one may need Up to 1hour. .30minutes for a complete satisfaction of this site. carry something warm, it may get chilly up there.
The fast way up. No problems. Smooth. Quick. What else can I say? It gets you to the top quickly and that's where you want to be.

Amazing experience. The views in the cableway up and down are unique and a nice introduction to the views on top of Table Mountain. Remember to buy the entry tickets online (will give some relief in the length of queue; esp., on crowded days)...
World class views. Managed to get a discount through YHA card, didn't have to wait long for a aerial cable carThe views are just fantastic , take a cardigan as it gets windy up at the top
Well worth it!. Cape Town is not complete without a visit to Table Mountain, which you access via the cableway. Amazing views on the way up and down - well worth a visit!!

Amazing Views. After a 30 minute wait (it opens at 8:30AM) wewere the 2nd grouo to board the glass walled, stand-up 360 degree rotating car to the top of Table Mountain in about 5 minutes. The view was wonderful! At the top we spent about 45 minutes walking all around . The day was perfectly clear-not a cloud in the sky and the views just amazing. We could see to the Western Cape, Cape Town, the 2010 World Cup Stadium and Robben Island. We were told that it had rained the day before and the cable car had been. Highly recommend getting there early to avoid the lines and the crowds at the top.

Breathtaking view. The place is must for every traveller in cape town.. The views are breath taking and you can view full city from the top.. The cable car is same as rota air as the mount Titlis at Switzerland...
Amazing. The cable car revolves at 360 degree and as such one can see the full view from the same spot. Worth for money
Wonderful. It was a wonder experience. Beautiful views when you are in the cable car. Good tour when you are up there.

amazing foliage and view of Capetown. Definitely recommend Table Mountain. Unbelievable view without any restraints. We were glad our kids weren't with us. I would have been worried...its a long way down! Gorgeous thought!!

Safe Clean Better than walking.. When we arrived the line was quite long, but we moved right along. The trip didn't take long, enough places for someone who is uncomfortable with high places to stand and not feel insecure. The floor dose turn, giving you almost a 360 view during the trip either way.
Spectacular view. Worth a trip to the top on a clear day. If able, take all the "side" walks and enjoy the views. The walk all the way down is not difficult and doesn't take as long as advertised.

make sure you book online for the tickets. We feel fortunate that we book online for the cableway tickets. even that it takes 1 hour for us till our turn, after all the online tickets, then they will serve the onsite tickets buyer

A consistently fantastic experience . The cableway is one of those must do experiences. The lines are extremely long in summer but you can save yourself time and money by booking online. It is well worth it and every time you go up, the view is different Unfortunately The restaurant is crapIf you live in Cape Town it makes sense to get a cable card. For roughly the cost of three trips you can use it every day. I use it to go down after I climb the mountain.

Crowded but fun. Although you can hike up Table Mountain, the cableway is a must-do. It's a quick but very scenic ride. If you're lucky enough to take it on a slow day, it's probably more pleasant but even though our tram car was crowded, it turns so that everyone gets an opportunity to enjoy the views.

Best experience ever. Romantic gesture isn't a good enough description. My first time last year on Table Mountain, number one on my "bucket list".Had the fortune of going up with who was at the time my boyfriend but when we came down was my finance. Spectacular views and had front row seats to see the work of God's hands.A day I will never forget. Definitely a must view and the experience is unforgettable!!!

Rotating cableway. If you want to visit the table mountain then an easy access would be to use the cableway. Its beautiful and amazing to go up the cable way to reach the top of the table mountain. But be warned if the weather is not permissible then the cable way is closed for operation. Check before you go up the mountain.

We had good weather. Table mountain is known for being cloud covered much of the time. We had perfect weather for our ride up the on the gondola and while we were on top. We could see for many miles in all directions. If the top is cloud free you should go as soon as possible because you may miss the opportunity.

Great experience. The cable car is very safe and gives wonderful view as the cabin revolves very slowly.It stays close to,the mountain and feels better than I thought it was going to be,as I don't like heights,but it was very enjoyable.
A must when in the cape. For the most amazing view of the Mother City a visit to Table Mountain is a must. If your days are full then go for the most stunning sunset there is.

When it's clear, you just gotta go!. Seized a moment; no wind, clear blue skies, mild weather, and up we went with our German visitor who was stunned at the views and ability to see 100 (?) kms in every direction. and what a vista. The queue moved quickly, we didn't even notice how long it took to get into a car and zoom to the top.The cafe at the top serves quite good food, but does not do all day breakfasts, so at 11.30 they stopped serving bacon and eggs just as we got there, tongues hanging out in anticipation!The Dassies did not show themselves for some reason, but the antics of the other tourists made up for that.

Sunset at the top. Views from the cable car 360 degree, views from the top of the mountain breathe taking. Took a picnic plus sundowners and enjoyed the mountain as a local tourist.Wonderful experience and would do it again.

Table Mountain Cape Town. The best place to have coffee and cake and have a walk to see the beautiful view of the city Cape Town and to see a nice and beautiful view of the blue ocean Table Mountain is the best place that you can relax Inn
breathtaking. breathtaking experience, lovely weather,well organized scoutseasy flow of people, well organized tripheavy clothing required as weather up is unpredictable

Fantastic views. A trip to the top of Table Mountain is a must when in Cape Town. We took our grandson on the Cableway while his parents climbed up the mountain. Fabulous views from the top but the walkways not very pram friendly. Lots of steps to negotiate. Well worth the effort!

Solo . I could see everywhere in Cape Town, the view was breath taking and I did not want to get down the mountain. The ride on the cable was interesting with the funny "pilot" . She made us laugh all through .

Fastest way to the top. Being on top of Table Mountain is AMAZING, but the cableway to get there is overhyped. Yes the floor rotates so you can get a 360 degree view, but the cableway is so crowded and the ride so short that it is difficult to see anything so it is really is just a very quick and easy way to the top. So don't expect anything spectacular from the ride and if you don't want to hike up - there are many paths - with different levels of difficulty than take the cableway. But when you get to the top of Table Mountain that is when it gets amazing. It is absolutely spectacular up there. Pick a cloudless day and plan to spend a lot of time. Great flat hiking trails on top.

Fantastic experience. Can't go wrong here. The view on top of table mountain is spectacular. We enjoyed the experience and the view of Cape Town from the top of the mountain is amazing. Took some amazing pics
Spectacular Experience. The views from the top of Table Mountain and on the cable trip were spectacular. Exhilarating up among the clouds.

Fun group outing. I was in Cape Town with a large group and we all were able to take the cable car up. There's a great gift shop and restaurant at the top and we really liked the short paths and hikes from the cable car. Also really well laid out maps to direct you around the top.

Spectacular . Unfortunately the morning we chose was cloudy and having debated whether to rearrange decided to take the trip anyway.It was disappointing not to see Cape Town from the top but very glad we still did it as the sun was out at the top and the view with the cloud below us was in itself spectacular.Will definitely return.
Amazing. A big tick off my bucket list, amazing experience, the panoramic views on the way up was breathtaking.

Off we went.... After 3 days in Cape Town where the cable car was closed due to high winds, we were finally able to get to the top. It was actually quite pleasant up there and easy to walk around. Views were a bit hazy but stunning none-the-less.

Must do for Cape Town, go early in AM. Everyone comes here to get a view of the city. The cable ride isn't scary and everyone gets a good view as it rotates. Best to beat the crowds and get there early or if time permits, hike it up the mountain for some exercise. Bring warm clothes and wind gear for the top as it will be much chillier than at the base. If you have a choice of days, opt for clear skies, we were forced to go when cloudy and visibility was not as good.
Beautiful view!. Cable ride was fun. To be able to see the different view going up and then coming back down was nice. Once up to the top the views were amazing!

Worth the trip up!. First thing I did when I landed in Cape Town was go up Table Mountain. Fortunately the day was sunny and clear and if I had waited a couple of days I would not have been able to see anything as the mist had completely covered the table top. The view from the top is second to none and absolutely beautiful. Definitely do this when in Cape Town.
Amazing views. Using the cable car allowed me easy access to the top of the mountain. The service was quick and good. You also get a 360 view while going up and coming down.
Spectacular views.. Did not have to wait long to get to the top. Only took a few minutes and was affordably priced. Very good restaurant (large variety of food and well priced) at the top.

The Table Mountain Aerial Cable way. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a state of the art cable car transportation system offering visitors a five minute scenic ride to the top of Table Mountain in Cape Town,
Wonderful roopway. enroute to table mountain this is wonderful facility from going to the top of the mountains.the view of Atlantic Sea and other mountains are mesmerising.

A Must-See in Cape Town!. A must-see in Cape Town. R240 per person for a round-trip on the cableway ($16 or 14 Euros). It's also possible to hike the mountain from several points in the city. Public buses run from the city to the bottom of the cableway. Frankly, though, the best views are of the mountain from the city, not of the city from the mountain. Views from the nearby, hikable Lion's Head are particularly nice.

Gorgeous Views. We got there at the end of the day and didn't get to enjoy the views as much as we would have liked and wished we could have stayed for the full sunset, but nevertheless it was beautiful views all the way around. You travel up in a gondola that holds 65 people, the floor rotates giving you a 360 view. There are gift shops at the top and the bottom. The ride was super smooth. Definitely worth seeing! Our taxi driver drove us to view the sunset at a nearby overlook when we left since we were unable to view the sunset from the top of the mtn.
Spectacular. Worth seeing this magnificent attraction .Regular tours with a very good cafe .Cable cars fast moving lines this time of year.
Short cable ride..rotating cable car. The cable car ride was very good. The rotating cable car provides 360 degree views. The ride itself is short (about 5 mins) but definitely enjoyable.

You're really high!. Busy place, but everything flowed pretty well. At the top we walked everywhere. We were lucky the tablecloth wasn't on at the time (cloud cover). The views are amazing! You can see so much. You're at the end of the world anyway, so the directions you can see are north, south, east and west, and they are all beautiful. I highly recommend.
A turning cable car. It was going up fast as it's turning and would save you hours from walking up yourself. The view is fantastic.
Great choice. On a clear non-windy day we room the aerial tram to the top of Table Mountain. Totally worth doing this!!
360 degree view. A huge cable car that can take 60 persons and as you go up for come down the car rotates 360 degree to give you an aerial view of the Table mountain and the city.

Three minutes and 360 Degrees. Quick ride up Table Mountain in a cable car with a floor that spins slowly so you get a 360 degree look. Nothing to hold onto and closes often due to high winds. The alternative is to hike.

Incredible views!. Take your time. We went when it was cloudy, no line, we got there in 5 min. Once we were on top the clouds parted and we got awesome pictures. Not saying that will happen every time, but it's worth trying.
Very interesting. It is very well managed & staff are willing to help & informative: they make you feel very comfortable.

Amazing View of Cape Town. Once you reach Cable Station , you need to pay 160 Rand for adult and 110 for kids. Cable takes you up in 10 minutes and then you can spend hours there before 5 p.m. enjoying the view , fog and nature. You have resturant at the top which serves both food and alcohol at normal rate.

Fun for the whole family. We were there on a beautiful clear day and got there early enough to avoid a long wait. The cable car rotates as you ascend and descend so everyone gets to see everything. At the top there are hiking trails, a coffee shop and a gift shop. If you are not hiking, the whole activity takes about an hour, plus however much time you have to wait in line to get on the car.

Well worth it if there is no large que. We were lucky not to have a very long Wie since it was a perfect Sunday morning. Note that the floor rotates as the cable car moves so yo will get a view of every angle. My advise is let everyone get on first and then your garenteed a spot against the window. The que when we got there had not reached the street yet , I would say a couple hundred people but the wait was about a half hour.
Rotaing Ride Up the Mountain. The cable car rotates while going up the mountain so everyone has a great view. It's about a two minute ride or so and there is no seating. Great fun - do it!

Breath Taking Views . My only regret is not staying at the top longer. I only allotted 30 min, I should have left an hour at least to walk the full route encircling the top, and to stop and soak in the magnificent everything in all directions.

A fantastic way to spend the afternoon!. The cable car is a wonderful way for people who can't hike up the mountain or (like me) who are a bit afraid to. It's quick, but it feels gentle and safe. The views are spectacular! Walking around on top was wonderful too. Be sure to keep an eye out for dassies- they're adorable little rodents who scamper about at the top of the mountain. I loved spending time on table mountain! Don't miss it!

a fun way to get up. Check before you before you go as its often closed due to the winds, we made 3 different attempts before we finally went. When you get in the cable car try and stay around the glass as thats the only place you can see any thing going up if the car gets full. The internal floor moves 360 degrees giving everyone by the glass the same views.
A must for everyone...... The cableway experience adds to the overall Table Mountain experience. I felt that the view is more enjoyable when I am not out of breath climbing the steps.

Well oiled machine. No queues during our visit. We had a really smooth trip up to the top in the cable car. The rotating 360 degree feature is excellent in ensuring that everyone gets the opportunity to take photos at the open section.

A "must do" experience. Of course it's a "must do" experience when you're in Cape Town, but it is much better than I anticipated. I booked the ticket through the Concierge in my hotel which saved queuing at the turnstiles at the arrival of Table Mountain.The waiting time for a cable car was only a couple of minutes which was a pleasant surprise.Also the journey up in the cable car itself is quicker than I had expected, and was very stable, so no need to worry if you're not a fan of wobbly rides like you would get on a ski resort!The views from the top are stunning and it is large enough up there to have the freedom to wander around and take photo's from many different angles.What struck me most, apart from the view itself, was the quietness up there. Almost silent if you're prepared to walk for a few minutes away from the other tourists.A nice little coffee shop up there adds to the overall experience.I avoided the shop with the usual tacky tourists gifts so can't comment too much on that.Overall a really excellent experience, no queuing for the cable cars, and much more freedom at the top than I had imagined.

nice comfortable way to explore table mountain....... nice comfortable way to explore table mountain......its rotating 360 degree to get the view of the scenic around the one of the most beautiful place in south Africa.

Table Mountain in Cape Town. it's a must when U visit Cape Town. Once U reach up there, U will feel like U are on another planet. Serene, rocky and peaceful. U would like to spend hours overthere. What a view from up there and look aound. Don't forget yr camera.

Breathtaking. I've been up and down the cableway many times over 20+years and it only gets better every year! The line ups move fast, the guides are informative and the views breathtaking!One day I hope to hike up, but the cableway is just too convenient ;)

What goes up must come down!. While some may choose to hike Table Mountain, you are more than welcome to catch the aerial Cableway to the top, enjoy a light walk around and then ride it back down. The view is breathtakingly beautiful up there and the air is rare. Enjoy!

Packed but the view is amazing. It's packed with people but the view is amazing and it can rotate 360 degrees. The nice thing about this rotation is that you can see different side, however it's also means you can't lean on the side.

Worth the Vertigo. I loved the ride down the mountain after taking a very sweaty hike all the way to the top from the bottom. Inside the cable car it rotates so that everyone has a chance to see the different point of views. Very smart how they did this. I got vertigo for a little from the rotation but it was definitely worth it
Great views from the top!. Great way to see the top if you don't want to make the hike. Breathtaking views on the way up, and the cablecar has a revolving floor.

Table Mountain . Spectacular views. Make sure you visit the cableway as soon as you get to town as sometimes it doesn't operate if it is to windy or if the clouds obstruct view it is deemed unsafe to operate the cable car. It would be a shame to miss this site

Amazing Views!. We had a very beautiful clear day to go up Table Mountain - and the cable car ride was a blast! The cars rotate, so no matter where you are standing in the car, you get a 360 degree view by the time you get to the top. It was a little bit scary, and I felt bad for people who were really not comfortable, because there was no where to sit down away from the windows for the six minute ride. But I loved it.
Amazing views and smilly staff!. Was a great experience with lovely staff and very impressive view!I've been booked the Aerial Cableway by internet and the service was excellent.

A Definite Must for anyone visiting Capetown.. An efficient and excellent of getting of to the top of TABLE MOUNTAIN.Offering superb views of the magnificent city and its beautiful harbour.Recommend a clear day to experience the natural splendour and beauty
Amaxing View and Experience. Everyone must experience the cableway. It is one of the best views in the world! It is absolutely amazing !!!

If you're short on time.... We would have loved to hike the trail up to table mtn. I think it's about 2 hours up, but we didn't have time so we took the cable car up. It was easy and the ride up was about 5 mins or less. The views were gorgeous. Round trip for an adult was about $15 USD dollars so steep but it is what it is. There are various discounts for seniors and students on different days. We bought our tickets online because the queue can be long at the ticket window. Also, beware the last cable car is well before sunset so you need to time your trip accordingly.
Best way to the top!. The cable car provides an exciting way to the top of the mountain. The views are extraordinary and only a couple minute ride.

A relaxing way to get to the summit!. If I must complain about something, my only complaint would be the scratches on the glass of the cable car. Shows up in my photos. I wish the glass wasn't there but I'm guessing it's a safety precaution.
Great Experiance ever. Must have experience of 7th Wonder of the world. Great view from the top of the mountain and View from the cableway.

Breathtaking beauty. We arrived in the morning and did not have a long wait to go up. The floor rotates around so you have a view from Marios points. You have to make sure it is clear so you can see many miles away. You can hike around once you reach the top for hours!!

On a clear day, Unsurpassed Views and great ride up!. Weather was amazing the day we decided to head up the mountain on the aerial cableway. I'd highly recommend purchasing tickets ahead of time or using your smart phone to buy them once you get there. Pre-purchasing tickets will ensure that you don't spend a few hours in line to buy your ticket. Initially we were in line to wait for tickets, but the wait time was well over an hour. A few minutes on the smart phone and I had tickets for us. There was only a small wait - less than 20 minutes to board the cableway. The ride up was incredible. If you are afraid of heights or with someone who's afraid of heights, be sure they are in the middle of the car. The floor rotates as it travels on the cable, so that was a bit much for my afraid of heights companion who had the death grip on the inside guardrail handle... she freaked when the car began to move and an announcement cautioned not holding onto the guardrail and the floor started rotating. Once at the top, there's a well-appointed restaurant that serves beer, wine and mixed drinks... The restaurant had lots of selections and the gift shop had lots of curios and touristy stuff. If it's a clear day, this activity is not to be missed as you can literally see to the end of the earth!

Amazing Africa . For any vistor to Cape Town it is a must to been on top of the Table Mountain. A tipp: your fist thing will be, if Table Mountain is open and not covered by most or clouds, you go up. Never mind what you had in mind to do. Buy a ticket at Hopp on Hopp of. You can do a nice city tour with them and included will be the ticket to Table Mountain.

The table top mountain gives you the best views of the area. A must do.. Try to get one of the first cable lifts to the top. Many tour groups come up the mountains and the lines can be very long and slow. Take the time to explore the various hikes on the mountain, that includes reader boards to explain the various aspects of the view and the flower etc. If you are a hiker I would suggest hiking the path to the top. I would have enjoyed this venture however I was with a tour group. That allowed only 1.5 hours for exploration.

Holiday at Cape Town . The cable car at Table mountain gave us excellent service. The trip is a must do and breath taking. The place is well marked and tablets on the side tell little stories which make the walk interesting.
Stunning views. Definitely worth a visit for tourists. We enjoyed the time spent up on Table Mountain. Parking is ok along the main road.

Absolute chaos!. The top attraction in one of the worlds best cities will never see me again. No queuing system in place so you have to try your best to remain moving forward while you get push and shoved by people with no manners in their rush to get to the top of the que . Once on top the restaurant was an absolute mess , spilled coldrinks and litter everywhere. Don't bother !!

Worth doing. Wonderful views from the top of table mountain. Cable car fun. Good idea to book before one goes as quite a queue even in the pre booked line. We went in the morning which is obviously busier as everyone wants to take advantage of the weather if it is good, it must be remembered that if it is windy the cable car doesn't work so at the first opportunity of good weather head straight for the cable car which was excellent and certainly worth doing.
Breathtaking experience. Both going up and being up there was a breathtaking experience - you have to be lucky with the weather though, but if there is even half a view it is gorgeous !

Amazing views. We did this from the open top bus tour. Go when it is a clear day for best views. Lovely cafe at top for snack while enjoying the scenery. Signposted walks around the top of the mountain

Great views. We were lucky with fine weather when we visited Table Mountain so we were able to take the cable car up. It is spectacular and the walk around the top gives 360 degree views. Well worth doing when in Cape Town

Spectacular Views. The view from the top of table mountain is something to behold. You can see the whole of the south peninsula. Some advise though, don't even attempt the trip if there is cloud over the mountain (the famous table top), you will be very disappointed. Try to book your ticket online, it saves you a long wait in the ticket queue. Food at the top is a little expensive so pack your own picnic lunch, it is worth spending a good few hours exploring the top of the mountain as it is pretty expensive to get there. It is also deceptively high up there and can therefore get pretty cold at times even though the bottom will appear warm, pack a nice warm top or light blanket.

Very good ride with fantastic views of capetown!. This is a nice ride up to table mountain, we were lucky to get good weather, although it was very cold that day. The views from the ride is fantastic, as the car rotates 360 degrees! I went in the winter, so the windows were open and you got the nice cold air inside the cable car. It is better to go early in my opinion. Also you can buy the tickets online to save time.
Quite a lovely afternoon. Splendid view! Quite informative! The view of the ocean was stunning and the rotating cable cars was quite an interesting surprise.

Beautiful as always. Had a lovely day out on the mountain. We took the MyCiti up to the cable station from the car park. Its free and far easier than searching for parking. The ride boasted stunning 360 degree views, something I doubt I'll ever stop appreciating.
Super Trip. Excellent cable-car experience with 360 degree view of fabulous Capetown and Table Mountain. You rotate within the cable-car so everybody gets a chance to see everything.

Wonderful ride in a revolving pod. The cable car to the top of Table Mountain is a 360 degree revolving pod with open actions to allow taking of photos without glass. Access by the City Sightseeing bus which ensures a good ride around the peninsula too
Easy way down. Had a lovely walk up but can be hard going so the best way down was the cable car! Advisable to pre book your tickets. Great views!

The only way is up! 😀. Bought our tickets as part of the hop on hop off bus. Took the bus to tabletop mountain. Long queue but it moved pretty quick. Those with tickets were in one queue, those without had to queue to buy them, then queue for the cable car to the top (it's lucky I know how to spell queue).One at the front of the queue you get into a lift ... This takes you to the cable car. Cable cars are not something I like at all so I settled myself by the handrail with my back to the mountain eyes shut at the ready. We set off and as soon as we did the guy advised us all to let go of the handrail as he said the car floor rotated. Shock horror!!! It revolved all the way round, slowly, I didn't look as I can't stand heights (yes I know..., table mountain is high but my hubby really wanted to go). Once there it was nice. I didn't look down but looking out gave wonderful views. There is a cafe, shop, you can stay as long as you like up top but, be aware the weather can change at any time and if it does the cable car does not operate!!! Long walk down! Look out for the Dassie's. A bit like Guinea pigs but bigger and they roam quite freely up there. They seem to like the crowds. Be prepared for the queue to go down again. For those like me, who don't like heights or cable cars.... It was worth it!

Book your tickets in advance. Stunning views a must we spent 3/4 hours up there and went by hop on hop off bus - tickets were included. But you can drive or take a taxi. If you do make sure you book tickets in advance save on queuing time.Once up there savour the views get an ice cream and relax!
Worthy of its Status. Absolutely stunning....the cablebar up the mountain was a fabulous experience...this is truly the cape at its best

Neat Ride Down. Hiked up the Kasteelspoort route to the top of the mountain and rode the cable car down. Was an interesting ride since the floor rotates to allow everyone a view of Cape Town. It's a short ride but a great view.

A good way to visit the mountain.. Walking does take very longer than going by cablecar. Cablecar is turning around; good way to see view CapeTown. On a busy day, you have to wait very long for cablecar. It's a good idea to buy a ticket online or by the office Sightseeing bus.

Table mountain. We visited Cape town between the 14 May 2016-21 May 2016,being regular visitors this was one of the best times of the year ,weather was perfect and it was off season.In the many years visiting Cape Town it was the 1st time on the cableway up Table Mountain,What an experience!.With the ride up less then 3 mins we seen breath taking 360 d views.I love Cape town and this was exceptionally beautiful.It was 25 degrees and sunny and we spent 6 hrs walking on the mountain,was lovely and so relaxed .Best time to go is off season where there is no waiting in line for tickets
Great ride both up and down. I have ridden lots of cable cars but never one that rotates in a circle. Makes it possible to see from all spots in the car.

Table Mountain . Buy tickets online, that's saving time. Good too be here early our later on they day. It took ous 90 min in low session to coming up. We was walking around and tooked many beautiful pictures. They way down tooked very shorty of time!

Top of the world. Visited Table Mountain on a cloudless day. Bit nippy going up, so take a warm jacket. Casual shoes is a must as the walking trails lead to spectacular views along the plentiful paths. Remember the camera . The restaurant serves lovely snacks and warm beverages to suit any taste and budget. Arrive early as the queues can be daunting to say the least. Visit this attraction whenever the weather allows you to.
Fantastic!. The ride is comfortable and of course has breathtaking views. Never been in a gondola that rotates before. Staff are helpful and friendly.
Lovely. Easy booking, nice scenery, good cafe's and great for people who enjoy walks.Make sure you have plenty of fluids if you decide to go for walks to keep yourself hydrated.

A "must do" in Cape Town. Table Mtn dominates the landscape of Cape Town, and the panoramic view of the city it offers makes this short funicular ride a "must do". Lines can get long, I am toD, but we were advised to purchase our tickets before we went up to the lift (a very good idea) and to go early. First car up on the Sunday that we visited departed at 8:30 a.m., although they advertise the site as opening at 8. We were in the first car up, and we were rewarded with the entire mountaintop virtually to ourselves. Depending on the season, the dassies may not be awake and running around if you go up too early. The view of the city is spectacular - don't miss this if you're visiting Cape Town.
Dazzling and stunning!. Excited to go up by this cable cart, which can contain 65 people and turns around so all at the window can catch the best views!
Gotta go. Iconic feature of Cape Town. Super views. Path to walk around circumference - about 1/2 hour max required. Waits for tram to top not bad.

Easiest Way to the Top. One can hike up to the top of Table Mountain if time and fitness are available. If not, take the cableway to the top. Going to the top of Table Mountain is a must. Short or longer hikes are possible at the top and the view cannot be better (on a clear day).

Great experience. Iconic scenery!. A Cape Town must! Very efficient system in place and wonderful views. Weather dependant but most days in the Cape are great.Can be long queues on busy days, but well worth the wait. Awesome scenery from the table top.

fantastic views. I am so glad I decided to overcome my fears ( I normally do not visit places high up) since the views were spectacular. we bought the tickets on the web, recommended to avoid long queues (specially if you go highseason).
Excellent. Excellent views.But its a very short trip.Its just over in 5 mins.But offers great views.It is rotating,so one can have the views of all sides.

So fun! ....however.... Long long lines and kind of expensive.... Overall I enjoyed Table Mountain and was glad we rode the cable cars to the top.
Make sure you go up on a clear day..... Otherwise you won't see much through the clouds.
Wow. Amazing views as you travel 3500 feet up and back again. The cableway runs constantly and has very friendly operators.

Excellent once your up, they cram lots of people into each cable car. . We had an absolutely beautiful day and clear skies which made for excellent viewing off and on table mountain! We were not prepared for how packed the cable cars get- being surrounded by lots of pushy tourists so high up can be quite scary. Try and get into the car early and hold your ground. The trip is about 5 mins up and 5 mins down. You can buy wine and snacks when your up on the mountain, it's absolutely beautiful!

Great views excellent value restaurant. A stunning place that is soo worth the money views are unrivalled and a must for anyone visiting cape townUp too good places too buy the touristy stuff however the gem is the restaurant price is great and good is very good if ostrich pie is on the menu go for it
Highlight on Capetown . This is one of the best things to do in Capetown. The views are spectacular where ever you walk on top. This is not to be missed while you are visiting this city.
Worth visiting . We visited on a sunny clear Day. It is nice beautiful place. We spent more than 2 and half hours walking around. Viwe from the top is awesome.

Freezing cold but beautiful views!. We walked up which was a fantastic walk but absolutely freezing at the top! Views are worth it. We got the cable car down and the queues to get up were massive so be sure to buy your tickets online to avoid waiting. Get there early to avoid the crowds.
Loved it. Loved it. Cable cars here are safe, not crowded. Reasonable prices. The views are stunning going up to the mountain. Will go back

Easy way down!. I opted to walk up Table Mountain but took the cable car down. Well worth it (125 rand/person) and the platform in the tram pivots as the car goes down so that everyone has an opportunity to see the magnificent views!

Above the Clouds Beautiful. Tram ride turns so you can see it all wherever you stand. A delight.Friends and I came with group first thing in the morning. It looked cloudy but they went away but time we reached top and then practically had whole mountain top to ourselves. Spectacular!!
Aerial Tram worth the ride. This tram was wonderful. It turns as you go up and down Table Mountain. The views are great going up and at the top. Worth the fee and time.
Well worth the cost. Buy your ticket online and save a few minutes waiting in line to purchase at the mountain. I heard that you can ride for free on your birthday, but did not verify this.

Beautiful!. Wonderful way to see the city. Book early and get to the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway to enjoy one of the most stunning aerial rides you will ever have. Cape Town is one of the most lovely cities in the world and this is one excellent to enjoy the sights. Fantastic!

Revolving cablecar. Wow! what a ride. It held 60 - standing and the operator. The cable car revolves 360 as you ride up or down the cables. It had a great view. Operator gave interesting facts on surroundings. It was smooth and did not make me dizzy. Wonderful ride to a grand place.

Up, Up and Away!. what better way to spend a warm afternoon making your way to the top of Table Mountain....I took some first time visitors to Cape Town and were treated not just to a cable car ride but the most delightful, local cable car operator who regaled us with tales of previous passengers scared of heights and the ways they dealt with it...she was also the operator on the way down and had us all singing! So yes, it was a fun experience but seriously, this is a safe, reliable mode of transport and the views on the way up and down from the mountain are spectacular in themselves....a must do for any visitor to Cape Town.....do check for a cloudless blue sky because if the clouds appear above it (the famous table cloth) the mountain will be closed so don't delay!
Perfect day for a visit. Well worth the queues to get on the gondola. Spectacular views at the top. spent an hour taking in the vistas

Watch the weather and time. We had 3 days in Cape Town with tickets bought before we left the UK. Check the official web site for weather and times of the last cable car up and down, We spent over 2hrs on top so that needs to be factored in. Waiting time was reasonable @ 10am but coincideded with the arrival of a number of school parties who bi passed those waiting in line and added about another 20 mins. when we came down around 12.30 there was no one waiting at all. If travelling by car there is parking both as you climb the road before the cable car and also after it. On the way up the parking attendants will try to encourage you to park which would mean a steep climb to the cable car. My advice is to continue past the cable car and try to park on the level section and only if there are no spaces turn around and park at the first available spot going back down.
Great on a sunny day. Expect long queues but it is so worth it, views are amazing, great facilities at the top just expect a long wait to get the cable car back down!! But a must do in CT!!

Fast and efficient. I only had one day to visit Table Mountain during my short trip but fortunately I was really lucky with the weather. I arrived quite early and had already bought my tickets online so didn't have to wait in line for too long - probably around 15-20 minutes.The journey up or down takes no longer than five minutes and the rotating cable car floor guarantees spectacular panoramic views.Staff were very efficient and the whole process was hassle-free, which contributed to an unforgettable trip.

Beautiful scenery from atop the mountain. A must do and see if visiting Cape Town! Stunning scenery ontop the mountain which is way bigger than expected. Cable car ascends so quickly, which is great if you get motion sickness. The only downer might be how long you have to wait to buy your ticket in high season, but definitely worth the wait. Remember to take something to eat/drink with you as the restaurants/shops ontop the mountain are rather expensive.
Enjoying Cableway. The Cableway journey is amazing. It takes around 20 minutes to reach and another 20 to back. The cabin revolves around to let the occupants see all things around.

Super way to get to the top of Table Mountain. The day we went to Table Mountain, the weather was fine. The Cableway line was long, but we had purchased our tickets on-line so we did not need to wait in that line. I recommend getting your tickets before going to the cableway. Because the weather was. Ice, the ride and our time on the mountain were fabulous.
Kids loved the cable cars. We took our kids to the top of Table Mountain. They loved the cable cars and just want to go back! There were a lot of people, but we didn't wait too long to go up.

A Must!!!. This is amazing when the day is clear, make sure you do this even if you are afraid of heights try it you will not be disappointed. The Cables Carts are large and the floor revolves slowly giving everyone a chance to see the amazing views of Cape town below.
Breathtaking. The cableway is a means to an end if you don't have the energy to climb the mountain. The views are simply stunning and the walks around the top of table mountain are breathtaking.

Best of both worlds, Fog and Clear. The fog was lifting and we were permitted the ride to the top, smooth and I loved the rotating car. I was able to get photos of Cape Town thru the clouds, then beautiful shots once the fog disappeared. Being on a ship excursion we did not have to lineup so that was a plus. Certainly worth the ride!
Do it first. Table Mountain can be closed depending on the weather so plan your trip there first. Try to get your tickets online so you will not have to stand in a "general" line.

On top of the world. There is a reason why Table mountain is one of the wonders of the world and it is worth spending a day on the mountain. The trip in the cable care is exciting and scary at the same time! One can't describe the trip up (and down) to someone ... you simply have to experience it for yourself.

BEST OF CAPETOWN. TABLE MOUNTAIN CABLEWAY is the best thing to visit in Capetownyou get best view of INDIAN OCEAN N CAPETOWN from the top of Tablemountainonly hindrance is to stand in queue for an hour to get into the cableway...something needs to be done by authority on same for visitors...so we can get more time on top to explore

Great experience. This is one of those must do attractions when visiting Cape Town for the first time. Travel time in the cable car is only four minutes each way with the gondola revolving as you ascend. Surprised to find free wifi at the top. Great views on a clear day.

Take it to the top!. If you are going to visit the top of Table Mountain, the quickest and funnest way is to take the cable car up to the top. It spins as you go up and down, so you get a panoramic view of Cape Town. Once you get to the top, the views are amazing. A definite must if visiting Cape Town.
Up, up and away... Something you just have to do when in Capetown. A trip up cable mountain, the view over Table Bay, awesome.Queus can be long, so get there early, or book online.
Go for the views (obviously). 360 degree views to die for. I would advise buying ticket online and get there early to avoid queues and make parking easier. (Like before they open)
Go early. This is a fantastic experience but he queues do tend to get very long so go early. Awesome views from the top and a cafe in case you are hungry.

Beautiful view, book in advance to avoid queue. This is a perfect way to get quickly to the top and enjoy the fantastic view. The floor is rotating, so you will get a great view from any spot. Buy your ticket in advance either online or at the hop on / hop off bus / office. This makes sure you do not have to stand in the big line. We passed a few times, and the queue was significant longer during the weekends (which i guess make sense), so suggest to visit during the weekdays if possible. The ride takes 5 min up, an i suggest you spend a few hours on top walking around and enjoying he view. We did the min walking route, which stunning view all the way around.

Must Do. If great weather is predicted, definitely do this. GET THERE EARLY. We bought tix at 8:30 and had 3 people ahead of us; when we came down at 10 the line stretched double length across the street and it was a zoo. The trams themselves have 2 open windows and the interiors rotate so everyone gets a chance for great photos on the quick ride. Up top there are lots of pathways and viewpoints. Stunning.

Beautiful...Must Visit. Purchased our tickets in advance over the internet via the website...simple and easy ( be sure to select the ride up and down unless you want to walk either way). Once you queue in line ( we waited for about 15 minutes on a PERFECT November day) staff comes with hand scanners and scans your ticket...then you board and up you go...exhilirating and smooth ride with great swiveling views up to the top to a truly magnificent views and landscape...a must do!

An inspiring day!. This was one of the highlights of our recent trip. When we reached the top we did the walk to Maclears Beacon and enjoyed the most incredible views! We also took some beautiful pictures from the walkways nearer to the cablecar station at the top. We had an enjoyable lunch at the restaurant and were pleased that the prices were reasonable. We were glad we purchased our tickets ahead of time as it saved us waiting in long lineups. You can buy tickets online or with the Hop On Hop Off bus tickets. The MyCiti bus also goes to the cablecar station and is an economical option for transportation. Choose a clear day and get ready for some inspiring scenery!

Well run exoerience. Well run, well executed. Bit pricey for local and you feel mugged by the staff as you exit the cableway to sell their photo packs. That kind of sales pressure at the end of an experience waters down the over all effect.

great views - even with some cloud coverage. We took a chance to go up the cable car with cloud coming and going over Table Mountain. So glad we did. It was beautiful to be on top of the clouds with blue sky above and then see Cape Town below when the clouds parted. The Rock Hyrax were so cute - hard to believe they're closely related to the elephants we'd seen a few days before.

Best way to get up to the Table Mountain!. The Cableway is most definitely the best way to get up Table Mountain. Never mind where you stand in the Cabin. It makes a complete 360° spin on the way up (and down), so wherever you are standing, you get to see it all!

A must in Cape Town when the weather is clear!. When you get to Cape Town you'll see the Table Mountain isn't always open, it gets covered with a "Tablecloth" of clouds sometimes. But if you see its open and you haven't been up there, don't hesitate for a second and go. The Cableway is the easiest way up, I'm not the biggest fan of heights, but it's not so bad... I just didn't realise it slowly spins 360 degrees between top and bottom, so keep looking up towards the top of the mountain, was not a good technique :)

Breathtaking views. Loved this cable car experience. It zips up and down at quite a fast rate and rotates at the same time. My ears popped going up and down. The views from the top are spectacular. We were blessed with beautiful sunny weather and virtually no wind and 100% visibility in all directions. Make sure to take your time and walk around the many signed paths. Make sure to check their website before going as the next day after we went the winds came in and it had to be closed. This is a must when visiting cape town.

Trip with a view. I have been up a number of times and is a greater experience. The views of Cape Town and area are great. Try to choose a clear day. What I would recommend is a ride up and a walk along the mountain top for at least an hour. This is a whole day experience but can be done in a half day. Pre-book as the wait in the queues can be long. One must dress warm as is can be cold and windy. I have also walked up the mountain and then caught the cable car back. It is a hard walk and one must me reasonable fit. I recommend you at least take water and a map of table mountain.

Deservedly One Of The Wonders of the World. We have been up Table Mountain with the cable car a few times. It is an experience not to be missed! Make sure you have enough time (I would suggested at least half a day). On the top there are a few easy walking trails where you will want to spend some time. The restaurant at the top is good. The service we experienced everywhere was very good. The rotating cable car is an experience on its own. Suggestion: take public transport to the cable car station, otherwise you may have a long walk from you car to the station, there is not a lot of parking. There are quite a few bus and shuttle services to the station. On a very windy or overcast day, don't go. You will not see much and it will be unpleasant.
A Special Experience. Ride up in the gondola OK but by sheer luck the "tablecloth" (layer of Cloud) poured over the mountain top as we approached the summit.

Make sure the sun is out. My wife was frozen to the floor and probably would not do it again but a great way to see Cape Town.Pick your time to go though as the cloud comes in quickly and regularly and this limited the vista.A must see in Cape Town

Long lines. Booking your ticket in advance saves you some time but still be prepared for long lines. The view from the brief cable car is not any better from what you can see on top of the mountain. So if you have the ability to hike, do that. you can save the wait in the line and enjoy wonderful scenery at same time.
Very nice experience . Very nice experience and very friendly service. Cable cart felt very safe to go into. And it's very beautiful from on top. There is also a nice curio shop and a mini cafe

Easy up, easy down. Besides the lines this is a great way to see the city without hiking. The staff are excellent and always willing to help where they can. My advice is pack a drink and some snacks because it can get pricey up there. If it is your birthday don't miss out on their price deal

Get an overview of Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain via the Cableway.. Table Mountain Cableway is a comfortable cable car ride and feels safe. It's a short trip and the car was not crowded. Even at peak times there is only a short wait.
It rotates !. One of the only 4 cable cars in the world thatbrotate when its ascending. Great park and walk. If its to windy, it will not operate. It closes down at 4 pm

On top of the world! A truly exhilarating and stunning experience!. I live in Cape Town not far from the cable car and have been a couple of times with visiting guests and relatives. Its also free on your birthday so dont forget to take ID with you if it is! The whole place is well run and operates very smoothly. I would advise getting there very early to avoid any queues as it gets very busy all the time. The restaurant at the top is pretty average so don't expect anything exciting there - but the coffee isnt bad and the views are spectacular! I dont think I could ever get bored of the view - its really superb - a reminder of what an incredible city we live in!

Great cableway to the top of Table mountain. Fast and comfortable cableway to the top of Table mountain. The cabin is rotating with beautiful views to Signal hill and Cape Town. If you're not hiker or don't have time to walk to the top I can strongly recommend.
Very convenient!. Cars leave base station constantly. If you get there early, the waiting time will be ok. Can be very crowded once the big tour buses arrive on the scene!

Loved it. The drive up to the cableway is incredibly scenic in itself. Parking was easier than I thought it would be, but the cable car was definitely easier than climbing up the mountain! Breathtaking views, efficient and helpful staff and very pram-friendly setup. We booked online so the entire process was very streamline and easy.
Table Mountain Cableway. Plan to arrive early (before 8.30am) to avoid lines. Very quick trip to the top (5 minutes max). Breathtaking 360 degree views

Awesome Views of Capetown from Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Awesome Views of Capetown from Table Mountain, this is a don't miss adventure and be sure to go up a couple of hours prior to sunset. This trip is a photographers dream, panoramic, sunset and great scenery.
Fantastic views. What fantastic views from the top of the mountain the cable car was very good and not too long to wait would recommend a visit.
Super Cool. A little stuffy but totally worth the few minute ride to the top. The couple different people I had operating the ride were great as well. Totally recommend!
Beautiful Scenery. I think a must-do as a tourist in Cape Town - even if it's the only touristy thing you do!! Great views! The inside of the cable car turns to you get a 360 view.

A must if you're new to Cape Town. You can't visit Cape Town without a stop off at Table Mountain. My recommendation would be to catch the Red Topless bus for a trip that includes a few great sightseeing spots. The cableway being one of them. Great views of the beaches along the Atlantic seaboard. You may see little dassies (rock rabbits) and can grab something to eat at the restaurant or take your own picnic lunch. A worthwhile visit.
Tooo gooood. Great viewNice experienceSuperb for hiking and taking pictures of the breath taking views of the sea, land and the mountain itselfFree wifi also available on top!
GOOD SERVICE. Everyone of the staff at the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway want to make it your best experience ever

Stunning views and easy access. A brilliant attraction. The cableway is brilliant and with a rotating cabin, you are guaranteed a few spectacular views. If you stay in Capetown, it is worth getting the Cable-Card as this pays for itself after 3 visits. Keep an eye out for special events ie Sunset tours, Cocktails on the mountain, hikes, etc. Weekdays are less busy and make sure you get there early to avoid queuing as the queues can become very ;long and parking can be a problem, although there is a regular shuttle from the lower parking to the cable station. Spend time on top of Table mountain and enjoy the views, but please stay on the designated and marked routes as the cliffs are high, steep and dangerous if you make a wrong turn. That said, it is still a GREAT way to spend a day. Best times of year - September to April .

Fantastic staff of Cableway. I am a tourist guide and had the following incredible experienceFriday 13 May 2016I went up Table Mountain with 28 Swiss Tourists.Upon getting back on the Cable Car at the top I opened my purse to show my guide registration card. At the same time I glanced back over my shoulder looking out for the last of my guests, as the group had already boarded. I did not realize that at that moment my cash fell out of the purse. I then dashed to the cable car as the door was just closing.Upon arriving at the bottom James was already waiting as the door opened, asking me if I or somebody from my group had lost money. I asked all my guests - but nobody had lost money. Before leaving the shop a little voice in the back of my head said: "you better check your purse". Only then did I realize that I had lost all my cash. I went back to James who contacted the top station. Believe it or not, my money was returned to me with the next cable car coming down.James would not accept a reward and explained that all the staff working at Table Mountain Aerial Cableway took pride in their work and excellent customer service was their goal.James and his colleagues more than reach this goal.Table Mountain Aerial Cableway can not only be proud of one of the new 7 wonders of nature but also their staff.Thank you James, thanks to everybody at Table Mountain Aerial Cableway for doing a great job.Erika Smith / Guide

A must to do when visiting Cape Town. We were lucky visiting in April that we didn't have to queue for tickets however if it is busy you can buy from the hop on hop off buses which was how we arrived at the cableway. It looks quite

An Awesome View. Arrived at the cableway expecting to stand in a queue for at least an hour or two. Was pleasantly surprised at how organised everything was and how quickly the queue moved. I have a fear of heights and was able to sit on a stool in the middle of the car with no stress. Fantastic views of the beautiful Cape.
Nice transport . Easy WAY TO get to The Table Mountain. A bit expensive butik hiking is NO alternativ Recommended butik check The wheather forcast. Get there by hop on hop off bus.

Beautiful Place that is placed in Cape Town . It's so beautiful and can be seen from all of Cape Town. The view from up is just amazing of the City of Cape Town. The only drawback is the clouds can really spoil your schedule as it closes depending on the wind and Cloud. Must visit place

Overpriced. It's one of those things that you have to tick of your bucket list, but it's over priced. They must have two prices..... one for SA citizens and one for travelers. I know it's costly to maintain the cable cars, but it's a rip off for South Africans to pay that huge fees. The restaurant on top of the mountain is also very expensive. Shame on you to try and rip us off. I've done it only once, but you wouldn't see me again

A Must. Bought tickets at hotel which made access to cableway easy. Staff attentive and experience fantastic. We were lucky clear day exceptional opportunity for great photos. Walked around the mountain with views at every angle. Amazing visit.
If you're in Cape Town you have to do this .... We were in Cape Town some years ago and we went up the cableway, worth the effort. It's one of those things you just have to do if you're there ...

Beautiful view and nice hiking. My husband and I took an uber cab from central Cape Town, which was very cheap, and were dropped off right where the line started for the cable car. Lots of people and we went later in the day after the clouds left the top of the mountain. There were tons of walking trails and you could see forever up there. We waited in line for about an hour to get back down as it was close to closing time. Worth the trip up though.

If you can bear the queues when it's busy you will not be disappointed. You have to do this, it must be the number one CT tourist destination. But we met a local couple who regularly make the cable car trip and love it so much they have lost count of the times they have been to see the views. Lots of fantastic views from the top and once you get away from the cable car station at the top it is reasonably peaceful, even on busy days. Buy your ticket at one of the bus stations, otherwise you will have to queue for a ticket when you get to the lower station and then get in the queue for the cable car itself. The queue may seem quite long but the cable car takes about 60 people each time so goes down fairly quickly.
Cable car to Table Top. A highly recommended outing. The weather needs ti be really , really good... So look up.. If the sky is clear and the sun is bright..hop in to the Red Bus and go for it.

Great and Scenic Ride. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is well worth a ride up to the top of Table Mountain. Offering great views and we did not need to queue for long before we boarded. The day was very clear so the view was spectacular (make sure you check the weather!) and the ride goes quickly. You stand on a turntable in the car so you get a 360 view as you travel up. A must do when you visit Cape Town.

Mesmerising. I took advantage of my gift from the city and took my free trip up the mountain on my birthday (for all SA citizens). And I am so glad I did.My first stop was the restaurant/deli they have up there and got myself a slice of pizza and a beer. They have options for everyone from young to old, and older! There is a selection of hot food and snacks, beer and wine, soft drinks and slushies, coffee and cake. It is a decent quality and not crazily overpriced. Weather was perfect, couldn't actually go up on my birthday but you can go and collect your ticket with your ID and then use the ticket in 7 days, so I waited until I had the right weather. Please remember to wear sun-block if you go up and comfortable shoes as you have to walk far to get to all sides and on rocks.You know I see this mountain every day and marvel at it, but being on top of it just made me fall in love with it even more.

Spectacular Views , worth the queue!. We were told the queue will be more than 1 hour when we went to Stop 5 early in the morning to purchase our tickets, longer for those without. So, if you haven't pre-purchase, go online and purchase your tickets during the queue. The cable car floor rotates 360 degrees, giving you an all round spectacular view. Make sure your camera is fully charged;you will not stop taking photos. Better still, bring extra battery or back-up chargers. Most people will be keen to help take your photos; just make sure you return the favours.This is the easiest way to get to the top of Table Mountain (or down).There are lots to see at the top. Allocate enough time to take it all in; you will realise why the queue is so long!

Great way to get back down the mountain! . My husband and I spent the 1.5 hours climbing up to the top of Table Mountain - get ready for a hike! All up hill (be sure and practice the stair master before you come). It was intense for me, but all totally worth it. Cafe up at the top serves a great ostrich pie, with breathtaking views of the bay and Cape Town below. Definitely recommend taking the cable car back town, it turns as you descend so you can see the mountain and city below from different angles no matter where you're placed in the car inside. Only about R250 one way for 2 people.

Best way to get on top ever. Loved the view, The floor also moves around in the cart so you can get a good view all around. The service was fine, excepted where they direct you which side you should go to aboard the cable cart was unclear. Over all experience was nice.

The best cable I ever used.. The best cable I ever used because the rotating system makes all the people inside to look at the best views so this is very nice and fair for everybody. No need to rush to get a good spot. All spots are good.

Children loved it. No wonder Table Mountain is one of the 7 wonders of the world. It is really beautiful. The children loved going up and down with the cable car. They loved seeing all the wild life. It is a must for every tourist and I will certainly do it again with the kids.

The easy way. The easy way to get up and down Table Mountain.Used it twice to get down after hiking up on two differenz days.A dingle ticket down costs 125 Rand and can be bought at the souvenier shop.
Breathtaking . Our adrenaline Rush! Philippe our guide dropped us off at the front and was the perfect chauffeur for the day!! He gave excellent advice and was very personable.

Great day out ! A must do.. A fabulous day out with the kids. Great view. Great experience. This is a must do in capetown.I recommend not to drive to the lower cableway as the parking is very limited. On busy days , you might end up walking more than a kilometre uphill, depending on where you get parking.Taking a Cab or the bus(i believe it's bus 101) is a far better option.the cab ride is around 80 rand from the city / VA water front.Buy your tickets online to avoid the massive queue. Check the weather in the morning before booking the cable car. The weather is a big factor in capetown. Table mountain is closed during cloudy / rough weather conditions. Take a real camera(not the one on the camera) , wear comfortable shoes and set aside half a day for this awesome experience.
Great day out . Really enjoyed this excursion. We were lucky and never had to queue. It is really beautiful at the top and a fun day out
Amazing Views. While the top of the mountain is the main attraction, the ride to the top is no less thrilling. Its a nice ride with lots of opportunity to take pictures

Epic . Never miss the opportunity to go on the aerial cable way. Magnificent 360 views as the cable car rotates it's way up to the mountain. We have the mountain card which gives us unlimited access - worth every cent - you pay off the cost of the card after 2 rides.

A panoramic view of Cape Town . With my wife we went to this attraction early in the morning, to beat the crowds. Even though we got there at 10 am, we had to stand in line for 20 monutes.
