The car holds up to 70 people and the floor rotates 360 degrees as you go up or down, so you get to look in every direction without moving. The area above that you can visit is amazing: it's virtually flat. We took the 20 minute trail and saw the views in 3 directions. Worth the visit. Get your tickets online in advance.
Table Mountain. Fantastic views over cape town. If possible take a late afternoon car up and see the sunset and then marvel at the views as Cape Town lights up, it's stunning !!!!

A breathtaking view . It was indeed a great fun to enjoy the cableway to go to table mountain at Cape Town. The cableway rotates itself to let everyone have the overview of the township. We happen to see the table mountain with table cloth since it was a sunny day.
transportation heaven. the cable car actually rotate 180 degrees so you have a view from all angles, you are being inside the clouds in a foggy day :)
Great views.. We visited when it was quiet and I am sure we had all the better experience for this. Clear views. Cafe OK. No queues.
Great experience. Highly worth it if don't want to do the 2h trek up. Get round trip because you won't be able to add difference up there if change your mind and want to take the cable back down.

Great attraction to do in Table Bay with family. The tour guide from PG Tops ( highly recommend) took us to this attraction and picked us up when we were done. Parking is lean so you might want to consider getting a ride. The aerial views are great and it was amazing to view the construct of the cableway itself. I exercise, but there was no way I was taking the stairs to the top of the mountain! Highly recommend taking this to see this beautiful world wonder.
I hate heights . Was a great experience over all, I am terrified of heights but the staff were understand and but me in the center . Went up for my birthday , which meant it was free .
cableway. i enjoyed the table mountain cable car it is a rotating car so you have a good 360 degree view all the way to the top i want to do it again

You Can Do It!. Admittedly, I'm afraid of heights, so the prospect of riding the cable car to the top of Table Mountain was a bit daunting for me. I thought I'd be smart and hurry in, grabbing the hand rail on the exterior wall away from the open window (shudder). But no, the floor rotates like a fancy spinning rooftop restaurant! Fooled on the way up, I was smarter on the way down, and sat on the interior bench - needless to say, a much calmer experience for me. If I could do it, it will be a breeze for you!

rotating cabin. It is the most convenient way up to Table Mountain and fortunately we did not have to queue for long. Overheard people saying it took them hours sometimes.The cabin rotates so make sure you stand by the window so you get 360 degree views.

Stunning views. It is a spectacular way to explore the Table Mountain. You can jump the queue if you purchase your ticket in advance: either online or as part of the open top bus tour. The cable car does not go if it is too windy. If you are not planning to walk down the mountain, it is also worth checking the departure time of the last cable car.

Good but short. . Price is fair I guess, cable cars usually are around this cost. The cars rotate so everyone gets a good chance to see the views. It only lasts about 5-7 minutes. I don't know if there is a way to walk up to the mountain so I think it is your only option.

A must visit for Cape Town. To truly appreciate this beautiful city you need to see it from high. Spectacular views of the city and surrounds. Lovely walk around table top mountain and you may be lucky and see a rock dassie. Revolving cable car to the top which allows everyone a good view.
Stunning CT views . Best way to the top!!! 360 degree views, as the gondola rotate's Amazing mountain and city scenery Worth spending at least an hour on top.Cable closes around 6.
Awesome view. Make sure you go their earliest in the morning. there is alot of Human traffic, best times is during low season.

Spectacular 360 degree views. We took the aerial tram up in the late afternoon. The views from the top were outstanding. See the city, the waterfront, the rocky, southern coastline, and much more. Spent about an hour at the top. The lines for the lift were relatively short and the ride was very quick. Well worth the cost if you want spectacular views of the area.

Well managed transport to the top of a fascinating mountain with impressive views.. The cable car is a superbly managed vehicle to reach the top of this beautiful and rugged mountain. Once on the top, you can walk around, impressed both by the local flora and the magnificient views - and have a nice meal at the reastaurant. It is highly recommended to book in advance in order to avoid long lines. Only go on clear days, otherwise time is wasted.

Cable car up and walk down. Has to be done and what a great view.When you get up in the morning have a look to see is the mountain is covered in cloud.If not go for it!If it is very windy at sea level it will be super windy at the top of table mountain and for safety reason the cable car won't be running.Bring some warm clothing if you are going to watch the sunset.

Spectacular. We visited the Cable cars our last day and almost did not go. It was well worth a visit. It's not just a good view it is a spectacular view. I recommend coming late in the afternoon and staying for the sunset. BE SURE AND CHECK BEFORE YOU COME WHAT TIME THE LAST CAR IS GOING UP> we came late a few days before and were turned away. Also it is worth it having your hotel purchase and print your tickets before you go.

Breathtaking view. We had to come back after 18.00h because there were so many people wanting to go up with the cableway. So arrive early if you have the perfect day. The view in the early evening was awesome, the sun was reflected in the ocean. Fewer people around too to check out the view points. The walks are also very interesting, so take the time to explore at the top of the mountain.

feeling like at home in the Swiss Alps. Efficient and quick way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Great rotating cabin giving you spectacular views of the mountain and Cape Town. Be there early on a sunny day to beet the crowds.

What a View and the Hyrax are cute. we went up to the top of Table Mountain in the cable car on our Private Tour. The beach area was covered in clouds/fog. For this reason we were almost alone on the mountain. The views of Lion Head and the area below that was not fogged in were teriffic. While we were there things seemd to break down below and we got some great photos.

360 degree view of the fairest Cape . Choosing the right day and time-early in the morning-to hike up to the top of table mountain, and after a welcoming cup of tea in the restaurant we chose the easy way down in the cable car. The only down side was the rudeness of the lady who served a cup of tea and muffin which I just about caught in time. Apart from that it was an amazing and exhilarating experience

Stunnig Views. This was the first time that we visited Table Mountain and the views was stunning. The cable car ride gives you a 360° view as the floor of the car rotates when going up or coming down. You are literally on top of the world. Something everyone should see at least once in their lifetime.

Stunning!. If you decide not to walk up Table Mountain (which you should definitely consider doing) the Cable Car is a well run and managed process of getting to the top. You are efficiently lead through the queue system to one of the cars, which load and unload at a good rate. Earlier is better to avoid long queues. Also, always check the weather as the top can be colder than the bottom, so warm layers are advised. If you are fit enough, the hike up Plattekloof Gorge to the top is a beautiful trail. Then take the cable car down.Take your time at the top and follow the paths as far as you can to really embrace the beauty of the mountain and to get just about 360 degree views of surrounding Cape Town.
Beautifull! . Nice cable way up the table mountain. Beautifull view and perfect way to see the table mountain when you don't have the time to hike!

Table Mountain cable car.. Wonderful experience, it rotates through 360 degrees during the 5 minute ascent so everyone gets a good view. Prebook tickets on-line or with open-top bus tour to avoid queues. Make sure to take warm clothes ( cold at the top ! )

Table Mountain. We were fortunate to get a clear day for our Table Mountain visit. The mountain had been closed the two previous days.Because this tour cannot occur if the day is windy, schedule it early in your Cape Town visit. Then if you have to reschedule you will have some time remaining to fit it in.Table Mountain is a must-do while in Cape Town. The views are spectacular. Take lots of photos to share with friends.

Amazing views!. We arrived at the aerial cableway just after 1pm. The queues weren't too bad at this time and the sun was shining!! We waited for around 40 minutes but it was worth it. The cable car came down the mountainside and I was a bit apprehensive as I'm not really keen on heights!! We were told once we were inside the car that it revolves slowly so you get to see the fantastic views. I moved into the middle as I felt more comfortable there. The views were amazing and absolutely out of this world. One on top the views take your breath away. There is a shop and toilets at the top. Well worth a visit. Tip: don't leave it too late going down as the queues are very, very long.

Not to be missed . After several days of finding the mountain closed due to high winds we ventured up with a warning of low visibility. The clouds were spectacular as was the scenery and we were so glad we made the trip. Good hiking and lovely scenery made the trip so enjoyable....

Great Way to transport up the Mountain. We took the cable cars up and down the mountain since we wanted to reserve our energy for the rest of our stay in Cape Town. You can pre-pay for tickets online for two entry times: Morning or Afternoon, however you can go down whenever...it's just going up you'll have to go with your set ticket time. A downside is the cable cars' last trip is before sunset, so if you want to watch the sunset on top of Table Mtn, you have to hike down. Follow their Facebook page to know when the cable cars are open due to weather conditions. We got there pretty early in low season, so there wasn't a line to ride the cars.

Tick off the bucket list . Absolute must do. Very weather dependent. As soon as you have a not too windy day do this activity. You could spend a whole day hiking around once on top it's amazing. Saw some very cute Hyrax as well. Cable car operators are hilarious & have great personality. The steepness of the incline is slightly terrifying but awesome. $24AUD to go up & down. Very worth it! Can easily catch the red topless bus up & back which is quite cheap.

Brilliant!!. Waited patiently for 2 days due to high winds and we weren't disappointed. Fantastic experience and a bit of low cloud added to the drama. Great idea to have the revolving floor in the cable cars as everyone got a fair view. Facilities at the top were good and queuing was kept to a minimum to get up or down

Good views going up the mountain!. Had we had more time, I would have happily hiked up, however the revolving floor and positioning actually offer great views on your way up to the top of the mountain. Book in advance and be prepared to queue for a very, very long time... (if it's a sunny day - if it's a cloudy day, don't bother going up!)

Only way is up (and back down). The easy way up and back down Table Mountain. Some people choose to climb up the many trails; good luck to them. This is quicker and gives a rotating view on the way. The floor of the cable car rotates!

Amazing view!!. Gorgeous view and scenery to see Cape Town from the above. Beautiful place to walk while enjoying the breathtaking view. Took lots of beautiful photos with the surroundings. A must to do in Cape Town.

Breathtakingly beautiful. The new cable cars are amazing! What a wonderful breathtaking encounter. The views are spectacular and everyone gets a chance to experience the revolving floor on your journey. Definitely happy with the friendly staff and efficient process overall.
It is ok. The ride is actually very short and not that much of an expierance.. It is all about the view from the top which is incridable...

Tour group. First day of our tour we were taken here. Arrived before opening at 8.30am to see a queue but once gates opened, we were though quicker than I expected. Revolving floor in cable car meant everyone was able to get a good view as we went up and down. Great views and several paths to walk around on at the top.

Probably the Reason You're in Cape Town. And unless you have the time and energy (and desire) to hike up this thing, you'll be taking the cable car. There are lots of discussions regarding long waits to access the cable car, so I can provide a datapoint: I went about 2pm in the afternoon and I had no queue whatsoever.The cable car is quick and efficient, and the floor spins so everyone can take in the views. If you have a fear of heights, then the centre section doesn't spin so sitting here will prevent you being exposed to the open sides.The views from the top of Table Mountain are breathtaking, and it's eerily silent. You can easily spend an hour walking around the summit and taking in views from all sides. And there are dassies! Just ensure your visit coincides with little cloud cover, and buy your ticket online the day before (it's valid a week).
Way down from the top. Nice panoramic way how to see the whole city and surrounding hills. Good option when bad weather, or disabled :)

If u have not done it then do it !. Its a great way to see Cape Town & the Cape Penisular the views are rediculously amazing ! Such a beautiful place & this is the way to see Cape Town from above.Go earley so you dont get the Cape Doctor cloud that pours over the mountain top.Food wise not that great just go for the view & walk around table mountain top, its an adventure i recomend.

Unforgettable experience. We absolutely adored the views from Cable Mountain and you only way up other than walking or climbing is the cable car. We recommend buying your tickets online and getting their early on a fine day. Unfortunately if it's too windy you may miss out.

Wonderful experience. Don't visit Cape Town without taking this ride to the top of Table Mountain. Great views. Go early in the morning on a clear day.Buy tickets in advance online or with hotel concierge so you don't have to wait in line to buy them

You have to do this!!!!. You simply have to find the time to do this if you're in Cape Town! Brilliant experience and the views are just fabulous! Get there early and book tickets on line as the queues get really long really quickly

Easy to use. We used the cable way to reach the top of table mountain, they put quite a number of people in the car, which makes it a little difficult to see. It does rotate which is a plus, the other way to reach the top is walking, so this is a great alternative. Loved it.

Worth the wait. Because the cable car does not run every day (weather dependant), the queues can be long. We waited an hour and a half or more but it was worth it. There is limited sunshade for most of the queuing, tiring in the heat though.

Cable car. Get a window view. While going up face the mountain and on your trip down, have the view of the city . Awesome. it gets a bit crowded and the uninformed will push their way around. Expect it but more importantly enjoy the moment.

Amazing Views. Great way to see the lay out of Capetown, absolutely amazing views. The cable car has a turntable floor which turns 180 degrees while traveling up to the mountain, so you get to see it all before you get to the top. We went at Easter and the only fault was that we had to queue for around 1-1/2 hours but in saying that it was well worth it, I'm not sure if it would have been this busy if it wasn't over Easter. You can pre book your ticket but if it is windy the cable car doesn't run and you don't get a refund. Would definitely recommend, you can hike up the mountain instead if you are reasonable fit and that takes around 2 hours I think. There is souvenir shops on the top along with a cafe and some furry little animals.
Must see. We did this on our second last day, breathtaking views a must do it was very cold up the top but amazing and we loved the dassies !

Stunning Views in a Five-Minute Ride to Table Mountain!. You can hike up the mountain, yes, but please take this breathtaking ride up to the top. It's about 3,600 feet up and the views when you get there are STUNNING.

Best of both worlds Table Mountain. Hiked Platteklip Gorge then took the cable car down. Lots of people were hiking up, taking their picnics to the top, then hiking back down - very healthy way to spend the day.The hike is so very beautiful, then I cabled down.My friend had a free cable car trip as it was her BirthdaySadly her mother who is 89 yrs old had to pay full price as pensioners only get special rates on Fridays, so if there is inclement weather - no special rate?? I feel that pensioners should get discounted rates every day.

360 Views. When the cable car is full, they will rotate the floor so that everyone gets a good view from all angles. This is great except for those that are afraid of heights. If you are afraid of heights, I would suggest you ensure that you are closer to the cable car operator and not the windows.
Dont miss the chance. I was so happy I did this cable airway ride. Fantastic to be up there! I felt like the clouds are within my arms length.

Pick the day and Prebook. arrived on a the Saturday of a long weekend, no chance to get on , unless you qued for 2 hours.The view from the Cable station is also good, we did not wait and people we met who had pre booked still had to que for 1.5 hoursd.

If you don't want to climb or do not have time, this is for you. I tried to squeeze as much as possible into my four days in Cape Town, so this option made a perfect end to a follow on to my half day Cape of Good Hope driving tour.Buy your ticket online.Lines can be Very long (over 1 hour).
Hiking. My first real hike.Absolutely compatible with different fitness levels. Very safe,great food at the top. And awesome views .

Big Cable way. Aerial Cableway in Capetown is a nice experience. The Cableway is big and can accommodate many people at a time. It's a quick and best way to reach the top. One can also hike to the mountain but its time consuming so the aerial Cableway is the best option plus you get stunning views from the Cableway too and it's open at one side which lets the air comes in and it's revolving all the time so everyone experiences the cold wind of the Cape.

Table Mtn cable. Nice overview of Cape Town. Even if u r a hiker, the weather gets so hot so fast, we were glad to use the cable car. The tour is worth it. Be sure & get pics of the views & also the friendly Dassies.

Spectacular ride, slightly scary trip. They don't tell you that the gondola rotates as you go up so that everyone gets to see the spectacular views! There's nothing to hang onto, but what views! I took some pictures from the gondola and all of the massive machinery used to bring about 30+ people to the top of Table Mountain. Amazing! Then, when we arrived, the views from the top were fantastic! You could see the rocky coast and some beautiful beaches from all sides. There were trails down to the bottom, and I met 4 young local people who had climbed up the mountain. Many others were climbing various paths to the top. There are several routes of varying difficulty for people who range from mildy athletic to advanced mountain climbers with pitons and ropes. Weather varies on this mountain: some days, it is too windy or rainy for the gondola to run. Fantastic trip. My day, Sunday, May 1 was ideal! Perfect weather, no mist or clouds on the Mountain! Definitely a worthwhile trip!

Long waiting queues!!. After 3 days of rain and wind, the closed cable car station finally opened on a saturday and was so packed that there was a queue of 2 hrs to get to the cable car! Wish we didnt have to wait for so long...

Table Mountain. You need to experience this when coming to Cape Town. It's beautiful from every side of the Mountain and you can spend the whole day there. You need to pay for the Cable Car but if you want to walk up or down the mountain on One of The Trails it's Free. Stunning and Stunning ....

Hike to mountain, back with cable. So glad I climbed table mountain instead of joining all those tourists on there way up....Climbing is tough yet beautiful experience! Great view.However when you enter the top you will be part of this commercial circus around it. Can not walk straight to cable, all tourists are forced to pass the tourist shops. Disgusting! Not just a cable service but a real tourist trap

Great Show!. The Table Mountsin Aerial Cableway is marvellous. The staff do a great job of managing the crowds waiting to get up to Table Mountain. When one gets into the car, it is explained that the floor will rotate 360°. Everyone gets the full view of this most beautiful scenery. Well worth the cost.
Efficient and safe. From a distance the cable cars made me feel a bit edgy and reluctant, but it was a very smooth and scenic ride! lines are well organized and the whole experience is pleasant
Turning around. Fun, we did not know before that the cabin turns around. Every guest has a spectacular view due to this turning. We felt save, the guide in the cabin was funny as well.

World class. Well kept facility, the system works efficient and the ride is unforgettable. There is a cute but expensive curio shop on the summit and lots of great viewing points. Very chilly up there so cover up!

Wimp's way to the top!. Make sure you book your times in advance as it get crowded in the summer months. Apparently it's not a bad walk to the top but I chose to ride up to get as much time at the top as possible!

Excellent views. Great views, restaurant on the mountain. Only bad thing was the hiking, the info said 45min, easy they said... Oh no it wasn't, 2hours later, sweating and difficulty of the paths would be more for the advanced hikers, rather take the dassie route
Visit to Table Mountain. Took my mom with me and both are a little afraid of heights but it was an awesome trip with the Cable Car and strolling around the top was so amazing.

Clear day great view. If you want to make the most of a trip up Table mountain the busiest time is in the morning when queues can be up to hour wait the afternoon is a quieter time also if you go to table mountain by the red tour bus get your ticket on-board as this could save you a wait of 1 up to hour to purchase tickets at the ticket office the views from the cable car are fantastic and there was only a short wait for the trip back down the mountain.

A Nice Ride with Stunning Views Of The CIty. We rode down after spending several hours climbing Table Mountain. It was a grueling hike so the cable car for the return trip was most welcome. The cars are quite large and they revolve to ensure everyone gets a full view. It's great for anyone who doesn't want to hike up as an easy way to access the mountaintop. One of the Highlights of a trip to Cape Town.

An Absolute Must Do in Cape Town. This was a highlight of our visit to Cape Town!The ride up and the views from the top of the mountain are beyond spectacular. In addition to exploring on our own, we took a short free walking tour that provides some history and facts about the mountain which was recently voted one of seven top natural wonders in the world. You'll see why!We were fortunate as there was no wind and it was a beautiful clear and very warm day where you could see forever. We considered hiking up and taking the cableway down but were very happy to have ridden both ways. The trail is very steep and consists of countless tall stairs so not ideal for a hot day!We stood in line for the cableway for about 30 minutes but heard the wait can be much longer at times so you might consider buying your tickets online prior to your visit. The Red Hop On and Off bus stops at Table Mountain and is a good way to get there from town. This is a fantastic outing for everyone!

We Almost Did Not Do This -- So HAPPY We Did!!!!. The cable car holds a maximum of 65 people & the floor revolves slowly while you are going up. Views are amazing on the way up (but look fast as the ride is short) & from the top. Once you get out of the cable car there's a large area on the top of Table Mountain that you can safely explore. Also there's restrooms, a shop & a restaurant with picnic tables outdoors. We did not purchase tickets before going & found a 45 minute wait for tickets. Fortunately, where you wait in line instructions are posted on how to purchase tickets online with your phone & a charge card which cuts your wait time to nothing!

Holiday . Well what can I say the views are awesome and out of this world ! You definitely get great views going up table mountain !! We had gone when it was extremely busy and it was well organised everyone was kept in order and no pushing in was tolerated !! Fab !! A bucket list must do !!

Spinning top. The cable car rotates slowly as it climbs to the top of Table Mountain, with breathtaking views below. Be sure to arrive early morning and avoid the queues in summer which can be hours. You can also descend in the same car after walking around the mountain.A must do in Cape Town if only to get your bearings and see the oceans and city.

eh just a rock. Wasn't blown away, it's something to do while here and can be very crowded. Once is enough, some good photos to be made but the waiting and crowds makes it not worth it. Didn't see any animals. If you go go early with a pre purchased ticket.

MUST DO HIGHLIGHT OF CAPE. Unbelievable views from all different aspects on top of Table Mountain. Cable car is a very smooth ride and takes around 4 minutes. A must do if visiting Cape Town. You will be so gkad you did it.

Amazing views. Excellent way to travel to the top of Table Mountain. Bought tickets online in advance. While there was a queue when we arrived around 10am, it moved quickly and we were on our way within 10 mins. It takes only a few mins to get to the top, with the cable car gently rotating to ensure everyone gets to see the great views. Cable car itself is very stable and comfortable.

Disappointed with lack of facilities. Apparently in winter the restaurant at the top of table mountain only opens at 9.30 and the cafe cannot cope with all public holiday traffic - what a disappointment !!!

A must.. We came to Cape Town 2 years ago for five days at the start of a two week journey along the garden route. We set aside one day to do the cable car up Table Mountain only it was so cloudy on the top we wouldn't have been able to see anything and missed our opportunity. This trip we made sure we got up there and what a view.....it's amazing and you can't not go there even if your frightened of heights! You won't regret it.
Great. If you can get to stand by the window the trip is great and the views amazing as it revoles, but they cram you in a bit and can be uncomfortable
great ride!. it's an interesting ride up the mountain. I think that it beat walking on a very cloudy day. The Cable car goes very quickly

Spectacular . Had a great visit and a nice long walk - the views are spectacular!! And it was great to see the natural beauty. Would be good to be able to buy water at more points on the routes when it's so hot. Was a great day

Go when you have the opportunity. I had been to Cape Town on three previous occasions, and due to work or other commitments, hadn't made it to the Top of Table Mountain. On the day of arrival the Cable Car was operating but the sun was out & Camps Bay was calling. On the next two days, every time we looked up, the mountain was covered in Cloud. Not again i was thinking.. Day 4 was a glorious day and we had booked to do the Peninsula Tour. Once we returned to our accommodation it was pasted 17.00 and again we turned down the opportunity. Day 5. yet more cloud & wind. Day 6 came and we woke to views of the cloud over the Mountain again. We decided to have Breakfast out and started to think, we had two opportunity's and we turned it down. Whilst eating Breakfast, the sun began to come out, within 5 minutes, the cloud had lifted & we could see the Mountain, fully cleared and the cable car was operating. Within Ten Minutes, and a Short Taxi ride we were in the queue. We had been told by murmurous people, that we could buy Tickets from Pick N Pay in advance so you could split the first queue. Did we, nope. Thankfully the queue was short, only six people in front of us just after 0930.. and no queue for the Cable car. We waited five minutes & we were on our way up.. The views from the Top of the Mountain are Incredible. We could see for miles.. after the walk around which took 35 - 40 mins we returned to the cable car for the return journey. When we returned to the bottom of the Cable Car the Queues were 400 -500 long. Luck was with us. You can be lucky like ourselves or you could be behind two or three tour buses, but the cable car can take 50 -60 people at a time so the queue is always moving.. My advise, if you see the Cable Car operating. Go straight away. The sky might be clear but the Wind can easily stop it operating.

Busy but a must. It will always be busy so you need to build in a wait time to ascend and descend in your travel plans. Booking on line in advance helps but means you have to ascend irrespective what weather is and can often be shrowded in mist. The staff organise you very well and, whilst waiting to board, there is shade canopies.
Easy way up. Smooth process , bought tickets on the day on site. Queue grew after we purchased, so we were lucky.Smooth trip up and down with amazing views. Good value for money

Perfect way to experience table mountain with three small children.. We purchased tickets online ahead of time and it was a fairly quick wait to ride to the top. The cable cars rotate 360 degrees so everyone can see the views.

My lord the queues . I suppose this is more of a review of the service/ management rather than TM itself. The mountain is gorgeous. Stunning. My only criticism is the queues are just a nightmare. It's not that they're overly long, it's just there's no concept of time!! Still worth it. Just fantastic.

Unmissable !. You can't visit CT without going up the Mountain!But the Cable car is not for the faint hearted- revolving through 360^ and quite steep- it's exhilarating but offers exceptional views across CT and Camps Bay.Amazing!

Mountain within the Clouds. One of the key attractions of Cape Town. Its well worth a visit, the cable car ride is nothing great but atop this plateau you are right inside the clouds, a great feeling. Also good views from the top

Spectacular Views. Upon our arrival in Cape Town we decided to make our way to the cableway, we arrived just in time to make the last trip up.The queues were still massive however the staff managed to move people safely and fairly in order to get them to the top.The views are spectacular and the Sunset is not to be missed, you should however be prepared for the long wait to get back down if you arrive at the end of the day.Whatever you do, remember your jackets as it gets freezing especially if you're there after dark.We travelled with 3 children and we took advantage of the 'Kidz Season' ticket offer which enabled two children to travel for free with one paying adult which made a real difference to pricing.

What a view!. The cableway was basically the only way up to Table Mountain and a cool way to go up, especially since it has a rotating floor so every person can see everything on the way. It was fun, and operates frequently.
Aerial Cableway . Well organized and well run - try to book online or on webticket which makes it much faster and easier - good value for money and beautiful views of the Mother City
superb views. it offers great view to capture although it is very difficult to take pictures as it is very crowded. Do this when the weather is clear.

Not to miss. You cannot visit Cape Town without taking a trip up Table Mountain. Be sure to choose a clear day for the best views. Unfortunately, I only had time for a quick trip. I took one of the last rides up, which gave me an hour to do the easy walk around the top. I would have loved to have more time to do more extensive hiking (or even hike up and down the mountain). Fortunately, we saw the spectacular sunset just prior to the last trip down the mountain. The crowds were minimal at this time. It was also cool, so pack a jacket.

Hiked up/cableway down. The cableway was awesome. We hiked up table mountain and had intended to hike down. We were very relieved that the cableway was an option down. The wait to get on the cable way was only about 15 minutes.

Really impressed. Really enjoyed the benefit of the 360 degree revolving floor of the cable car to see all the views as you ascend the mountain. The staff were in good spirits and the queues moved swiftly-would advise buying a ticket online to avoid having to queue for the ticket and then again for the cable car.

Cableway a must for any visit to Cape Town. No trip to Cape Town is compete without a Cablecar trip to the top of Table Mountain - enjoy the views from the rotating car on the way up and down, and exploring the top of the mountain - the flowers, dassies and sometimes even snow! Take a warm top - it can be icy up there no matter how sunny in the city below

Great way to see Cape Town. We hiked up Table Mountain using the Plattenklip trail (very steep but a straight shot to the top of the mountain, about a 2.5hr trek). The trail is pretty clearly marked although it got a bit confusing once. Keep in mind that I am a novice hiker. Once we got to the top, it was well worth it. We were greeted with an amazing view and a solid sense of accomplishment. Refreshments and a gift shop awaited us and we took our time before heading down via the cableway. The cableway is about a 3 minute ride with a rotating outer shell that allows a 360 degree view of the mountain and of Cape Town. It is also very reasonably priced. Highly recommended!
Mesmerizing View. Excellent View from the top, there are plenty of special plants and flowers available from various parts of the world. You can spend some hours here, to be visited once.

Worth the wait. Its been many years since I visited Table Mountain. In fact I used the old cable car.I hve also walked.There will always be queues for this wonderful sight,no matter what time of day you go.Our wait was 20 mins.The new cable car was great.The view is just breathtaking on all sides.The restaurant food was very good,with an offer of game. With all the visitors the restaurant is just not big enough.AdultsR240,Kids to 17,R115,& Pensioners( SA only) grid R100.Expensive, but a must.New Wi Fi lounge almost finished.

Belly tickling experience. Avoid the long lines by buying your tickets online before your planned visit. Don't worry if that chosen day the cable car is not working- you have a week to use your ticket. The long lines to get in can be a bit boring but the wait is worth it. Excellent views once up and going - and reallly worth it. At the top be prepared to wait again so if you have kids, have something to drink and eat with you to make it easier. The lines move quite nicely so it is managable. Enjoyed our day and especially the walking in the top of the mountain - unbelievable place!
Amazing trip. Cable car is good value. Fantastic views from the top. A MUST visit while in Cape Town for everyone!

Great outing hosting international guests. I had the pleasure of hosting international guests and decided to take them up the mountain! We were lucky to have superb weather. Goodies on the mountain overpriced for local South Africans but the experience up and down the car is worth every cent. Clean carts, all equipment well maintained and staff fantastic!

Expensive But Impressive. My family (boy 4 years old and girl 6) found ourselves with the opportunity to be tourists in our own country, which we love. On the spur of the moment we decided to take the cable car up Table Mountain. After finding parking (not easy) we joined the que to buy tickets. Suggestion - buy your tickets online to avoid standing in line. The que was long but moved relatively quickly. The ticket seller was very friendly and polite. The cable car is impressive and my kids loved the trip up. It was windy at the top and in spite of the weather being warm down below it was far colder on top. Hint - always bring a jacket! We had a walk around the top. Views utterly stunning! We had lunch at the cafe which was busy but efficiently run. Our food was a little cold by the time we got to our table but not inedible. We popped into the curio shop - waaaaay too expensive for the average South African but considering we didn't hear a South African accent for the entire time we were up there perhaps understandable. The curio shop was the original retaurant that holds a special place in my heart as it was designed by my grandfather. We nearly froze whilst standing in line to go down but we made it. The Table Mountain experience is something all South Africans can be proud of. One issue - the whole visit cost us over R1000! That is very expensive for a South African family and I would like to suggest that they offer discounts for SA citizens like the Kruger National Park does.

Easy ride. Well organized ticketing although could be quicker with more booths open. Quick way to get up on top of Table Mountain. Love the feature that the inner platform of the cable car rotates to enable everyone to have 360º view during the ascend and descend.
Table Mountain. Very nice- very efficient moving folks up and down the mountain. Great views from the cableway. Mid morning and mid afternoon are less crowded.
Views from the top. I have both hiked and use the cable car to go up. I have been fortunate to go when the weather was good in both occasions so I had really splendid views.

No Regrets-So happy we took Cable Car to the Top!. Our hotel booked our tickets in advance, which I recommend. The great part is that if you book in advance they do not hold you to a specific time-more like a range (e.g. from 13:30-17:00), so you can plan your day and know you have a few hour window available to you to take the cable car. The time will be listed on the ticket. Cable Car ride was a smooth ride up and of course, the most spectacular views of Cape Town at the top! Cable Car closes shortly after Sunset.
Great to have there. Certainly makes Table Mountain more accessible if for any reason you are unable to climb it - and well worth the trip to the top
AMAZING!. The staff operating @ Table Mountain are amazing. They are super friendly and have loads of patience. Book tickets in advance and go EARLY...one you have checked the weather! :-)

Amazing cable car ride!. The cable car is a great experience for young or old. We did not experience either lines or a wait. When you get to the top it is awesome!!! This is truly one of the spits in Capetown not to be missed. The stunning views at the top are just fabulous. Five stars in my opinion.

Family day out. My daughter, son in law , grandchild , aunt you & myself went up on the cableway .Very busy but queues moved fast. Staff friendly & organized getting us into the cable carIt was a beautiful day , only a breeze , & the view was awesome from the cable car.The Windows rotate giving everyone a chance of seeing out the open window..The views from the top of the mountain are almost 360 degrees. It was gorgeous.We didn't eat at the restaurant, which is self service & very organized, large selection, but had some liquid refreshments. Bought some small souvenirs, a little pricey.
Sunset is beautiful....... We got to the top one hour before closing for Sunset and it was a beautiful and clear afternoon with very little wind. Stunning....timing is everything

Stunning Aerial Views. The cable ride to Table Mountain is just this side short of amazing. There's about a 10-minute wait to get in the cable car but the ride is worth it. It rotates 360-degrees so you can enjoy all the views- city, sea, cliffs...

Prebuy tickets if possible . We made the error in not prebuying our tickets and were stuck waiting in the queue for 20 minutes. However, once bought we enjoyed the experience. Table Mountain is a beautiful natural wonder and a must visit for all travellers. Return adult ticket was R240.

Get there early. On a clear day there is not a better place to stand and look down the Peninsular towards Cape Point. Stunning view Never fails to please me after 20 years. Some how I preferred the old cable car rather than the rotating modern one!

Stunning views. We were so lucky that the cable was working as it had not been for the days prior due to the weather. So glad we got our ticket through the bus company as queues. You queue to get on the car and a great idea is the car floor moves so just stand by a window.
Awesome . A must do. Buy your tickets online or from your bus driver of possible. Line was an hour long but we skipped all of it with online purchase at 1 pm on way out at 3 no line.

Wow. Long wait to the cable car but definitely worth it. Ride was glorious but the view at the top was even better. Take the time to walk around and check out the views of the Atlantic and Indian Ocean alone with various small creatures. Nice place to eat The Tabletop Mountain Restaurant. Best view was from the internet center.

Amazing views of Cape Town on the way up and down. The best way to catch the cableway is to pay for it on line. That way you can avoid the long lines at the ticket counter and just get in line for the cableway. It is fast and as you start up the mountain, the bottom of the car starts to rotate around! That way, as you are standing in one spot you see 360 degree views. One draw back of this system is if you want to take a video of the car going up or down, you have to keep walking to keep in place. With the car full, this is a daunting task. But the views are fantastic.

The best experience in Cape Town!. I'm extremely afraid of heights but I just had to see what all the fuss was about. So my girlfriend and I went to experience it and even though I was scared as can be once I reached the top, the views were totally worth it!Just amazing!Don't leave Cape Town without visiting this Wonder of the World.

Dramatic Vistas / Unforgettable Sunsets. The view from the cableway is one of the best city / ocean spectacles in the world! The Atlantic ocean with mountain backdrop, city lights, and pink sky hues will pull you back again and again. The only negative is planning for weekend and holiday crowds. Even with a wait it's not to be missed!

Up above the clouds. Get up early so that you are in the queue by 9:00 am. We unfortunately had to stand in a long queue for 1 hour 45 minutes! The view from the top is spectacular and was well worth the wait! Wear walking shoes and pack a jersey or jacket as the temperature at the top is much cooler than at the bottom. Pack your camera as it is definitely worth it! We saw rolling cloud banks covering the sea and stunning scenery of mountains and city below. There are dassies (rock rabbits/hyrax) and birds to photograph as well as indigenous Fynbos. The restaurant with a buffet lunch was clean and the staff offered friendly service.Just a pity the food was not very warm! Coffee was hot and delicious though, so that made up for it!
Easiest way to the top. Smooth riding....clean . You have 360 degree views. Free ride on your birthday ! Peak season = long queues (who cares ?) so worth it.

A few hours on top felt like a week away from home. I decided to celebrate my birthday on top of the mountain! The bonus - birthday people travel for free!! The queue to get a ticket was 1 and a half hour long as was the queue coming down, so a tip; buy your ticket on-line beforehand. But the queue was part of the experience - you know great time to eavesdrop on foreigner conversations (it helps if you know the German language for on this particular day there were mostly foreigners. Travel in comfortable shoes with a good grip for uneven slippery terrain, should you want to explore some more while on top. The views toward Camps bay, Robben Island, over the central city, towards the Hottentots Holland mountains, over False bay and even right to Cape Point was simply awesome on this clear day.Be sure to take a warm jacket and if you want to save on expensive restaurant prices, do take a picnic lunch along.

Must do when in Cape Town!. Very easy and quick way to get on top of table mountain. You can take it one way and walk back down, or take a walk on top of the mountain and take the cable car back. There is a gift shop on top of the mountain, as well as a lovely restaurant with a great view from the terrace.

A must do for you Cape Town visit. This is a must do when you are in Cape Town. Suggest doing this as part of the open top red bus tour, as you will have benefit of some background information as well.
A must!. For every visitor of Capetown, this is a must! Beautiful panoramic view during trip to the top and magnificent overview over Capetown.

Cable Mountain Aerial Cableway. We were very impressed with the whole Table Mountain experience. We had last gone up the cable way over 30 years ago, so we noticed huge changes. Even though the queue was long, it was well managed (shade & info people), and we rode the cable car after a one hour wait. The view was breathtaking, and everything so clean and well managed on top of the mountain. There was even Eco information on the inside of the toilet doors !
Terrific!. This cableway goes from a height of some 200 meters to 1067 metres is about 10 minutes! And more: the car rotates slowly in order you can see the landscape all around!

Spectacular!. World famous mountain - what a way to see Cape Town. Revolving cable car - the most spectacular views in the world! Tip. Do the open top red bus tour - buy your tickets for the cable car when you get on eg at the Waterfront, and you will not have to stand in the queue! Prepare to spend at least 3 hours on top if you want to go on a short walk - well worth it. Take a light jacket as it is a tad breezy.
Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Great way to ride to the top of table mountain and the cable spins around giving everybody a panoramic view on the way up.
Breath taking!!!. Must see if you are visiting Cape Town! The view is breath taking, you can go up on a cable car or hike the mountain if you are brave enough.

"Breathtaking views, makes you realize how wonderful nature and the world is". If you are young, fit and in a group, hiking up and down the Table Mountain would be a great experience and one to remember for life. This will be a one day trip which has to start early in the morning on a clear sky day and no strong winds. Otherwise you have the Aerial Cableway which is quick, safe and has a spectacular 360 degree view. On the top you could not ask for a better view and can spend hours enjoying nature and its beauty. Free to public if you hike up and down or pay for the cableway.

An easy way up and down - if you can afford it!. The views are wonderful from start to finish (if you are not a vertigo sufferer). If you have an extensive family, then I hope you have a fat wallet, because the return trip is NOT cheap! Avoid this attraction on public or school holidays as the queue for the cable cars borders on being ridiculous and time spent waiting here is time wasted, while the magnificent Cape Town below is begging to be explored and enjoyed, tasted and discovered!

Nature s Wonder. "Table Mountain Aerial Cable way" , unimaginable views , never ever thought that the views from the Cable can be so beautiful .One Glance and you can view the hills with wild flowers.

Aerial Cableway. This is a must for any person visiting Cape Town. Very efficient and timely. Although the queues are at times quite long, it still remains worth it. Friendly and efficient cable car operators.

QQQQQQQ. BOOK your tickets online!!! we went up Table Mountain on the first clear day we had, so did everyone else ! even with Pre Paid tickets we queued for 90 minutes to get into the cable car, the ride up was good and interesting as the floor revolved slowly so you could get a full 360' view of the mountain and surrounding area. Upon reaching the top, my husband went to re join the queue for the cable car ride down the mountain as it was already at the 90 minute queue time. (he had been here before) myself and the children walked around the paths where you could see all the way down to Cape Point and just as far in all directions, beautiful. There is a cafe at the top, but again we had to queue to get in and buy snacks, before rejoining my husband in the queue.TIP : get there EARLY, before it opens even!

Tick one of the 7 wonders off your bucketlist. Table Mountain is a must visit for any tourist in Cape Town - I made a joke while I was in Cape Town that Capetownians climb Lions Head because Tourist are on Table Mountain and boy is that the truth! While the Cableway is only available weather permitting it offers amazing views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas as it ascends and descends - If you are an avid climber you can choose to climb up or down Table mountain or even use the cable car on one of the ways. The Mountain itself is beautiful with animals, reptiles and plenty of fauna and flora to keep you occupied - aside from the view which is most important. The shop at the top has options for anyone needing a curio, and the restaurant has options for all pockets, from wine to beers, pizza, biscuits and more! This should definitely be a stop on your Cape Town Bucket-list!!
Relaxed trip up the mountain. Great way to see the city from above. The trip and process is well laid out & efficient. Suggest booking tickets online to save on the queues.

Excellent. We hiked to the top of table mountain. We were quite tired and really needed a smooth experience of buying our tickets and getting onto the cable car. This is exactly what we got. We received our tickets and smoothly got onto the cable car with no major delays. The views are excellent and because the floor rotates, you get a 360" view. This is a must do in Cape Town
A great ride. A very nice ride, but sometimes the queuing can be very long, parking is very bad.Staff is friendly and gracious and seem to enjoy taking the ride with you.

Excellent View. Fantastic place if you wanting to see how far Cape Town really stretches. Many people go up to watch the sunset which is quite spectacular. Excellent restaurant as well as excellent wheelchair facilities Has lots of hands rails down the stairs for those need assistant other walking down the wheelchairs ramps are easy. You a 300 degree view of Cape Town. Would recommend it as a "must see" to visitors as well as Capetonians Would advise people to book on the internet than to have to stand in the queue .

Amazing Table Mountain Cape Town. A must do to see the peninsula, what a sight! Beautiful! Leave early, like 8am on a good day ito weather, relax in the restaurant at the top after exploring the top of the Table Mt. This could be a 3hr adventure, half day or full day, choose to hike back down, so many choices, have fun!

Long weekend getaway . Enjoyed it, will suggest to make sure of the weather and timing to avoid long queues. Try midmorning rather than early mornings. Also a great restaurant on top of mountain to enjou lunch with a view.

Best way to see the Cape Town from above. The views are endless and gorgeous,but be sure to buy your tickets online if you can to get a head start. Go early if you can so that you can get up there before the lines get to long.Early is also good because Cape Town is windy and the afternoons are generally worse.For us an hour up there was enough, no need to plan you full day around this activity be there by 8:00 am and you can be out of there by 10:30 and have a full day to do other activities.
Table Mountain. The clouds move in so fast, we just did the cable car up & down & glad we did. What a beautiful view, the floor keeps rotating so you don't have a bad view!

Amazing Views, not as flat as i thought :). Truly amazing views on a clear day, the cable cart ride was better than expected i didn't think it would rotate on the way up and down which was a pleasant surprise. take some water with you.
Great use for the way down!. We hiked up using "Hike Table Mountain" group but used the "Table Mountain Aerial Cableway " to come down. The cable cars rotate around as it descends. Great views!

A Great Way to get up Table Mountain during pregnancy. If you want to get to the top of table mountain but cant hike due to pregnancy, this is the perfect solution. Make sure you go on a clear day (when mountain is also clear) otherwise you will only see mist everywhere. There are card facilities at the ticket office and at the resturaunt on the top. The whole experience is done smoothly, you queue to go up and get in the cqble car with about 30 other people, it rotates so dont worry about where you stand, youbget off and when youbare done, you follow the same process going down.

Must do in Cape town. While visiting capetown this was the first thing we ticked off the list..the service is only available weather permitting but if you do get an opportunity this shouldn't be missed!! Book online for speedy entry into the place and to avoid long queues

Gorgeous views over a stunning city. The cable car itself is good fun and has excellent views no matter where you stand as it's revolving. We were lucky enough not to have to queue because we were there on a Tuesday afternoon, but the queues can be crazy so it's worth booking in advance.

Ok then 😄. I have a love hate relationship with this cable car. I can appreciate the views and different angles (for lack of a better description) as the floor rotates. However because im a little uncomfortable *not fully fearful) i could jot hold on as it rotates. I can see how that could be a problem. Other than that, very smooth ride despite the wind. Awesome views going up and down. Cable car has capacity of 60 people so when u enter go immediately to a window.....my advice is directly opposite the open one so that by the time it rotates u will hopefully get a nice photo op.

Wow! Proudly South African. Haven't been up the mountain since my student days and returning with my son was exhilarating. The revolving cable cars are fast, stable and provide an ever changing view on the way up and down. The services at the top are clean and efficient. The mountain itself is still one of the most incredible feats of nature with the most jaw-dropping views. Please take your time and every sight and sound at the top, appreciate the vastness of time. She is older than the Andes, the Alps, the Rockies and six times older than the Himalayas. She supports life for thousands of plant and animal species - some of which cannot be found anywhere else in the world or even South Africa. Buy your tickets on line ahead of time to avoid queues. Check whether the cableway is open on the day of intended visit on the official website tablemountain.net (they will give temperature, visibility stats and wind speed). If cableway is closed, your tickets will still be valid for the next 7 days and if you can't visit at another time your tickets can be refunded. Take lots of photos but please be respectful of our treasure and take all your litter and cigarette ends with you.

Go very early on a clear day!. Great way to see capetown. Very efficient, but get there at 8:30 am before the tour buses arrive. Order tickets online. Not $$. Hop on bus will take you there. Do NOT go on a cloudy day. Just look up at the mtn to see if the clouds are around. It'll be cold, grab a jkt. Can get a coffee or food at the top. So very well done, beautiful walkways and great areas to take pics. A must do !!!!!!

Another perspective... Regardless whether you like go hiking of nor, the cableway offers you another perpective of Table Montain. As it goes up, an internal platform starts to turn around giving to you a 360º view of the environment. You can also see the slope of the montain like a bird.

Impressive and efficient. A NOT-TO-MISS ATTRACTION! Friendly and funny staff. A bit crowdy but it goes quite quickly. Not too expensive, especially if you take the ticket from the red buses tourists stations (bus tour + table mountain cableway), which will save you from queuing.

Job well done. It took about one hour from que'ing up until we were at the top of the mountain. The people are nice that work there. The wait coming down was only 10 minutes until we boarded up to return.

Best way to the summit. We were fortunate to have had good weather. It's best to check the day before. Also a good idea to prebook your tickets (ask the red bus tour company or some supermarkets do that as well - pick and play if memory serves me right.)
Eaterie and gift shop at the base and summit.
Spectacular. A must place to visit as the view was spectacular and we had a beautiful clear day. Advisable to take a jacket as very windy and colder even on a sunny day,

Glorious views from up above the mountain . Best tourist thing to do in Cape Rown. Views are to die for! Cable car is slow giving one ample opportunity to snap some pictures of the great views. The nice gesture, which some people do not know, is that You can go up for free on your birthday!
So exciting and extraordinarily beautiful.. An amazing trip up in the cable car. Very well organised and lovely cafe ang gift shop at the top. The views are incredible.

Still amazing. Done this many times and going up and down Table mountain is still an awe inspiring experience. The best views day and night. A few tips its really busy so don't drive, no parking take the bus or taxi. Pay for tickets online beforehand or you wait in the ticket queue for an hour before you wait in the cable car queue.Better to go late afternoon as you get to see the amazing city lights below the evening. There is a queue at the top too so come prepared-something warm, snack etc or a bottle of wine and some glasses.Care for the mountain and take your rubbish with you.

Go even if it's cloudy. This is a very clean, green and safe business. Sure it's better when there are few clouds but the cable car is amazing and you will likely get short peeks to the city below even when it's cloudy. Highly recommended. Get there 30 minutes before opening to avoid most of the crowds. Wear two or three layers of clothes.

Great experience, little disorganised queuing process. I would highly recommend the Cableway as a great way to explore table mountain, unless you want to make the hike. Their website provides all the information you need to establish if you should make the journey to the lower station (e.g. Weather, visibility and operating hours) One thing to improve is the queue once inside the lower cable station as its a little chaotic coming out of the lifts. Ensure to book your tickets online in advance to avoid queuing for ticket sales.

Corousel Cableway!. A fast safe and easy way to feel on top of the world when you take the cableway to the top of cable mountain. The cable car rotates slowly as it goes up and comes down the mountain ensuring that one gets every aspect of the spectacular views that are on offer .Each ride takes five minutes and it is indeed engineering marvel for the technically inclined. A fun way to reach to the top of cable mountains, one can also purchase a one way ticket if they fancy trekking up or going down the mountain. But a must do experience for all ages. Highly recommend this to anyone.

Magical. Clearly one of the icons that just has to be partaken of when visiting this beautiful city. There is little point in buying tkts in advance just get here early ie 9-10am and get in the queue you'll get there sooner or later.
Best Experience . This is a MUST DO when visiting Cape Town, South Africa. It will be by far one of the best experience of your life. All I can say is that God is Amazing

Great Tram!. I'm a serious skier, and a fan of trams. This one is an awesome one! Very steep and serious, with amazing views. And it rotates! There's some great easy hiking at the top of this flat mountain, go explore a bit and get away from the crowds while enjoying the views. If I had more time, I would have hiked up then taken the tram down, but we had only a limited number of days in Cape Town...next time!

Sunset on Table Mountain. Table mountain aerial Cableway has a sunset special every year from about early December to the end of February, excluding high season.As a local, making use of this, going up the mountain after 18h00 with a packed picnic and watching the sun set over the Atlantic while the clouds may roll in from the south and the lights starting to go on in the city below is something which needs to be experienced by everyone, local and visiting alike.Always a pleasure experiencing our mountain and our city....

Unparallelled. The view from the top is the most breathtaking, majestic and humbling view on Earth! It is absolutely stunning! It is no wonder that Table Mountain is a New World Wonder.Take a walk to McLear's Beacon - the highest point on the mountain that historically was also involved with astronomical observations.The restaurant serves basic but tasty food, though it is slightly pricey.The cable cars are safe and state of the art! Panoramic windows and a rotating floor mean you don't miss a single iota of the view!
Best view. Having done this a few times it was overcast that day. Instead took a walk and sat down on a bench enjoying the best view in the world. This is a Must for any tourist.

flying high. very modern and fast, with nice personel. it is the only way to reach table mountain if you don't want to hike. expect long waiting times, so go as soon as you can. buy tickets in advance!

Fun and amazing views. Taking the calbe car up table mountain is clearly the easy way up. It's a lot of fun though. I didn't realize the cabin is rotating so no matter where you stand you will get 360* views of Cape Town and the magnificent mountain. Wait to go down until sunset to see the city lights.
Don't Miss it!. Wonderful! Impressive! Have a break for a coffee or a drink after looking everywhere, its so marvelous and calm!
The easy way to the top. If you are very energetic, you can hike up to the top of the mountain in a few hours. But if you want the quick and easy way, then just take the cable car.

The only way to travel to the Table Top. Choose a time carefully and book a ticket in advance. Otherwise you may have to wait for an unacceptably long time in a queue. The service is efficient once you reach the station.

Great Experience and Well-Run. Having visited Cape Town many times, we always put off going up the cable car for various reasons. We should never have waited this long. It's a streamlined process, but I recommend buying your tickets for the cable car from the City Sightseeing Bus tour office - this means one less queue to worry about and I also recommend you use the City Sightseeing Bus Tour to get off at the Cable Car. That way you don't have to park a day's walk away with your own vehicle.The service is efficient and friendly and the views and walks at the top are breathtaking.Go.

Worth the fear. OK, I suffer from vertigo and am a wimp when it comes to cable cars but this was so worth it when I saw the views from the top and the wonderful wildlife and landscape on top of Table Mountain. Be aware the floor rotates so you can't hold on but it mean everyone gets a view at some point. If you don't like that, sit in the middle by the controls. Well worth the butterflies.

Well managed queues. At first I thought I was in for a long wait but the queues are managed well, efficiently and with good humour. Purchase your ticket before arriving and you can go straight ahead. Once in the cable car, listen to your guide. He is very knowledgeable, very humourous , and gives life saving tips like not to hold onto the rail inside the car as it spins, or maybe it is the floor that spins. Come and visit and you can work it out.

Good ride, must like heights.. Table Mountain was under a blanket of misty clouds when we arrived. The line moves pretty fast, 50-60 per gondola. The floor of the gondola revolves as it travels up the mountain. As we were in clouds until the top of the ride, it was a little eerie. Once on top, the view was well worth it. On a clear day, it would be breathtaking, overcast it was still a serious WOW!
Simply Stunning. This is a true wonder of the world,the journey up and down on the cable car is great but the view from the peak is to die for.
AMAZING VIEW. Expensive ride - but worth it. I normally reach Table Mountain on foot but as we had overseas visitors we used the cable car on a beautiful wind free day and enjoyed every minute.

Fabulous! Don't miss it!. This has to be one of the iconic things to do in the world's favourite cities. It's so easily accessible. We used the City Sightseeing Tour bus, buying the tickets in advance. It being April, there were no queues anyway, but it was off the bus and straight onto the cable car. Not too many people so great views and photo opps. We'd gone with jackets but they weren't needed. It was warm, sunny and clear. We enjoyed a lovely walk, lunch at the cafe, then coffee and scones in the much quieter wifi lounge. Back down before it got too busy and back onto the bus. Wonderful.
Table mountain cable car. It is an excellent oppurtunity to experience the Mother city from an arial view. Be sure to choose a clear day for this excursion.
Breathe taking. It feels so great to be inside the cable car, you get to view the city of capetown from a higher ground. An amazingly beautiful scene.

Beautiful scenery . The Table mountain aerial cableway is a magnificent way to view Table mountain. This provides comfort for those who do not want to hike up the mountain.The view from the top is amazing. One can view the city, Robben Island, Lions head, Table Bay and many more attractions from above.Any tourist who visits Cape Town must summit our mountain.
Table Mountain Cable Car. A must while in Cape Town, Spectacular views from the top. Pre book (hotel concierge can do it) to avoid the lines.

Fantastic experience, go for it if the visibility is good and wind not too strong (neither is guaranteed). My husband and I stayed for just 4 days of March in Cape Town (should have stayed longer). We were warned that the cable car does not operate if the wind is too strong and, obviously, there is no point going up if visibility is poor. On the second day of our Cape Town visit the day seemed ok, we went up, visibility was so-so, we had a lovely walk looking at clouds below us, and suddenly the sky turned blue and the city and the ocean were there. We did not book in advance, we did not have to queue, the place was busy, but when you walk you don't feel the crowds around you, just occasional meetings. We loved it, as we loved the whole South African experience,

Canadian friend loved it! Totally underrated . Living in Cape Town for majority of my life, I knew we had to take our friend from Canada up Table Mountain. Not only did she love it, but we (locals) loved it! The visit is unforgettable and the infrastructure and experience flawless. Know that the queue for prepaid (online) tickets was the exact same length as the queue without tickets, so you both wait an equal amount of time.The view from the top was totally underrated, I was blown away by the beauty of our own city.Next time, I want to hike up the track then just take the cable car down, or take the sunset trip - that would be unreal!Proud Cape Tonian.

make sure you pre- book your tickets. a long wait because we did not pre book our tickets, but at the top it is amazing the views are breathtaking, a good tip is only go on a clear day and if not much wind, the close the mountain if there is a lot of wind,The 45min round walk at the top of table mountain is a must,

Stunning view - A must see in Cape town. Definitely a place to visit in Cape Town, you can not miss this. Really worth the time to go there. Stunning view of Cape Town on a clear day. You can take the bus or get on the Sight Seeing Bus to get there. You can spend a few hours walking on the top after you get up there. Beautiful view !
Great view from cableway which does a 360 from bottom to top. Mayhem queueing, go early! Free for all, no system once you are through to the area where you alight.
Loved it. Fun timeA must to do. Trails are incredible. View great. Short but expensive ride. A must do but family pass offer would be great

You could walk.... But the cable car provides such an excellent view...and I love the fact that it rotates while it goes up. The staff running the lift are very humourous and friendly. If you have time maybe you could walk one way and cable car the other.

You kind of have to do it. You have to do it once if you visit cape town. It's a pretty worthwile experience for views of the city and ocean and a look around the top.The quiet time to visit seems to be in the afternoon. We bought our tickets online at lunchtime, the same day we visited the mountain at around 3:30. All you need to show for entry is the ticket on your tablet/iPad and they can scan it from your screen. It's quite squishy inside the cable car, so either wait to be the last on or the first on to get a place next to the windows. The floor of the cable car spins 360degrees while you are inside which is pretty cool.When you are up there you can go walk around the top. You would expect it to be flat but it's a bit rocky, sensible shoes allow you to explore many different viewing points.Dassies seem to hang around the café which is an added cute bonus so make sure you keep an eye out for them.We left on one of the last cars, at around 6:20pm. It's nice to stay up there for sunset. You can buy beers from the café on the top of the mountain for sundowners. Bring a light jacket as it gets cooler around this time.

pleasant surprise. it was a painless experience: to go up one of the world's busiest cable cars, thanks to booking in advance and going out of season. the cable car itself is sophisticated and pleasant; faster than I expected. safe.

Great Day Trip. Make sure you plan this trip the moment you have good weather as it can change in a day!It can be a bit cold on the mountain so best to take something warm.Purchasing tickets online will make your waiting time much faster to use the cable cart to get to the top. You can also check on the parks website to view if the cable is open or closed based on the weather!Just heard that there is a dedicated Wi-Fi spot on the mountain which is great!There is a little shop on top where you can buy coffee and some goodies to eat as well as a curio shop as well.Free guided tours on the hour :)
Aerial awe. View is magnificent. Unique landscape. Must do when in cape town. The gondola rotates so everyone sees the view 360 degrees.

Pre Book. Loved the experience, however the day we decided to do it there was a huge cloud.The guy that operated the car was friendly and nice.Pre book your tickets otherwise you will be queing twice. Breathtaking views on top that wesaw for a few minutes before the cloud descended. Nice cafe and shop on top.
Brilliant. Fantastic experience ... When in Cape Town this is a must .. We loved the rotating floor in the cable car , giving everyone an oppurtunity to get a 360 view ..

Breathtaking view!. Be sure to check the weather to get there when there is little or no cloud cover. Don't worry about there you initially stand in the cable car as it does a 360 degree spin as you make it to the top.
fantastic views. looking up at table mountain, one would never think it was not level. the views were out of this world. so much to explore on top.
stunning. What a fabulous experience! We felt so blessed to be on top as it had been closed due to bad weather. Great time!!
Amazing . A real wonder just make sure the weather is decent. We were lucky and the weather was beautiful. We came actually at around 16:30 and there were no lines so we went up quickly.

loved the 360 degree ride on the Cable car. The service was good at the foot of the Mountain. Queues do develop but i believe that you can book on line. We took the Red bus route to get to the entrance to this attraction.

Brilliant activitie. As a family of 5 who have been to Cape Town several times, we decided to re visit Table mountain. We loved the ride up and down and were very impressed with the foot paths, information boards, cleanliness and development of the mountain top. Well done. Loved it.

Great experience. We pre booked on the red hop on, hop off bus. Once at the mountain everything worked like clockwork and as we had tickets we did not have to queue. View is stunning and staff are friendly

A must do when in Cape Town. It is awe inspiring, you feel like you are on top of the world, the scenery and views are spectacular, I am afraid of heights and cable cars and was pleasantly surprised not the ordeal I thought it was going to be and one of the trip to Cape Towns highlights.

Must do!. The weather can change quickly -- if it's a clear day, head up to the cableway to see the beautiful sites while it's clear! Purchase your tickets ahead of time to avoid potentially long lines at the ticket booth.
From the height of Table Mountain. The views from the top are gorgeous and there is much to see above and below from paragliders to city and ocean views. Take pictures, eat and shop at the top!

Family Breakfast up Table Mountain. We had breakfast up the mountain early cable car beating any queues and breakfast pizza.The views are fantastic but get out and do the guided free walking tour explains animals and vegetation.

Met all expectations. It's many years since Table Mountain first grabbed my attention and this visit did not disappoint. The 'car' rotates so that where ever you are standing, at some time, you get both a close up view of the mountain and across the city. On Bank Holidays and sunny week ends, pre book your ticket which shortens the waiting time, ( which could be 3hours) but does not put you at the front of the queue.Gift shop top and bottom sell the obvious tourist tac and are a magnet for children.The caffe at the top is expensive for S.A. and has a slow service system to get your drinks and prepared food.

best cablecar ever. this cablecar is revolving so you dont miss a photo opportunity, half of the car has open windows for great shots, but you only have 3 minutes before you land, make the most of it!

Great trip. A must do and see in Cape Town - worth the wait in the line. Don't be afraid to buy your tickets on-line it works much better and you miss the one queue. The staff are very friendly and always ready to help so ask away. Get your photo taken its def worth it as a memory to take home.
Nice ride. used it to get to Table mountain. Be sure you buy tickets upfront online. Saves a lot of time. The car spins around during its drive so you will get 360 degrees view.

A must . It was bad luck that the morning we went to TM the weather wasn't to good. A bit foggy and cold and rain at the top. Still it was an amazing excursion and we still really enjoyed it. Very glad we didn't miss it!

A must-do in Cape Town!. Amazing tour....a few tips - book your tickets online, get the receipt sent to your smartphone and avoid the queues. Get there early as soon as the place opens and avoid the throngs of tourists; the cloud also comes in towards late morning so go early for the best views

Perfect place to watch the sun set . There is no better way to spend a perfect night than to watch the sun go down over Cape Town at the top of Table Mountain.
Unreal views, good facilities. Go!

Fantastic experience. We were extremely lucky with our recent visit to Table mountain. Queue to buy tickets not too long, most probably best to buy them online beforehand. Weather perfect, hardly any wind. The cableride was exciting and over far too quickly! Stunning views and was pleasantly surprised with the footpaths, information boards and cleanliness of the mountain top. We have been to the top many times before but loved the way it has been revamped and it certainly was one of the highlights of our holiday in the Cape

Visit in the morning. Be aware that the weather is your adversary when using this aerial cableway, visit in the morning as the wind does build up during the day and can result in the cable way being closed. The ride itself is wonderful and because of the rotating floor every one in the car gets to see the views. As this is the only access to Table mountain book on line and arrive early unless you really do want to climb up to the top as some brave souls are want to do!
Amazing view!!. Awesome view to Cape Town, totally worth to hike up to Table Mountain and go down by the aerial cable.

Up Table Mountain by Cableway. Our ride up onto Table Mountain was by cable car allowing us to see Cape Town from a birds eye view from above. The restaurant and souvenir shop and the workmanship of the structure above allowed one to enjoy the visit to the top of the Mountain.Walks along the path and the beautiful view from above makes one feel like they are in a different world away from all life's worries. I would love to bring the rest of my family to experience the view from the top.
Fast and friendly. . The one thing you have to do when you come to Cape Town is go to the top of table mountain. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Thrilling View of the Cape Town and Table Mountain. If you are visiting Cape Town, don't miss the Aerial Cableway for splendid views of the city and surrounding scenery. Because the cableway is sometime closed due to high winds and sometimes the clouds move in and spoil the view from the top, be sure to be flexible in scheduling your visit in Cape Town. If the clouds are not covering the top and the weather does not close the cableway for safety reasons, head for Table Mountain immediately. The car rotates during the transit, so any direction in the car is as good as any other.for enjoying the view. Lines can be very long, both going up and down, so give yourself plenty of time. Sunscreen is strongly suggested, especially since you will likely be waiting in line in the sunshine.

You have to do it once! Or more. should have booked ahead as we had to queue, but it was a tolerable wait. Bought a lovely ring in the shop at the top - NOT tourist rubbish; we walked for an hour or so, and quite apart from superb views, we saw little animals, known as dassies, too - this is what I found about them --- rock hyrax, a small furry diurnal animal belonging to the Provavidae family, more commonly known as a dassie. Although it resembles a small rabbit, the dassie is actually a hoofed mammal related to the elephant. --- Hard to believe it has a connection to the elephant..... Fascinating up there altogether - a must.
