spectacular views!. Stunning scenery and a must do trip if you're in Cape Town. Try to go on a clear day for the best views and tends to be less busy in the afternoon.
Symbol of Cape Town. A must do for all visitors to Cape Town. If you are adventurous you could hike up and take the cable car down. Spectacular and so beautiful.

Great hike but cable car got sutck. Waited 30 minutes in the heat of the day dangling over the mountain after our 2 hour hike because the cable car got stuck. Nice view but very cramped and I enjoyable experience.

Spectacular views. It's a real experience to go up table mountain and see the views of cape Town and surrounding areas. My daughter is small and nd loved running around on the paths at the top and the cable car ride.

Breathtaking views. Spectacular views when u reach on top of table mountain, simply breathtaking, i never miss to visit this amazing place everytime am in capetown, i went on top of the mountain more than once, it's worth it✌

Spectacular views ! . Be sure to go early and get your tickets ahead of time if at all possible online. Go when there is good weather not too misty or too windy. There is 360 degree view from the rotating cable car . This is world heritage site for good reason ! You feel like you are on top of the world as you meet dassies and check out kinds of exotic plants and wildlife. There is a guided 30 minute hike that starts over by the twelve apostles, a restaurant and a gift shop. Wear study shoes so you can climb all over the rocks and get a better view. You can even watch groups of amazing rock climbers scaling the face of the mountain! This is a real must see in Cape Town!

Amazing experience, shame about the queues!. Such an amazing experience, the cable car is great and the 360 rotation is an experience. Obviously amazing views at the top and a great environment from which to enjoy the views.Only downside is the queuing, not sure how this can be resolved but it took hours to get off the mountain which wasn't enjoyable in the dark cold night.

great thing. be prepared to stand in queue for a few hours on a nice day. the ride itself and service is quick and friendly. good option for lazy people, older people or just people who just don't necessarily want to hike up that rock!
Zoom. Get your tickets online that way the queuing experience is shorter. The cable-way itself works very well indeed.
A must to do. This is just a must to do in Cape Town, well worth the money, what views of Cape town. If the weather looks good, then book online to save you some time at the ticket office.

Slick transportation to iconic Table mountain . Very straightforward means of getting to table mountain and spectacular views of city and rock face (and climbers) Recommend buying ticket in advance to beat the queues.

360° viewing. In less than 3 minutes you are up. Through the 360° rotation you see all sides. At peak hours it is very crody in the cable car. If you come by car just park you car at the lower peak and take the free shuttle to the entrance (higher peak). In this way you have no stress with parking your car and it is much more relaxed.

Great views. Well worth the wait, it gets very busy on the weekend. Pre- booking online cuts your waiting time. Very novel rotating floor of the gondola gives everyone a good view on the way up and on return. Spectacular views from the top and a few sign posted walkways.

Be prepared to queue for up to 2 hours during busy periods.. A great and quick way to get to the top of Table Mountain for the amazing view but be prepare to wait during peak periods. We were there in late March and even though we arrive at 8:30 am to hike up the mountain, there was already a long queue. Three hours after our climb, the queue was still there, if not, longer! Bring a sweater as weather can be a lot cooler at the top.

What a view.. Travelling up in the cable way is the only way to appreciate the amazing feat of engineering that then gives you the stunning views from the summit. It wasn't too crowded when we arrived at the lower terminal but we were glad that we had bought our tickets in advance as although the ticket queuing area is does have a shade it can still be very very hot, the sun's strength is deceiving. The cable car rotates as it ascends and descends so everyone gets a good all round view view.

Long awaited experience. I've been looking forward to this for many years. It didn't disappoint. The weather had been rainy in Cape Town all week but just before were due to fly home we had our opportunity.It was pretty busy, but the staff were efficient at moving the crowds and people we're generally in a great spirits making for a fun atmosphere. I recommend booking online ahead of your trip so you can take advantage of the quicker entry- it's easy to do and they even have free wifi at the entrance so you can do your booking as you arrive.The views were as expected - amazing! And the facilities at the top are good. We spent a few hours up there and had the chance to see the sun set over Cape Town as we descended.It's a wonderful afternoon out if you're in Cape Town and you should miss out. One thing to note is that if the weather gets too windy while you are up at the top... They might have to close the cable car... So be prepared to walk down (2-3hrs) if the sky is cloudy when you go! Haha!

When in Cape Town. If you don't buy tickets in advance, they have wifi in the queue area so can buy them on your phone while you're waiting. I did this - we skipped the wait and went straight on. Approx wait 30-60mins. Not complaining, all in all a good setup. Cable car takes about 2-3mins to travel each way and spins around so everyone can get a good photo.When at the top of the mountain it was cold - lots of people braving it in t-shirts and you could tell they were freezing. A jumper, jeans and windproof coat will sort it. The top of the mountain is well developed, good paths, viewpoints, toilets and a restaurant.
Great time on top of the table. Great weather, great views, fantastic experience! Shop at the top a bit too cluttered which makes it difficult to maneuver.. Especially with children or if disabled.
Phenomenal. Whisked to the top of the mountain in a rotating cable car offering panoramic views all the way up. Great that there's a good restaurant up there too with very decent coffee!

Spectacular views - a great day out. Two tips:1. Buy your ticket online. You avoid the biggest queues this way.2. Arrive early. The queues get long very quickly and the weather can change rapidly from fine to misty.Excellent views over Cape Town, the revolving floor means everyone in the cable car can enjoy the view. It is lots of fun, and well worth the trouble.
Buy tickets in advance . It is fairly well run but naturally very long wait times both going up and going down. It is well worth the wait as it is a must do in Capetown

A must!. One of the New 7 wonders of the world, offering the most amazing views. Very efficiently run. Take your best camera with you. Not for someone who is nervous about heights (my husband stayed behind once he saw cable car).

Must visit for sunset. The Table Mountain Cableway is amazingly well-run. Book your tickets online in advance to shorten your wait period and jump the main queue. The cableway transports 800 people an hour, so if you book in advance, your wait is pretty short. Try and get up for sunset - we were there a good hour after the supposed 6:30pm last cable car down, along with a few hundred other people :-)Fantastic views on a clear day.

One of the top 3 things to do in Cape Town. Hassle free boarding, quick ascend, once at the top magnificent views of Cape Town , Table Bay and most of the peninsula. It gets quite hot at the top so took the 5 pm cable lift and returned on the last one at 6:3o pm. If you get the red tour on city sight seeing double decker, it stops at the cableway station. Purchase on line and use the bar code to avoid the ques. Recommended.!

Quick interesting ride. We bought tickets online, just as well as the queues are long and the day we went the sun was hot! The 10 minute rotating ride up and down was scenic and made reaching the summit available for everyone
Revolving floor gave us a 360 degree view. Excellent trip up to table mountain.First time we've ever come across a cable car with a revolving floor which added to the excitement.

A must in Cape Town. It goes without saying that Table Mountain is the iconic image of Cape Town. However the views from the top are stunning on a clear day and should be a must do trip during any visit. As such the simplest and easiest way to get there is via the efficient and modern cable cars. Two tips however: make sure you book your tickets via the easy link on their website (valid a week); and allow plenty of time for your visit if the weather is clear and especially if a Cruise ship is in harbour.

Go early. . We went early just after Easter holiday finished. So no queues for us but holidays and weekends really busy and after noons too. Great weather by top station. Walk to bluff needed better shoes than we had.

Out of this world. A must if your in Cape Town I cannot recommend it enough,the views are out of this world you feel like your on top of the world.I would give you a few tips beforehand though:always check weather the day before,the cloud can descend very quickly,we bought our tickets online the evening before when I knew the weather was going to be good,this is a must if you want to avoid long queues(there are 2 queues,one for online ticket buyers and one for on the day ticket buyers,be there early it opens at 8:30am we were there at 7:50am as soon as it opens they let in the online ticket buyers first.It cost us as a family of 4 (2 adults,2 children) 740 SA rand which was at the time about 35 pounds sterling which I think is well worth it.I had the tickets emailed to my phone so I had the barcodes when I arrived the staff just scanned the codes off my phone.There is also wifi there so easy to access tickets on your phone.
Great experience. Fast purchase of tickets. Fast to get in into the cable car. Excellent rotating cable car - Swiss or German quality! Fabulous view.Restaurant at the top was good.

Gotta do it!. We ran out of time so had to go on a day which was clouded. We were in the tablecloth so the view was gone BUT I really enjoyed the ride up and by driving over to Signal Hill, we enjoyed beautiful views of Cape Town just fine.

Not for the faint hearted. If you suffer from vertigo or are afraid of heights then this not for you. As the car goes up the mountain it rotates slowly giving everybody a chance to take a photo or two.

A ride with a view !!. A fantastic view from the top of table mountain and well worth the cable car ride. As you reach the top there are various paths to give you views from various parts of the mountain and it is possible to have free guided tours too. We did our own thing and

Fantastic ride and views............. ............ but total confusion and chaos on the queues to return to the base station. One of the nicer cable rides and gondolas and the views from the top were fantastic - our weather was perfect - clear but it did get a little hot. The queue to return was disorganized and sadly put a damper on what otherwise was a nice day.

Table Mountain is amazing, shame about the queues.. I bought my ticket in advance and got to the cable car station at 0845 to try and avoid the queues. It still took 90 minutes to get to the top and given that the cable car only takes about 4 minutes then you can guess the delay was waiting to get up there.It would be a huge benefit to everyone if this could be speeded up but don't let it put you off. From the top it is unbelievable and really give you context that humans are but a spec on our planet.
breath taking. I am afraid of hights but I enjoyed every minute of the breath taking views, I felt safe in the enclosed bubble.

Amazingly Beautiful. The views from the top are amazing and incredibly beautiful. I would strongly suggest the cheaper sundowner tickets just before sunset. Go a little earlier to setup any equipment for s perfect shot.

Top of the world. Their is something very special about taking the cable car to the top of table mountain. When you reach the top and look down at a city that never sleeps you quickly realise that this place / town has something special. I bought our tickets on the phone whilst I queued up and it was a life saviour,don't rock up without tickets as you will be dispointed. Cool coffee cafe at the top , amazing views and very enjoyable. We spent around 2 hours but could have easily spent 5. It's a must don't leave town without ticking this box , 7 wonders of the world

Wow - Fantastic views but not for the faint hearted.. The views from the cable cars are unreal. Would totally recommend this as long as you're not afraid of heights. The higher up we got, the thicker the clouds unfortunately. It's worth checking the weather forecast before you head up as at the top, we were met with thick, grey clouds and we couldn't even see over the edge of the cliffs. If you do go up on a cloudy day, take a jacket as it can get quite chilly when the wind picks up.

Table Mountain Cape Town. The view at the top of the mountain is awesome. The guards or security are very helpful. The tellers are quick and everyone seem to be happy to welcome tourists. I would recommend that everyone visit table mountain when in Cape Town.

A "must do" in Cape Town, but beware long queues.. Strongly recommend buying tickets online beforehand. At the bottom, there are two queues, one for ticket holders and one for others. Even with a ticket, wait was 90 minutes and very little to do or see to make time pass pleasantly. The operators need to ask Disney how to manage queues!

Interesting Cableway - revolve your way to the top!. As with most attractions like this there was a queue to get on the cableway but it moved quite quickly. Before you go through there is the opportunity to have your picture taken in front of a green screen.The car holds aprox. 60 people and very slowly revolves so that you get a full panoramic view on your journey.

Round and UP.. Friendly people all around will direct you to where you need to be. The car can be quite crowded so watch your camera so you don't bang it as the car rotates up.Go early to avoid the herds of touris-buses. It's fee on your birthday and a substantial discount is offered to students with a valid student card. Cars and all areas are clean and there are conveniences at the top.Even if you want to hike up and car down, you need to buy your ticket at the bottom first.
Fun ride. We spent just over an hour on the top. The view was amazing. Lots of hiking - wish we had more time.

You must go. They apparently don't run the cable car if the weather is cloudy. Just as well because it is all about the view. A really worthwhile photo opportunity and the taxi up was a. Lovely drive. . CABLE CAR RETURN SAR21 each.

Amazing experience. . Make sure to book in advance online and try to work out a sunny day. The ride up is amazing. I hear the walks are fantastic too. On top you get a Panasonic view of most of Cape Area. Breathtaking. Well maintained, clean and foot paths available. Defining tent worth seeing the 7th wonder of the world!!!

Our Cable Trip. Very good experience overall, integrate logistics in place and amazing view on top of the mountain!Restaurants located on the hill with assistance throughout.Downside I noticed some tourists unattended going down the hill in non safe location, that could have gone wrong and messed up the tour's rep, however they returned sound and safe.All in all great experience!

Loved the rotating cable car!. No queueing and a very fast climb in our first ever rotating cable car with the views being worth the trip on their own! Arriving at the top was a revolution with loads of walking areas and a very well stocked cafe which served great coffee!

Good option for people with physical handicaps or short on time. The Aerial Cableway is a good option for those who are not able to hike up the mountain. You will still get to the top using this method and get some incredible photographs and take in some incredible views. The queue for the Aerial Cableway can get quite long so get there as soon as they open (around 7am) for maybe less of a wait. I hiked up Table Mountain using the Platteklip Gorge trail and then took the Aerial Cableway down which is what I would recommend, but if you are not physically able to hike, this is a great option.
Little Exciting. It is okay ride. It helps you to get to top and down quickly. I feel it is little costly. Otherwise, i didn't find it exciting.
World class. Excellent all round - queuing, staff interaction, facilities - nothing to fault! Not to be missed by locals nor tourists. Nice touch - on your birthday you travel for free.

A MUST in Cape Town. It is well worth the wait, but when I went it was winter and my second attempt at going up. The first time it was closed due to the weather. You MUST book online, this gets you to a shorter line when you arrive, but be prepared for a long wait. The cabe cars are great as they ROTATE as you move, so everyone gets a view of everything. Coming down was not such a long wait. PARKING can be a real issue, so you might want to drop off any people with you an then go and park. You can park either side of the cable car station.

Prebook tickets . We hadn't prebooked due to the inclement weather so the waiting time in the line was about 2hrs. I recommend prebook in tickets . the website gives waiting times for up and down and when we where coming down the waiting time on the website showed 2hrs but it was actually around 20mins. Keep this in mind when arranging transport.

Not to miss!. While in Cape Town, you must make the trek to Table Mountain and take the cable car to the top. Extraordinary views and the ticket organization is flawless. There is a cafe and gift located at the top, too!
Quick ride to the top. Get your tickets ahead of time. The line moves quickly. Great way to meet other tourists to the city.

Must be done. A great experience and we were lucky with the weather. Going in the afternoon can be quieter as the Coach tours have been and you get a chance to see what the weather will be like. We certainly had little or no wait in the afternoon.
Easily accessed by the hop on hop off bus.
Amazing Adventure. We went up with my Mom for her birthday! It was amazing - the restaurant was tops. The cable motor operator was a treat! The views absolutely breathtaking.
weather proble3m. We manged to get to the top of the mountain but the weather was too cold and the cloudy and we did not walk around the table as we could not see well.
Table Mountain Cable car. Excellent views. We were unfortunate not stay long on mountain due to mist. But had good views during visit there

Essential viewing - Booking tips to save time!. Nothing much we could say that hasn't already been written. Spectacular views and not at all crowded when you get on the mountain itself. Number one tip. Check that it's not covered in cloud and book tickets online. These can be kept on your smartphone as it's just a barcode reader when you get in. The advance ticket queue was a quarter the size of those without and moves quickly. We went on a clear day (that clouded up later) and from queue to top of mountain was less than half an hour.
Top of the world . Great place even for locals. Doing this makes me proud to be a Capetonian. Worth every cent and if I could I would make sure I visit at least every season
Sunny Day only. It's a cool ride up the mountain face, but only on a sunny day. It can be sooooo cold up there. No visibllity on a cloudy day at all.
A hair raising descent. Caught the cable car down having climbed table mountain with 3 children. It was fun and quite hair raising but over in 5 mins!

Simply Spectacular Views. I highly recommend purchasing tickets ahead of time online or on your phone when you get there. There are two lines which can get pretty long (one line with tickets on hand and the other line to buy tickets). But once you reach the top via the cable car that SPINS you will be simply amazed and in awe. On a clear day you can see to the edge of the world. Definitely recommend when visiting Cape Town.

Amazing. The weather was great during our trip. This was our first visit and as we did not know what to expect at the top of the mountain we were surprised that everything was well organized including a restaurant where you can have breakfast with a great view! We went early in the morning and although there were many people the queue moved and we did not have to wait for long both the way up and also down. It is a great experience and would recommend it if travelling to Cape Town.
absolutely one of the wonders of the world. from the start to the finish line of the trip you will beam with pride to be a south african. scenery, efficiency and first world service.

Romantic and any nature lovers envy. From the start of the journey right to the end you feel proud to be South african. Everything is in working order and staff know their duties. Clean and quick carriages. Beautiful scenery.

Breathtaking views, a must see when in Cape Town. I am obsessed with Table Mountain. I've been to Cape Town twice and have gone to Table Mountain twice. Try go in the morning when it opens at 8am- you beat the queues and it is so much less crowded up there! What's great is when you get up there you can walk around and go at your own pace, admire the view and sit down and relax.You will get the most amazing photos and unforgettable memories from this experience. Go see it for yourselves.
Brilliant. Amazing views-take a jumper and be prepared to wait.If there is a hint of cloud at the top, don't bother. You'll see nothing

Always beautiful. Perfect weather today. The queues coming down the mountain were dreadful and leaving the area by car even worse, but the weather was perfect; clear day, no wind, warm and the sun was shining.

Needs better Coordination !. The greeter at this queue has the hardest job around. Everyone that shows up with a ticket doesn't understand why they should go stand in a line hundreds of feet long.The ride if not crammed in is very nice. Unfortunately on most good weather days, you will be crammed in. Just be prepared. Get on board and get as close as possible to the outer perimeter. The plexiglass is in need of cleaning / scratch removal. But at end of ride you will have been thrilled !Just wished the popularity could be handled with better coordination .

Quick trip to the top, Rotation gives you all the views!. We bought tickets online the night before, and caught the first or second trip up to the top. Recommend going early - there were no people in line when it opened at 8:30am on a weekend. The rotating carriage allows for complete 360 degree views on the ascent - a Must-See in Cape Town!

Beautiful. Used the open top bus to see Table Mountain
It's a must to see, so beautiful, breath taking views.
You can do absailing, if you don't mind heights.
There's a restaurant, which was busy, but we did not have to wait long for a table, only had a snack and drink

this is a tram you'll want to ride. While we usually prefer to hike up or down vista area like Table Mountain, we took the tram to save time on a busy day. The unique feature of this tram is the fact that it revolves AND the most scenic direction facings are open- air for perfect views and photo opportunities. You simply need to stand still and you'll have great views without fighting with your fellow travelers. It's terrific!

Views to behold. This tourist attraction is unbelievably popular to both locals and overseas tourists. You can understand why as it is one of the wonders of the world, with over 1400 different plant species but even on it's own it is a marvel. A cable car takes up to the summit from which you will experience the view of CT, the waterfront and the ocean. It is absolutely beautiful. A bit pricey at R240 per adult but you can also hike up the mountain if you are the adventurous type, I believe the hiking is free.

Scenic. We have gone up Table Mountain several times with our young children and it is always as exciting and breath taking every time you step out of the cable car onto the plateau .On a clear day the views across the Twelve apostles are simply magnificent .It tends to be very chilly at the top so go prepared with a warm jersey or jacket . If there is a white " tablecloth " across the mountain it isn't worth going up the cable car as your views are limited .The restaurant at the top has a self service section and a coffee bar with cakes , but the seating is quite limited . You can also buy alcohol in the shop and souvenirs .During summer they run specials where you can stay at the top of the mountain and watch the sunsets .In peak season it is best to go early to avoid the very long queues .An absolute must if you are visiting Cape Town for the first time !

Very efficient. We booked online, which avoided one queue. As it was morning time in March there was not much of a wait for the cable car, either going up or down. The weather was beautiful, so the scenery was spectacular. We used taxis to and from hotel. Hop on hop off bus also stops at cable car entrance.

Everything it is cracked up to be!. Wow. A rotating car to help you see the sights as you ascend and descend. Delicious food at the top to power you up for the spectacular sunset. What could be better?

Breathtaking views. Be sure to check the weather forecast before you head to the Table mountain as weather can change drastically. And also to see whether the cableway is running or not. Best to buy your tickets online to avoid the huge queues during peak season time and therefore you will be spending more time in line rather than on top. The cable cars are frequent, safe and rotate as they go up so that you get a 360 degree view of the bay and the city. It's fabulous. The cable car attendants have a great sense of humour. The trip we made had a Chinese couple in the cable car and suddenly the South African attendant started speaking in fluent Cantonese... A very surreal but brilliant moment for the Chinese couple... Have a great ride!

Great rotating cars. We went on the cable car after 6pm so got a reduced price ticket. We also got the best of both worlds having the daylight and night time views. We came down again around 8pm. The ride was great and having been on many cable cars around the world, this one matched many of the best. The rotating cars make sure you get to see all aspects during the short ride up or down. Highly recommended.
Nice and good view. We stopped the car there and walked around. Very good view, and nice scenery. spend some time walking there!
Table mountain. We used the cable cart to come down from table mountain. We enjoyed the hike up which took just over 2 hours and it was so worth it.

A Must Visit. A trip up the Table Mountain via Aerial Cableway is one of the things one must do in Cape town. I had online tickets so I did not wait for long going up. The view from the top is beautiful. We had a sunset wine toast from the top with my wife and it was amazing. The queue on the way down was too long and we had to wait for almost two hours to get on the cable car.

Book your tickets in advance to avoid queuing! . Table Mountain is one of the New 7 World Wonders, and rightfully so - the views from the top are magnificent. Luckily, we purchased our tickets online the day before, otherwise we would have ended up in a 2 hours queue. If you have tickets already, you might end up waiting for like 30 minutes, but that's about it.The cable car rotates so you will be able to have a panoramic view going up/down no matter where you're standing. Alltogether great experience!

Great adventure . Reasons why I am not giving 5 is simply because of the ridiculous long queue during holiday season. Otherwise a must explore place, views from the top are just breathtaking. If you are fit enough consider hiking rather than the cable car.
Does what it says... We hiked up but got the cable car down. R100 with a wild card. Queue was long but goes fast. We liked the way the floor moves around inside the car to give everyone a good view.

Fabulous Access. We visited Cape Town whilst on a cruise and one of the highlights of our three day stay in this great city was the ride on the cableway up to the top of Table Mountain. As I use a mobility scooter, I was not sure how accessible this attraction would be but I need not have worried. There was a lift which bypassed the steps leading up to the cable car and the car itself was simple to access as the entrance to the car was completely level. The journey itself was fantastic, the car turns 360 degrees as it travels to the top station so, no matter where you stand in the car you get to see a full panorama. The views from the top are stunning too and an experience not to be missed.

Enjoyed it. What a place to be. You can read about it , see videos and all but it's never complete until you get in the cable and go up.Visited on a busy day but had the advantage that we had booked online.Stunning views from the top. Nice picturesThe restaurant is good, serving fresh food. Check online if it's open before going because at times they close because of bad weather. Have warm clothing, just in case.
Revolving 360 deg cable car. Enjoyed every moment of it and to see the mountain in different angle as its goes on to the top is an experience by itself

Must do in Cape town.. You have to do this trip in Cape Town. The views are amazing. Go early though to avoid the queues. We queued for about 20 minutes having arrived at 9am. When we came down the queue was predicted to be 2-4 hours. No fun in the heat and if you don't have long in Cape Town.

Table Mountain revisited after 30 years........ What a huge difference from my last visit in the Christmas of 1981. In the good old days there was no need to book, no online was around. You rocked up at Lower Tafelberg , no long queues, just hop onto the old Cable car, no revolving floor and away they go.Return trip stress-free no long queues to stand in.However much has changed over the years and it is recommended to buy your ticket online, we did at Pick'n Pay, they do at selected outlets. Be sure to buy a return ticket to avoid hiking down if you never intended to and keep your ticket handy for the return trip.Tickets booked online are valid for 7 days from date of intended travel so it gave us a good few day's grace when the cableway was closed due to poor weather conditions.You can check the website for weather updates and whether the cableway is operating or not.Parking at Upper Station can be very limited so suggest one of the following options.1.If you are using the Red hop on hop off bus, you can buy the tickets from the office at the Aquarium on the V and A Waterfront or from the driver of the bus before it gets to stop 7 which is the Upper Tafelberg Rd.The hop on bus will take you to the very top so no long walking needed.2.From the waterfront you can use the My-citi bus and get off at the Civic Centre.From the Civic Centre there is a bus that connects to lower Tafelberg Rd. At the lower Tafelberg Rd there is a free My-citi bus that transports you to the top at the cable way entrance.3.Likewise park your car at the lower Tafelberg Rd My-citi bus station and connect with the free bus.If the Sunset option is the one you choose at a cost of about R100-- after 6 p.m., remember to get down in time to connect with the bus as the last My-citi goes down at 7p.m.A few words of advice when going up the mountain. Most important wear flat comfortable NON-SLIP shoes at all times.Children should be seen to at all times.The exit from the café is a bit tricky for prams so caution is advised.Perhaps there could be additional handrails installed for added safety for children and adults alike on top of the mountain.Cable car did have a technical hitch the time we were about to board as there was a problem with the doors on one of the cars and people were suspended mid-air for about 20 to 30 mins. So expect these issues however rare.Staff are very helpful and friendly . Don't expect to pay ground prices 1km up in the air on a mountain-top cafeteria !!!
Promenade. Amazing experience to go up in the turning cable car. The view is breath taking. Nothing compares to this place. It is insanely beautiful and peaceful. Everybody should go.

it has to be on your list of to do things in capetown. we went to Table Mountain on march 3rd this year ,it is really a wonderful site .the cable car is an experience as it rotates when it is moving,there are spectacular views both from the cable car and on the mountain top ,it is a must see for anyone visiting capetown,the queues can be long in high season so it is better to book online but always ring and make sure the mountain is open as often it is closed due to wind or if there is low cloud.

Painful experience. Went to bother of pre booking tickets why I'm not sure as everyone was lumped into same very long queue those without tickets were taken to top ,leaving us saddos who had pre booked standing still in a very long queue. After an hour we got to a notice board that said we still had another hour in queue so gave up. Very badly organised and staff particularly unhelpful. Go early or go late that's my advise

Sunset then evening on the mountain. As we only had an overnight stop (again) in Cape Town we felt we must go up the cable car. We checked with reception and were told that the queues were only 45 minutes (they'd been 3 hours a couple of days before when we thought about going!) so we headed off.The queue did indeed take about 45 minutes from getting the tickets (the queue for that was about 30 mins) and the line was orderly u till you got out of the lift at the cable car station when it descended into a scrum as more and more people were sent up but we were being held back until each car had left and the waiting area was empty.There are only two large cabins so one goes up as the other descends. This is why the queues get so long, I think. We arrived at the top as the sun was setting, had a quick look round and then joined the line to get down again. We queued for over an hour in the gathering dark, watching the lights go on down I the city and the stars come out. Not the best way to end the evening!My advice would be book online to avoid the ticket queues and don't go up for sunset unless you're prepared for a long wait to get back down again!

A must do when you in Cape Town. 1st time for me, and I just loved it. What spectacular views. This is truly the highlight of our vacation\. Although it was very busy, it was a well worth trip. The views just takes your breath away.

Great way to get to the top. Suggestions:1. Check out the weather for next day2. Buy your tickets online 3. Take a warm sweater with as it can be cold on top4. Always make it a rule, if you get to Cape Town and you see the weather is clear, go up the Mountain. You never know what the weather will do. We already bought our tickets online and it was cloudy in the morning. We still went to the Cableway. The staff were very friendly and there were no lines. Revolving floor - 360 degree views. It was cold and very windy on top. There were clear patches where we could take some pictures. We stopped at the cafe to get some hot chocolate and coffee which warmed us up. After 30 mins then clouds had cleared. We purchased goods at the store and the cashier was very friendly and we had a nice conversation. She was very funny and was almost the highlight of the trip.

Book online to avoid queues. Brilliant, view is amazing and allow at least a couple of hours to really enjoy it. Take your camera and look out for the Dassies, the little animals that live on the top,

Awesome sights. Queues are long but worth the wait. Staff are friendly - especially on your birthday when you receive a free ride. The views are spectacular all the way up and, obviously, especially at the top. We would definitely go more often if it was a touch more affordable.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Breath-taking, amazing a must do. Purchasing of tickets and going up and down was a quick process. Enough parking space. Very orderly process despite it being peak season. The food is not Halaal and the restaurant at the top is limited with food choices. The view is astounding and foot paths are nice for kids and adults not to destroy any fauna or flora.
Tourist in my own country SA u rock. A must visit. Surprises u at the top the mountain is a great place. Thed queue though is a must work on as it is irritating.

Go early but don't miss it. We went quite early and we were glad we did as the cable car had been down due to winds for 3 days. The ride is spectacular - the rotating car so everyone gets a view is genius. The view from the top give you such an appreciation for the cape.

A South African gem!. Beautiful is an understatement! Really makes you appreciate the beauty of our country. I went during a peak time but found things were well organised. Make sure to book online beforehand, saves a bit of time in the queue. The wait is worth it though! I had a pizza slice at the cafe, not the greatest but then again I went up for the views not the food.

A must visit when in Cape Town . Seeing table mountain from down below is nothing when compared to close up and literally on it The weather can change in an instant do a jacket is always recommended. Pack a lite lunch and drinks as the food and drinks on the mountain can be pricey.Be prepared to go another day of the wind is to strong. Or the skies aren't clear.

Must do un cape town. What an amazing view from up there ! Really worth the wait ! And if you're lucky you'll get to see some marmots ;-) Few tips : get your tickets ahead, take a cab or the sightseeing bus to go there, you'll easily find a cab to go back, bring a pullover as it maybe windy / cold. You can also climb your way up, it's quite a walk but not that difficult (i heard).

Very efficient. We visited in December 2015, and it was really hot so the long queues were not fun. However, the staff worked very efficiently making for a trouble-free journey. Will definitely use this service again.
Great Way to See Spectacular View. Took this down after hiking to top of Table Mountain. Fun way to get down when you don't want to hike the steep trail down.

Magical. This made me so prepaid to be South Africa. It was right up there with the Eiffel Tower and Big Ben and the Statue of Liberty in terms of being a really world class, we'll run, worthwhile experience but when moe than that it just does something to touch your soul! It's a lifetime must do!

Amazing. Top Tips- buy your tickets online before you get there. When you get to the front of the queue it splits into an online and 'still to buy' line. If you have already purchased your tickets it's one less queue- tickets are valid for 7 days, you need to specify a date for the cable car when you purchase the tickets, make this the day after you arrive and then watch the weather. If you know it's going to be clear go to the cable car- get there early! Plan to get to the base of the cable car for about 7.30 am. You'll have to wait for it to open at 8.00am, but once it's open you'll be in the first or second car going up. The waiting time in the queue gets longer, very quickly!- despite it being almost 20 degrees at the base of the cable car it is still very nippy on top of the mountain, take a jumper!- I wouldn't bother with the photo shopped photos you can buy from the shop once you get back down, they are not great quality and expensive.The views are stunning and the entire attraction is very well run and organised. All the staff are friendly and helpful too.

expensive. It is expensive to use the cable cars-R240 return, but worth it if time is short to avoid the hike to the top. The revolving floor is a great idea giving all passengers 360 degree views as they travel
Amazing!!!!!!. Wow!! It was really really interesting to see the beautiful Cape town from up the table mountain!!! Me and my family really enjoyed it!! Perfect thing to do in Cape town.
Loooong queue, but with a nice surprise in the end. It does what it should do: takes you up and down, but beware, the line can be very long, for us about one hour.

Amazing!. What a View! Very safe, and no lines when we came in March. We choosed the sunset time (6:58PM) and it was perfect once we could buy some wines in the little market upstairs and have a sunset experience outside.

A must do when your here. A great ride even if your worried about heights it's so big it's like being in a coach. And when you get to the top it's amazing. Timing is the most important avoid when the cruise boats come in you can wait. Go early if the weathers good.

Long queues on busy days but still worth the effort.. I had been up the mountain 20 years previously with the older cable car system. The new cars have rotating floors making the viewing good for all passengers.The walks at the top offer stunning views of the cape peninsula and Cape Town city. We well all very glad we made the effort and braved the long queues on a perfect weather day.It's highly recommended that you buy your tickets online. We did this while standing in the ticket queue and it saved an hour at least.

What a beautiful trip!. My family of 5 and I went up the mountain using the cableway and although the line was a 2 hour wait, the service was efficient and well organized. Very well worth a try but it gets very busy in the morning - come early or by tickets for later at night.

Simply Amazing and a MUST do for everyone. Depending on whether Mother Nature is in a good mood as to whether you can go on this breath taking adventure. Credit must be given to the operators/managers of this as I was completely blown away of the sheer beauty of everything and didn't really want to come down from the top.

True delight. It was very busy, but we felt the management kept the lines pretty efficient. booked online in advance. finding a parking can be painful. but once uptop, its amazing and calming. good walk around for a couple of hours

Totally Amazing. We visited on a busy day so line for tickets was at least an hour I def recommend buying tickets online as there was almost no waiting for those that did. View is amazing totally worth the wait. Love the picture package you can buy at the end for 260rand with your photo superimposed on various scenes . A good day out and photos were amazing didn't try the restaurant but bought snacks and souvenirs on the ground and have no complaints.

The most iconic part of a Cape Town Holiday. There is a good reason why Table Mountain was voted to be one of the 7 wonders of the Natural World. It is a breathtaking experience. The hikes cater for all ages and fitness levels and offers picture moments at every turn. Book online and avoid an even longer wait and expect a wait even when you book online. It is just that popular but definitely worth it. My only other advice would be for the men to leave their pride at the bottom of the mountain and use a selfie stick to get the best of the photo ops. Or else you could just ask someone to take a picture for you

Smooth running. A very well-run way to get to the top. A long queue moved quickly and the ride is smooth and impressive. Especially fun when you pass the other car and realise how fast you are moving!
Must do!. This is a must do and see in Cape Town. Get there early as it gets crowded and check the weather forecast so the table is not covered by clouds.

Best way to see Cape Town. Arrived in Cape Town from the airport after being in the air for almost a full day and were told we were visiting this first. Thought it too much but OMG it was so worth the stop. Stunning views as this revolves as you are ascending and descending.

Long queueing times. Unfortunately I was very unlucky and had to queue for 2 hours before finally getting to the ticket office and then further hour to get to the top. My guide book clearly said to avoid the mid morning and I went at 11.00, so I have myself to blame .. Partly. The queueing system was somewhat inefficient and even people with pre booked tickets waited for a long time. The day was very hot, so make sure you have a hat, sun cream and water when you go because the queue is not always in the shade. However once you get near, there are water sprinkles. But , it's worth the pain.. The views from the car are amazing, it rotates so everybody can appreciate the views. The staff are friendly and helpful and it's a wonderful and unforgettable experience.

Good trip with the family but poor queue control. Surely you can't come to Capetown without visiting this gem but be prepared to queue. At the top there is a restaurant (again) 200 people queuing in a space big enough for 20.
Beautiful everytime!!. Such a stunning view from above.The system is very well managed by the staff.Be sure to dress warmly though, it gets super cold up there.
Amazing views. Queues at each end but worth the wait. Excellent ride very smooth and car revolves giving 360degree views

A special "don't-miss". Table Mountain, and the views, are unique to Cape Town and beautiful. Having ridden many cableways and mountain lifts in Europe and the US, this is as nicely done as any. The restaurant at the top is better than many. Go first thing in the morning, and have it somewhat to yourself, before the winds get cranked up to shut down the cable car, the tour buses arrive, or the "tablecloth" cloud cover rolls in to block your view. Buy tickets online from home, to avoid the first queue—they are good for one use on any day of a seven-day period, and they are refundable if you never actually use them. Sneakers are fine, but you could stumble in the wrong footwear, as the footing at the top is rocky. Enjoy both the views and the wildlife.
A must do in Cape Town. We hiked up Table Mt on our first day in SA . Wow what an experience. Lines for the cableway are long. Try to buy an advance ticket

Shortcut to the top of Town. If age, health, time, or sheer preference rule out walking up Table Mountain, then this is the providential means of ascent for you. An efficient queuing system means that the rigmarole of waiting is nicely oiled and you will also have an opportunity for photos before you arrive at the cable car. We used it for our descent only, after a good climb up Platterklip Gorge, to be kind to tired knees. One way cost R125 each. The floor rotates slowly so you can get a 360 degree view of this iconic city. Just be sure you don't have anything that might get caught in circulation and know that not everybody in the world knows how to queue...! I asked the guys who operate the car if they were bored with just riding up and down all day. "No ma'am," came the reply, "every 4 minutes we meet new people." Wonderful!
Wonderful view. A must try when you are in Cape Town. You would be able to see a spectacular view of Cape Town. You can also see the other places (Ariel view).

Real fun! . A must do when you're visiting Cape Town. Going to the top of Table Mountain via the aerial cableway is not only fun, but is also a fantastic way of viewing the Mother City from above. However, queuing for tickets can be a drag so it's best to buy them online or from the Sightseeing Cape City Tour bus before hand.

Fantastic. Fabulous panoramic views thanks to the interior of the cable car rotating.We bought our tickets beforehand and had hardly any queuing up or down.The staff were helpful and efficient and even the announcements and instructions in the cable car contained a touch of humour which helped to reassure and relax anyone who might be a little nervous.Altogether a pleasant and memorable experience.

Fantastic Views of the Complete Cape. Tickets can be a Problem especially at School Holidays. Also you need to be lucky with weather as it can Cloud/Fog up during the Day or Late Afternoon. Generally Good Value for money and it is really sensible to make good use of the Local Guides at the Top to Fully Understand where and what your looking at. We had a Super Guy who made the viewing Most Interesting.

An absolute must. It is one of the absolute high lights of what Cape Town has to offer. The ride in the revolving cable cart alone is quite an experience, especially for the little ones. The views from the mountain is spectacular. One can walk around, quite an area to cover, see the Dassies, if the sun is out. Be sure to take something warm to wear, as the wind up there can be extremely chilly. They have a restaurant which we did not frequent, it is well worth the wait , as there is always a long line to get to the cable cart. It does not go if the wind is blowing which happens often from Dec to Jan

Always amazing. We went up the table when we visited Cape Town during March. We planned on going up the Thursday, but it was closed due to terrible winds. We booked our tickets online for a Friday trip - it took quite some time to get up and down due to the amount of people. The facilities are clean and staff are very friendly. It was icy cold when we waited for the cable cars, but once we were up the mountain, the weather couldn't be better. I'd definitely go up again when in Cape Town again! Lovely views of CPT. TIPS: Book the tickets online - it's much quicker when you already have your ticket in hand (no need to print them out as they can be scanned from the phone). Also, book a ticket for after 13:00. The waiting time is much less after 14:00 to go up.

Best Way To the Top. First of all, Table Mountain is so beautiful. If you want a great way to get to the summit, the Aerial Cableway is the best way to get there. Order your tickets before you arrive to avoid the queue. You will be rewarded with splendid views of Cape Town, Lions Head and Devils Peak. Be forewarned. The floor of the Aerial Cableway rotates as it moves travels.
Excellent views . Amazing views over Cape TownWell worth the money and experience which was excellent Plenty to do whilst on the mountain.
Birds View. Very well run cableway. The ride up is five minutes of pure excitement and amazement. The 360 degree view spectacular.

Great view as one rides to the top. This is a rotating cabin on the cableway - so one automatically ends up with a 360 view on the ride to the top / bottom. Makes life simpler as all of us get a view and there is no crowding to the front side for the view.

Cool ride. It's a pretty neat ride on the gondola up the mountain with great views. The inside of each car rotates which is a nice trick. Sadly it's a long line to get on them, even if you have tickets ahead of time, and maybe even longer when going down.The ride is maybe 4-5 minutes and there are only 2 cars that each carry about 50 people.
Well designed. The cars have water as ballast to stabilize them, and make a complete revolution on the way up and down so that all 609 passengers get a good view.

Fantastic Views. Get there early and buy your tickets beforehand to avoid an extra queue. The floor of the cable car revolves so you can get 360o views. This is amazing. Don't forget your camera. A commentary is also given on the way up.
There is a cafe at the top and walks.
Wear sensible footwear. Prepare to be amazed.

Always worth a visit up the mountain. We took our young kids up the cable car and although the youngest was a handful, the view is spectacular and, on a good day, one can see for miles. It's worth checking the weather and going at an off peak time.

It is stable when windy. I had the complete experience of sudden weather change up there, and the cable car ride down was very secure, it is very stable. I couldn´t walk a lot on the top. So before going up check the wind forecast website...
Iconic. Definitely worth a visit just a spectacular in person as in any pictures you might have seen ,don't regret not visiting
Cableway - 360 degrees. A fast way to the top of table mountain which is a must see. Efficient. A very large cablecar and a 360 degree rotation a new experience.
cable ride up table mountain. this was a fantastic experience going up in the cable car. when you get to the top you don't know what to expect. its a must for anybody going to South Africa

Just another beautiful example of the mother city.. An experience that will leave you in total awe!! Seeing Cape Town from the air with the beautiful mountain on one side makes you appreciate why this is the most beautiful city in the world. Amazing!

The Blanket. We left the base in perfect weather in shorts and slops, had a magical ride up by a very organized unit and climbed onto the mountain in clear sunshine with panoramic views and headed off to explore...we did however see wispy clouds scudding over the mountain from behind us with a thick one behind it. All was good for a while till the wind picked up, the clouds got decidedly thicker and the temperature plummeted. After a short amount of deliberation and lots of goose bumps, we headed for the cable car...along with most of the rest of the mountain...after a fair wait and no passengers coming up from the bottom and wind screaming through the vibrating waiting area, we boarded a very windy cable car and had an absolutely smooth ride back down to a hot and sunny day...an experience well worth having...

Stunning Scenery. We went up about 9.30am on a slightly cloudy days and it was spectacular.We walked straight up to ticket office, no queues...and what a lovely smooth ride up with views over whole city..as we got to the top we passed through light cloud and again ..stunning being above the cloud...that soon cleared away and we did a walk over to Maclears Beacon.The cableway does get crowded so best time is early to avoid queues.

Beauty!. Beautiful to see! Never knew Africa had such wonders in a big city life Cape Town. Expensive cable ride but worth it, went with my fiancé and Dad so the trekking will be another time... Worth being on the top to really get the view! Beautiful place, a big must!!

Great fun and great views. We bought tickets on line well in advance so avoided the q's for purchasing on the day. The one for the chairlift moved quickly and it holds30-40 people at a time. Don't worry about were you stand as the capsule revolves
A must do in Cape Town. An enjoyable ride and a must do for the Cape Town Experience. And if it is your birthday take your I.D. with to get a free return ride ticket

Myrnas table mountain experience. Nice place to see. Good management if place for tourist. Enjoy food and shopping and photo selfies. We were six in the group , it was our first city sightseeing stop. Have a very good experience in Capetown, its one of the best city we can recommend for any age group to visit

Stunning Views. Table mopuntain Cableway is a great way to see Cape Town from above. You have a 360degree view of one of the most beautiful cities in the world! There are restaurants at the top which cater for all tastes, snacks, sandwiches, hot meals etc The best time to go is around 4pm as you will miss most of the queues, have late lunch or dinner and watch the sun set over the sea! Remember that in Summer the sun sets at around 8.30pm! Truly magnificent!
A must :). Take the first good day (checked with the cable car that it's also ok "up" there ) and head out early and have breakfast.
Beautiful vista.. Take the cable car up to Table Mountain as soon as you have a clear morning. It's worth the ride for the experience and the stunning view of Capetown and surrounding area.
Must do. Absolute must do, if the weather is clear. The weather might not be favourable another day change your plans and do it!

Essential . Straight off the plane and took the red bus tour stopping off here. Sunday afternoon and not actually too busy. I bought my ticket with the red bus ticket so could go straight from the bus to the cable car entrance. Magnificent ride, views. Unforgettable.
Amazing Views. One of the seven natural wonders of the world - and for good reason. Be sure the mountain is clear of clouds before you go, or you will be disappointed.

Stunning Natural Beauty. This cableway shows you some of the best views in all of Cape Town! The cable cars rotate 360 degrees on the ride up and down, to give everyone an equal view of the stunning vistas. At the top, you can have coffee, drinks or snacks before or after a walk of the top. You are able to roam freely to the edges (or OVER) so keep a close hold on those wandering children.Check the weather and go on a cloudy windless day if you can - it was wonderful. For those who are adventurous and energetic, you can climb up and / or climb down, or use the long hiking path up and / or down.

Tips and tricks . Check on the website for the weather and queue times. If they say 2 hours, it'll be closer to 3hours. Mornings when the wind isn't blowing can be a long wait. Buy your tickets online. Pack your own snacks as the shop at the top is expensive and packed with thirsty and hungry visitors. Take a jacket, it's cold up there.

One feels as though one is having a very safe aeroplane ride As the cable Car rises, the views become more thrilling.. One feels suspended between the clouds and the rocks and as the climb upwards is leisurely, one has time to drink in all the feasts for one's eyes. The restaurants on the mountain are of an excellent quality from the self-service one on the lower level to the more upmarket one higher up. The view from the top restaurant is magnificent. Watching the sunset at a table outside the self-service restaurant was a rare windless treat. We experienced a long and colour-filled twilight..

Place to go!!. Cable car awesome. Go early otherwise gets very busy queues and parking difficult. Need head for heights as fantastic views. Went prepared and walked down difficult route - amazing but tiring - legs ached 3 days afterwards!! Felt fantastic having ticked visit off my list 'to do'
A bit of a wait, But Worth It...... Some of the best views in the world. It takes a little time to get up there and there will be a wait, but hey when you get up the top, you will be blown away

World class experience. Having done this trip before both my wife and I were still blown away by how good this experience is. Weather permitting you will be treated to 1km high views of the city bowl, west coast and beyond. First book online for an afternoon return ticket, then take public transport (Uber or taxi/bus) to the bottom cable way station. Try get there around 3pm so by the time you are ready to come down the sun will be setting treating you to spectacular views.Take warm clothing to layer.

You Have to Do It Once. We made the mistake of not buying our tickets ahead of time---as a result we stood in the hot sun just waiting to purchase tickets. Our wait was slightly shortened when we figured out we could buy tickets through our phone--which we did. However, once you have tickets, there is still a longer than preferred wait. The cable ride up the mountain is quick and in a way it is almost too fast, as the views are great---with the horrific lines, there is no way they could slow the rides up and down. I am pleased we did it. We were lucky it was a clear beautiful day---quite windy, but worth doing once. Just be sure to buy tickets ahead of time, and don't go on a weekend if you can manage that.

Up in the clouds!. This was a must do, despite my husband's vertigo. We enjoyed the panoramic view of the city , and the dramatic sky as the fog/clouds rolled in . An iconic landmark that is recognisable all over the world

The rotating floor works well to give everyone a chance to see the vistas. We went on a cableway in Caracas, Venezuela, and it was a bit scary. Not here. Not sure why not, as it is steep, but the rotating floor keeps your view fixed outward. Nice trip up, and return.

Stunning views - worth a ride. You have to accept that there is little in the way of parking - get there early. The staff are a mixed bunch and some seem as working there is a prison sentence, whilst others are friendly. The organisation is good and the views are magnificent on a clear day. Worth the effort and having to put up with the "grumpies".

It's a must while visiting Cape Town. We were very lucky to have good weather when we decided to do this attraction. Not our first visit there. Since we bought our tickets together with our 'Hop on Hop off' tour - so no waste of time.... We did not walk a lot : the 'Hop on Hop off' bus left us at the entrance ....We enjoyed the nice views while being in the cable car and on the Table Mountain....As usual, lot of people visit it...Michele & others

Great for the sunset . We went in the evening at around seven. The cable car rotates slowly as you go up. I found the prices of the food and drink quite expensive, understandable but still. Maybe take your own bottle of wine with you etc if you can. The sunset was great though so definitely a worth while experience.

Gorgeous Views - Don't Miss It. Because of the wind and the clouds, daily access is not guaranteed. Seize the opportunity to visit when you can. The cable car is really fun and rotates. If you have time, stay a bit on top and enjoy the place.

New 7 wonder of the world. Earlier in the day we were told it was too windy so the cable cars weren't running, as this was our last day in Capetown I was disappointed. We went to lunch and did a small tour and returned in the afternoon to find the cars were traveling up to table mountain. We purchased our tickets with the disclaimer if the winds were to pick up we would have to make the trip back down by foot. It was breezy (bring jackets), but no trek down for us. The cable cars hold about 30 people and it rotates as it makes the 3 minute trip up. Wonderful views of the entire city, should not be missed.
Table Mountain. We visited Table Mountain but I would recommend that you buy your tickets at the hotel prior to your visit it saves a massive amount of waiting time.

Much improved from previous years - a good trouble free experience. We got to the cable car lower station about 8.45am after a c 10 minute walk from our roadside parking spot - your cars are monitored by car 'guards' and it is well worth it for the modest cost.We didn't buy our tickets in advance - you never quite know what the wind or visibility may be. We were pleasantly surprised at the smallish queue to buy tickets - R240 each - ticket booths were efficient which is more than can be said in previous years. There was then a c 20 minute queue for a cable car - quite happy with that - they try to get you to have your photo taken for a souvenir - if you don't want to and it is not mandatory, just politely decline as we did.I am not great with heights but had no problems in the cable car itself which hold 65 - think they can get 800 people up to the top in an hour. Coming down around midday we had a c 20 minute queue for the 'car'. Whilst perhaps stating the obvious, it less busy early or later- if you go in the middle of the day you may well get superseded by the punters from the omni present coach tours.A good overall experience and better than I dared hope for queuing wise.

The 7th Natural wonder of the world.. What an amazing experience. This was my third visit to Table Mountain, the first over 25 years ago, and still it takes my breath away.Make sure that you get there early if you can. A good idea, if you are able to walk a bit of a distance, is to park at the car park at the 'foot' of the mountain and walk up to the mountain, it is a steep walk but good to get the blood flowing. A shuttle bus also runs from there. If you arrive late-ish parking may be a bit of a problem as this is a busy venue.Try to buy tickets online. We did not, and the queue for non ticket holders were over an hour to buy a ticket. We quickly jumped on the free wifi and bought a ticket online (you can pay with a non-SA credit / debit card without problems) and manage to jump into the online ticket queue. This made our wait go down to less than 20 minutes to get to the cable car queue.The staff was ever so friendly. Helpful and really made the experience that extra bit special. The cable cars rotate whilst going up and down the mountain - so no point to try and rush for an open window - it will come to you as long as you can stand near the outside part of the car.For those of you who are a bit afraid of heights - there is a seating area in the center of the car to sit on - it helps to make the ride go smoother.Once up on table mountain and being able to stabilize my legs the views were breath taking. Around every corner is a new amazing view of Cape Town and her surroundings.We saw Dassies and many lizards, the Dassies are wild animals but are rather use to us humans - but treat them with respect and don't feed them.A restaurant serves food once on the mountain top. Not the most amazing of food services but it sure filled the gaps!The ride down was just as breath taking as going up (I won't know about the going up to be honest as I could not watch, but got the courage to stand at the end whilst going down - it was amazing!).For the brave there is also a route to hike up the mountain - be prepared to have a good long hike, I reckon around two hours up. Summer time - make sure to take lots of sun cream - I looked like a delicious lobster after the day on the mountain.If you can, be sure to visit this wonderful place.

Spectacular views.. It's worth it to go up and see the view. The teens will want the pics for their Instagram! They could have done without the teeny gift shop, packed shoulder to shoulder at the top. Climb if you want, but the cable car is a less strenuous way to the top.Go early... before 9 and it shouldn't be more than a 5-min wait to go up and down.
Fast ride. Fast ride to the top, short quee of only 10 mins that was at 4pm, a lot busier at peak times. good views from rotating car

No wonder it is one of the 7 wonders. We visited Table Mountain for firts time with new cable cars. An amazing experience. Some advise - book ticket using on line booking service before you get there. There ate two line - one for those with E tickets and the other for those with none. We were worried that the line was so long that we were going to wait for hours - less than 30 minutes and we were on board. Friendly staff. Nice restaurant in top. Be prepared for sudden change in weather - rain wind cold (chilly) and hot on same day. If you do feel up to a different experience - take a walk to the top and use cable act to come down - must start early as it is not an easy stroll. If you like hiking then walking up on one of various routes is worth it. Make sure people know which route you take and when you depart. Don't forget enough water and food should you need to take shelter.

Clouds... . You cant control the weather.... And even getting into the cable car on a sunny day doesn't mean when you get to the top its going to be the same weatherSo i arrived in clouds But i still really enjoyed it, a very strange feel to know your very high up and be in whiteout Ill have to go again before i leaveStill the revolving cable car was a nice touch

Need to visit if you are in Capetown . Very good scene of bay and all city around. But you need to be lucky and need to call cable car before arrive if its working or not. If its windy or foggy its not working. And also need to add that fog can suddenly arrive :)

A quick Way to the Top. The Aerial Cableway is a fabulous way to get up to Table Mountain. It's quick, quite, very smooth and comfortable. The views are outstanding all the way on both directions. Dont miss it.

Terrifying! . Amazing trip up table mountain - although I'd recommend booking tickets online before you go - even that morning as we had to wait around an hour to get tickets and then queue but the lane for "online purchased tickets" was totally empty and those people went straight into the queue for entering the cable car - very informative and great trip - although absolutely terrifying- especially the bit near the top as it basically goes vertical!!

Eh. Since we hiked up and I died a million times, I was really happy that the cableway was an option to get down. But it a bit expensive and was nothing special. Simply a means to get up/down the mountain. If you're able bodied and have the time I absolutely recommend just taking the time to hike up and walk down. Otherwise this is a fine option. They pack people in pretty tight though and the floor rotates so you kinda have to "fight" to get the most out of the ride for views.

Wonderful views of the Cape of Good Hope!. A taxi ride up to the tramway takes you past some very nice homes. Then for 240 Rands (about $15) you ride up the aerial tramway to the top of Table Mountain. Once on top, there is a refreshment stand and washrooms, and a long loop hiking trail takes you all around the flat mountaintop. The rocky surface is inhabited by many black lizards sunning themselves . It can be hot and sunny, so wear a hat and sunblock.The views are spectacular -both down into Capetown and south to the Cape of Good Hope. Get there as early in the day as you can - by noon the lines are long.This is a must-see when in Capetown.
Head for heights?. A wonderful ride in the rotating gondola. Big queues so book your ticket on line. Good park and ride. Free
Well organized. Although the number of visitors wanting to get up the mountain is enormous, the organization is excellent and the staff very friendly.
Exquisite views . The cable car is very safe and stable, even in windy conditions. Beautiful views from the top. Loving the half-price after 6pm.

A Must Do. We went to cable mountain for sunset. The sunset was beautiful however, I'm not sure I would recommend going at that time because it was really cold during then and right after the sunset there was about a 45 min wait for the cable car to go down. If doing it again, I would choose the warm part of the day and when there is not that rush for the return trip down. Otherwise, it is a must do while in Capetown! Have some champagne while up at the top!

Cable car or hike.. This the main option. Buy your ticket ahead of time if going during busy time. Skip the queue. We didn't and waited 30 minutes to buy ticket and another 30 for cable car. It was a clear day so very busy.
A must see. It is very nice to go be foot but also the view from the aerial Cableway is a must when you visit Cape Town. Book your tickets online to save time. It can be very busy with a huge queue
Mr Mentor. Cape Town is the best town.The view are awesome unforgettable. Something not to be missed....A visited not not be missed....Its a must a BIG must see trip.

Cabling Table Mountain. I would have preferred to hike but due to the weather and the fact that my friends are not too enthusiastic about hiking, we went through the cable car. It was an awesome sight from the cable car and we were on top of the mountain within minutes, but it was particularly foggy up there so I could not particularly take pictures. Even though its half price to take the cable car at sometimes after 6pm, the view during the day or early evening would have been better.
A highlight. Loved the cable car ride. Loved the view. Loved the walk around the top of the mountain. Only disappointment is that we didn't see any dassies.

Fun day on Table Mountain. As a disabled person planning to travel on the cable car I was a little nervous before hand. The staff were so polite and helpful on seeing that I didn't walk very well and nothing was too much trouble. I cannot praise these young people enough.

Up Up and away. This has to be one of the greatest cableways in the world, climbing mountains is normaly the domain of specialist climbers, but this opens the mountain to all mankind. As the car assends the mountain the whole floor revolves to give a 360 degree panoramic view of Capetown. Then as you reach the top walk around the top of the mountain to get some great views of the whole Cape,

Table mountain offers amazing views! Do not miss the chance!. Went there by hop-on hop-off bus. Thought that there will be long queue but it took max.5 mins to buy tickets. Cable car wasnt too crowded, there were also open windows. Day was sunny and not windy.We walk the longest way and it was fantastic. Views are stunning and unforgettable. Table mountain is one of the world's greatest places to visit. Don't miss it!

Fantastic views. Absolute world class cable way, the cable car is very modern with revolving floor which allows you to take in a 360 view during your trip up Table Mountain. Once at the top the views are breathtaking and definitely worth the wait.Be aware that if you do go during mid morning to late afternoon that you will have a wait to get up and down the mountain.So if you are not one for standing in line then be there early for the first trip up at 8am this will ensure that you dot. Have to wait to long.

Beautiful. One of the world's greatest places to visit and I've been everywhere.Just go and spend the whole day there in a wind free Cape Town day.Picnic, walk, hike, meditate, explore.Unbelievable even after I've been over 30 times!

Spectacular. We went early to avoid the queues. Weather was perfect, views were splendid. The staff were great and looked really pleased to see everyone. Though I am sure they see thousands if tourists every day, they made you feel special.
Awesome View. The view is awsome at the top. The cable train could be scary sometimes but once you reach the top its breath-taking...
Wonderful world wonder . The views are magnificent from the top. The cable ride up is fun and scary. It took us a few days to get up there as the cable cars don't go up if the winds are too strong.

An amazing experience. The only negative that I can think of is the waiting prior to getting into the cable car. (queues are painful) The new cars are stable and spacious, and the slow revolve allows for spectacular views. It is advisable to pre-book online.

Well worth it.. It,s 240 rand for under 60 year olds and 100 rand for older people. The open top bus tour stops here. The walk to the top would take 2 and a half hours so our guide said. The cable car takes around 60 people at a time so things move well. The floor spins slowly so everyone gets to see the views. We loved the trip.

Straight up!. The cableway is an efficient way to reach the top of Table Mountain.The last trip down was at 7.30 pm, and the impression was given that there was only one car going down at this time. We rushed and missed the sunset we had come to see, only to discover that the cableway kept running until all people were tranported to the base.The rotating floor gave an excellent view, and the driver was very friendly.An experience not to miss whilst in Cape Town.
Very efficient and great views. The cable car revolves so you get a great view no matter where you are. It runs efficiently and feels very safe

Great vantage point for the surrounding area!. GO early to avoid crowds. Watch the weather, because the do not run on windy days, so take advantage of the nicer days to plan your trip here.There is a snack bar and shop at the top

Recommended by Lion World Travel. The Cable Car that takes you up Table Mountain is large and holds quite a few people. The inside floor turns as you ride up and down so that you can see all vistas. It is not for the faint of heart for it travels quite quickly and it almost looks like you will crash into the face of the stone mountain when you reach the top! But it is a well made mode of transportation and is safe and definitely worth the ride! Make sure you book the tickets beforehand through the Internet site or your travel agent for the lines to buy tickets were very long. I do want to mention here that our travel agency, Lion World Travel, did an amazing job at booking everything for our trip! Laurandie du Preez, our agent, was amazing and very professional, answering all my questions quickly, and just ensuring that every hotel, every tour, every detail was done to perfection! I'd definitely recommend using her for your South African travel arrangements!

Beautiful view. We had the perfect weather for our cable ride to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car rotates 360 degrees as it makes it way to the top. The day was sunny with a slight breeze...very unusual for the unpredictable Table Mountain weather.

"An absolute MUST for sure". You may experience a long wait but the rotating cable car takes 60 at a time & it is worthwhile. The 360 degree view while ascending is awesome. There are many attractions on top as well as a restaurant. You can easily spend the day there, so bring along a hat, jacket, water bottle & sunscreen.

Amazing view of the City. Went up the cable car - 360 degree from the cable car really stunning and were fortunate enough to take our picnic up and watch the sunset -couldnt have chosen a better night on the 22nd February, even though there were a lot of visitors, we had a wonderful spot and were fortunate enough after the sun set over Camps Bay way to look towards Devils Peak and see the Full Moon rising. Awesome sight.

Exciting Ride up. Its worth taking the ride up table mountain on the cableway. Nice views of Capetown as the cablecar goes up.Watch out for bad/windy weather as the cableway does not operate under those conditions.

Take the Table Mountain Aerial Tram. If you really want to experience the beauty of Capetown, take the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. I recommend taking the bus or taxi and arriving early to beat the crowds. There is a charge, but it's well worth the cost. The views are spectacular. Try to avoid a cloudy day so you can capture the full panoramic view of the region. It's very special.
Oh the view!. It's worth the 240R per person for the ride up and down. The cable car rotates so everyone gets a panoramic view

Best piece of advice: GO EARLY or GO LATE!. Hiked up on India Venister trail early in the morning around 6 am and then went down the cable car tram around 9-10 am. We watched as the later the morning got, the more people came and the longer the line. Hence, come and go early! or go later on in the day after the crowds. When we hiked later that week, the line was SO long and in the hot sun so take this advice to go early/ late!

View from the tabletop. What a wonderful afternoon we spent on Table Mountain. Getting to the top was by Cable car. The 360 degree view was amazing. Once we got to the top we walked from one side to the other , seeing Camps Bay down below and on the other Capetown itself. We were lucky because the mist cleared off the top for the clear view in the afternoon.

Fabulous Views. Even though we had pre-booked tickets we had quite a long wait for the cable car but when we arrived back down around 1.30 p.m. there was no queue at all!The cable car holds around 60 people and rotates. The ride is very smooth and the views on the way up are stunning, even more so from the top.There are lots of places to walk and enjoy the many different views.

Must do in Cape Town!. I was fortunate to take the cable car up to see the sunset (which ended the end of February). The views from Table Mountain are spectacular. You can see Robbens Island, Lion's Head and other fantastic views from that vantage point. If you walk around, you are bound to see some rodent type creatures running around called 'dussies'.
