The ride up and down the mountain is an experience with the floor rotating 360 degrees allowing everyone to get a view.This is a must when traveling to Cape Town.

Easy way to go up or down. We climbed up Table Mountain and decided not to walk down but take the Cableway. This cableway is going often up and down and gives everyone the opportunity to reach the top of Table Mountain!
nice ride up and down Table Mountain. Be sure to get your ticket online to prevent having to queue up twice. Try to go up as early in the day as possible. Wonderful

Exhilirating. This is a must when visiting Cape Town. The cable car is new and big. You can see the whole of cape Town and all the mountains that surround it, from up there.There are paths that you can walk on across the whole mountain top.
Safe slow due to amount of visitors. Wonderfull to see one of the wonders of the world lately. Wonderfull sight seeing from the top of Table mountain.

Birthday treat. Booked on line to avoid the queue.Went up on the cableway to celebrate a sisters birthday.( it's free on your birthday) Four old ladies. Staff very friendly and helpful. Beautiful views with a sunset and champagne Lovely experience

Breathtaking Cape Town. A must do when visiting Cape Town. You'll get to see the Mother City in all it's glory. Make sure you don't leave it too late as you'll need a day when it's not too windy to go up on the cable car and they close it down when the wind gets too strong (which happens quite often in summer).

It is Heaven on Table Mountian. Any visitor coming to the beautiful city of Cape Town must make sure to schedule a trip up Table Mountain in the cable car. The views are breathtaking with the city unfolding below, down to the beaches and out into the endless blue ocean. For the more energetic traveler, hike up and take the cable car down. I recommend booking tickets online to avoid queues.

Great if your time is to limited to hike up!. Its a great way to experience the mountain if you don't have the timme (or physical ability) to hike up. Its fairly pricey, especially for locals, and the queues can get quite bad, but the view from the top is spectacular. I still prefer Hiking up though.
Mr . Efficient one of 7 new natural wonders of the world a Must see Make sure you do this as you arise as if windy the cable car does not ride and you may regret not having done it first

Day visit Table Mountain. Always magical to be on top of Table Mountain. Scenery wonderful, views spectacular. A must on any visit to Cape Town. Just check the weather to make sure you get the best benefit.
Amaaazin 😍. Dont miss table mountain tour!!!! One of the best tours....its better if you take it full day tour just for table mountain. ENJOY ❤

Great view. The easiest way to get to the top, it also offers a great view over the bay thanks to the rotating cabin. If you are not about a tough hiking, this is strictly recommended to enjoy the awesome view from the top

Fantastic views dependant on the weather. Buy tickets on line to save queuing and check the website before setting off to make sure that it is open. It may be clear to see from the City, but high winds at higher altitude make close the cable car. Tickets have a 7 day validity and can be refunded if not used. One of the wondrs of the world - has to be visited whilst in Cape Town.

Lovely sights and activity. Good place to go for a family activity or picnic. Spectacular views, clean facilities and cool souvenir store. You need to be careful during the summer as it can get very hot.

BEAUTIFUL EXPERIENCE. the experiance of being in the cable and the spectacular view of cape town is out of this world. i will go there anytime. i had the greatest time the employee and staff take care of you from the tickets office to until you are back is like you are talking with the same person thats how awesome they are.

Slick and organised. Simple and easy trip up - the inside of the cabin rotates so everyone gets a window for a brief view as you go up and down. Choose a clear day obviously however the cable car does shut down in high winds for safety reasons and this can spring up without notice. If its clear NOW, then get up as tomorrow it may be closed and the best plaid plans for mice etc ..... aft gan aglae !

wonderful experience in the air before landing on the great Table mountain.. It was awesome riding up the cable way.Restaurants up the mountain are fantastic.Tips when going up the mountain please do carry a jersey/track suit especially for kids.

Brilliant views. This is a Cape Town must. There is inexpensive public transport available from the MyCiti bus service to get you to the booking office at the base of the cableway.Make sure you have a jersey, as it can get a bit fresh on top of the mountain.Take a camera.

A must for a sunny day. Book on line to avoid the queue for tickets. Swift and efficient dispatch but be warned if you suffer from vertigo the cable car revolves so you have to look out at some stage. Great views from the top, allow more time than you might expect.

Great attraction, stunning views. Well worth the queues! We arrived early and was at the top on the mountain within an hour but it was very busy when we left a couple of hours later. The most fantastic views over Cape Town, lovely to walk around and a good coffee shop too! A must on any tourists list of things to do in CT, loved it!

Hot and busy. The lines were long, waiting in the heat difficult. Dealing with the forced photo shoot was extremely annoying... They slow down the lines with their officious manner, instead of making it optional. This is an archaic "service".. More like an opportunity to fleece tourists.The pricing is also too high. There should be differential pricing for South Africans. The system of selling tickets is very slow. Just put up a vending machine. This place needs a serious rethink to get it in touch with the 21st century and international standards.

Amazing Amazing Amazing. I absolutely loved being on top of table mountain. It was breathtakingly beautiful and very relaxing. My advice would be to go as early as you can to avoid queues and crowds. This activity of on my list of "MUST DO'S" in Cape Town!
Try to climb the mountain!!!!. The teleferic is just a moment and is ok but if you want to enjoy te view, climb up the mountain. You wont regret!!! The view upthe mountain is just amazing!!!
Awesome. Best day ever, totally awesome experience. The views are just magnificent. Excellent restAurant at the top of table mountain
Great view . One of the place you need to see if you are going to Cape town. Just keep in mind that it can be pretty crowded. Make sure to get tickets in advance.
Amazing views!. Love the journey up and down the mountain; cleverly designed with the rotating floor so all get 360 degree views on both journeys. Just be prepared for queues... in both directions

retirement trip. this is a must do experience in CT. the large gondolas travel up and down the mountain all day from 0800 to dusk. the also revolve so that passengers get a 360 degree view of the mountain and unfolding cityscape as they ascend the 4-5 minute trip. One tip; buy your tickets from hotels or other dealers before arriving to avoid the queues
No problem. Was worried about the cable car as am scared of heights but was reassured and didn't find it a problem in the end. No bumps, very smooth quick ride, amusing operator!

Do the table by the cable, but.... ...expect the warnings on the queue to be true...but a must do for the view! Well worth the wait, and it did look like if you go at the best time of day when it is cooler, you will be waiting with everyone else for your turn - go later in the heat and the queues were definitely shorter...

Great views over Cape Town. We went early in the morning and out tour guide got tickets so limited queue. Am told it can be horrendous! Lift up to the cable car. We were asked to pose for a photo but no information about what this was or cost so didn't. Regretted this as it was done in front of green screen and finished photo was good. It would be better to explain this up front! Ride up and back good and the floor of the car revolves so you get all round view. View great at top well worth the trip.

A Great Attraction But Beware !. Much has already been said about Table Mountain Cableway and there is no doubt it provides great views of Cape Town however, always purchase your ticket in advance and check the queuing time to get on the cable car - there can sometimes be a wait of 2 hrs to get on !! If travelling there by car there is now a car park that provides a free shuttle to the base station. Most people suggest the best time to visit is early morning as you can beat the tour bus crowds but mid to late afternoon can also miss them however, although you may not have to queue to get up you can sometimes spend 30 - 60 minutes queuing to get down !! Finally do check the cableway is open before travelling there as it closes when it is too windy or if there is too much cloud. Despite this it is worth the wait as there are various walks around the top and fantastic photo opportunities.

Pending on the weather. Get there early! Especially if the lift is closed for a few days — I waited 2 hrs in queue. Beautiful view of Cape bowl. Follow the Twitter feed for closures or openings since the lift can close in windy conditions. Follow @TableMountainCa for status updates.
Trip to South Africa. We booked our tickets on line and were able to use the cableway very quickly without much queuing, the whole experience was very enjoyable and a great start to our trip.

On top of the world!. Well worth the trip up in the revolving cable car for the superb views once you are up there. It can get very busy so you often have to queue to get in the cable car but they run regularly so you don't have to wait too long.
Easy route. We used the cableway to get down the mountain after climbing up. It only takes around 5 minutes and has wonderful views.

Not for the faint hearted!. The queues can be very lengthy as the cableway can shut due to wind, and as a result people and tours have to re-arrange their visits. The cars can take around 60 people and revolves as it moves so you don't have to fight for the best place. It becomes very steep and almost vertical near the top. Fantastic experience!

Easiest way to get up Table Mountain. Been up and down the cable car many times. Costs around R 250 for the trip up and down (both included in price). The price is really worth the view and it is much easier than hiking up the mountain. Be sure to purchase tickets online or you will have to follow ridiculously long queues during peak season.
I was there !. For the astonishing view, for the best spot, to be able to said : "I've been there, did that & get the t.shirt".
Amazing experience. Great disabled handling. Amazing views and a must for every visitor to Cape Town.The staff were so helpful, they are clearly very well trained and customer focused. Well done.
A must for visitors . I decide to travel via City Sightseeing. No parking issues ;) Queue was long but moved fast. Friendly staff all around and what a view!

Stunning Views. Booked on-line on the day and saved queueing for tickets and then joining another queue for the cableway. Amazing views and fabulous experience, even for one nervous disposition when it comes to heights. But overcome those fears and it is well worth it.

If you want appreciate Cape Town take trip up Table Mountain. The all round view is something to behold. The fauna & flora on the mountain explains just why Cape Town has been declared one of the wonders of the world.Absolutely wonderful site for walkers to enjoy the beautifully created walkways created for the not so active walkers has been well thought out with plenty of places to relax after working up a good sweat. The restaurants are geared for for all tastes.
so memerizing. the day was just perfect no wind very sunny and it was worth the price, the restaurant on top has an excellent choice of food to pick from

Best Views of Cape Town. Awesome vies of cape Town, a must when you visit the Mother City. Looking at the mountain below you do not fully appreciate the size of the mountain, this can only be truely appreciated by getting up there. Plenty to look out for while you are there, you will not be at all disappointed.
Amazing views. When in Cape Town this is a must experience - the views are spectacular and you get a great sense of how Cape Town has developed over the centuries - highly recommended.

View to enjoy. Awesome, I had the opportunity to take the sundown trip. You need to experience it to know what people are talking about. The staff, service everything is on par. Can not miss this, it is a must when you visit Cape Town in the summer.

Great experience . It is better to go up early in the morning, reason being you can not trust the weather it can just change in metter of minutes and the cable is closed if there is a fog.Please buy the tickets online this will save you time, I saw signs on the que communicating the time you are away from the ticket booth and you can be in a que up to 45 min. When I was on top of the mountain I learned that there is a foot path that will take you up to 3hrs depending on your pace and used cable on your way down or vice versa.You are allowed to bring your own refreshments as the tea rooms are expensive, the food is prepared in the shop/ restaurant in the mountain is super, carry some 5 rand coins for binoculars or bring your own. The flowers flowra is amazing and it is believed to be found in the ocean and only in the table mountain in SA and that support the argument that the mountain was under the sea at one point.Please bring 3l of water for drinking purpose.The is a free tour for kinds and family but did not make use off.

Go early. You can't go to Cape Town and not go up Table Mountain. And it is dramatic and exciting. So a few tips: check the weather and go early as cloud comes in in the afternoon; buy your ticket before you go, either through a travel agent or as part of the Hop-on, Hop-off red bus service. You'll avoid the queues.Believe it or not the souvenir shop at the top is cheaper than some of those in town! Take water, the altitude dehydrates you.If you've got a snazzy camera take photos, but otherwise buy some postcards or a book, the pix on your phone just don't do the views justice.Enjoy.

A Must when going to Cape Town, even for one day!. This is an iconic place that you must see, being one of the Official Wonders of Nature in Africa. It gets crowded, so book online or well in advance. The trip is short and has a WoW. The park at the top is very well organised and the views fabulous. Taka coat at all times since the wind can be cold.

One way ticket to heavan. Great trip up, It seems to be very busy at times and is only operates in clear wind free weather, your hotel can check if it is open for you or check their website if you have Internet access. Buy a return ticket or you can walk up and get a ticket down at the top, or buy a ticket up and walk down, you need to be fit, have good footwear and plenty of water which ever way you walk. Check closing times for return ride.
Breath-taking. We arrived there at around 11 am. The weather was perfect and people who go there are very friendly. It was a nice experience
Family time. We walked up Platteklip Gorge, checked the dams, had a drink at the nice and busy restaurant and took the cable car down.

A must do for visitors to Cape Town.. We did not pre book so we waited for more than 2 hours. I recommend prebooking now but we didn't as sometimes it doesn't even open due to high winds. On our visit it only opened at 11am due to the wind. Once on the Cable Car though it's fantastic. It revolves as it's ascending and descending so everyone gets to see the views which are spectacular. On top of the mountain you can walk all around and see so much in every direction. We actually spent 1 and 1/2 hours up there.

Fantastic View!. The cable car up the mountain rotates 180 as you ascend and descend the mountain. We saw a climber on the mountain on the way up. The car holds up to 50 people. Get your video cameras ready before you board!
On top of the (Cape Town) world. Well worth the queues, & a lot easier than walking up although I'd recommend that too... obviously a bit touristy, but wow, so worth it !

Strong winds spoils visit . We came at 8am and it took forever to get to the parking spot from Noordheok. When we got there the park rangers told us today the ride is suspended till the wind died down and when we ask what time they think it will take the whole day. So next time please call or check online before going down. But there is plenty other places you can visit within vicinity for other recreational activities.

cableway the easy way to go on top. If the table cloth is not covering the table mountain, it is a must to go on top of table mountain and enjoy the gorgeous view. Climb up or go by cableway. The cableway the easy way to go on top. There are specials available e.g. sunset special check the cableway website for these specials, operating hours, weather conditions and waiting times.

Wow... A Must do at Sunset. Plenty of info on here so a brief review from me this time. The best advice we were given was to visit Table Mountain at SUNSET... We went up around 7pm and frankly the views were stunning. We had no problem getting a late car up, no queue and it was half the normal price. Take a bottle of wine with you and enjoy...simply enjoy...

"Raise" you to the top!. The ride to the top is so breathtakingly beautiful! We were lucky as we took one of the last rides up because of the weather. So, a tip to you is, take advantage of the good weather or you might miss out on a beautiful and majestic views. There is a small restaurant and cool to try, little pricey but good food! Take your time, go early and make it a day trip. We were a little rushed as the weather cut it short for us and the next days the only way up was by hiking it but we didn't have the right gear or time for that. But had we had the time it would have probably been as majestic as our time there!
Fun. We took the cable car down after hiking up Table Mountain. The floor rotates, so you get a 360 view of the mountain and scenery.

Sunset from Table Mountain is an awesome experience. We've been during the day and enjoyed the walk around but nothing beats sunset up the top. Get back to the cable car as soon as you can after the sun sets though as there's not much time to get on the last cable car down..and it gets crowded
Great ride !. Enjoyed the cableway up to the top of Table Mountain, especially as the revolving floor gave a 360 degree view for everyone on the way up, and down.

Table toppings... Book your tickets a few days in advance or you will probably queue for 30-40 mins....worth it though. If you don't fancy the drive - use über taxis - they were a god send for my whole tour
Top of the World view. Table mountain is een must see location. From above you can look into different directions and have a perfect view over Cape Town

Don't miss this trip!. Table Mountain has got to be the highlight of any visit to Cape Town. We didn't book the cableway in advance in case it was cloudy on top but arrived around 10am on a Wednesday morning and there was no queue. Lots of cars were parked on the steep access road so a good tip is to drive up to the top past the cable car and part on the flat or catch the shuttle bus. The mountain is just over 1,000m high and the trip up is short but stunning - the cable car revolves as you go up. At the top the views are amazing. We then did the one-hour (each way) walk out to the end of the mountain which is mostly flat, except for one steep gorge. Sensible footwear recommended! You can also walk all the way down but having done the walk along the top we didn't bother - the info says you need to know what you're doing and be careful. You can follow the cableway page on Facebook and get updates on the conditions: the wind can get up suddenly and then the cableway stops running. There is a cafe and shop at the top (naturally) and lots of people seemed to have come up for lunch - this option would suit the less adventurous.
EASY WAY TO GET UP THE MOUNTAIN. It goes up and comes down too quickly so you don't really get to enjoy it that much. I does however slowly rotate.
Table Mountain. A must on a clear day, sun screen and jacket in case it is cold. Don't be put off by queues, buy your tickets in advance, on line or on the red bus.

Spectacular views.... If you plan to hike Table Mountain, I would suggest the 3 hour walk up and take the cable car back down. We did it the other way around and are still hobbling around after 3 days....it was a killer walking down the mountain.

Excellent -- go early for sunset. This is a must do in Cape Town. Try to schedule your trip on the cable car so that you are on top of Table Mountain at sunset. You can purchase tickets ahead of time online, so you won't have to wait in line. Bring your camera. Leave time to explore the top of the mountain too. There is a gift shop, coffee and food at the top, as well as bathrooms.

Awesome views and weather at the top. Instead of driving, we took a cab to Table Mountain. We had a short wait in a line, which was also a bonus as we got to take some good pics before we went up. Everything runs so smoothly, from the staff to the lines to the cable car which revolves to give you views from all around.The cable car ride and views going up and down were amazing. Walked around a bit. There is a cafe/restaurant and shop at the top. Tip: Get your shopping done at the top or even at the bottom shops as you come out after your tour if you want specific Cape Town or Table Mountain souvenirs. I couldn't find anything similar in town. We walked around a bit, took lots of pictures and enjoyed the views. We were visited by several dassies who came out to us and sat quite patiently waiting for their photos to be taken. Cute! Please remember not to touch or feed them. Don't forget to take something warm to wear when up. The temperatures really are much, much cooler than down below. A must do! :-)

No waiting today, memorable visit, always recommended!. I'd bought tickets online. Not the cheapest purchase, but compared to experiences abroad, it was totally on par, if not slightly cheaper. My husband is on crutches due to surgery and the staff were very helpful, allowing us to park close to the entrance and letting us use the elevator to the entrance and exit instead of the stairs. We did not wait for a cable car going up and probably had a three minute wait going down. We arrived at 14:30 on a Saturday. Once at the top, there were no queues in the restaurant, bathrooms or shops. Obviously we would recommend this attraction-it's well-signed, well organised, it's clean, the views are unbeatable, the staff are friendly, the dassies are cute. Remember the sunhats and sunblock in summer, as well as water if you're not keen on buying any.

A view not to be missed. A visit to Table Mountain is a must do if you find yourself in Cape Town. The glide up in the rotating cabin is spectacular. I am not a lover of heights but the ride was so smooth and quick and the view amazing.

Unless you are fit enough to climb!!. The only sensible way to get to the top. Ride up takes about 5 minutes and the pod rotates slowly giving panoramic views.Purchase tickets online before going as there are 2 queues, those with tickets and those buying on the day. Those with pre-bought tickets get to go up a lot quicker.

A good way to the top.. Don't drive to the car park walk up from Cape Town it only takes about 40 minutes and you get to see more and different views of the mountain.On the way back stop off at all the coloured houses in the Muslim area.The cable car gets you to the top very quickly so spend a good half day at the top.R200 per person.

Gazing out into wonder. Visiting the top of Table Mountain is an fantastic experience, Looking over the mother city and further out of clear days is an unbelievable sight to behold. Travel with comfortable shoes and there's a fair amount of walking involved once on top, a camera is of course a must, Tip: try and book on line so that you don't have to stand in the sometimes very long and hot line - advanced bookings getting priority - or arrive very early if you can't book on line.

A must in Cape Town. Going up table mountain is a must, and worth the money. We had our 80plus parents with us this time, and the staff was extremely helpful.Hint: get online tickets to skip the queue.

Easy way to get on top of the mountain, but ....... When in Cape Town one should go and see Table Mountain and going up in the Cableway is definitely part of the experience.We parked our car at the Lower Table Mountain parking area and took the free shuttle bus [MyCity line 110] up to the entrance and back down again. This is a nice service but be aware that the bus only goes every 15 minutes or so and stops to run altogether around 18.30 or 19.00 - miss the last bus and you will have to walk back down [or take a cab].If you haven't reserved tickets online the wait to purchase them can be quite long. You will be waiting under a roof with watersprayers [for cooling] which makes it not too unpleasant but still, pre-booking is much easies and faster.Once you have your tickets you will queue up again to get into the Cableway and that can also be quite a wait [with no cooling sprayers].I am not 100% sure but I think the cableway cars [there are two inservice] can carry up to 65 people per ride and take about 10 minutes to go up to the top. On a busy day your wait can be quite long but you will be rewarded with incredible views from the top and the ride up itself is really nice - the inside of the cabin is actually rotating and makes roughy a 180 degree turn on the way up/down and you get to see wonderful views - a quick tip: when getting into the car to go up find a place immediately to the right of the entrance, that way you will have the view of Cape Town and the Bay rather than the mountain.
Cableway. Lovely panoramic views as you head up and down the mountain. Breath taking scenery and a comfortable ride,
Awesome. Unbelievable. Beautiful. Very impressed with the organisation of large numbers of tourists. Go as early in the day as possible to avoid massive crowds.

Wonderful 360 degree views of Cape Town. Purchasing tickets - If you decided to catch the railcar to the top, I'd advise purchasing your tickets online prior. By doing so, you get placed in a a special queue and can save 45 min - 1 hour. On a busy day, i got in the special queue by purchasing my tickets online. It still took about 40 min to get to to the top, but it would have been even longer had I not done so.What to do at the top - Once you get to the top, the areas to the left and right of the cablecar offer scenic views below. If you have a clear day, take advantage; you never know when the mountain will be shrouded in clouds or high winds. In addition, there is a decent cafe that serves food and alcohol with some of the best views in town. Additionally, there are several hiking trails, I believe 3 in total. You can go around the entire perimeter and that will take you slightly over 2 1/2 hours. The signs all indicate that the trails are easy, but I found some parts to be of medium skill so stay within your comfort zone.I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at the top. Saw many wonderful and scenic views and saw a lot of flora including the King Protea!
A must do adventure. Fantastic experience! A must do/bucket list experience. The views from Table Mountain are exceptional and the trip will live long in the memory.

Breathtaking views. Provided it is not too windy, this is something which should be on everyone's bucket list. To view Devil's Peak, Table Bay, Signal Hill and the Twelve Apostles from this vantage point is a sight never to be forgotten.

Outstanding . Wow this is an amazing experience and what a blessing to have it right on our door step. The most spectacular views. Absolutely breathtaking. Very well managed and run. Staff are amazing.

Easy ride. Well it certainly beats the long walk up the mountain in the beating sun. It almost felt too easy. Very professional and safe, and really enjoyed the revolving floor so that everyone has a chance to see the views on the way up.

Fabulous!!! . We bought our tickets online which was fabulous! The lady asked us if we had tickets, we said yes and walked right through. It would have been an hour wait otherwise! Anyways, walked right through and got on the cableway. Up, up and away.....The whole unit is stationary, but inside there is a table that turns slowly so you get a 360 degree view as you go up to the top of Table Mountain!It was very cool and I was amazed at how fast it went up to the top and how I didn't feel nauseated with the slow turning. Bonus!Buy advanced tickets online and enjoy!!!!

Breathtaking Views. This is a must-see while visiting Cape Town. Plan to go on a day when there is excellent visibility so you can take in views from afar while riding up the mountain in the cable car.

Always amazing . A visit to the top of Table mountain via the cable car is always amazing.I went after 6 pm .They have a half price sunset special.I feel the best time to be up on table mountain is sunset.The view of sunset over camps bay is just spectacular.

Stunning views-completely breathtaking-very relaxing and peaceful-well managed-safe. Must check weather first though as it's often far too windy or cloudy-well worth a visit-lovely walk on the top-restaurant and gift shop

Worth the money!. We took the cableway to the top of Table Mountain and it was truly the way to go. We went later in the day, around 4pm and there's wasn't much of a line that time of day. I loved the way the cableway turned as we went up. It was fun to get views all around as we ascended. I can't imagine hiking this, but I wanted to at least take the cableway up just in case we had to hike down (which could happen if the cloud cover gets to be severe and they can't take trips down.
On top. Such Amazing views And Great to have The 360 degrees View ... It's a must to do If you visiting Cape Town!!! It was my 5 or 6 Time And it's Never boring!!
Fun and good view. Book in advance to avoid long queues. Try to get a position near the glass walls, otherwise you may not see much during its very short route. Looks safe.

Smooth ride to the top. Very smooth and efficient, revolving ride to the top of Table Mountain. Best to get hotel to check weather forecast (no cloud) and book tickets ahead to avoid queues. Cost around £12pp in Feb 2016. Arrival around 9.30am ensures fewer tourists.

A Rare Revolving Ascent !. The cable car holds approximately 25 people, in a semi-open air configuration. So if you get a standing spot hear the perimeter (not in front of a window), you will have the best unobstructed view during the ascent/descent. The cable care makes a complete 360 degree rotation during the ascent/descent, but bear in mind that a some points during this ride, you will be facing cables or the shear mountain side.The ride is very swift (2-3 minutes), and very steep, which adds to your exhilaration. If you miss some photo ops on the way up, you will get even better views on the Table Mountain walks.

A must do when you visit Cape Town. I have to say I hate heights and I was really worried about doing this. However, it really was worth doing and I am so glad I overcame my fears. I would recommend you book online to save the queues. We went on New Year's Eve and it was very busy. The queues for non ticket holders was almost an hour wait and we actually booked ours while we were waiting in line using our mobile phone.There was the usual rush to get the best view and I loved the fact that the floor rotates so everybody in the car gets a great view and it is not just blocked by a few. The views from the top are just amazing, what a spectacular place and as it was so clear we could see for miles. It was probably a bit more commercial than I would have liked with souvenir shops and a cafe but I would really recommend this attraction and it's not expensive. The only downside is the chaos to get back down. No queues and lots of pushing and shoving to get to the front. Quite frightening when you have small children and should be better managed.
Never disappointed . Always amazing. Kids loved it. Not totally overpriced in terms of food and drinks up on the mountain either

Cable ride to Table Mountain. This is more than a cable ride! Large cable car that rotates so everyone gets a great view of mountain and Cape Town. Get there early to avoid crowds. Need to watch weather since wind will close down the cable cars. Top of mountain great for walking around, little cool and windy.

Amazing how fast it travels. In my opinion if you want to see the amazing views from the top of Table Mountain, this is the only way to go as I am not a fan of hiking. There were no ques when we arrived just before sunset in Mid-January, but our cable car was full. It is constantly turning so you will always get your chance to see the different views as you are traveling up the side of the mountain. After sunset we waited in line for 45 minutes to travel back down the mountain.

World Class and Worth It. You think can it really be so great. You've seen it all - even flown over Everest so what can this mountain show you? Answer: one of the most beautiful cities in the world - right in the middle of a mountain chain - not an ordinary combo.Do plan to go early in your stay, because it can close down sometimes for days if its cloud table cloth socks in the mountain. If you book early you have a good chance of getting to this don't miss attraction. The tickets are usually good for several days. And check on the website that it is open when you are actually heading there. Things change quickly. And be sure to check if the site tells you it's now closed. An hour later you may be on the way up,

Fantastic service; quick and efficient. If like me, you aren't likely to walk up Table Mountain, the cable car provides you a quick and relatively cheap way to reach summit.The cable cars take less than five minutes to reach the top and as they rotate offer everyone some picturesque views. This must be on your bucket list when in Cape Town.
Way to travel. Revolving cable car up and down to give you a full 360 degree aerial view of the mountainside. Good value for money and frequent use of car.

Carpe Diem!. We were advised to go for this as soon as we were happy the day was clear and this proved excellent advice. We also got there early to beat the crowds and picked up our tickets at the kiosk (240 Rand pp return). I have to say I don't do heights so I was happy to get hold of a handrail looking out over the horizon. It was then that the guard announced that the floor revolved and handrails should not be held. So you get the full 360 experience on the way up (and down). The cars can take a good number of people and I wouldn't have liked to be in a full one (so again glad we got there early).There're plenty of walks and excellent viewpoints at the top and it is possible to steer away from crowds.We were lucky we went when we did, as the cablecars are at the mercy of both the wind and low cloud covering the top. So if in doubt check it's running before you head there.

Spectacular journey to the top and back. It costs just £8 return to go to the top of Table Mountain on this cableway. The gondolas rotate as you ascend or descend, giving an ever changing view of the scenery. The cableway is busy, so go early or late to avoid having to queue.
The quick way to the top!!. You have to queue for some time in the summer season and it can be hot but the cable car is quick and you are able to take photos from all angles with the rotating floor.
A great view!!!. Need a clear, cloudless day, to fully appreciate the views at the top. You can walk up if you want to, rather than take the cable car

Don't miss this!. Going to the top of Table Mountain was a highlight of our trip to Cape Town. Don't miss this. The ride up is an attraction in and of itself.Remember: buy your ticket online in advance otherwise you will wait in 2 long lines instead of 1.Park on the lower part of the road, then take the free public bus up to the point where you pick up the cable car.

Its a must do really.. We were to told to visit Table Mountain at the first opportunity as it can be closed for days due to the wind. We went on a fine day, there was some cloud on part of the mountain but that was ok. We arrived at the Mountain using the red bus and we had pre booked tickets on the internet which meant no queing for tickets, I would recommend this as if the mountain has been closed then it gets really busy when it reopens. The cable car ride is smooth and does not last long for those who do not enjoy such rides. The views from the mountain are spectacular. It is one of those must do tourist things if you are in cape town.

Check the Website First to See if it is Running. Don't assume that because it is a clear day, the aerial cableway will be running. If it is windy up top, it will close temporarily. It is best to check the website before you go for both the operating status and the wait times. That said, this is as an absolute must-do for anyone visiting Cape Town as the views are spectacular. Note that if you go on line locally, you can purchase a ticket that is good for the entire day and it will cost less than if you purchase a morning or afternoon pass abroad.

Table Mountain. Very smooth ride, excellent idea with the revolving platform. Do make a point of getting there first thing, especially before the cruise ship hordes arrive, and book your tickets online beforehand!

Fantastic experience!. Go as soon as you possibly can! The cable car does close if its windy or very cloudy. Thankfully we took the trip on our first day when it was beautifully clear, We hopped straight on even though wed heard you sometimes had to queue. It was just wonderful and the views at the top are amazing. We wandered around a couple of the well sign posted routes and had lunch in the excellent café on top of the world! No trip to Cape Town could be complete with this visit!

Great way to get up table mountain. Great views on the way up to the top of table mountain. Great views on a clear day.mthis was one of our highlights of our vacation. It can get windy so take something warm to pop on at the top.

Check in advance if it is open as it is very weather dependent Book your tickets online in advance, you will still need. Check in advance if it is open as it is very weather dependentBook your tickets online in advance, you will still need to Queue but it should move fasterBring a sweater - it's chilly at the top, no matter how hot it is below!

Nature is unpredictable and will survive us all,...... My advice as I lived in Cape Town, do not buy the ticket in advance unless you know that Mother Nature will be good to you, that they won’t be any wind and that the view will be clear.Buy it a day before or on the day and get up early. In spring and wintertime, the light is the best in the morning. The queues are also not that long and while you wait (we waited 15 Minutes), you can get into contact with people and exchange experiences and ideas.The staff of the cableway has stringent orders and they do not take chances. It is for your own safety and interests as especially the winds can be very dangerous. Accept that we humans do not control Mother Nature.At the top the view is splendid and fully worth the time spend for the trip, you won’t regret it! Enjoy and plan at least five days in Cape Town.

On top of the world. If you are in Cape Town this ride to the top is a must. Amazing 360 degree views of the city, mountains and beaches. Grab a beer while on top and sit back and take it all in. It's one of the oldest mountain formations in the world.

Of course you are going up!. Delightful way to view the city. I suggest going early in your visit so you can get a bird's eye layout of the city to help you get your bearings. Also, don't go if too windy as they can shut down the cable while you are on top. Try to pick a clear day.

DEFINITELY AN ESSENTIAL THING TO DO WHILST IN CAPE TOWN.. We were quite surprised how short the "Cable Car ride" was, (approx 5 mins) to the top of Table Mountain, because when you drive to the base of the ride, you're already three quarters of the distance up from the city. Fantastic views from the top however, looking down over the city and beyond. The top of the mountain is more developed than I thought,( as far as footpaths etc were concerned) as I naively expected it would all still be in it's natural state.I suppose I was spoilt really, as I was so very fortunate to climb "Uluru", (Ayers Rock) in Australia a few years ago, before they stopped people from doing so, and so nothing I'm afraid, can or will, ever match that!

Watch the weather!. Just returned from Cape Town- wonderful place, but when you see Table mountain beautiful and clear, go, go, go!! Some people put it off until later in their holiday and its ' tablecloth' comes down and there's no way you can go up.We were there for 9 nights in February, their summer and only 2 days was it clear to go up, and boy did everyone and his wife go up on those 2 days!! Always,always book your ticket in line before, we did and it still took 1 and a half hours to get up, standing in 90degree heat (take a hat and sunscreen, we had to buy them there- we're now proud owners of a bush tucker man hat, a Cape Town baseball cap and an out of Africa straw Panama) It's fantastic when you get up there, a must do experience, but go in the afternoon on a good day, by the time we came down , the queues had gone and it would have taken you half an hour.

Completely amazing. The czar ride itself was breathtaking - but once on the top of the Mountain - words fail me - I acts lily felt on top of the world - it's called the 7th natural wonder of the Turks and I agree completely - it's a complete wonder - can't stress enough how glad I to have been able to see a sunset from such a unique position

Saves you a long climb. There was a long queue due to beautiful weather. A ticket bought in advance will save you a lot of time. Even so there will be a long time before reaching the top. The view is fabulous.

Takes you to the top. It's a cable car that spins around for great views and speeds you up to the top of Table Mountain. Well worth the price even if you do get crammed in. It holds 64 people. Try to get a spot by the window.

relaxed way to get up on table mountain. If you don't want to take the hike up the Table Mountain (which is quite high, no kidding...) this is a great alternative. I enjoyed it and felt like it was completely worth the price. You can get online reservation so you don't have to stand in line. The tickets can be scanned from your cell phone, so no printer needed.
Spectacular. It is what you expect but bigger! Watch out for queues in the summer and remember it is much colder at the top than it is at the bottom!

Just as the name says...flat mountain. If you decide to go make sure that you book tickets online. It will save you time.A gorgeous view of Cape Town from the table top mountain, the cafe at the top is good as well

Must Do Activity in CPT. The car rotates as you go up the mountain, very cool as everyone can get a great view during the trip to and from either top or land.The cableway is the best way to go as the experience is just fantastic however those adventurers you can hike up if you want. Very fortunate to have a beautiful day and just decided to go and the wait was short. Several pathways at the top I don't know what my expectations were..! Worthwhile when in Cape Town. I will do it over and over again....

A considerable disappointment. We had done all the right things and booked our tickets in advance, but that didn't save us from other tourists pushing and shoving, and a horrid experience in the cafe, which was just a scrum. The staff tried to put us off ordering coffee by saying there was a 15-minute wait; in fact, it was three minutes. There weren't enough chairs, and it was all pretty disagreeable. There are only four ladies' loos. We couldn't see anything due to the mist; the views were much better from the road on the way up. (One advantage is that you can get there using your Hop on Hop off bus ticket; but the tickets for the attraction itself were £12 each which was expensive.) The queue to get back down was very long; note that gondolas take 65 people,which I hadn't expected. Overall, very disappointing.

Quick, efficient and clean. We got there early, to avoid the queues. Trip up took about 5 minutes.Only issue I can see is if you suffer motion sickness. The gondola has a floor that rotates gently to give everyone a 360 view of the journey. A very good idea, but I have friends who might struggle with it.

One of Cape Town's must do attractions. This formidable transit system offers a unique and thrilling perspective of Cape Town. Table Mountain provides the base anchor for Cape Town and the stroll around the top provides spectacular views.The Cableway is well managed but make sure your tickets are purchased in advance as the ticket office at the mountain often has long lineups. Tickets may be purchase from most tourist information facilities or directly from the driver on the hop on/hop off busses.Lineups for trip back down can be a bit long so allow plenty of time if other appointments are planned. Also be prepared for a complete shutdown of the cable system if there are high winds.Do not pass up this attraction while in Cape Town.

View from the Top. I'm proudly South African & have not visited the cableway for a few years. I hosted some colleagues from the UK/Isle of Man/Colombia in Feb & another proud moment. It was a lovely day so the views were spectacular. What impressed me most was improvements that have been made over the years , easily accessible , guides to assist with parking & directing you to the right place. Fortunately we had no q's as it was a Thursday afternoon , week days generally a bit quieter than weekend. The cablecar runs about every 10mins so not a long wait at all ,going up or coming down. The ride is pretty smooth , the floor rotates so it gives everyone an opportunity to get that special picture of beautiful Cape Town. Once on top there are walkways to guide you all over the mountain, wheelchair friendly as well, A couple of shops & a pub to pass away the time while enjoying views of different parts of Cape Town. You can't say you have been to Cape Town if you have not been up Table Mountain. There are also fantastic views of Robben Island , great photo opportunities , those postcards moments.

Fantastic, if it's not windy.. This is really a 5 star event which can only be given 4 stars if you try and go up the mountain on windy days....WIND = NO CABLE-CAR!! If your time in Cape Town is limited and conditions are windy or overcast, you may not have the opportunity of experiencing one of the worlds greatest sights.That aside, book in advance, if not, the wait can be more than an hour.Enjoy.

Such a beauty. Table Mountain was a great place to visit! We went on Table Mountain as the sun was about to go down. The views were breathtaking and you could see the clouds moving past you we were so high. My only concerns about this place had to do with a lot of negligence related to parents. We saw several parents that allowed their children to run all over Table Mountain unattended. The children were under the age of 5. I just wish there was a age requirement for parents who do not have common sense to watch their children. Other than that I love this place and I will never forget it.

Spectacular view, but beware the taxis to take you back to town. The cable car provides a great view over Cape Town on the short trip up and down the mountain. The queue can be quite long so try and book before you arrive, but even then it can be quite a wait at the bottom and top.As to the taxis, this is a scam which the staff appear to be complicit in. The taxi we were shown into by the cablecar staff already had R48 on the clock before we got in, then the clock was running so fast that we had reached another R30 before we got to the bottom of the hill. We got out. Don't fall for this, and shame on the cable car staff for their complicity in this scam.

you've just got to do it!!. The ride up to top of the mountain was well organised and rose surprisingly quickly. there are a couple of windows that are not glassed in the pod and people made a beeline for them. But then on starting we were told not to hold on to the handrails as the outer rim revolves so everyone got a chance to see through the open windows. Quirky! the views at the top were brilliant and there is a guided walk. Only drawback was that there was a long wait in the cafeteria for a coffee! The visit to the mountain was well worth it and we didn't have to wait too long to get up there. You can also abseil down if you have the nerve!!

Table Mountain. Can be very busy at times, but well organised, best to buy tickets online before you go all hotels will book and print tickets for you as queues can be up to 90 minutes long when busy. the 2 cable cars hold up 60 people a time and the floor revolves 360 degrees as it climbs to the top, it takes about 10 minutes to the top.

Sunset ascent. 15 minutes in the queue could have been shortened had we bought the tickets online. The trip to the top is over soon after it begins - the rotating floor gives all occupant a view of the mountain, Robben Island and the City. There are a few well marked walks on the Table offering views of Slangkop lighthouse in Kommetjie, Elsie's Peak, Robben Island and Big Bay. Not forgetting the City Bowl and the mountains near Ceres!

Well worth it!. We purchased our ticket on line, and the ticket was valid from the first date for 5 days. Couldn't go up on our first day as shrouded in cloud, but 3 days later we had brilliant sunshine and tremendous views. Purchasing the ticket before hand meant that we only had a 20 minute wait and the whole queuing procedure is very cleverly organised. We used the hop on, hop off bus to get there on the red route with a 1 minute walk to the queue.

Great trip. Very safe and quick but very dependent on the weather - fog, low clouds, rain and wind. As Cape Town can have 4 seaons in one day.Do book before yo get there either on the Red Bus, online or at one of the offices as there can be very big queues.

Fantastic view! A little hiccup in the waiting queue but overall it was great!. My family and I went there on a week day in February (not peak season). However it was too windy in the morning and they cable car was close. We drove to other sight-seeing attractions close by and came back in the afternoon. It was open and we did not have to wait for long. The cable car is quite big. It probably takes more than 30 people? (I'm not sure, just assuming from what I saw.) Therefore it was very stable, unlike my other cable car experiences in other countries. The view was just spectacular. We enjoyed it very much and this is definitely a must-do activity in Cape Town! ** A little hiccup during the waiting queue after we bought the tickets and went upstairs, out of the elevator, a staff told my husband and I to go to the right entrance where no one was standing. When my family did move over there, there was another staff talking to us NOT in a nice tone, saying "this entrance is not open. You need to queue back there." We explained to him it was his colleague who told us to come here and he insisted us go back there, still in bad manners. OK, we get it! But don't we deserve an apology? We didn't mess up the queue. We were told to go there!

Lovely views. Before you head to the mountain for the cableway, check their website, because if it is too windy or foggy on the mountain, the cableway will be closed.The lines are long, so be sure to go to the website and buy tickets ahead of time. Wear a hat if it is sunny because the wait in line can be long and there isn't shade for the entire time.
Majestic views, breathtaking scenery. Prebook your tickets so as to avoid queues. This place is magical and the views over Cape Town are beautiful I love living in this amazing city...

Be sure to watch the clouds!. Fun cable car ride. Clouds rolled in just as we were about to go up. Couldn't see anything from the top but the ride was fun, smooth, and not scary! Do it in the sunshine if you can!
Great views. The views while travelling up or down are stunning. Be warned, arrive early (7h00), to avoid hours of queuing. Once at the top spend the day.

Great trip. It is a bit hit and miss when you get on the cable car as to whether it will be clear when you get to the top, but worth it anyway, it can be quite cold if the mist is down. We combined the cost of the cable car with the open top bus tour, good value.

A very special Place. I walked up Platteklip Gorge and caught the cable car down which was great. The views of Cape town from the top are spectacular and the work they have put in to make the walk ways and viewing sites is fantastic.

Stunning views of the Cape from here, but sit loose in the saddle - plans may change!. Well worth the somewhat expensive ticket to get up to the top. Be aware that the cable car shuts down when there is too much fog/clouds or too windy. This happens frequently enough that you need to do some planning if you can. Parking is always an issue too so be prepared to walk a lot. While it is an amazing view from the top (and on the way up and down) it is not as stunning as Cape Point. If you only have a half day, go to the Point instead. If you have a couple of days go to Cape Point first if it is windy in Cape Town. If the weather is great in Cape Town, do the cableway first.

What a thrill...and I live in the mountains . Just go...you won't be disappointed. And book online to avoid the ticket purchase line. I live in a city with mountains and great views but this experience was just incredible. Even saw one of the little furry creatures that live at the top...one was sunbathing next to the viewing platform. I guess I would be content too with views like that. If you have good weather go fast as the weather changes on a dime.
Early. get there early to avoid massive q's once at the top stunning views of the city and ocean lots of places for photo's.

Don't miss. If you came to Cape Town you should never leave the city before doing this. Not because it is a classic in Cape Town but also you would get the chance of getting the full view of the city and also chances of doing nice walks and a lovely sunset seeing.
Breathtaking!!. February is the best time to make this trip, we had great weather which made this trip a life time memory! Caters excellently for tourists !!

Big queues. Bought the cable car tickets beforehand but still had 50min wait, slightly disorganised in getting people to the cable car but once on it the ride is very smooth and the car revolves as it moves.
Well.... Well, it's there and it is convenient if you're in a rush or is tired, but I really recommend going up and down the mountain to get the full experience.

A Must Do!. The wind can be a big barrier in Cape Town. When visiting, check the cable car website every morning when you wake up to see what the conditions are. The cable car does not run when it is too windy or cloudy, so check periodically and when the conditions are right, buy your tickets online and go! You can buy and scan tickets from your phone so printing is not necessary. The lines are often short (5-20 mins) if you buy your ticket in advance, but could be over an hour long if you want to buy in person. Enjoy the quick ride to the top and take in the beautiful view!
The Easier Option to access the great views. At 72 years old I was pleased to opt for cableway instead of steep walk to top. The cost was reasonable and not a long wait to ascend and later descend

Must do . Nice ride. It's easy to find the table mountain and the cable way. Easily parking. Maybe a little long to wait until you are in the cable car. But the views are spectacular. And when you are on top of the table mountain you will have such a nice view on Cape Town. Simply a must see!

Top of the tower. Took the open top bus which stops at the mountain. Hopped on the cable car to the top and had a walk around to take in the views.
A must do on visiting Cape Town .

Great 'up', needs work way down!. 2nd visit and very impressed with the organisation and staff in the queue on the wait to go up. Great visit again and enjoyed my abseil with Abseil Africa! Unfortunately a huge queue to get back down, a noticeable shortness of staff to manage proceedings. It was likenened to a rugby scrum when near to the car itself with people jostling to make sure they got in. Must introduce a better system before something gets out out of hand!

70 Thumbs Up . Even though we were a group of almost 70 visitors the ride up was smooth. We had tickets pre-booked and within minutes we were on top of the world. Sparkling wine and snacks arranged by the restaurant were served outside and definitely added to the experience!! Table Mountain is still as awesome as ever and definitely worth a visit.

One of the natural wonders of the world. Awesome visit, spectacular views. Well kept natural park. Wildlife & birds a plenty. Amazing vistas overlooking the cape, Cape Town, Robin Island & mountain range. You can choose to walk the mountain or take the cable car which itself is an experience. Simple and quick to reach the top, I advise to pre book tickets to beat the queues. We took a taxi from green market square Cape Town, a short 10 mins to the cable car for very little money. You have to plan ahead and keep an eye on the weather as it moves very quickly over the mountain. It can be cold and windy even on a very hot day in town but still comfortable. To witness these views and watch the cloud 'table cloth' spill over the mountain is a memory that will last forever.

Table Mountain Family Visit. We visited yesterday (22 Feb 2016) with family from USA (New York) & Poland after 10 years.Initially we were amazed that there were only 3 parking bays for the disabled and all taken. So I dropped everybody off and drove 2 km to find "legal" parking.When we got back the family had not moved in the queue for ages but people that had pre - booked were going through quickly. Everybody else seemed to be waiting. We then decided to book on line whilst in the non-moving queue. This we eventually managed to do. I then went to a very helpful lady (Nazeem --I think, humble apologies for not remembering her name accurately) and told her about my family member who was disabled, that was taking strain. She spoke to someone, who authorized all 8 of us to take a lift to the 5th Floor to get in the cable car together as a family. We were so relieved that we did not have to wait in the long queue and I can only say that from then on it was an absolute pleasure. All the staff were helpful, even at the well stocked/pleasant/efficient restaurant. The only area I think needs urgent attention is the parking, although its 1000 times better than Signal Hill (that's an absolute disaster, especially at sunset - not a policeman or traffic cop in sight to control illegal parking)Maybe a stop and go facility at the Table Mountain Cableway (reasonably priced) would do the trick! Thank You and well done to all.

Up up up and away. Fantastic trip up the mountain on a cloudless sunny morning. Arrive early as it gets extremely busy. Well worth the wait though. Wear comfortable shoes and sun protection. Hydrate often and stick to the pathways.

Great spectacular view. Great outdoor. The cable way offers you some spectacular views. Its the safest way of getting on top of the table mountain. You havent explored Cape Town until you go up the Table Mountain. Friendly staff to assist you to get up as quickly and as painless as possible.

Views are stunning. You go up the mountain by cablecar which is an experience in itself. The views from the top are absolutely stunning. You can see all around Cape Town. There is a lovely little shop on top with curious and food etc. Just watch out for the birds - they nicked my crisp out of my hand lol. In peak season make sure you book online. We stood in a very long queue for tickets. But definitely worth the wait

A number 1 must do when in Cape Town. Have done this cable car trip many times but it never fails to delight with the beauty of the city and mountain seen from avert different view. We went on one of the half price after 6pm tickets and it was perfect : short queue as we booked online, and a great time to go. Just after 6pm in Feb is daylight so you see the views, then see ( usually ) a beautiful sunset and the city lights come on. We were very impressed with the information boards from various viewpoints that told you some well researched and informative historical points about various aspects of the city. Very professionally run and excellent safety record.

Long queues so allow all day if weather good; worth the wait as great experience. Long long long waits everywhere, although booking tickets on line saves an hour's queue (or book in the queue if you have data: wifi connection is unreliable at lower station). When you arrive at the top, be prepared for cooler temperatures and layer up! Walk away from the hoards & be rewarded with wildlife, proteas, views views views. Hike to Maclear's Beacon or further: take water & bananas!

Fantastic views!. It's a 15 minutes super energizing trip with some fantastic views on the mountains and the city. Avoid big organized groups and .... watch out your camera. The cabin moves around, so everyone has a chance to see well.

Excellent Trip to top of Table Mountain. We wanted to go to the top of Table Mountain. The cableway is the best way to go (you can hike up if you are up to it). We were fortunate to have a clear day and the wait was short. The staff were efficient and friendly. The car rotates as you go so everyone can get a great view during the trip. I have a moderate fear of heights but the tram is large enough that I tolerated it well. There is a lot of room at the top with several pathways to take so you can get wonderful views of Cape Town. The is a small café and a gift shop on top as well. Overall a good experience. A "must do" while visiting the area.

Expensive to watch clouds . I went in the early afternoon. As we ascended the clouds came in very quickly and once we got to the top nothing was visible. Surely they should inform you before paying the money that the trip will be worthless. In addition I hate heights so when getting into the cable car and hanging on to the rails for dear life to find the floor moves and the rails can't be held onto was abit scary.

Fantastic !!!. Get there early for this fantastic experience - or maybe you will be queuing for an hour plus ..... We bought our tickets in advance through our hotel, got here via taxi for 09.00 and hardly had to queue. The cable car ride and views from the top are fantastic - not to be missed !Easy to get a return taxi.

Amazing!. Spectacular is the only word for this attraction. The views from the top are absolutely stunning. You cannot visit Cape Town without a visit. Be aware it is a very popular attraction and you will queue for around an hour but it is very much worth it. Top tip purchase your ticket online before you get there as the queue s much shorter.

You just have to go up when in Cape Town. Great to get up there. The views are amazing. You must pre book tickets otherwise you have a very long wait. Even with tickets it is a long process queuing. We were in peak time so to be expected. Still really worth it.
Quick Trip. Hiked up table mountain and this is the best way to return after a long day in the sun. Slightly crowded but the short ride balanced out the lack of space.
Breathtaking. Was an awesome experience being up in the cable car with my 2 best friends. beautiful breath-taking views from on top of the mountain.

Awesome Experience. The rotating tramway is not for the faint of heart but offers magnificent views all the way to the top. From the top you see all of Cape Town and the Bay from the other side. Little coffee shop at the top. If you're strong you can actually climb/hike up and back!

Great experience - Wear a hat and buy water before going on tracks!!!. As always Table Mountain did not disappoint us it was an amazing experience. We were there 3 hours and we enjoyed every second of the breathtaking views.I visited Table Mountain 3 years ago and all the facilities were dramatically improved.The store and restaurant is very efficient. All is clean. Really good experience! Thank you.

Looking down on Cape Town. We booked on line after advice. It saved us a few minutes. By the sound of it we were lucky - there were very few people there when we arrived (mid morning). The views from the lift and the top of TM are amazing and a must if youre visiting CT.

Top 3 on your priority list. Being in Cape Town and not going to the top of the Table Mountain is like visiting Sydney and not seeing the Opera House or The Great Wall while in Beijing for example. the journey is just not complete without certain things.Booking in advance speeds things up, though the line can be long. Still moving relatively fast. The ride doesn't take much time but the views are spectacular and the rotating floot alows you to see the surroundings all around. Good time!

Beautiful sunset. Table mountain aerial cableway staff are friendly and helpful.The queues were long as usual but it was worth the wait.The view of Cape Town and the atlantic coast from the top of the mountain is breathtaking.Currently running a special for sunset returns at R120.A must for all visitors.

Spectacular views. The views were breathtaking from the cable cars. You get a great view of Cape Town central. The floor of the cable car rotates so that you get a 360 view of the trip to top of table mountain. The only negative point is that the trip is quite quick. Just 5 mins or so.
Fun and exciting!!!. A memorable experience,the rotating floor provides spectacular views of Cape Town and table mountain.
Réunion peeps holiday. Awesome place. Book ticket online to avoid the ticket queue. Properly coordinated, clean, vibrant such that it gives you a feeling of adventure.
Long waiting rows. Up the Hill and Feeling good was the plan. Howver despite early Internet booking thousands waiting in the sun for about 3 hours. Not worth the effort Overall.

Wonderful Cape Town view. Don't miss the cable car for the table mountain.You need minimum 3 hours for the trip and trekking into the table (small loop) and coming back.After buying tickets you need wait for the cable car and on the top 2 ways are available for discover Cape Town.At the end of your trekking you have to wait for the cable car again.Try to go when the weather is clear whitout clouds and wind.

Book in advance!. This is the must do experience in Cape Town so it gets horribly busy. Booking in advance won't mean you avoid the queue - but it does mean you don't have to queue twice. Well worth the wait as the views are spectacular.

Sca must for all visitors. We waited for a day when no cloud hung over the mountain and reached the base by the easy bus system , we could also buy the ticket in advance, so a shorter queue. A very exhilating experience, just a pity that attracts so many visitors! We had quite a acceptable light lunch.
The view is worth it!. Buy your tickets online and hope that the queue favours you. The Trip is well worth it. Plan at least a halt day depending upon the queues.

A must do but go early. The cable-car queue was busy when we arrived and it gets busier later in the afternoon (as apparently it is cheaper after 6pm).The cable-car floor rotates as you travel in it. Part of the car has enclosed windows and some sections are open air so that you can take uninterrupted photos. They say if you’re afraid of heights or get vertigo, stand in the middle where the driver is. It’s only a 3-4 minute ride but the views are certainly worth it.

Wonderful views. Any visit to Cape Town has to include a ride to Table Mountain. We got there using the hop on hop off bus on the red route. The buses go to the cable car base station every 20 mins from 0900hrs to 1900hrs. So you have plenty of time. If you are intending to eat, why not try the Ostrich pie - delicious.

Table mountain. Wow you must get to go to the top of the mountain. We have been on three separate times over the years. All were different. This last experience was lovely as we walked the furthest we have. Beautiful views. Just an amazing place to visit

Good views and facilities but can be crowded. Part of our escorted holiday package. Interesting trip on a cablecar that rotated during the journey, giving all occupants a selection of views. Some queuing at the start and probably subject to overcrowding at the terminals at peak times. Also, very weather dependant and the service closes in high winds and low visibility. (When Table mountain has its 'tablecloth' of cloud on, there would be little point in the journey anyway) Good views from the top of the mountain. Coffee/gift shop and restaurant at the top too.

Fantastic experience . This has truly been a great experience seeing Cape Town from Table Mountain - and it goes without much saying that you have to go on a day without clouds :). We tried to one day before noon and the queue was extremely long - the day after we went in the afternoon and the queue was much shorter.

Great experience - check the weather. Very enjoyable and some stunning views of the city and the surrounding areas. The cafe at the top was also good and provided a much needed hot drink (even in mid-summer the temperature at the summit was cold). Do check the website (book tickets in advance) for the weather conditions in advance of traveling to the cable car station. Even on a nice sunny day the cable car can be affected by high-winds (which may seem like nothing more than a light breeze in the city). To go to Cape Town and not experience Table Mountain would be very disappointing so to check in advance and ensure you get to experience it is important.

Has to be done.....top tops. 1. Book online.2. Get there early....the red bus tours from the V and A is a good option.3. Go on a clear day....some days it's covered in cloud.4. Keep return tickets on you at all timesEnjoy. Views are spectacular

Get there early!. We arrived at 07.30 for the first cable car at 8am and there were already quite a few people queuing. Buy your tickets online - they are valid for 7 days which is useful as the cars don't run in high winds. 360 degree rotation of the car gives great views up and down the mountain. Parking gets very busy early.

Make sure you go on a clear day ............. Gorgeous trip up to the top of Table Mountain. Make sure you go on a clear day as the clouds ("Table Cloth") can engulf the top of the mountain and spoil your view of the city and ocean vistas.

Go early and buy your tickets in advance!. Unless you want to hike up the mountain, this is the best way to reach the summit. Take water, a hat and sunscreen and enjoy the breathtaking views! Be prepared to stand in line, but if you buy your ticket in advance you can eliminate the ticket line and proceed directly to the cableway line. Food and drinks and restrooms are available at the summit and there are several well maintained pathways around the top.

Good tourist attraction. Went up with my wife Andrea, we pre booked the cable car but queues were small. There is a restaurant and shop at top and plenty of walks to be had. Had great time would recommend going

Scenic ride for the lazy/relaxed. Going in the afternoon pretty much avoids any queues for this, but makes the lighting less appropriate for good photos. Awesome views from the cable car - it rotates gently so you don't have to fuss about moving around to get a good view. Guide/controllers are pretty friendly and nice.

It was OK. Fortunately we did not have a line as is often the case. The views are spectacular if the clouds are not in the way. Bot much else to do except walk around for a few minutes to look at the view from all sides.

Amazing cablecars. First of all the great lady that took us up, she was just amazing,always smiling and trying to make our trip really unforgettable even after hours of service (we went down after 5/6 h and she was driving it again with the same enthusiasm). Then the cablecars, just perfect. They rotate in order to let all the people enjoy a 360° view. The cablecars are spacious and wuite new. Worth the price.
A great ride!. The rotating cable car is quite ingenious; you get to see all angles on your trip up or down the mountain.

Magnificent views.. Be prepared to spend some time in the queue, also take a taxi to the drop off, parking can get very difficult as it gets quite full. Do not forget to take a rather thick warm jacket with you as it gets quite cold even on a hot day.Enjoy
The best way to get to the top. It's a great experience to get to the top of the mountain. The gondola floor rotates giving additional vies as you ascend or decend.

A brilliant experience. If you're in Cape Town, travelling to the top of Table Mountain is a must do. We were lucky in that the good weather meant the cable car was operating - it doesn't run if it's too windy or if the mountain is obscured by cloud.

A must. This trip is weather dependant but well worth watching for a clear day. We used the red tour bus from the Waterfront which enables you to pre buy your Table mountain cable car tickets. This is great as the queues can be quite lengthy and this is a fast track ticket. The cable car holds 65 people so it doesn't take as long as you think and the queues are under cover from the sun, although the fast track queue has no seating which was a little difficult for my 82 year old mother.The cable car rotates on the way up and down which is nice, but only takes a minute or two so don't miss the views.
Most amazing . Truly that was the best than ever.i did enjoy myself really.thank you guys.I think i have to go back there twice every month.its so refreshing.
Well run. This is an efficient service running the route up to Table mountain. Slightly tawdry shop availability both below and at top level.Watty

Can't miss it. The views are stunning. Don't miss it, but book your cable-car ticket in advance. You'll still have to stand in line for the car, and if you go in the middle of the day you'll be waiting in line for an hour. So go early or go late.

Not to be missed. A trip to the top of Table Mountain is not to be missed when visiting Cape Town. From the time the cable car leaves the lower cable station the views are mesmerizing. Take a walk amongst the indigenous fynbos on the top of the table, or just relax and soak up the views of the City and the stunning coastline. But, for a really special experience, pack a picnic and watch the sun setting over the Atlantic Ocean, followed by the city's night lights.

Fast and easy way to ride to the top of the mountain!. The space inside is large enough and spins around slowly so we all can have access to view through some small windows and take pictures. One doesn't feel the altitude or when it spins!

Above the clouds, occasionally!. Great views across Cape Town and the harbour area, and once you have reached the top, the views are truly spectacular, only occasionally blocked by the fast passing clouds, which can make it feel a little chilly - take a jacket no matter what the weather is like at the bottom!

Rip off online tickets. Purchased tix for 4 of us using their online service for a trip between 08:00 & 13:00Stood in 32+ heat from 10:00 until 13:00 & were still not at front of queue! Left in disgust & have emailed for refund. How can they sell tickets that they know cannot be honoured?!Ridiculous.

The only way is up (and down...). Was a little unsure of the cable car - I am not a great lover of them - but it is actually fine! Rotates on the way up so all get a good all round view. Buy tickets in advance and the first chance you get go - cloud can close the mountain so make it a priority to go! The views from the top are fabulous ! Easiest way to get there from the waterfront is on the bus tour...

Breathtaking Views. A wonderful surprise to enter the new cable car at Table Mountain. Compares with the best in the world I'd say.A Revolving floor so one could view the beautiful Cape Town in all it's splendour.From any angle ;simply spectacular views.
great views over the city. we arrived fairly early in the morning and the queues were really short. great views over the city. it's nice to spend a bit of time wandering around the top too.

Not on a windy day. Cape Town is a very windy town and the cable car will not work if it is too rainy; if the table cloth or duvet (clouds covering the top of Table Mtn) is out, there is no sense in going up. The floor of the cable car revolves so that you can stand still and see all views throughout the trip up.

Brilliant trip. We visited via the red bus and prepaid the cable car admission to avoid queues - there weren't any but from the queueing signs I think this could be a problem at times so suggest you do prepay.The car holds quite a few people but don't worry about getting the best view as the floor slowly turns as you go up so everyone sees everything..very good idea. Only waited about 5 mins each side.Felt very safe but it is very high and some might not be that comfortable.
A must do when in Cape Town. The cable car will take you to the top of Table Mountain where you can walk around and view the sights of Cape Town from the top.
Go early. Great spot to visitGo early and beat the crowds. First one up at 8am and the top was a real treat.Walk of about 30 mins at the top gives great pictures
Look out for the weather . Good efficient cable car to the top of table mountain. Keep an eye on the weather as it can very quickly change from being sunny and clear to being overcast and lethal

Amazing views - wait for a clear day. You cannot miss it while in Cape Town.Just wait for a clear day and go as soon as you can (it is often cloudy)Now they are running a special of 50% off the ticket after 6 pmAmazing viewsThere are several hikes that you can do, different levels and durationsOr you can buy a round trip ticket and go up and down on the cable tram.On a good day you can see where the Atlantic and Indian Ocean meet.

Very scenic. Good value ride with then novelty rotating platform which allows everyone to experience the views so no need to scramble for the best position. The cars can be crowded but the ride on takes 5 minutes. For those seniors there is a reduced rates on Friday.

We were lucky. Our impression is that the tramway isn't working at least as much as it is working. Clouds, high winds all cause it to close, only to open later.The first time we tried, we were near the head of the line at 8:00 am, however it didn't open that day until 12:30 pm, so the early departure didn't pay off.
