However, later in the day we noticed it was working and raced up to get the sunset special (prices go down).By the time we got up, clouds were starting to blow in. They were lovely, as was the sunset, but we didn't have time to go for a hike and really explore. Too bad, but we still found the experience exciting and we sure wouldn't have wanted to miss it.Take something warm, it's a lot colder up there. And take a book to read whilst in line.Oh yes, you can get your tickets online and that will save you a lot of waiting.

Nice comfortable ride. After climbing up the Table Mountain, we decided to get the cableway down, one part because we were tires, one part because it was raining. It was a nice quick ride with stunning views.

Awesome. Going up the mountain in the cable car is quite an experience. You don't even know that you have left the ground the ride is that smooth. The floor rotates as you ascend and descend so that everyone gets a good view. You don't even feel the floor rotating. Recommend that you go. Cable car doesn't operate if the weather isn't very good.
A must do. You cannot go to Cape Town without riding the cable cars up Table Mountain. Heaven and earth meet at the summit - just amazing.
Fun. I found it great but a freind was scared by the height, tip, don't fight to get a good view when boarding, the cabin rotates
A fantastic experience . A fantastic way to reach the top of Table Mountain.The views are terrific as the cable car has glass sides and a revolving floor.
AMAZING. Well I am petrified of heights but table mountain had to be done I sent postcards from the red letter box up there fabulous staff an experience not to be missed if you visit cape town

A must "do" when in Cape Town. Fantastic when you are up there but there are long queues on public holidays and weekends. Essential to pre-book (I did it on line), also the cable car doesn't operate on windy days. The best way to get there is by the red bus (hop on hop off)

MUST DO. This is well worth doing if you are in Capetown! The view from this cablecar is spectacular. Plus it revolves as you go up, so you will get a great view from wherever you stand inside the car.

A great evening out. With late sunsets in the cape this is the bat way to spend one. A must for all but please take a jersey at the least. Great hospitality. The restaurant was good but could be a but less canteen like. As we have many foreigners as well. We'll done CCT
Excellent day out . Can't fault it!!! It is very well run with out of this world views of Cape Town. The only difficulty can be parking. Can't wait to go back
Amazing view and topography. The lines are long, so go early. The walks up top are literally awesome. Take the guided tour- it's worth it! The views are spectacular.

Great views of Cape Town. Truly one of the 'must see' spots of Cape Town. Went here late afternoon for a great view of the sunset. Great experience both the cable ride and the view. Book your tickets online to skip the long line of people waiting to buy tickets.

Long waits in the sun...the view is worth it.... Had to wait for hours and the sun was really very hot. Yes it is worth it as a means of getting up to the top...but it is such a short ride...over almost before it begun...but still nothing beats the views from the top

Amazing views. Can't not do this if you are in Capetown. We had a ticket for the red sightseeing bus which dropped us right at the cable car and allowed us to,pre buy tickets for the cable car so we didn't need to queue. Spent about two hours wandering around (take water its hot!) and taking some fab photos. Bit worrying watching some braver souls standing on precarious ledges taking selfies but plenty of safer pathways ! Some of the paths are not suitable for less stable legs or buggies etc but there is at leat one good flat path

Buy tickets online. There can be long queues so buy tickets online if you can and save yourself time.At the top go on one of the longer walks to get away from the crowds milling around the cablecar station....wear good walking shoes though.
Cloudy visit. Shame the cloud had descended by the time we ascended yesterday morning. Slick operation but would certainly not recommend Table Mountain Cafe for breakfast.

Glad I didn't have to hike!. While I was in Cape Town it was incredibly hot, so the cableway was a great option to make it up to Table Mountain. I must say that even though I had to wait in line, the line was efficient and water/drinks/snacks were for sale in the line. Once you get in the cable car, it's pretty crowded. The car rotates, so you get plenty of views as you go up the mountain. The line to come down was not as efficient. People were pretty pushy when it came to getting into the car and it was more crowded than gong up. Still, I'd rather wait in line to ride down than have to brave the sun on a hike up or down the mountain.

Great views!. Went to Cape Town on a recent work trip and stole a few hours on my last afternoon to take the sightseeing bus. The table mountain stop was a highlight- the cable car was a tiny bit scary but the whole experience provided wonderful views of the city and the ocean! The restaurant on top is busy but a good place to grab a bite or a drink. One can take a nice walk around the periphery and get a range of views from the various sides. A must see for the casual visitors!

awesome!. Do this when in Cape Town and if you don't want to hike up the mountain. We do get a fair amount of wind in Cape Town, meaning that there will be long queues on the first nice day after the wind dies down. However, you can book tickets online. We opted to do the "sunset special" ie. tickets are half-Price after 6pm (promotion is still on till Feb. 29th). The ride in the cable car takes about 5 mins and as it rotates you get a great view of the surrounding area. Watching the sunset on top of Table Mountain is such an awesome experience!

An all round view. We pre booked our tickets and were glad we did as there was a very long queue waiting for tickets when we arrived at the lower station. We were able to bypass this and get straight onto the cable car. It's quite fascinating as the inside of the pod revolves so you get views all round as it ascends.

Superb Views. I am not sure what else one can say about Table Mountain and the cable car, other than "fantastic views". It seems a safe, comfortable, inexpensive ride and if you don't have the couple of hours I am advised it takes to walk up, nor maybe the fitness, it is a must-do in Cape Town. When it is windy the cable car may be closed and it is not always obvious in town that it is windy up top.

What an Interesting Ride!. This is one of those things you're "supposed" to do while in Capetown. We weren't sure until the last minute whether the weather would permit us to do it. Fortunately, the weather permitted. I've ridden on cable cars in several locations around the world, but this was the most interesting I've experienced. The mountain is practically a vertical ascent. The cars have both a close up view of the strata of rocks and as you ascend and descend, an ever changing view of Capetown and its harbor. Each car rotates while it travels up and down the mountain. For most travelers, a trip to Capetown is a "bucket list" experience. So while you're here, be sure to go for the Table Mountain Cableway ride.
Awesome. Brill experience, but you must book before, even the same day. Online is very quick and easy. You go straight to the head of the line. The line without pre booked tickets is long.
Table mountain cable car. Nice views from above! Pick a day with clear skies and as less wind as possible. If you are hiking - start out early - it gets really hot!
beautiful views; fun ride. we rode down after climbing up. the climb was very hard; the ride down was easy. price for the ride was quite reasonable.

Easy way to get to the top!. By far the best way to get to the top of Table Mountain - and down, unless you are very energetic! It is cheaper to book online. It takes about 5 minutes, the cab revolves so everyone has a good view. Not really scary!

Expensive but worth it. Actually, if you are not climbing on foot, there is only cableway to take you up to the top. And its worth it. We came in the morning, so there were practically no queues, we easily got into and even had a ride with the restaurant band, which was additional and unexpected fun. There are nice views seen from the windows, but it travels fast, so not much time to enjoy. And one thing for gift shoppers – the shop at the below exit from the cable (just before the barrier) offers good deals on beadwork and some other souvenirs, some even better that in other places in Cape Town. But you have to decide on buying then and there – once you pass barrier, you can enter the shop only by buying another round ticket.
Wow. Having been fortunate enough to visit Sugar Loaf Mountain - Brazil, Iguazu Falls- Argentina and Victoria Falls - Zimbabwe, I can honestly say Table Mountain - Cape Town, is the best of all.

Perfect view over the beautiful Mother City . A visit to Cape Town would be incomplete without a trip up the cableway - the views are absolutely magnificent and on a clear blue - sky day, there is nothing better. The queues can be long so get there early, and watch out for the late afternoon/ evening discounted ticket prices.
Very nice. Enjoyed it tremendously. One of the highlights of our visit. Highly recommend it if you visit this area and have time. The line for tickets is long. So buy your tickets in advance.
Amazing Experience!. Took visitors from Singapore to Table Mountain via the Cableway and they enjoyed every moment. Quick, efficient and communicated thoroughly.
amazing. this is a destination that you don't want to miss. there is always a line but don't be discouraged - it moves quick and the sites at the top of the mountain are more than worth it

NICE ATTRACTION, BUT...... visited in January with the group of 60 PAX. We were 2 tourguides with the group and the Cableway management didn't offer us any free of charge tickets. This is very unusuall in the tourism industry. The way from Cableway is very nice

Dreaded trip. If you're in Cape Town you feel obliged to go up on Table Mountain, even if it's by cable car, which I dread. BUT if you stand in the center of the car (where you can also chat with the operator) you won't notice the journey and arrive feeling like an interred venturer at the top.

It's a MUST DO....wonderful experience. We did this on my birthday and it is something I will not forget. Fast. Rotating floor, superb view sad just a great thing to do. Unless you want to walk to the top of table mountain, this is the only other way to get there, unless you can find a chopper somewhere. Great!

AMAZING VIEWS FROM THE TOP OF THE MOST BEAUTIFUL MOUNTAIN IN THE WORLD. Outstanding, spectacular views from Table Mountain of Sea Point, Camps Bay, Clifton, Lions Head, Town and all over the peninsular. . The cable car is new, luxurious, it takes 68 people at once, it rotates once you are moving so everyone get a 365 degree view! The only advice i would give is book before you go! If not you will be waiting in line to go up for an hour or 2 !

Beware the table cloth. We looked up from the base station of the cableway and the top was clear. However minutes after we got to the top the mist came in, the temperature dropped sharply and the views disappeared. We waited half an hour but the mist didnt clear so we went down on the cable car. As we stepped out of the cable car we looked back at the top and it was clear again. So visitors take a gamble on the mist. But the views when is is clear are fantastic

Great outing for friends, family or couples!. Great outing for friends, family or couples! Book online in advance, especially during summer. If you are going up for the sunset session make SURE you dress warmly!

Revolving ride!. There were a lot of people in the cable car which I did not like but as we went up and coming down the gondola revolved around so you could see the amazing views of Cape Town below as well as the bank and different plants and vegetation. The views up the top are beautiful and have a light jacket as the weather is different up there to down where you start. Well worth the ride!

Breathtaking View. Being there on the cable car is wonderful and beautiful experience, unique feature is its fynbos vegetation that is displayed here better than anywhere in the world. richest floral regions in the world

Hassle free until you want to come down. Great views, a fair bit of walking at the top but you can reduce it if you want to. The wifi didn't work but that didn't really bother us. The cable car has a revolving floor and open windows which is great. Not recommended for those who are unsteady on their feet. Coming down was a long wait and when your young and have a hidden disability and struggle to stand and walk it makes the experience rather unpleasant. It was worth it for the views as it was a clear day. Expect to queue and be leaned on by elderly tourists.

Fabulous Views. Had fab views of Table mountain from bedroom window. Decided to have a look. Long queues to go up but well worth it when you reach the top. Cable car has a rotating floor so everyone one great view going up.

Amazing views. We walked up table mountain one day but I wouldn't have missed also taking the cable car. The views are amazing and its a real experience to go up in this way. Check online to see if its operating before you go.
Fantastic. Crazy busy but very well run..Get there early, by 12:00 the que was approx. 500 meters long What a pre eleven to be on top of table mountain on a perfect day....

ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. The views are to die for - The food at the restaurant was ok - Very expensive - typical of a tourist attraction. Well worth the visit and I suggest you take a jacket as the weather so high up - vastly different to lower down
Wow experience. The view from the cable was just magnificent. We took loads of amazing pictures. I will highly recommend it to everybody. It's a must!
Breathtaking. Worth the queue, worth the heat, worth the walk.Do not miss this - what a spectacular view and a place I will never forget.
A must see in SA. Quite an experience to take the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain. Only available on good weather days. Unbeleivable views.

Professional operation. The cableway is professionally operated, focusing on customer comfort, viewing pleasure and safety. It conveys one to/from a great vantage point from where the mountain can be explored. For walkers/hikers, be VERY aware that the cable car doesn't operate in inclement weather conditions (such as fog and high winds) so always be prepared to walk down the mountain (via, say Platteklip Gorge).

Worth it!. One cannot come to Cape Town without going up Table Mountain, and using the cable car makes it so accessible! The que can be long but they move at a steady pace. Buy your ticket on line and save some time. There are organized walks on top of the mountain or you can do your own thing. Enjoy the views!

Table Mountain Cableway. Taking family & friends to the Table Mountain Cableway is always interesting to watch all the people pack into the Cableway and instinctively press for the ocean facing view. What people don't realize is the entire floor of the cableway rotates 360 degrees to ensure all on board have their opportunity at he front of the Cableway. Yes don't forget your cameras as this is a spectacular ride with even more spectacular views. Once on top of the mountain you can enjoy the walk and views at your leisure.

Wonderful views of one of the greatest cities on Earth. We managed to get up despite the high winds ( it was closed an hour aft we came down and remained so for 4 days - we were lucky). Reasonably priced and very good. Long wait, close to an hour but well worth it. If you get the chance, take it!

Rocky Mountain high. There are two ways of getting to the top of the famed Table Mountain,walk or cable car.walking is by far the most energetic way of accomplishment but at my age the cable car is best.Get there early as the ques can get rather long and expect delays of up to 4 hours.....partly in the hot African sun.Great view from the top ,well worth the trip.Hint...take your own snacks and drinks as prices at the only place selling drinks can be up to 10 times the normal store prices.

Breathtaking. We were on a business trip and decided to mix business with pleasure and visited table mountain. i had never been on an Ariel car before. it was an amazing experience, i am definately going to bring my family next time. You can see it gets crowded during holidays, so make sure you go at a time when its a bit quiet. had a wonderful time,
Fabulous views. Reasonable price for the overseas visitor against a weak Rand. The views are stunning and the whole experience is a must when visiting the Cape area.
a trip to cloud 9. a must to every cape town visit. well organised despite the masses sometimes. safe and secure and served by friendly staff well done

Busy !!. Used the city sightseeing hop on hop off two day pass and purchased ticket at their office which is at v&a waterfront , also one on long street . Easier as you then join queue at the cable car in the tickets already purchased line . Waited around 45 mins to get on the cable car , busy . Great experience getting up there and the stunning views , great place to wander around at the top and take in the scenery . Waited around 30 minutes for cable car to get down

A must do for all tourists to Cape Town. But the queue can be horrendous! We had to queue for 2 hours in the burning sun and none of us had sun block with us (My friends fresh out of the UK got terribly sunburned) although the last hour we had partial shade and water misting down on us. Apparently the reason for the queue was that the weather hadn't permitted trips up the mountain for a few days running.Very well organised, totally safe and stunning views reward the intrepid tourist at the top. A must do at least once.

Obviously you have to do this if you come to Cape Town. Go early and buy your ticket on line before you go to avoid the line for tickets when you get there. Out hotel concierge did it and printed the ticket for us. You really only need 20 minutes at the top and then you are done. Breathtaking views obviously as you would expect.
It was cool. The Cable ride had a good view while going up and coming down of the city. It was quite crowded though.

Worth the trip, just for the ride.. Be careful to choose the right day. The cable car does not go when it is windy and the view from the top is very often obscured by low cloud, even when it is clear elsewhere.Well worth the time and effort, but watch the weather.

Great ride, great view. After missing out last time due to changing weather conditions changed plans and went for the cable car as the weather was clear and sunny. Two tips - if the weather is good go as it varies from day to day (it was completely covered in cloud the next day) and buy your ticket on-line before going as it cuts down the queuing time massively! The ride was great, dramatic views and lovely staff who had a good laugh

The good the bad and the ugly. Provided you buy your tickets online beforehand, this is the easiest way to see Table Mountain. It means you miss one of the queues. After queueing to get through the turnstiles though, you are subjected to a rugby scrum to get on the cable car. This is positively dangerous. It is only a matter of time before there is serious injury. Add to that the oriental ugly use of force can have an upsetting affect on your physical wellbeing.

A nice ride and great view. We decided to use our short morning before a noon-time flight to travel up the Cableway for the view from the top. None of us in our party were particularly fond of heights, so we were a bit worried. These cars both revolve 360 and half of the car is an open window. We stayed to the center of the car and we all had a nice ride up and down. The walk at the top is more than I had expected it to be, but we were not prepared. It was a very hot and sunny day and we should have brought waters and sun shade if we had time to completely explore the peak. But, as it was, we could only stay 1/2 hour. That amount of time gave us the opportunity to appreciate the view, take in the geology, and flora and fauna of table mountain. For us, these were not to be missed. A recommendation for travelers: the earlier you visit, the shorter the lines. There are strict rules regarding the wind speeds, too, so the cableway may not be running for a few days. The morning after a big wind means even longer lines!

Great way to go down. We used the Aerial Cableway to decent from Table Mountain. Perfect combination, walking up and avoiding the long (someone mentioned 3 hrs waiting in line) and going down by cable way, The way up (India Venstre) was great, I would not have missed it for anything.

A must do but sometimes there's a queue. I go fairly regularly. It's a lovely ride, totally safe and I recommend people do it at least once. I usually hike up and cable car down. There can be long queues sometimes
Truly one of the seven wonders of the world. What a scenery ! The cable car takes you to the top in less than 5 min. It's better to book tickets in advance. There is no queue a bit before noon.

Table Mountain. Visited the Table Mountain cableway after it had been shut for 2 days because of the wind, we didn't buy online so had to go in a longer queue for about 45 minutes, in the heat but it's in the shade. I'd say buy online first. The view from the top is amazing with a shop, cafe and toilets. I think the cost of an adult ticket was about 240 rand, so well worth the price for a trip to the top!

Must-do in Cape Town. Avoid the queues and get your ticket online. You can take a snapshot on your phone and they'll just scan the barcode. The views at the top are magnificent and it is worth walking around the Table Mountain National Park. Don't rush it!
A must. Was worried about the steep incline and no support but once on it was no problem at all.The revolving floor meant everyone had a good view at sometime during the ascent and descent.
Amazing way to go on Table Mountain. Don't miss this way to go on the mountain. You can see the town appearing onto your eyes step by step while the cable car is turnning around.

Plan ahead. It's best to buy your ticket beforehand on line or from one of the sightseeing bus companies to avoid the queues.Some suggest you avoid the crowds and go in the afternoon, but in January and early Feb, the winds can get up and Table Mountain wears it's cloud table cloth which reduces visibility and can close the service.The rotating base of the car catches out those that have rushed for the windows!

Magnificent views. We were so lucky with the weather. Blue skies not too much wind & no rain or clouds. The thing we found was avoid the day after it has been closed & also first thing in the morning.
What a fun experience.. If you are afraid of heights and moving objects this will completely take you in. I can't say "wow" any better.

Good way to access the top!. As we weren't lucky with the weather in Cape Town we only had a clear afternoon which was our opportunity to go to the top of Table Mountain. We didn't have time to walk up it so did a return trip on the cable cars. These were great, giving a wonderful view all the way up - they revolve so it doesn't matter where you stand. If I'd had the opportunity I would have walked up and gone on the car back down.

It's definitely worth the money. We adored to trip with the Aerial cableway. The cableway is turning around while it moves slowly but surely up to Table Mountain. This is a great experience as you get the whole view already on the way up to the top. And - of course - there is nothing that beats the amazing views up there, especially on a clear, sunny day. We were very lucky. Table Mountain is a MUST for everyone visiting Cape Town.

Cool way to get up to the top. Nice views, fast and convenient.To avoid the queue, buy your tickets online.And always watch the weather forecast on their website as they close in case of strong winds or too much fog. Their website is very helpful!

Clear Views From The Tabletop. 19 Jan 2016, fm V n A Mall, boarded the Hop on Hop Off Red Tour to the mountains cable car and thirty minutes later with online tickets were in the ascending gondola. A wonderful surprise when the rotating floor afforded all passengers great views. A few took to the centre to avoid the rotation. Within minutes we were atop, exiting, finding the flagstone cemented walkways and in clockwise search of the vista views. Breathtaking in awe we found a young couple, nestled on blanket and in party hats to a Birthday, what a neat setting, sunshine and a view that went to the horizon.We took the circular loop in awe of the plants and birds and wonder on the many trails around this mountain. A cool breeze was a pleasant relief from the seaside heat.Once back at the base we soon realized the tingling to our skin in failing to uv protect. This was a small consolation in experiencing the greater moments on this world wonder!

A Must Do. If you visit Cape Town, this is one of those things you should do at least once. It is quite an amazing ride, with wonderful views. I would advise anyone going, to buy your tickets ahead of time. We waited at least an hour to buy the tickets and then another 20-30 minutes to take the Cableway up the mountain - but it was worth the wait. One more thing - if it's a sunny day - DON'T forget your sunscreen.
Perfect. Buy the tickets before hand. At the cable, Try to get a spot next to corners, so you can enjoy the view!!!

Table Mountain Cape Town. If you go after 18h00 you pay half price. If it is your birthday you go free of charge. Provide passport or Id as proof. Look out for the My City bus to take you up to the mountain for free. Watch out for Parking tickets if you park illegally. Do not wander off on footparths, even in groups, it is dangerous.
Amazing Ride. For a non walker this is the cheapest way up Table Mountain and also the best. Quick with amazing views up and down. A not to be missed experience when in Cape Town
lovely trip. we only waited 5 minutes which was great. the service is very good and all info is readily available

Beautiful!!!. Got one of the 1st cars up when I visited. Gorgeous day. Not very much fog, not too much wind (the next day it was closed due to high winds). When you arrive at the top it is breathtaking. The staff was amazing and efficient. You MUST visit Table Mountain when in Cape Town!!

Amazing views!. Great experience for all ages. I am not a big fan of heights but the cablecars feel very secure and I was able to relax and enjoy the scenery. Definitely a must when visiting Capetown!

Buy Your Tickets in Advance!. We visited during the super busy New Years period, so everything we visited had a line. Fortunately, our hotel recommended that we buy our tickets on the website in advance, which saved us a ton of time. If you don't have advance tickets, first you must wait in line to buy tickets, and then you have to wait in the general line to go up. Also, there is an estimated wait time on the Cableway's website, which allowed us to try and visit during the least crowded time. I believe it also states whether the cableway is operating, since it can be closed during high winds.The line at the bottom had lots of umbrellas and canopies providing shade, but when we were waiting at the top to return there were only a few umbrellas spaced out along the line. So, I would recommend bringing a small umbrella to give yourself some shade if you're visiting during a busy time and will have to wait on the way down.

Table Mountain. If you get the opportunity a visit to Table Mountain is a must. They say if you haven't visited Table Mountain you haven't visited Capetown.The views on a nice day are stunning. But it does shut down if windy... It had been shut for 2 weeks prior to our visit due to high winds so the day we went it was very busy, so if making the trip get there early.

An essential Cape Town experience. I got lucky during the week and arrived at a time where there were barely any queues. Staff are friendly and helpful, views are spectacular and the top of the mountain is a perfect place to take a walk. I see why so many tourists do it. It can be a bit pricey for South Africans, but there are so many half price and birthday specials, you just need to get your timing right.

Views are stunning on a clear day . This is simply a must do for Cape Town as the views from this mountain are stunning. We went around 10 am on Sunday which was getting busy already. You can book tickets online to save time waiting in the queue , but do it on the morning of your visit to make sure it is running ( closed during strong winds) and it is not covered by a cloud. Enjoy
A fun ride!. The cable car spins as it rises up to the top providing everyone with spectacular views. A great choice of something to do if you have limited time.
Great views. Struck lucky with no queues. Very entertaining operator on the cable car. Rotating car is good so you see every direction.
Efficient but long wait. Quick, easy trip to the top, but it is an extremely long wait to get on. You can buy your tickets on the app once you arrive, but not sure if this saves time.
Table mountain. beautiful views. after 6 is half price. much cooler then to see the sunset views. staff are excellent. waiting for tickets in queue is quick quick.

Super expensive but super worth it!. We climbed up and got the cable car down. Absolutely recommend doing it that way, you get to reward yourself at the end of an awesome challenge.. The cable car is bizarre how it rotates. But we loved that it gave you a different view to the mountain and beautiful Cape Town below.

Wow!. Spectacular views!It's really a world wonder!Buy online tickets to save a queue. I recommend to come after 13pm, there is less people downside and we had found a parking.Upside, at the mountain there is a wifi zone, souvenirs, and a cafe. We didn't like food in the cafe, but you can buy a bottle of wine and enjoy a sunset! It's wonderful!

Stunning Views of Table bay and The Mother City. The views from the rotating cable car and from the top of the mountain were spectacular. Long queue to get in but worth the wait. We booked and paid on-line which reduced the waiting time considerably. Our party consisted of three generations from kids to grandparents and everyone had a good experience. Once on the mountain, the walks are easy and there are plenty of benches and resting places for the not so fit and active. All is very safe from the safety aspects of the cable cars to the actual mountain top. If you're visiting Cape Town this is a must do! Just don't leave it till last as if the weather is bad or the wind too strong, the authorities stop the cars from going up.

Does what it's supposed to do. The cableway is a very convenient way to get up to or down from Table Mountain. In my opinion a bit expensive for the 5 minutes you spend in the cabin, but it brings you where you want to go. Nice views on the way, and the turning cabin makes your view 360 degrees during the ride. Perfect transport when you don't want to hike up, but not more than that.

New Year visit.. We visited on New Year's Day, what a stunning place. We got to the Cable car entrance by the hop on hop off bus, I would highly recommend purchasing your cable car tickets on the bus, as it saves queuing once you get to the base of the mountain. Views were all we had hoped they would be.Nice walk around the top of the table, however, the walk is not flat, so flip flops not the best idea.

The most beautiful view. I have been English in Cape Town for 2 weeks in the mornings and sightseeing in the afternoons! For me the Table Mountain is the most beautiful place in Cape Town , the views from the top are incredible, stunning, amazing !!!

Views at sunset. Awesome views at sunset of the awestruck Cape Town city, the Twelve Apostle mountain range and opportunities to hike or sit and enjoy the views over False Bay or dine or enjoy a picnic.

Brilliant way to see the view on the way up. Pre book tickets! We saw the que the day before and decided to book on line. We booked the early access tickets which allow you access half an hour before others. We picked the tickets up at the pick and pay near to the place where we stayed. We arrived really early. Nothing was open but we got parking which was great. Formed a line and they let the early tickets in first. Other people who didn't book early tickets had also arrived but had to wait even if they were in front of us. The cable car is great. It takes about 15 minutes to go up and as long as you are near a window you get a 360 degree view on the way up as the cable car rotates around. The que on the way down took much longer so leave at least 40 mins to get onto the cable car to come back down.

Spectacular ride. One of the "must-do" attractions in Cape Town, well worth the cost and the time. Our trip was at the height of the holiday season in early January and we made the mistake of arriving late morning in roasting heat and facing a 2 hour wait. The next day we started off earlier but the tour bus took ages to get there and again we decided not to wait. I would strongly recommend our third course of action which is to take a cab and get there before 8.30a.m. The trip up was brief and a little hair-raisng but the views get better the further you go We spent about 2 hours on the table-top and there was no delay getting back down. The views are quite magnificent in all directions.
You could walk up but this is much easier. Get there early to avoid the queues. Even with the queues it is worth it. The cable car slowly revolves 360 degrees so you get a good view.
Wonderful views. You have to do this on a clear day . We didn't spend enough time time give yourself at least 3 hours to walk round properly .. Good to go later on in day after early rush
Spinning cableway. I had never seen a spinning cableway, and it was very interesting. Nervous at first but loved the 360 degree view. The $15 pictures were well worth it for the included information.
Short but fun. I'm not walking up....just saying. The cars are unique and theres a surprise when they get under way: the floor rotates! Everyone gets a view.

Table cloth lifted in time. The day before the mountain was shrouded with cloud and unable to visit, luckily the following day it left ed enough to allow the cable car to go up. WOW what a great view we had of the harbour and city side.... exhilarating.

Unbeatable. Did the helicopter ride many years ago and thought that was great but have to admit the view from the top of the most iconic mountain in the world (I think) is something else. Could not face getting there very early, so did late afternoon and were not disappointed with the fantastic panoramic scene. Cape Town laid out before your very eyes. It was fun trying to pinpoint the land marks below. Would do it again.
travel. a wonderful view in the rotating car. You can get good photo opportunity .Reasonably priced but photos they take are not really worth it. Better to take your own.

A delight!. As always, this is a delightful experience. Well organized and well run. The restaurant on the mountain offers delicious food - the cheese cake and carrot cake is to die for! The staff is exceptionally friendly. A must visit!
what a treat. the cable car rotates so all can see the remarkable views-and terrific shops on top-a must to look down on both bays a fun and quickly moving although crowded attraction

Excellent . Go early to avoid the crowds or later in the day it's half price after 6 pm to be up there for sunset. The most amazing views ever a scary cable car ride it's very very high but well worth it we went up twice in the morning the cloud closed in around us which it often does so we went back up in the evening to watch the sunset.

Beats the Walk Up. Originally, we were planning on hiking up, but, instead, bought tickets online and arrived at the station around 8:30. We walked right in and had no wait for the gondola. The ride up was faster than expected, and everyone was surprised when the floor began rotating, since they forgot to mention that would happen. Gorgeous views from the top, with paths leading to vantage points around the rim of the 2 mile plateau. Again, we hoped to hike down, but by the time we had done a lot of viewing on top, the day was warming up and we decided to ride the gondola back down around noon. Again, no wait at the top. At the bottom, there was quite a line queued up for the ascent, so get here early. It was just a perfect day. Two people round trip on the cable car, plus taxi both ways from the waterfront came to $52. Loved it.

Efficient and lovely views. It was well organised and inexpensive. We didn't have any problem with queues but the staff who issue the tickets are efficient and I would have thought the queue would go down quite quickly. I imagine it must be frustrating though if you have to wait for ages so it would probably be good to check when is the best time to go.The cableway itself was fine. When we got in I was a bit anxious because there were quite a few people already in the car and I thought we might not be able to get very good views or photo's. However, the floor rotates so everyone has an opportunity to take photo's of different locations. It doesn't take long but I would definitely recommend it. I don't think it was particularly expensive given it's popularity.
not to be missed. Am a bit apprehensive about heights but this journey was so smooth and speedy that I felt hardly troubled at all. Views from thetop just breathtaking.

as son as there are no clouds, go there.... ...otherwise you will miss the most spectacular views over Cape town from all sides. Book your ticketts online, in town or in the bus. Saves you queing time.

Awesome views . After three overcast days we headed up the mountain at 2.00pm - no queues at all!Amazing cableway with a floor that rotates.Up the top there are short walks and long walks and simply amazing views.This one of the top 7 things to do in Cape Town for a reason!

Fast, well orgnaised, modern transportation system. My wife and I did not visit this when we came to Cape Town 10 years ago as we felt it would be cable car like in a ski resort. But the views were stunning and the trek around the top full of interesting signposts giving relevant information. We can now see why it is the top rated attraction and a must for visitors to Cape Town - not ideal for disabled - quite difficult to get around if in wheel chair or on crutches

Nice view shame about the queue. It is well worth the trip once you get there but be prepared to wait along time. We managed to get up in the cable car quite easily but when we arrived the whole experience was ruined by the sight of hundreds of people in a snake across the top of the mountain waiting to get back down. Also difficult to get photos as the people waiting were blocking the way!We felt we had to rush our visit in order to join the queue to get back down.

Worth it.. The cost of the ride is 240 rand, but if you take it after 6pm it's 120 rand. There is one that goes up and one that comes down at any given time. It hold around 30 to 50 people and keeps rotating. The normally do not operate the aerial cableway when it's windy. If you are not into trekking than this is the best way to get to the top of the mountain without breaking a sweat. The view from top is amazing and worth every penny. I would surely recommend it.

Good attraction on a clear day. I'd definitely recommend to check the weather forecast prior to getting there. On a windy day the attraction is closed and on cloudy days, even if you make it to the top you won't see anything. On a nice day, it's definitely worth going. There's a shop and a small restaurant at the top. You can purchase your tickets online that'll save you queuing to buy them.
What a view. A visit up table mountain when in Cape Town is one of the must do things. Fantastic views and a smooth ride up and down

Table Mountain Cable Car. Nice short trip up the mountain. Great views as the car has a 360 degree turning floor so you just about get a full view as you go both up and down.Just one tip - buy your tickets in advance otherwise it can be a long wait in the queue to but them and then also joining the queue to go up.Getting there early is also an advantage.

Make sure you go on a clear day. The rotating floor makes for a picturesque trip up cable mountain. I can't imagine what the trip would be like if the winds picked up or if it was cloudy.Be prepared to wait in line, especially if you haven't pre-bought tickets on line. Thankfully the line for the car has a mister that turns on intermittently when it is hot. Also be prepared to walk a long distance from where you parked your car!
cool experience. It will be crouded, it will rotate 360 degree on the way up. It is spectacular views but hard to get a good picture
surprising. We went on the cableway and were surprised at how fast it actually went.The floor turns round so you can get a good view of the area.

Hairy scarey. The visit to table mountain is a must for visitors to cape town. Pick a day when there is little cloud and the views are spectacular. The cable car is not for the faint hearted. It wooshes up the mountain and seems faster on the way down. Better than a fairground ride.
Revolving Splendour. Breathtaking views, Mother City's heart beat. Sunrise to sunset, a beautiful experience. Weather dependant, must see for every visitor.

Good Views. Its an easy way to get to table mountian however its a total tourist trap and its really crowded. they try to sell you photos and there is no escape unless you run for it. worth it if you dont want to hike up.

A must do, just book in advance. . This is a must do when I'm Cape Town. Just pick a clear day! Booking your tickets in advance will save a big queue and make you the envy of those waiting in the heat.
Amazing. Amazing is all one can say...such diversity in plant life and such a beautiful spot to see...love the restaurant a lot too.

A spectacular ride to Table Mountain by cable car. This is a very worth while trip but be prepared for long queues unless you book in advance. The cable car turns through 360 degrees as you travel up and down the mountain anfd move remarkably fast. As someone who doesn't like heights, I felt completely safe. The views at the top are spectacular and there are lots of beautiful flowers there too.

Spectacular views. Don't miss this if you go to Cape Town... Got to be one of the best experiences in this amazing city. Pre buy your tickets because the lines are slow, but once up on the mountain there is plenty of room to walk and see the views. Wear good shoes, a hat and sunscreen

A Must Do. Quick efficient route to the top of Table Mountain with the added attraction of being a rotating cable car so you get to see in all directions on the way up (and down).This is one of the 'must do' activities when visiting Cape Town.
Really interesting trip. The rotating cable car is certainly the most convenient way to Access Table Mountain. Waiting time was really very short, probably was jsut very lucky.

A must when in Cape Town. Should you be visiting Cape Town then this is a tick list must but either go early morning or late evening as it gets very busy.Either book online or queue once you get here but be patient as it seems slightly disorganised on getting onto the cable cars but once you are on the top the views and scenery are fabulous.

Great visit. I enjoyed watching the cloud come in for sunset. Weather can change quickly so be prepared. Also, be aware, there is half priced fare for the cable car, after 6. It's worth a trip just for sunset.

great views all the way. Great way to come down the mountain. The Cable car rotates so you get to see all the way round it as you descend. You can have pictures taken if you travel up and down by cablecar but for anyone who is able I would recommend the challenge and triumph of climbing the mountain

Panoramic. Best way to see Cape Town, worth the wait. Picture perfect, postcard day to see the mountain. Get your tickets in line to shorten queue time. Specials if you go up at six pm. It's such a cool thing to do, walks everything. Amazing!

Beautiful . Had a hard time getting this tour, as it was subject to the wind conditions on the mountain. We kept on checking their web page for openings and got lucky. Purchase your ticket online to minimize your wait. Views and walk are spectacular. Enjoy !!!
Very fast to the ground a lot of people fit in the Cableway. What can I tell about a cableway? It's going down fast, normal price, I used to bring my skies in Austria this time I was in my t shirt.

fantastic views all round. We decided to take the red sightseeing bus to table mountain, we paid for the cableway ticket beforehand to avoid the queues that i had heard so much about. Either we were very lucky or we went up early enough in the day but there was not a queue. The cableway takes about 5 mins to go up to the top. The cabin rotates 360 degrees so you get views of all sides on the way up and down. What a view from the top. All i would say is check the weather before you go as we got a lovely clear day, later in the week, the clouds came over and it was a bit misty. We spent a couple of hours at the top, walking around, they have rough paths along the top of the mountain which was a nice way to spend more time rather than just looking at the views and going back down.

Outstanding. . It's so incredible and the rotating cable car best way to see Cape Town. Go early to avoid the queues or book in advance. Weather depends heavily whether you go up and the winds can certainly put the journey drastically. So planning your trip is key.

disabled person. we arrived to find the disabled parking full, but the parking guard said one was not disabled and got him to move. there was a long queue to get on the cable car but as we had our booking on the i pad he sent us up in the lift, which was great as my husband could not have stood in a queue for along time. we had a lovely time at the top, had lunch and had a very enjoyable day.
Great views from revolving gondola, heat and sun can be intense on top. Hot and baking sun at the top, take hat and sunscreen and water. Enjoyable half hour when views are good
On Top of the WORLD!. The top of the mountain gives very beautiful views of Cape Town and surrounding areas as well as the ocean. Very beautiful and breathtaking

Table Mountain cableway. This one of the most beautiful view in the world, must check the weather they will not run the cableway when the it's windy take a walk a round the top it beautiful on both side of the Mountain

Very good, eventually.. For pity's sake book ahead! The queue for the tickets is the first shock. We tried to book online whilst in the queue but the WiFi is woefully inadequate to cope and the App you have to download to get the tickets seemed very flaky and kept failing, probably due to the numbers of people trying to access it. Once you have your ticket you have to join another queue for the actual cable car, so you have been warned, book your tickets ahead of your visit. Booking ahead is the first major complication because Table mountain can adopt it's iconic tablecloth at a moments notice, so trips up the cable way can be cancelled at any time so check the weather before trying to book your tickets and cross your fingers. It is worth the trip though, the views are amazing and the air is much cooler up there. The restaurant is very clean and modern BUT is a bit of a bun fight - the food area is too constricted for the amount of people trying to get food and too dark then there seems not enough tables once you do have food - we were so appalled by the whole scene we bypassed it and went down to find somewhere to eat. Well worth Table mountain is a must do in Cape Town but allow three to four hours to get up, around, and down and take water and sunscreen if only for for the queues!

Put this on your bucket list. The long queue lines are soon forgotten as you experience the 360° views made possible by the rotating floor of the cable car on the trip to the top of the mountain. I'd advise enjoying the view on the way up and take your photos on the return trip for maximum impact...
Great way to the top. very nice ride in the cable car to top of Table Mountain, Floor rotates so you get 360 degree views.

Always a special place to visit . We have been here several times, easy to access via the Cape Town red tour bus (red route) Really good visit this time as no que! This saved about an hour. Our previous visits must have been weekends as very busy then

Beautiful Table Mountain. In summertimes be sure you all ready booked a ticket, otherwise you need to wait for a longer time. The cableway is an easy way to go up and down. You can spend a long time above by walking around. A great view over Cape Town and surround is a climb or de cablecar worth it.
Amazing sunset. We went up at 6pm to watch the sunset it was amazing, with a wonderful view of Cape Town. It got a little cold so bring a jacket!
amazing. easy on line tickets. quick queue. staff knowledgeable and very helpful. clean neat and tidy. very efficient and organised

Stunning views. Beautiful views of Cape town! We thankfully bought tickets online to avoid the queue - this saved us over an hour over queue time so well worth doing. Sunset tickets cheaper and much cooler with a beautiful sunset and plenty of time to walk round. Love that the floor of the cable car spins to give everyone great views on the way up and down!
NICE VIEW. Book in advance on internet to avoid long queuesI Don't forget your camera or you phone. Wind could be strong

Thrills and chills approaching the cliff. Few cable cars are really fun but this one not only scales the mountain, it comes freakishly close to out-jutting rocks making your arrival chilling. And, the whole thing rotates around you as you go. Fun!

Great on sunny day. Loved it . Went at 1pm and avoided all the ques. The morning visit should expect more waiting time. Do not forget to buy your ticket in advance online. This is going to save you more time
Perfect visit. Excellent experience all round. Service exceptional and fabulous for kids to see Cape Town from up there. Plan for a visit on a non windy day!
worth of money. nice view you can go by cable and by foot also can book lift both side price are also different also advisable take food with you

Holidaying with teenager. June holidays brought 4 teenagers to my doorstep. What excitement!! I knew we had to go up the Cable Way.It was a hot day, thank goodness we took extra water , as the queue was a killer in the heat. Once in front and looking at the mountain the excitement grewThe journey up the mountain was amazing, to watch the scenery appear and disappear as we rotated, it was truly breathtaking.On top, the walk around the mountain, looking, taking in the scenery, having photos, doing selfies was mind blowing. It is a sight that every tourist whether local or international should do...The restaurant is quaint with great ideas for snacks or meals. The ablutions were clean.Then finally back down, queues again, but not so long, thank goodness.Back on terra firma and an experience that was thrilling and wonderful

Don't miss this. We thoroughly enjoyed this amazing experience. Despite the cable car having been closed for days due to high winds,we got there on a Saturday and the queues were quite manageable and well organised. The car rotates as it climbs so everyone gets the chance of the best views.The views from the top are breath-taking.

World class attractiion.. If you do nothing else in Cape Town, you must do this trip. The hop on, hop off bus takes you to the entrance of the cable lift, if you purchase your cable ticket at the same time you buy your bus ticket, you can save considerable time in the ticket queues. The ride to the top is exhilirating and the car rotates through 360 degrees giving nice views on the way up. This is just the start, you are now in National Park, and nearly all walking is easy on the mountain plateau. Plenty of beautiful native flowers to photograph, also sunbirds, and Dassie's ( Rock Hyrax ) outstanding views of craggy cliffs, and views to out to sea over Cape Town. There are nice clean toilet facilities and a restaurant on top, i found it easy to put in 3-4 hours up there. Down side, the queues can be enormous to reach the cable car, it took me 1-1/4 hours to get up there one morning, and when i came down 4 hours later, the queue was longer than in the morning. The cable only runs when weather conditions are suitable, but they have a very good website, letting you know current conditions. I would avoid this venue during school holidays or weekends, if possible to avoid the crowds.

Great view!. Although it was windy and closed for 5 days in Cape Town, on my last day, I was able to experience this. The queue was long but not too bad. The views from the cableway and the top were amazing!

Attractions of the Cape. Visiting table mountain is a great experience, but better than the modern improvements is the history behind the Cableway. It is excellent for families, kids (young and old) and Adults. Friendly personnel will assist you with any queries. To avoid standing in long ques, book online beforehand to have a better experience of the cableway. The cafe on the mountain is well stocked with a variety of foods and drinks. Take lots of water and sun protection.
Excellent. You should go up there, beautiful views! It is worth your while, nice walking on top but make sure you go outside rush hours to enjoy even more he beauty of Cape Town

Make sure to buy your tickets in advance. A must see in cape town but don't go near the place unless you've bought your tickets online in advance. we had bought our tickets beforehand and even then had to queue for the best part of two hours, I'd hate to think how long the queue for those without tickets took. also recommend taking one of the free walking tours once you get to the summit, really interesting and a good way to get your bearings.
the view. gable car trip worth the money with red bus trip grand daughter enjoyed the whole day will go again and take more time and picnic

Stunning View. This place is wonderful the overview is excellent and the combination of Ocean, City and nature makes it to one of my favourite place. There are places on the top were it is less busy so you can hike a bit and enjoy the views.

Ski lift with rotating floor. The subject title says it all! Its a nice, big ski lift (like they might have at Squaw Valley, Ca, or the Emirates ride to O arena, London) but the floor rotates as you stand on it so yoo get a 360 degree vuew. Easier than rappelling or paragliding, I guess.
A great morning. Great Value for money, and well worth the 45 minutes wait. We caught the Red Bus tour from Long Street and enjoyed a great experience.

Iconic. We combined our Red Bus ticket with the Cableway entry and avoided any queues or delays.We went early on recommendation which was good on a 36C day. Views are sensational.The cafe at the top serves a good coffee.

One every 5 minutes. Very well run cable car supposedly every 5 minutes and up to midnight if whether allows. Very popular. Great views from the top.Dont try to walk up unless you are an experienced climber.

Worth the wait!. I used the Aerial Cableway on 30 December 2015. The locals told me that there were unprecedented numbers ther that day, which accounted for the queues of two hours for the ascent and one and a half hours for the descent. At least by having an advance ticket I was able to reduce the former queue to an hour and a half. In the heat that day it was a bonus not to be sneered at!Despite the huge numbers, I was impressed by the speed with which the staff loaded and unloaded the cable car with minimum fuss. The views on top of the mountain were spectacular. Even in these gruelling conditions the waiting time was worthwhile.

Good aerial views of Cape Town City and the Table Mountain!. We traveled to the top of Table Mountain and back in the Cable Car. The view was very beautiful and proved to be a good build-up to the top.

Fun way to see Table Mnt. For all. This is a must do for anyone visiting Cape Town and wanting a to see a different view of the city! Although lines can be a bit hectic, it is well worth the wait. Perfect for those who want to see and explore the mountain, but not climb it. Lovely views and nature await at the top..!
Same as table mountain national park. Must do bucket list job please never miss the opportunity to go get up early ,if its not windy and the clouds aren't over the mountain get up there
Efficient Entrance Procedures and Cable Car Ride. The entrance procedures were quick and efficient. Because of the time of the day, the lines were minimal. The cable car ride was extraordinary.
Best Way to the Top. I really enjoied the cableway and highly recommend it. The trip up the mountain would be a long hike without this.

Wow what a view . A real must when you visit Cape Town the cable car with rotating floor is a real thrill. If you haven't got a head for heights then keep your eyes closed as it doesn't last long. Book online as the queue is shorter but be proved to wait an hour. Worth the wait for the view in the top!
amazing views. can't go to cape town with out going on this.Advice: go early morning.We went on the red bus to get there and got tickets for the cable car at the bus office so no waiting.

Should visit to understand the understand her majesty . We booked the kasteelspoort route through Cape Escape Tour. The starting point is Tafelburg Road at 8am through Pipe Trek Path. The guide, Mr Patrick, has helped us to know the ecosystem of table mountain, the different sounds, the flora and fauna. The pipe trek path gives the best view of camps bay on your right and the lion's head on your back. After about an hour, slow due to wonderful sightings, we took the left path known as kasteelspoort route. The path is rockey and going up up up... crawling on the boulders which stands almost 90 degree. On the way could able to observed the steel tracks which are being used to carry the boulders at the top for building the water resourver. After one and half hour of hard hiking we reached a plane land where a mountain hut was observed, with permission one can stay there. After this point trek was comfortable but three to four times climbing up the hill and down the hill. In this stretch there are three steel stair case have been placed at three different huge boulders for climbing. Another one and half hour we are at the top of table mountain. It was a memorable and enjoyable trek. We took cable way for getting down.

A must-do in Cape Town. We have been up the cable car many times and never tire of the views. Make sure you have enough time to walk around at the top and see the views the other way. Also recommend hiking up and taking the cable car down if you can. Sunset is less busy and very beautiful time to go up.

Table Mountain. Here is a must see for any one visiting Cape Town. The views are magnificent. The tram is well run and worth the price of admission. The cable car floor rotates so you will get a 360 degree view no matter where you stand. The top is windy and chilly so bring a jacket. There is opportunity to hike around the top of table mountain for the sporty types. After seeing Table Mountain head to the V&A to take a picture of your friends with the mountain in the back ground.

Go early. Pre book your tickets and get up there early whether you're hiking up (before sunrise), or using the cable car as the queues can reach 3hrs long in peak seasons. I suggest walking up the 2hr trail and paying for a single trip down on the cable car, it's more adventurous and cheaper. Locals, on the week of their birthday, get a free trip up and down, just show your SA green ID book or ID card. Views are spectacular from the top. Don't leave Cape Town without visiting this top site. Set aside 1/2 day.

Add to your Bucket list. Something we always wanted to do! So it was the first time for us all. We were blessed with an awesome clear day and the view was picture perfect!The cable car was not as scary as I imagined it, even my little one enjoyed it. The facilities were very clean and all the staff were friendly and helpful.I have been amazed by the variety of flowers - it was beautiful!A bit pricey for the average South African, especially if a family would like to go up. Would be nice if they could have a special price for South Africans.

Find a way of avoiding the queues. A short but worthwhile cable car experience, especially mid-summer but those queues in severe heat - oh dear. Especially the return trip as there is no cover until the 'station'. Probably 2 hours each way.I ignored the advice on one site to delay the trip until afternoon. Stupid. Also I drove to Table Mountain via the road from the city which added another 45 minutes to the experience. The longer route via Camps Bay has to be better, if that's an option. Thankfully I had bought a ticket, online, in advance or I would have been turned away, such was the popularity. I acknowledge my visit was during the peak holiday week (December 30) but other sunny days are also bad, I was told. After those negatives, I have to say that the cable car experience itself was great. Wonderful views and the 360 rotating platform is a tremendous initiative.

Fantastic. It really was one of the best places I have been to, it's worth the wait, I just would recommend that buy the tickets online, there was on staff there that showed us how to buy online and I did on my cell phone, that made us cut the waiting time in almost one hour. But this is a must go.

Beautiful views, long lines. Table Mountain is very beautiful. It has fantastic views of the city and it's a great thing to see if you're visiting Cape Town. With that said, the line up to get up and down in peak season makes it in my opinion completely not worth it. Definitely buy tickets online before you go or you can be standing in hot heat waiting 4-5 hours just to get up. We did buy tickets in advance so it took us 2 hours to get up and another hour to get down. The lines were unorganized and it was a brutally hot day. Had I not been going abseiling, I would never have braved the lines. If the lines are short and it's not peak season I'd 100% recommend it.

Wonderful experience. Can do this again and again. Lovely views. Fun ride!! Rotating aerial views over Cape town. If it is your birthday you can do it for free!! Definitely a must do when in the mother city!!

Cable Flight. This experience seems to not last long enough You want it to go on as it is lovely going around and the view is great. Very professional and organised Staff well trained and very friendly

Good but can be better managed . The cable car is impressive. However service wise they could get better for sure. For example they can sell discounted tickets online so that more people buy and we save time in queues. They only sell. Limited options online and close the selling quite early. The queue management was also a little sloppy. But overall the experience was good.
Dont miss it. Cape town is table mountain ,You take the cableway and reach the top ,with no doubt it was my best view i have ever seen

Great way to go up the Table Mountain . You can buy the tickets for the cable way at several spots in Cape Town and also in the hop on and hop off bus. We recommend to buy the tickets in advance. The cable way is easy, fast with a great view. The cable car has a 360 view as it turning along the way.
Awesome View. The cable car was huge and held very many people. It was a thrilling ride up and a magnificent 360 view when we reached the top.

Worth the wait. We went to table mountain during the peak holiday season. We had to wait for 2 hours before we got on the mountain but it was worth it. The line was long but it moved very fast and was orderly. Once we wer up there.wow!!the view is just surreal. U can literally see most of capetown up there . there is also a gift shop and gorgeous cafe to eat. We enjoyed the food there. My advise however is that as soon as you get up the mountain, there is an option of booking the tym you want to go down so you don't have to wait in a 2 hour queue to go down as well. Wc is wt we experienced.

Buy Your Tickets Online!. We arrived early to find a long line that indicated we had a 45 minute wait. While my wife got in line, I went over to the building, found they had free wifi, and used my smartphone to order tickets online, thus skipping a longer wait.

Long waiting lines!. 31st December is definitely not the time to go up the cableway very long waiting times - especially if you've not booked your tickets online. To stand in 40 • C for more than 2 hours can be sapping !However the view from atop is absolutely stupendous.

Beautiful . Had the pleasure of taking my three year old up the cable way for her first time last month. We had a great time. The guides are informative and friendly. The view from above is breathtaking and the area is practically clear which makes walking around, even with a young child so easy and fun. So proud to live in this city.
Breathtaking. Went up table mountain twice, and everytime it takes my breath away with its beauty. Second time it was my birthday and it made it extra special getting a free ticket on the day

Go in the afternoon. If it looks like a fine day ,go in the afternoon,less crowdedWe were there the week before christmas and went at 2 pm ,weather perfect and the line started at the bottom of the stairsYou are packed in ,but it rotates and is quite quick so you are up in no time .

awesome view. the cable way to the table mountain is a wonderful mode of transport to the top. carefully crafted path. the tickets to this cable car can be booked online (which i would recommend to avoid waiting in long queues). if you are unable to there is a wait for nearly an hour for buying tickets and then joining the que to the cable car. the place where the cable car inities is very windy and during the time we were there we needed good woollen cover.The ride is approx for 8 minutes.the view from this cable car during sun set was amazing .golden hue tinged with pink and orange..

Spectacular views and walks!. Riding the Aerial Cableway to the top of Table Mountain is quiet an experience! It is exciting and the views are breathtaking. Don't worry about crowds and waits - the process is very well run, and moves along nicely. Once you are on the top, you can stay as long as you like, and go down when you want. It may seem like there are a lot of people when you are in line, and in the cable car, but once on top, everyone spreads out and wanders - it is a lovely flat hike with incredible views. Wonderful for all ages and abilities. Not only are there views, but interesting foliage, plants and flowers are growing up there. I have been there when it is clear, and when the clouds are rolling in - both are incredible. Note that there are restrooms there, as well as a nice restaurant where you can take away snacks and drinks, or sit down for tea or a glass of wine. The views are exceptional - not to be missed. Glorious!

Must do. But beware of queues. Buy your ticket beforehand on a red tourist bus or online. Bring plenty of water on a hot day. The cable car is great but expect to be in a mass crush while waiting to board a car to go back down. The restaurant is great and the staff are fantastic (I'm not reviewing the mountain, its obvious incredible)

A must do but there are must do hints too. It is all very well done and well worthwhile BUT it is SO busy. Firstly parking. There is no car park so get your spot on the approach road where you can and pay the ‘guard’ when you leave. To get the best spot (it is a steep long road especially on a hot day) go right to the top and turn back at the roundabout and take the first spot you can. Alternatively come on the hop-on sightseeing bus. You MUST buy a ticket in advance (on line ticket valid for 7 days from date of your choice, or on the sightseeing bus) as the queue for tickets can be over an hour on top of the queue for the cable car (we waited 45 mins+). Go in the morning when you can see it is clear. I think it often gets worse during the day and rarely gets better. Wear stout shoes as the paths at the top soon decay into rocky walks. All well maintained but not smooth. Disabled access good for the first part of the paths at the top so worth going. The cable car rotates as it goes up so no need to try to grab a good spot. They are all good! There are no barriers to falling off the edge of the mountain, so parental control and self-control is the order of the day. Walking up and/or down is only for the really fit. Food at the top is decently priced and decently good albeit in a busy place. There is a new system now for booking a place in the inevitable queue to get back down. The system will have evolved. We were there on its first day (2 days before Christmas can you believe!). Take a timed ticket from the machine (your choice of time) as soon as you leave the upward cable car terminus. The queue to go down equals the one to go up and this ticket enables you to have a walk/coffee/comfort break instead of wasting an hour in a queue!
rotating cableway, ensuring 360 degree views for all passengers. Good experience, but make sure you get there as early as possible, as we did, otherwise the queues are very long.

Spectacular. A must visit. Recommend sunset since there were no queues and you get the benefit of daylight on the way up, breathtaking sunset views at the top and a night view on the way down. Magical and well deserved new 7th natural wonder of the world.

Up, up and away..... what great afternoon.. We decided that walking was too much energy (but you can do it if you like) and went up to the top of Table Mountain via the cableway. The booking was done in advance online which saved time queing and definitely a thing that should be done if you can, especially in holiday seasons and weekends. The staff are very friendly and it would seem that the buildings and equipment are well maintained. The short trip to the top was excellent but the views from the top were spectacular. The restuarant at the top was very busy if you need a drink or bite to eat. We did have a wait a good 30min to get a cable car back to the bottom and there is little to no shade to stand under. Be prepared for both hot and cold weather.Great experience and you can't visit Cape Town without doing this at least once.
Pricey but easy way up. Cableway does get extremely busy during peak season and can be pricey but if you are unwilling to trek up the mountain it is the easiest way up bar helicopter.

Visit Table Mountain. If you are in Cape Town you need to visit Table Mountain. But to get there you had to go bye cableway. Remember to buy the ticket through the website where you avoid the long queue to buy a ticket on the spot.

Awesome as always. To buy your tickets online is the best advice, we didn't really have to queue long at all and went straight to the cable car. The views are spectacular and the restaurant's food is always good. Even when it is very busy, one does not realize it, as the restaurant works on a self-service basis. I can definitely recommend this beautiful wonder of the world to any visitor.

The newish cable cars are fantastic giving a wonderful viewof the City.. Table Mountain is a must visit in Cape Town and the cable cars are a must unless you feel extremely energetic, then you can walk. The cable cars are round thus affording everyone a great view of Cape Town. They leave every about 12 minutes in season. Get there early otherwise you could be standing in the queue for up to 2 hopes.

Totally Unorganised. Website said 5 mins waiting time so off we went. Parked half way and walked-only to find a mammoth 2.5 hr queue to buy tickets and then rejoin another 1.5 hr queue to get on the mountain so not 5mins.Lots of people complaining so we left. Badly organised..

Over priced. Yes, this is a very convenient way to travel up Table Mountain, offering amazing views, but the ticket prices border on extortion and are most certainly not directed at the local South African market.

Fantastic but there can be long queues. The breathtaking views from the top are well documented, another major plus for me was doing the cablecar and seeing the shales of rock up the mountain almost perfectly level...amazing. The car rotates which is a good feature, though the grubby windows in places can spoil an otherwise perfect picture.The downside though are the massive queues for the cablecar. They say go early but unless you are there at least before 8am or even earlier it is not worth going 'early'. We took one of the first City Sightseeing buses on 30 December and were in line around 9.45am (later than expected due to queuing traffic on the aporoach to the mountain) and got through about 11.15am. Queues were much shorter at the bottom when we returned about 3pm, though it was hotter. Note that there is only shade for so long in the queue (we had shade for about an hour), so bring adequate protection, I wish we had brought an umbrella, as it was a 30 degree day.The killer though is the queue to come down which is almost entirely unshaded, apart from close to the car which is a crowded room without air con. So despite precautions we still got sunburnt. I feel the customer experience here could certainly be improved - namely air con inside and some further shaded areas for the queue.There are also long queues for the cafe and restaurant at the top. We got fed up with the restaurant queue so tried the cafe but they had already run out of sandwiches and wraps by at least 12.30pm.Better to try on a day when it is less hot, ideally February onwards and outside of holiday periods, if you can.

Wonderful. Long queue but well worth the wait, most of the wait is in shade. The view from the top is spectacular. The cafe could do to have more seating. There are lots of places to sit but most are in full sun. The views make the trip.

choose your time carefully to avoid hours in line. We climbed up - it was not easy so please bring water and make sure you are fit enough. during peak season it is massive amount of people at Table Mountain and a lot of waiting in line

Breath taking views . Having visited before we knew to check the weather for a clear day and booked on line with a ref to show on your phone. Saves time as there are always queues. We arrived at 8 am and had to park quite away below ( about a 10 min walk up hill) we then had an hr wait in the pre booked line. The other was even longer. When you pre pay on line I think the tickets are valid for a few days in case the weather suddenly changes. Take binoculars as well as cameras as the views are amazing. There is now a cafe bar/ restaurant at the top which wasn't there before. A must visit when visiting Capetown

Unlike most others. Table Mountain is the iconic flat-topped hill overlooking Capetown: The cable car goes to it's top. Tickets are available in many places and online but be careful; the high winds that affect Capetown on a regular basis often cause the cable car to shut down suddenly, for unpredictable periods making planning difficult. The car is fairly unique in that it rotates during the trip; no matter where you stand you get to see everything, Capetown or the dramatic cliffs. The top of the volcanic hill has outstanding views of the city and the coast. There is an excellent restaurant on top. The top is quite barren with abundant fauna and flora. Dress warmly, the strong winds at the top can make the temperature much cooler. Be prepared for lines at the base and for the return coming down.

Not just another mountain. Some unlucky people find Table Mountain shrouded in clouds when they try to visit the top. Don't be one of those. Study weather and seize the day when it's in your favor. Get your tickets online -- if you're my kind of tourist there will be a line for the tram (mostly shaded) when you get there at 11:00 am, and you don't want to do two lines. If you head for the eight o'clock opening or even something sort of early you could avoid queueing and of course we know about all the nice worms available for early birds. Better yet, the late (sunset) runs are reduced price, and probably less crowded but of course risk of cloud may go up. If you want help or information from a person as well as the handy cell phone app available for free, pick up a guide (green shirts.) Theoretically these give free tours on the hour, but go up to one at any old time and you will find there is no charge; your gratuity is his or her salary, but mine earned it with plenty of information, key views, and a walk exactly tailored to my physical limits in time and effort. The facilities at top and bottom are top-notch -- visited Whistler in British Columbia five months earlier and these are every bit as well-built and well run, with a lot more lore and history (no insult intended, O Canada!) The cafeteria can get crowded but the food seems fine and covers a family-friendly middle ground. Table Mountain is a favorite outing for locals as well as tourists, and you'll find whole families from every one of South Africa's nations spending the day. Also a treat.

Sunset view breathtaking..perfect if with less-mobile travel companions. We went in the off season, so line was very short in the late afternoon. We went up to enjoy the sunset and were not disappointed...views of the city/Robben Island/Camp's Bay, were unbelievable. I preferred the hikes (Lion's Head hike @ sunset or actually hiking up Table Mtn), however if with any less mobile travel companions I highly recommend this route up the mountain. I recommend calling beforehand to make sure that the cablecar is running (often stops due to winds), and also that it will remain open for you to get back down! Also, we brought our own snacks/drinks which turned out to be a good call since cafe at the top of cablecar is very expensive.

Breath-taking. Times have changed since my first ascent of the world-famous landmark. But the early open gondolas remain on view! Now the ride up the mountainside is on rotating versions - slick but not quite as terrifying. The quantities of ascendants has also multiplied - a hundredfold - so try and avoid the queues and the tourbuses. The evening times are cheaper and more rewarding. Watch the weather forecast - high winds and sudden squalls close the cableway.
No shade. Very busy: one hour traffic queue to get there to be faced with a 2-hour queue with no shade to get on the cable-car.

Up, Up and Away.. Wherever you travel in the world the experience is better than the picture you see back home. The short journey up to Table Mountain was smooth and effortless but the view ascending was awesome !
