The floor within the car revolved to give a panoramic view so that all on board could see and not just those at the front.The descending journey was also a great experience because you can then focus on those views missed on the upward trip.

Amazing.... We were 11 people - 4 adults and 7 'kids' ranging from 18 to 23 and everyone had a great time. We headed up to the mountain cable car for 8am so we could beat the queues. There were quite a few people queuing up for tickets when we got there so my husband booked them online while we were standing there. Would recommend you book tickets in advance to save queuing! Up we went... A rotating cable car so that everyone gets to see the views. Once up at the top there are plenty of places to take photos with amazing views. We grabbed a bite to eat in the restaurant before we started off on our walk. IMPORTANT - make sure you take plenty of water and sun cream. We didn't have enough water and there is nowhere to buy any except from the shop at the top. We walked for about 3 hours (approx 7km) stopping for photos. When we got back there were a lot of people so best advice is to get up there early! A great morning and we were lucky because the weather the next couple of days wasn't very good for going up table mountain so get up there as soon as you can!! ;-)

Wonderful experience. Being a Brazilian I've been to the cable car in Rio de Janeiro. Have to say I'm bit afraid of them, so I was in Cape Town.But frankly speaking, I didn't feel scared, otherwise, I enjoyed every moment. And the way it keeps turning around so everyone have the opportunity to get different views is amazing.The restrooms are clean and the only problem I felt was that we bought our tickets one day prior through Internet and even though we had a 2 hour cue. Out of that, amazing experience. Recommend

Often closed and massively overpriced. We planned on going with the cableway but then decided against it as we saw that a return ticket costs R350 during main season for a 5 min. ride each way. In the end, on the day we wanted to walk up, they were closed due to gale force winds anyway. So far, 70 % of my days in CT, it was closed, so don't get your hopes too high and if you plan on walking up and going back down with it, don't count on it.
Amazing views!. Definitely worth a visit on a clear day! Go earlier the better so your not disappointed as the winds pick up in the afternoon and they have to shut it if too strong.

Sick!!!!. If you go to Cape Town, there is no way that that you will not do this.The cable car is crammed with 65 people but the cable car is huge so it's not bad. But you could end up in the middle and end up not seeing a lot if you are short. One of the unique features is that it has a rotating floor which lets you take in all the views.On the top, although you may not see it from your hotel/ apartment room, there is a nice restaurant , a shop and of course toilets, etc.
Better than the pictures. Wow what a mountain. So worth the trip, the walk or cable car. You won't be disappointed! Sunset is peak period for obvious reasons.

Excellent view from rotating cable car.. The cable car ride is a 'must do' for a visit to Cape Town. The large observation windows make for good viewing of the terrain travelled over as well as the wider area. he rotating car ensures that all passengers have an opportunity to have an uninterrupted view. The crowd was well and unobtrusively managed and the cost is very reasonable, especially when included in the Hop On Hop Off bus fare.

My Spectacular Cape town Cableway ride. The ride to the top of the Table mountain was great despite the long wait of about 2 hours on the queue it was worth the time i waited. The view of the whole city is just so breathtaking. its a spectacular place to visit. I had fun. I would urge those going there to buy their tickets in advance like we did saves you an extra 2 hours wait to get to the pick up point.
Great views. A must for family with kids on a visit to Cape Town. Very organised. Parked at the bus stop and caught the bus up to the cable station. Purchase tickets online to prevent long lines

Excellent view of Capetown and excellent hiking spot. The ride has a superb view and very comfortable. We were lucky enough to go up on a good day in November. Not so hot and sunny. Nice view of Capetown. Definitely recommend it. Hotel got us tickets before we arrive at cable station so we did not have to wait in line. The staff was very courteous. Very clean. A very pleasant rideA fabulous view to take picture as the tram descends from the top

No 1 attraction in Cape Town!. This is the most beautiful attraction you can experience in Cape Town. It's wise to book in advance and to check the weather before heading to The Cable Car. We had a clear view when we got on the summit but after 20 mins clouds gathered over the peak. The cable car is spinning during its way to the summit. Don't miss the views of Camps Bay, Stadium or Lion's Head while you're in the cable car. At the top you will find a souvenir shop and a cafeteria. The views are awesome and they can't be compared with anything else. It's a must even if you stay only one day in CPT. Ticket costs 240 R pp.

A busy day at Table Mountain. This was a must do activity during our stay in Cape Town over Christmas.First the good - the trip is well worth it and is a unique experience. The novelty of the revolving floor means everyone gets a fair view on the way up and down. I would also advise buying tickets in advance so you join the main queue without having to wait to buy a ticket.Then the opportunity for improvement - it would have helped if notice was given at the bottom of the average wait at the top for the return trip. We had to wait till we got to the top to find that we could "book" a return slot but it was 2.5 hours wait. Having booked our return and enjoyed the experience at the top we found that the ticketed return system failed as people were being allowed through with various slot numbers almost to the point of it being a free for all.
Unbelievable experience. The aerial cableway is such an unbelievable experience, it was safe amd secured, the view from the top of table mountain is an experience we will never forgot.

Pretty amazing. The cableway is often closed when weather is windy. It is a fab experience. The floor rotates so everyone gets a great view. But the queues for tickets are horrendous. Go early and pre-book tickets on line!!

Long waits but completely worth it . You can't miss table mountain when you come to Cape Town. When you first arrive you have to wait in line to purchase tickets, then wait in line to go up the mountain, then wait in line again to come back down so be prepared to do a lot of waiting but know that it is worth it. Our group had a tour guide and a driver which I recommend as they close the mountain to traffic when it gets too full, parking is limited, and we saw a lot of people walking a loooong way to get there. We also got there pretty early (by 9 am), which was good because shortly after cars were turned away. When we got there we found out we could have purchased tickets ahead of time online which would have made things easier and cut out 2 hours of waiting. You can purchase beer and food at the top too! It's cheaper to go up in the afternoon, but we noticed every afternoon table mountain was covered with clouds (aka zero visibility) so I recommend going early in the morning.

A lot of effort but worth it. It took 3 days to get up to Table Mountain due to the fact it was closed for much of the time. The weather was perfect in town but totally different to what is on the mountain so don't assume if it's a sunny day that it'll be open. Make sure you pre-purchase tickets online. They're refundable if you don't use them. It's definitely worth paying extra and going to the 7:30 session. Our first try we went in the afternoon. Just as we got there they closed the cable car. I heard one lady complaining she'd been waiting over an hour. The traffic going back down the hill was horrendous and not moving. We walked down but if you had a car up there you were stuck. Our second attempt was at 7:30am the next day. We were put in an express queue to go up first so not only do you not have to wait in a queue we also missed all the crowds up the top. Once there the effort is definitely worth it. Just stunning! You can walk along the various routes so give yourself plenty of time. Even at that hour the cafe was busy so take this into account if you want to have breakfast there

The Mother city.....Cape Town. Being a resident of Cape Town with the iconic mountains and beaches and great weather...this should be a must for all.I have been living here for over 36 years and still cannot get tired of our awesome views.Come and see for yourself...it will not be regretted.
a must visit. never leave Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain.the view from the top is awesome & so picturesque

Stunning as always. We chose to book afternoon tickets which are valid for 7 days from purchase. As it was high season, although the table cloth was beginning to descend over the mountain, we only went up after 4pm and had no wait to go up in the cable car. Coming down was another story but understandable due to the time of year. As the wind became very cold we chose to buy jackets at the Shop at the Top (I had forgotten how quickly the weather can change) and were pleasantly surprised to find that they we not exorbitantly expensive and of very high quality. We really did need them as our wait for a cable car down ran to about 2 hours but then also afforded us the opportunity to watch the sun go down.All the staff are friendly and efficient and the whole area is very well kept and clean.Definitely an experience worth making the effort for.

Don't miss out on this when in Cape Town!. Taking the cable car up to the top of table mountain is an absolute must when you are in Cape Town. The view from the cable car is fantastic, as are the views from the top of Table Mountain. We went there at about 18h30 and rode up while there was still full day light. We then took in the sunset at the top of the mountain and came back down while darkness was falling. That way we got to see the day time and night time view from the cable car. But be aware that if you have a serious fear of heights then the cable car is not for you.

Adventure. The cable car will cost you R240.00 return trip. you can pay for one trip and then walk all the way down. There are incredible views of Cape Town, Camps Bay, the Stadium. You can also walk around the mountain and experience nature and wild creatures. Don't forget to put on your Sunscreen, comfortable shoes, a pair of sunglasses and a hat.
December 2015 visit. Great experience and well worth the visit. Buy tickets online as the queues can be horrendous. The view is breathtaking on a clear day. Carry caps and sunblock

Well worth a visit, the views are amazing!. Recommend that you buy your tickets before you arrive as there is a queue for the ticket counter and another one for the cable car. We got ours on the hop on hop off bus terminal 5 and other people on the bus didn't buy them and queued up when they arrived. They were still in the queue when we got on the cable car. You can buy on the bus before you arrive but once you are there the bus driver can't sell the cable car tickets. Amazing views and well worth going in the morning before the "tablecloth" (cloud cover blankets the mountain). The 12 apostles and view of the beaches were truly amazing. Some wheelchair access paths too! The cable car revolves as you go up so everyone gets a chance for a photo - a great and very fair cable car ride!

Worth the wait!. The mornings are a popular time to go up the cable car and explore Table Mountain so be sure to get there early and expect to stand in a queue if you going during a peak period. If you are willing to wait, the mountain offers an amazing view of Cape Town and Robin Island from a number of vantage points. Not only are the views spectacular, the fauna and flora are also one of a kind. Try to arrange buying your tickets before getting there but beware of the unpredictable weather!
Long Lines. Long lines to wait for the cable cars, but not unbearable. We waited for an hour and a half while the rest of the family hiked up Plateklip Gorge to the top.

Visit in February. I've been twice to table mountain and each time was great, the first year was scorching hot and not a breath of wind while the second time we had to get off the mountain because of high winds. Conditions change quickly on table mountain so make sure to go on a clear day

The only way to visit Table Mountain. Whilst you can hike up the Mountain, most people will want to use the cable way. The cars now have a revolving floor so that everyone sees the views on the way up and down.Queues to use the cable car seem ineveitable but it is truly worth it when you get to the top of Table Mountain - the views are simply stunning. Around the cable car area at the top, paths are well laid out and would be suitable for wheelchairs.
great. great place to visit. make sure you get tickets online to avoid long lines to wait. we had to wait 4 hours!!!

"Natural Wonder indeed.". Wonderful day trip with family . Save time by taking the cable cart going up and down. Buy tickets online and avoid standing in a very long queue. Weather permitting great to walk the pathways on top of the mountain and take in wonderful views. Best place to watch a sunset in the southern hemisphere. Time your trip towards the late afternoon and it is even at a reduced rate for the cable cart. Keep in mind to take something warm to wear as it can be quite nippy. One can also enjoy refreshments or have something to eat at the restaurant. Sit down or take away.

Always a winner. Best way to see the city. Whether you hike up and cable down or buy a return trip you will not be disappointed. Queues during school holidays can be around 2-3 hours of waiting, so get there early and be sure to put on sun block and take a bottle of water.

Great Views of Cape Town. What a beautiful area to walk around and view this magnificent city. We did not hike up the mountain, we took the cableway and we still needed our water, because it is quite warm in December. Once you get to the top, there is still some serious negotiating around the area and rocks. During peak times it is best to get your tickets ahead of time online to eliminate some of the wait time.

Breathtaking Table Mountain. Table Mountain is a MUST DO - superb views and on a clear day you can see the whole of the Cape Peninsula and Robben Eiland - little animals and flowers are abundant and in the summer season can be very busy and at times the south easterly wind closes down the cable car - well worth being one of the 7 wonders of the world
Try it early in the Morning. The wait for the cableway was really long in the afternoon. But the view of the entire city and the Peninsula from here are breathtaking

Amazing . We went up on a cloudy day which means we had absolutely no view haha. But I still thought it was great. Looked really cool with all the fog/cloud around you. Cable car is quick and smooth. Tried to go up again on a clear day but had a 2 hour wait. I would have gone if I didn't have my 1 year old with me. Would of been worth the wait. :)

A Must do!!!. i loved driving up to the table mountain,although i had queue for a while, it was worth the wait. riding all the way the top of the mountain was nothing short of amazing. the surrounding view, the mountain itself , the rock formation, all just makes it perfect! don't miss it on ur visit to cape town.

Wow - Top of the World.. Buy your ticket on line first to avoid at least half of the queuing. Go in the afternoon - weather permitting to avoid the morning rush. Take warm clothes - its a different world up there. Awesome views. Restaurant very confusing to negotiate, with some food ready to go and other to pay for by weight!
Great experience!. Definitely worth saving your legs and taking the cable car! Stunning views on the way up and down of Table Mountain, Lion's Head and the city!
Table mountain trips. I use the cable car regularly as I climb the upper crags. Never get tired of the view. The efficiency of the staff and humorous commentary on the way up.

A must-see when you come to Cape Town. Climbing Table Mountain either by foot or by cable car is a must when you come to the mother city. Although it is very weather depending, the view from the top is amazing.

Crowded but worth it. Table Mountain is a must do, but be forewarned that the Cableway is frequently shut down due to high winds, so have a backup plan in mind. The views are stunning from the top, but expect a crush of bodies in line to get back down.

A must-do in Cape Town. Even if it wasn't one of the 7 natural wonders of the world, it is certainly a must-do if you're ever in Cape Town. For South Africans, it's free to go up on your birthday.. be sure to have your i.d. with you to prove it though. It's also free to children under 4, so taking my 3 year old son up for his 3rd birthday was cool (his request, not mine)The best viewing time is to go about 2 hours before sunset (during September 2015, it took us 2 hours standing in a queue to get up, and almost the same amount of time to get down, and only about 30 minutes at the top). Go at this time so you can experience daylight, golden hour (my favourite), and the amazing night lights that you can see across the city.Also book online in advance on the Webtickets site, so you can avoid at least 1 extra queue, and you can even scan in the barcode from the phone at the entrance to the cableway, no printing necessary (just make sure your phone has enough juice). Make sure your cameras are fully charged and have plenty of space on your memory card, because you'll want to snap the amazing sights at the top and the bottom of the mountain. When we went, it was a wind-free day and there was a 40-something year old guy showing off by flying his drone all over the place.. I don't think that's responsible or should be allowed either way though.. and he eventually crashed it somewhere and damaged the propeller.Be very careful with your young ones though.. it's possible for them to run right off the mountain in some parts. I still don't get why some people insist on taking dangerous photos while standing at the edge.Also be careful on the cable car itself.. if you're tall, and holding a child or baby, then stand as close to the centre as possible to avoid dropping them over the rail! (I was surprised that there was no previous warning about this)The cable car floor rotates to give you epic 360 degree views, so you literally have nowhere to balance or hold on to when you're going up or down the mountain.. be careful. Apparently you can also hike up and take the cable car down at half the price (it's about 2 hours of hiking for the average joe).. maybe I'll do that one day.There's also abseiling options available at the top (maybe I'll also do that one day), as well as a gift shop, a mini restaurant/coffee shop, and a loo at the top and the bottom of the cable car areas.There's also free guided tours every hour or so, on the hour.. just be at the assembly point in time.. was sad I missed it

Make sure you have a clear day!. Overlooking Cape Town, Table Mountain is a breathtaking place to visit. From the flat upper surface (hence the name) you can not only see downtown Cape Town and its harbor, but also some of the surrounding communities making up Greater Cape Town. The ride up by revolving cable car is quite an experience, but not for those having a fear of heights! Once up the walking around is easy and there are many paths and interesting vegetation to explore. Mae sure you have a clear day without imminent low clouds, for these can obscure all the great views.
Great view . It was one of the hottest days , but amazing experience , I think it's a bit expensive to go on top but once in a life time right so we got to pay .
Help. OK, it is not smart but still a warning... DOn't try to go up during the holiday (dec / jan). Too crazy with a 2 hour wait!!

Quick, efficient and it rotates!. We were there on a National Holiday but there were no great crowds. Simple efficient way to get to the top. The cars rotates so everyone gets a view. Parking is along the road so you may need to walk a little

Do not miss! . Please do it as soon as you reach Cape Town. You never know how quickly the weather changes. We left our hotel to go to the table mountain. When we got there it was beautiful and clear blue skies. Gorgeous view. However just after we got there, the clouds ascended the mountain so beautifully. We got shots of the views when it was clear as well as videos of the clouds ascending. It was stunning. But after that it got very cold and started raining. So basically the weather can change in minutes. Go there as soon as you get to Cape Town please.

WoW Christmas Eve and no waiting. Great the drive up is said - " Open ", on windy days it closes, Park at the side of the road at the top approaching the cable car station. Parking is free.Another way is to take the Red Bus, the hop on off open air double decker drops you 50m from the cable station, here you will find toilets / snacks / hats for sale.it can get cool on the top so pack something warm. when entering the cable car don't panic about being near a certain window or view, it revolves around very slowly so everyone gets the fab views. + - 60 people per car.On top you can walk for miles or stay close to the station the view is fantastic in every direction, Cafe serves foods hot and cold drinks inc wine. A must for your Cape Town Trip

Amazing Views. We took an afternoon to go up to the top of Table Mountain. The views were spectacular in every direction. It was cold and windy that day during their winter, but there are shops and a restaurant where you can grab a snack and warm up. We found some very nice quality items for sale up there including jewelry and many varieties of jerky. If the weather had been warmer outside, we might have hiked around while up there. I highly recommend taking a couple of hours to do this while in Cape Town. Bring binoculars if you have them.
Excellent . A must see for any tourist and local, staff friendly and well informed. I would recommend this to tourists and locals

What a fun surprise!. After 6 hours hiking up Skeleton Gorge, we took the cableway down. What a great surprise! The views are amazing, and the cabin rotating 360 is the best. A fantastic way to end the day and not to be missed especially if you've climbed up!It gets very crowded though so be prepared to queue. Having a taxi tel number to call to pick you up a short walking distance from the entrance saved us tons of time in line. Good tip!

Breathtaking experience of 360 degree view in cable car amidst the way to table mountain.. Never miss the sunset from on top of table mountain. It was a wonderful experience of mountain climbing aka trekking and cable car.

We took the cableway down after climbing the mountain. The ride itself is a great experience (unless you're afraid of heights) but buying tickets from the top is a long process of queueing in and around the tiny curio store...

Table Mountain Cableway.. One cannot visit Cape Town without travelling on the cableway. It is an absolute MUST. In high season the line is very long and moves slowly, very slowly. The staff are really friendly helpful and very professional, the day before we went it was closed because there was strong winds so just imagine the crowd when turned up the next day. Our coach was due to depart at 8 am sharp from the hotel, by the time we got to the bottom of Table Mountain lower station, after a long wait eventually to top of the mountain. It only takes 5 minutes to get to the top and rotates 360 degrees so you can all enjoy the 360 degree view. It the hold about 60 people very trip. After a quick 30 minute visit and quick look at the souvenir shop, it was 10 minutes waiting time at the upper station before starting to think about coming down again.

CAPE Visit - MUST SEE. We visited Table Mountain in what can be described as Cape Town's heaviest tourist season. We tried attempting to enter the cabelway for a morning visit, but traffic was so hectic that roads were closed. We then decided to do the sunset tour and went back at around 3:30pm. The lines took us an hour to get through, but then we were on our way. Stunning views from a dizzying height definitely comes to mind. The trails were reasonably flat and accommodating to even the most laxed walker. We stayed until 8pm to see the sun set and man was it worth it. Table Mountain can be closed on some days due to weather. And if you do make it to the top, please ensure lots of sunblock, a hat and water.

Delightful ambiance & breathtaking views. This should be one of the most interesting activities to always consider when visiting the mother city. The ride is so smooth & fast and the rotating floor gives it a pleasing advantage since you can be able to take photos not worrying about your position. It doesn't end there, the top of the mountain really gives breathtaking views of the mother city, the mountains and robben island. If you are a photo frenzy then you'd really enjoy taking pics on top of mountain rocks and in front of beautiful mountains and the ocean. Fortunate enough the day we went the weather favoured us. The ambiance was delightful.

SCARY!!!!. For someone who is afraid of heights like me, this was a hair raising experience. However, the cable cars are very safe and secure and the journey its self only takes 2-3 minutes so is over before you know it. Queues during busy period are extensive, in hindsight we would have pre-booked, although even pre-booked visitors had to queue for quite a while. Definitely a must do when visiting Cape Town - alternatively, you could walk it!?

You haven't seen Cape Town until you've been up Table Mountain. The Scene: after 3 cloudy days in Cape Town, our last day luckily cleared up. Unlike others we decided not to hike it and took the cable car instead. Positives: The cable cars have rotating floors as you ascend/descend so even if you are last to board your car, you still get a 360 view on the way up/down. Amazing view of Cape Town, if you go towards the back you also gets view of both the Indian and Atlantic Ocean. It was very busy on the day, so we were worried that it would be cramped at the top. There was no need to worry as there is plenty of space to walk around and take photos. Very friendly staff. Negatives: there was over crowding when you got out of the lifts upstairs to get on the cable car. As a result, people could queue jump/push in front of you. Top tip: make sure you buy your tickets online beforehand as you save a lot of time in the queues on the day. Also, tickets are valid for 7 days from purchase so if you're staying for a few days in Cape Town, book your cable car tickets for the first day and will still have 7 days to use if the weather isn't on your side.

You have to do this!!. Great Morning amazing views and the cable car rotates so you get a full view. Cafe is very crowded so don't bother with that take loads of water and definitely book the cable car tickets on line DO NOT get them there as you will queue for ages - enjoy!!!

Moves very fast and rotates so don't worry about where to stand. The cars are large so the lineups move fast. A line up down the ramp to the road is about 30 minutes. The floor of the car rotates s everybody gets a good view, but the ride is fast and the best views are after you get off so don't worry about where to stand.

Well organized and a real thrill. Everyone going to Cape Town needs to go to Table Mountain and it is a real thrill. The cable way is well organized, clean and user friendly. The staff are well informed and incredibly friendly. Suitable for all ages. Give yourself enough time to enjoy the top!

Check the weather forecast . The weather in Cape Town varies during the day. Check weather forecasts and book a few days in advance, looking at rain and wind conditions. You want clear skies to appreciate the view.

Breathtaking. This is a must to do when in Capetown. Make sure you check the Weather and buy your tickets online. Better to not drive there and spend hours looking for a parking spot. We Parks the car at the waterfront and took the bus red route all the way to the table mountain. On the way back the bus did a tour by the beaches and the sunset is just beautiful.

A definite HIGH-light of Cape Town. Had to resist a visit to Table Mountain so armed with strong recommendations such as 'pre purchase' , 'go early' ,'take water', 'use sunscreen' we were up on the mountain early to do some exploring .. Wonderful vistas, beautiful flora and some pretty birds .. We'd recommend sensible footwear if you plan to do any walking around the mountain top too. We highly recommend a visit
Best views of Cape Town . Really good experience, must do for visitors to Cape Town. Be prepared to queue for a long time (but it's worth it).
Fast and efficient. We got the tickets and the journey only took about 10 minutes. It is a bit scary if you are scared of heights! I would recommend it to anyone! Enjoy the amazing view!

A sight to see!. Another MUST when visiting Capetown. Very safe and efficient operation. Unfortunately at top of Table Mountain it was very misty and chilly - but the ride up and down was spectacular!

On a clear day!. This cable car is great as it moves inside in a circular motion so everyone gets a view all round although it is a very quick trip. Get there early for less queues and better chance of clear weather at the top.

Day out on the mountain. Loved our visit up the mountain - I haven't been up since the rotating car was added. Cape Town is a second city - but there really is nothing like walking around the top of the mountain, looking down on all the areas. We went in the afternoon, we didn't have to wait too long to go up (20 minutes). We didn't have as much time as we would have liked to walk around. Only recommendation would be - take water/drinks up with you. We found the restaurant quite pricey - though the restaurant is worth visiting for the novelty of being in one at the top of the mountain.
One of the best experiences of my life. I have been on this adventure 4 times and i keep coming back. One of the few wonders of nature which leave one in awe.

Service review . It was interesting to go up the mountain in that cable. What a way to climb up the mountain but at the same time having a full view of the city on the atlantic ocean side. I enjoyed every bit of it
Loved it. We pre booked tickets online and arrived a 8:30 to be greeted by a long que of people waiting to buy tickets. Booking online is a must. We were on the mountain within 20 min from arriving
Better than hoofing it. Short wait time, and the cable car rotates so you get the full view on the way up. There was also a short free tour at the top which was very informative.

Reasonably priced ,fantastic views.. Took the cable car to the top which was very reasonable,even the photos which we don't normally buy were great value so do take a look .The mist cleared and we got some great photos .It's a must do if you visit Capetown .
great ride. SPecial ride in a circular cable car that give everybody a view and opportunity for pictures when the weather permits and when the windows of the cable car are clean. A definite must do
Beautiful view. The view wss beautiful from top. I liked the idea of rotating floor. You can have a 360 degree view as you go up. My family from india loved it. Will go again for sure.
Revolving cable car. Such a beautiful view!!! No matter where you stand you will get a chance for gorgeous photos as the cable car revolves. Free on your birthday, if you can prove it.

Great Cape Town Views . Love the fact that it rotates and the Cape Town views are fantastic
Cons: the lines were so long and I believe they should have a line for seniors.

Cool experience . The queues over peak periods are a bit long, expect upto 2 hours waiting time. Even so, the process is efficiently run and staff are knowledgeable and helpful. The rotating cable car affords beautiful views going up and coming down. The car operator is humorous and witty.

Clear day? Take the cableway!. The views at the top of Table Mountain are stunning and there are also many trails to walk. The cableway itself is an experience. It rotates so all can enjoy the view as you ride to the top of the mountain. Highly recommended

Glad we caught the Cableway as we saw the walking track snake around below us on the climb up. Well worth the visit and were were debating to walk up or catch the Cableway and glad we did, a big climb and well worth the views on top.

Worth the loooong queues for the views. we were advised to go early but at 8.30am with prebooked tickets there was already a 2 hr wait in the blazing sunshine. Contemplated leaving but met some friendly people to chat to and time flew past. There's a cable car carriage selling water in the queue but bring sunscreen and hats as we got a tad sunburnt.Views are worth it and it's something to tick off the bucket list. City sightseeing bus stops here right by the cable car station, we went past many people driving who struggled to park their cars, it's around a 20 min walk from the bottom to the cable car station.

A Required Stop in Cape Town. We took the tram up to the top of Table Mountain on our last day in Cape Town. There had been a cloud cover on the mountain most of our stay, but the day we went to the top was beautiful. Great views overlooking Cape Town, Robben Island and down the Atlantic coastline. There were a number of trails on the top of the mountain that offer great views in all directions. If you are going on the weekend make sure you go early before the afternoon crowds!
Stunning views. Love the rotating cable cars allowing everyone a birds eye view of Cape Town as you travel up to the mountain.

Good fun and great views. I've enjoyed the cable way which is a lazy way to get to or from the table mountain. There's lots to like about it except the price. Rotation and speed are good. Queues are long in holiday season but well controlled and managed. It's not too fast so you get to enjoy your ride. Parking is very challenging in holiday period. Book rides online if you can. I think it's more convenient and less of a wait.

Breathtaking views of the city. Table mountain is definitely worth a visit. For those not wanting to walk around too much there is a cafe and benches to sit on but there is plenty to see up there.We walked for around an hour, stopping to take loads of photos of the amazing views. Very good value for money activity for all ages.

Another great trip. Wonderful time on table mountain. Wish we could have bought tickets online as it would have saved is a 30min wait in the queue. Was a beautiful day on top of the mountain. No clouds. Absolutely perfect.

The Summit.. It is the most spectacular view I have ever seen, it is really special up there. It is a must, the feeling up there is special. It was my birthday, I went with my brother. You have to up top to understand its magnanimity.
Worth the wait! . Incredible views not to be missed on account of the highly probable long wait time. More bins and staff might be beneficial as around the eateries could have used a clean up.

If the skies are clear, magnificent views!. Queues can be quite long in order to get to the cable car that goes up the mountain. But it is well worth the wait. Spend some time at the top taking in all the beautiful views, and the dassies running around, hoping to get some food. Have a meal at the restaurant also.

Tickets in Advance!. Buy your tickets the day before online to avoid long queues. Then about 10 mins to get on the car. Early marking is the best time to avoid the crowds and the sun! You only need to do this attraction once

A must do . Book your tickets beforehand (maybe through the Red route tour bus) to avoid even bigger queues when you reach the cable car station .. but then you'll be rewarded with a fantastic cable car ride - rotating so everyone gets an even view. Once at the top there are various walks & stunning photo opportunities. It's a 100% must do if you're in Cape Town

Brilliant as always.. Long queues so better to book on line , although you will still have to queue.The wait is worthwhile as the views from the top are spectacular and probably the best in the world - a city and two oceans with a mountain as your vantage point. Not to be missed.

Views to die for!. On a clear sunny day you certainly cannot beat this trip. Fantastic aerial views as you travel up on the 360 degree cable car.Meander along the top of the mountain to see the Dassies and flowers A life event for sure!!!

look down. when you are in the cable car, make sure you are on the outer circle of visitors when the cable car is packed as the floor rotates and look down and you will be able to take amazing photos.
Essential experience: book ahead. The cableway is fast and efficient. It rotates on the way up so you get a panoramic view. It's best to buy tickets in advance online.

interesting ride. You can hike to the top of Table Mountain but that is quite an undertaking. The aerial cableway is a great way to get to the top and see views along the way. The inside of the car rotates slowly allowing views from all angles, however they do fill the cars pretty full so unless you are tall try to get a spot with an unobstructed area near an outside wall or window. Also they do not run in windy or bad weather.

Best views in the world. You Definitly feel like you are seeing the bottom of the world from the top of th mountain! Great views and hikes. We had a wide range of ages from 8yo to senior and everyone had an amazing time. Wear hiking shoes or sneakers as you will be tempted to walk and walk and discover other sides of the mountain! Expect to stay 2 hours!

Sundowners. I enjoyed the sundowners special, the queue was quite long but moved so quickly. Was lucky with good weather and no wind. The restaurant is a bit pricey so rather take your own picnic and drinks. Take a jacket and hat!

Spectacular view on Cape Town at 1000m height. Safe 1-2 hour(s) waiting time and already arrange an internet ticket in advance (in your hotel room). Wifi at location can be overcrowded and 'not' or 'slow' working !

Revolving Aerial Cable. The ride to Table Mountain by revolving Aerial Cableway is Wow! But for the price they are charging they should provide seats in the cabin so the passengers can sit and enjoy the ride.
Aerial View. The panaromic view of the city is awesome with rotating swiss cable ways on one of the seven wonders of nature.

Easy way to climb the mountain. We had a pre-paid tickets,but that is not helping to escape the queue. We waited like 45min.but anyway after all worth the effort. The cabin is rotating 360 degrees,gives you the opportunity for grate photos and views. Look for the weather cast,to be clear sky and not very windy(cable car might not work). We reach there by taxi,cost app.100 rand from V&A waterfront, but perfect way is to use the hop-on-and-off red tour bus.
Absolutely stunning!. Table mountain was absolutely stunning! We had booked in advance. But there were no queues and everything was well organized and run. My family enjoyed it greatly.

Must Experience . Words do not describe the feelings of this experience. It's one place to visit when in Cape Town in fact it may be the one reason to visit Cape Town when you consider the Table Mountain

Beautiful views from the cableway. Aside from the views, one of the features of the cableway is the inside spins very slowly so everyone on board gets to have different views going up Table Mountain. So, its not necessary to rush into the cable car as everyone has equal opportunity for great views.

Excellent service . The upgrade to Swiss Standard Cable Car is an excellent initiative from the perspective of the vertically challenged. The panoramic views of the city on a clear day are second to none!

Best view ever. The visit of Table Mountain is fantastic, you take a cable car up there and while going up you can really see the beauty Cape Town has to offer from one side of the mountain you have the town and on the other side of the mountain you have the beautiful beaches like Camps Bay. While you walk you can also see little animals like the one on the picture also they have refreshments bars if you get to hot walking I recommend you don't forget your cameras it's so beautiful. Just be careful it's really windy up there. Another must in Cape Town. You will not be disappointed.

Scenic and safe. A victim of its own success, the lines can be long on a good day; two hours on the Sunday in December we came for a visit. Hence, we climbed up Platteklipp Gorge, but took the cable car down.You can check the waiting time from the top on a monitor in the Table Mountain Cafe, although the posted time may not be that accurate. In our case, the posting said 30 minutes wait, but we got on the car after only 10.The trip down is too short, but at least the floor rotates so that you get a full 360 degrees perspective. No need to fight for that particular window space.Each car takes 64 people, so the line moves quickly each time the car arrives.

Book Online. I have 'done' Table Mountain twice - this is primarily about my visit in Dec 15, but I will throw in some insights from my last visit in Mar 14. This is a top Cape Town sight, and well worth it. The first time I was in Cape Town I walked up a path to the east of the lower cable station and then took the first cable down. Sunrise on the top of the mountain (with nobody around) is spectacular and much recommended. Do this if you can, if not, be sure to book in advance (the tickets are valid for 7 days) to avoid queuing for the ticket office. You will have to queue for the cable but even during holiday season this was fairly quick.Allow at least 2 hours at the top to walk around the summit and eat/drink in the cafe. The cafe at the top is fairly good but it will get crowded so you may want to bring your own food if you need to eat. There is an flat and even path around the summit and plenty of good photo opportunities. You park on the road by the lower cable station then walk to the station - there is plenty of parking, which is free. The most important consideration is probably the weather. You do not want to go up if it is very windy (eventually they close the cable) or cloudy at the top. Even in the middle of summer cloud can form on the summit as the moist air is pushed up by the mountain. Look online at the weather forecast before you head out to go to the top.i
An easy way to get the magnificent view. Despite the ridiculous Qs -it was so organised and moved so efficiently.great way to reach this view!

Stunning. Book online before you go!. This is a must do attraction. The views from the top are incomparable. We were there in the week before Christmas and thankfully went early in the morning. By 1030am the line to enter was horrendous, although staff did their best to Marshall the crowd and provide shade with mobile umbrellas. Buying your ticket online is a no brainer - there is a separate entrance line - and the ticket is valid for 7 days so you have plenty of flexibility. Even our teenage kids were impressed. You can do a quick trip up and down or spend an hour or two ( or longer with a picnic) wandering the paths on top.

The easiest way up to the top. If hiking isn't for you or you're pressed for time, taking the cableway to the top of Table Mountain is fantastic - a beautiful journey. Be sure to go early if in peak season as the lines can become quite significant.

The views are amazing!. I was sorry not to be able to hike up as I did 30 years ago! But I still wanted to enjoy the experience with my family. It was Christmas Eve and seemed a bit cloudy but it turned out the views at the top were great. Took advice from others and bought tickets online - definitely a good idea! They are still good for a couple of days after purchase, so if the weather turns you can wait a day or two. Still waited in line over half an hour both up and down, but it was worth it. There are lots of good walks at the top and the vistas are spectacular. Food at the cafe was average, service was extremely slow, but it is just a cafe.

Always a treat. We have been up the cableway a few times. I find the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. Of course the ride with all its beautiful views is something to be forever in awe about. Cape Town is just a magical place.
Cable car up and down. First time experience and it exceeded all expectations! Wonderfull advert for SA andCape Town nature and traveller's service!

Our second mountain experience. Me, my hubby & our older daughter it was our second experience on the mountain except for our younger daughter. It was her first experience and she was so excited she really had fun exploring the mountain, she even went to the deeper sights together with her dad without any fear at all! We captured her climbing the higher rock with no fear at all singing "I believe I can fly" by R. Kelly...pity the image is too large to download!

Efficient mode of transport to the mountain top.. Went to Table Mountain on 26th Dec'15 by cable way. It was crowded as expected and ticket booking on line helped to avoid long queue. The cable car is very spacious and rotating platform inside is a very useful feature allowing 360 degree view. More than 1000 meters almost vertical ride is quite a feeling. We enjoyed our ride.
Walk up cable car down. Walked up with my daughter. We went the Platteklip Gorge route. Quite a tough walk but very safe. Truly can recommend this.

Unbelievable Astonishing,but please stay away on busy days. Absolutely amazing,a must visit on any trip,but really,don't go with small children,take warm clothes and comfortable shoes.But a true Miracle of life,what a Gem and beautiful Creation.

This is a great way to he up the mountain. No one should visit Cape Town without doing this. The views are spectacular and it was expensive but value for money. The restaurant at the top serves all kinds of food and was not too expensive. There were also some unique things to buy in the shop at the bottom.

360 turn for all rounded view . The queues here are very long and the car parking is also amazing. Luckily, The funicular can take about 65 people so it moves 800 people an hour. Make sure you buy your tickets before you come otherwise the queue will be much longer The highlight of the cab;e car must be that it turns round and round so never mind when we first enter the cable car that be doesn't stand next to the window because by the sheer fact that the floor of the cable car goes round, during the journey to the mountain there would be a complete 360 degree turn and view while standing in the cable car

A New Wonder of the World. When one visits Cape Town a trip to Table Mountain is a must. The views from the top of the Mountain is magnificent and worth the cost of the cable car. Of course if you are fit there are various walks to the top as well. Get to the lower station as early as possible as this mountain is the number 1 attraction in Cape Town. and the wait for the cable car can be a long one. A restaurant is available as well as a gift shop. Altogether a great way to spend a day

rotates. Could not believe , the car rotates as it ascends and descends so all get fair viewing opportunities. And nice operators wishing us Merry Christmas. Our car sang Merry Christmas and Happy New Year.

Expensive and long queues. I appreciate the challenges they have during peak times but I do think the management can do better to manage the long queues, especially the people trying to push in. We stood in a long queue for just over 2 hours before getting into a cart. You should have plenty of water with you and use UV protection! I feel the price is not worth the wait. If you are reasonably fit, I would rather suggest you hike up/down the mountain. Took me 2.5 hours up.

Breath-taking. We were so lucky that the skies were clear and it was not a windy day! The cable cars do not run when it is windy or cloudy. The ride up was glorious with a 360 degree view of Cape Town and the magnificent ocean. On top there are easy hiking paths for those not terribly adventurous, and for hikers, there are designated hiking trails. I was taken aback by the beautiful memorial in honor of those who have passed while hiking table too. A must place to visit while in Cape Town!

Stunning views. We went on the cable car just before lunch on a Saturday and queues were minimal.The views from the top are spectacular and it lovely to wanter round the top of the mountain with different views of the city and surrounding areas from each side.The cafe at the top is reasonably priced allowing you to sit with a beer appreciating the view.

Prebook tickets!. A Cable Car ride up Table Mountain is brilliant - and sure beats walking up! Do not even contemplate going unless you have pre booked tickets - they are valid for a week. Go early and on a clear day. And take a jumper - it's chilly and windy up there.

Cables up Table Mountain . The ride in the cable cars showed a Vedic scenic view of Cape Town. We went with other families who had children 7 and younger. The children had a fun afternoon exploring the rocky top of table mountain. There are many paths to walk around. Be sure to bring a jacket, it can get cold and windy.
Novel Experience. The view from the rotating Cable was awesome. We found a very charming and hilarious lady at the controls who made the ride enjoyable even for those with acrophobia

Rather climb Table Mountain!. The aerial cableway is always extremely busy, but after climbing Table Mountain three times, I would never use the cableway again. The cablecar is nice to use when you want to get up the mountain as soon as possible, and also of course if you're not able to climb up the mountain. But the satisfaction you get from climbing the mountain is soooo much better. You also get better views and enjoy the surroundings much more.However, the cableway is at least well kept. The cars are huge, and about 20 to 30 people (maybe more!) can fit into them. I was expecting a small car for only our group of friends, so when I saw the big car, I was quite disappointed because it makes the trip very impersonal. But it was still fun. I would definitely tell everyone to rather climb than use the cable car!

Spectacular but Crowded. The views from this mountain are spectacular but be prepared to wait almost an hour to ride up to the top and to come down again--each way!--especially on a weekend with clear weather. Worth the time & trouble. You don't need to go on a tour--well marked and easy to do yourself.

Amazing experience . Superb experience ..it takes you to the top of table mountain ..the view is just amazing ...from the cable way.at the top the whole mother city along the coastline is visible ..you can have a short trek around the top of table mountain ..it gives a excellent experience .just be sure you go on top on a bright sunny day..and not on a cloudy rainy day.

Great views. It's a long wait and it must be sunny and no wind , you can eat and drink up there and have fun , what views, super. Plan to stay a while have lunch and relax and drink wine and take in everything .

The last bit to the top feels like being in an elevator. The aeroal cable car is nice added extra to the top of table mountain. The usual cuing is horrendous, go early and you might get lucky. Sometime late afternoons are goid as well.
Beautiful day looking over Cape Town. Stunning views and a wonderful experience. Serene and magical and an experience to remember with fond memories.

Truly spectacular. We had a superb trip on the cableway to the top of Table Mountain. We booked about a month in advance and arrived at the lower cable station at 7.30am. As a result we were spared the awful queues, we were able to park close by and were able to leave at the end of our visit without any difficulty. The cafe at the top is a good spot to have a bite or a drink whilst you decide which paths to take. The paths are well-marked and there is no shortage of routes and things to see. The views are obviously spectacular and worth seeing, but the landscape at the top, the flora and fauna are worth the visit too. We can highly recommend the online booking to save a lot of queuing time.

Obvious must.. Took my mother here. The views from the cable car as it ascends are worth every penny. Especially towards the end when you are able to see past the mountain peak to the ocean behind. Magical.

Table mountain in Dec. What a day The que was long , we prebooked the tickets and took the red bus , an absolute must No parking issues and you join the pre booked que , this was long and took ys around an hour and 15 min , much shorter than waiting for a ticket can take twice as long The ride up is spectacular and well worth the waitHint in Dec pre book your ride down no que as you can arrive around 5 min before your ride down and go streight to the front - no queing a massive bonus

This is a "must" for any visitor to Cape Town. To truly appreciate the peninsula you have to see it spread before you from the top of the mountain. If you are not energetic enough to do the climb(!) the cableway is an excellent option. But once up at the top do try to walk at least half an hour across the top to get away from the "tourist attraction" immediately round the station. We did the walk right across to Maclears Beacon, and back along the front path (to be done on a windless day) and the views are stunning.

Cable car. This is worth doing but check the Internet before going as it may be closed due to high winds. Expect long waiting times if you haven't booked on line. The cable cars revolve as it moves and the mountain itself is just awesome.

Great experience - except for the queuing. With only a couple if days in CT and this attraction having been closed because of the weather on day 1, inevitably we were among massive crowds visiting - not particularly a problem at the top but, even with pre bought tickets we had to queue for an hour to get up - and about 45 minutes to get down - frustratingly as we got to the front of the queue for the return trip, the staff explained that we could have pre-booked the return on our arrival at the sunmit - this feature should have been explained en route up
Great . Well organised and a great ride. You can't visit Cape Town without going up Table Mountain - and this is the easiest, fuss-free way to the top!

Can't miss it!. I highly suggest buying your tickets online prior, which is something I failed to do. The line was incredibly long when we got there, but I was smart enough to buy the tickets on my phone. You do not need to have them printed out. I will suggest doing a screenshot of your tickets just in case the service is bad when you reach the last screening.

Amazing as always . My 10th visit but the first for my other half and for friends. Unfortunately I forgot to remind everyone to take a jacket and as it was late in the day it was windy and cold!! Clear day, amazing views but not enough time.

Heavenly. I think if I were to visualise what it would be like to be at the doors of heaven, this is as close as it can get to it!We were walking into the clouds on the top!Spectacular views of Capetown , this is an attraction not to be missed !!
Magic. Magic must do. Queues as at all wotld attractions but well handled by staff.The rotating car is great so everybody gets a changing view point

Great views From the dramatic Table Mountain. It is true that you can walk up ~Table Mountain or you can abseil down it too, but for the less energetic the 'Cable /Car is the only way to get to the top. The circular capsules rotate through 360 degrees during the ride so that everyone gets a view of the whole panorama.The city is spread before you and t across Table Bay Robben , for 27 years the prison of Nelson Mandela, is visible,

WORLD CLASS views, simply stunning vantage point - A must see. I hate "bucket lists" and believe in being alive and following my own personality but this is a must see. I previously lived in CT and didn't visit. This time we went. Grab a cloud free day ("the table cloth" cloud that forms) and ride the cable car up there. Take a sweater incase it chills off. Cable care return trip was 240 rand Dec 2015. Worth it. Looking at Robbin Island and down on to Camps Bay is so very beautiful. Do not miss this. There is dedicated taxi rank so you will not wait even on a busy day. Very helpful and will use meter.

Stunning sunset views. A must see (weather permitting) when in Cape Town. One of the modern 7 natural wonders of the world. On certain days there are half price return tickets for the cable car for departures after 6pm (last return trip at 9 pm. Stunning views of Cape Town, the mountains and ocean sunsets. Take something warm as the weather and temperatures can change quickly. Food and drinks available in cafeteria-styled restaurant.

only one table mountain. we were very lucky had the perfect day with a perfect view and weather! we also eat at the restaurant, a lot of people assume it is expensive but i didn't find it that bad, alcohol on the other hand is a bit overrated. If you go up after 6 it is cheaper so keep that in mind.

Great views. The views from the top of the mountain are spectacular. The only downfall was the cable ride, too many people cramped in such a small space. Other than that, incredible! Staff very welcoming and helpful.

Must see but watch that cloud! . Table Mountain is famous for its cloth of cloud so when you go, be sure to check if the cloth is in place; we didn't and then the visit is a whole lot less spectacular. However, the cable car ride is definitely worth the very reasonable price. We went fairly early on Saturday morning just before Xmas and there were no delays or queues. Apparently there can be long waits so check your times. The City Sightseeing tour gives a hefty discount and you can do the trip as part of the route.

First thing we did in Capetown. As soon as we got off the plane, we decided to go up to Table Top Mountain and I am glad we did!Firstly, be sure to grab your first opportunity to go up the mountain as clouds roll in unexpectedly and they close the attraction. Secondly if you are fit enough, be sure to walk down the mountain taking the path along the beach. It is a tough walk but lots of fun and add some spice to your visit.The mountain itself is magnificent and offers some beautiful views, great for picture taking.We didn't encounter any crowds whatsoever which was quite lucky.Walk to the lighthouse for the most spectacular views.This is a stop not to be missed while you are in Capetown.Enjoy you walk down!
Fab. Wonderful experience and views highly recommended. Could have dpent the gull day here. Make sure there is no cloud when you go up as you wont see the wonderful views.

Nice view on ride up, cloud obscured view at top.. The weather and cloud cover at top of Table mountain is notoriously fickle. So our best views were on the way up and down on the cableway.Couldn't see anything when we were on top.Still an activity I believe I would recommend others to go for, especially if they can be certain of zero cloud cover.

On the to of the world. My second visit to the Table Mountian and it didn't disappoint! Be prepared for queues and lots of people also wanting to visit the table-top. On the way up, the floor of the cable rotates 360 degrees so everyone gets a complete view....fantastic innovation! But do be prepared to have your camera charged, buy a lovely bottle of Table Mountain Red or white wine and take your bottle and glasses, and some of their low salt chips, around the lovely viewing area. Superb. The shop at the top was wonderful the first time I went and had some really different jewellery of the area....fijnbos earrings etc, but the day we visit on the second visit it was closed...too late in the day.Magnificent.

Pre-book tickets. Waiting line was awful but they had a sheltered waiting area and mist for the heat so that was very thoughtful. Rather Pre-book tickets and skip that one line. Everything was well organized and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We visited on a very clear and hot day. So I would recommend to put on sunscreen lotion and wear a hat.

Fantastic views, why wouldn't you do it!. By pre purchasing our cable car ride tickets we were able to skip the big queue and get straight inline to go up in the cable car. Being very windy during our stay we were very lucky to be able to go up and absorbs the amazing views atop Table Mountain! We visited the well stocked gift shop and made a few purchases. It is a must do for all visitors to Cape Town, try and go the first day your there to ensure you don't miss out if the wind picks up!
Long waiting times. When ever there are no clouds just take the tour up to table mountain. Be there early because the waitng times can be very long.

Not to be missed. We pre-purchased our tickets on the Internet as suggested in other reviews. This was really easy to do and offered us the flexibility (ticket valid for 7 days) to go up the mountain when the weather was perfect. We bought one way tickets which also meant we didn't need to commit to timing.We arrived in Cape Town just as it stopped raining and noted the clouds lifting as the day progressed. We checked the website and wait time was listed as 5 mins and visibility was noted as good so we drove ourselves to the cable car station. We were really lucky and parked on the side of the road right near the station. There was no queue (3pm) so went straight up the mountain.On the cable car try and stand near the edge. The floor rotates once 360 degrees during the 3 minute trip up the mountain so you get great views regardless of where you stand.On top there are various timed walks marked out. The views are stunning, the information boards informative and the vegetation very different.I would highly recommend this as something you do near near the start of your holiday as long as the visibility is good. It gives you great perspective on Cape Town.

Hiking and abseiling. Friends said I'd be fine with the climb and i made it but it wasn't easy. But I'm unfit ands slightly overweight and had spent the last 9 hours on a plane so if i can manage that I'd say the average person could too. Maybe earlier in the day before it gets too hot. Once at the top it's unbelievable. Definitely one of my fav places in the world it's magnificent. Loved the cable car ride. MUST purchase tickets either online or at the city sightseeing bus tour as the queues are massive. Abseil was so much fun i went again straight away. There was mist at the top so no one could see much until that lifted but shortly after starting the abseil i could see everything below and it was brilliant.

Thrilling experience . Kids loved the cable car. Only criticism would be that the inside waiting area should be air conditioned. When there's lots of people and they are pushing and it's crowded- it can get claustrophobic.
cool ride. The cable way takes you to the top of Table Mountain. The car rotates 360 degrees for a panoramic view. Note: Pre buy your tickets or you will be waiting in a long line.

Spectacular views!. We seem to do this wherever we travel and are often disappointed...not this time! The loading process was efficient and the views between the clouds were magnificent! On a clear day, this is a must!
What a view. The windows are so big so you can enjoy the fantastic view while climbing. Don't miss to take photos. İt takes about 3 minutes so hurry up.

Breathtaking. The cableway is an incredible experience. It is extremely well-managed and I am very proud that my home country offers such beauty to travellers. I found the top of the mountain unexpectedly serene. Even though there were tons of tourists, it felt like everyone respected the mountain and it's exquisite fynbos and was touched by the magnificence of the mountain. What a privilege.

Great views, beware of the queues. Having hiked up table mountain, we took the cableway on the way down and the view was brilliant. It's a well-earned rest after hiking up but beware of the queues, it took us about 30 mins to get into the cableway on the way down and when we hiked in the morning, the queue of people waiting to take the cableway up stretched well beyond the ticket office.

Worth the Visit. The Ariel Cableway is pretty much your only way to the top of Table Mountain unless you want to hike up to he 3000 ft summit. My only problem with the cableway is when you enter and everyone is all tucked in for the ride up it's fine, but the minute the door closes and you start moving you have this moving floor that moves clockwise in order for you to get a 360 view of the amazing scenery, BUT not everybody appreciates this so what I experienced was a load of rude people that wanted to climb over me to get the next best pic of the same thing. To avoid this sit ya self in the middle of the car that has fixed seating and doesn't move, I figured this out on the way down. At the top of Table Mountain there are lots of great trails to walk and views to experience, as aggravating as the cableway was its well worth the visit. Hope this helps, enjoy.
Family outing. The scenery was breathtaking, weather bit chilly on top of the mountain, restaurant was very expensive & we decided to dine somewhere else.
Great views. great views, i would suggest purchasing tickets before arriving at the Tram base. Pretty crowded, but a must do tourist site.

Sunset special. Bought our tickets online for the half price sunset special. Very good deal. Very easy to buy the tickets and then not a long wait at all to go up. Sadly the mountain was covered in fog- so no great views, but still managed to have a romantic picnic, and appreciate one of the 7 wonders! A must see in Cape Town, just watch the weather and take a warm jacket

Fast and Efficient Way to Top of Table Mountain. The Table Mountain Cableway is an excellent way to journey up Table Mountain. As many have mentioned, aim for your trip to be on a fair weather day and not expecting any rapid changes while you're up there. Don't worry about "positioning" yourself in the "best" position when on the cable-car as the floor rotates 360° while on the way up. Besides, the best views are when you get to the top.

Table Mountain Cableway. A very thrilling and exciting ride on the cablecar upto the Table mountain. The view of capetown from the top is wonderful and this is a must do, to anyone visiting capetown for the first time.

Table Mountain Cableway. We took the sundowner (1800-2100) online special rate, which allowed plenty of time to enjoy a picnic (self catered) and watch the sun set, and then a short wander around the foot paths to enjoy the different views There is a bar and deli at the top and plenty of benches/tables to enjoy the views from.

Sunset. Beautiful views all round. The cable car rotates while going up and down. So you see the whole of Cape Town! Robben Island csn be seen perfectly. A must do! Wear comfortable shoes if possible. Lots of walking.

Has to be done. Was best to get a cab because parking is not good We pre booked and the queue moved quickly and the staff were very organised ! The cableCar ride rotates so everyone has a chance of good views! Once at the top there is a bar & shop the views were spectacular paths are well maintained ! Definitely a have to see whilst in Cape Town! X
Nice. That 360 degree view gives you an amazing spectacle of Capetown. and it just delights you when you descend at gaze at the top, to think about the beautiful ambiance you just descended from

Breathtaking views. Choose a day when the weather is clement and not expecting to exit quickly - weather changes can mean closing the cable car. Take the time if you are a walker - there are beautiful nature walks.

South African roadtrip . Great 10 min ride up mountain.Some tipsDo book it saves messing and same price.Long queues even if you do book so take water.Try to get as high up mountain to park even if u go top u can turn round.The queue is just as long once over the roadTake the picture on way in great value and we'll doneThe cable car rotates so everyone inside can get a full rotation of the viewEnjoy we did

A nice walk. The cableway is fantastic but do book a two way trip online and skip at least part of the queue. Parking at the lower station is straightforward. The cabin spins though 360 degrees so you don't have to move around to get good pictures of everything. At the top a reasonable walk is to be had to McLeods Beacon (maybe 60 -90 mins there and back) so decent footwear, a bit of water and loads of sunblock etc for this - worthwhile. The abseil point is to the right of the upper station as you exit.

Finally made it!!. We have made it to the parking area several times, but as on a good day it is always so busy, we changed our minds and went elsewhere. It was worth getting up early, as we got on the second cable car. The ride was amazing because the car turns as it travels, so everyone gets a chance of getting a good photo. The view is amazing in all directions. Lots of lovely alpine flowers. Nice self service Restaurant. Really unforgettable.

Spectacular!. I had the privilege of sharing my beautiful mountain with a guest from the UK recently. I was so proud of our precious mountain that captured the heart of my guest. The Aerial cableway is efficient and the friendliness of the staff was outstanding.A must do activity if you are visiting our fair city.

Nice Aerial Cableway. Nice ride up with great views but too crowded. I suggest the management should control the numbers of people per group for the ride. Due to the crowds, I can really enjoy the views throughout the ride up.

Amazing views from the top!. The cable car is a convenient way to get to the top of Table Mountain, and the views from the top are amazing. I recommend buying tickets online in advance - they are for either morning or afternoon so not for a set time, and you avoid the line when you get there. Next time I'm hiking!
Beautiful . Really beautiful place to see and spent time. Really easy assess and when u r at top u can see whole coast and city which is really amazing.

cable car turns around as you move,so you ALL get a good view.. Bit of a queue as the day goes on,so earlier or later is better.Sunset onTable Mountain is amazing, a bit of advice, start to queue for the lift,just as the sun sets,because the last lift leaves at 8pm. Don't worry,because I don't think they would leave you up there.Don't forget your camera. And good walking shoes. Have fun.

A really convenient way. It's a really convenient way to get to the top if you don't want to walk. Very safe and well organized, but only opens when the weather permits. Enjoy the ride...even then the magnificent view starts.

Still the easiest way to get to the top.. It was fortunately not busy, so we could avoid the usual line for tickets, although getting tickets issued seemed to take forever. The trips up and down was quick with some interesting views. It may not be as rewarding, cheap or scenic as taking one of the hiking options to get to the top of table mountain but it remains one of the quickest.

Wonderful aerial view of Cape Town. A good option for those who don´t want to rent a vehicle to reach Table Mountain Aerial Cableway, is to use the double-decker bus City Sightseeing, passing through the main sights of the Cape Town.The route is amazing and the bus ticket has one-day validity. Thus, you can get off the bus, go to a restaurant and/or go to the beach and then get back in the next bus without buying a new ticket.

An awesome way to start the morning . We were fortunate enough to be on the first ride up and had a wonderful morning on top of the mountain. The queue wasn't too bad but we did get there early (07:30). The staff are really friendly, helpful and very professional. Well worth it if you are prepared to get an early start or wait in the queue for a bit. I would definitely recommend buying your tickets online as it reduces the wait dramatically.

New seven wonders. This is our second visit. This time we bought tickets online more then 2 days before. So getting up the mountain was quick and easy. We took the early access option. I recommend this for anyone. We were lucky as the clouds came down at about 10 am Please make sure you dress warmly as its cold up there even in summer. Every one started lining up to buy jackets at 4 times the price The sales assistant on top in the shop closest to the docking point is the least service oriented person ever she was so upset to sell anything if it wasn't for the fact that it was freezing I am sure most of the clientele would have left. So be warned take a jacket or face the wrath of the unwilling angry shop assistant. We finished the walk on the top and the decided to have breakfast in the only eating place. This is a buffet. You choose what you want then it get weighed let me tell you if service is bad food is worse Which is a pity as all the ingredients for an excellent meal is there There is a lack of training or maybe a like it or lump it attitude that says don't eat on the mountain. So if you just there for spectacular views take your jackets and eat elsewhere you will not be dissatisfied

magic spot. as always going up table mountain is just great, the ride up is already fantastic butstepping out onto the mountain with views that go over the City and Capms Bay and the sea. Its incredible.

Very good and attractive destination. We booked our tickets online in advance and lucky to avoid long que at the counters. It was nice weather and enjoyed a 5 minutes cable way to reach table mountain. Nice scenic view of the city from table mountain will remain in memory for long time.

Breathtaking. Slot this in your to do list if you are in Cape Town. It's the first place we went to after we checked in to our hotel.We took a Taxi from Sun Square Hotel and were charged about 60rand. We also targeted the "sunset view" which is going up the Mountain at 6p.m where the toll fee is at half price (120 rand). Any time before 6p.m is 240rand. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather, the view was breathtaking.Carry warm clothes. Weather in CPT is fickle, just before getting down from the Mountain it got really foggy and it started drizzling.

Beautiful views. Once you're up there, you can relax and enjoy the beautiful views! In high season the line is very long and moves slowly. Suggest you buy tickets online (and you'll still have to wait in line to board) but definetely worrh it. Also bring a jacket because there can be strong winds

Table Mountain Cableway. One cannot visit Cape Town without travelling on the cableway. It is an absolute MUST.It is a great experience to see the city and surrounds from the top of the mountain. Suggest taking the bus to the cable station. There is parking for cars but be prepared to walk!
Beautiful view. It was amazing the view of the city from table mountain is breath taking we had so much fun as a family

Got to go when the sun shines. Table Mountain is a grand view from Cape Town, and the view is grand when you take the cable car up a couple thousand feet to the top. There are complete facilities up there, a cafe, the inevitable gift shop, and spotless rest rooms. There is also a world-class view of the city and the South Atlantic. This is not quite to the Cape of Good Hope -- the Cape is still further south, so you don't see the Indian Ocean. But, you might see water that recently has been in the Indian Ocean. Take care to go when the weather's good and not wait for another day, as the clouds often obscure the view and they close the place on cloudy days. The cable car ride is only five minutes or so; it is well-maintained and up-to-date and safe.

Excellent way to get up if you dont want to trek. This takes 4 minutes to go up or down. Great way to escape the city. Costs 125 Rand. Get in early. Crowd gets very long very soon and they push up to 65 people per car each way. The car also spins so you can enjoy the 360 degree view.
Must do in Cape Town . Don't wait around to do this! As soon as you get a clear mountain go!!! The views are stunning! The effect is a completely different perspective of Cape Town!

Great if you don't mind the queues. This is a wonderful way to access an iconic location - if you are lucky enough to get the weather and can handle the queueing. Of course you cannot miss this if you are in Cape Town and the best advice is seize the first weather window when the skies are clear and the "Tablecloth" cloud doesn't shroud the mountain. Book tickets ahead - even on the morning of your visit to avoid the ticket queue - then you just have to queue for the cable car. Book on line or buy a ticket on the Big Red Bus, which is as good a way as any to get there. It's also worth noting that the queues are worse after a day when weather prevents the cable car running. We queued, we ascended & descended, the cloud came and went and we wouldn't have missed it!

Best of the 7 wonders of the world. This is a must experience for any person visiting Cape Town- what an awesome feeling taking the rotating cable car up and viewing the Mother City from every angle imaginable- every angle more beautiful than the previous. Take along some jerseys as it does get cold- but worth every moment!

Beautiful N must must must visit!!!!. Table mountain cableway is a must visit in capetown if you go there. As you buy ticket you get information leaflet about cableway and facts and history about it. As you get inside cable you feel like you are about to fly, it rotates 360 degree so that every1 gets chance to look from all the ways the scenic view of cape town! Also there two cutouts in cableway which are open and not covered which gives you oppurtunity to view clearly N feel the chilly breeze of capetown! Its once in a lifetime experience guys, just do do do visit it!!!!

Great View - Long Wait. I decided on the spur of the moment to catch a bus to the base of the cable car at Table Mountain. I had been waiting several days for the weather to clear and for the cable car to operate. On arrival I found that one had a join a queue for those without tickets and it took 90 minutes to get to the ticket office. Once getting the ticket I then had to queue for a further 30 minutes to actually get on to the cable car which was surprisingly fast. Its 360 degree rotating view was excellent, especially as the car was crammed with 60+ people.The journey back required a 30 minute wait to get on the cable car, so that meant I had to shorten the time I had hoped to spend at the top. I had joined a guided tour which was very interesting, but I had no time to walk further on the pathways around the mountain as one had to spend so much time waiting. There is no obvious solution to the problem, but one option would be to buy one's ticket in advance and perhaps go later in the day and take a risk with the vagaries of the weather.The scenery is amazing and worth the wait. Take a book to read in the queue!+
