Fastest way up & down. 40-60 people fit on these gondolas and it will be crampt but it goes up so fast you are only inconveniance for a short time, its also rotating so you see 180 degree views of the mountains and the city below.

Up MY Mountain. In August I had took 2 very special ladies up Table Mountain. They last went up the mountain around 25 years ago, so were super excited to get to the top for what would probably be their last visit as the one is 81 and the other 76 years old and they don't live in Cape Town. What a wonderful experience. The pathways were easy for them to negotiate and the staff were super friendly and helpful. As always the views were breathtaking. If you visit Cape Town, please make a point of going up MY Mountain (okay, you know it as Table Mountain)...

What a view!. We were extremely lucky to arrive in Cape Town in good weather. The views from the top of the mountain are stunning. We were able to see the 'Table Cloth' from the boat as we went out to Robben Island. The mountain just makes Cape Town
Great. The cable cars rotate as you go up so everyone has the chance to see the views so don't be disappointed if you think you are at the back
Another World Wonder via exiting cable car. Conquer the huge work wonder via a exiting journey of new minutes! Lovely views of the city, mountains and the sea.

Wonderful but very short. We walked up but took the cable car down. Well organized -- since it rotates, everyone gets a great view. takes less than 4 minutes. 125 rand (~$9USD) for one-way is a bit pricey but we wanted to experience both the hike up and the cable car down. Worth it!

Regulato visitora. We live in Cape Town and make a point a of visiting the Mountain at least a few times a year. The aerial cable way is fantastic. A short ride up allows for the most amazing views of the Mother City. The cablecar is equipped with a rotating floor that gives passengers a a 360 degree view. Its best to buy ticket online to avoid long queues. Check websites for specials. Have your cameras but do keep in mind that the operation of the aerial cable way is weather dependant

Wonderful ride to the top of Table Mountain. A ride up the cable car to Table Mountain is a must do when you are in Cape Town. There is a rotating floor in the cable car that moves slowly so that every person has a chance to look out of the front of the cable car and take wonderful pictures of Cape Town, the harbour and the mountain.

The only practical way up. Life's to short to get to the top any other way. Park around the cable car entrance or the free park and ride n the way in.. It is free parking. The look after you car brigade are just the usual scam associated with the area in general ignore them. it is also part of the hop on hop off bus route so easily accessible for non drivers

Mandatory program. This experience is a mandatory program for cape town visitors. If no wind, as it will stop in windy days. Sometimes there is a long queue. But if you go by guide, you can skip the lane. The experince is unique, unfortunatley very short (4 min). Still must do!Just a connected tip: the only similar, turn-around cable car I only saw in Italy, at Garda lake - Monte Baldo.

A quick ride to Table Mountain. As we did not have much time to do the hiking to the Table Mountain, we took the cable. First suprise, the turning cabin so you get a 360 view experience, then is so silent and comfort that you can enjoy the view without a problem

Unmissible. Who could visit Cape Town and not ascend Table Mountain? Us actually. We didn't have time when we last visited in 1990 but I got to the top on this occasion while my wife went birdwatching elsewhere. Our guide told us that you have to go up if the weather is good because there are plenty of days when the cable car is not running at all because of low cloud or high wind. So don't leave it until tomorrow. But we had the extraordinary experience of having gale force winds in Simons Town, to the south of Cape Town, yet at the cable car itself, and on the top of Table Mountain, there was no wind at all - and people were wearing t-shirts at the top! Goodness knows where the wind had gone.We had only 40 minutes at the top as we had other attractions arranged, which was a pity because you could have a great walk at the top - although I'm not quite sure what you would do if they rang the bell to indicate that the cable car was about to stop because of impending bad weather.
Fascinating with the moving floor!. It worked good, the trip up to the top was very quick and the moving floor made it possible to all passengers to see the surroundings.
Such fun. Turns360 degrees to add to the experience. Quite a quick climb feels like something out of James Bond. Get in quick to get to a window as it gets rather crowded.

Must Do. We were only in Cape Town for 8 days, but from the few things we managed to do, this HAS to be top of the list for anybody visiting. I was terrified going on this cableway, my partner didn't mind the height, but I managed to get myself some courage and go on (even if I didn't look out the entire trip up and down). The views from the top was what I was there for and they were incredible, so many different angles and views and each better than the last. It really is very calming and relaxing at the top and I wish we could have spent all day up there. We spent around 90 minutes up there due to "tablecloth" - which is what they call clouds that cover the top of the "table" mountain. I also thought the price was a good price to may for such a landmark.

Amazing. It was truely and unforgettable experience. The guides were amazing and friendly. We went at 7:45pm and it was overcast and slightly cool but i think it was the best time. The photos we took n the memories were great. Will deff recommend it to all and we will b back . Its a must see

Majestic views. If you're visiting Cape Town Table Mountain is an absolute must.The restaurant at the top sell a diverse range of dishes and snack so its not necessary to take along food or drinks.Sun screen and a jacket is mustas it gets pretty chilly.

Taxi with a view. You may walk up Table Mountain or you may take the nicer cableway 360 degree view of Beautiful Cape Town expect long line of people during the holiday season but you will have a lovely view inside the car and on top the mountain. Go and enjoy........

Very well done and romantic . I recommend to get there early, and for the lashes take a sweater. I took do many pictures it's not true. We spent 3 and a half hours there in total. It is very well planned. Do yourself a favor and get a bottle of wine (Table Mountain) and get some food, the restaurant and store are top class. It's a wonderful experience.

Well worth a visit!. Loved our morning at the top of Table mountain! We were told to get there for the first cable car at 8 and i'm glad we did. We got to the top before the crowds arrived which meant our time at the top was peaceful!

Easy trip up Table Mountain. When you're in Cape Town, you will see Table Mountain from pretty much anywhere and want to go to the top. The views are fabulous, even if the clouds are rolling in. The experience is well worth it. The red, hop on-hop off tourist bus takes you directly to the cable car for the journey up which makes for a very easy visit. The cable car runs continuously so there is no real time constraint when you are looking to fit in a visit. We did not get our tickets in advance, but there was no line when we arrived (in late November). This is probably not the case most of the year!

A must do in Cape Town - weather permitting. I agree with other reviewers that it is very crowded but I in my mind it has to be included when visiting Cape Town for the first time as long as the weather allows it. I would definitely recommend arriving by bus as parking is a bit of a nightmare. We were lucky when we arrived in our hire car as I already thought I would have to walk halfway up the mountain. It took about 1 hour to queue so booking online is an advantage. Slightly strange sensation inside the cable car as floor turns while going up or down. Crowded yes, but all well organised.

Got the red bus from the VA jumped off at Table mountain got the Very quick cable car up then did the long walk around . It was 2 hours well spent on the walk followed by a proper meal in the top restaurant Take sun block and water

So crowded!. Well worth a visit and probably one of the "must do" when visiting Cape Town. Make sure there is no cloud on the "top" as that will indicate wind and likely cable car won't be going. Beautiful views of course. Restaurant crazy expensive and not great quality. Over crowded, bad service and avoidable.

Get your ticket in advance!. A must visit if you are in Cape Town, with amazing views over the city. It's easily accessible by the tourist bus which stops at the cable car station or by taxi from the city. Keep an eye on the weather as the sun doesn't always shine and when it does the winds can pick up closing the cable car, so if the weather is good go for it and find something else to do when the clouds descend. I would also recommend getting your cable car tickets at the tourist bus stops (either by the V & A or on Long Street) as this will stop you having to cue up twice (once to by the tickets, once to ride the cable car) you'll still have to do it once though!Once at the top there are a number of self guided routes that will take you around the top from a short 10 mins to about an hour long route. There is also a restaurant and reasonably priced bar at the top to enjoy a beer while taking in the views.

Way too crowded. This was a quick way to get up to the top, which is the real attraction (and 5 stars!). I would recommend hiking if you have the time. The car was way too overcrowded, though very useful since we didn't have the time for a hike.

Flying on the top of Cape Town. Even if you have a prepaid ticket,you need an hour waitin time until you get in the cablecar.Silent ride turning around with fantastic mountain and City views.You can not leave Cape Town without visiting the iconic mountain.

Great views. Great views over the city, the bay and over the Atlantic ocean for a reasonable price. This is NOT an alternative for people who are wheelchair bound or whose mobility is impaired: The Cableway is closed without notice when the winds are high, and you may be forced to walk down the mountain instead.
What a view. Stunning views (on clear days) in all directions after an exciting cable ride to the top. One of Cape Town's not-to-be-missed attractions
Great attraction at the thing Cape Town is famous for. Really good way to get up Table Mountain (if you don't have the time or energy to walk). Book online to avoid the queues. Will visit again.

View has to be experienced. Went at 8 AM to avoid lines. Did not get ticket until we were there because the tickets are not refundable due to clouds unless cable car is not running. Can have cool breeze and wind on top. Walks on top as long as 45 minutes each way to highest point. Nice walk off cable car of 30 minutes. Views to both sides. Walks would be impossible for wheelchairs or walkers. Surface on path is irregular and need to be careful.
Beautiful views. Loved it! Great experience after the 2 hours we spent climbing up! Very smooth and quick. I would use this again on the way down
A must do item in Cape Town. This is something you must do when you are in the beautiful city of Cape Town. Go up to the top of the mountain for some breathtaking views.

Panoramic Sensation. This is a good way to discover and enjoy breathtaking views of Cape Town. The cable car rotates and provides a 360'. Take a sweater as it might be breezy on the top. There is a nice restaurant as well. Up we go!

Table Mountain. The best way to get a perfect view of Cape town. The easiest way to go up and down the table mountain. The rotating floor gives a 360 degree view which makes it great. Just be prepared to take some litres of water when you walk around the table mountain on the top and a good pair of sneakers. There are also guided walks which again are very helpful. Some people say 1 to 1.5 hours is enough. but then if you want to walk around, you can spend at least 3 hours. Be aware of the weather as the cable way gets closed because of bad weather.

The best way to get to the top!. Unless you are in really good shape and prefer to hike up to the top, this is the only way to get to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car turns while it is going up and down the mountain which allows you to take pictures from all directions. Just be sure to stand around the outer edge to get the best view.

Worth the effort. Best to buy your ticket for the cable car in advance, to avoid the bigger queue. If you hop on the red bus you can buy your ticket as long as you don't leave it until you are at the cable car bus stop. Don't worry about where you stand inside the cable car itself as the floor rotates. If it is a clear day don't hesitate to go.

Phenomenal views. On a clear day, it truly seems you can see forever. Buy your tickets in advance online to avoid the queue. The rides both up and down are scenic, and the views from the top are immensely memorable.

DON'T miss it !. IT is a must see at cape town visit. we went there on a very hot day so please choose the day wisely as the temperature was very high ,, choose a cloudy day to take picture with the clouds ,u can see the whole city and ocean in an amazing view !there are restaurants and cafe there but it is very expensive don't forget to take bottle of water and heavy clothes if it is cloudy dayif it is windy day , cable cars are closed
Spectacular Views. Quick, clean, efficient way to ascend Table Mountain. Employees are knowledgeable and polite. Highly recommended.

An Absolute Must In Capetown. We were at a conference and took an afternoon to do the Red bus tour stopping off at Table Mountain. Perfect. Jaw dropping ascent and spectacular views. We stayed up there for 2 hours (30 mins would be OK) had lunch, shopped and took lots of pics. The red hop on hop of was the easiest way to do it.

Must do!. Parking is an experience as there basically is very little space available. Be prepared to park some distance from the Terminal and walk. You will be accosted by two enthusiastic photographers as you enter. They are part of the official experience but be warned that the price of their wares is a little excessive. Once you are actually inside the car, be aware that the floor rotates, but the handholds don't, and adjust your limbs accordingly. Now prepare for a stunning view of Cape Town and some serious vertigo!Once at the top be prepared for biting cold winds - dress accordingly. The views continue to be stunning from all sides and many vantage points on the top plateau, and there are many plants and walkways to check out as well. When you are done, retreat to the coffee shop for a warming beverage and a hot breakfast or lunch.

perfect view of cape. the cable cart was a beautiful experience going up the mountain. whats interesting, the flooring inside the cart spins in a circular direction which allows everyone inside to see the 360 view.
Great Views. Can get a little busy, but is only 1 of 3 in the world which rotates so you can get 360 degree view, well worth the ride to the top
Must see it . Beautiful view at the top and you can c take pictures to fill a big album book. Spend at least 1 hour on the top. Visit the souvenir shop and buy some thing.

A must see. This place is amazing! Go early in the morning to avoid long lines. Only so many people are able to fit in the cable car each time and the expletive of riding up is better if not crowded. We purchased our tickets online and downloaded them to our phone. It was easy and very convenient. Plan to stay at least two hours, there is so much to see. The cafe and gift shop seemed a little pricy but it is on top of a mountain. The day we visited was cool and cloudy in Cape Town, however when we got to the top of the mountain it was clear and sunny.

Quick - Scary - Marvel of a ride. I would like to think I don't have real heigh issues, but when you see this cableway as a dot in the sky from below, I should be excused if my stomach lurches a bit. We hiked up the mountain using Patteklip Gorge route and took the cableway down. The line up at 10am on a sunny day to go up alone would have made me hike of we weren't planning to already. It was ridiculously long. Be warned. I got one-way tickets at the top and the line to come down around 3pm was very short so this worked out. The cableway rotates as you go down and up so you can't hold on to the sides. It's a strange sensation to be rotating and going downhill, but that is quickly forgotten as you start to look at the views and prepare for when the open window section of the car gets to where you are standing to take a photo. It was over before I could even comprehend the rotation aspect A worthwhile experience.

excellent way to get to the top. We arrived at the cable car station on the Red Hop on Hop off bus and there was slight cloud cover over the mountain. No queues. we chose to use the cable car as the climb was suggested at about 2 1/2 hours and we just had so much to see we couldn't afford the time. But what a good decision we made. because we travelled in the cable car we arrived at the top refreshed and excited and were able to enjoy walking around on the top for nearly two hours instead. In the cable car all the best spaces had been taken when we arrived and we wondered if we would get to see much, But.... what a great idea... the floor of the car rotates, so everyone gets a chance to see a full 360 view. well done! fast and effective.

It's amazing view. i hiked to tablet mountain from Cape Town backpackers only takes 2 and half hours to hiking table. Mountain when you get top of table mountain best view and probably you can spend your half there it's beatiful view on top has a cafe and shop if you are in Cape Town you must visit this attraction

Simply great!. We bought the tickets through the City Sightseeing and realized this was a smart move as queues to buy tickets at the Cableway are really big. Please buy your tickets online or at other places before getting to the cableway. Staff are great and wonderful and always keeping you laughing- kudos to that guys!! The cable car gives you a great 360 view of Cape Town. I loved the experience!

Awesome♡. We went hiking and then took the cable car down. Staff were friendly the view was amazing♡ Would definitely encourage adventure-lovers to hike to the top and then enjoy the aerial cableway down.

Amazing view and a must in Capetown!. Now this is something that you have to do. This mountain is so famous that even Michael Jackson tried to buy it! lol. We booked a 1 day city sightseeing tour and hence bought tickets with them in advance. We took the cable up there so go there quicker. The views are breath taking. My only suggestion is to try and find out what the weather may look like the day you go as sometimes it's nice and sunny and the other days there was a big mist covering the mountain so you won't have a nice view. Otherwise there are plenty of spots up the mountain that you can visit and even have a personal time with your partner and just sit quietly and on your own and enjoy the view. There is space for everyone to have their own private moments without having ppl always coming by you and taking pictures the whole time! Definitely recommended just buy your tickets in advance and take the cable up there.

Long lines. Well we will start from the end. Visiting Table Mountain is a must when in the Cape Town area. Breathtaking - well deserving the new title of one of the seven nature wonders of the world. I believe that the only way to get up to the mountain is via the cable car. The ride is OK and the turning floor is an added feature but we faced very long lines - 45 minutes just to get the ticket counters and another hour to get to the cable car itself. It was a hot and sunny day and the wait was not pleasant. If you do go, and I believe you must, GET TICKETS IN ADVANCE - this will save you at least the wait at the ticket counter.

Top of everybody's list in Cape Town. Do not miss this spectacular experience, but do realise that for some it can be quite scary. Getting out of the car at the upper station you should not look down through the gap!

Well Organised. As this is such a busy venue credit must go to the staff who organise the queues as without them it would be absolute chaos. If you use the Hop On Hop Off bus to get here make sure that you buy your cable car ticket with your bus ticket as this will save at least an hour queuing at peak time. The cable car rotates as it goes up and down so everyone gets to see the whole view.

View !. The trip itself up is pretty crowded and wasn't too much fun..but then again my boyfriend is afraid of heights so he wasn't very happy with me.. View from up top is unbelievable and a must see. A restaurant, canteen style is available. Wines, beers, sandwiches, hot foods. Good marks for the view at sunset and the mist rolling in, you have to make the effort when in Cape Town.

Best part of Cape Town!. My experience of Table Mountain was quite a unique one. I am terrified of heights so I went on the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain with my girlfriend to try and overcome my fears. It didn't help as I was so terrified, but once I got to the top of Table Mountain, I stood in amazement at the beauty of the views. It is absolutely breathtaking and the most beautiful views I have ever seen. Even with my fear of heights I loved every moment! You won't be disappointed!

Breathtakingly Beautiful . Wow, wow, wow !!! Well this is an absolute have to do in Cape Town !!! We arrived and everything was really well organized. The queue was a little long, I would suggest to buy the tickets online .... You will save a bunch of time. The cable cart was an experience ! It rotates and gives you a 360 degree view on your way up and down. Try get a spot close to the edge for the best viewing.Once at the top on the mountain, you will be amazed at the utter beauty ! The flowers and little dragons popping out here and there were surprising lovely. Take your trainers .... There are lovely walks that you can do o. The top as well as some sunscreen and water. Next time I go I will take the more adventurous route of hiking up the mountain !
Excellent . The rotating cars give excellent views to everyone aboard. They move rapidly and allow the line to move very quickly. If scared of heights, you can stand in center and be okay.

a new 7th wonder of the world. There are no words to describe this attraction and the views you will experience. This is a must do in Cape Town, the minute you see a cloudless sky head there. You never know when the weather can turn!

Great views of Capetown. Call before heading up the mountain if you are planning to take the Cableway. If it is closed due to bad weather check back periodically as the weather can change drastically very quickly. There are many walking trails up the mountain, the lower mountain isn't very difficult for those in decent shape but the higher regions have pathways literally hanging off mountain sides. If you are planning to hike up I would suggest taking the Cableway first to assess the situation. Trails have varying degrees of difficulty so do your research. Should you be on top of the mountain when the Cableway closes, you either wait for it to reopen or walk down. There are two cable cars that revolve when going up and down so any spot by the window is a good one. Long lines are the norm, get there early to beat the worst of the crowds if possible. Wait time can be about 30-60 minutes, ride itself is about 10 minutes to the top. There are trails on top of the mountain and abseiling for the fearless (rapelling). The weather was clear but cold so dress warmly. There is a gift shop and restaurant there as well. On clear days amazing views of Capetown, Robben Island and the surrounding area.

Impressive!. Table Mountain is most accessible to Cape Town visitors. I usually hike up Platteklip gorge and descend with the cable car. The cable car is most impressive, rotating and offering spectacular views.Ideal for those who love nature and who would like to visit the number one attraction in Cape Town.

Wonderful views from the top. When visiting Cape Town you must go up table mountain for the fantastic views that you get . You can get the red bus tours to take you to the cable car station or the drive up from the surrounding area is quite easy . Parking is available on the road before and after the station and at busy times this may mean a 10 minute walk . Buy your ticket on line before you go otherwise you may have wait for over an hour for a ticket . Once you get your ticket the wait for the cable car is about twenty minutes . The journey to the top is quick with fantastic views with the cable car rotating in order that everyone gets a good view . The staff are very efficient and you feel very safe at all times . The walkways at the top are well marked out and guides are available to give you added information . I was surprised at the expanse of the area available to walk around at the top . It is a must do when visiting Cape Town .

A wonderful cable car !. This cable car is spacious...with both open and closed panels. Not to worry, it rotates as it travels ,thus your view is 360. For those in fear of heights, there are 2 wee benches in the middle of the car. A superior design.

Nice view. Nice view on the way down. We went up by foot on a nice hiking morning and wanted to make the descent by foot but again ... The rain didn't let us. Cable way was nice but, for a 2-3 minutes ride it's too pricey ( 125 rand ).If you have time and the weather lets you do it ... Go up and come down walking ... Much better !
Steep ascent. Apart from walking, this is the only way of accessing the Table Mountain national Park. It's a nice ride and VERY steep.Staff is extremely friendly, which comes as a great surprise.

Hiked up, took the cableway down. Taking the cableway was necessary after the hike up, there was no chance I was walking back down the mountain in midday sun. The cable car was definitely a cool experience as well.
Table Mountain. Great experience fantastic views. Every one so friendly even the the parking man in the road outside gondola terminal

Wow world class with outstanding views, beautiful. A wonderful experience, you cannot go to Cape Town and not visit the mountain it is a world wonder the cable car up and down is an experience with outstanding views well organized and managed clean and pleasant compliments to those who manage all.

Table Mountain the hassle free way. This perfect for the less adventurous. you can then have a meal or take in the views from the top of the mountain. My friend and I took the cableway up and hiked down.
Great 360 degree views.. The floor actually rotates so everyone gets 360 degree views. Its a quick ride to the top. There is a restaurant and gift shop at the top.

Worth every penny!. We had a blast going up the mountain and walking around on top. Go early - we got there before the crowds arrived but just before the clouds fully passed. It meant going above the cloud line which was neat and it was sunny and warm on top. Definitely do your best to avoid the crowds; we loved the peaceful and quiet walk!
Beautiful ride!. I could go back any second, love this place. My recommendation is to hike up and walk down. Very loooong line to buy a ticket though. Go early on a wind-free day!

Very large cableway, helps move the crowds. You have to go up on Table Mountain when in Cape Town, and this is the fastest way to do it. We were there in winter, so there were no crowds to speak of. I bought my tickets on line before leaving the states. It is nice they give you a time window of when you can use the tickets, days not hours!. The car turns so everybody has a chance for the good views, a must do in CT.

Fast but not Furious. A quick ride up to the top of Table mountain via rotating tram car. It rotates 360 degrees on the way up and down, allowing all aboard to see all they can. They close down during inclement weather/high winds and when you hear the " HOOTER " you better get to the down way car as they are getting ready to shut down.

Amust see in Cape Town. This is a must see in Cape town. The vista from the top is wonderful. You see how the cape is set up great for orientation of Cape Town. The flora onthe top is very interesting. A lot of fun!

Easy Way Up. on a recent trip to Cape Town we made time to visit table mountain .. due to limited time we chose to use the cable cars .. this is a must if in cape Town . the views are stunning and the trip is quick to the top .. you can spend time to walk around top and is has a wonderful atmosphere when the mist starts to decend (the table cloth the locals call it) .. tourist attraction but a must. Believe the queues for this can run into hours of waiting but we booked online and went around 17:00 in the evening and had no problem at all or queuing.

A Must Do. Going to the top of Table Mountain is a must do. We decided to walk up and take the cable car down, which worked well. 2 things to note, you will need to plan this trip based on the weather forecast, as they can close if the weather is bad and the queue for the cable car gets pretty long. We did read that if you use the city tour bus, you can but your ticket there and avoid the queue - which seemed a good idea.It does get cool at the top of Table Mountain, so do bring layers to put on. But the view is amazing and the cable car ride is good, although do expect to be packed in like sardines!

Does what it says on the tin - can get busy!. If you want to head up Table Mountain, you have two options really. Either hike or take the cableway. I took the latter and arrived fifteen minutes before opening on a Saturday at 7.45am. There were already cars parked all along the edge of the road up to the cableway base station and I waited about 25 mins for tickets. The queue to then get to the top took another 40 mins. There was a separate queue for those with tickets which was much longer and comprised of many coach parties. I don't think it was much different time-wise. The view is great and the cable car rotates during the very quick journey. Don't lose your ticket or you'll be walking down - this seems to be a silly rule. Offering free rides down would encourage more people to hike up which is a good thing (but obviously bad for business!).

GREAT VIEWS IF ITS A CLEAR DAY. We went up on the cable car, the views were amazing BUT as we got to the top the mist came down and you couldn't see a thing. There is a local bus that goes to this attraction. We did consider going up again to try and get the sunset and the views, but there is so much to see in Cape Town we just never found the time again. .The staff were lovely and very helpful with people with disabilities.
Nice view 360 degrees. Unfortunately Table mountain was enveloped in clouds, but for 3/4 of the trip visibility was pretty good.

Yes, this is worth doing!. The cable car ride is well worth the time an it is an enjoyable way to access the beautiful views from Table Mountain. There is another way to reach this lookout/view area, by way of the city tour open air buses. If you want to and have time to do more than just enjoy the view then the bus is probably a better choice. However, the ride up the Mountain is really spectacular and enjoyable.

Good line of site. If you choose to not climb the mountain and take the easy way up, the cable car, come early. The que tends to grow quickly. Before you get on the car the staff request to take a picture of your party, This picture of course is for sale at the end of your visit. You will be packed in like sardines. I'm sure there is a maximum number of guest per ride. The floor rotates as you ascend and descend in the cable car. The ride is short. You need your ticket for the ride up and the ride back down (I think these is to prevent those that climbed up the mountain from taking the cable car back down).
Very cool. Quickest way to the top of the mountain to see that amazing view. Had to wait a while in line to get on, but once you are up there the view is like no other.

Weather dependent - check before you go. Good views of course, but prone to crowds and susceptible to windy conditions, when it may be closed. The kiosk has a hard to find viewing platform which is a great spot for an ice cream and a shady seat

Captivating!. An absolute "must" when in Cape Town. But even quite early on Sunday morning the queue between booking-office and cable car was 30 minutes. The wait is worth the views from the top — breathtaking vistas of oceans and city. It was surprisingly hot on the summit.

Nice, but nothing for people with a fear of hights. I think it is a must while in Cape Town, and the view on a clear day is just breathtaking. Make sure you buy tickets online, as lines can be looooong!
must do. a must do in cape town. If you take the Cableway after 6:00 pm you get half price tickets and get to watch the beautiful sunset :)

Go early!. A really good trip. We went first thing and had breakfast in the cafe. The staff at the top and cafe were really good. The walks were pleasant and I would have spent more time if hubby hadn't been keen to go to work! I recommend this for anyone but the sheer number of coaches but I would absolutely recommend an early start!

Easy and quick way up Table Mountain. I took the cable car up and down to the top of Table Mountain. It was quick an easy despite the crowds. The views on the way up and down were great. The station has good facilities as well as some souvenir shops. Easy to access the lower station on tour or public bus, and lots of taxis were hanging out just a bit further down.
Nice ride. Quick trip up and down, the line appears never ending but moves relatively quickly. The view going up and coming down is breathtaking and beautiful. Would recommend to everyone.
A must see. Always special to take this trip up the mountain especially if the weather is good. A must do if you are in Cape Town. Fun for all ages
A place you must serb. Had a spare afternoon on business trip went to top of table top mountain views great don't miss this
Beautiful . Beautiful view. Need to buy tickets online in order to go quickly through the line. We had a cloudy day but the experience was great although the sight wasn't 100% clear.
Sunny day. You can't go wrong. Service and staff are welcoming and participative. Views are amazing. Cable car rotates so everyone gets to see the view from a different angle

Good views and transport.. Watch the weatherforecast before you go. We had good weather but there was much crowd. Try to get your cable car tickets online before you go.Than you have much less waiting time.

Revolving cable car which transports water to the mountain.. Went up around 1pm. long much crowd, little waiting. Waited long (45mins) to get down. Do check the time for last cable car returning and plan in consideration that many others are also doing so. The wait at 6.45pm can be freezing if not clothed warm enough as you are standing still in the cold.Felt like a 8 degree Celsius.
Highly recommeded for the beautiful view!. Try to go on a clear day for the best view. The views are spectacular and good for the whole family!

Fabulous views from rotating floor😜. A trip to Table Mountain in Cape Town is a must, especially if the weather is good. We bought or tickets in advance (recommend - to avoid a longer queue). The views from the top are spectacular. The is a restaurant and a souvenir shop at the top - both are nice (and the items at NOT made in China).
Great views. Worth a trip up for the amazing views of Cape Town. I would recommend buying your tickets online beforehand and also doing the abseil from the top if you dare!

Exhilarating. Riding the cable car to the to The top of table mountain is an exhilarating experience as the car moves in a circular motion. Once at the top the view of the city and sea below is breathtaking. You Can walk around and enjoy little caves and wildflowers blooming ...baboons walking around freely... and a myriad of birds perched on the ledges. Sip on a glass of one the fine wines of South Africa while enjoying the beauty of Gods creation. There is a small fee for a round rip ride; the car runs every half hour but not on cloudy days.

Stunning. The views are spectacular, especially when the clouds fold over the mountain tops and it's just like pulling a table cloth over, stunningVisited via Red Bus really a good way to jump on and off well worth a visitClean and all staff helpful, you can see for miles on a clear dayIt really is a 7th wonder of the world don't miss out when visiting Cape Town

Breathe taking . Wow nothing could have prepared us for the view at the top; simply amazing. We opted to buy tickets online, for the sunset ride which was 50% off. Having the tickets in hand when we arrived got us into the shorter line, which was very helpful. The line to buy tickets at the door was terribly long. Highly recommend buying ahead of time!

Long waits!. We hiked up to the mountain so we'd only have to take the tram down. We waited in a cue for 30 minutes for the tram down in the blazing sun. The staff could communicate with customers and let them know how many people can be accommodated, when the next car will arrive, and provide shade to wait. Disney World can be a model for you! It's very crowded at the top unless you read the map and trek out of the tourist zone and then it's really worth it.

Some great views. Take a camera.. For those of us in our later years, this is a great way and far less tiring than walking up. I can remember just how much it cost but it was not expensive and well worth it for the superb views on the journey. It is over too quickly. There are some great views over the city from the top, providing the cloud cover is not low.
Easier than walking. The cableway is a great way to get to the top, the rotating car gives you a 360 degree view as you ascend and descend the Mountain.. The picture they take is a good souvenir.
what a view. It's quick, the floor rotates whilst moving to get a full 360 degree view and a real must whilst in CT
A must do in Cape Town. Book up online you'll miss some of the queuing, your ticket is valid for 7 days and then just rush up when the weather is clear. Don't wait!

Pick A Clear Day and Go Early !. The view is the thing! Modern, 360 degree rotating platform provides a comfortable and safe journey to the top and back. Go early. We were there in a shoulder season, arrived early and still had a 30 minute wait. As we were coming down, the line was even longer.

Excellent way to spend a couple of hours in Cape Town. The attraction is the destination at the top, rather than the ride. But I found it well organized, and the facilities up to the task. Try to go at quieter times - it must be much nicer. We went in rush hour and it took a while waiting, with crowds at the top as well. Warning: we went at the height of summer but it was seriously cold up top with the wind blowing. And in Cape Town the wind knows how to blow.
New heights. Visited the mountain during the week. The ride up was quick however the queue to get back down found us waiting over an hour. Good walk and amazing views.
Great views and wonderful ride . Do plan to spend some time on the top if you can ... Has some great views all around. Weather could be tricky and change at the turn of a dime. Take warm clothes!!

A Terrific Experience!. This is a lot easier than hiking!! You can get to the cable station by bus, taxi or the city sightseeing bus - but watch the weather as its not worth going up if the clouds are rolling over the top, and the service can be disrupted for bad weather. The car rotates 360 degrees so you get to see both sides of the view of Table bay and the Atlantic. Stunning! There's also a nice restaurant at the top.

Fantastic mountain views. Very short queue as we went at lunchtime (the quietest time of day). Lovely views and walks from the top. The cable car turned round as you went up and down so that everyone got a great view at some point.

One of the top attractions in the world. In this world of ours there are certain experiences one can have that take your breath away and you go 'wow!'This is one of the natural wonders of the world. The great thing is that it is easy to get to, easy to get to the top, and easy to walk along the top. Parking can be an issue and you may have to walk quite a distance. Obviously you won't have this problem if you come on a tour. The cable car ride to the top is spectacular and as you approach the summit it looks like you are going to hit the side of the mountain!The views from every lookout are amazing and there were plenty of easy walks. The cafe is good and serves hot food.

Just a way to get to the top. Nothing spectacular about the cable car. Yes it rotates as you go up and down but the ride is less then 3 minutes.They fit about 70 people in the car so if you end up in the middle of the car you will not see much anyway.It is simply a way to get to the top of table mountain, which is fantastic, without hiking.

A must do. A trip up the mountain by cableway is a wonderful experience. The cable cars are big and you never feel cramped or unsafe. It rotated to give you ann allround view going up and down the mountain. Something special that is a highlight for the kids.

Spent longer waiting than in the cablecar.... We decided last minute to go up table mountain, and didn't have time to hike up, which meant we took the cablecar. We bought the tickets online to avoid waiting hours on site, but it actually didn't change a thing, as we still had to wait almost an hour to get in a cablecar.On the plus side, the rotating platform is very original, giving us the opportunity to see all around during our trip up and down the mountain, and not just either Cape Town or the mountain.But still, we recommend the hikes which are way better!

"Not so enjoyable" experience. Unfortunately our experience of Table Mountain was not a very enjoyable one. My husband and I treated ou heavily pregnant daughter, her husband and our 4 year old grandson to a trip up Table Mountain by Cableway. It was recommended that we purchase tickets online in order not to have to stand in a long queue. Imagine our horror when we arrived at around 10 o'clock, to be confronted by a very long queue. As we had tickets we were not too worried, but on joining the queue we found that it didn't make any difference. We still had to stand in 36 degree heat for over 21/2 hours!! It was ridiculous and there was no seating or any shade whatsoever. This unfortunately spoiled what could have been a very pleasant outing, as once we were at the top of Table Mountain the views were spectacular!

Great views of Cape Town and Table Bay. The 5th time was a charm! Foiled on 4 previous tried due to high winds shutting down the cable operation, the winds calmed briefly enough for us to go up and take a 1 1/2 hour hike (walk) on the trails at the top. If the weather (winds) permit, this is not to be missed.
Go see the Rock Dassies. Table Mountain is a World Heritage site, to not visit would be a travesty . If you want some awesome photos, get cracking! Half price after 6pm.
Quick trip to the top. A great way to see Cape Town as the car spins 360 degrees as you travel to the top. Much easier than climbing the rock!

Perfect way to climb the mountain. Went up Table Mountain on a Thursday afternoon around 12:00 which turned up to be the best time as there weren't too many people and the although I had pre purchased a ticket at the hotel the line for tickets wasnt very long ( be advised you can queue up to an hr or more on a busy day to get a ticket. There are stairs and an elevator to get you to the platform to board. the cable car/ box itself takes about 64 people and has a revolving floor giving 360 degree views on your way up and down. to add to the exhilarating ride 2 side of the car are open and if standing at the edge the blast of cool mountain air will wake you.A great way to get to the top. There are souvenir shops at the top and base.

Buy Tickets ahead of time!. The Aerial Cableway, or cable car, takes you up to the top of Table Mountain. You can get to the lower entrance by public transportation. We did.The car slowly spins as it brings you up and as it brings you down. This allows you an amazing view, no matter where in the cable car you stand. And the spin is slow enough that there is no feeling of vertigo or motion sickness.We bought our tickets online ahead of time, and wow are we glad we did. The line to get tickets was enormous. It took us about 30 minutes after arrival to get to the top of Table Mountain. And only 4 minutes of that was in the cable car itself. But that was nothing compared to the people who had to buy tickets. They must have been there for hours.There is a cafe and a gift shop at the top. The food is terribly overpriced, but good.

Stunning sunset views.... We made the most of the "Sunset" offer and could not have asked for more beautiful views from the top. With a cold front rolling in and clouds covering most of the ocean, it felt like we were transported to another world. Wind picked up quite a bit but still made for a wonderful outing. My only concern was the fact that expired desserts were on sale. I didn't notice it until I tasted it. One would assume that with so many tourist visitors each day, this would be a priority.

Modern and safe way to get on top of the Table Mountain. It took me an hour to get to the top due to the long queue, on the other hand purchasing the ticket from the Sightseeing bus driver definitely saves time. The cablecars are very modern and are turning around which gives everyone the chance to admire the scenery on the way.With 240R not very cheap but worth it. The alternative would be to hike up the very steep and in my opinion dangerous hill.

Fantastic views. Time your visit carefully by looking at the weather forecast. Book your tickets in advance to avoid long queues and then you will be rewarded by fantastic views of Cape Town . The ride up in the revolving cable car is also terrific.

A must do. We arrived on the table mountain rather late in the afternoon and hesitated whether we would take it of wait till the next day?Boy are we glad we did not wait! The nest day was foggy and cloudy, whereas we had a perfect view. Lesson: when circumstances permit, DO IT! It is a once in a lifetime experience.

Indeed! Fun ride to Amazing Experience!. Why walk!!??? It's vacation... yes! to the cableway and yes to the Mountain!! Fast, safe, entertaining and safety conscious operators, buy your ticket at the Hop on Hop Off Bus Stop on Long Street, makes entry to Cable very fast...otherwise longer lines!

One of the 7 Wonders of the World - Table Mountain!. Recently we visited Table Mountain. The que was quite long but the staff were really friendly and helpful. They advised visitors to purchase online tickets which will ensure a shorter waiting que.Note: You can buy online tickets OR tickets from the RED BUS in WaterfrontWe took the Redcity bus to the mountain, no worries of parking. Take money or your visa card with to the mountain as their is a nice restaurant where you can relax. I prefer a picnic basket as it is just so much more romantic and the kids also love the idea of a picnic on the mountain.Do not forget your camera!!! Its essential to bring back up batteries.Only downside for me was the toilet facilites. There is a "smell" haning in the air close to the toilets, but due to the location there is no other way to do the toilets i assume.... so only go there if you NEED TO.Whenever you come to Cape Town, you MUST visit our beautiful mountain. Please leave your cellphone on silent. It is really a wonderful, relaxed, calm atmosphere. It is not nice hearing 20 different lanuages all on their cellphones having conversations....be there to have family time or romantic time with loved ones. Welcome to Cape Town!

Wonderful. Amazing thing to do for a treat. Really kind staff,great views, cute animals. The staff are kind and if kids go there and there are nice the staff give them treats. They give you a booklet in which you write your details and go up to the shop and caffe and they will give you a biscuit and a lollipop.

Mooie ervaring, jammer van de lange wachttijden. When the sky is clear, it's absolutely worth doing. Unfortenately this can change real quick. If the table cloth is up, you won't see anything. We were lucky that the clouds dispersed a bit when we were up.Do buy your tickets in advance! Even then it's a long wait to take the cableway. Without tickets at busy days you can easily add an hour waiting to that!

The best way to get up and down Table Mountain. What could I say? Table Mountain is one of the world's heritage sites and one of the 7 wonders of the world. Unless you like to hike up mountains, use the cableway. The cable car revolves to give you 360 degree views of the city and mountain on the way up and down, so perfect for photo ops!

Worth it. Awesome views. Buy your ticket online beforehand. You just need a credit card. We got there and saw the queue so I quickly took my mobile and bought us tickets. The mobile site doesn’t work, rather access the full site. If you go after 6pm it’s half the price and you can watch the sunset. Take LOTS of warm clothes, the wind is extremely cold up there. Take something to cover your ears (like a hoodie).

Sunset special . Would advise visitors to get online tickets for the sunset return special and get in line around 5.30 PM in order to be one of the first up there. Make sure to get to the station quickly after sunset to avoid long queues.

Quickest way to heaven!. Once initial confusion with expired tickets was sorted, we enjoyed the ride to the top. The floor revolves too so everyone gets the view back to Cape Town bowl. Just read the fine print on your tickets as it contradicts the online fine print.
mg101. very efficiently run but be aware that it is very popular and by its very nature it can only take a certain amount of people up or down at any one time

Route to the top. The cableway is quite busy at weekends and the views from inside are limited but the cableway is a great way to visit the top and marvel at the views from 3500 feet above the city. Not that expensive considering.

Great views!. The cable car was great - fast and efficient and the views on the way up and down were amazing!
I had friends who hiked up, and did the cable car down!
It's much higher than you think!
A must do!
Nice view, great scenery. Nice view for everyone due to the turning platform in the cable car. Short but fun ride with lots of views and walking tracks on table mountain.

Phenomenal views must see. If you are in Cape Town you just visit Table Mountain the views from the top are fantastic. To avoid unecessary queuing purchase your tickets on line before you go. Even when you have tickets there still will be a wait. The Cable cars only run in light winds so check that it is running that day before you go and that the views are clear. You can get there either by self drive, round the city hop on hop on bus or taxi are the best options to get there. Well worth the visit especially if you have time to complete the walks at the top.

1087 meters of sheer bliss!. Table Mountain has to be one of the highlights of any Cape Town visit. The organisation is slick and "well oiled", even when the queues were rather long. The views are absolutely incredible, especially when the weather is good. The restaurant at the top is also really great! An absolute must if you find yourself in Cape Town and highly recommended!

A great start to the day. Book in advance to avoid the queues and check before you leave home that it is running. Great views if but a bit chilly but quite weird to walk on the top a mountain so well landscaped

Get there early and have your ticket before you go. Get there early! Buses start coming in around 8:30. There are two lines..one for those with tickets and one for those without. If you don't have your ticket you have to stand in line to get your ticket and then you go back to the other line to wait your turn to get up to the car. If you're there by 8:00 and you have your ticket, you'll be in line when the car opens up and you'll be in the first few cars up. Then, when you get up, there won't be a whole lot of people at the top. They can transport up to 800 people an hour...have the top to yourself for at least a little while. We stayed up there about 2-2.5 hours and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. You could stay longer and have lunch up there, as there's a very nice cafe there as well. Because it can get windy and cloudy, if you have a pleasant day, take advantage and do this on that day, as it can get closed because of weather conditions. THIS WOULD BE A MUST SEE!
A bit of a wait. The queue was a bit long. I felt more sorry for the elderly waiting for tickets. There should have been someone who could fastback them and the infirm through more quickly.

SEE CAPE TOWN FROM ABOVE. The cable car has been in existence since the 1920's. Has seen a few changes to the style of car over the years. A MUST when in Cape Town. It is world heritage site and also a new natural 7 wonders of the world.
Quick ride - great views. Must see Table mountains made easier in this quick ride - technologically sound and enjoyed thoroughly. Check weather before traveling.

CHECK THE WEATHER!. This tram ride is an iconic attraction in. Cape Towm, and well worth doing on a clear day. However clouds can often obscure the spectacular views, and it can be quite chilly and windy at the top of the mountain. Take a jacket, pick a sunny day and enjoy this unique experience! The tram is efficiently run, but lines can get long, so be prepared to be patient.

One of the seven world miracles indeed!!!. We were looking at ta Le mountain from our hotel bit never thought it would hide so much magic!!!This place is unbelievable! !! Beautiful nature!!!! One should definitely have a ticket before getting there to save time from waiting!!! We got up with the cable and we faced the unbelievable! !!! A flat mountain! !! Amazing!!! Highly recommended! !!!

Awesome views. What a wonderful panoramic view - pity they jampack your in and have people being nuisances! Would recommend when you are in Cape Town - though be aware to check the weather before you go!

Breathtaking. What an experience. Can see from organisation at bottom of cableway that it can get extremely busy and crowded at times with long waits, but was lucky as no queues after a morning when the system was closed due to windy cinditions. Safety is taken extremely seriously although it seems on the way up that the cable car is going to crash into the cliffs at any moment and on the way down the drop into the abyss is quite something. The cabin turns a full 360 degrees so a wonderful view can be had by all. At the top there is a sign warning that a siren means get back to top for descent as high winds are expected. Astounding views from top but take a pullover and or warm fleece as can be blowy and cold at the top! A must do if in Cape Town. Probably need a couple of hours or three to enjoy the views and do the walks at the top.

Amazing but be careful of queues!. Impossible to flaw the cable car and table mountain itself. It's a privilege to do this. However, we queued without any update on how long it would take to get to the car for the way up and also the way down. Although the winds were picking up, the team should have provided us all with a clear indication of estimated times to keep us at ease. We also experienced some pushy individuals who the staff could not control and managed to queue jump. The latter can happen anywhere but the former could do with an improvement.
Amazing !!. Very modern set up and the views were amazing. When we went, it looked cloudy at first so the crowds were minimal. Luckily it cleared however and we had a great day
A must. Great fun - only way to get up there and back. Handles the crowds well. Car rotates so that no one has best view - it's shared.

For me, it was far better than walking. We were very lucky that we didn't have a long wait for the car going up. It's a lovely ride & very quick. Going down we had to wait about 20 minutes or a half hour.

Beautiful views. We took the aerial cableway to the top of Table Mountain on a recent weekend getaway to Cape Town. The line to get the tickets was long but this was probably due to it being a long weekend. I would suggest purchasing tickets online to save time. Once we got to the top though, we realised it was worth the wait. The views are absolutely spectacular and there is a lovely coffee shop at the top offering a range of food and drink. I would advise anyone visiting Cape Town to definitely make use of the aerial cableway. I would also recommend comfortable walking shoes as there is a lot of walking to be done at the top, should you choose to.

Excellent - hard to dodge the queue though. I bought a prepaid ticket for this attraction through the city tour bus. It's a good way to do it if you don't have internet access and they will refund it if you are unable to use the ticket. It's also good to be able to use the bus to get up here. Not sure what parking would be like.... I went early in the morning and was there before 9am. The queue was already growing fast by that time and by 9:30 was easily looking like a 2 hour wait. In the end even with the prepaid ticket it took me 1.5 hours to get up. Depending on when you go it might be best not to prepay. The queue for that was shorter and you don't have to queue twice. If doing it again i'd take a taxi to be there for when they open if i didn't have a ticket and would head there half an hour earlier if I had a prepaid ticket.. That way this amazing trip would take up so much time. The ride itself is well organised and swift and the views from the top and definitely worth the wait. At the top there is a restaurant and gift shop too. If you chose to walk up I'm told by a (fit) friend that it took him around 2hrs. Might be worth thinking about as you can buy a one way ticket to come back down on the cablecar.

A modern swiss made cable car. Interesting cable car made in Switzerland and the main cables are embedded 90feet down into the ground to support the weight. The center of the cable car spins around slowly as you ascent and descend the mountain. Great smooth, quick ride up and down Table mountain. Even if you have phobias with height, turn your back to the mountain wall and enjoy the views. If not afraid enjoy the geology of the mountain formation and the views of the city.

Great views!. The fastest way to get up and down Table mountain. Queues for the ticket office can be long - try to book your tickets in advance. Lovely cafe at the top. Practical advice: take a warm jacket as the weather can turn in the blink of an eye.

trip to the top of the World Cape Town style. The cable car took us vert smoothly and safely to the WOW factor of a view. Having previously travelled to the Cape of Good Hope on a trike it was wonderful to see our route from above and to recognize our various stopping off points on the way.Magnificent views.

Spectacular. Although I am afraid of heights, this was a sight I was not going to miss. We took the hop-on-hop-off bus to the bottom of Table Mountain where we queued up for the cableway (we had bought our tickets for the cableway when we bought our bus tickets so didn't have to queue up twice). Although it was busy, the queue moved quickly and soon we were airborne! It's a short ride up and you are on a rotating floor so everyone gets a chance at a view (unless you are very short and standing in the middle). The way the cableway was built into a cleft at the top of Table Mountain is a little scary but when you emerge you forget about that part. The top is quite extensive if you walk all the way around and great views over Cape Town and the bay beyond. I would have liked to have walked down but they advised only to do it with a guide as it's not safe. A must-do in Cape Town!
Fantastic experience. A must do.. Fantastic excursion to the top. Great views of Cape Town and the Peninsular from the top. One of the 7 natural wonders of the world.
A must visit. When you are in cape town you have to visit this great view. Easy to get there by myciti bus. Restaurant on the top not so good

Great Cable Car. You always have to pick your time carefully when planning a trip up Cable Mountain largely due to the fact that on many occasions the mountain is shrouded with cloud thus masking the view from the top. However if you get it right it is stunning and the cable car is the only one I have come across that actually rotates slowly on the way up and down enabling a full panoramic view od the scenery

Sensational Views. A very efficient service, ensuring safe passage to and from the summit of Table Mountain.The rotating base of the car provides 360 degree views both to the summit and back down.Even though we had not booked, the wait, although of an hour, was quite good considering the number of people queuing.The wait was well-worth it, The views are spectacular.
great table mountain. Just unbelievable experience. I visited table mountain twice.early morning to witness the sun rise and also just before the sun set. what experience (no words for it)!!!!

You HAVE to go. You're in Cape Town!. Amazing, unforgettable views from the top of Table Mountain. The aerial tramway gets very busy so I'd try to go in the morning. I went on on a Sunday AM (in winter) and there was no line. Parking is limited to the road coming in to the tramway, but it goes a long distance past the ticket booth so you can try your luck on the far end. The tram car spins around as it goes up so everyone near the windows gets a full view at some point. I'd recommend standing by the open air section without windows because the view is that much more spectacular without scuffed up glass. The area at the top is huge... you can definitely spend a lot of time wandering around but 90 minutes or so should do it for most people (not including time spent going up and down). Even if you're not a big fan of heights, this ride is pretty easy to take and it would be a mistake not to go up.

Sky high. One of the 7 modern wonders of the world, the mountain and the cable car to the top was an exquisite experience, I have never seen such fantastic views. And don't worry about oushing your way in to get a window view, the internal floor rotates so everyone gets a great view.

Real nightmare!. There are better ways to see the mountain, ok maybe not if you don't like walking! Seriously the queues are enough to put you and the crowds too! You can be waiting to get off for hours if you hit it at the end of the day. If you do want to go go early and get down before the queues or you will regret it as it can get cold up there waiting in a line!! Also be warned it may be sunny down the bottom but cloudy up top so make sure to go on a clear day….!

Hurry up and wait. Going up Table Mountain is one of those must do things for visitors to Cape Town. It is always great to see the view at the top. That said be prepared for hectically long queues and long waits for the Cable car. It may well pay to phone first and see how long the queues are, that said it is still a must do trip the view alone is worth it.

Great day trip. Took the cableway to the top and was so happy we did. We bought a round ticket but ended up taking the walking track down. Good idea at the time, I mean how hard can it be? As it turned out, very! The weather is crucial to the experience but It changes constantly and so I think you have to just go and at some stage the clouds dissapear for a remarkable vista of capetown and surrounds. The walk down was a great experience but you may not have thigh muscles for a few days after! We took no food or water which was dumb in retrospect but luckily a couple of mountain streams proved very welcome to rehydrate at intervals along the way. A pizza and beer on the summit were very nice. This day was an unforgettable fun day that should not be missed if in capetown.

Amazing 360 degree views. The railway called Rotaire rotates 360 while traveling up the mountain. It is a very unusual ride, in a beautiful, unusual landscape. Views of Robbin Island, and where 2 oceans meet, makes this experience memorable.
Cable car. This was also an experience in itself, the cablecar moved around in a circle allowing everyone to obtain a good view.

Great views. It's great to go up table mountain even if just for the views and scenes. The queues can be long so arrive early. Check to make sure the cable car is operational as it may stop during high winds which is quite often.

Beautiful views. This ride takes less than 10 minutes, but sure is a good way to get to the top of the Table Mountain and back if you are challenged with hiking the mountain. The views from the top are beautiful. The cable car rotates giving you an all around view. However, before you realize you have reached your destination, either up or down. It must be one of the shortest cable car rides I have taken. I have hiked up the mountain several times, but have never hiked down thanks to this cable car. I have seen long lines to catch the cable car at times, but this time when we did decide to take it up & down on a Monday we were lucky because it was not busy at all.They don't operate the cable car on windy days and even when you have gone up with it in the morning, weather can suddenly change and they can decide to shut it down. The signs on the top say that they have an alarm system that alerts people to quickly come back to the cable car if this happens. Luckily it has never happened to us. However, it is worth your while to study the weather conditions when you dare to go up, especially if you have difficulty hiking down the mountain.
used to be afraid of heights not anymore. travelling up table mountain was a great experience the cable cars a have a revolving floor so you have A 360 degree view worth the wait

One of the best activities in Cape Town!. What a great activity! The views from Table Mountain are spectacular! Suitable for everyone, a definite must-do on your trip. Grab a bite to eat, walk around and watch Dassie's playing in the rocks. If it's your birthday, you get to go up for free! Don't miss this exhilarating experience!

Breath taking view. Lovely spectacular view..love the revolving cable, its a must do when visiting capetown..each rock of the table mountain has its own character, the flowers of africa will stun u in awe.. only disappointment is the very little time spent there...pls spare a day to appreciate everything table mountain has to offer

Harmonies at the Cable station. Having booked the tickets with the hotel on the morning when we knew the sky was perfectly clear and sunny ,we headed for Table Mountain cable car. Visitors with tickets found queuing to be minimal and we were very quickly at the entrance to the cable car. We were very lucky as the the whole experience was made thoroughly enjoyable as a team of junior fire fighters happened to be visiting on the same day and burst into song, as we approached, and we were entertained with wonderful melodies, for the very short wait.The cable station was very organised and staff were very friendly, a great ride in the car and a truly wonderful experience.

Ariel cableway. Must do it - but be prepared. Everyone should, if they have time in Cape Town, try to get to the top of the Table Mountain. The views are spectacular and the walks on the top interesting and manageable. But there are a few things that you need to be prepared for- weather is a big factor - low clouds or winds are not uncommon and the mountain will close - keep an eye on the forecasts- Be prepared to queue. I went off-peak season (October), and had to wait for 45 minutes from joining the queue to getting into a cablecar. And, once in the queue, there's no going back - difficult for young kids to understand- If you haven't got a ticket, you have a seperate queue to join before you get to the main one - so, if possible, buy your ticket in advance (I believe the circle tour bus terminuses sell them, amongst others)- The cable cars revolve - but they pack them full. So, if you don't get to a window asap you'll not see too much from the centre of the car, as people at the windows don't move. A tip. When in the cable car station, go straight to the door where your cable car entry will be and stand by it. Most people don't do this until they see their car coming towards them. This will put you near the front of the queue & in prime position to bag a window. (If you do't get one, don't worry - the views from the top are better)

Take your binoculars and camera!. Line up can be tedious, but this ride up to the top of Table Mountain is not to be missed. Breathtaking views. The actual car rotates so everyone has an opportunity for a full 360 view. Plan to spend an hour topside.

Mother Nature dampens the ride. Disappointing that the national parks org couldn't better advise of what the weather is like at the top. When we took off, they were advising limited visibility and light wind. When we arrived about 10 minutes later, you could not see past the edge of the mountain and it was misting. We went and grabbed a coffee and got back in line for another hour or so to head back down. Aside from the cool view before we hit the fog, not the best use of a few hours.

Wow. A group of business associates decided to go at the last minute I was skeptical but I went an experience of a lifetime would recommend this tourist attraction for all the world to see. Simply beautiful and reasonable a families memory of a lifetime. I loved the gift shop at the top got all my souvenirs and if you missed something you could get it at the bottom. The drive to the mountains was simply magnificent. A must visit. It was a little cloudy but it cleared up. God in all his splendor
Loved it!. Our whole family enjoyed the ride up the mountain. It was really interesting how the inside moved to give everyone opportunities to get the photos out each side.
Queue madness!. It took 2 1/2 hours standing in lines to finally get to the top. View and walking path were great! Suggest going in the mid-afternoon when there was no line at all!
Exciting trip. Rotating cable carts are really cool! Bit of a long wait but definitely worth it! Beautiful views of the mountain!

Expensive But Well Run. The cable car runs regularly unless there is wind (an alarm will go off on the mountain if the wind picks up to advise you to come down). It is pricey but works well and takes you up and down in minutes. There are no seats and you can´t hang on to the sides as the car turns 360 degrees to offer a panoramic view, so it´s a bit tricky to hold on.
Beautiful sunset. If you do Table Mountain and you want it to be romantic have supper there while the sun is setting what a beauty

Just returned from a trip to South Africa. During my stay in Cape Town the weather was clear and sunny in October and we tried to get on the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. After quiewing for over an hour in the sun we finaly got close and were told it was too windy and the cable car was not taking anymore people up.We tried on the next day and despite a long wait 1.5hrs we finnaly got on the cable car and reached the top. It was well worth it what a view.I would not recomend taking small children up here as it was a long wait in the sun.Paul.

You have not been to Cape Town unless you do the Table Mt Aerial Cableway.. Absolutely afraid of heights, I sat in the middle on the floor next to the cable car controller. Smooth ride and very nice experience. What an awesome view from the top. Fabulous pictures --went to the edge,,,no fear.. safe as on the ground. Walked all over experiencing such wonder; even attempted, and succeeded the side boardwalk! Had a lovely light lunch and refreshment at their restaurant. Next time I'll experience the walk down...just need comfy shoes, and a bottle of water. On the way down I actually stood at the revolving window in awe of the absolute beauty and splendour of the view. Cannot wait to experience it again. Afraid of heights or not - trust me- it is THE highlight of visiting Cape Town. An absolute MUST. Note: rapid weather changes- take a windbreaker.

Hang on tight. A great trip to the top of the mountain. The car rotates as you go up so no need to get what appears to be the best place to stand, everyone will get a good view on the way up and down.
Great. Enjoyed the quick journey to the top of the mountain - the floor spins below your feet so you get a 360 degree view of Cape Town.

Half price 6pm Sunset option is perfect. You have to keep a sharp eye on the mountain, trying to "read it" for a window in the clouds. Check each day around 5pm and if it looks promising, grab a cab and go! Cab fare is about 150 rand and takes about 20 minutes from the Waterfront. Half price sunset tickets must be bought on site so be prepared to wait in line 10-15 minutes. The views from the top are amazing especially the side opposite Cape Town. Many brought bottles of wine. Great place to take pictures of couples in a romantic setting.

Took online to avoid the queue.. If you're nervous, the operators are happy for you to sit in the central control area that does not revolve, and does not feel as scary as being that high up. The queues are long, but move reasonably quickly. You could choose to walk up instead, but this is a serious choice for fitness fanatics only. The cable history is published alongside the queue and is quite interesting, and despite not enjoying the experience due to my own issues, the cable ride was smooth and felt safe.

Top of the world. The top of Table Mountain is wonderful, fantastic ,brilliant....Great ride up in the cable car and a large area to walk around and take in the superlative views over Capetown.....not to be missed

Amazing views...but long queues. Firstly you need to go on a clear day, otherwise you will miss out on the amazing views from the top. The only problem with this, is that everyone wants to go on that day as well!We drove and parked our car in the free park and ride carpark just off the roundabout when driving from the city, there are regular free buses to the cable car station. If not you drive to as near to the cable car station as possible and then try and find a parking space on the road, much less hassle using the park and ride.We had to queue for around two hours, but the time passed quickly and it's all well controlled and no-one jumps the queue. However, if you are smarter then we were, buy an advance ticket online, you then jump the queue.The ride up is spectacular, and when boarding the car everyone wants to be near the open window, don't worry if your not, as the inside of the car revolves slowly as it ascends so everyone gets a turn.The views from the top are simply amazing, it was worth the two hour queue. There are well maintain footpaths to explore the top of the Table Mtn, and people stick to the paths so as not to damage the beautiful flora. Look out for Dassies (Rock Hyrex), and you should see eagles or buzzards above.There is a good, but very busy café, easier to take a picnic.The ride down is even more spectacular, as the cable car station is on the edge of a precipice, and it just launches into space and it's very steep.If you visit Cape Town, this is a must.

Beautiful views. Incredible views from top of the mountain. Everywhere you turn is a photo opportunity. The ride up is also worth it. The cable car floor rotates so that improves your views. I recommend buying tickets online first before going, saves you from standing in one queue.

an adventure within an adventure.... Just getting to the top is an adventure all on its own. Once at the top Table Mountain is a photographers dream, with spectacular views of the surrounding areas as well as Robben Island.

Amazing. This is an amazing experience not to be missed when in Cape Town. We decided to go up on a sunny, but windy day. The cable car had been closed for 2 days previously, due to high winds. We had pre-booked our tickets, but so had everyone else! When we joined the queue, we were told that it would be about 30 mins before we got on the cable car. Unfortunately it took over 2 hours! If we had known it would take this long, we would have done it another day. After 90 mins we were told they were running the cars at half speed and half capacity and that is why it was taking so long. This was a safety precaution due to the wind. When we eventually made it in to the cable car we had an amazing ride with spectacular views. The views from the top were well worth the wait, but my goodness it was windy!!! We had to cling on to everything! After about 30 mins the sirens rang alerting us to the need to return down as the cars would be closing due to high winds. Again we queued! About 45 mins this time. We made it down safely and overall felt it was worth the hassle, but I think we would have had a better experience if it hadn't been so windy and we had been updated earlier. Our advise would be check the weather and avoid if it has been closed for the days before.
Love The New Cableway. I love the views that you get in the new cable cars. The rotating platform makes the trip up and down so much more exciting.

Missed out on this due to ....... Had four day in Cape Town and on the three days that we wanted to go up the mountain there was a sign saying it was closed.the reason on their website is gale force winds. Now after this happening twice we checked the weather for the next day. Sunny, no clouds and a wind of 14knots. Low and behold it was closed that day as well. Was not impressed with how this company runs its business and so disappointed at missing such a spectacular site.

A thrilling ride and breath-taking views. The trick is to avoid the days and times when the mountain is covered in cloud - have a flexible plan which allows you to head for the mountain as soon as it looks clear enough.

360' views. This is definitely a must do thing when you are in Cape Town. We loved the visit , and would love to do it again at sunset to see the lights coming on as the sun dips below the horizon. On this visit we arrived at 10 am on a beautiful sunny , and almost windless, saturday. We had to queue for an hour, but there was lots of shade provided, as well as cooling mist which was very much appreciated ! If you bought tickets online then there was a shorter "queue jumping queue" which would have halved our wait (oh well, next time !)The ride up was so smooth and the car rotated giving everyone a changing view as we ascended. Amazing to spot all the mountain climbers and rock climbers scaling these heights. At the top we did the short circular walk, which gave us an opportunity to appreciate the cliffs, valleys and vistas in all directions. There are longer walks available to do, as well as ways to climb down on foot. There is a cafe and shop up here, as well as toilets etc. All in all we spent an hour taking in all the views.
