There was a short wait to come down (5 min at the most).When we got to the bottom we discovered that there were no queues ! Clearly morning are peak times, so best avoid. The cableway website was very helpful with weather conditions and expected waiting times, both were very accurate. The Hop On Hop Off bus offers a combination ticket, and these will let you jump the queue.Table mountain has been voted one of the "New 7 Wonders" of the world, and it absolutely deserves this title !
So Cape Town. A must do for any visitor to Cape Town. Beathtaking views. Booking or queueing a bit of a frustration at times, but worth the effort. A unique experience.

Tremendous Views. Arrived on the first Cape Sightseeing Red Route Bus and there was hardly any queue. we only had a wait of about 15 minutes in total to get on the cable car. To save queuing tickets should be bought on the bus or the web site.The service is very quick (7 minutes) and the views from the top are excellent. Cafe is not expensive and the 3 marked walks vary from easy (wheel chair friendly) to slight rugged but basically not very hilly although more difficult routes are possible

Great views on the way to the top and at the top itself.. Tremendous views from the top. Cable ride was enjoyable. We were lucky to have been able to ride up since the cable car is often closed due to winds.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. An absolute must-do for those who don't want to hike up Table Mountain.Fabulous views from the top but get there early - the queues for the cable car can be daunting at peak hours. And please, once on top of the mountain take time to explore away from the arrival area - it's well worthwhile to see the fynbos vegetation. Bring camera and binoculars.

Natural wonder. Such an unusual mountain with a flat top...the tram ride is only 5 minutes but quite dramatic. The views are amazing and multi-dimensional.....highly recommend as a must visit in Cape Town!

A make this first on your list of things to do!. If you want to see table mountain (and your friends will ask if you did), put it early in your itinerary, because it closes when the clouds move in, or the wind picks up. If possible buy your tickets for the cable car at your hotel, or online. We lined up for an hour to get tickets on a Saturday around noon, then got in the 40 minute line for the cable car. We could have skipped the ticket line.Walking up or down is free, and possible, but dress in layers and wear hiking shoes....it's a dirt and rock path and is rigorous.Beautiful park at the top, and gorgeous vistas of Capetown.Good for the whole family!

Loved it !!. As touristy as it might be, a must do when visiting Cape Town. Some tourists dip out because of the weather so don't delay it because of other plans. Jump in while you can. The views from the top are magnificent and walking around up there is beautiful. A once in a life time experience. Cable car can get quite crowded but it's all worth it. Would definitely do it again if we come back

Magical. We were lucky enough to visit on a clear day. Yes the cable car itself can be a bit crowded - can take around 60 people - but the car rotates and the main attraction is when you reach the top. Fantastic views, the dassies lazing around and the beautiful plants. A really peaceful spot. Would definitely do it again. Tip - get there as early as possible. Traffic and queues can get quite manic but weather can also change quickly and the mountain is then closed to visitors

Spectacular. I was staying in downtown Cape Town and woke up to perfect weather (sunny and not windy). I only had time for a quick trip up Table Mountain. I went just when they opened at 8:30 am and the lines moved pretty quickly. I was up on top by 9:30. I had to be back in my hotel for a meeting at 10:30 so my stay at the top was short but spectacular. I got to see some beautiful flowers and very cute local rodents called Dassies sunning themselves on the rocks. The views are amazing--ocean or mountains in every direction. Definitely worth the trip to the top, even if you only have a bit of time. I would love to come back and hike around on the mountain.

breathtaking. Taking the cable car to the top of Table Mountain provides a view of Cape Town and the harbor that is truly breathtaking. The cable car is a ride that puts carnival rides to shame in its unbelievable rise and isn't for the faint of heart.

On Top of the World. Make sure you go on a good clear day. The ride up is fast and amazing - but the walks up on top are a surprise. Lots of wildlife to see, good paths, and a café and shop. A must-do activity, which puts the rest of Cape Town into perspective. Also the option to walk up or down, and use the cable car the other way (if you wish) or just enjoy the view both ways from the cable car - and wave to the intrepid venturers who are doing it the hard way.

Beautiful. We also pre booked our tickets. Do this. And keep your tickets because you have to have them to return back down. Have a glass of champagne and enjoy the incredible view. Absolutely amazing.

WOW! This is a Must Do!. I used the HOHO Bus to get here, when you arrive it is a slick and efficient set up. Loved the trip up to the top, and back down, hard to take in everything you can see. Your time at the top is unlimited, there are walks to take, and places to eat and drink, all with the 'Views'. FYI - Be ready, as they take your photo before you get on the Cable Car, these are ready for purchase (no obligation) when you come back down.
Up Up and away. We pre booked our tickets, and i am glad we did. So be advised pre book. Sadly we were like sardines in a can going to the mountain and back. The view as always was breathtaking.

nice view and very steady ride.. this ride takes just a few minutes and has beautiful views (but.... only do this when the skies are clear...) the cable car is rotating slowly, for people with hight problems , you can stay or sit in the middle of the car, and the staff is very helpfull
Great experience . Had a GREAT morning on top table mountain clear skies, beautiful weather and good experience. Service was good. Wil be back soon

Incredible views over the city and the peninsula... but some organizational problems. We visited Table Mountain on a beautiful Sunday afternoon so the cableway was obviously very busy. Despite this, the queue was fast-moving and we got to the top of the mountain quite quickly. The ride up the mountain is fun, the rotating cablecars allowing every passenger to get a good 360° view.Once we got to the top, I was amazed at the view - it is really splendid. There are some nice walks on the mountain top as well as a restaurant, souvenir shop etc.We watched the sun set over the sea and when we decided to join the queue to travel back down, about 20 minutes before the last cable car was scheduled, we found the queue to be very long but expected it to move quickly as it had on the way up.I am not sure if the cablecars were going slower than usual of it simply too many people were allowed up during the afternoon, but the fact is that the queue was extremely slow and it took us over one hour and a half to be able to travel back down. This hour and a half was spent in the dark, with the chill of the night and the wind (we were cold despite our jackets but some people were in shorts and tshirts and must have been freezing). People with children or elderly people were given priority, which is good, but the situation seemed really out of hand. I am not sure if this was a single incident or if it happens regularly, but it seems that there is a great deal of lack of organization regarding the "quotas" of people allowed up...
Very exciting. The trip up the mountain is great with the cable car rotating so you get all views. Beware the line to come down can take 45 minutes on a busy day.

long queues. Although we pre purchased our tickets we unfortunately struck an extremely busy day( with perfect weather0 and ended up spending a massive amount of time standing in the queue to go up and to go down. Whilst it was scenically quite magnificent up the top the crowds and queueing severely detracted from the experience.

"What a view". After 2 days of the mountain being closed it opened. We dashed up there and waited an hour in the queue. The ride up was amazing and very safe. The views from the top were breathtaking. Something you must do in Cape Town

Fantastic way to get up to the top!. We had a great day up table mountain with a relaxing and picturesque views. I would recommend booking in advance and getting there early- you will queue but not for long. Definitely check on their twitter/ Facebook page to see if the cableway is open- otherwise you may be disappointed!
What's not to like. Safe and easy way to see the views from the top of Table Mountain. Clean, staff were helpful. Perfect!
Table Mountain - Amazing Views. A must do on a first trip to Cape Town.Try to be there early morning.Amazing sweeping views across the Cape Peninsula
Great views - don't miss this. If the weather is clear go right away do not wait. The weather changes very quickly. The view is stunning.

Exciting. There is floor all together up to 65 persons and the floor spins (rotates) during the trip (duration about 5 minutes)to the top of the mountain. You can see the beautiful town and the mighty mountain. Clever!

Website lies about queuing time!. Website said 5 minutes queuing time we were nearly two hours having prepaid tickets on line! Should give people time slots as only two cars which hold 65 people so they know how many people an hour they can take. Just don't care about people standing for hours in the heat!
Good Trip. Quite cheap, and really good. Perhaps we just got a good day, but at the top it's surprisingly not that windy or cold. Stunning views, and a must-do for any trip to Cape Town.

Magnificent MUST DO when in Cape Town. Try to buy your ticket before in order to avoid another queue before you go in their cable car with an rotating inside platform to reach the top. Form there you can wander around and have some breathtaking views.

Great ride up the mountain. A unique cable car where the floor rotates as the car moves so that the passengers get a 360 degrees panorama view. There can be a long queue for tickets in the morning, if possible buy them beforehand.

Amazing Views! Not your typical cable car ride. Make sure the sun is shining!. Not your typical cable car ride. Beautiful views and the cable car rotates. This provides all riders with the opportunity to see different views. The windows rotate as well. That way you sometimes have unobstructed views without windows for photos as your ride up / down the mountain. Make sure the sun is shining! Otherwise, the ride to the top and view at the top are not worth the time or money.

Good views and good value. The cable car up Table Mountain is a must do if in Capetown. The views from the top are stunning. It gets very busy and you are advised to buy a ticket in advance. However I didn't and the queue was shorter without a ticket! Cost as at Oct.15 is 240 rand return. You can if you wish climb up or walk down

Unique mountain with awesome views. One of the hightlights on our trip. Taking the cableway up the mountain was great. Awesome views from the top of Table Mountain on a clear day. Get there early...the lines are longer in
the afternoon. It was worth it.
Great place and nice views. The access to the Table Mountain was very easy, the walk there is a good experience for those who want to feel the energy of the place. I recommend to all visitors.

AMAZING VIEWS!!!. a not to miss attraction on SA Cape town!!!one of the wonders of the world....TRULY!!! breathtaking views. if you are lucky the line for going up will be short. beware of the taxis on the way back...from the attraction......that might be taking advantage of you being tourist...

Stunning. We were lucky enough to visit this stunningly beautiful place yesterday. We arrived on the red hop on hop off bus. Even though we had pre bought our tickets for cable car online, we still had to wait 75 mins in temps of 34 degrees to ascend. It was roasting. The other queue where people who had to purchase their tickets was sprayed with light water sprinkle but no joy for us!!the wait was very uncomfortable but staff were very professional. The wait was certainly worth it. It took about 5 mins to ascend in the cable car which rotated constantly ensuring everyone got to see the spectacular views from all angles. When we reached the summit, there were panoramic views of the Cae Town city bowl, harbour and of Robbin Island. There are many gorgeous walks and spectacular flora and fauna. We had lunch in the mountain top restaurant accompanied by a glass of Cape Town's best Sauvignon blanc chilled to perfection. Food was reasonable enough considering this is one of the New Seven wonders of the World!A must do if you are in Cape Town!! It closes very frequently due to wind so go at the earliest opportunity on your holiday.

Avoid the crowd... Go early in the day!. An absolutely wonderful experience, not to be missed. The first cable car leaves at 8:30. There are two lines (queues) One for those who have tickets and one for one who don't have tickets. GET YOUR ONLINE TICKETS BEFORE YOU GO!!! Cheaper and you'll save an hour of line waiting. If you don't have tickets you wait in the first line to purchase your tickets, and then you wait in the second line to get on the lift. If you get there by 8:00 you'll beat all the tour buses (read groups of 60 or more) and get on the first couple of cable cars, beating the hordes of people. The first day we went, we had our hotel get our online tickets and print them. We waited in line for 30 minutes and then they closed the car because of high winds. This was at 1:00 in the afternoon. Online tickets are good for 7 days so we were advised to get there early the next day, when winds are usually lower. We go there at 8:00 and were on the first 3 or 4 cars. Right after we got in line FIVE tour buses dropped off their guests, with more on the drive up the road! We did the half hour free guided tour which is given on the hour and it was very enjoyable and informative. Highly recommend that one as well. Then we walked around the top, oooing and aaaahhhing and taking lots of pictures. Enjoyed watching paragliders take off from Lions Head, just to the West of us. We went down around noon, and could have stayed longer but we felt that we had gotten enough of the flavor of Table Mountain to know we could easily come back and we wanted to get down to the Waterfront. See my other review of hiking up.
Beautiful!. Such a great ride and the views are fantastic. Bring a picknick since the restaurant was chaotic at lunch time...

Great views. Obviously the easiest way to get to table mountain. Sometimes there's quite a queue but I was lucky. The cable car rotates, so just get a spot against the window and you'll have good views at any time.

Lovely family day out. Best to call before you arrive as they will tell you what the weather conditions are like. Even though it was misty on top of Table Mountain it was still a enjoyable. Get there early especially on a sunny day unless you want to queue for a long time. The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and we felt safe at all times. The Restaurant and Shop on Top was well run, well stocked and friendly service. We walked a few trails and had a picnic lunch. Kids really enjoyed it too. This attraction should be be on your bucket list. Thank you for a lovely day out!
top of the table. a must for any visit to Cape Town Great views and above the clouds at some points nice touch wit the revolving cable car so every one gets the same views

Great experience. A partial tablecloth on the day we went, but no wind so cable car operated. Bought out tickets on the open top red bus tour so avoided the queue at ticket office. Views amazing and walks on top of mountain. Food and drink available.

Second visit. . Awesome!! Love the view. Very eco friendly. Love to go again. When visitors come gotta take them. Fun for everyone. Always cooler at the top take a jacket. Great flowers. And many awesome views.

Well worth a visit. On day one the cable car was not running due to high wind ,as our ticket was valid for a week we ventured back and were glad we did. The views are spectacular and worth the queuing
Great weather makes for a fantastic day up on Table Mountain. Spectacular views and unbelievable foliage. Take a walk around the trails and enjoy Cape Twon from above.

The Best Day!. The sun was out, the wind was down, and we were ready. It was around 4PM when we decided the weather was not going to get better the next day. The cable car is closed in high winds. When clouds cover the top, you can't see anything. The next day was windy, rainy and cloudy, so we had lucked in. With our daily tour guide, we took the cable car - a unique 360 degree turning car - to see everything. On top, the view was super. Various walkways enabled us to walk all over the top, looking over the edge frequently or taking pictures. We saw dassies - so cute. The distant ocean was a bit misty but you could still see Robben Island. It would be perfect to bring a picnic sandwich and enjoy many hours here. The cable car was just as exceptional on the way down.
Amazing view - Surprising great food and wine for a tourist site. Recommend having a wine in the afternoon while watching the sunset.Great food and excellent service - not your usual fast food.
Bucket list. Going up Table mountain should be on every persons bucket list. The view is spectacular. Be sure to bring book in advance
Well worth a visit. The cable car sometimes has big queues, but it's well worth the wait. Fantastic views. It's a must visit when in Cape Town.

Stunning views! 7 Natural Wonders! . Now one of the 7 New Natural Wonders of the World!!! Buy tickets online to avoid the wait in line. Trip to the top is very fast - about 5 mins. The interior of the car actually rotates for an amazing panoramic view. At the top are short hikes with many viewing spots for photo opps and stunning views of both sides of Table Mountain.

Brilliant Views. This is a must do experience when in Cape Town. We took the Red Bus up to the cable car station. The revolving cable car lets everyone see the views on the way up and down. We were lucky and the clouds stayed away and we enjoyed the brilliant view from the top. We enjoyed the walks on top of the mountain and had a nice coffee and lovely carrot cake at the café.
What a view!. Amazing view, easy to walk around, 365º and ways to see this gorgeous townCan I go back? Pleaseeeeese!

It does its job. The cableway is good but the mountain is the real attraction. I actually wouldn't mind trying the climb anyways. If you are goimg to come, definitely book online in advance to avoid a 2 hour plus line. The tickets are good for a week and even refundable.
AMAZING EXPERIENCE. You need to check the weather and don't bother is it is a cloudy day or a windy day.. The cable way is super fun for the kids.

Wonderful experience!. We went during the busy holiday period but lines were swiftly moving along. Beautiful breathtaking views! We went on the sunset one- it was freezing up there, so if you are going during the evening, I suggest you dress warmly.Truly an outing enjoyed by all ages. What an experience!

Breath-taking view atop Table Mountain. A must visit place in Cape Town, Table Mountain. Lucky to be able to go up this new wonder of the world as the weather was good in the morning. The revolving gondola was an interesting ride as one got to see the 360 degree view. It was a breath-taking view looking down from the top of Table Mountain. The fog quickly fill up the sky making the city view misty. That's why the gondola ride need to stop if it get too foggy. Some even waited for days and yet couldn't make it to the top.

Mist did not spoil. Very fun experience. It was misty and we had our doubts when we rocked up in shorts and t shirts, everyone else in jackets and bobble hats. Oh dear were we to be disappointed? Not at all. We laughed and got on with it. From the top we could not see a thing to the mist, we decided what the hect we would just grab a coffee and have a walk. The sun tried to break through and after an hour we were treated to some special views. A very fun experience and it delivered what we wanted. Would recommend and dont be put off from the early mist. Table top delivers

OMG!!!!!!!!!!!. We got SO lucky! A cloudless day on Table Moutnain. Temp was perfect, you could see forever in ALL directions. The rotating car means you won't miss a thing! Just stand back and start taking pictures and video.

Quick ride to the top. Waited in line but not for too long.Ride was interesting especially as the car revolved allowing everyone to see all parts of the view.Very pleasant joky member of staff on board.
A worthy wonder. What a privilege to visit one of the 7 World Wonders. This is a unique experience and when it is a beautiful day the view from the top is picturesque.

Worth the ride. Great the ways in rotates 360 degrees so you get the complete view on the way. Facilities up top include toilets, cafe, gift shop. Views in all directions and can be as active or passive as you like.

Book your tickets online in advance to avoid the queues! Brilliant way to view Table Mountain and Cape Town. I was very happy that I had purchased tickets in advance of my visit as the queues were very long and I was able to breeze through with my advance purchase ticket. The cableway is a professionally run operation and allowed for smooth, easy passage up to the top of Table Mountain. Note - the cablecar rotates 360 degrees as it travels up the mountain so you get spectacular views no matter where you stand. The views from the top are spectacular and definitely worth going up for. There is a cafe at the top if you wish to purchase refreshments plus bathroom facilities. Highly recommend this attraction.
A great day out. Go early morning to avoid the ques, but a brilliant ride up the revolving cable car the views are out of this world. You can walk up if you wish. plenty to do on top

A must in Cape Town. Tickets are best booked on line and in advance. Ques get very long so get there very early like 7 to 7:30am. Take a jacket because it can get very cold with the clouds. Excellent visit at least once in your life. Kids loved it so did we.

Walk or Ride?. There is a route to walk to the top of Table Mountain but we chose to take the cable car, a well organised and slick operation. We booked our tickets in advance and so avoided the long queues to buy them. It gives you longer on the top as well. Be careful of the burning bushes which grow up there as they can cause nasty blisters which take a long time to heal.
Quick and easy with a view. Booking online was a plus, very easy and no queues. The views from the car were beautiful and everyone gets a turn to photograph with the revolving floor.
Great adventure. Well organised way of handling guests; friendly staff and very knowledgeable. Be sure to take one of the guided tours at the top of every hour on the mountain as you learn a lot.
Stunning views. Reach the top of Table Mountain for spectacular views of the southern tip of Africa, the sea and the city of Capetown.

a birthday to beat all birthdays. I went up Table Mountain on my birthday - South Africans can have a free trip on their day. This coincided with it being a Friday when pensioners (and I am one) get a special deal on a meal at the top of the mountain. What a treat it turned out to be. The staff of the cableway went out of their way to make sure I enjoyed it. They wished me happy birthday all along the line. The food was excellent and on our trip down again, as we left someone on the staff said, "We hope you have enjoyed your day with us". And I sure had. The vistas are wonderful, the scenery superb, the flora and fauna exquisite. It's a wonderful world in a rarified atmosphere. Loced every minute.

Buy tickets first! Before the gorgeous views expect to wait.. TIP: Book tickets online before you head up this gorgeous mountain (print them out before hand). If it is a rainy day the printed tickets are valid for 7 days from the date you planned to go up! There are two queues - one to buy tickets and one for pre-purchased tickets - they are both long but the one with pre-purchased tickets is the shorter one. We waited about 45-1 hour to get to the top, coming down there were no waits but I have been told by friends they waited for up to 2 hours to go up and come down (both ends - total of 4 hours). It isn't expensive online, from memory it was 300R per person - $30 AUD. The cable car rotates inside slowly and you get a full 360 view - get near the outside to look out the window! The middle part does not rotate so if you get motion sickness you can sit in the middle. The views are absolutely breathtaking! Take a good camera! We also hired a driver for the day, I highly recommend it. She charged 100R from the city to Table Mountain, a little pricey compared to the CITI bus at 30R. There are shops at the bottom and from memory there may be a cafe at the top but it wasn't open so not entirely sure it was.
Great time!. Awesome!!!! Fantastic view of the city and the ocean. Take all the time you need to walk around and get photos. Great gift shop on top too!

Cable way Table Mountain . After climbing Table Mountain it was a pleasure to ride down with the cable car. As it revolves while descending the views are something to see and treasure. A must for the visitor to Cape Town.

Nice views. We hiked up, bought a one way ticket down in the shop at the top and enjoyed great views from.the rotating floor in the cable car on the downward journey. We were lucky to stand near the windows so not sure what the view is like from the centre.The queue for tickets at the bottom was long when we got down around 1pm. Recommend buying on line to avoid that!

The Easy Way to Climb the Mountain. The aerial cableway provides a fast and efficient service to ascend to the top of Table Mountain. One of the nice features of the cable car is that the floor rotates which gives everyone the same opportunity to get a 360 degree vista and take photos of different views over Cape Town. Definitely a must do activity in Cape Town.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Simple and good!. Good way to get up the hill if you don't want to trek it. If you have a mobile data plan, just buy your ticket when you get there and bypass the line to get tickets at the foot of the mountain.

Why walk when you can glide. Yes, I know you could walk up the mountain but the cable car is much more pleasant. Locals have the option of buying a cable card so that they can make a return trip, once a day as often as they like, for the period of the year for the price of two return tickets. We bought cable cards for the family for Christmas last year and we've been up the mountain every other weekend. Great views, the food in the cafe at the top is delicious and there is a fascinating collection of wild and plant life at the top. Photos available on our tazzdiscovers instagram account.
Just recently had its service. Amazing, smooth, rotating and quick 4 minutes each way, Must get your tickets before to save long queues.

Fantastic rotating cable car giving you full 360 views. A thrilling time was had by us on this rotating cable car. The sun cast a shadow onto the hilltop which made for great photos. The journey is quick and safe and is the only cost to the mountain which is thrilling in itself.

Stunning Table Mountain. The beauty and splendour of Cape Town is directly linked to the majestic Table Mountain. The easiest and quickest way to travel up to Table Mountain is to take the Aerial Cableway. At the entrance you can see one of the original cable cars (as South Africans refer to them) that was used back in the day.There are numerous routes to walk up and around Table Mountain. If you walk up the mountain before 9am you are able to buy a ticket to travel down by Cable Car at half price. On your birthday you are also able to ride the Cable Car at a discount.Visit the top of Table Mountain if the weather allows it. Bask in the sun alongside the dassies (African rodents who reminds one of a rough version of a guinea pig) and get lost in the vast view which shows you where the Atlantic and Indian oceans meet.

Beautiful Cape Town. We had a lovely exeperience at the Cableway. The queues are a bit long but doesn't move too slowly. Bearing in mind this is one of Cape Town's number 1 tourist attraction, patience is required. Upon reaching the top the views are so breathtaking it definitely is worth the wait. My advice is to go very early to avoid disappointment. The restuarant is convenient with average food.
Table Mountain. A must see.. great for family and outdoor lovers.. also adventurous type. Lovely for hikers.. we have climb it many times.

Buy tickets online. Definitely buy your tickets online! Parking is a nightmare so use Uber taxi service, less stress! The cable car is packed and any thoughts of taking photographs from it are immediately squashed. On saying those negatives, the positives are there. Actually being on the mountain is awesome. The views and the actual terrain on the top was not what I expected, but ten times better. Just wish a camera could capture what you feel and see. It is breathtaking. Loved it.
Who knew - it turns. There is always a line - but it is worth the wait. On the way up to the top of the mountain, the tram TURNS so all can get an amazing panoramic view. DO IT.

Cape Town, SA is one of the Most beautiful places to visit & Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is definitely a must to do.. Cape Town, SA. Is one of the most beautiful cities to Visit. One of my highlights was Table Mountain, it was my first time on a Cable Car & I hesitated to do so at first but with the persuasion of my Grand Children I had no other choice it to venture the ride. It was totally amazing & the view overlooking the beautiful city was spectacular. Once to the top there were trails & lookouts all around where you could see the beautiful beaches, vineyards the port & Robin Island plus there was also a shop & restaurant. We were able to spend as much time as we wanted on the top of the mountain & Our tour guide was excellent . It is definitely a must to see & do.

Easy way up!. If you are not up for a couple hour hike to the top of the Mountain then this is the way to go. Your ticket is for up and down. I recommend getting your ticket online and printing it out to avoid the line at the ticket counter. You will still have to wait in the line to get on the cable car however. The cable cars hold tons of people and not only goes up the mountain but it spins so everyone will get a chance to have a great view. Be sure to verify that the cable car is running before heading over from your hotel.

Tops!. The weather was perfect so made for a perfect day to take the cable car up the mountain. Line for tickets was a little long but it went fast. Enjoyed how the inside of the cable car turned in all directions while going up and down. Was great to be able to see in all directions. Watched 2 gals repel down the side of the mountain too.

Very wrong procedure. Wonderful and clear morning: 8h00 AM. Table mountain is completely clear after 3 days in the clouds. We jump in a taxi cab and go to the cable car. First deception: a long line-up to purchase ticket. Vvery long, but predictable, in fact, it is a nice day for everyone. The problem is that the buses arrive one after the other, and these groups are directed to a parallel queue advancing much faster than our own! Actually, these groups are prioritized!! So it will take us more than 1h45 only to buy our tickets! And that's not all: it is then time to another line-up: to board the cable car itself.. another hour lost! Obviously, reached the top at 11:30, the clouds invaded the summit and seen nothing. We descend disappointed. I suggest much more, go to the Signal Hill by car or taxi or hike the Lions Head. As beautiful and less frustrating.

Africa Wonder to behold. Its definitely one place you will never regret visiting.It is such a beauty to behold how nature carved the mountain.Although we went there when the weather wasn't so friendly and had to make an early departure.

Table mountain is great, but hike up instead!. Table mountain is an amazing experience, which is partly ruined by the insane lines to get on the cableway in high season. I thoroughly recommend hiking up instead, and you could always ride the cableway back down again!

The easy way to get up and down Table Mountain. I went during a school break and the lines were quite long at 2 PM, but had diminished by 4 PM. They have a separate line for those who booked online and already have tickets which probably saved over an hour in line so I would recommend that highly. The hotel concierge helped us with the booking. Tickets booked online are valid for not just the day scheduled, but up to 14 days beyond that so you don't have to worry about missing your trip due to fog or wind closing the cableway. The cablecar floor rotates as it goes up and down so everyone has the same view. but that means that you cannot hold onto the railings since the outside of the car does not rotate. Several elderly individuals on my last trip had some difficulty with not being able to hold the railing so they may be better off in the small central area (where the operator stands) which does not rotate. It has a bench on one side for individuals who need to sit down for the trip up or down.

A must if you're in the area. The cable station and ride to the top of table moutain is rated as one of the top 3 attractions in Cape Town and this is not hard to see why. First time we went the queues were pretty big but the views were amazing. The cable car just vanished into the clouds. It was mystical to see. We returned on a different day and were graced with clear skies so we got some amazing views. It's reasonably priced and you can get there by taxi, self drive or by the red bus. I highly recommend doing the trip but don't prebook your tickets for the cable car as the winds can change and it stops running

Worth the wait?. The view from the top is gorgeous, no denying. And the cable car is pretty cool, it actually rotates inside, so you get a full 360 view as you go up. I didn't spend a lot of time at the top because I'm terrified of heights (which, if you are, this is terrifying). Just be warned, I went early on a weekday and still waited over an hour to take the cable car. Don't plan too much after this, as the time it takes will be slightly unpredictable.
The view is to die for!. The mountain is one of a kind, the cable way is safe and great way to get up and down fast, it is very busy, amazing view of Cape Town and ocean
Smooth ride to the top.. Try to pre-buy your tickets to jump the queues.Definitely take the cable car up but if fit and energetic you can walk down

Great views at a good price. The cable car was a really fun experience and a great way to see Table Mountain. Even though we purchased our tickets ahead of time we still had to wait over an hour to get onto the cable car, but the line was really well organized. Don't stress about where you end up standing on the cable car. It turns while you're inside so you'll get a view of the whole landscape from every angle. Also, be prepared to have interruptions for your trip. They will stop running the cable car if the weather turns on you so go whenever you have good weather.

Slow then fast. The line was insane, so glad we booked online and managed to skip over an hour of wait time (as it was it was nearly an hour still). Highly recommend this option if you have kids, or hate waiting in line. It's very frustrating. The process once in is quite quick, directed into a holding pen waiting for the cable car. The doors open, file on and doors shut. The floor rotates which is a great initiative to allow everyone in the round carriage to get the full 360 degree view on the ascent. It is a quick trip though, hardly seem to be able to take it in and we were at the top and out the door to the next part of the journey. Overall, didn't enjoy the wait but was fairly painless process, the staff were well drilled and made it flow where it needed to and were quite aware of requirements.
Fantastic!. We loved our visit to table mountain, the scenery was breathtaking. Cape Town and the surrounding area is such a beautiful place!

Pre-book Tickets. Queues form from very early, so suggest pre-booking tickets so you skip the queues at the sales kiosks. There are queues for the cable cars but we went mid-morning so we went up fairly quickly. The cable car floor rotates so everyone of the outside of the round car gets a good view up and down while travelling up or down. They stated that if you loss your ticket you will have to walk down, didn't test that and hung on to our tickets carefully.

Unforgettable cabel car ride. The cable car is the only way an ordinary traveler like you and me get to the top of “ The Mountain “ in Cape town. It is advisable to you to be there as early as possible, but if it is rainy, windy or misty, you are guaranteed to miss either the ride or the views from the top or both. So read the weather forecast and be forewarned that Cape weather can change almost instantly. Anyways we were lucky and id was a clear morning.Once you show your downloaded bar chart in your phone to the entrance, you are on. The lower cable station is on Tafelberg Road. The upper cable station offers views overlooking Cape Town, Table Bay and Robben Island to the north, and the Atlantic seaboard to the west and south.This cable way has officially opened to the public in 1929 and extensively upgraded, In 1997. A car can carry 65 passengers. As one goes up, the other one descends. Don’t worry where you stand, you will get all the view, as the cars rotate through 360 degrees during the ascent or descent, giving you a panoramic view. The ascent is quite steep and if you have a fear of heights you might as well close your eyes in the car….

A Must Do, But !!!. Everyone wants to do this, and on a clear day and only a few hundred visitors, rather than thousands, this is a great trip. It is closed for low cloud and or high winds (quite often), so when conditions are good the queues can be huge, 2hrs plus wait for a 10min ride. The views are breathtaking, but only if you manage to get a window, cars take a lot of people, many of whom will miss the views.
Cascading view. An escalating experience with a classic view. The early morning chill is fantastic but all depends on the weather

Better then walking up. Please book in advance, it takes only 6 minutes to get up and the views are amazing. We went early, please check the weather before booking (please book only one day before you plan it, that is what we did and it works nicely)

Good experience but feels very short. We stopped at Table Mountain as part of the Hop on Hop off tour. The base of the cableway presents amazing views of the entire city of Capetown as well as the Lions Head.The ride is a great experience as well but can feel very quick and short for the price. However, with the overall experience of Table Mountain and the views from top, it is decent value for money. There are other ways to get atop Table Mountain (Aka hiking) but can be tiring.Do make sure that you check if the cableway is open before making your way to the base. In times of wind, especially in winters, they close the cableway which happened with us on two occassions. However, if you are patient enough, you will get a chance to use the ride. If you book online, you generally get lower prices than what you get at the spot. Also, it will help you to cut down on the queue time.

Fantastic if you can cope with cable cars. The views from the top are magnificent and well worth the terror of riding on a cable car if you are so inclined.It is weather dependent and you need to get there early to beat the crowds.

Horrible system!. After waiting for four days for the Table top to be clear, we finally bought our tickets online, and arrived at Table Top to stand in line. After about an hour and a half, and not having got too far in the queue, we realized that those who arrived without a ticket, were being taken to the ticket counter, and then put in at the front of the line, whilst we were kept waiting, with just a few of us at a time progressing for the final queue to the cable car. Very disappointed with the situation, although when we finally made the top after two hours, the view was quite impressive. Restaurant was reasonably well organized, and they have a well supplied gift shop.

Great views. While hiking up/down the hill would be excellent exercise, the views from the cablecar are wonderful. It holds lots of people but rotates as it's moving so everyone gets a view of each aspect. To avoid the queues, buy your ticket from the driver on the Red Open Top Bus. Sadly the cablecar closes on windy days.

Incredible Views. Do not miss if you are in decent shape. Definitely worth a visit. But during the spring it can be very windy and they can shut down the Cableway at a moments notice which would mean you have to walk down. The day we went it was windy and so we climbed up and down. Each way takes about an hour. But be warned, it is not a light stroll. One needs to be in decent shape. Definitely not for people not in shape or with health risks. The views from the top are spectacular! Oh yes and it is noticeably colder on top.

Well organized, must do with good weather!. At the beginning of our day allong the Cape peninsula we first stopped her at Tablemountain because of good weather (the dat after it would be cloudy and rainy)Altough we first had to buy our tickets the line wasn't that big so it rather went smooth and swift.The cablecars itself are big, so lots of people can go up out once.Nice feature is the rotating floor, so everybody had nice views.the views from on top table mountain are offcourse also great!

Great experince. A great ride up to the top of Table Mountain, very smooth ride in a cable car that rotates as you go up or down. We booked our tickets on line before we went to South Africa as some reports said there were long queues but when we went in September mid morning there were no queues. Parking may be a problem in high season so be prepared for a bit of a walk up hill. And watch the weather forecast as well as low cloud will ruin your view.

Full Cape Town View. Amazing walk up....remember your bottle of water!! Great way to come down!!! Amazing views, brilliant day out. Check the weather before you go....it might be too windy or when you get up there you might end up in a pile of white cloud.
A long line that's worth the wait. One of the must places to go to in Cape Town. The views are spectacular when the weather is nice, plenty of trails short and long. It's a must.

A 5-STAR WONDER-WATCH EAGLES SOAR-..BEST OF BEST!!!!!!!!!. Forget their beaches...Forget their medicore food..Forget the haggling vendors looking for handouts...This is the 7th wonder....At the top of the mountain..it takes your breath away..Watch Eagles soars-SPECTACULAR PICTURES..The cabecar is exciting and enticing...Wonderful and fulfilling experience...

A View that Can't be Beat!. What a fun ride up the mountain in the cable car as you look down upon several younger folks hiking up to Table Mountain. Go in the early morning before the fog rolls in. We got there at 8:20am and a line had already formed for the 9am opening. Each car can take up to 65 people. In an hour they can service 800 people. We had an hour on top but you could spend more time taking photos or even just relaxing a bit looking down at the coast and the two oceans where they come together. (Atlantic-Indian)
Revolving cable car. Loved that the cable car revolved so everyone got good views up and down the mountain. Efficient service. Get there early and avoid the crowds.

Fantastic views, worth the wait. We had to wait a few days to finally get up table mountain as the cable way was closed due to strong winds. But thankfully on our last day in Cape Town it was open and well worth the visit! Views are spectacular and kids really enjoyed it. Just make sure you have enough time, the wait to get up and down can get a bit long. It also took us longer than anticipated to get through the traffic trying to leave with all the cars still coming in looking for parking.Oh and wear comfortable shoes!
awesome experience. Excellent view from the top. We went early so we did not have to wait in the line for long. The restaurant on top of the moutain serves good food and beer.

What a View!!. Thankfully we had a lovely day to experience this smooth ride to the top of Table Mountain with its gorgeous views over the city and across to Robben Island. I was amazed at the flora and fauna that existed on top of this wonder of nature.

Very slow line.... We waited almost 2 hours in line! It was very ineffective...Unfortunately, this is the only way up... (going by foot is not really an option, unless you're crazy)But the view is worth it..

Brilliant assent. Can get busy but buying advance tickets not always the best as cable cars do not operate in poor weather conditions.Efficient pay and Q for next cable car. Only takes two minutes to reach the top. Car revolves so it does not matter where you stand you get to see all vistas.

Great view of the city and Robben Island from above.. Really worth doing for the view fromthe top, the inside of the cable car turns around when its moving so that people on the outside get a different view.

Got there on a good day, the second day. When the weather cooperates, this is a thrilling ride with spectacular views; too often it is cloud covered. The crest offers views almost to Anarctica (just kidding), but does show the Cape of Good Hope to the South and north to Robben Island, home to Nelson Mandela for too many years.

Buy tickets in advance!. We arrived, with tickets, at 1010. Got on the cable car at 1130. If you didn't have tickets, it would have been at least another hour in line. When we came down a little after 1400, there was still a long line to buy tickets but almost no line to get in with tickets. Our experience on a beautiful Tues when the cable car hadnt been closed for several days. Ride up with the car very slowly rotating 360 degrees was beautiful. Couple of windows were open in front and back so nice breeze and not too hot in the cable car. Almost no wait to get down.

A must do in Cape Town. Fantastic views from the top of Table Mountain, be sure to visit on a clear day as the cable car can close due to wind or bad weather consult ions. Reasonably priced and lovely cafe at the top for a warm drink on those winter days. I don't particularly like heist and felt safe and at ease in the cable car.A must if visiting Cape Town.

Revolving view was big fun. The cableway was nothing short of ingenious. Capable staff helped to maximize the experience by meticulously attending to crowd control and advising us how to be safe. The revolving car delighted passengers from around the world.

A must..... When in CapeTown you must do Cable Mountain.Weather permitting the cable car takes you up, it holds 65 people at a time and it has 360 degree view on way to top. If weather is windy, it will not run, it is a very smooth and quick trip

Do not miss when in Capetown. Take the double decker red bus. Buy ticket before hand. Go early on a good clear weather day. It is frequently closed due to high winds, cloud cover or fogged in. Over 2.5 hour wait but well worth it. Do not drive there as no parking. Even locals take the Red Bus

Must do if you're in Cape Town. After a short ride on the Gondola, you arrive at the top of the mountain to some unforgettable views. It must be said that the views from the top of Table Mountain are stunning!!! ...On a clear day you can see Robben Island on one side and the Cape of Good Hope on the other.There are plenty of walking trails to explore and the lots of places to stop and take amazing photos. Food and souvenirs are also available for sale on the mountain. This is a must do activity for all visitors of Cape Town.

Awesome Ride, both Up and Down to Table Mountain. The cable car is quite large and allows everyone a view when entering. No need to struggle for a "good side" as the car rotates slowly around during the time it makes its way up or down, allowing everyone an opportunity to view the incredible sights.

Spectacular views from Table Mountain. We had a perfect clear sunny day for our visit and spent an hour and a half walking around. There are many lookout points offering amazing views in all directions. The cable car ride itself doesn't last that long but it's fun and the car rotates as it moves. The queues can be quite long even if you have prepurchased your ticket, I would recommend getting there as early as you can to avoid waiting too long. It can get very windy in CapeTown so we visited in the morning. Hop on hop off bus also stops here.

Put it on your Bucket List. The ride up and down in the cable car is an experience in itself. The view starts immediately and the cable car rotates so you get to see all the different angles. The view from the top is breathtaking. We've been during the day and at sunset - which is too magnificent to describe. A small tip - buy your tickets online as the queue is much shorter to get onto cable car .... Because on any given day with beautiful weather, the waiting times are long !
Amazing views. feel on top of the world, fantastic views of Cape Town, lovely clean and well preserved. Does get chilly up there so dress appropriately. Well worth a visit.
Great views. Try to get on first so you can be on the outside to look out. Get there early. At 10 am we queued for 2 hours.

Probably South Africa's most popular tourist attraction. A ride in the cable car to the top of the mountain, or just back down if you've hiked up, is a "must do" when in Cape Town.It's efficiently operated, affords great views, and although not cheap is well worth the expense.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning - but be warned, it is freezing! Even if it is a sunny day, wear trousers and take a warm jumper! Staff are friendly and very efficient with the large number of visitors!
On top of the Mountain. Spectacular views of Cape Town. Exciting ride up the vehicular as well as hiking trails up to the top of table mountain. A must, weather permitting, when you are in Cape Town.
great view. Beautiful view of Cape Town from up top, a well preserved and clean place, a little expensive but beautiful nonetheless

An aerial view of The Mother City. Athough I am an Capetonian an a HUGH ambassador for this BEAUTIFUL city of ours, I have to constantly remind myself just HOW beautiful Cape Town is by going up Table Mountain occasionally. Being one of the New Seven Wonders Of the World, she just NEVER dissapoinys. This is one of THE most spectacular views of Cape Town, so please make sure you have a camera around your neck when you visit this amazing Table Mountain
Very good service and amazing at the top!. Nice Cableway to the top of Table Moutain. With glassbotom and with a lot of people what get up.....

Beware of the table cloth that can cover the mountain quickly. Very popular and busy...be prepare to wait in queues. Buy your tickets in advance. If you can climb to the top and come down with the cable car...
Bit windy and rocking but did the job.... Its a must as too far to walk up really in my opinion if your trying to pack in other things in Cape Town

Amazing. An amazing view awaits you as you ascend to the top of Table Mountain. The floor of the gondola cars rotate 360 degrees as you ascent/decent. A MUST DO when you are in Cape Town. Do it when there is little wind and clear visibility

Amazing site with beautiful views! One of my bucket lists!. It was on my bucket list to see this wonder and it didn't disappoint. One thing to be aware of is that the cable cars can stop running without much notice due to either high winds or low cloud cover so if you plan to go, a) call ahead to see if the cars are running and b) have a back-up day to go if your schedule permits in case when you plan to go, you can't get up.

Unique to South Africa, Cape Town's Table Mountain is an experience not to be missed!!!. With tickets obtained through the internet, we were sure to miss the queue that made us turned back with our last peak season visit. The excitement after stepping into that cable car was tangible. The rotating floor is a stroke of engineering genius as everyone aboard can experience a 360 degree of the view as we make our way up the mountain. There is a feeling of disappointment as we realised the “tablecloth” might spoil it for us. But as time passed the sun triumphed, revealing the jaw dropping view of the city of Cape Town.

Spectacular!. The Table Mountain cable car is definitely a must do when you visit. it gives you a 360 degree view of the mountain, city and surroundings and its only 5 minutes. when arriving at the top there's a variety of things and a little of everything for everybody for example: fauna and flora, animal life, history, bird life, spectacular views, activities for kids and its also disabled friendly! there's also a lunch spot, restaurant, rest rooms and a curio shop :) extremely convenient for everybody whether you alone, in a group or spending the day with your family!
Don't be scared!. i am scared of heights but so pleased i did it - amazing view of Cape Town and around. Amazing how quickly the weather can change up there so be prepared for anything!

A MUST. Every time I visit Cape Town my trip is not completed without a visit up to Table Mountain with the amazing cable car ride and the views from the top. A must see for all visitors to South Africa.
Do not miss this if you are in Cape Town on a clear day. We lucked out and got clear weather to take the cableway up to the top of Table Mountain WOW and AWESOME

A Must See. Even for acrophobiacs, when in CapeTown, this is a must. Be flexible, as the "tablecloth" can be stubborn, so when it clears, be ready to go. Buy a ticket ahead of time; they are good for one week Take a guide. There is too much to see and understand to do it on your own. Go early to beat the crowd. The gift shop at the top is not worth exploring.Count on two hours total.
Table Top. The ultimate in beauty and wonder. Standing atop Table Mountain gives you a full view of Gods amazing creations. Nature at its best.
Views from the top of the Table.. Get there early. The crowd builds up quickly. Some magnificent views from the top. There are guided tiurs which might be worthwhile doing.
Great way to see Table Mountain. Wonderful way to a scene Table Mountain. The floor of the car rotates 360 degrees which makes for great panoramic views. It shouldn't be missed!

Fantastic 360 views!. Well worth the time-and it doesn't take too much as the cable car is easy to access. The views are all around from Table Mountain. The cable car is quick and feels safe. We had a lovely sunny day. they shut it down in the wind. Would not be good on a foggy day.
Do not miss. Do not miss an opportunity to go up. Go when you can because the weather and Wind can cause it to shut down quickly. The views are spectacular and the mountain is beautiful .

Interesting Experience!!. Long wait in line for tickets if not booked online. Too many people squashed in one cable car to really enjoy the views. Spent most of the time being pushed and shoved under someone's arm pit and trying to keep my balance for most of the journey down. The operator was very happy and sang a song which was nice & it made the arm pits more bareable! If it were not so crowded I think I would have enjoyed it. Before you board the cable car, they take a photo of you & try sell it to you on the way out through the shop. We couldn't find our photo though!? The gift shop is very small and doesn't have much.

On top of the world. My umpteenth trip up the mountain... a must do every time I visit the Mother City.Arrive early on weekends and the holiday season as parking is a problem and lengthy walks to the cable station as well as lengthy waiting times in the hot sun are normal during the day.If there is a strong wind blowing or if the mountain is covered with a thick blanket of cloud the cableway is likely to be closed
Perfect way to spend a day. Just a fun thing to do.....beautiful scenery and we had lunch and the food was pretty good....wish I was back there right now!!!

See Cape Town from the top of the world. A trip to the top of Table Mountain is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. A tip is to go up at the first opportunity because the cable car does not run if its too windy. And if the top of the mountain is covered with cloud you will see nothing.So at the first chance get to the top.The views are magnificent and you can get food and drink at the top. The cable car rotates on the way up and down. The one negative is the price to go up. I think its far too expensive, especially for South Africans.

One not to miss. We manage to be very lucky to have the perfect day to go to the top of this mountain, the day was sunny and clear. We had to queue almost 2 hours but thought it would be worth it and it certainly was. The cable car is smooth and only takes a few minutes to reach the top.And what an amazing view over Cape Town.There is an excellent cafe at the top and a small gift shop.Keep a check on the weather and if it's a clear day forget what else you had planned,go to the top of this mountain you will not be disappointed.
Must see!. I never get tired of the view from the mountain. Cape Town is a beautiful city and what better way to view it.

Gives you more time to explore the top. We took the lazy option of a cable car up and down. There was a wait of about an hour to get on, even though we had booked tickets in advance. There are two lines, one for the ticketless and one for pre-booked. Both seemed to move at the same speed and the people who didn't have tickets simply went to the front of the queue after purchasing - so advice to pre-book seemed pointless. It's a nice ride up and down with the cable car rotating in mid air so everyone gets the chance of enjoying the views. We parked at the bottom in the free car park and got the shuttle bus up. They run every 20 mins when we were there late September.

Circumferential scenic mountain viewing. Weather permitting ,a compulsory trip up to the top of Table Mountain by a revolving cable car will induce indelible visual and visceral memories of the flora , fauna and scenic beauty of the Cape Peninsula . If time permits, safe tracks provide trampers with an intimate access to different areas of the iconic mountain and it's ecological treasures.

Loved the cable car n Cape Town. Cape Town is amazing. Very nice especially around Camp Bay where we stayed. Beaches lovely but cold even in Dec but lots of cafes n restaurants near the beach. Table Mt is a must see. The views are fabulous. Better than I expected with a lovely walk at the top. Lots of tourists but manageable. No queues. Also go to the Cape of Good Hope to the tip of Sth Africa. Windy but terrific. On the way back u can visit the Penguins out natural like. Millions of them n they r so cute enjoy the place it's lovely
Top of the Mountain!. 1. The cable car is modern; and you get a 360 degree view of the City and Peninsula.2.Get there early as there always queues3 A must for any visitor.

To the Top of the Mountain. This was good value for money, well organised, the queue moved quite quickly. You can purchase your tickets there but we purchased them on line the morning before we went just to save time and it was beneficial. The day before the queue had been a 2 hr wait so we got there early (8.15am) and maybe waited 15 mins. The view at the top was spectacular and 360'. Make sure you take warm clothes as it was quite cold at the top. Binoculars & cameras a necessity and leave at least an hour to enjoy it once you are there or longer. Some lovely walks you can do as well.

A view from the heavens. the organisation of the cable car operation is superb waiting is minimal. it is clean friendly to children and the handicaped. A big effort has been made to ensure one can see the magnificent views easily and safely.

Our recent visit to Capetown. We had a wonderful visit to Cape Town and enjoyed the Table Mountain experience.Lovely going up on the cablecar and once up enjoyed the magnificient views over a nice lunch. Walking around the top was an experience with the animal life and birds.Would recommend.

A Cape Town Must Do. Don't miss a chance to do this, it does not take long and it's well worth the time. Also plan to eat lunch at the top, food is good and not expensive. There is a nice restaurant and shop at the top. View is spectacular.

Good way to get to the top. We had no issues with the cableway and as we did not want to hike up the mountain, we were lucky that the weather cooperated and allowed the cableway to run! The rotating floor was nice, as it allowed you to see everything on the way up.

Awesome. An amazing experience for everyone. A revolving cable car gives spectacular views or coast and mountain flora as it revolves slowly while climbing to the top of the mountain. Well worth a visit but if possible either pre book your ride or check how busy it is as waits can be very long. Parking too so rather a problem but all said the experience is worth the hassle. Cor get to keep a look out for the delightful Dassies, correctly called Hyrax and strangely a close relative of the elephant. Flora is abundant and interesting as is the bird life. Views have to be seen to be believed

Sundowner to remember!!!!!!. We accompanied our friends from France on a Sunset trip with Cable Car to top of Table Mountain. What a stunning experience!!!! The views from different parts on top of the mountain.....yes walk around and see for yourself. We've packed a Cheese and wine snack picnic basket and enjoyed the worlds best Sunset with our overseas friends!!!!! Arrive early at the entrance even if you've booked tickets elsewhere, so that you can be on the top before sunset.

A must do in Cape Town!. What a rush! From the cable car ride to the views from the top this place is breathtakingly beautiful! There were moments that we were surrounded by clouds and you could bearly see in front of you which was awesome. Tour guide was very knowledgable and funny. A must for anyone visiting Cape Town!

Book in advance. Great views wherever you stand as the car revolves as it climbs. Buying the tickets in advance saves you a lot of queuing as you have priority. Tickets can be purchased online or at the pick and pay supermarket in the waterfront. The tickets are valid for several days.

Good views. Having been in table mountain over three times now, the novelty has worn out. Nevertheless, the views (as expected) are stunning but comes at a high price (R225 per adult).We were planning on spending lunch time on the mountain, but having walked into the overpriced, very stuffed shop, we decided otherwise and returned to ground instead for a sandwich and bottle of water. I'd put aside an hour to enjoy the views. During peak season, the queues are very very long and waiting time may reach 2 to 3 hours. Also, you may have to park down the mountain and walk up so I would rather get a cab to the top to avoid parking hassles. A sunhat and shades are a must (especially if you going to be waiting in the queue).

Quick trip to the top. If you're short of time, meaning less than a day, to explore Table Mountain, then taking this cable car is your best bet. Yes you're paying more but it leaves you with more time and opportunity to explore the summit.

Once in a lifetime experience.. Do not miss the opportunity on a clear day to visit table mountain. Cheap for waht it is. Go early, and gte in the queue, don't be deterred they go fast enough. Bring plenty of sunblock (no point not going on a hot clear day). Once in a lifetime experience.
The best of Cape town . This is really an excursion to put on your travelling 'to do' list. There is no view like you see when you reach the top. A must - see view for any tourist and south african!
Nice. Really big carts. Great views. The platform rotates so you see it from all angles. Takes about 4 minutes to ascend.

Fantastic views. Over the last 8 years, I have been to the Cable car four times and never get tired of the place. The views from the top are always different due to the time of the year and the weather conditions on the day. Sometimes it can be blustery and it can get chilly at the top, so always keep a pull over handy. The cable car rotates, giving you 360 degree view of the mountain and Cape Town, thereby affording marvelous opportunity for great photography. Be adventurous and take a walk along the paved walkways to make the most of the scenery. Rather than reaching there and being disappointed, always ring first to check if the cable car is running because it does not operate in high winds and rain. There is a restaurant at the top for usual fast food. I must admit I have not used itr except for a drink.
an Amazing and relaxing natural wonder. Scurry and exciting at the same time. that's fun i guess. the view of Cape Town is awesome from the Ariel of the mountain.
Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Take the ride...you will like this, The car is turning around so you will have beautiful view over Capetown
Fairest Cape. Liked the food , delicious even though a bit over priced , Should make it affordable for South Africans as they are charging tourist prices.
A must do while in Cape Town. Brilliant trip on the cable car which revolves whilst ascending To Table Mountain. The views on the way up are superb
Must see in Cape Town. Must see of every person visiting Cape Town. Just do not go first thing in the morning, rather go in the afternoon as then the entry line is short.

The Table View. A gorgeous view from table mountain. Take a good camera for a nice selection of scenic pictures. There is an option of cables or hike to & fro Table mountain. It is always busy, so choose to go in the morning which will give you enough time to relax and enjoy the breath taking view.

book before you go!. If you book you will go straight through into the cable car otherwise its a huge wait usually.The cable car has a revolving floor so you get 180 degree visuals which are truly amazing!. Not sure about the hype over this attraction as have been to similar places elsewhere but hey if in Cape Town its worth the effort. Take a sweater with you it can be chilly at the top.

Beautiful. Stunning views of capetown from atop Table Mountain and the gondola to get you up there was perfect! I suggest purchasing your tickets online prior to going to Table mountain as the que can be quite long so we were able to jump to the front of the line! Bring a sweater as it can be quite cool and very windy up too but worth it for the stunning views :)

Amazing Views. You can truly catch amazing views of Cape Town and the mountain. The views are breathtaking, always keep your camera as the cable car rotates giving you a 360 degree view of all surroundings areas, must visit.

Great when it's running. At the fourth attempt, we made it and it was well worth it. The views on the way up and when you get there are stunning. It's not only the views of the city of Cape Town, make sure you walk over to look at the back view as well. It is not so urban but is equally terrific.Note that the cable car does not run when the wind is strong, which in Cape Town is frequently., So if there is a day when the car is running seize the opportunity because it may not be running the next day, or even later the same day.Table mountain is one of the best views in the world. Don't miss the view from the top if you have the opportunity.

Amazing views!. Great way to see all of cape town. Buying tickets online is very easy and means you don't have to wit in ticket lines. The Cable car is a great experience as the floor rotates so you are able to see the view from all angles. The day we went up the queues to come back down were very long which meant that the cable cars were still running past 7pm. My advice would be to take the first opportunity you can to go up. Don't wait for another day if its good conditions because they often close the the cable car in windy conditions.

A Cape-town MUST-DO. If you travel at all, there will always be attractions. But this one is unique. My party chose to visit around dinner time so we could be on the table top for sunset. We chose wisely. It is popular, so plan ahead. We made reservations in advance. We stayed up on the top and explored for about 2 hours. We even had friends in the states see us in real-time on the live cam pointed at the Queue line.

A bit of a surprise!. OK, you can walk up and down Table Mountain but if pushed for time, the cable car is the best way to access it. So, it is a cable car that gets you up to the top and down again but this one has a bit of a twist i.e. the floor rotates which increases the opportunity to see the whole of the vista spread below you which is a fantastic sight.We understand that it is one of only two worldwide that have a revolving floor so that in itself is a good reason to at least do a one way ride!Tip! Buy your ticket on line to avoid having to queue on site to purchase.

Great way to check out Table Mountain. Very well run. The ride was easy, fun and the lines were moving very quickly. If you're not up for hiking this is a wonderful way to see Cape Town from a different perspective. But if it's cloudy, don't bother. Make sure you check the weather before heading up there.
Stunning views of Cape Town. Excellent views from the cable car, but long queues in a fine day, ensure you get your tickets in advance.

Impressive View / Excellent infrastructure and services. Table mountain truly deserves to be listed as one of the 7 nature's world marvels, the view from the top is amazing, the Aerial Cableway is a piece of engineering art, it is big, fast and rotates while you are traveling up, which enhance your visit since the very beginning.A good tip for future travelers: You can buy your tickets on-line, it will save you around 40 minutes of waiting line, the best thing is that you can buy them previously or on-site. They have a free wi fi at the base of the station, so you can get there and buy your tickets from your phone, skipping the line.

Great cablecar, but check queue times.. Very efficient way of getting to the top of Table Mountain. Easily accessible from Cape Town using Hop-on, Hop-off bus or by taxi. For the taxi, try to negotiate a fixed price - we paid 120 rand back to Green Point which we thought very reasonable for 2 people. Check that the cable car is running before going to the cableway station and avoid busy times. We went up at around 4.45pm and there was no queue. At mid-day we were told that the queue was 2.5 hours !
good. a great experience but that was it really - we were lucky with the weather as seeing table Mountain can be hit or miss.

Life line of Travellers visiting Table Mountain. If you have time, you can try trekking to the top of Table Mountain (You need to be a Professional). If you are a Mountaineer, you can try and climb the steep rocks of Table Mountain and try and reach the Top. But if you are none of the above, your only option to go up the Table Mountain is Aerial Cableway. Its well managed - no chaos - regular update on weather condition - waiting period could be directly proportionate to weather condition. It doesn't take more than 10 minutes to reach the top of Table Mountain and its a good experience using the Cableway.
Amazing views . This was a great way to see Table mountain. The whole car rotates so you get to see every angle going up and down.

A must-see but be sure to get there EARLY!. Our first attempt to ride the cable cars to the top of the mountain was foiled by bad weather; cars not running. The next day was gorgeous and the ride to the top for breathtaking views was well worth the wait! One caution: GO EARLY!! Aim to get there just before opening to avoid what can be a very long wait and crowded experience, plus difficult parking. We went early enough to beat the hordes of tour buses and were very glad that we did. This is a don't miss experience for your visit to Capetown.
Rotating view. Excellent view. Inside rotates so doesn't matter if people run in trying to get a particular view as you get to see the whole view on the way up.

Be prepared to queue or book in advance (a shorter queue). A great experience that is totally dependent on the weather. Clouds plus winds, unfortunately. Still, it is certainly worth the wait and don't worry where you are in the cable car as it rotates so everyone gets to see the view - just get your camera on quickly!

The easy way to get to the top!. I don't ever try and kid people I am a keep fit fanatic and therefore the cable car is the only option to get to the summit! My husband has a problem with heights, but had no problem with this trip. You need to check the cable car is running before turning up at the base station and queues can be very long...luckily we were taken to the front!

Table mountain is the diamond of cape town . Since it is the diamond so i advice every tourist to visit this giant mountain, awesome view, 360 degree cable cabinet so everybody inside it can have a nice view and photo, do not suffer from long queue it will go very fast even if there is a children school visit, you can enjoy your meal and soft drink in real as well, in addition you can enjoy the abseiling with a professional group but it might need to book in advance ..don't miss it please
The best view in town. Every time you feel like a kid going up in the cable car. Always fun! Amazing views over Cape Town and the staff are very friendly.

Iconic attraction.. Well worth the ride , we went as part of a group so the tickets were pre paid. If your scared of heights just close your eyes the ride is smooth and the views from the top are fantastic, a must do on the "bucket list". There is a restaurant at the top as well as a gift shop.
Beautiful views . Was great. They handled our big group with ease. Very clean and neat. Will come back again. Buy your tickets online and save yourself a lot of time.
Outstanding. Well worth it. If it's a clear day, buy your ticket online or in town to beat the hour plus queues and get up Table Mountain in 4 minutes flat. Breathtaking views.

Prepare for crowds if cableway is closed the previous day.. Definitely a must-do if possible. Views are stunning, ride is fun with cable car turning 360° so everyone has a great view. Paths on top are great. We arrived a little after 8 am on a day after a high-wind closure. The line was very long, but moved quickly. We were on top of the mtn by 9 am (cableway opens at 8:30 am). Food and drinks available on top of mtn. Friendly and efficient staff but line-cutters are notorious.
A must do. Just find a day with nice weather and go for it...a wonderful place on earth and will never be forgotten...a view to die for..good food also..book in advance by your hotel and save time...

Easy and quick way to access the mountain! Beautiful views!. The traveller has two options: take several hours and hike the path up the side of table mountain or take the cable care to the top and walk around the extensive flat top. The cable car is a quick and easy way to access the top and see some beautiful views of Cape Town. Remember: in case of high winds or sudden impending storms and the cable car is closed for safety reasons--which do happen--you may have to walk down the path.

Simply not to be missed. OK - so everybody does this when in Cape Town - who cares? It is beautiful! The trip up is great, the views stunning (DO mind the weather though) and as others have commented - a short walk allows you to look down the back of Table Mountain... Views up and down the coast are stunning.... Go on - you know you want to.

Absolutely must do when in Cape Town . This is an absolute must do when in Cape Town or surroundings. Take a clear day and the views are perfect from cable way and mountain top. Check internet for opening as by strong winds the cable way is closed.
Great views. Table Mountain is stunning and so are the views from the top! The cable cars are a great way to get to the top. They revolve so you get a 360 degree view on the way

Disgraceful display of organization. People cutting lines, no control, people without tickets getting to top before people with tickets. Obviously beautiful must do, but truly a poor representation for a country seeking to display their position on the global stage. Tip - do not pre-purchase tickets. Just purchase them there. We arrived at open with tickets and people without tickets got up 45 minutes before us.

They all tell you go for a reason. We went somewhat out of obligation - you have to do it. I was thinking it was just for the view of the city, but no. The view on the other side of the mountain is really worth the fee and the ride. A must do if the weather is good.

The world at your feet. I was lucky and had good weather, reaching the top, stunning view and pictures now framed and hanging on the wall. Chose a day with guaranteed good weather or your be disappointed, windy no go and if the clouds come in you won't be able to see a thing.

Beautiful, Revolving Cable Car Ride, Great Views. Plan wisely. Strong winds (very common) can delay or stop you in your tracks for a ride to the top. The ride up is fun. The top of the mountain is well developed with pathways, points of interest and vista points. Table Mountain recently became a 'Natural Wonder of the World', A must see when in Cape Town.

Well worth the trip - especially if tight for time (or tired of leg). The cable car itself is nice, speedy and the rotation is cool so you get to see the full view without jostling for space.Use the mobile site to check if it is open (or simply look to see if the cars are moving from most places in the city) to avoid disappointment of getting to the lower station (although there are lovely views from there or you can hike. The strong winds occasionally close the cableway and the site is kept is up to date. Staff are efficient - they could drop the lame green screen photos though.The main event is getting to the top of the mountain which is incredible and worth an explore via the paths or skipping across the rocks - really beautiful and great for adventurous kids.

Stunning view!. I always say it, explore the Table Mountain taking the cable car up, is just amazing and unforgettable! CPT is by so far the best tour of my life, the views from up there are spectacular for your eyes! Must see it, you can't miss it!
Great cable car experience. really special in that as you travel up the cable car, the car rotates 360 degrees so that you can see the full view.
the view. an absolute must when visiting Cape Town, best views ever and a lovely place to have a wander around.

Beautiful views!. Went with my brother, his wife and boy from Australia. Stunning views, but the qeues are way too long! Definitely worth the money, but I will not go again.
