We went on a Monday of long weekend, and the parking situation is also ridiculous. Your car overheats looking for parking up and down the road. Also the busses make it very difficult to navigate the narrow road.

The views from the top!. This is a must for every tourist or local wanting to experience the true beauty and sceneries Cape TOwn has to offer. Book and pay for your tickets online to avoid the queues and be sure to wear comfortable shoes - there is a lot of trails and space to walk around on the mountain. Pack your hat, camera and enjoy the outing. The restaurant on the mountain sells decent lunches in a buffet format - a bit pricy but worth enjoying with the stunning views. Check the weather before you go since the might close it due to wind / bad weather.
This is a must on you rlist of things to do. For me I was happy to get to the visitor center because the panoramic views of Cape Town to the ocean from the point were amazing.
You have to go up the Cable car.. a great visit on a clear day. Excellent views of the entire bay, city bowl and Camps bay. Restaurant service is poor and food is limited.

If the Weather is Good, Go Right Away. The view from the Mountain Top is spectacular as well as the unique characteristics of it. Illustrative plaques provide interesting information. Even on a nice day it can be quite windy and cold at the top. If the weather is bad the cable car does not operate, so go when the weather is nice and don't wait. You can walk to the top, but it is very steep and the steps are uneven.
Sightyseeing holiday. Excellent cheap conveyance to the top of Table Mountain. Cost 225 Rand about £10.Only a 5 minute journey to the top of the mountain

Nice rotating floor giving 360 degree view. The cable ride is a great experience! In season one will have to wait for turn, long que. However it is worth the wait. This is the only way to reach the top of the Table Land.

Unique style cable car.. Its a unique rotating cable cars that bring you to the roof of the table mountains. Book your ticket online to avoid the traffic, and call before starting your trip since its a weather sensitive activity. They have a wheelchair facility and the staff are friendly and helpful.

One of the best view ever in your life. Table Mountain is something I do have the prefiledge of seeing everday but everytime I go up the view is just something else. All the amentities is weel maintain and the breakfast at the top was great. Just the coffee cups were a bit small - haha. Enjoy this great wonder of the world!!

Gateway to the best views in South Africa. The cableway is quite efficient, and for the number of people lining up we got through relatively quickly.I recommend booking in advance to avoid extensive waiting times and get there early before the tourists come out of the woodwork.
Well worth the trip even if you don't have a head for heights!. A revolving cable car allows everyone a beautiful view of the trip up/down the mountain. It's worth the vertigo!

Easy way up and down. You can hike your way up and down table mountain, which I recommend. However, if you can't or do not have the time, the Cableway is quick and effective, even though it costs a bit too much in my opinion. I used it only on the way down, and it probably saved me an hour of hiking back down.

Aerial views to die for. using this to come down was amazing . the kids were blown away .. we took the long way round to get to the top .. once up ... had amazing views from the top and using the Cable way to get down was a real treat for the kids

The easy and nice way beautiful Table Mountain.. We were fortunate to go on Table mountain and experience the nice ride with a wonderful view. The cable car does not operate, when it is windy. It is nice to purchase the tickets in advance to avoid the lines. The cable car floor rotates, so everyone gets 360' view. Though there is not proper information about this rotation before hand, so people Were confused and could not let go of the holding bar, which had lead to some pushing and discomfort.

A must-do in Cape Town. The cable car ride up to Table Mountain is a definite must-do in Cape Town. A little pricey at R220 per person, it is still worth it. The ride up takes just a few minutes, but the views on reaching the top are sensational. Give yourself at least 2 hours on the top to enjoy the stunning views. Great little cafe also on top.
Fun. It's the tourist thing to do! If you get to see the clouds (tablecloth) on the mountain from below, you want to go up the mountain. The view of CapeTow is beautiful from on the mountain!

Just do it!. I'm not the biggest find of heights.. so a Cableway has also never been high on my to-do list, but after my 10th visit to Cape Town on a clear blue-sky day we decided it was time to overcome that fear and hop on.. Funny enough once inside I clearly wasn't the only one who doesn't like heights. The ride is smooth, the view is amazing and once you're up there its totally worth it!
Very beautiful. The view from over there is very very beatiful and also the promanades. A place where to go....!!!. Sunset from there is fantastic.

scary. I so loved table mountain , I actually went there 3 times, It was good weather and the view was incredible. Well organised but up very high, I don't like heights but it was so worth it for the amazing scenery

A great experience in Cape Town!. The Table Mountain cableway is a great way to visit the mountaintop and get spectacular views of the city. If it's a nice, clear day, head to the mountain immediately!

Great morning out. Beating the clouds and wind was a bit tough with closures the day before but we made it up and had a great few hours exploring. Cable car ride up was a treat in itself. Amazing views and interesting for all ages. Great pathways so everyone can explore. Big cafe with good foods and drink available.
Cable car ride. The wait to ride the cable car was a little long but well worth it. Views going up and on Table Mountain were spectacular. Lots of trails to walk. Water was very inexpensive.
Speedy. That ride went far faster than expected. Totally beats climbing up if you are pressed for time! The view is great, but if you don't like heights, just close your eyes!
Table Mountain . Such lovely views. Stunning. Definitely a must. The cable car turns as it goes up and down so everyone gets a view. Brilliant for sunset views too.
Good way to get around. The floor moves around so you will get that all-important shot if the weather allows. Great views and very speedy if unusually expensive by SA standards.

Nice view. The ride to the top of Table Mountain is a must while visiting Cape Town. The views from the top are amazing. The rides do shut down when it is windy.Hard to tell when it will be windy at the top of the mountain
Efficient . Queue was reasonable in the afternoon. Website gives good information. All well organised and efficient.

Must do when in Cape Town. Don't miss this as the views are amazing and good walking when you are up there.It is possible to walk as well if you are feeling fit.Table Mountain is a world heritage site and the area up the top is lovely
Quick clean and does what it says on the tin. Great experience, though I believe at high season can get very busy, if the queue signs outside are anything to go by.

Swinging on top of the world. This is now one of the new 5 modern wonders of the world, and the views from up there were to be enjoyed and respected. It's not far from downtown Cape Town and easy to find. so glad we went.

A highlight of any visit to Cape Town. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a visit to the top of Table Mountain. Although the cable way is not exactly cheap, those who are fit can reduce costs by walking up the mountain :) Otherwise the cable way is a slick operation, with reduced waiting periods if you book online. The views going up and down in the cable car are just stunning, and of course the experience on the top of Table Mountain is truly worth the effort.My advice would be to bring your own food with though, as the restaurant is very overpriced unless you're traveling in dollars or euros.

Fabulous...... ...... views and the perfect way to travel to the top of Table Mountain. Obviously you need a clear day to get the full benefit so fingers crossed you get one. A very good price and very regular trips up and down.

Always magnificent views. Firstly make sure you call beforehand to check if they are open. Operations are run professionally and tour guide was very informative. Beautiful views in all angles. Worth the trip, but if you've seen it once then nothings changed.

Book online to save the queues. The best way to experience the cable way, if you are able, is to book ahead online. It can save a lot of time and inconvenience as the ticket queues can get very long. Alternatively, head up late afternoon when the cableway is quieter and watch the sunset. That can be an amazing experience. If you have to go in peak hours, please note that parking is difficult so you may have to park a long a long from the cableway. Take the the free MyCiTi shuttle service from the Lower Tafelberg Road stop, just off Kloof Nek Road, to the Upper Tafelberg Road stop at the Lower Cable station. Alternatively take the red City sightseeing bus. Check out the tablemountain cableway website. It is very helpful .www.tablemountain.net Note that the cableway closes in high wind and is frequently covered in a blanket of cloud. If you arrive and it is a perfect day, grab the opportunity to get up the mountain. The next day could be a different story.

People do walk up, but.... This is the only reasonable way for most people to get up to Table Mountain. Lines were long the day that we were there, but if you want to go up without walking for 2+ hours, this is the only way to do it. BE SURE TO BUY TICKETS IN ADVANCE OVER THE INTERNET -- this will save you a long wait in line.

Fantastic late afternoon spot.. What a fantastic late afternoon/sunset trip with the kids. They had such an amazing time from the trip up in the rotating cable car to the most amazing views from the top of the mountain. Our 5 yr old was inundated with questions about everything she saw from all sides of the mountain. Our 2 yr old enjoyed seeing the sun set. We packed a little picnic for the top as I've heard the cafe gets quite full and doesn't have a great halal offering. We did get some nice chilled drinks from there though and few souvenirs from the shop. All in all, a wonderful 2-3 hour experience for the kids and adults alike, which doesn't include and tech. And nature in all it's wonder and glory and the beautiful panaramic views of Cape Town.

Good experience, gteat staff. The Table Mountain cable car is a first world experience. It's clean, well run amd the staff are excellent. The restaurant at the top is also efficient and the food is fresh and tasty
Must do. Definitely a must do in Cape Town this takes about half a day. Try and get your tickets in advance to avoid the queues. Once at the top go for a walk

It's a cable car, not much else. While the views are splendid, the cable car in itself is no big deal. Sure, it rotates to give you an encompassing view, but if you have the time, the hike offers a much better experience. And it's free!
Up through the clouds. Although the clouds had moved in we still went up and received a wonderful sight when we broke through the cloud layer. It was absolutely beautiful.

Ingenious Innovation that allows 360 Degree Viewing on the Way Up & Down!. Unless you're a masochist or enjoy climbing mountains, this is the best way to get to the top of Table Mountain and experience its wonderful views.Our tour guide dropped as at the bottom to purchase tickets: he had a season pass which for anyone intending to pay more than one visit to the top, is excellent value. As we got there early, the purchase process was fairly quick, but the queueing facilities that were in place suggest that you can spent a lot of time in the queue for this ... get there early to avoid lengthy delays.There are two carriages, that are circular in design, which enables the most wonderful feature: the floor inside the carriage revolves and means that there really is no bad spot to view the scenery on the way up (or down). The "driver" in the carriage warns folks to release their hold on handles and step away from the windows before he activated the rotation mechanism.The trip up/down is only 2-3 minutes in length, but it really shows off the spectacular views of the Cape Town cityscape. As there are two carriages, one will come down at the same time the other ascends ... passing at the halfway point.The ride is smooth and the big windows allow plenty of photography. I've attached some snaps that I took on the way up/down, but don't worry if you aren't able to photograph anything - when you get to the top, astounding views there more than compensate (and you can easily snap away there).For anyone with a fear of heights, stand in the middle near the driver and enjoy the views from a distance ... but the great design of the carriages means that really anyone can enjoy the views.Enjoy!

A walk on Table Mountain. Did not like the long ques, but found out once there you could buy on line. But once up on the mountain it was just peace and beauty, and a view to die for if if one felt like doing a longer walk the choice was there for long or short walks

There's no question a trip to Cape Town without going up is just incomplete - end of story!. Best to buy tickets before during busy periods but you do want good weather so you have to think about this! Take some drinks and snacks with you - there is a restaurant at the top but it is pricey! I just love this outing and as a Capetonian I do it about twice a year - usually when someone is visiting :-) A TOP 5 HAVE TO for Cape Town!

Fear of heights? No problem!. Our senior group required the tram to get to the top. Quick, easy, hassle free. Gorgeous views of the bay and surrounding mountains on the way up and down. The experience was enhanced by beautiful weather. If you're afraid of heights, this is the way to go. Just turn and face the mountain as you go up and down. You can do this!

Nice ride up. I was a bit nervous when we first got on, but man this was thoroughly fantastic. I was trying to position myself to get some good pictures going up - but the whole platform revolves!!! Everyone gets a chance for great pics through the open windows. The staff is helpful and friendly - just get there early and make sure the cablecar is operational.

Great views. What a fabulous view of CapeTown and the surrounding area. Wait was about 45 minutes for the cable car up and only 5 minutes for the down return. They pack the cable cars both directions. About 45 Rand for the 2 of us. This is for a good, no clue, good weather and no wind day. If it gets too windy they close it. Our day was perfect weather. If in CapeTown and the weather co-operates, this is a must visit.
Great trip to the icon of Cape Town. Fantastic views from the top. Efficient tramway. Can spend a lot of time up there walking around. Keep an eye open for the dassies (rock rabbits!).

Rotating cable car!!!. It is not the longest cable car ride but the views are amazing. when you get to the top of table mountain. you can see all of Capetown and all the way to Robben island. Something you must do if in Capetown.
Very good serivce and value. Came down on the cableway after hiking up the mountian. Great service offered and very good value for a one way pass!! extremly enjoyable as it turns to!
Best way to the top. Easiest way to reach the top! Staff are funny and friendly. The cable car does rotate during ascent and decent which was ok.

Fantastic views at the top. A great way to see Cape Town looking down over the town and coastline and across to Robben Island. You can spend a few hours walking around on top, and if you are there for the sunset if you are lucky it is stunning. If you are only visiting for a few days don't leave this until the end as it operates subject to the wind conditions and can be closed.

Up, Up and Away. What a pleasant surprise. A normal ride was made more interesting as the car went up (and down) the interior rotated so we could have 360 degree views. Also along the way was live narration about the mountain and some statistics. NOTE: Get your tickets online in advance to avoid the potentially long queue. Parking can also be difficult.

Big Tick on the Bucket List. Our third cable car of the year and definitely the favourite. There was a wait to buy ticket on a Thursday morning , about ten minutes. There is a very strange quequing system which involves crossing the road in groups. Why they run the queue this way iI have no idea. But there is a fast lane for anyone who purchased tickets on line. I would recommend it. The ride only lasts a couple of minutes but this is one of three such cable cars in the World than revolves slowly as you go up. Although you mainly look through glass there is a section that is open so you can get great photos. It is the floor that turns, not the outside.Of course when you get to the top it us breath taking.Table Mountain has been on our bucket list for years and the experience was enhanced by the super ride up. Of course , if you were energetic, you could walk up and watch the two cars going up and down!

Naturally Man-Made Tourist Attraction. Spent a month in Africa. I believe I could live in Cape Town! Felt like a cross between the CA cities of San Diego/San Francisco & the NW cities of Vancouver/Seattle which leads me to Table Mountain. Beautiful views and worth the trip considering one likely travels around the world to get there and the city is centered around this giant table but it is definitely set up as a tourist attraction similar to our Seattle Center, Space Needle. Other than that. the views are amazing when the weather was on for the cars to run up the Mtn.and the memories are lasting.

Best way to the top. Loved the rotating floor to get a good view regardless of your location on the car. I felt very safe. the time to get to the top was reasonable and the early morning queues were reasonable.

Clear day. We had tried to go the day before but the cable car was not running due to the wind. When we arrived there were long queues and we wondered if it was even worth waiting....but they moved very fast and all staff were very friendly. The view from the top just has to be seen. You cannot describe it. We were very lucky and there was not a cloud in the sky and it was a really warm day....but that said don't forget a jacket as it is still cool at the top.

Table Mountain is a must see and experience. As it is the most convenient way to the top, do it. Views are nice but nothing you wouldn't see from the top. Trip is short but long enough because you're standing in a small rotating car. The price is the experience at the top. Go early to avoid the queues.
Maybe the best part?. Table Mountain is fabulous but your transportation up there may be the best part! Don't worry about getting a good spot, as the floor moves...turns! Too cool!

Cable guy operator was a hoot. Give the guy his own show. He's Mr. Entertainment. At the very least he deserves a rise. He had the cab in stitches with his laconic stream of consciousness. A real refreshing blast of South African humour that eased a hair raising ascent to the summit of cable mountain. Well done man!
Nice view, but a long queue to wait. You have to book tickets via internet and come early morning or in the afternoon, if you do not want to wait 1-2 hours in the queue
Cable Car. Spent a great morning here, just be sure to purchase tickets before you go as queues can be long. One can abseil from the top as well

Save yourself the agony... rather hike to the top. Unless you're have a physical disability, wheelchair bound or EXTREMELY lazy... save yourself the agony and the $$. There are much better ways to see the spectacular views and take in the beauty of Table Mountain, than doing it by cableway.The lines are long, it's overpriced, the staff are rude, the trip is too short to take in all the splendour that Table Mountain has to offer.There are many hiking routes up to the top of Table Mountain. Pack some snacks, put on your comfy clothes & hiking shoes and head to the top.Don't be silly... if you're a novice hiker... take the easy routes. i.e. via Platteklip Gorge, or call in the help of a guide who will aid you in choosing the right route "hiketablemountain.co.za"

Wonderful Experience, check the weather though.... This cable way is certainly wordclass and is run so aswell. Wonderful, without any of the usual South African hiccups A word of advise, if you see the weather is clear, GO UP IMMEDIATELY, as the weather changes rather fast. my wife and i went up when there was not a cloud in the sky and came down literally through the clouds two hours later

Pales in comparisson to the real thing And is more expensive. The top of the mountain is just great, but the impact of this cable way on the local community and your waistline is truly unimpressive. Rather spend the exorbitant fee on a tour guide to give you a genuine experience of our unique mountainous nature up close and personal ON FOOT. Suck it up and take lots of water and sunblock. Don't let anyone pressure your natural pace. Breath, look at the occasional bush or gogo and enjoy Yourself.

Romantic Engagement. If it is a cloudy day then the trip up would not be worth it because you will not be able to take in the beauty of Cape Town.If fit and looking for a little challenge then walk up the mountain and join your family and fried who aren't so fit for the trip down in the cable car.Pack a picnic basket and enjoy the sunset.

take off!. you cannot visit the city without enjoying the view from the top of table mountain! the cable car rotates 360 degrees allowing you to enjoy the view as you ascend, and its really an experience anyone will enjoy.during peak season it can be lengthy queues though and busy so pre-purchase tickets online!!
Gret service. After renovation work the cable was opened on the day my family walked up and was a blessing for their decent

Safe with fabulous views. We got on in just a short wait and as it turns a 360 degree as it rises you get to see all around you. Its really gorgeous and very high to the top which is just a short ride. Really cool.

Touristy? Yes. Worth it? Yes!. A very nice way to visit Table Mountain (if you don't want to do the all day hike). Highly recommend booking in advance to avoid the queue. Stop and take a picnic to the top and be sure to walk around and follow the trails to find your own spot. The inside of the tram rotates, so everyone will have a good view at some point. (No jostling for position!)

You have most certainly not experienced Cape Town without a trip up in the cable car. The views are spectacular from the moment one enters the cable car and it just gets better the higher one goes. It's wonderfully smooth, not too slow and revolves as one ascends or descends the mountain. It is never packed so that it is impossible to get a good view. This is a must see and do!!

Panorama View. The queue was so long at the lower station because it was the first pretty day after a few days of rain and cloud. We walked up, but we knew we wouldn't be able to walk back down. The queue at the top to go back down wasn't long at all. The special thing about this cable car is that the floor turns so that you are able to get a panorama view.

Breathtakingly Beautiful Table Mountain. This is perfect for those seeking beautiful views of Cape Town City. Go up the cable car on a clear day to avoid disappointment. Located in my home city and a must do for Cape Town tourists. Wear comfortable shoes and take a camera with!

A must when visiting Cape Town for the first time. Although it may seem touristy, this is a must do when you visit Cape Town. Go on a clear day and you can see the entire region from the top of the iconic mountain. We found the 20 minute guided tour to be informative. Don't touch any plants! We were told on the tour that at least one produces far more potent reactions than poison ivy! It was growing right by the path!
Has to be experienced. ques were bad but if you book it online you can bypass the waiting hoards. The ride is very scary but the views at the sumit are out of this world.
Great fun!. The cableway speeds you to the top in no time at all! The rotating cars ensure all inside are guaranteed spectacular views on the way up and down.

A must if visiting Cape Town. If you go to Cape Town this is definitely a must.The views on table mountain are breathtaking. I must admit the cable was a little scary going up, however the views more than make up for it. It can get very cold up there due to the altitude so remember to take a jacket or shawl.
Amazing Views. I would recommend this to any tourist that is coming to visit Cape Town.Spectacular views, amazing restaurant, curio shop for souvenirs to take back home.

Simply Majestic views. See Cape Town and surrounds from the perfect aerial view. Be prepared to have your breath taken away as you see Cape Town from way above with all its splendour just laid out for you to feast your eyes on. Safe and beautiful cable cars transport you up and down. Avoid the long queues by getting there early and don't forget to check the weather conditions to avoid disappointment if the cable cars are not operational due to inclimate weather. No visit to Cape Town is complete without it.

What A View: 1,065 ft Above Cap Town. Afford yourselves 3-4 hours if you want to walk the entire mesa or simply 30-45 minutes if you simply want to view this magical city from above and stay around the upper tram station. Well worth the price and a must-do/see in my opinion.
amazing views!. Timing is key! We did not have an issue getting on the cableway, but we have heard that people had trouble. absolutely stunning views!

Climbing is nicer. There are several routes up Table mountain. Depending on your fitness they take 30 minutes (really fast) up to 2:30 hours (really slow). The views are great and the paths are well maintained. The cable is much faster of course, but the experience is also a lot less as it is over very quick and you don't really get the nice views you get when climbing. There are information centers that offer free route information.Table mountain itself is great!

SPECTACULAR VIEWS AND SKYWAY.. We were thrilled to have a perfect sunny day with no wind and crisp clear views. A bit dismayed to find so many people waiting for the Skyway at 8:30, but luckily we had tickets (which I would recommend purchasing in advance). Queues moved quite quickly, surprisingly even for those without advance tickets. Absolutely stunning outlook from all sides at the top. Liked all the landscaping with steps, pathways, and plantings. Gift Shop was under repair, and limited things to buy in a temporary spot. The Restaurant had one entrance, then through the Restaurant area to the cashier at an exit point, and limited types of drinks, and we did not eat there.

Breathtaking. The Cableway up to the top of Table Mountain in Capetown is not to be missed. The view is spectacular. Just important to know that the lines can be very long. It is critical to buy your tickets beforehand to cut down the wait. You can buy these at your hotel or on line. There is food at the top. Don't expect other activities but viewing from all sides.

Check Website before you go!. My review is based on the fact that the cable car was closed and I bought my ticket in advance on the internet and they are yet to refund me 17 days later. There website telling the status of the cable car is not updated regularly.

Not to be missed!. Table Mountain is amazing and not to be missed. You can ride the fantastic tram to the top. The equipment looks to be in great shape and very well maintained. The car itself spins slowly so you get great views. There are a couple of little shops and places to eat at the top. There are trails that lead off fit for the fittest or just a little stroll. Be sure to pay attention to the amazing variety of plants and mosses. The views of course are stunning. Don't forget your camera! But be warned - South Africans are a stout bunch. We hiked down. We are fit and have done 20 mile hikes before. Most of the South Africans we met were very casual about it when we asked. "It's easy". "Just take a little water" they said. But it was more strenuous than expected! And we ran into more than a few tourist who bit off more then they could chew including one dude who took a tumble. I thought I was going to have to assist him off the mountain or go get help. On the top you can get really close to the edge! It's fabulous, wonderful, and unique. But hiking it is to be taken seriously. Also it can create it's own weather so if you're there pick a good day and go.
Dont lose your ticket. A little bit of a wait to get on cable car but trust me it worth everything to see the view! It wasn't that expensive and the lines weren't too long either.

Must see. The most amazing views of the cape town harbour and coastline. Panoramic view of the whole city extremely windycheck online deals and book online to avoid rushcheck the status of cableway before you go as rough weather sometimes shuts it down

Wow what a view!. Buy tickets online earlier if possible. Make sure you visit when you will have a clear view from the mountain. Great ride up to the top as the car turns around as it goes up and down so you get a complete view wherever you stand.
Fly over the highest mountain of capetown. The most amazing views of the capetown harbour and coastline. Panoramic view of the whole city A must see

Awesome!. It was a superb feeling "flying" on a cable car. What's good about it, is that the car revolves and gives passengers the chance to see the whole Cape Town in different angles and experience being in a thousand depth ( cant remember the exact number) within 3 or 4-minute ride plus the good sense of humor of guy-driver made it more thrilling . And of course the view from the top is a different feeling of excitement, peace and gratitude.
Great experience . The place of choice to visit when u get to Cape Town, truly stunning, NATURE wonder. Great for family and friends. One of the only two of this in the planet. Amazing!
Amazing views. You need a head for hights but it's is so worth the buzz. Amazing views of Cape Town and surrounding areas. Lovely walks. Also very good for plane spotting!

The Highlight of Capetown!. Definitely the highlight of Capetown....where you can see a full view of the city, the beach, and natural surrounding in cool breezy day. It won't be open during cloudy and foggy day though... but still it offers nice view from the city, as 'table cloth' covers the whole mountain:)

World wonder. Its quite scary, but seriously good fun to ride this cable car. The views of the city are worth the slightly vertiginous feeling as you sail towards the amazing mountain face. You can see climbers from the car.

Best view of cape town. This is obviously a must do for any tourist. I would recommend taking a taxi in peak season as parking is sometimes difficult to find. I did however find parking this time around. The cable car spins slowly around and offers such a great view. Once on top the view is truly astounding. You see all of cape town. Please be aware that if the weather is bad or its windy the cable car does not operate

This Is Awesome!. This is a great attraction that gives you a view of Capetown the Peninsula, and Robbins Island. The weather is very different on the top from the bottom so be prepared. We had winter jackets, ear muffs etc as the wind is very cold. Definitely a must if you are here!

Worth the visit. We enjoyed the cable car ride up to the top of the mountain and all the different views that one can see once on top. Also the cable car turns around so don't worry where you stand when you get in.

Thrilling ride. Short but exciting ride. You can get to the top other ways, but this is the easiest and best. You have to be careful of the winds, and if it does get very windy, they stop the service. Great views since the cable car rotates as it goes up.

Best way down. We hiked up the Plattekklip Gorge in the morning, and walked the top of Table Mountain a bit. When we were ready to come down, it was great to have the Aerial Cableway as an option! Even though it was a buy day on the mountain, the wait for cable was less than 10 minutes. The view was spectacular, the staff was great, the trip was short,. The car rotates during its trip, so that all can see.

Amazing Table Mountain. Hang the cost, just do it!You can pre-purchase tickets but on the day you're expecting to go to the top you should phone the cableway or check on the Internet to see if the cableway is going to be open. Rain, wind & cloud will close it. Be prepared to queue. I've been up to the top 3 times now and every time is still a special trip. Mid afternoon to late evening is my preference. It gets hot up there so take fluid, it gets wet too, it gets cloudy as well so taking wet weather gear should be considered. Prepare. Good shoes should be worn if you're going to wander or go to Plattekloof gorge. The paths are good but there are rocky areas. If your hat blows off your head, let it go!!!

Cannot comment as poor weather precluded operation of the Cable Car. Just a warning that inclement weather (cloud +/- wind) can prevent the operation of the Cable Car. Four out of five days of our stay in Cape Town the cable car was NOT operating, so plan your activities carefully.(This is not a complaint just want to alert travellers to potential missed activities).

Do Not Miss This!!. This should be one of the top To Do when in cape town. ideally book online to avoid loooong queue for spot purchase. The best part is they refund money incase of cancellation of cable car due to bad weather, which can happen often in Cape Town.Ideally be there on a sunny day and plan accordingly to local weather forecasts. One can easily spend 3 - 4 hours amidst fresh air, ocean smell, admiring the view and nature, enjoying a coffee and just staring at the horizon. No words to express this stunning place.Make sure you carry a bottle of water and something to eat along with a camera. food and drinks can be quite expensive. To summarize: A Spectacular Experience

You must!. Just great. Be there early when the weather is good. The queues can get quite long later in the day. To us, paying so little to experience such a great wonder was fantastic. Getting to the top of the mountain was made even better by the cable car having a rotating disc. So before you arrive at the top, you have had a beautiful 360 degree view of the mountain and Cape Town and its surrounds. Don't be in a hurry. Enjoy the views from every vantage point. Identify landmarks. Take a long walk towards East side of the mountain. Take in the wonderful variety of "Fynbos". Join a free guided tour if you want. Just sit somewhere on a rock and admire the fantastic views towards the Atlantic Ocean. Don't skip the gift shop. You will find a great variety of Table Mountain branded products at very reasonable prices. There are many friendly staff members around to help or assist. If you want to make the most of your visit, budget 3-4 hours to ensure you can take it all in. It is truly worth your time. We loved it!
Perfect DAY. Asked my mother in law for her daughters hand in marriage. Amazing day. The weather was perfect and so was the occasion.

A great way to go up!. I actually wanted to hike up Table Mountain and make a day of it, but because of time constraints, we ended up taking the cable car up and it is a great way to get to Table Mountain. As you ascend, you get a great view of the city and the ocean. The cars also rotate so everyone, regardless of where you are standing, can get great views. Highly recommend visiting Table Mountain!!

Spectacular Sunset on Father’s Day. Our family was lucky enough to catch one of the last cars to the top. We enjoyed walking around to see fantastic views of Cape Town. The best part was watching the sunset from atop Table Mountain. We toured it on Father’s day, and my dad said it was one of the best father’s days he’s had, watching the sunset with his two kids atop the mountain. Weather can stop the tram, so allow some flexibility in your schedule to make certain you have a chance to go to the top. If you are lucky enough to make it up, it is an unforgettable experience!

Bird's eye view. When visiting Cape Town, be sure to visit the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. The views from the top of Table Mountain is breathtaking. One can spend hours there just staring into the horizon, from any angle. The fresh air, smell of the ocean and sightseeing is worth every cent one pays for this privilege. Be sure to grab something to eat and drink at the top! Photos are taken and this is a lasting memory for the photo album.

Amazing attaraction,from the top of Table Mountain one can see the whole of cape Town. The Cable car was too exciting,what a wonderful feeling as one goes up the Mountain carrying so many passengers.A Beautiful Restaurant awaits us hungry travelers.One can go for a lovely hike and a walk.Romantic for couples who want to propose,get engaged or Married.Its too Stunning,I would recommend all visitors who go to cape Town not to miss this spectacular experience! Wow
The best way to the top of Table Mountain for anyone with physical challenges.. The Cableway made the trip to the top of Table Mountain very easy for people with some physical challenges.
Up on the table mountain. I did take the cable car only up and it was very fast and scenic. Down I walked to see more of the fauna and flora. It was a very nice half day tour.

Good experience. For me was the best way to get up at the mountain. Is very fast, safe, with good view until get there. But pay attention about the weather because is possible to be closed if is winding.

Cable way and Table mountain trip. Great tourist activity and a must do if you are in Cape Town. The views are outstanding from any point at the top and the rotating platform ensures everyone in the car gets a 360 degree view either on the up or down trip.Little frustrating in regards to the weather conditions shutting the cable way down and the ques that exist during busy times but the web site provides pretty up to date guidelines.All in all very worthwhile and reasonably priced.

beautiful views from this amazing mountain.. The table mountain views are most excellent, we went up on a cool clear day and enjoyed a nice meal at the restaurant. The little Dassie's ( rabbits) on the mountain are cute. The aerial cableway was safe.

A must-see site - just get there early. You can't miss table mountain. It's a must see in Cape Town. But be warned, the queues can be massive and the wait time to get up the top can be long. This also means there can be quite a wait to come back down.With young children, plan to get there early. And plan to spend some time up there. It's not as flat as you think it would be and so there's much to explore if you have a child in tow as we did.

Aerial Cableway to Table Mountain. This will take you up to the top of Table Mountain. Works efficiently and only runs in favourable conditions. Best to buy your tickets beforehand so as to not waste time.

Great Views. Positives:- Stunning views once you're at the top- Really natural and not too much man-made impact- Good amenities at the top- Cable cars are clean and allow for panoramic views- Did I mention the stunning views?- Specials for students, children, elderly etc - Website indicates what kind of clothing needed and weather conditions but hey you never know how Mother Nature is feeling so you can't blame them if you don't get the weather you wantNegatives:- If you don't get there early you will be stuck in a queue for very long- If you don't pre-book again you will be stuck queuing for hours- Not sure if there is wheelchair or stroller access or for the elderly?- Parking is a nightmare. Get a taxi rather than bringing your own car

Visit Table Mountain painlessly!. Reached the Cableway via Red Bus tour. Was my favorite day in Cape Town. We loved hiking and our people watching after taking the cableway up Table Mountain. Buy tickets in advance.
Amazing view. Long, long ques but worth the wait. View from the top well worth it. Plenty of room inside the cars even when full to capacity you still get a good view

Fantastic view. To view it really depends on your luck as the fogs come alternate days and it will close for the day. So better go up as soon as opportunities arrive. Fantastic view of the coastline and the city.

Don't miss this.. A spectacular ascent/descent and utterly breathtaking views from the summit, this is one of Cape Town's essential activities. Book ahead as the queues are long and parking a nightmare (tip - park at the visitor centre in Kloof Nek and get a taxi to the cableway - saves a lot of frustration!). We went with my elderly mother and were swept out of the queue and given VIP service all the way - can not tell you how impressed we were with the staff running the cableway: well done to you all. On top of the mountain you can walk, eat and shop, but its the views you are there for and they are unbeatable. Café at the top serves decent canteen style food but is designed to annoy, so be warned!

Breathtaking view. One of the most incredible places on Earth. I really love Cape Town and its mountain. The only problem is that on windy days the cableway is not always open. So check it out before going there!!

A Cape Town must do. Despite the cable car being large and you thinking you wont get a good view due to the numbers the cart rotates as you climb allowing everyone a great view. And the view at the top will leave you speechless. Take your time and enjoy every moment. This is a Cape Town must do.

Breathtaking views of Cape Town and environs. This is a well-run operation, and if you go relatively early in the morning (say before 9:30) you will miss most of the crowds. We had only a short wait for both ascent and descent. You will be rewarded with stunning views and nice options for hikes.

spectacular views. great and peaceful place. Go early to avoid queues and to really appreciate the stillness and take advantage of the gift shop and alfresco seating area as you what the clouds move on by

Mother City experience.. This world heritage site give the visitor an aerial view of our Mother City and its surroundings. You are literally in the clouds. At time you could enjoy the "table cloth" as the clouds move in to cover the mountain. The cable car is an exhilarating experience as it rotates as it ascends or as it comes down to the ticket office. This is a must for every visitor to Cape Town. For the energetic there are a few routes to walk up the mountain to gain a different perspective.
Scenic view. Wonder view by do go when the weather is clear as the fog rolls in and then there's no seeing much of anything.Easiest way to top of mountain price is fair.

beautiful view. The hike up is quite challenging (bring snacks, sunscreen, water, and appropriate footwear). Nice bar\restaurant at the top to enjoy a few well earned beers. Then take the cable car down.

A must do when visiting Cape Town. We booked on the internet which saves queueing tickets (Can be an hours queue). The process of getting on the cable car was well managed.the floor of the cable car rotates which means that everyone gets a fair view up and down the mountain. Thwarted viewsare breathtaking, whilst we were there quick storm came iehand we were asked to leave. Staff were calm and courtesy. Would have been great to staff longer but we felt very lucky to have visited.

View from the top of Table Mountain on a clear morning.. The trip up to Table Mountain was the start of a tour of South Africa. After staying overnight in Cape Town we arrived at the cable at 8 am for a spectacular trip up to the top of Table Mountain. The name related to the unusual flattened top of the mountain. An absolute must when visiting Cape Town and hope for a clear day as it is frequently surrounded by clouds.

Amazing sights to behold.. If you have the chance to visit our beautiful country that is South Africa, do yourself a favour and visit Table Mountain and make use of the Cablecars. Once on top of the mountain your breath will be taken away by amazing sight and at the beauty of SA. You also have the chance to see two oceans meet, the Indian and Atlantic. Not many people can say that. It is for sure a trip to do and have a relaxing drink at the top and watch the sun set over this amazing country!
Great winter visit.. Make sure that there is no mist or bad weather forecast, as you will not see the most majestic city in the world.

Spectacular views. If you have never been up the Table mountain cableway, you must do it soon. It is an awesome experience with spectacular views of the city, the ocean ,which can compare to any other amazing overseas city

Remarkable. You can't visit Cape Town of love in the city without doing a trip up to the top of Table Mountain. As a Capetonian I do it once a year to remind myself of just how spectacular this city is. if you're a visitor it's a must-see- the views are incredible. Go for breakfast (there's a restaurant up there) or watch the sunset... it's not one of the Natural Wonders of the World for nothing! Ps, check the weather forecast in summer as strong winds make it a no go zone.

Really a True wonder of Nature!!. There is just something about Table Mountain. I've been up many times but every time is so special. When we went up this time we had a clear and warm day. It was the 1st time we had taken our little girl up, because of the lovely weather she really enjoyed it.

Must see. A must do on any list! Very safe, very professional staff. Views are beautiful on a clear day. See local folks tending their plantings on the many hillsides. Reasonable cost- bring your camera!!

Spectacual views of Cape town and surroundings. The Funicular is really fun but don"t look down.. This is a fun trip. The views are very nice. The only two caveats are:1) make sure the top of the mountain is visible.2) Don't go if you are REALLY REALLY afraid of heights.
A Ride in the Sky. A beautiful view on the way up to Table Mountain and back down again. The rotating floor gives you different views up and back.

Just a have to do........... When you get here, this is very much a must do! You can walk up the mountain or take the care as we did. Whatever your choice you will never regret your decision to reach the top, the view is awesome and really does take your breath away. It can get cold if the cloud (tablecloth) roles in, so just be prepared. Enjoy it all, its so worth it.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a once in a life time expereience, and a 'must do' event. Although a little pricey it is the best way to avoid the foot slog to the top; (and perhaps less risky of muggings according to the locals).

Table Mountain Cable car. This attraction is a must for the whole family. On a stunning day in Cape Town, there is no where better to visit and soak in the absolute beauty that our mother city boasts!
What a privilage!. As one of the Wonders of the world we are very fortunate to be able to enjoy this in our own beautiful country!! This in one place everyone MUST visit.

Table Mountain Cableway. Table Mountain's Cable Way is Round, spacious 360 degrees of breath taking natural views that takes your breath away. and that's only the beginning of your exploration of the majestic Table Mountain. Towering over Cape Town and The Atlantic ocean. What a start to a great day.
A must do for Cape Town ! . You must do this no matter what! This is the best thing in Cape Town . Reminded me of the Grand Canyon! I loved it so much and so did my kids

Brilliant cable car trip. Brilliant experience to enter a cable car with a revolving floor which ensures everyone gets chance to see the amazing views as the cable car travels. Recommend to everyone that tickets are pre bought before you arrive which means you won't be waiting as long.
A great place to take photos. How wonderful to take photos here with your partner. It is really peaceful. I can view all the best things from the top.

Easy way to get to the top of the world. The cable cars were replaced a few years ago, and after the equipment that had been in use for many decades, these Swiss built cars are a breath of fresh air. They rotate on the way up and down, so it doesn't matter where one is in the able car. The views are spectacular from all angles, and it is well worth the time.

Scary but worthwhile. The cable car is a unique experience, although I found it a bit challenging due to the thought 'what if the cable breaks'. It didn't and doesn't. You can't beat the views. A nice experience. Recommended.

Seriously scary but super-safe. Be prepared to be impressed. The cable car carriages are big (30+ people) and go slowly horizontal before VERY steeply going vertical. It's a hair-raising climb but worth it. The ride is safe, well maintained and they close it at the hint of poor weather, wind etc. The actual mountain is much higher than it looks.

Awesome experience. This was really an awesome experience for us. You cannot describe the view so beautiful it is. A bit expensive to use cableway especially if it's for 2 or more people. But it is worth going up the mountain though!

Well organized, and can't beat the view.. We went on a busy day, and had to park quite far from the departure point of the cable cars. However, there was a handy transport that drove up and down the hill taking people to the departure area. Good thinking! The line moved quickly, the cost was reasonable, and the cable cars provide a wonderful view of the area as they go up (or down) the mountain. They rotate so everyone gets an excellent view. Once on top of the mountain, we had a marvelous time, but do check the weather report before you go.

Stunning views of Cape Town. An absolute must see in Cape Town!! I have been 3 times now and each time I am in awe of the stunning view - blue skies and blue seas as far as the eye can see. The cable car trip is great fun too. Book tickets online in advance to partly jump the queue.

THE Mountain and getting there. Table mountain is one of the most wonderful places on earth and the CableWay is the easiest way to get there - walking uphill is the other.The cable car is modern, safe and presents a beautiful viewing platform and a fantastic place to get pictures of Cape Town from. It can sometimes be busy and the best way to avoid this is to book on line. Just be aware that when a high wind blows the cable car does not run.
Worth it. We visited table mountain and were not disappointed. The views are beautiful - you feel like you're on top of the world. DON'T EAT IN THE CANTEEN! Breakfast not good.

Your gateway to stunning views of Cape town and beyond. Taking a cable car is (apart from walking) is the another way to get to the top of Table mountain, but the only one offering spectacular views of Cape town and its surrounds as you ascend and descend. You can buy your tickets at the gate but it is advisable to check if the cable car is running before you get there as it only operates in favourable weather. Once up there, you will be spell bound by the views and vistas as long as it is a clear day and the sea mist does not spoil the fun!! A must do whilst in Cape town.

An absolute wonder!. One of the 'must visit' place on our planet! Spend at least two days looking at, hiking on and being close to this wonderful mountain. Be sure to check the weather in advance of your visit!

Spectacular views!. You cannot visit Cape Town, and not go up Table Mountain on the Cableway! You get 360 degree views, as you slowly make your way up the mountain.Once at the top, make sure you go to every lookout point, as each one has a different view. You feel like you are close to the clouds and humans and cars are just a tiny "dot" very far away. There is no noise, just the beauty that extends for miles as far as the eye can see. Literally, "on a clear day, you can see forever"!Be sure to stop at the restaurant as well, for a snack or a meal as they have typical South African food. The staff is very friendly, with welcoming smiles and are only too happy to make your experience an unforgettable one!

Pristine surroundings, pity about .... Saturday July 4th after queuing for around twenty minutes (I hadn't booked, had only arrived from Australia a few hours earlier), I paid my Cablecar fee to Brett. I then realised I hadn't received 50 rand change and went back to him and he gave me a 5 rand coin. In my jet lagged state and still being unfamiliar with the currency I didn't realise he had short changed me not once but twice. The attraction itself it top class and the only rubbish that wasn't in a bin was a tiny wrapper. Very well maintained site and brilliantly designed cablecar that rotates 360 degrees so everyone gets a good view. Pity about one of the (ex-?) employees.
Must Do. We Never Booked in Advance... If you're early Bird, no Long queques... If not may take 30-45mins but worth to Do it... The Special is the Rotation of the cabin...

Table Mountain, Cape Town, South Arica. We went to the top of Table Mt the first morning we were in Cape Town. This is the number one activity to do in Cape Town and it is so worth it! Get your tickets online ahead of time. This will save you time when you can go in the "ticket holder" line at the mountain. The views are spectacular from the top. Spend the time and do the 45 minute hike at the top. Make sure you go when the sky are clear. Check the weather reports. As soon as the clouds come in, your views will diminish dramatically.

Going Up To The Top Of The Table Mountain . This my third time that i use this Aerial Cable to visit the national park in the top of the Table Mountain , it is safe and i was having fun seeing all the city around me and below .
great view!. The table mountain is a must do for visitors in Capetown.Go only if the visibility id's good and buy the ticket in the Internet. It will save some time on the line.

Brilliant overall experience "on top of the world". My wife and I went up Table Mountain Aerial Cableway for her birthday and had a great experience "on top of the world" The restaurant facilities and overall experience cater for both local and tourists alike. Although we are from Cape Town our tour guide shared his passion and plenty of information about Cape Town.
Visit. A great attraction with stunning views, a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. A short Que for the cable car to the top and the restaurant was very busy, but a great day out.
Stunning Ride. Great experience. The floor rotates so everyone gets a good view. Plan a good weather day for this excursion.

Cable Car to Table Mountain. We visited with our two kids - 11 and 12. You must buy tickets online before you go otherwise you will be waiting two hours in the queue just to buy a ticket. We bought tickets on the internet the night before and we got in very quickly. The cable car turns around while going up. For kids, there is not much to do up oin the mountain except for a little walk and seeing the "dussy" rabbits - but worth it if buy tickets online! Also the say must have clear skies otherwoiise cable car wont go up etc,
fantastic views. this was a great experience - a little chilly on top, but the serivce and staff were great, helpfull and knowledgeable about history and facts

magnificent Table Mountain.. What a breathtaking view.I have being up the cable car before, when it use to be small just 4 people at a time. the revamped cable car turning around gives you a 120 degree view of the mountain and surrounding sites. The photos we got as well as the video are such a treasure. I would do it over and over again. It was a fantastic day walking on top of the mountain with my friend. The sky were clear and we took great photos. One up for Table Mountains friendly staff. The food we could buy were excellent. Thank you Cape Town. The gift shop has got a big variety of gifts, postcards and mementos.

Best way to get to the top.... The cable car ride was nice and smooth, but the rotating floor made things a little dizzying. It also made standing upright a challenge. My husband initially refused to get on it to go to the top, but ultimately agreed (he is afraid of heights). He was glad to have gone up. He thought the rotating floor was helpful in making it smoother. To each their own! If you are hesitating for fear of heights, consider pushing through--my husband says he's glad he did and he would go again.

Aerial cableway was great. Do this if the weather permits. We weren't able to go up on our first try due to wind but tried again another day and it was great. The views were fantastic. It was fun to walk around the top of the mountain and look at unusual plants and watch the clouds and look a the city below.

Worth the wait. Amazing view, you cannot explain this in writing you have to experience it. It is definitely worth the wait, yeah some times in busy periods you might have to wait 1.5 hours but it is definitely worth it! Try and buy tickets online as I think it is slightly faster. But a must do!
Beautiful views. Going up the mountain reminded me of the cable car in the Alps. The views are magnificent! Try to take some photos while in the cable car.

This is so much fun - especially with a GoPro!. The rotating floors add that extra element of fear and excitement when going up the cable car!
Done it about 6 time snow and is alway sgreat fun! FREE on your birthday and cheaper during sunset times :)
Student card holders and senior discounts also available - phone to check first!

Table Mountain Cable Car. Even with lines of people, the cables get you up there quickly and efficiently. The cable car has a moving floor so as you ascend and descend, you get a 365 degree view. Fabulous.
Great view. WE enjoyed the cable way on the way up to the mountain. We like that it was turning so you get a great view as you are going up. And we loved the photo they took of us before going up.

Make A Plan & Enjoy. We monitored the weather and had the reception person at our hotel book our tickets online in the morning and print them out for us. The price was 225 Rand per adult. They were good for the day. (If we could not use them we could get a refund). After our Robben Island tour we went to Table Mountain. We saw the line ups for tickets (there was another line up across the street on this busy day since it was cloudy and windy in the AM). We waltzed right by the line up and proceeded to go to the check in area, take the elevator up the the platform and we just had to wait a couple cars before we boarded. Every window has a view because the cable car rotates as it goes up and then down. It takes five minutes and their are two cable cars (one goes up while the other goes down). It is a smooth safe operation. Many people chose to hike up - impressive! We got some nice photos going up and down in the cable car. Allow one to two hours maximum.
Got to be done!. Thankfully we did this as a group tour as the queues were very long. We were very lucky with the weather, so got to Table Mountain at her best.
Must see Cape Town!!. A must see. Take it the first clear day. Book online - even if it is the day you decide to go - saves a queue when you get there.

A great way to get to the top if you are not up to hiking the mountain!. Thi is the way to get to the top unless you are seriously ready to do some mountain hiking. Well worth the price. I experienced NO lines but my guide stated there can be VERY long lines at times.

Easy and fast, great views!. Most convenient way to get up to the mountain and I loved the rotating cabins, giving everyone a good view. Could also hike up and down which is also a good option in my eyes.

Fast and Efficient. We had a small delay because of the numbers early in the morning but nothing too dramatic. No problems coming down. The fact that the car rotates is a bonus - everyone gets to appreciate the view.getting
Very cool. The Table Mountain cable car service is definitely a great service. The fact that the cable car rotating when is going up surprised and attracted everyone. Very cool!

A bird's eye view of Cape Town. Take the cable car to the summit, enjoying fantastic views of Cape Town on the way up and down. The ride is smooth and secure for even the most nervous passengers. A possibly unique feature is that the interior floor of the cable car revolves when underway, providing all passengers with an ever changing view. The rotation is through a full 360 degrees so all on board can see everything worthwhile. On arrival stroll around the National Park enjoying the flora and fauna and majestic views down to the Cape of Good Hope. The National Park provides plenty of information on the animals and vegetation on top of the mountain so it is worthwhile spending a few hours strolling around.
A must do for all visitors. A great way to see the mountain. Booked ticket via Hop on/Hop off buses to avoid the queues - worth it!

Can't miss this site on your visit to Capetown!. You can't leave town without going up to Table Mountain. You just need to time your visit so that you arrive when the clouds and crowds are minimal. We went on a late afternoon when the lines were non existent and the views phenomenal. We toured with a local guide who was giving us the local city tour---early in the afternoon the top was shrouded in clouds but opened up about 4PM. She whisked us up to the aerial cableway, which had no line whatsoever, and we had a glorious view of the city...

Must do experience in Cape Town. The Table Mountain cableway is very modern,clean,safe and professional run,I have been on one in Santorini which was like a free for all.I only really appreciated the controlled order of the Table Mountain cable car at that moment.The cable car rotates so everyone gets a chance to get good views.This is the quickest and best way to get to the top of the mountain.Climbing up by foot is only for the very fit,and een then you have to be very careful.

spectacular trip. Fantastic trip up and down, seeing the perspective shift on the scale of the mountain and the coast. Wonderful to walk around on the top of Table Mountain among the unique vegetation and view the peninsula.
Iconic cable way. The experience well worth it. It is always well organised and well run. The cable cars are new and look well maintained. I would recommend it to anyone.

Worth the queue! Views are amazing. We queued for around 45 minutes to purchase tickets and go up in the cable car. The ride itself takes around 5 mins and the floor revolves so everybody gets to see the view from all angles. The view from the top is amazing and well worth the wait, we wandered around taking photos and admiring the scenery. It was very busy but I guess that is to be expected.

An engineering marvel. The aerial cable way is the easier way to get to the top of table mountain. The mountain climbing (hiking) should be left to the experts. The cable car accommodates 64(?) persons at a time & the floor rotates to give a 360 degree view to all. So don't worry about where you are standing. Just try to stand next to a window.

Makes the climb easy.. We took a cable car up early in the morning. There were not many people in the queue so we went straight on. It is a large cable car and the floor rotates as it ascends, (and descends), so everybody has a chance at the view. The trip up and back are one of the "must see" things to do in Cape Town.

Simply awesome. It is difficult to find the words to describe the awesome beauty of Cape Town and the surrounding area. Table Mountain dominates the skyline and is fascinating with its intermittent mist. The views from the top are just stunning, and inwould certainly recommend a trip up there.
Beautiful. In June no queues to get on cableway. Four and a half minutes to go up. Revolving cable car. Lovely views. Amazing views. A must do experience in Cape Town. Don't miss out.

Fun Way to See a Natural Wonder. This famous ride takes you to the top of one of the 7 Wonders of the World, Table Mountain. The views are stunning as you rise from street level to mountaintop. Don't worry about what side of the car you are on that you may miss a view of beautiful Capetown because the car rotates as you go up the mountain. This ensures that all will be able to get a rotating view of both the bowl of the city and the rugged mountainside of Table Mountain. What a fun way to see the natural wonder of Table Mountain.
easy. Great way to get to the top without hiking. It is crowded but they move people around efficiently. The cable cars are glass sothe view up and back are amazing.

Not to be missed!. The views on table mountain are outstanding. We only spent 45 minutes but I would have allocated more time if we had it. Don't be deterred by the lack of parking or the lines for the cable car as the line may look long but moves swiftly.

Next to heaven. At such high altitude, the table mountain is a perfect example of natural beauty. The aerial route makes the mountain accessible in 10 mins and you move through the clouds to enter the natures beauty.Lovely visit and never to miss. Simply loved it.

Highlight of a Beautiful City!. Do not Miss this highlight of Cape Town!! Our guide made sure to get us there early in the morning. The line winds around forever. But it is worth it. Do not miss the views from the top.

Gorgeous views. If you're anything like me, hiking up more than 1.000 meters sounds worse than death. Luckily there's the cableway, with its rotating cars and absolutely stunning views. There are two sections of the car that are permanently open to the air, so you also get to feel like you're climbing up the mountain -- or, with some good preparation, a clear shot for stunning photographs of the bay and Cape Town proper.

A must see in Cape Town. Vital to go up iconic Table Mountain when visiting Cape Town. You get a great perspective - like going up the Empire State Building in New York to get your bearings. More than 23 million people have visited this Natural Wonder of the World. Do yourself a favour and have a glass of great South African wine or Methode Cap Classique at the top with the most spectacular views.
Always busy. I climbed the mountain and went down via the cable car. The queues are always very long, but move very fast. The view on the way down is spectacular and you feel safe.
Table Mt. Cableway. A must do. A breath taking ride up!! Terrific views of mountains,ocean,Cape Town, great little restaurant on top. Super hikes on top.

Stunning View of cape town and surrounds. it was a clear sunny day and the view of Cape town from the revolving cable car was stunning. it can be a good idea to take a light jacket or cardigan/pullover because although it can be very warm or hot at the bottom of the mountain there is often a much cooler temperature n the mountais table topi

Breathtaking - GO!. You cannot visit Cape Town without taking the time to go to Table Mountain. Pre-order your tkts online to avoid a line and be sure to leave enough time to sit and enjoy the silence and 360 views from the top of the world. The cableway ride up and down was breathtaking. The views, stunning. GO!
Trip up Table Mountain. Was an awesome event with the Kids. They really enjoyed.Rotation cabin gives you excellent view in all directions.

A must do!. One of the must do's on your visit to cape town, the cable way is cheap and efficient with superb views of cape town being provided at all view points, going up at sunset provides even more incredible views

Must do. Was a beautiful winters day and the view was fantastic. I've been up before, and I am from SA, so it was heartwarming to see the delight on the faces of all the foreigners in the cable car. We had lunch in the restaurant at the top, but it was seriously understaffed and somewhat chaotic before we could finally eat. Management should be more wakeup when it is a Saturday in schoolholidays and the wheather is good, obviously lots of people would then go up the mountain, and they should be better prepared .

Spectular. I am a person who hates heights and even I enjoyed this!! I spoke to the staff first of all and they explained that if I sat in the centre of the cable car I would be fine. They were absolutely right!!! I even managed to peek around some people to look straight ahead. The weirdest thing was the floor of the cable car rotating!! When on the mountain the views are spectular, I simply looked straight ahead and kept well away from the edge!!

Dont miss it. If you go to Cape town you must do this. What a great view. Get there eraly though and get your hotel to book tickets on line or you wait in a long line. If it is too windy they close it so plan you trip.
A must. This really is a must when in Cape Town. The views are amazing. My kids loved the revolving cable car which gave them a chance to see everything on the way up and down.

Well worth the trip if the weather is good. We tried to get up the cable car for 2 days and finally the weather was agreeable and we got to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car revolves as you ascend for 360 degree view.
Amazing views. A must for anyone going to Cape Town of South Africa amazing scenery photo opportunities and wildlife an amazing visit you will never forget!

Great views in good weather. The famous Cape Town mountain is a must visit for every traveller. The views are exceptional and worth the long wait. It is nice that you can get a free ride on your birthday. The ride to the top is also very nice.

worth the effort & money !!. This was one of the 'must do ' for us , having heard so much about the ride & the Table-top Mountain, in Cape Town. We were told to keep our fingers crossed because the weather can turn foul & we may have to abort the venture. As it turned out , it was a nice , bright day with the Sun shining benignly. Its an interesting place where the trip starts with small way side shops selling wares of tourist-attraction. Do bargain, my advice. The cable car is decently packed & we enjoyed breath-taking view of the Town, the blue sea water & the mountains up close.. I took some very memorable pictures which have since been appreciated by all our friends. The ride itself is enjoyable , though not lasting more than 10 - 15 minutes. But , it is some thing which should not be missed by first time tourists.

Unless you want a long walk...!. Well organised with proper queuing systems set up for customers. Each car has a "host" - both of whom were personable and entertaining. The floor within the cars actually circle the car, so it doesn't really matter where you sit or stand at the start. Good move! Just get any muppets who try to stay where they are to move with the floor!Superb views on the way up as well as down.Only way to get to the top unless you are a fitness freak!

Best View.. This is a must when you visit Cape Town. And OMG the view was unbelievable. Take your time and walk around there. You can have something to eat when you up there. I must say I find the price to pay to go up and down was a bid overpriced. Try and go on a clear day if you can but keep in mind the weather can change in a instant.

Really glad we did this. We didn't have this on our original Cape Town agenda, and added it right before we boarded our flight over. That turned out to be a really good choice. The fee was reasonable, and the system to get on the cable car was very well designed and made queing no big deal. We found the staff to be much more hospitable than expected, and didn't feel pressured for additional purchases; although they were available.The car itself was so well designed, and the rotating floor surprised us and delighted. Everyone on the car got a great view. It was a fast ride up, and the ride offered stunning views of the people brave enough to hike or climb the mountain.The top was worthy of it's vote to be one of the new seven world wonders. The photos we took, the video, the experience of being there -- it was all an unexpected highlight to our trip.
Lunch at table mountain.. A great lunch and fun day with children having fun on the rocks. Beautiful scenery and lovely photo opportunities.

Very Lucky. We were very lucky to make it up today. In the morning I checked the website and it was closed. While touring the city I periodically checked the status and when I saw that they were open we came immediately. It's cold, but still beautiful. There is a shop on top and they sell stamps and post cards. So, you can mail your postcards from here!

Thoroughly Enjoyable!. I don't think a trip to Cape Town would be complete without riding the revolving cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The idea of the revolving outer gave everyone an opportunity to see the breathtaking views without a glass panel - this was a great feature. They take photographs of you before you board - these are presented to you at the end of your trip as part of a rather expensive package. My tip is to ask for the photographs alone and the price drops significantly. Take care with the weather as the cars can stop running and this may leave you in a pickle at the top with a long walk back down!

Good but overpriced. The actual cable car was fine, it had good views, was about 5 minutes, and had a rotating floor. I think it is overpriced though, I believe it was around R250 for a ride there and back and R125 one way. Should be half the price I payed.

A breathtaking visit to the Mother of our City. My best experience was taking the 18h00 trip up the mountain; it was around February when there is less wind and it is light enough to take in the day-time view. Absorbing the energy at the top while walking around is an experience that I'll never forget and it build up an appetite for the picnic basket that we took along which was filled with scrumptious treats to devour at a spot with a spectacular view. Our timing was perfect in taking the last cable car, at around 22h00, back down to reality. Going down was another stunning view as this time the city was in Bling - Wow!

Transport to a magical world. The views going up were fantastic, and the floor rotates so you can see all around. Once at the top, clouds form below you and wash up the edge of the mountain, making it seem like a fairy tale land. When the mist breaks up, there are fantastic views of Cape Town and the surrounding area. It can get quite chilly, so bring a jacket in winter. Definitely a must do in Cape Town.
Amazing views when it clears. This was a visit I just had to do and it was fantastic. The views are amazing when it is clear, but to see the mist descend so rapidly is quite something.

Fantastic ride and view. The Table Mountain cable car is the only viable way to gain the top of the mountain other than become a mountain climber. Weather affects the cable cars due to the fact that high winds will cause a stoppage of service. Even if the winds are calm, the famous Table Cloth (low level clouds covering the whole mountain top will make views impossible. It took us 3 days for weather conditions to allow us to reach the top of Table Mountain. However, the view on the way up as well as from the peak of the mountain were fantastic.

awesome weather, surrounded by clouds on top of the mountain. Unbelievable, view from all angles on the mountain , was surrrounded by light clouds , which cause a bit of cold .we had some hot coffee at the restaurant. The vipe in the restaurant was busy and very warmth.we had an awesome time.They had a special running on the cable car, free tickets for two kids escourted by an adult , which was quite a saving.
Awesome experience. Every person that visits South Africa should go on top of table mountain and this is the easiest way to do it, friendly staff guided us all the way.

This is one of those can't miss attractions in Cape Town.. The cableway was of those attractions that I was determined to visit. The mountain was fogged in on the morning we wanted to visit. The fog lifted about mid-afternoon and we took a cab to the mountain. I used Uber for the first time and the fare from downtown was $10. The ride up and down the mountain was fantastic and the views were spectacular. I would stay until sunset if possible to get the best views. We enjoyed the visit so much that we waited and took the last car down.

If you want to hike up, take the cable car down :-). If you take the cable car, you actually have more energy and time to walk around the mountain top. We were shot from the climb and didn't have as much time spend on top. We took the cable car down and it was a nice, easy, quick ride.
free on your birthday for south africans. remember to take a jacket. i like to walk up and cable car down. grab a beer on the top and enjoy the views!
For those who do not want to climb. Everyone has to visit Table Mountain at least one time in their life. It is one of God's special places on earth.

Unmissable THRILLING . A true city Asset. Smooth Sleek rotating car platform so everyone gets all the views. I usually make a habit of not going on tours to see rocks. I find it boring . Not this Rock it was the first thing I did. Theres something prehistoric about this. What happened here those millions of years ago that could leave such a dramatic landscape. It's a little frightening!If you don't have a Hire car and it is not something I usually do in foreign cities take the Red Bus. Check weather and as the mountain can basically be seen from just about, everywhere, have a look up and see what's happening. Cloud coverage often pour down over the cliffs - I recomend you check out the weeks weather and select the most likely day it will be clear. It's gobsmacking the serenity views and on top of the world atmosphere. I took the photo package at the end. I found that the staff engaged well & were really passionate. Its winter so not so crowded.

Typical Item to do in Cape Town. I have been on Cable Car 3 times in the past 10 years. I must admit, the service has improved a lot. My most recent visit was two weekends ago when I went with a friend. The staff members were very welcoming, they really warmed you with their smile in the cold weather. View was spectacular. one side of the mountain you will have the entire city under your feet. The other side of the mountain you will be mesmerised by the endless ocean. Definitely worth a visit.Pros: Incredible view, should I say more?Cons: Waiting time, expect a queue to get up and down the cable way even if you bought the ticket online and "skipped the ticket queue". Tips: Do book your ticket online, get a free pass on your birthday (bring your ID). Take your time and have a drink in the cafe restaurant on the top of the mountain. Try get a one way ticket and hike up or down the mountain.

On top of the World !. Book online for the cableway, saves you time at the bottom and no lengthly queue's. straight up the stairs to the waiting platform. The wait for the cable car wasn't too long. Once inside the car, the floor revolves so you see the mountains,the sea and the city. It is just spectacular. When you reach the top its a quick exit and you are in for a treat.
