Everywhere you look is just breathtaking. The views are spectacular. there are walks you can go on and a restaurant you can escape to should the crowds become too much. Not a long wait for the cable car down ( in winter ) and you exit through a gift shop. Very irritating if you have kids who will ask for anything and everything.

Fabulous views. Breathtaking views. Worth taking one of the walking tours around the top of the mountain. Cable car is always full but the floor rotates to allow everyone to get a good 360 view. Suggest arriving early. We were in second car up and it meant we had more space and fewer people crowding every viewpoint. Restaurant service was poor and slow with only one til open on a Friday morning. Breakfast quality not great.
Spectacular. Table Mountain is not only a "must experience" but also a "must return". Of course you can hike or climb to the top but the Aerial Cableway offers a sound and less strenuous alternative.

Go on your birthday. One of my favourites and am I pleased I live here. The views once you get to the top are unforgettable. This amazing giant of a mountain never disappoints. If you go on your birthday, don't forget the passport or ID you get a free ride.

Excellent Ride. Loved the Free tour on Top, Highly recommended. I did note though that the cable operator sis that the mountain was 1067 m high and I had read 1054m, its not a Biggie.. but please someone tell me how high we went :)
Great attraction. Be ready to queue!! But at the end it worth it: beautiful panoramic view, the cabin turns around so everyone can see the 360 view.

The Easy Way up Table Mountain!!!. We went in July and were lucky enough to have wonderful weather - better than a British summer has to offer!! Due to ut being winter it was very quiet in Cape Town and going up the Cable Car was quick (no queuing) and the lift was really a good sight seeing opportunity in itself!! The route to the top was quick and quiet and the revolving table means everyone gets a chance to see the coats and the mountain side during the trip up ( no scuffles for space!!). The sights from the top were brilliant. Got to do this when in Cape Town

Misty-eyed at Table Mountain. We pre-booked our tickets for this whilst still in the UK. To avoid restricting ourselves, we paid about an extra R100 to buy tickets which were not restricted to morning or afternoon. Unfortunately, the weather wasn’t too great but we still enjoyed our trip up the mountain, even though visibility from the top was “zero” – see the photo! We knew we weren't going to see anything from the top, but still wanted to have the experience. I’m sure the view is stunning in the right weather conditions. As it was winter, and given the weather, there was no queue at the cable cars. The service was very efficient. We didn't stay up at the top for too long, given the weather conditions. I imagine you could pass quite a bit of time if you could see where you are going! Would love to return one day without the clouds and fog.

Very Good. I went to Table Mountain to sightsee for my friend's birthday, they gave him a free ticket for his birthday, provided he gave proof, which is great in my opinion. The queue for the tickets moved fairly quickly, and the cableway provided a 360 degree turn on the trip which I particularly enjoyed as you get to absorb the view from all angles.

Quick and efficient. If you are in good shape and you have plenty of time, you can walk, otherwise, take the aerial cableway. On the Friday, it was closed in the morning because of high winds, although it was a perfect sunny day. We went back the next morning, and luckily it was free for children under 18 that day. We did not make any advanced reservations, and there was no wait time (probably because it was low season). Just check on its Web site before you go to make sure it's open.
Quicker than walking. The ride in the cable car took less than 10 minutes and I loved that the floor rotates so that you get 360 degree views.

Cape Town the most beautiful city in the world the view from atop is amazing!. One of our top highlights of every visit to Cape Town is Table Mountain for sure! The views are stunning! The Flowers the Feinbos plants the little Dassie's the hiking trail once you get to the top of Table Mountain, Absolute wonder! Take a sweater gets pretty cold up there! Restaurant has good bites and real good coffee and pastries!

Breathtaking 360 degree View of Cape Town. This is a must do when in Cape Town! The only setback is that towards the end of the day, the cable car tends to run on a single generator and it prohibits the maximum capacity. The cable car itself, rotates 360 degrees the whole way up and down, great for photos and checking out Cape Town from above. There are a few trails at the top, a bunch of scenic photo areas, a gift shop and grab n go restaurant.
Table Mountain Cable Car. A truly magnificent attraction with a modern cable car having replaced the original one. The views are wonderful well worth the effort.

Spectacular journey. We lucked out on our first day when we woke up to a spectacularly clear morning where Table Mountain was visible. We rushed and beat the crowds with very little wait. The rotating floor on the way up was awesome giving 360 degree view even in packed cars. If you have small kids or persons who may have difficulty walking uphill you may want to drop then drive back to park along the road where you may want to have some small bills for the parking attendant.
Excelent view. Excelent view from the city and the ocean. However, it's pretty hard for those who are afraid of highness.

Magical Table Mountain. On a clear windfree day there is nothing more magical than taking the cable car which revolves slowly up to the top of Table Mountain. The views are magical and the walks at the top spectacular. On a clear day one can see for miles and miles and it feels like Robben Island is just right there.To sit at the café and have a drink is so relaxing and tranquil. Personally, it must be the most beautiful view in all of Africa. Don't miss it
Wonderful views. Every visitor to Cape Town must see Table Mountain from the top. A restaurant at the top, but don't expect gourmet. Good toilet facilities and fun for kids.

Always and I mean always nice. Growing up in the Cape it has always been part of you. Have seen the cableway through many changes to today's ride that slowly spins around (no more running to get to a specific side). In summer - get there early as the queues can get incredibly long. Otherwise walk the mountain out from Platteklip and take the cable car down.

Well worth the visit!!!. So my review is from the point of view of someone who has a fear of heights. The worst part of the journey to the top was the trip up to the cable car station..... the road was steep, and I got a bit nervous. But the actual trip up the mountain was grand, the car does revolve, but there are bits that are stationary & you can sit there and get up to the top no bother. Once at the top, the view was amazing!!!! We walked around, soaking up the surroundings, and watching others abseil back down!!!! The restaurant is really nice, clean and the food is good. We had no worries coming back down either!!! Highly recommended!

amazing views. table mountain is the symbol of cape town so one HAS to tick this off the list! The table mountain aerial cabelway is very efficiently organuised and offers a thrilling ride to the top of the mountain. the cable car offers a 360 degree view of this beautiful city! just check to make sure the cable car is open on the day you plan to go as frequent winds or change in weather can cause a shut down for the day/few hours.Tips:1. book online and avoid the queques2. check to see if the cable car is actually running on the day before you book3. take the cable car ride one way up and than trek back down, it is a long trek down but worth it. but DO NOT wander from the marked trails as the mountain can be dangerous . and please for the love of life, do not attempt to trek up or down the mountain in sandals/heels etc!

Wonderful experience. It's simply one of those must do things in Cape Town If you don't want the crowds of tourist at the restaurant , pack yourself a pic nic and walk off a bit to find yourself a rock , just don't feed the wild life please

An amazing view. Well worth a visit. Book on-line to avoid queues. Wear walking shoes if you enjoy walking. There are lots of vantage points to see Cape Town and surrounding areas. There is a good restaurant for meals. If the top of mountain is covered in heavy cloud (table cloth) or it's very windy the cable car will not run.

Dominates Cape Town and dominated our stay. We last went up Table Mountain 10 years ago and everything about the service has changed. Cable cars very efficient, with a minimal wait, the staff were friendly and greeted everyone. Our lunch at the restaurant at the top exceeded expectations, with great variety and quality of food. and of course, the views, well they have not changed and are as spectacular as every. However, while the view made up for the rest of the experience the last time, this year they were the icing on the cake. Thank you!

Day & Eve Spectacular Wonder of the World. One of life's must see natural wonders of the world,I often play as tour guide when friends visit and I never tire of either hiking up or via cable car to the top of Table Mountain. Both day and night have their attractions ( apart from the reduced ticket price ) take a bottle of bubbles or some chilled beers and sit out on the rocks to watch awes cloud formations flow as if liquified followed by jaw dropping sunsets. Don't worry if you forget your drinks or run out as there is a well stocked and reasonable priced cafe on the top. A tip if your getting the last cable car down, visit the toilet as it can be a little wait time depending on the time of year.

A must for you capetown trip!. This cable car has come a long way from what it was 25 years ago! very comfortable ride, and even the faint hearted can handle it now! Breathtaking views from the top of the mountain, and fauna and flora very interesting. Make sure it is a clear day, otherwise it wont be worth the hassle.Another tip - go early to avoid the queues. Or book online prior to going.A must to see.

The most beautiful views in all of Africa.. The modern cable car takes you smoothly to the top of Table Mountain and rotates through 360 degrees on the way up and down.The view of Table Bay from the top is to die for. Spend some time walking the safe trails on the Tabletop.An excellent restaurant provides food and wine.

Buy your tickets for arrival day regardless of when you plan to use them!. You have to go up on a clear day, and in winter (Jun-Aug), those are unpredictable. The tickets appear to be usable for two weeks after the stated date on it, so make sure you get a ticket for the day of your arrival, and use it on whatever clear day comes. The cable car has a stationary platform in the middle for anyone afraid of heights or who is prone to motion sickness but the remainder of the platform rotates like a turntable so everyone gets a chance at a good picture out of the one section of the car that has only bars (the rest is plexiglass windows, but the section with safety bars is open to the outdoors). The cars close in high winds, and the winds at the top are stronger than at the bottom, so if you happen to have a clear day with low wind, cancel or reschedule your other plans and make your way to the cable cars!

Top of the mountain. Visiting the table mountain was one of our best choices we have done. This place is unique. Starting from using the cable car to reach the top, you will have the most wonderful experience. Reaching the table top is like seeing a part of heaven, the beauty of nature is surrounding you.. You walk beside the clouds.. The view down is like an art, the mountains, the sea, the town and the harbor.You can see also the island where Nilson Mandela was prisoned. We had a very nice walk and it was a great experience!You should try it! Photos are here taken from the table top of table mountain

Must do!. Make sure you take everyone's advice and go the first time you see the weather is clear. We went the afternoon we arrived and were glad we did as there wasn't another perfectly clear day the rest of the week. Very small line to go up. Beautiful views of course and my kids were enchanted by all the dassie animals living on the hillside (closely related to the elephant - which we didn't believe so we looked it up). Sweet little shop where we bought wine for the grown ups and ice cream for the kids. Wonderful afternoon. Def wear sunscreen no matter what time of year.

Stunning views remind you why Cape Town is a special place. The revolving cable car means that everyone can enjoy the stunning views on the way up and down the mountain. At the top the views take your breath away. I suspect climbing to the top would too which is why the cable car is the only sensible way to make it to the top!

Truly amazing views from the top. Well worth calling in advance as the weather at the top can often close the cable car. If you are staying nearby take a Taxi to/from the place as if you drive you can find it a long walk to the cable car on a busy day. The views are amazing and hope you like heights! A must visit if you are going to Cape Town. Cafe at the top is good too, plus a few souvenir shops....

A must when in Cape town. Amazing views...overpriced restaurant at the top. Ensure you dress warm when visiting in winter and check the website to easily find out wether the service is running or not.
Don't miss this. If your in Cape Town and have the opportunity do not miss this experience. The views are breath taking. The cableway does not run when its windy so pick your moment and get up there!
What a view. Well worth it with spectacular views from the top. The staff are very helpful and always smiling. A must do in cape Town.

A must when in Cape Town. If you can't hike to the top, be sure to take the tram to the top! Fantastic views of Cape Town, Robben Island and beyond! There is a little restaurant at the top and lots of space to walk around and take photos.

Great view, and alternative to walking. I would recommend hiking up Table Mountain of you get the chance, and then take the Cableway down. Especially on Days with nice weather, there will be A LOT of people wanting to take the cableway up, but on the way down ít´s easier to get a spot for the 360 view. Table Mountain was my best experience from Cape Town, so I would recommend anybody to go there. You will not regret seeing that Amazing view!
Good fun. Albeit you have to queue a bit , it is good fun going up on the cable car and a very amusing and witty commentator! The views are spectacular.

Breathtakingly beautiful. If you don't mind waiting in a touristy line, the cable way is definitely the best way of reaching the top of Table Mountain and seeing what the fuss about Cape Town is all about. A must-do!!

Great Ride!!!. Im not a big fan of cable cars but this one its quite good!! . With a 360 rotation while goes up, this funicular ride gives you a glimpse of what to expect up there. Easy to access it by bus or taxi, the base of the funicular its well known for almost everyone in the area. The tickets its not the cheapest (around 18 USD return) but in my opinion its worth it. Just a reminder, the funicular does rotates, so don't rush to the front part of the funicular and choose the back side so when it turns you will have the best view for your pictures. Enjoy!!!

Quick but fun ride to the top with great view. We hiked up Table Mountain in June 2015 (a ~2-3 hour hike) and enjoyed the amazing view before taking the cable car down since it was getting a bit late and we didn't want to feel too rushed. The view at the Top of Table Mountain is outstanding on a clear day which we had. The ride down was short, probably 2-3 minutes and the floor rotates such that you have an awesome view. The last cable car is at 6 PM and lines can sometimes get long so if you know that you'll take the cable car it's probably best to buy the tickets in advance.

Cape Town Cable Car. Yay this cableway was really well set up with the revolving floor allowing everyone to see the amazing views. The cablecar didnt follow the mountain along suspended a few metres above ground, it was really out there, was amazing and didnt take long to reach the top. Well signed walkways to follow up the top and a restaurant for a warm drink. Well worth doing.

Amazing Place to Visit.. The new Natural 7 Wonders of The World. Its Beautiful on top. Keep atleast 3-4 hrs to walk around & explore the Beautiful Scenery & Soak in the Million $ Views. When I went I did not buy online tickets, there was NO big line to buy tickets,took me less than a minute. I found this place very safe & had NO Safety concerns.
The Table. WOW! What an experience! The view is great if you can avoid the tablecloth on the mountain. The top is not what I expected and the Dassie were so cute.

Convenient ride. The cable car is an easy way to get up table mountain. As it is a must do in Cape Town you have no choice if you don't want to walk. There are some considerations: Lines can be very long, weather changes fast.You want to buy ticket in advance online so you can skip the line. There is also limited risk as they are valid for a few days. Our strategy was to go as soon as possible after arrival so we have 1-2 days more to try in case the weather changes.
Must visit. Good climb to the top. Must visit if you are in Cape town. Excellent view of the city and check if it is cloudy. go on a sunny day
Nice experience in 2 mins. this cable way is one of the fastest cableways in africa with a rotating deck to keep you always in the air without barrier

Excellent on a sunny day! . I am very lucky to have been up on a nearly perfect sunny day, so my experience will be not the same as if you go in inclement weather. The entire operation is extremely well organised, with good queuing facilities and fast turnaround time. I would advise purchasing a ticket before you get there to save time. Parking is all along the side of the mountain road leading to the cable station. Visitors: take the hop on hop off bus to save a ton of hassles! The cable cars are seamless and rotate so everyone gets a good view. On the top of the mountain there facilities for eating, drinking and shopping, and acres of rocks and walking trails to explore. If you are bringing small kids up here, for goodness sake keep a good eye on them, as most of the cliff face rocks are not fenced off. Thoroughly well organised and well patronised attraction that is also really well worth it. A must do while in Cape Town.

too fast for a scenery ride but could be worth for some people. a bit too fast so you can´t really feel how high you are going. Its quite expensive but if walking up and down isnt for you, this is the best way to get those amazing views.

Fantastic view from the top!. It is very easy to get to the Table Mountain cable car by using the Red line Hop-On Hop-Off Bus. The entrance fee for the return ride is approx. US$20.00/person. Once you are up the top you will get a breathtaking view of Cape town & the coast. It was amazing! There is a restaurant & shop up the top & also a free guided walk around the area every hour. We also saw lots of Rock Hyrax ( Dassie) on that day & they were very cute! But beware, make sure you check the weather forecast before you go, the day we went it started with sunny 20C & half an hour later the temperature dropped to around 5C & the mist rolled in. It was freezing cold & very windy! However it is a must to do when you are in Cape Town!

excellent view of the city. The rotating cablecar is a nice experience you can earn during your visit to Cape Town.You can get a nice view of the city and also you can get a wonderful view of the sunset if you go there before sunset!
Table mountain via cable car --South Africa. You just cannot miss the view from it.I guess the best time to go there is April MayAnd the journey in the cable car with its view was the best
Great Views. The Table Mountain tram is a great way to see the entire Cape Town Coast and the city. Its a great day trip with a good restaurant on top and great hiking tours.
360 degree views. This is a must do in Cape Town. From the top of table mountain you get an amazing view of the city, the ocean, the 12 apostles, Lions Head, etc.

Must do in Cape Town. Cable way station always seems to be busy but these guys really know how to move people so don't let this put you off.Spectacular views of Cape Town and beyond on a clear day. Can be quite chilly on top, especially if there is a breeze. Had a great walk whilst there and the mountain top restaurant provided a tasty hot snack and drink.

Not to be missed. If it is not too windy get yourself up there early to avoid the heat and crowds, then enjoy a walk down the mountain. Go into Camps Bay for lunch and then relax on the beach all afternoon!
Just beautiful. It is breath taking the view from the top. Can see all the way over the bay to Blouberg Strand. Will be back

A Must. A must visit if you're fortunate enough to get to the beautiful Western Cape and in particular Cape Town. For those not wishing to hike/climb up the mountain, the cableway gives easy access to stunning views of the city

Fantastic view. There is a fantastic view over Cape town and the surrounding area. It is possible to go for a walk at the top following the pathways there. Consider bringing a bottle of wine and some glasses and watch the sunset from the top. There is nothing like it!

Magnificent views - on top of the world. Quick trip up to the top.Almost too fast to really savour the views. Wonderful walks on top of Table Mountain, with many safe look out points.Plenty of time to meander around, enjoying the wide variety of flowers and fynbos.Restaraunt serves tasty snacks and warm drinks.Wear a warm coat, as it can be chilly - even when hot at the bottom.

Awesome visit. Table Mountain was spectacular and the views were amazing. Table Mountain had a great view of the city and i can understand that it is now one of the 7 wonders of nature. The cableway had great service, Table Mountain is defenitly a place I would go to again.

Great view. This was a very fun trip. Fortunately, when we arrived the line was not too long. Unfortunately, the parking is terrible. Once you are parked on a treacherous drop-off or safely, but far away, the ride is really fun! The cable car turns to give you a 360 view. I just wish the ride was longer... maybe slow the ride going up and down. It is definitely worth riding at least once. My boyfriend and I rode up and down instead of walking down.

The revolving cable car is perfect to see the city!. The views are terrific but get a ticket in advance to avoid long lines at the mountain. The options for dining are varied so something to suit everyone's tastes.

Bit dissapointed. Loved the ride. Weather was acting up. Barely saw anything from up there. The restaurant on top is well stocked with variety. Staff were friendly but not too clued up regarding their menus.

STUNNING VIEWS FROM THE TOP!. We were lucky to take the last Cable Car to Table Mountain the day we did. The weather wasn't good during the morning but luck was on our side in the evening. Breathtaking views of Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain plus a few animals to add to the treat! Its a city landmark so I think its a must do.....before actually going up there, I was quite happy seeing TM from any point in the city but being on top of it all made the difference. Highly recommend this attraction.

Scary High. The moment it starts going up your heart will be in your throat because the height is crazy. I had my eyes closed the entire time because I am scare of heights :) but you have to make sure you take pictures while going up as the view is amazing and the floor inside the cable cart is rotating to let you see all the angles.

Wonderful place. Lots of fun and the view is absolutely stunning! I'll admit parking is slightly tough because it's up on a mountain but definitely worth the view and the experience. The car itself has been designed and engineered to slowly turn to allow every single person standing to get the full 360 deg view of the city. Very smooth!

Cloud Formations were exquisite. This is a don't miss when touring in South Africa. The views are spectacular. The cableway has great service, I wouldn't want to walk up! Make sure you choose a day with great weather to maximize the view.

Panoramic view of Cape Town. A National Park in the middle of this great city of Cape Town. Beautiful panoramic view of the city and it´s white beaches. For all travelers to Cape Town it is a must to visit.

Of the most stunning nature I've ever visited.. It is one of the seven wonders of the world. The scenery is breathtakingly beautiful. There are several hiking trails to the top and also the cable way. It's affordable and worth it. There are also on top of the mountain facilities to eat or drink something delicious.

A true wonder . The table mountain is worth every praise. We had tried to up the mountain on a few occasion but poor weather prevented it. We finally made the trip on January thus year my advice is to buy your tickets online not only are they cheaper they save you time and you avoid long queues. The view from the top, priceless picturesque... my family truly loved the experience. A must when in captain.
View over Capetown. Awesome experience with a fantastic view over Capetown. My advice though is to pre book tickets to avoid the ques

Table Mountain Cableway- Spectacular views, great experience. A must see. Stand in awe of the panoramic views from the top of Table Mountain and the engineering feat of the cable car. Go early or buy tickets online
Who would have thought?. Who would have thought that a cable car ride could be so amazing! Spectacular 360 views of the ride up the mountain. Well worth the long wait to get on
Best ever Sunset. excellent place--- options to go -- Aerial cable way, hiking, trekking. Must to go if you are in capetown. Try to go at evening time. You cab witness best ever sunset in life.

Breathtaking family fun. I haven't been on the cable way or Table Mountain since I was a teen. The upgrade operates like a well oiled machine. Friendly staff, you can book your ticket on line which gives you faster entrance to the cable car, the cable car itself rotates 360 degrees so everyone sees the unbelievable view going up / down. The renovated restaurant on the mountain was brilliantly designed, queues go faster, it a self help with a variety of meal choices, you can sit down and eat. It is just a breathtaking experience as a whole, unmatched beauty!

fantastic views. managed to get onto cable car whilst sky clear on a misty daycable car was a must do for me but was very full of screeching people ,esp when the floor started to rotateviews where spectacular but able to appreciate them much more on way down when car much emptierwas extremely windy up to and didn't spend much time up there

Fun ride. this cable is quite fun, it turns 360 degrees on its way up and down so there are no bad seats--well actually no bad places to stand. in the very center of the cable car there are a few seats, if you feel you need them head for that area. We were not too crowded, I get a little claustrophobic and did not have any problems there at all. the ride is very scenic, and enjoyable and you can see the people who walk up as well as the route they take.

Mind the weather.. Two visits, the first in blue skies - great. The second however was when the clouds were swirling around the mountain - to be honest we were killing time before our flight. If conditions on the top are not suitable then there should be some mention of it at the ticket desk.
Must Do. I have been twice now - different seasons, and it is just a remarkable place with the most fantastic views if the weather is friendly.

Incredible views. The cable goes round so everyone gets a view. Having said this make sure you are early to avoid long lines. Don't make plans just go the first day the weather is good. they close if the weather is not good.

Amazing and thrilling. This is must visit. Worth every effort and money. The top of table mountain is a different place altogether. Its cool and windy and one of new nature wonders... The view from top is superb with blue ocean and mountains all coming together. Just loved the visit.

one of seven natural wonders. best views from top of mountain. Go on clear morning before crowded. Tram pictures are great. We had this trip included in our tour with GATE1 travel. Great company with good prices and fantastic guides. Gate1 gave us transportation, parking, services, and escort. Our guide with Gate1 mentioned that Table mountain is one of seven wonders of world. But also the smallest flora/fauna area in the world with the most diversity. Fantastic information and scenery with Gate1 and Table mountain in Cape town, SA

Fab views. I am not a fan of heights and this rotating cable car is quite scary for someone like me, but, the views are fabulous, you can see Table Bay, Cape town itself, the Lions Head and SOO many other things from up here. If you are in Cape Town and the sun is shining, it would be rude not to!

LEARN FROM OUR MISTAKE: Check the weather report before you go.. Check the Weather! We didn't, and it bit us in the backside! Despite visiting in the summer, we went on a day with low visibility, freezing temps, and rain. By the time we made it up to the top, we spent five to 10 minutes hiking around, saw nothing but clouds, and got in line to go back down. Our fault, but still a pricey investment for a family of four.

Amazing experience! A must on any Cape Town to-do list. Beautiful views with a revolving floor to make sure everyone gets to see everything! Just make sure you have enough time as the walk at the top takes a while and the lines down can get long to the end of the day.

Flying with angels. A very safe and unique experience ascending up one of the seven modern wonders of the world. The cable car is well maintained. In summer the ques may be a bit long, but it is definitely worth the wait.
Fantastic views.. The cable car is one of only two(the other is in Palm Springs) that rotates as it ascends. Great views from the top!
Get the tickets online !. Make sure you get the tickets online to avoid crazy line up in the ticket office.Morning and sunset time are better to see the view from above!

YOU CAN'T VISIT CAPE TOWN AND MISS OUT ON A RIDE ON THE TABLE MOUNTAIN AERIAL CABLEWAY. You can't go to Cape Town and not go on the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway...it's part of travelling tradition...and those who know about tradition know something became a tradition for a reason...that being...this is an awesome experience....best view of Cape Town...awesome standing on top of Table Mountain...one of those things you can say, "I've been there, done that!" Don't miss out on this ride - it's worth the price.

Dramatic Views. As soon as you arrive in Cape Town head for the cableway if clear. It can be days of fog and wind which will make it impossible to visit. Visited in late afternoon so could stay for sunset which was really magical. Seeing it was early winter there were no crowds so could really take in the dramatic landscape. An experience you will never forget.

Revolving floor. What a surprise... You get into the cable car, and the floor revolves, so everyone no matter where they are standing gets a 360 degree view. We cheated and got the cable car both up and down the mountain. Well worth it as the views are amazing, and you can go for a walk when you're up there. Take your time and enjoy the views.
Really impressive. The 360 revolving views on the way up are really cool. Good organisation, world class. wait times displayed and adhered to

Breathtaking Ride with a Spectacular View. The cable car is a massive vehicle. Manned by an operator, the passenger floor rotates 360 degrees during the trip. This provides a nice view for all riders. A picture is taken prior to departure. On return a clever edit places the rider in various areas of the attraction. We almost never buy them however purchased this one. The cable car closes during high wind so check before you leave. Parking is along the roadside, requiring an uphill walk to the ticket counter. VISA is a sponsor, so bring that or cash. Food and drink at the top are very good.

Worth It!! Don't miss it!. We took the trip to the top to Table Mountain as part of our Grand Circle tour of southern Africa, but even if it had not been part of the itinerary, we would have done it on the basis of TRIPADVISOR reviews and a last minute suggestion by a friend who's parents live in Capetown. The wait was very short, because we went up as a group. My wife has acute fear of heights, but after sitting on the floor a couple of minutes, changed her mind -- if she could overcome her fear to make the journey up & down the mountain, so can you.The car rotates so everyone gets to see all views on the way up & down, but the best sight is at the top. Take the trip with enough time to explore up there. No matter what the weather, be prepared -- it rained while we were up there, but not at ground level. Also take binoculars with you. Temperatures were considerably milder than at sea level.

Excellent view of surrounding area. Went up the cablecar to a fantastic view of Capetown and the surrounding area, there were easy walking trials at the top, with alot of signage. the cable car ride was smooth, stopped at the gift shop.

What an Innovation!. Having used this facility annually since 2004 the improvements are massive, from the improved queueing/ticketing fCi,I ties to the restaurant/gift shop options. All of thAt aside the awe inspiring feeling of being atop the 'table' and looking across the magnificent surrounds.... Speechless!

Not to be missed. What an exciting trip on the cableway. Fastest lift I have ever been on. Not to be missed in Cape Town. Beautiful views all the way up and of course from the top. worth the price of the ticket. LInes move quickly

Effecient & Nice Way to Get Up Table Mountain. The Aerial Cableway was a good way to get to the top of the mountain. It only takes a few minutes and affords you with excellent views on the way up. The car actually rotates, so everyone will get a good view on the way up and down.
Great Views. get an early start because the clouds move in unexpectedly and you may not see much and may get wet.
Long lines, but worth the wait. Fun experience and breathtaking views from the top. The lines are very, very long. Consider buying tix on-line before heading to the mountain. Parking is limited.

Best Cable Car!. The cable car staff and facilities were very good! I sometimes feel a bit wobbly on cable cars. It was a very smooth ride and the fact that it turned as it rose was beautiful as you got the view from all sides. They also have some panels missing so that you don't have to take photographs through glass which was very helpful.
Fabulous!. An exciting trip up to Table Mountain. The revolving floor in the cable car gives an ever-changing view.
Awesome views!. Very cool views of Cape Town all the way. The line to get up the mountain, however, was horrendously long. Go early or get a guide and hike up/

Fun way up Table Mountain. This is definitely the easy way to get up Table Mountain. You might walk (or rather hike), but this would for sure take a lot more effort and time. Despite the warning in various guide books, I've never encountered a line at the ticket counters that took more than 5 minutes to clear on the three occassions (consecutive days, though different times) I was there. It's not really cheap (about 20 Euro), but it's worth the money. They are fair enough to tell you about visibility on the top and explicitly warn you about low or even no visibility. The ride takes about 8 minutes and the gondola turns 360 degrees during the ride, so no matter where you are standing at the beginning, you get the full view. With good visibiblity you have a perfect view over the bay, watch the hikers on their laborious way up or even spot a rock dassie among the rocks.

Great Ride. We enjoyed the cable car which took us over 700 meters to the top of Table Mountain and back down. The view on the way up and down was just stunning and we enjoyed every second of the ride.

Amazing trip with fabulous views. Spotted the top of Table Mountain was clear on the morning of our trip so rallied the troops and booked our tickets online..As it was the middle of winter here we didn't need to have done as there was no queue when we arrived. But we did notice the long sunshades baring 2 hr waits used for the height of summer.Pictures taken before we walked into the cable car ,( good value. )We were met by friendly staff and entered the cable car. Easy access for wheelchairs and buggies. During the smooth trip to the top the cable rotated so everyone had chance to see the amazing view, including the hikers making their way up the mountain. Something which needs to be done in a group. My friends were not adventurous enough to take this option. If you like amazing views of the surroundings you really need to take this trip.. Chose a day when the top is clear though.

Don't Miss It. I recommend this trip to everyone. The cable car ride was amazing and the view was absolutely breathtaking. I could have spent all day up there but it was starting a pretty chilly day. I loved it.
Great ride to the top of Table Mountain. Fantastic views and fast trip to the top without the sweat and challenges of hiking up. Totally worth it!

Memorable View. From the drive up Table Mountain to the cable car station to the top of the mountain, each moment is memorable. A must do when visiting Cape Town. Only once you get to the top can you truly appreciate the magnificence of this city.

A first for an aerial tram!. This one rotates, so you needn't worry about scrambling to be first aboard so you'll get a view spot. Just try to stand by the glass -- anywhere -- and sooner or later you'll have that enviable view down to the city. A great idea!

View is awesome and breath-taking from the top of table mountain. One of the wonders of the world.Everything is of the highest standard.From security through to safety and other attractions on the mountain.Views from the top of table mountain is breath-taking.

Amazing views. I dislike that when people gets there for first time, they do not know how it Works the Aerial cableway cabin, and they are not kind when finding a window to have the best view. After first usage of it, when they get down, everybody remains calm. And i like how the staff isvery proud of this attraction

Wonderful experience, especially for those in wheelchairs. i was so excited to get in the cableway to get to the top of Table Mountain. There is wheelchair access through an elevator to the cableway. Staff is very helpful. It can get crowded and once a person just jumped in front of my view knowing I was in a wheelchair and couldn't see over him. Made him move and continued to enjoy myself. The bottom turns around 360 degrees so you see all aspects. There is a toilet for people with disabilities up top. Be warned, once on top, the terrain is rocky and steep. It can be difficult for those in manual wheelchairs. So unless you are very strong, bring someone strong to help push. A cafe and store is up top too. Worth every penny. Also be warned...if it is too windy, they cant use the cableway and you have to climb down the paths. Not sure how that would work if you are in a wheelchair.
Must do!. Must do if in Cape Town, if possible wait for day with no wind (if windy cable car will not be open) take the red tour bus as it can de difficult getting a taxi back

On Top of the City. By far the easier way to get to the top of Table Mountain is to take the aerial cableway. The trip itself is smooth and very efficient - the challenges for any visitor are, depending on the time of day or more importantly the time of year, finding a place to park your car near the lower station and waiting in line to purchase a ticket.For tourists I would recommend a couple of ways you can avoid these potential pitfalls - firstly book you ticket on-line and avoid any queues or delays and also if you take a hop on hop off tour bus it is a great way to get close to the lower cable station without the hassle of finding a place for your car.The trips in the cable car are great - the platform inside the cable car rotates so you get a 360 degree view going both up and down. Of course, the whole purpose of taking the cable car is to reach the top of the Mountain - you will not be disappointed when you get there! Stunning views from all over the top of the mountain and some great walks also.

September, nice weather with hot chocolate. I went there on September 2014, unfortunately the sky was not open, cloudy, but the weather is awesome, i got amazing hot chocolate up there, say that this is must see place when you visit CT

Awesome!. Table Mountain is a wonderful place to visit and the cable car is part of that. It offers a smooth fast ride with the clever revolving floor allowing all the passengers to get amazing views.

Rushing up to heaven. One attraction you shouldn't miss when visiting Cape Town would be the Table Mountain Cableway. The cable cars are new and safe and do not accommodate more passengers than they are supposed to. They are also quick and comfortable enough - you will not get claustrophobic. The operators are professional and ensure the safety and comfort of everyone. The view? Well it is one beautiful sight!

Great views. What a stunning way to see table mountain ,i have never cried so much a candain woman was almost crying at the hight of views , loved it what a trip ,will come again the cable car just goes up and up and up its a nightmare for anyone with vertigo

On a clear day........ This is a great place to visit....I wish we had more time so we could have hiked up or down or both! The tram makes it easy to get to the top! Go early and spend time walking around....a site in Cape Town NOT TO MISS! Also, go on a clear day so you don't miss out on any views!

It turns and you get a little tour!. I admit, I wanted to hike but felt too lazy and so only hiked up to the cable car (don't walk here after dusk!). The walk was pretty exhausting already but getting on the cable car and going up is super easy. During peak season, I highly advise you to order your ticket online as you can skip the massive queues. There is no ATM down at the cable car but you can use visa card.What I loved about the cable car is that it has an open window so you can take proper pictures and the bottom turns so you get a 260 degrees view without moving (which is hard when it's crowded). One of the staff will give a little talk about the mountain etc and it is really nice to hear. There is also some cheesy music playing. The last cable car goes down at 6pm sharp so I was able to see the sunset from up there and it was spectacular! One last important tip: in winter, Cape Town often gets a nasty fog but more often than not this fog just collects in the valley and going up on the mountain you can end up having the most brilliant sunshine! You can check it by going up to Signal Hill or driving further away from the city. Or by just going for it. It is beautiful either way.

Fantastic Views!. This was a great way to see Table Mountain and views of Cape Town, SA. The Cableway rotates 360 degrees so that you can see everything. The only drawback is that not everyone gets to stand right next to the exterior walls. If you are short, you may only see the backs of people standing in front of you. Not much the cable company can do about that, but if you aware of the problem, worm your way up to the front of the line. Or you can stand behind a group that tries to walk with the turning view and then stand in the space they vacate as they follow the floor. Be aware there are high winds on top of Table Mountain, and that if they are to strong, they may close the aerial cable car down. It is also a lot cooler on top of the mountain so be sure and bring a jacket and, of course, sun screen.

Stunning view and strenuous hike down. Took the cable car to the Table Mountain and enjoyed the spectacular view on a clear winter day with almost no view and a golden sun. Apart from the view on the top the savannah-like, flat nature at the top was stunning and unique. Decided to take the 2 hours walk down to benefit from the change of angles and found it incredibly beautiful - but also quite a steep hike even going down. If not in reasonable physical shape be prepared for a couple of days with sore thighs, knees and legs as the steep climb down really is a strain. But still worth it !!

Table Mountain a must,. We went to the top of table mountain and it was a great experience, the best bit was the cable car which goes straight up vertically, the view from the top of the mountain is awesome, really worth the trip ,

Timeless. With the limited time we had available, this was probably the best way we spent our time. With a Fantastic View of the City & Surrounds, something to bite on & Friendly Staff. We could not have asked for more.

Well done!. We saved this for a sunny calm day during our Cape Town visit. There is parking on the road up, but also once you pass the entry point, there are actually parking spaces. A Saturday with lots of visitors, but no wait more than 10 minutes. The ride up is smooth, the floor rotates so you get a panoramic view, so don't worry where you stand you will see it all. At the top there is so much room to wander around and enjoy the views that even though there were lots of people you did not feel crowded. Watch the weather forecast and plan this activity on a calm day, others have told me it was not so nice on windy cloudy days. Views are spectacular and we could see all the way to the peninsula down toward Cape of Good Hope where we had traveled the previous day. Very nice activity.
Will visit again!. I know the view is really good, but the weather was really cloudy when I got there. However, the cable car was awesome! clean, comfortable, kind staff, and quick!
Amazing Trip. I have been up to Table Mountain twice and both times were absolutely amazing. The park is kept beautifully and it is well worth a trip.

Oh what a view. I enjoyed this experience which seemingly look frightening at first. the ride up the mountain was pretty smooth and quick. the view from the mountain top is breathtaking and one needs to see for themselves. I would however advise people not to go too late as later the winds on the mountain can really spoil the fun.

Tourists in our own city. Beautiful winter day, sun shining sky blue so we headed off to the cable car along with MANY other tourists. Lots of cars parked but no queues. Being locals we have an unlimited use card so could go straight to the cable car entry. The staff were very welcoming, treated us as if we were visitors to the city and the cable car. It was nice to be around tourists, excited children taking the ride up to a magnificent view. We could see as far as fishhoek, splendid morning.

Stunning views!. I have been to Cape town several times, but due to weather conditions, were not able to reach the top by cable car. But on this occasion we were able to reach the top and the views are stunning. A memorable place, a place for the bucket list.
Top of the World. Exceptional service from well-trained staff. The views on top of Table Mountain are unparalleled. There is a reason why it is one of the natural wonders of the world.

amazing view. The ride on the cable car to table mountain is quick but the view is stunning as the cable car rotate as it ascends and descends, but is advisable to stand close to the window or you will miss out.

Breathtakingly spectacular view. We went up Table Mountain after 25 years. The "new" cable cars are absolutely beautiful - clean and very modern. The 360 degree rotating platform gives you just that - a complete view of the scenery as you go up and come down on the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway.

not to be missed experience. not to be missed experience to see the "top of South Africa" and views galore. Make sure to take the tour offered by the ranger staff (it takes about an hour) and it's well worth it!
Table mountain. Loved the view from top. Pls check on their website if they will be open on the day you want to take the cable car. It's worth it!!

Views for all to Lions Head and more in rotating Cableway. For the less athletic this gives wonderful views for all as the cable car rotates 360 whilst asceding and descending. Key is to get your spot next to any window for you photo opportunity!Buy your tickets online in advance to avoid endless queues and there is also a financial benefit to buying in advance.

Awesome. The views from the top of Table Mountain are breathtaking. We were advised to visit Table Mountain on the first clear day of our stay in Cape Town to avoid disappointment as the summit is very often covered in cloud and the cable car is sometimes cancelled due to high winds. We arrived at about 9 a.m., bought tickets straight away, luckily avoiding the queues which had built up by the time we came down. We only had 45 minutes on the top as we were on an organised tour but if we had gone independently we would have allowed time to explore the numerous paths to maximise on our visit. Check out their website www.tablemountain.net where amongst other useful information you will find some 'Quick tips' under 'Plan your trip'. It certainly answered many of my queries. A thoroughly worthwhile and memorable visit.

Ride up walk down!. The Table Mountain cableway is a fantastic piece of engineering the upper station is perched precariously on the corner edge of the Mountain, the ride is amazing because the floor of the car revolves giving everyone aboard a proper view. On my way up I noticed that there where a great many people walking both up and walking down the mountain, so when I got to top I decided to have a go at walking down, so, armed with a bottle of water and help from a local guide I set off. It was one the best things I have ever done! The Trail comprising of random sized lumps of rock snakes horizontally and vertically up to the summit and is quite steep in places great care is needed in placing your steps as the track is very uneven. But honestly if you are fit enough I would recomend attempting it, the the atmosphere is fantastic there were lots of people doing it both going up and coming down and everyone was so friendly there were shaded places where I could stop and chat to folk. It took me two hours to complete but it was two hours well spent!
Views to Die For. The fact that it turns as it goes up did not agree with my stomach - but the view was amazing. I just had to keep telling myself I was fine and to concentrate on looking at the view

Revolving Floor Gives 360 Degree View. Table Mountain is only 1000 m high yet it affords a magnificent view and is particularly dramatic when it has white clouds rolling over it. The mountain is not always in view and one must be willing to get to the cable car as soon as there is a clearing. It rises steeply and dramatically while the people inside revolve on a moving floor affording views of the entire Cape Peninsula. Table Mountain itself has garnered the prestigious title of being a UNESCO World Heritage site. One should dress warmly as it can be cold and windy on the top. And too much wind means the cable can't operate. Fynbos is the predominant vegetation type. And there are a number of trails and a small restaurant.

Visit table Mountain at around midday. Had the opportunity to go up Table Mountain in the cable car to kill some time before returning by air to Gauteng. Although I have frequently hiked up Table Mountain in the past, their is no more comfortable and easy way of doing is as per cable car. The view from the top is unsurpassed, in all directions, but especially towards the nearby coasts and the sea line in general. The Cape is truly one of the most beautiful places in the world, especially if you look at it from table Mountain; a must see!
On top of the World. Touristy but with good reasons , Happy I did not miss it.. The view from on top is really quite incredible a bit of a wait to return down the Tram. Quite the engineering marvel

If you visit Cape Town - you have to do this.. Certainly a must see place! Great to spend the afternoon milling around. Make sure you pack sun screen. Lovely little cafe at the top for well deserved refreshments. Great for pictures!
Priceless Views. Wonderful day out for anyone. Beautiful views from the cable car as you go up and wonderful when you get to the top too.

The way to go!!!. One of the best ways to get up the Table Mountain.And the easiest way by far.when getting in the cabin, there is no fighting to find a good place, as the cabin turns around 360 degrees before getting to the top.A pity when too much wind on top or overcast the Aerial Cableway is closed, and can stay closed for days.so, when arriving in Cape Town and the Mountain is open, go straight up there.

What a view. For those Hardy enough you can walk up but for those time precious and enjoy a nice view then this is the way to go!!! , the queue can be massive so book on line before hand and rock up at your time and off you go after a small wait. Amazing views and you ascend and worth the money alone .

Fun ride. Be prepared for lines to get the cable car depending on the time of day - but once you get on you know it is worth the wait. Views are spectacular and the car floor rotates as you go up. So no matter where you stand you will see the magnificent views.

Wonderful view. We were lucky - the clouds had disappeared so up we went in the cable car which does a 360 degree turn so everyone can see the view. The view from the top is amazing - both sides of the mountain ! There are trails at the top to walk and shops and a couple of places where you can buy snacks, sandwiches or something a little more substantial. A must do if you're in Cape Town.
Scenic Cape Town. Was a great ride to the top of the mountain. The inside cab spins while you are traveling so you get a full view all around.

Awesome views. The trip to the top of Table Mountain via the Aerial Cableway is a great way to see different aspects of Table Mountain. It is a very smooth trip and even those who are nervous about heights enjoyed the ride. Large gondolas with 360 degree views enabled everyone to take some great photos.

A Must See on a Clear Day. Our first visit was a wonderfully clear and sunny Sunday, the views were incredible. We arrived via the Hop on Hop off Red city Tour and stop #7 was right in front. We waited for 20 minute to ride up with some disorganization in the line and the then waited 60 min. to ride back down, it was again chaotic with the lines blending together. There was a nice restaurant at the top which served beer and wine with a selection of cold and hot foods. It is considered to be one of the of 7 new natural wonders of the world. The cable car has a revolving deck with 2 open windows so there is no need to worry about getting the best viewing spot although some tourists did not heed the instructions. For those who are more energetic, there are several hiking options, ascent and descent as well as trails on top. Bring comfortable shoes and warm clothing with the opportunity for amazing photos.

Stunning views as you rotate. Definitely the best way to get to the top of Table Mountain (walking is the alternative!). The ride is not a long one and the views as you climb to the top are superb. Parts of the cars have open areas to enable photographers to have an uninterrupted view. Apart from the very centre of the car which has some bench seating and does not move, the car rotates slowly to give passengers a 360 degree view as they travel up or down the mountain. The ride up does not take that long but perhaps is it not ideal for vertigo sufferers.
View not to be missed. AMAZING view from the top. Cable car a bit crushed but obviously because it is so popular. There is sometimes a very long queue dont be put off it is worth the wait
not for the faint at heart. Beautiful view from the top. Cable car is simple to take, very organized. Buy tickets online in advance and just walk right on.

The reserve in magnificent and a treat each time. The reserve, the flora is just exceptional, the walk is good and an awesome mornings entertainment. There is just so much to to see in around, on the way up and down, a simple must do if the outdoors is your thing, splendid

Quick way to get on the Mountain. Cable car is not the cheapest but quickest way to get on the Table Mountain; but be aware of queues; book ticket online, then you will have a shorter queue; however if you have time and fit, claim: this is most rewarding way to get to the top of the table Mountain. The view and experience is unforgettable.
Highly recommended. This is a must for ALL!!! The view up on the mountain one cannot describe, but have to experience. The tickets are expensive for the average South African, but worth it!

Spectacular Views of the Mother City. Fantastic panoramic views of cape Town. The cable car trip up is pretty cool itself. Walk on the paths and take in all the sights of Cape Town with fantastic photo view points. Go early in the peak summer months as the queues can get very long.

Unique in the world . Truly wonderful experience. Last time I went to the top of the mountain was In 1993. It is a great treat in the now revolving cable car. Once on top you can see the most wonderful panoramic views of the peninsula and north over the city bowl and Table Bay. Eating and drinking facilities at the top and wonderful walks. See the cape dassie indigenous animals to the mountain. If in Cape Town on a good day with low wind and good visibility an absolute must.

Spectacular spectacular. Fantastic view on a clear day; various walks available depending your ability and time up there. Cafe at the top is worth a visit too, lots of yummy to choose from as well as beer, wine and a bit of sparkling! We sat outside eating lunch watching the clouds roll in drinking bubbly! Very nice
Worth the trip up the mountain. The cable car up Table Mountain is fast and secure. Once at the top you will have panoramic views of Cape Town. It is best visited on sunny days with little wind.
It's a must in Cape Town!. Be prepared to wait, but it's worth the time once you're on top! I don't know what is the plain B in case of clouds, it may occur quite often...

Wow. Loved this experience! You can spend as much time on the top of the mountain as you like and there's a fantastic cafe up there. I wish I had worn a cooler top - thought it would be freezing and wore a big jacket but got hot walking around. On that point also wished I had worn runners or walking shoes - slip ons or flats are not be good enough for the bumpy terrain and all the walking required.

A Most Beautiful View.. Riding up to Table Mt. is wonderful. The floor rotates. The view from the top is spectacular! It is quite windy but when the wind gets too high they close the cableway. Get there early to avoid the crowds.
Check it out . Worth a the stop for the views, chilly at the top come prepared! .. Saw some wildlife but mostly greenery and crazy views from the top.. Boy is that high! Take the hop on hop off bus
Table mountain. Easy and fast way how to get on the top of the Table Mountain. It is wise to check the weather conditions as for safety during bad weather the Cableway does not work.

Even on a cloudy day - a spectacular ride up. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is one of Cape Town's "must-do" things to do. It is the quickest and easiest way to get to the top of iconic Table Mountain ad offers magnificent views of the city on the way up in your rotating cable car. No visit to Cape Town is complete with a ride on the Aerial Cableway!
Excellent!!. This is one of the best tourist attractions in South Africa. It is a must. The service is seemless, safety is fantastic and it is world class.

Excellent View. Lucky to get a good visibility (Mist free day). We had a fantastic view. My friend went there a few days later. She did not have that much of luck as the visibility was poor. Well organized and informative tour guide information.
Aerial view. It was a great experience with a fabulous 360degree view of Cape Town. It is better to visit as early as possible because there are so many waiting to get into the entrance.

Best way to the top. An expensive 5 minute ride to the top, and return, but their is no other way up, except a very long walk. The views going up and down are nice. The greatest views are on top. So save your photo taking till you get on top and walk around to the many scenic overlooks. Make sure you check the weather before going, otherwise you will not get to see the great views of Capetown. Also bring warmer clothes with you and good walking shoes, as it can be very windy and sometimes cold on top.

Great views. As you would expect great views of Cape Town but what we certainly did not expect was that in every direction you look from the top of table mountain there are exceptionally spectacular views. Also there is a well defined walking route to follow with clear information boards at every view point, so if like us you do not have time to take a guided tour you can enjoy your visit on a self guided basis. It was rather expensive for the cable car trip but so well worth it we can not remember what we paid, but the views will last us for the rest of our lives.

Beautiful views. The whole experience was very positive. We spent over 2 hours making pictures whilst walking around. Breath-taking views from the mountain and whilst cable car takes you there. I would like to mention that cable car revolves around. There is also a restaurant on the top of the mountain. Would recommend for every visitor of Cape Town.

Amazing Views on a sunny day. My Guide picked the best day to go so I was lucky.A contrast to my 1971 trip on the red-topped car(outside the entrance as a relic today!)The movement of people was efficient.I don't like heights-my Guide organized for me to sit on the little seat so I didn't have to stand on the moving floor so it was a breeze.Very quick trip up & down.Take a warm jacket-it's very cold at the top even if it's warm before you leave.The views are fabulous-well worth the trip.A must do in my opinion.

Fab views of amazing Cape Town. Amazing views from the top and good guides to follow as you walk around. The revolving cable car adds to the experience. Well worth a visit, but take a jacket or jumper, it can be chilly.

Panoramic views. this is Cape Town, 360 degrees of awesomeness, so beautiful. You can see Robbin Island, miles of coast line, breathtaking. The restaurant up there is really good, I had lunch with s glass of Brut and enjoyed the views. Bucket list for sure!
Super !. Its fast, quick and convenient. WE made bookings online and it was easy way to get to get the tickets.
An amazing attraction. High quality, well managed, very safe, professionally operated, very friendly staff - a world class attraction by any measure

Great ride. Going up to Table Mountain by the Cableway is a trip in itself. the views are outstanding and the ride gets really interesting when you are approaching the top since it seems that the rocks are coming at you really fast. Really thrilling.
Smooth & Easy. What can you say...it's a cable ride. But although I am not a fan of heights; the ride did not scare me. It was smooth & easy; and beats walking any day.

Table Mountain - Highest stage in Southern hemisphere. A trip to cape town is incomplete without a visit to the Table mountain. the aerial cableway is the best way to explore the best natural stage anyone can see on earth. There are two cable cars which run continuously during peak seasons and holidays and transfer visitors to the top of the Peak and back quickly. The cable cars can hold around 20-25 people a trip. It has glass enclosures and provides a good view of the mountains and the city during its ascend and descend trips. Furthermore, the Car rotates while it climbs and hence the occupants get a 360 degree view of the place. It operates quite smoothly and offers good view of the Hills, Gardens and the city. Children surely love this and most adults also do. The view from the top is breathtaking. It is better to spend atleast 2 hours at the top for some walking and photo ops. Also check the timings of the last trip to the base and ensure that you are out of the peak without fail. The weather can get very rough there at the top of the mountain and night stay is definitely not recommended. Take care.
A View to Die for?. The cable car was smooth, the views dynamic The Trip safe, the Queue was small, the vale for money Good, truly a trip to the New Wonder of the world.Just do it!

High in the ( cloudy ) sky. We really enjoyed the adventure of taking the cableway to the top of Table Mountain...spectacular views, efficient service...but the Cape Town weather is unprectable, as windy & raily winter approaches. So , be prepared , with a raincoat and warm clothes, for a misty view. But when the mist parts, enjoy the vistas of cityscape and seascape !

How Else Are you Going to Get There?. How else are you going to get there? Actually, if you have the time a walk up path is available which does not apprear to be too strenuous (from the cable car perspective!).
Clean bathrooms a plus!. Best way to get to Table Mountain, and you can buy a one way fare if you are up for a hike down. Fast and efficient, friendly staff, phenomenal views, a must do when in CT.

Awesome. During the busy season, parking could be a major problem. My advise is to get there early. The views from the cable car and also from the top is absolutely breathtaking. Planning to go again early 2016 to watch the sunset
Great ride. Spectacular views as you go up and down. Need to keep an eye on the web site as it does not always run depending on the weather. Advised to book on-line as then you avoid queues

if open, go.. The Table Mountain cable car is an experience. If weather is clear, go. The cars shut down for wind or fog. Weather in Cape Town can change in minutes. Depending on crowds, wait can be 10 to 30 minutes. Well worth it. You rapidly ascend 3000 meters in minutes. The floor revolves in a 360 swing to provide maximum camera opportunities. If possible, the top of Table Mountain is better. If weather is clear, cancel everything else and go.

A View From The Top Of the World. This is the best way (except for hiking) to get to the top and down from Table Mountain. You can buy one way Up, one way Down, or roundtrip tickets. The easiest thing to do is buy online, the tickets are good for several days which is good because the cable cars will be shut down if it's too windy or other weather forces a stop. This, too, can be looked up inline BEFORE you show up at the meeting point. The cable car is especially cool because it does a 360 degree rotation as it travels, so a great view is to be had by all. A "don't miss" attraction of Cape Town.

A MUST see if in Cape Town. First of all if you are going there, take the topless sightseeing city tour bus, they let you hop on/hop off, so you don't have to park and have a long walk up the hill. The cablecar ride gives you a fabulous view as you go up but once you are on the Mountain, the views of the whole area are stupendous. TAKE water! It is very hot on the mountain.

nice quick ride with good views. The views from the cableway were great. We took the kids special pass (where 2 kids are free with the parents buying return tickets). This was publicized only on their website.The lines could be a little better managed though.

Table Mountain cable ride. One of the "must do" if visiting Cape Town. We had pre-booked which was great, no queuesRotating floor is wonderful.Unfortunately the cloud came down on the mountain so it was all very misty. Entertained by all the dassies.

Rotate the view. Nothing to dislike on this adventure but you do have to wait if it's busy. Scenery is delightful but take an extra layer for if a cloud comes over the mountain it can get very cold and miserable very quickly.

Worth the fare. Table Mountain is great for the views and the hikes, but the Cableway alone is worth the fare. Lines can be a bit long, particularly returning at the end of the day, but the ride is smooth and the views magnificent.
Ooooooh scared. The trip up was scary, I didn't realise the floor would also be turning.Quite un nerving if your not expecting it.

Never tire of Table Mountain. Have visited 4 times, each time there were queues but these shortened very quickly and we soon got onto the Cable way. It is easy to book tickets online but we have never done so and not had any problems.People tend to rush on and get by the open "windows" . There is no need as the cableway rotates and everyone will see a fantastic view with good opportunity to take photos.
Surprising. The idea of revolving floor is a masterstroke. Those that rushed on board for the best vantage points were quickly disappointed. A great attraction to an equally stunning location.

A highlight of any trip to Cape Town. This has to be a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. With views reaching tens of miles, the vantage point which is provides is fantastic. The fauna and flora is intruiging, to say the least, especially if you are fortunate enough to see one of the dassies ehich live there.

WALKS. We took a walk, not knowing how long or how the terrain was, out to Maclear's Beacon Point. It wasn't actually planned, we just started walking to see where it was.The walk was nice although very long, about just over an hour and a half, we couldn't see much ahead of us, as the weather was overcast on the day. It would have been nice if the time to walk it and the layout of the terrain as to easy, medium or difficult, was printed on the pamphlet that they give with your ticket. Also if there is an alternate route back as it tends to get boring going back the same way that you came.Anyhow it was quite exciting and after all the walking, hanging onto the chains to help us up and down over the rocks at one place, it was very enjoyable.
Oh what a ride. The staff werepolite and helpful. The new cable cars offer a smooth and trouble free ride. The day was clear and views spectacular

A must-do!. I have done this may times, and it is always memorable. Pack a jersey and scarf as it can get very cold up there. Try to book online to avoid the queues which can be awful in season. There are also sunset specials in summer. Pack a picnic basket to enjoy at the summit. Spectacular views so bring your camera. Ethereal experience.

what a view. The cable ride to the top is amazing. The floor rotates to provide 360 views. The top of Table Mountain provides vistas of all of Cape Town. We brought lunch with us and sat literally above the clouds while enjoying panoramic views. It is well worth the trip. Do bring layers as it gets quite cool and windy.

Beautiful treat. This is a tourist and local MUST. On your birthday you can go up the cableway free of charge - otherwise it can be costly if you're a family. If it's just you then pay the fare... it all goes to a good cause :)The view is breathtaking. I must warn you that the trip itself is short but don't fret, you can always go again!!

Great Experience. The views are amazing and no matter how many times I visit, things look different depending in the weather. The queues are frustrating but if you choose your time carefully, these can be avoided (or reduced to 10 minutes or so).I did walk down once (many years ago) which was a great experience but tough on the knees as so many steps in the rocky pathway.My one word of advice if you are only in Cape Town for a short time - take this trip at the first opportunity or you could be disappointed as the cable car is closed when it is windy.

Nice Cape Town wiew. I am so scared if heights but I couldn't leave e Cape Town without visiting the famous Table Mountain. The ride is amazing. The lady that was operating the Car was very helpful. Oh my the buffet lunch was delicious compliments to the chef.

Great views...don't be afraid to explore!. I love table mountain. I have hiked up many of the different routes and generally take the tram down. Once you are at the top there are a few different trails to take. I recommend hiking out to the beacon. Takes about 30 mins to get there. From almost any view point there are incredible views of Cape Town, camps bay, Muizenburg and many more.The food service in the table mountain cafe is okay.
Scenic. Not to be missed. Offers a pretty view of entire Cape Town. Though the cable car covers a pretty good distance from the base to the top in a very short time, you would not realize the speed.
Pity we couldn't use the cable car. we took the hop on/off red bus up there but the wind was blowing too hard whilst we were there so couldn't do the cablecar - the views excellent.

Thrilling ride t Table Mountain. This cable car ride gives a super view of Cape Town from all sides and builds up ones expectations about the view from the top of the mountain. The only challenge in visiting Table Mountain is the cloud cover, one should be prepared to visit when its clear sky. It can be windy, so carrying appropriate clothing is a good idea.Best views of Cape Town is both on top of the mountain as well as while taking this cable car. Hope the lines are not long!

Its the best service came across in south africa. Very wel maintained and the staff is also very kind and helping.The ca. Rotating floor of the car give the classic and best views.Every thing is so perfect and wel managed.Love to see the management working to hard on it.

Walking on Sunshine. Breathtaking vistas that flow across mountaintops and seem to slip off the ocean's edge. The crisp fresh air & warming winter sun unwind your senses invigorate your soul! Definitely a must-do for visitors to our fair Cape
Excellent way to the top. To early to catch this ride before all of the tourists. Beats walking up. Best views of Cape Town. Gift shop is pricey.
Cape experience. The ride on the cable car up was amazing. The views of the entire city of Cape Town. The beautiful little restuarant on the top is amazing to just relax with a bottle of wine.

Worth doing depending on the cloud cover. We went up the cableway in the morning on Friday 1st May as part of a tour group. It was a public holiday and we waited 45 minutes before even getting to the ticket office. The return cost was 225 rand pp, about £12.50. South African pensioners do get a discount. The ascent takes only 7 or 8 minutes and the cable car floor rotates slowly with one complete revolution per trip so grabbing the front window doesn't work.There are 2 suggested walks. One 30 mins and the other about 50 minutes. The top is remarkably flat and their are prepared pathways but the terrain is much rougher if you wander off the path. Various viewpoints exist but it all depends on the weather. Thick mist spoiled any views over Cape Town on the ascent but the top was clear and the views to the South towards the Cape were very goodThere are a couple of cafes and some toilets but other than that there is no shelter whatsoever if the weather deteriorates. The mountain is not particularly high at 3,558 feet but windproof and waterproof clothing are advisable and in "iffy" weather essential. We visited in the morning and it was cloudy but by lunchtime the sun had burned off the mist & cloud. Bear this in mind if planning a visit

Amazing. When in Cape Town a visit to Table Mountain is a must see. The views are amazing especially on a clear day and sunsets are awesome. You can either walk along the easier shorter path's or walk all the way to the end of the mt. But be warned the wind can pick up quickly especially in summer to gale force South Easter so you can be disappointed when it blows for days on end. So make a visit your priority and work your trips around the miuntain

Natural Wonder of the World in Cape Town. Not even my fear of heights could keep me away from this. It is easy to understand why Table Mountain was voted as one of the seven Natural Wonders. Viewed from the city of Cape Town (and it dominates the city) it is awe-inspiring and the cable - car ride up to the summit is unforgettable. The cable car ascends at a brisk pace and in addition it rotates 360 degrees to give you an even more amazing view. Once at the top, you are able to roam around but are strongly advised to keep to the demarcated paths for your own safety. Apart from the stunning views of the Cape peninsular and the coast, you will also encounter dassies- furry rodent like creatures that wander about totally unconcerned by the presence of crowds of human visitors. Apparently their closest animal relation is the elephant, although to look at them it is hard to believe. There is a self-service cafe/restaurant at the top where you can sit and take in the stunning view over a cool drink. Be advised that the current South African phenomenon of "load shedding" (scheduled power cuts by area) even makes its way up here. This happened during my recent visit, and although generators were run to try and keep as much of the service running as possible, it meant a two hour queue to get bacj down. If you are not accessing the cable car lower station by private car or tour bus, you can make use of My Citi bus service 110 which will connect you with service 107 running between Camps Bay and the city centre. Service 110 runs every 10 minutes. If you are visiting Cape Town don't miss out on the cable car and the opportunity too look out over the southern end of the African continent.
Cool revolving Cable Cars. The trams are very well run, can handle large crowds easily and the cable Car revolve to give you a 360 degree view as you rise up the mountain side.

Cafe on top of the world. Nothing beats the view of this little cafe and it has a buffet type menu ( and although it is rather expensive on South African terms, the food is good)I would suggest they rather offer a set price for a buffet meal rather than on weight but I guess they cater for foreigners coming with pounds and dollars not us local yokals

Lovely. I bought my ticket on the red bus so got straight into a cable car. It revolved giving everybody a chance to see the view. The view from the top was stupendous. I was lucky, there was no wind and no clouds.

Must Do Tourist Attraction. As a local, I can safely say that the Cable Car experience to the top of Table Mountain is one of the best tourist experiences I have had anywhere in the world. A "must do" for every visitor to the Western Cape

Beautiful must visit. You have to visit Table Mountain, take the cable car or take a hike via Kirstenbosch. Either way you will have awesome amazing views. You wil see that Cape Town is one of the most beautiful places in the world. I love living here.
The beauty of Cape town view. This is an amazing ride, with rotating floor its fun fun fun. the top of the mountain is breathe taking.
