On top of the world. An absolute 'must do'.. Nobody should be nervous going in this cable car. It is professionally run, very stable and turns 360 degrees as you go up so you don't have to fight over the view!Make sure you make this trip on your first clear, wind free day in Cape Town as the cable car does not run when it is too windy or cloudy.At the top there is a bar and restaurant and lots of amazing well organised walks where you can see wild flowers and lots of little dassies (small animals).

Memorable visit on Table Mountain. We took the offer of the sunset special during the summer season. The staff were friendly, excellent array of food choice... reasonable prices. Views were memorable- definitely to repeat this next season. Souvenirs were very tourist orientated.. nothing a local would buy- but as a local I would not expect to purchase anything as a keep-sake to take home.. appreciated the opportunity to take a picnic up and just enjoy the specialness of our very own Wonder of the World in Cape Town. I will definitely recommend this as a tourist destination.

Up, up, and around. The top of Table Mountain must not be missed! When you cannot climb yourself due to age, disability, or time constraints, the cable cars are the way. Unlike most ski lift cable cars, this has a rotating floor that gives everyone a view. Only problem is that the cablr cars are shut down for wind and fog so you should plan on being flexible in your schedule. Very much worth your time!

Lovely Experience. This attraction is a must. The earlier in the day the shorter the wait for the cable car.The clearer the day the better the view!. We picked a cloudless day. There is a bit of a walk once the car was parked. It was a busy day. We probably waited about an hour or more to get our tickets for the cable car and then another half hour to get into the cable car. We just took it in stride! The guys lined up and the ladies sat in the shade - or browsed in the little stores and bought a couple of souvenirs! The stores also have sun hats and t shirts - of course. The ride up was good with great moving views. It was fun to walk around and look at the different areas of Cape Town. Walking around the mountain was lovely but do wear good walking shoes as the terrain can be quite uneven. There are some pathways but not everywhere. There is a restaurant fairly close to the cable car entrance as well as an ice cream shop and bathrooms. A great morning trip!
Best ride in the continent. The view is amazing giving you a variety of angles as you go up. But the car rotates and is crowded, so don't plan on great pictures.

Beautiful View. Table Mountain affords you a SPECTACULAR view of the entire city of Capetown. If you are afraid of heights...do NOT look down when taking the 4 minute ride to the top of the mountain via cable car. The only downside is if the top of the mountain is covered in clouds! Word of warning....BRING WARM CLOTHING...VERY WINDY and COLD up there. THe restaurant for lunch is QUITE CROWDED and the food is only ok.

Fantastic views. Due to very changeable weather the cable car can be closed at a moments notice. You just have to be lucky and if you are, you can enjoy the car turning slowly through 360% on the almost vertical ascension and descent. It was good. Even if you pre-order your ticket to avoid the ticket queue you may still also have to queue for access to the car. The view from the top is astounding. provided the weather is clear. A very reasonable and
amazing views. good fun, amazing views, cable cab fantastic turning 360 degrees. tip - buy your tickets on line if possible to avoid any queues.

Views. This was fantastic the table had a little mist which gave the mountain character and great photos the mountain itself has great walks and a fantastic restaurant for everyone with a great variety of food and drinks.

Great views. This is a must-see stop in Cape Town. If you're especially adventurous, you can climb up, but the cable car is really fun. The floor rotates (slowly), so you get views of different sided of the city as well as a sense of the ascent. It feels very safe.

Great scenery of Cape Town. It was great to go up the Tabe Mountain by Cableway. it is a great scenery but those who are fearful of heights should not attempt. gives one a lasting view of Cape Town city. From the mountain you have an overview of the City. You are able to see the famous Roben Island where the late Icon and great Leader Nelson Mandela was incarcerated for 27 years. This a must for any first-timer to Cape Town.
Breathtaking. Took the cable car up and down, very cool trip overall. The restaurant at the top was pretty amazing. Nothing like a glass of wine while you explore nature and a view from the top
Amazing views. Amazing views when we finally got up there but stood in a queue in the heat for 1.1/2hours because of an electricity shortage

What a ride!. This is iconic and certainly the most comfortable way to get to the top. The walking alternative is arduous. Love the fact that it revolves as you go up. Try to go at a quieter time either early in the morning or late afternoon - queues can get very long

One of the Most Spectacular Sights in Africa. No trip to Cape Town, South Africa, is complete without a rrip to the top of its iconic landmark: Table Mountain. Visitors join natives in looking toward the mountain every day, if not many times a day. It so dominates the horizon one cannot avoid looking at it. The fact the mountain is the site of interesting meterological phenomona makes it interesting and beautiful. Clouds from the cold south Atlantic just over the mountain roll in from the sea almost daily and sometimes hang just on the top to create the sight called by locals, "The Tablecloth on the Mountain." Table Mounntain is truly Cape Town's jewel and source of identity, even if a native has never made the trip to the top.For the visitor traveling to the national park on the flat top a choice of routes and methods are available. Most people will choose to purchase a ticket to make the five or six minute trip from the station located up on the base of the mountain to the top. Once on top you can eat at a nice cafe and hike on the many trails along the top. The views of the ocean, Cape Town and its harbor, and the dramatic other peaks between Cape Town and the sea are magnificant. Tickets are reasonably priced. Warning: in the middle of the day the line to buy a ticket and get on the tramway can be long, e.g. an hour or more. But if you order your tickets online beforehand or using a smart phone after you show up you get to go to the front of the line, making the wait as short as 15 minutes. You can also walk up on the relatively strenuous trail underneath the Tramway. Anyone in reasonably fit condition can make this hike in under a hourIf you are a serious rock climber you can go right up one of several solo or group climbing routes. Some outfitters offer adventure rapelling or absailing from the top for people who do not want to ride or walk down.However you get to the top of Table Mountain do so when the weather is clear. Once the ocean clouds roll in you will miss the fantastic views. Also note that the top of the mountain is often closed due to high winds. A prudent visitor will make the trip early on a clear morning on the first day you are in town. Delaying your visit may mean weather makes the visit unsuitable on the day you had planned to visit.

Can't Miss Experience. Table Mtn is the glue that holds the culture together and a trip up the rotating cable car is a must for every visitor. Check their Twitter site for visibility since the Mtn is often shrouded in mist. We spent the day getting on and off the open top bus and when visibility improved by mid afternoon we took advantage of the opening and went up. Hint...purchase tickets on line and shorten your wait time by half

Fabulous cars. The view from Table Mountain's aerial cable car is absolutely spectacular. I've been up twice (last month and 6 years ago) and were enthralled at how stunning it is.Not only do the cars rotate, they also have an open top window in 2 sections to give a clear view and fresh air experience.Stand by the edges for the best views, which everyone will get due to the 360° rotation. It's only a short trip, but one that I think is spectacular. It's pretty good value for money - and once you get to the top and see what Table Mountain has to offer, well that's priceless!

Nicely maintained. Saves lots of time to reach the top if you have time constraints.....Must do thing. Online booking is preferable to avoid que . It rotates 360° for great view provided weather is clear and crisp.
spectacular view. Great view from the cableway, could not go up Table mountain due to cloud cover, but got to see magnificent Cape Town from the cableway.

THE BEST VIEW OF CAPE TOWN!. This is a truly special trip and a lovely way to spend an afternoon. It's busy, but the queues go quickly. The views from the cable car and from the top of the mountain are worth seeing over and over again. We love having lunch on top of the mountain!

An absolute must! Free on Birthday. This is just such a touristy thing to do and it is magnificent going up in the cable car.On your birthday you take your ID and can go for free. Of course, you can just imagine how amazing the view is from the top of Table Mountain and there is a restaurant to go and eat and refresh.It is expensive, make no mistake, but it is an absolute must. Remember that the wind blows at the top of the mountain and it's often a lot colder than at the foot. Always take a jersey, snack and water along for just in case.Keep warm and safe!

Must Experience Views. This was not my first time going up the Aerial Cableway but since its become quite expensive. But if you don't want to walk up this is the only way up and up you must! The views from On top of Table Mountain is a must for every single person visiting Cape Town! For a family it just becomes quite expensive and if the weather turns everyone needs to go back down. But the ride up is very quick, its very full and crowded but not an issue. The views while going up is incredible and very safe. The floor turns while you go up and down giving you a wonderful view all around. You can buy only a one way ticket if you might decide to walk back down or visa versa. The new Cable cars takes a lot of people at once which is great.On the specific day we went there in December we stood in the Queue for just over 3 hours to go up and the rest of the family members who walked up waited on the mountain for more than an hour for us to get there so avoid on really busy times of the year unless you would rather walk. Definitely an experience you have to do atleast once. Remember to take something warm with.
Crowded, but worthwhile. The cable car can be crowded, but the whole unit rotates so you will get a 360 degree view as you ascend and descend.

Easiest way to get on top. The cable car allows you to get on top and enjoy the panorama without the dreadful sweats and pain of a hike. The views from the top are simply jaw-dropping. Book your tickets online so you can skip the queue.However, if you can, I would still recommand hiking, for the feeling of accomplishment and because it's free!
dont go up if it is cloudy. The view is really great if the sky is clear.Its R225 return for adults.But one can opt for a one way ticket and either climb or descend the other way.

Do not miss the panoramic views. The ride up is a must. The view from top is magnificent. The cableway is very efficiently run. There is short climb after getting off but the walkways are well laid out and gives a fantastic view though on early mornings you may have a heavy cloud cover below you which blocks the view.
A must-see in Cape Town!. Absolutely stunning views- but the friendly Dassies (big rodents found all over SA) were our favorite haha.

The Way to See table Mountain. Unless you are a mountain goat, the way to get to the top of Table Mountain is on the cable car. Get your ticket on-line and make sure you print it out in advance--otherwise, you still may have to cue up to pick it up. Show up with your ticket in hand and just proceed on. My best advice is go for sunset. The last car up is 5 pm and in May the sun sets at 6 which is ideal. The last car down is at 6 pm, the photos that you will get are ideal!!!!! By the way, have your hotel call ahead to ensure the cable car is running. It stops when it is windy and the winds can start up in the afternoon. If you are on the mountain, they sound an alarm warning you that they will be shutting it down so you can hurry and hopefully still get down.Enjoy!!!

table mountain. a most exciting experience. the day we went it was not too busy so it was great. all the staff were very helpful and informative and when we got back to the hotel my friend realised that she had left her cardigan on the mountain. A quick phone call ascertained that it was there and when we went back it was waiting for us. very good service

Keep warm at the top!. R 225 for adults and R 110 for kids - return tripThe "Rotair" cars carry 65 passengers and run on a double cable, making them much more stable in high wind, and giving a faster journey of 4–5 minutes to the summit. The floors of the cars rotate through 360 degrees during the ascent or descent, giving passengers a panoramic view.Once you are at the top - make sure you have some seriously warm clothes. A hat / beannie is a very good idea. The toilets a the top work on a septic tank system. This system was not smelling good when we were at the top and so did not eat the restaurant because the smell was seriously off putting!All in all a great thing to tick off your bucket list!

great. You got to go as soon a you see the cloud disappearing above table mountain.We were advised to buy refundable tickets in the hop off hop on bus and go as soon as the cloud clears .When the cloud cleared -long queues appeared at the ticket office and we were able to go with our prepurchased tickets.Signs are not good designating- going to the cable car and we initially joined the ticket purchasing queue in error-so enquire which is the queue for the cable car -if you have a ticket.We were very fortunate as the cloud seem to reappear as we left the mountain and then there is no view.

Gorgeous View. Arrived at the cableway using the city sightseeing hoho bus. Left the V&A waterfront early and there were no queues for the cableway. Very efficient, arrived at the top quickly with stunning views.

...You spin me right round baby!. Awesome trip, be sure you get your hotel concierge to pre-purchase your cable car tickets before you head up to the mountain...it will save you a long time out of cues!

Great Way to See ALL of Cape Town. Coolest thing to do in Cape Town at sunset!!! Take the last cable car of the day (5pm after May 1) to the summit of Table Mountain in order to a watch a masterpiece of creation each evening at sunset! Trails all around the top of the mountain afford you plenty of places to watch the majestic sunset experience without feeling like you're doing it with a thousand of your best friends. Last cable car back down is at 6pm during the winter months as well, so you'll have to leave right after the sun has finished its show, but what an amazing thrill to see! Cable car round trip is R195, but so worth it!
Awesome!. If you have a clear and wind free day, do whatever it takes to get up the mountain. Chances that another day will be as good are near zero :)

Well worth it!. Go on a clear day as the views will be breathtaking. This is a well run and organized sight and a must do when in Cape Town. Go in comfortable shoes as there are paths that you can walk around in so you can admire the different views

Breathtaking views. I'm a Capetonian and this has and will always be one of my favourite things to do in Cape Town. Go early and spend the day exploring the topside. You definitely can't go wrong by making this your no.1 priority of things to do when visiting Cape Town

Stunning views. A fantastic experience! Stunning views! An unbeatable experience. We were there for 6 days and thank goodness! One day it was too cloudy, another too windy, and on another day there was a problem with power.The cable car was quick and fun. There was hardly a queue and we had only a ten minute wait.
A visit everyone must make. This is an experience you can't miss when in Cape Town. My kids really enjoyed it. I will definetly do it again.

On top of the city. A trip up Table Mountain is a must for travellers and foreigners alike. The key is to purchase the tickets online and be there once the cable way opens. That way you avoid the long line and pass by the rest who are buying their tickets. Once the cars start operating it goes quite quick and about 65 people can fit in a car. It takes less than 5 minutes to get up there and once at the top you can roam easily. The top is marked well so you can walk long distances or simply admire the views of the coast below. It is just as easy to get down. Absolute highlight!

Why wouldnt you go - surely this is one of the reasons why you're in Cape Town !!. We had 4 nights in Cape Town and were advised by both friends and our hotel to go when it was open - which may sound a bit strange.We arrived at 2.30pm, and decided we'd go at 4pm that afternoon (our hotel was going to arrange to drop us off). It was a clear day and we were keen to ensure we went up Table Mountain. They called us at 3.58pm to say it had closed for the day due to the winds...... luckily we were able to get dropped off again following a day trip the next day. The tickets we purchased via our hotel were valid for 3 weeks I think, so nothing was lost.The cable car up is quick and efficient. The inside of the car is on a turntable, so it rotates one turn during the ascent / descent. This means it doesn't matter where you stand when you get on!The views were amazing at the top of the mountain, and you were able to follow some paths and walk around the plateau. There was plenty of flowers and wildlife to see !There is a small gift shop and café - but we didn't stop.We enjoyed every minute (well I did - my hubby isn't great with heights !!) - but it was a must for our visit here.We did a bus tour a few days later, which has a drop off point at the cable car - the queues were much longer that day....
Great View. After waiting 2 days for the weather to allow us to visit, the views of Cape Town and surrounds were fantastic. The cable car and walkways on the top were very crowded.

A must. Go with the weather not your plans !! Whilst we were there winds closed it for a couple of days but we had a perfect day. Not sure about the revolving cable car - closed my eyes as we neared the top but worth it. Small cafe at the top was busy but reasonable prices to say you ae in the middle of nowhere. The temperature drops quite a lot so take layers of clothing with you.

Spectacular. It's just a really well put together tourist experience. The cable car floor spins so you get a 360 degree view.Definitely do the free tour. Starts on the hour, every hour from 9am. Very informative and the guides are really friendly. Covers a lot of subjects like the surrounding areas, the mountain itself, flora and fauna.

Very unique place, One of the Nature's Wonder. My husband and I had a chance to visit Table Mountain for our Honeymoon in March 2015. It was fabulous! But the line was a little bit long, we were waiting for a few hours just to buy tickets for Cabelway. My advice for everyone who would like to visit Table Mountain is to buy tickets online. ) By the way, Cableway is also interesting, it's moving 360 degree.
What a view. The day we went did take long to go up though longer wait to leave mountain but views were worth it - we scored a perfect day with sunshine and little wind

Great Way to Reach the top. We visited Table Mountain in December 2004 on a trip to see my sister we only stayed in Cape Town for a week but just had to visit Table Mountain . We bought a bus ticket which took us all round the City and one of the stops was at this amazing place, we had to que for the cable car but it wasn't long but it was well worth it the views on the way up were amazing and in side the floor rotated which moved us round to look at the various views of the city....... Would definitely go again if I had the chance.....highly recommend.....
Table Mountain. Loved the ride up and down the mountain. Felt very safe. Spectacular views from top of the mountain. Well maintained paths and wonderful photo ops.

Take me to the moon. Not quite but it is a long way up. Simply very impressive, the main issue during our visit was actually finding it open. Winds and bad visibility play havoc with this venue and if that was not enough scarcity of electricity causes further problems. They have load sharing from time to time which results in lower capacity on the lift hence much longer waiting times. On our successful visit the wait time up and down was in excess of one hour.We were fortunate to be up there on a beautiful clear day and there is nothing like it in the world.Well kept with paths taking you to the park it is truly amazing.Use the bus or taxi to get there, parking is just awful and you could end up with a very long walk.

breathtaking but over too soon!. Very organized queuing system but long queue so advise to book tickets in advance (online!) Worth the ride though with breathtaking views!! But it doesn't last very long! :-)
Turning cabins, well organized. The turning cabins are very nice, you have a 360° view. Everything is very well organized, people are friendly.

great design. a rotating cable car! an easier and not over expensive way to get on the top of the mountain. Very interesting design, in strong winds it is stabilised by extra water tanks at the bottom!

A must for every visitor to Cape Town. I often travel to Cape Town for business but have only been there twice on holiday and on both occasions the weather did not permit a trip up Table Mountain! This time round, although a bit breezy, I decided to hitch a ride up the mountain in the cable car. What an incredible experience. Clever people who designed and built this marvel! I could not believe the view and to top it off the wind died down and the few clouds around disappeared. Advice is to purchase your tickets online to avoid the cues although it took people less than 20 minutes to move through and get going. Next up on my list is hike up Table Mountain! Make sure you allow enough time to wander around. At least three hours!

Great view from the top. You can ride up on the cableway and use it on the way down or walk down. The view from the cable car and top is fantastic. The cable car and mountain was in view from the park near our hotel

You just have to go!. On arrival,the queue seemed to stretch for a mile,but we were near the front in no time.(we went around eleven o'clock).The staff organising the queueing were very efficient and there are water sprinklers in place for added comfort in the heat.The driver? was very friendly and the views are superb.Note! The car floor rotates so all get a good view.All in all a very efficient,friendly and value for money service.Another note:ensure you try and book on line before arriving as the queue is shorter.

a nice ride up the Table Mountain. You have to go early at the departure of the cable car in order to avoid a long line.
The ride let you see a beautiful view. Once on the top, you have a great view of the city and of the bay. You can choose to walk down for about 2-3 hours instead of taking the cable car.
Fantastic views. This is a great experience. Great views of Cape Town and the cable car rotates 360 degrees as you go up and down so you get a great panaramic view
Amazing views all the way. A very pretty ride up. And the views from the top are pretty epic. Lots to walk around and see once there. A must for a Cape Town visit

Best way to visit Table Mt. Going to Table Mt via the cable car is an excellent experience. The floor rotates 360 degrees so everyone can see and enjoy the amazing views on the way up. Cable car will close in bad weather and you will have to queue but on good weather days definitely worth a visit!
Amazing. Once in a lifetime experience must really go here when u visit capetown. Amazing view on the top of the mountain. We used the cable car to go up and down ;)

Like mob scenes?. Table Mountain is beautiful from afar. I suppose visitors to Cape Town are expected to go to the top, and for those fit folks who want to scamper up it's likely worth it. For the rest of us, getting topside means standing in enormous queues, being pushed by and pushing a sea of humanity. That's just to get up, where the view is good but not worth the cost. Then the fun part: want to get back down? Join the queue. It's a personal thing, so others may love it up there. I wouldn't stand in a line like that again if they were giving away $100 bills.

Pricey but fun. With a RT ticket coming it at about $20, it can get expensive for a family for a 5 min ride but once you are at the top you can spend a few hours taking in the beautiful panoramic views. There is also a nice cafe.
High!!!. Table mountain has always been my favorite in cape town the cable car fast and safe. it was high up and i nearly...... ???

Plan ahead and plan properly. There are queues of tourists (both local and international) waiting in line to get on this cable. So plan ahead. Overall it is very orderly. Cable cars take up to 50 people standing. The ride itself lasts about 5 minutes. Atop the mountain there is a great restaurant offerring a wide range of buffet meals, sandwiches, snacks, soft drinks and beer. Great views of Cape Town, the shores of the Atlantic. Hidden among the rocks are rock hyraxes.

Fantastic! Highly recommended. And food at the restaurant at the top surprisingly good! Everything about this experience was good, but important to keep the weather in mind - chilly at the top even on a warm day - so take a jersey along

A must.... Don't hesitate going to the top one of the world's most stunning places... We could have walked for hours and hours at the top, experiencing the pace of the stunning clouds going over the mountain, and then the clear stunning views across one of the world's most beautiful cities. Missing this excursion in Cape Town would be like going to Egypt and not seeing the pyramids!

Terrific way to climb a mountain. The Table Mountain cableway is unique in that the cab revolves as it ascends, giving the passengers the experience of seeing 360 degrees of panorama as the cable car climbs the mountain, one side of the cable car window being open to the fresh air. It's unique and a terrific way to approach the beautiful mountain.

360 degree view. Talk about a room with a view.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The gondola rotates 360 degrees. The staff are attentive and makes sure that the customers are safe during the trip going up and down. The wait is overly longggggg.!!!!!!!!!!

wonderful views when we weren't lost in clouds. Very nice on top, but with weather of it's own creation. Clouds were a problem. The tram operators really filled the cars too full. The floor rotates and people aren't used to it so it makes it really strange.

Very smooth ride.. Anyone scared of heights or riding a cable you don't need to worry as this ride is as smooth as it gets. The cabin rotates, but if you are anxious you can stand in the middle near the operator and don't look out at the view.
Good to go up. would recommend to go up with the cable car, it has a nice feature of 360 turn in side, so that everybody in the cabin can see the nice view of cape town.

What a way to spend Easter !. Went up on Easter Monday, Family day & I think children go free ! Easter egg hunt on top of the mountain was slightly surreal but the children liked it. It was busy, long queues to get on & off mountain, but hey, so what; it was worth it. The views are breath taking. If it's sunny, take a hat, especially if you're bald like me !

Go between 11am and 3 pm. My only suggestion for dealing with the queues. Everybody bus goes first thing in morning with huge waiting for all. Everyday I was here the mountain was not visible early . Late afternoon it was clear. But the effort was worth it. Spectacular views . I just kept walking to where there was blue sky. All sides were beautiful when it was blue. I think this is a must do over and over!

What a view do do do. I hate these sort of things, but this was great. Very smooth, and very quick. BUT THE VIEWS are fabulous. Take a deep breath and do it! There is a restaurant at the top with great food and drinks. Rug up as it is very chilly and windy at the top. No need to book but you can buy on line and tickets are valid for a week,.

Views. We pre booked our tickets with the bus tour company and avoided big ticket queues, however still ended up queuing at the bottom and top due to "load shedding". All worth it for the views and the rotating cabin.

Excellent. Don't miss this when you're in Capetown!. Pick a sunny day and enjoy the panoramic views of CapeTown from the trip up to Table Mountain.
we walked into Camps Bay for dinner afterwards. it was a lovely 20 minute walk.
All the way to the top. This is very weather dependent, check what the weather might be before heading up there. Also get there early as the queues can be quite long with large tour groups arriving

Get there Early, and buy tickets online. When riding the cable way, Make sure you get there early to avoid the pesky tour busses.Also buy your tickets online. This will save you a lot of time waiting.
A must if you are in Cape Town. Do it but try to walk up the mountain first as this is a good experience - we used Dominic, The Fymbos Guy and he was a great independent guide.
A thrill. What views as you ascend and descend the mountain It was a hot a sunny day with clear blue skies. Heavenly is all I can say.

One of the high spots when visiting CapeTown. Well worth a visit but get there as early as possible as the lines to get tickets and getting on the cable car can be very long.Great view of the entire region once you get to the top and you can spend at lest two hours walking around.

Feels like the top of the world. Stunning views, good coffee at the top, and lots of information is available as you walk around. The cable car rotates so make sure you stand near the windows to get some good photos. Thoroughly enjoyed the morning trip.

One of the wonders of the world. A must visit if you come to Cape Town. My mom is scared of heights and even she made it to the top. The cable car is modern and safe, turns whilst travel and give you a great view. They have seating in the middle which was perfect for my mom that is scared of heights, it made it possible for her to enjoy the ride. Once on top of the mountain you cannot describe the view, incredible comes to mind! They also have a restaurant for refreshments. Expensive but one of the things you have to do in life.
Our visit to table mountain. Our visit to table mountain was amazing and the aerial views were magnificent. Well organised experienced.

View from the top. Excellent attraction. Catch the red double decker bus from city centre to get there and back. Being in the low season, the queue was non existent, but the guide advised that the queue can get quite ridiculous at peak summer season. Staff was good. be prepared to spend some time walking on the top once you get there. Bring some warm clothes and walking/ trekking shoes. If you feel energetic, walk up and buy a ticket to get down on the cable car.A very worthwhile stop on your trip
Could only go up. Shut on our way back, had to climb down. The service was prompt, we traveled in slightly off season on a weekday.
great trip. the cable car keeps rotating so that all can have the views of the area.well maintained car. very fast movement and good views of rocks

Hiked up Platteklip gorge with two families and down on cable car. Platteklip gorge is challenging for the kids they ranged from 6-10 years old but all made the hike in under 2 hours. Came down on the cable car, beautiful views and a very entertaining operator.

Mother Mountain. We took our 4 year old up for her first time and she loved it. The floor of the car revolves giving everyone a full 360 view on the way up. It was cloudy and at this time of year you should take a coat or jersey as it can be very cold when you get up to the top. For a local resident I find the costs steep at R225 per adult and R110 for kids. The restaurant has improved over the years and the quality is much better however they are a bit chaotic.The cableway is free on your birthday if you have something on you to prove it. And of course you can always hike up/down or both to save some doshSadly there were a number of tourists walking around with beers and other drinks and bins are located towards the cable car building and restaurant area so I did see cups, cans and wrappers tossed into the fynbos whilst walking across the mountain top.This is an absolute must do for any tourist visiting Cape Town and should be on every Capetonians holiday to do list at least once a year.

A Wonder to behold. Nature at its best -breathtaking views. Excellent facilities for the visitor. You must experience this great gift from God. Photos just cannot do ut justice. Check out the website for specials - tickets for the day visitor cost R225 return on the rotating cable car. We bought the yearly ticket for R535 - we plan to make the most of the mountain.

Cold air and a cold beer!. The cable car was suprisingly quick; the floor rotates so you get a view of every angle going up. I cannot stress enough to buy tickets before you get to the mountain, what a huge waste of your time waiting in line.Make sure you get a beer up the top of the mountain, you won't regret it.

Just an advice. .....get there early in the morning! We arrived by 11.30, and it was crowded with people waiting, and waiting, and waiting....Since we brought an eighteen months old child, we decided to go down to Camps Bay instead. So, may be next time?

Excellent.....IF....... Yes, it's an excellent way of getting to the tope of fantastic Table Mountain...IF....it's operating! You really need to watch the weather. If the clouds are too low, it's foggy or windy the cable car can't operate for safety reasons of course. As the floor of the car rotates, you really get a good view on the way up. From my experience, mornings are popular as are weekends. I went a couple of times in the afternoon and I didn't need to wait long to catch the cable car.

Nice ride to table mountain. its great experience you see most of Cape Town the eastern and northern part of it facing waterfront , the Olympic stadium . Reasonable prices . Would to it again for sure

A Photographers Delight.. Wonderful cable car ride to the top. A unique feature is a revolving floor that allows one to view the ride up and down from a 360° perspective. Once at the top there is much to explore with fantastic views towards Cape Town, the ocean and surroundings. A must see visit
It's Quite High. The journey up and back down were an adventure in themselves and even if it gives you shakey knees it takes 2mins (the floor revolves btw)

Arrive early!. Book online in advance - take your time at the top; take in the spectacular views from various vantage points; hat, sunglasses and a light jacket is a must-could experience four seasons in one trip!

quick, comfortable ride to the top. This wasn't a particularly long or high aerial cableway, but it did have one unique feature - namely the interior of the cable car rotated 360 degrees so every passenger got great views going up and down the ride.
Go early, but a nice half days entertainment. Long queues after 11am or so, but if you get there early you can get the experience without the crazy long q.

A great alternative to the walk down. I walked up Table Mountain via Platterklip Gorge (a very long, hot hike), and was very relieved not to have to walk back down. The views from the top were great, although there were a lot of people up there! If I'd have had more time I would have considered going up Skeleton Gorge, but Platterklip was useful as we could leave the car near the bottom of the cable way.

Fantastic views. We booked our tickets in advance and luckily there was only a very short queue when we arrived. The views are spectacular as the cable car rises rapidly. The floor rotates so everyone gets a chance to look at the views.

Great way to get to the top!. Although you can hike to the top of the mountain - its soooooo much easier to get the cable car!! As you ascend - the inside turns around by 360 degrees so you get an amazing view as you travel upwards. Make sure you visit on the first clear day you get, as the weather changes quite quickly!
The only way up!. When you get into the cable care try to get a position on the outer side as the car turns as you go up the mountain and you get a full view all around as it moves upward.
Super fun. You can walk up the mountain but taking the aerial cable car is fun and much easier and not scary at all. It move 360 degrees as you go up and down so everyone gets all the views.

Grab it when you can. I just realized that rating and reviewing on Tripadvisor are two different things. I wish to post this review from our trip in July of 2011.This was one of our primary reasons for visiting Cape Town but it was closed due to hight winds. The hotel informed us it had been closed for a number of days. We were actually at the botanical gardens with a driver when the driver received word that the cable car was running again. We decided to make a break for it and even though we would have a shorter time than originally planned we headed off. I am so glad we did - no lines to board any of the cable cars and the views were amazing! We were lucky enough to take the last cable car down off the mountain and were able to see a portion of the sunset.The next day the attraction was packed with long cues. So glad we made the most of our visit time to Cape Town by being flexible with our itinerary.

Best Birthday on the mountain. Despite living in Cape Town all my life I had only ever been up the mountain once. On the 9th of April my husband and I took our 3 kids up for my birthday.Being a huge tourist attraction I expected everything to be over priced and jaded staff. It was the exact opposite. Awesome friendly staff, great lunch at a reasonable price. Wonderful atmosphere up there and the bonus of not paying for my ticket on my birthday.SO impressed and proud of our mountain, well done to the staff and management.

Go early. Make sure you arrive early and If you can, pre-book tickets just before you head out - this way you can skip the queue. If you get there early enough though there shouldn't be much of one, its also good as after around 9am it starts to get very warm and the sun can be a little strong so you can be down by the time it gets too hot to walk around comfortably. Do check the weather though to make sure you can see the top... if you cant, no point in going. You get spectacular views from the top, and the cable car does a 360 on the way up giving everyone a chance to see the full views available. The café at the top is fun and sells lots of different things from milkshakes to prosecco, the gift shop is a little pricey and you can get most of the stuff sold there at the bottom or in town anyway... Worth the trip

Best Way to Reach the Table Mountain Top. Inorder to escape the crowds, we got the cable car early in the morning. Although the weather was sunny and nice we came accross the clouds which prevented the wonderful scenery during the rise. The cable trip was comfortable and worth trying.

Cable Car. This was an awesome way to get to or from Table Mountain. While I strongly encourage you to do the hike up, this is how we got down from the mountain. It is best to purchase tickets before arriving to the cable car so you don't have to wait in the long line. It is a quick and smooth ride with a panoramic view of Cape Town. A Must for everyone to see!

Must do in Cape town. Amazing views! But the queues can be long… If it is too windy the cableway might be closed to plan ahead and have some alternative dates. Just walk around once you are up there and relax and admire the view!!!

Queing. Very nice when you finally got on . But be aware that the outer part is rotating while the middle is still. I thought at one point that I had lost my wife but she had rotated to the other side while I was admiring the wonderful view.

One of the Seven new natural wonders of the world. We pre-booked a tour including a cable car ride to the top of Table Mountain. Luckily on the day we had booked the mist cleared early and, at 20km per hour the wind was not too strong to prevent the cable car being stopped. Trip was well organised, weather and views perfect.

Nice experience. A nice experience worth trying, the queue is a bit long though. you will have to wait to buy the tickets and wait to get a cable car up and again down so its a bit of a hassle however once you get to the top of the mountain the view is amazing. the fare is almost 18$ you will take amazing pictures and after all its one of the 7 wonders of the world so definitely a must try
Best Way To Get Up The Mountain. Easiest and quickest way to get up the Mountain and also offers some stunning views. If your lazy like me and hate walking, best to do it this way!!

Must do. Amazing views and experience. Just be aware of the unpredictability of the operation of the cableway- it can be gorgeous in Cape Town but the weather on Table Mountain can be horrendous. Phone in advance to check. There are two queues for the cableway; one for people with tickets and one for those without. At peak times get your tickets on line as the queue for people with pre-purchased tickets definitely moves twice as fast!
Wish it went slower. Beautiful views but the cable car goes pretty fast and you are to the top in about five minutes. Bring an extra jacket as it can be windy and cold up on the mountain.

A Must Do!. Queues can be long so take sun tan lotion and water as you will be standing in the sun. If you are able to plan ahead, book your tickets on line as the queue is shorter and quicker. The website will tell you if it is open and its opening times to save yourself a journey as it closes if there is cloud coverage on top or if the winds are too high. We visited with our two boys, aged 9&6. We thought they might be a bit bored but they loved it as there were plenty of good paths for them to do some independent exploring. Fab views and good cafe for a snack on top.
Trip to table mountain. All the dassies seem to have disappeared since my last visit and have been replaced by absailers! Slightly more commercial but not too bad.
..recently built cable cars... ..this is so efficient..very large..full panoramic views as you climb the mountain, the cars actually swivel around giving more vistas..well staffed and very safe..
top class. family holiday in the cape highlight - the rotating car with amazing views was awesome on this clear autumn day, staff friendly and the whole experience is world class

A Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. Had the opportunity to take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. Very nice trip up/down the mountain with gorgeous views of during the journey and when at the top top.

Amazing. Apart from the poor sign posted public parking, the rest of the trip was well organized. We booked tickets the day before and went early the following morning. Cable cars are fast and efficient. Once on top of table mountain the paths are well sign posted and the views amazing. The resturant and coffee shop although a bit pricy is well run and offers a good selection of food and snacks. We were lucky enough to access table mountain on a clear day therefore views were magical.

Going up!. Awesome weather, awesome experience, regarding that I took my 9 month old twins up! Staff were friendly and very helpful. They have a new Halaal friendly restaurant at the top and the food was lovely... Will definitely do it again....

Great views and fast! Suggest purchasing advanced tickets. We purchased tickets in advance (at Cape Town Intl Airport) to skip the lines of people. What a fun ride with great views. The floor rotates so everyone gets a view of everything. What surprised us the most was how fast the cable car gets up there. Well worth the trip, especially on a nice clear day!
Cablewat. My first time in Cape Town, and it was wonderful, the rotating cable car was just too cool, and the views on the way to the top and from the top are breathtaking.

Awe inspiring view. Wow, this was one of the best views I have ever experienced in my travels. A sunny day, blue skies and the feeling you are standing on top of the world to appreciate the amazing panoramic views of the cape coast line. This was unbelievable and jaw dropping. That cable ride to the top is quick, around a minute and you get the 360 degree experience with the rotating cable car. Book on line and pre-purchase tickets to get there early and appreciate the experience at the top rather than in a line waiting. You only need an hour or so at the top, we had breakfast in the cafe which was hectic, the parking is also not a great experience but the view makes it all worth it. Maybe an experience for older kids only.

Fast but brokes sometime.. In the morning veryone goes so a big amount of people. Better book online. Unfortunately when we went there was a technical problem. So they refunded us and we came at sunset and it worked perfectly.

cabale way. vabale car is nice with 20+ cpacity and it rotate slowly to have the view of 360 degree while climbing and coming down,staff are very proffesstional well maintaind with full glass to have view with speakr on instructions

Must do. Going to the top of Table Mountain was amazing. The views were great and it was so fun being in the clouds on top of the mountain. Plus the cableway rotates when you are in it so you can see all the views on your way up and down.

You can't visit Cape Town without a visit to Table Mountain. The cable car goes up and down a very steep route. Each car can take about 60 passengers and be prepared for the rotating floor which ensures everyone gets good views and photo shots. There are various walks around the summit 15 mins to 2 hours. The cafe is a welcome stop for lunch on a hot day, food average, prices above average but still worth it. Car parking is on the side of the road up to and beyond the cable car station, parking guides will help you into spaces.

Easier way to get on the top. I luckly could climb the mountain on foot and another day up by Aerial Cableway. I have no doubt that is easier go up by cableway than on foot. The 360° sight is so cool and it take around only 3 minutes to get on the top of Table mountain.
Disappointed!!!. Got to the top and the mountain was covered with clouds could not see anything and the staff was not helpful either.... It was a waste of time and money!

Amazing experience!. Table mountain is amazing and worth the visit.Please plan ahead. Unfortunately the tram will not run if it is cloudy or windy. Safety first! Your hotel should post whether the mountain is open or not in the lobby. Changes are it would be cloudy in the morning.The car rotates so everyone can get a great view. It will be cool up there so dress appropriately. Again the weather could change. Time that you need to spend depends on if you want to eat or not. I spent an hour and it was plenty to explore and take my photos. It was cold and windy.I thought it was breathtaking!
whoa!! a thrilling ride!. to go up to table mountain the line was not too long but coming down..we had to be very patient and it was getting cold and windy!! BRING scarf and a sweater!!
Spectacular view!. Unless you are some kind of athlete, this is the best way to get up and down Table Mountain. Great views of Cape Town. We went in March and there was only a small queue.

Rotating floor!. The alternative to hike up the mountain. Too many blisters that day.. so the choice was easy :-) The floor is actually rotating all the time up to the top, so everybody will have their chance to see the same things. A clever idea and I enjoyed that! Remember: bring warm clothes for the Table Mountain. The winds can be strong! Enjoy!

Spellbinding. When I arrived it was a beautifully clear day and went up in the cable car to the top. The floor of the car moves 360 degrees so you have a truly panoramic view all the way up, which takes 2 mins. Amazing scenery. If you are in Cape Town you really got to do this.

Safe and fun!I. Its a cool expierence seeing Cape Town and Table Mountain from the cable car. You don't have to try to get a good spot for viewing when you get in because the floor rotates! Doesn't take long to wait in line for cablecar, and quick trip up the mountain where you can stay and walk around. (bring layers, even on a hot day the wind makes it cold!)

Worth it!. Our VBT group had no lineups. Early morning clouds were heavy on mountain, but we decided to go up nonetheless. Vistas of Capetown, Robben Island are fabulous. Cool photos among the clouds were taken. There is a trail for a short walk around top and many great lookout spots for photos. Not that scary a ride, especially if you are a skiier. A must do in Capetown!

A must do. The Table Mountain calling, and the Cable Car gonna take you there. There's an option to walk up as well, but thats for the HEALTHY and FIT ones, not for the common man.Very good views from this Cable car, and the experience itself is too good to miss.

The beautiful Table Mountain which surround the great Mother City (Cape Town). Welcome e to the Table Mountain a very beautiful place you will see the Rock Dassies little creatures that cling on the mountain you will whole of Cape Town the V&A waterfront and Robben Island where Nelson Mandela was sent to prison you will love it here
A must see in Cape Town.. The views are breathtaking and Abseil Africa is there for the adventurous. Bring hats, lots of water and sunscreen.

Great view.. I took the first Hop on Hop Off Bus in the morning to avoid the heat and the queues. I didn't have a prepaid Ticket but the queue was short and we were soon on our way to the top thanks to the efficient crew.I don't particularly like heights but it is worth the effort to get to the top, the view is spectacular.A very stimulating experience.

Must do it....great vistas and friendly ....just check the weather first .. Best attraction in Cape Town for photos etc...The ride up and back down are great due to the fAct that the floor revolves and you see a 360 view up and back. The top has great gardens,restaurants,sitting areas etc. Very surprising how large this mountain top park really is . Very clean and well organižed .
Cable Way. long long lines, but orderly with friendly staff. The lines for People without prepaid tickets and therefore the waiting times were really Long, Even for going down there were lines.

A Cape Town Must do but overrated. It is one of the big six attractions of Cape town. While the views are nothing but amazing on a clear day but the cost of the cable car is too expensive. The food on the top is naturally also very expensive. Lots of flora & fauna on the mountain and you can see 360 degrees around you. I would say save the fee and climb up walking. Go late afternoon when you can watch the sunset. Check the website before going there to ensure its open and how long the queues are.

Great views. Loved doing this!Would of hated climbing!! HahaWe waited for a good day so there would be good views which there wereQueue wasn't bad at allWent up nice and slow to allow time to take in the amazing scenery (but not too slow)Overall great experience

needs to be done. Apart from the long wait - even with prebooked tickets, definately worth the wait. Bring a hat for standing in the line - there isnt a lot of cover. The cable ride was great with the amazing view going both up and down the mountain. At the top you had several self walk trails to follow or take a short guided one. The cafe had good serving sizes, prices and view - especially for a tourist location when you expect to be charged a lot more. I would go later int the day for less waiting time in line and watch out for the weather forecast - they do close if the weather is bad.

Worth it. Spending the money is worth the trip up the mountain. Once up, you can hike to your heart's content & watch the clouds cascading over the mountain. If you're first up, you can avoid the crowds. But check to make sure it's open..even on a clear day, the winds can shut down operations.

Average.. good view but a bit expensive!. I paid more or less 20/25 euros for the Cable car.. ok the Table Mountain is a good point of view on CT. But no more. In less than 2 hours you can do everything.

Go early or late to avoid long lines. Weather permitting, do not fail to take the cable way for fantastic views of Cape Town. Be aware that it is windy at the top and that there is ample room to take short walks once you get there. The cable car rotates on its course, so no passengers can "hog" the best view, which is quite fair - why wait in line if you can't enjoy the view up and back. Lines can be long so go late in the day (my preference) or when they first open to minimize waiting.

A well oiled machine. I took the family in an outing up the Table Mountain in December. We were very impressed by the efficient and professional service of the staff and how very good the cable car ride is. Highly recommended.

WOW. It's a WOW thing!!!! It's WOW when you come to the Top! It's WOW when you get there! It's WOW when you come to the base again!!! Do not stress yourself looking for the best place to stand on the cart to see the best views. The cable cart floor turns along the way, so you can see 360º. Enjoy it. It's something you won't forget for you entire life!!!

Don't Even Consider Hiking Up To Table Mountain. Yes, you can hike up to Table Mountain, but unless ultra fit and happy to exercise in direct sunlight, take the cable car.Highly recommend purchasing ticket online prior to your visit and don't drive up, as we would have had to park about 1 mile away. Take a tour or the HoHo bus, which stops at the entrance.The floor rotates which provides excellent all round views going up and down.

Super exciting!. I do not like heights but the Cable Car ride was thrilling! The views were spectacular and the walk at the top of Table Mountain very informative. We had 2 friends get engaged at the top of the Mountain. It was very romantic! There is café and gift store at the top. The gift store seemed to be the only place in Cape Town that sold stubby coolers! Sorry, being from Australia we like our beer cold! During our stay in Cape Town, Table Mountain was one attraction we would have done over again. Highly Recommended.

16 day tour of South Africa. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is the only way to get to the top unless you really fancy a walk for over an hour always going up hill in what can be very hot conditions.The cable car is good fun with the floor rotating as you travel both up and down giving panoramic views over the whole area. Really worth a visit, but go early to avoid the crowds.

A must do. If you come to Cape Town, you have to go to Table Mountain by Cable Car, its simple! A word of advice, try to go later in the day, less people, oh by the way, the Café staff are very strict on time, 6pm they shut down, as the place closes at 6:30 why would they close the café at 6pm! a lot of tourists were thirsty and we could not buy water!

prepare to wait. Great and worth using it rotates so is fair for everyone the only thing is the wait up and down can be really long so be prepared to wait would not recommend for bored kids would book tickets online if you can

Fast way to get the best view.. Clean, well organized and efficient with an engineering surprise inside the gondola, this highly rated attraction exceeded our expectations. For those without the time or inclination to hike up this mountain the gondola is indispensable. The views from the top cannot possibly disappoint.
Amazing. Apart from the lack of parking and the long wait, the whole experience is spectacular. Some of the finest views I have ever seen anywhere.

Spectacular - wear sunblock. Remember to wear sunblock. Or sunscreen or whatever you call it at home. Please wear it. Book tickets early if you can or wait in line. We didn't but waited just 30 min during school holidays - so quick. And well organized. Park past the tram station or take a cab or the red tour bus. (Red tour bus is amazing. We followed it around the cape.)Pick up your trash. Don't feed the dassies. Bring a picnic. Scare your mother with edge of cliff photos :)

Efficent and modern but buy in advance. As nice and modern as I have ever been on. The view is spectacular especially as you approach the top and are near the shear cliffs. But be there as early as you can to avoid the lines and cut that wait by less than half by purchasing a ticket online in advance. Otherwise you can easily be an hour in line.
Well worth it. Stunning views of Cape town. Seems that it is always windy but worth putting up with to see the views that surround

Amazing view . Firstly, if you want to go to this place, you should come really early, just after that start working, because there are a lot of people! Also, you should check the wind, because they don't work in windy weather.But, it you will follow my recommendations, you will get really amazing, 360*, view it's really amazing! You should go there

Well worth the trip. In Capetown Table Mountain is everywhere it is a must see experience. A short trip up the mountain to stunning views. Nice restaurant at the top for a wine and some lunch after you have had a wonder around the summit.

Fab views. No long queues. Efficient system for boarding the cable cars which rotate internally so everyone gets a good view. The service guy in ours was brill; had everyone laughing and even singing. Views over Capetown are thrilling on a clear day. Smooth ride up and down. Very enjoyable experience.
Amazing view. Go there early and stay on the top of table mountain as much as you can... the view from the top is just spectacular.

A must do!. Tip buy your tickets online in advance, you just need the electronic ticket and get there early if it's holiday session! There is parking on the road side up to and past the actual cable car centre, but boy does it get busy and the queues with tickets can be long, let alone those without! Once you are travelling up and are on top of the mountain the views are amazing, remember to taken an extra layer as it is windy and can be chilly, even on a hot day! We joined a free tour by one of the park rangers, which was excellent and very informative. All in all an excellent day had by all and some great pictures.

Girls Road Trip. This is a must do in Cape Town. Being my third time I often wonder if I will ever tire of this amazing view and location.. the answer is NO. I was so happy the weather was perfect and the view spectacular. Truly a must do if you can. The only draw back was waiting for the tram but with good friends and great views.. Really who cares. Enjoy

Beautiful. Was a bit scared going up there but enjoyed everything about the whole experience. When you up in the mountain it does become a bit cold so please take a warm jacket/jersey with you so you can enjoy the experience

Much Improved and a tourist 'must'. I have visited this cableway several times since 1999 and on this visit I noticed how much more organised it is. It is very 'customer friendly' and my advice is to buy tickets in advance which cuts out much of the queuing also try to visit first thing in the morning or late afternoon/early evening when there are hardly any queues. There are good transport links with the new MyCiti bus service so its not necessary to book an expensive tour. Parking can be a nightmare if you arrive at a busy time. The views and walks from the top are breathtaking. If you feel energetic you can walk up (takes about 3-4 hours) and take the cable car down. I wouldn't recommend walking down a bit too dangerous
Fantastic Views!!. Amazing experience, cable car rotates slowly so you get 360° degree panoramic views! On the summit itself we were actually above some of the clouds! Awesome!!

Do this early in your visit to Cape Town.. We took the cableway on our first day of visiting Cape Town. The views from the top were spectacular. It also helped us to understand the topography because we could get a visual of the key points of interest. We took the rim walk and it was worth the time and effort. Allow more time than the brochure states to complete the walk. We purchased our tickets in advance. This helped us avoid a small queue at the ticket window but it was not crowded the day we went and waited only about 15 minutes. Go early as the clouds rolled in later in the day and the wind picked up. This is the daily occurrence that gives the mountain the tablecloth effect.

Fun. The cable car rotates so you're not stuck with a bad view. The ride was smooth and quick but not fast. Very gentle. Easy on and easy off. There is an old cable car at the bottom we used for a photo shoot :)

A "must do" if you're visiting Cape Town. We'd read all the warnings about having to book online but hotel wifi was too slow, so we took pot luck and arrived at the ticket office at 9am - no queue! Amazing views from the top, definitely worth having a wander on the various trails. Don't miss the dassies sunning themselves on the rocks. Cafe had a good selection of food and drink.

Wonderful view, but go on time. it's quite an experience going up the mountain with the cableway and the view from the turning cabin over the city is stunning. Go early in the morning otherwise there will be a long queue of people who want to go up

Have to SEE if FOR YOURSELF!. All I heard about prior to my visit to Cape Town was TABLE MOUNTAIN! So, this was one of the first places that I wanted to check off on my list when we arrived. We arrived via the hop on hop off bus which dropped you off right near the entrances to purchase your tickets (however, I recommend buying them online...saves you tons of time). We chose NOT to hike to the top, but to take a roundtrip ride on the cable car. The hike up is about 2 hours and everyone in our group was not for it...so we nicked that...The ride was short but AWHHHHH SOME!! No need to worry about where you stand we you enter the car as the car rotates giving EVERYONE a chance to see the views from the top. Once we reached the top, we got out and took pictures all over the place (there is no bad place to take pics). We had a nice refreshing drink at the top (that was good too!) and they left. Depending on when you go, lines can be long. We went on a Tuesday and the lines were still long...so remember that when planning. You definitely HAVE to go there!!
A Cape Town must.. We have done this many times over the years. It is specatular. Be prepared to queue and buy tickets on line before if possible.

Go early. Has to be done. Had a tip of a South African in the UK to book tickets online and visit early on a clear day. Did that and got on the cable car at about 8.30am. Had a great time with my camera, a snack, a guided tour and a nip into the shop. Got back down at about 11.00am and the queues to go up were massive. I don't think they extra hour that those folks had in bed was worth it to them.

Must do!. This is a major attraction in Cape Town and really is one of those "must do" things when visiting this fabulous city. We had a great day for our visit and therefore had spectacular views going up/down in the cable car as well as from the top of Table Mountain. Long wait to get into the cable car but the line moves along smoothly - highly recommend to buy the tickets online before arrival otherwise there is also a long line to buy tickets.

The rock in the middle of Cape Town. Going up Table Mountain is a necessity when visiting Cape Town. While costly for locals, it is worth the expense in views, rotating cable cars and simply experiencing the wonder of it all. I would suggest comfortable shoes and layered clothing as the weather is very unpredictable. It may be very hot at the bottom and freezing at the top!There are refreshments on sale at the top as well as soveniers. Make sure your camera is charged and ready for every few seconds the view is completely different.During holiday seasons the wait going up may be as long as an hour or two and the same coming down but it is a crowd growing with excitement and different accents. Quite enjoyable and entertaining.Parking may be an issue on busy days so be prepared for a bit of a walk.

Pity about the cloud !!. We all enjoyed the ride up to the top especially the revolving cabin which ensures that everyone can get a view. Queues going up were not too bad and about 10 minutes coming back down though I would imagine that on a busy day (we went on a Thursday ) they could get very long.If coming by car remember to have some change for the "attendant" looking after your part of the road. There also appeared to be a shuttle bus service which nobody was using.
A Must See. When you are on Table Mountain you can see till the end of the world! The fauna and flora is beautiful and if you are the adventurous type, you can ab sail to the bottom.

Table Mountain Views. You must do it if you're in Cape Town. If the weather is clear get up there and check it out. For the view over Cape Town is spectacular. Be warned that the mist can roll in quickly but it can leave just as quickly.

A must visit!. I went to Table Mountain for the first time in January. The cable car ride is free for SA residents on their birthdays (you have to show your ID or proof of residence) so it was a great start to mine. The cable car revolves as you go up so everyone gets a chance to see the amazing views. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone that handled my ticket wished me a happy birthday when they saw that I had a birthday ticket.The view on the way up and on top of the mountain is nothing short of amazing. Here you can see Cape Town from so many sides, uninterrupted. The hike over to the next mountain was also very worth it. A must-do for every Capetonian and every visitor.

In the clouds. It was such fun to travel up to the top of the mountain we had been seeing from every angle during our stay in Cape Town. There is a long line to get to the cable cars but the ride itself is quick and you can spend as much time as you want at the top. There are trails all over the top along paved paths and beautiful views when the clouds aren't covering you with fine white mist.
Worth the long lines.. Try to purchase tickets online to avoid first line. Second line tends to g fast, but try to get there early to avoid crowds.Views at the top are majestic and worth the wait.

Fabulous views. On a clear day this is something worth while. Queues can be rather long so good idea to get to bottom of Cableway early morning. A bit daunting if nervous of heights as I am , but it doesn't take long to reach the top. At the top there are plenty of easy little trails to wander along and enjoy the view of Cape Town from all angles.
a must for anyone travelling to cape town. i really liked the astonishing view from the aerial cable which offer a unique 360° cape town's wiew
Not as fast as you think. Yes, it's marketed as just 15 short minutes to the top. However, there are long lines and only two cars. Also, be aware that the cars rotate as you ride!

Fear of heights ... you can do it. Party of 6 adults including 2 very nervous of heights. I asked a staff member at the bottom if it was worth going up because of my fear, she replied yes and that it was only 4 minutes up and I could close my eyes during the journey, so glad I listened to her. Once up there it's so vast you can wander around without fear. The staff were so friendly, the weather was kind, it was well worth it.
Amazing Views. Incredible views of Cape Town. Definitely a 'must-do'. If you are fit, you can ditch the cableway and hike instead.
Wuthering Heights. I liked EVERYTHING about it! Friendly staff, the best views in the world and three seasons in two hours!

Stunning on the way up, at the top and coming down.. This is a memory of a lifetime. The weather was crystal clear but there was a heavy mist on the harbour. It was a phenomenal view. I'd have loved to stay up there for ages but we were on a tour..

Interesting perspective, Easy way to top (or bottom!). We took the aerial cableway on the way down only. We hiked the strenuous trail up (quite satisfying, but exhausting), but were told by a few locals to take the cableway down to save our knees and legs! The cableway slowly rotates 360° as you head up or down the track. It makes one full rotation, not more. The cableway always nearly anyone to get to the top of Table Mountain--a must see!Also, if you do a roundtrip, they'll take a posed picture of your group with Table Mountain background, for a reasonable price purchase.Decent, reasonably priced gift shops here too.
Fascinating. Simply breathtaking!!!Value for money. I definitely advise my friends to take the aerial cable to the top of the Table Mountain.

Good journey with nice views all around. Not easy to get a ticket - the queue is pretty long on weekends. Try and book online. The views while moving up on this aerial cable way are breathtaking with mountaineers all around

A Literally Breathtaking Experience. Don't miss the opportunity to see Table Mountain. The tram up is an adventure by itself. It gives you a magnificent view on the way to the top. The terrain at the top is varied and very interesting. It is stunning to look down and see the clouds below you!

not to be missed. get your tickets early and visit early in the day, its getting really busy after 11.00 o" clock. Visit their site to see if the weather permits the visit, amazing restaurant for breakfast or lunch up on the top.. ok, the view from there is something else, its a 600.000.000 years old rock!!

Above the tablecloth. We went up on a cloudy day hoping to be up when the "tablecloth" was on n did my kids enjoy... going through the clouds, the coolness, the views, the friendly staff all were superb. Even a few dassies came close by. Can't wait to go up hiking next time.

No other place like this on earth. Can never decide which is better, the journey or the place. During the cable car ride, the view is outrageous. But on top of the mountain it is too... take a walk across to look out over the Camps Bay side (and remember to take a jacket or jersey; it's always a lot cooler up there!). Such a beautiful place!
Cable car with a twist. It was a nice surprise to see it rotates through 360 degrees as you go up and down so everyone gets a good view.

Average amazing?. Too many people stuffed in a box on a hot day. Of corse people wanted to get the best view possible but... Once you got to the top, it was again, just average. I LOVE Cap Town and everyone should do it ONCE. I'm going back in one week but this will not be on the must do list.

DO IT. if you have time, buy the tickets online, check whether the cableway is working (it closes if it is too windy) and GOOOOO!!!!! you won't regret it a bit.one disclaimer: it does tend to get busy with wait times of upto 2 hrs between 10-4pm.

a sight not to be missed. Once you have waited long enough to get on the cablecar, it was not too bad in March, you get such a view on a clear day with the rotation of the car, it gives you that 360°view you were not expecting! It is a quick ascent that leaves you awestruck!

Cableway to the Top!. Cableway is fun to reach the top of table mountain. There are few other ways too but this simpler one. The cable cars rotate 360 while on the way to the top. So irrespective of where you stand you will get great view the mountain and the city below. For adventure seekers, I recommend trekking.
The easiest way to go up. Extremely fast and secure, less than 10 minutes and i was there on the top of table mountain. Perfect.

Table Mountain trip. Fabulous experience. Check waiting times as we went on Saturday afternoon on the hop on hop off bus (worth buying joint tickets on the Tour). and there was a 1.5+ queue. We left and took a cab there on Sunday morning and walked virtually straight in.Obviously extraordinary views and interesting and informative free tours.

Interesting Ride. Nice views and the car rotates as it climbs affording everyone a shot at the views. Some people found the rotation discomforting so they stood in the middle which does not move. Either way it was a nice ride.

Sitting on top of the world. Amazing views and wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and I got a free ticket up the mountain because it was my birthday. The ride is smooth and the scenery breath taking. I cant wait to go back

Indeed one of Natures wonders. Friendly and helpful staff made our visit to Table Mountain a fantastic experience. The staff at the restaurant on top of the mountainturned a cold day into a warm experience. All the trails are in great condition and you become one with nature strolling on the various marked paths crisscrossing the mountain top. Our kids couldn't stop smiling. Awesome to see one of the worlds wonders being cared for by dedicated, friendly staff

TABLE MOUNTAIN. pre book your tickets, and then go first thing in the morning, on your first clear day. pre-booked tickets are good for several days, and allows you to join the faster line, table mountain only had good visibility for 2 days out of the 10 we were there. the views are spectacular, it gets very hot so wear a hat and take water.
Parking an Issue. Buy Tickets in advance. The way up to the top of Table Mountain. For such a major attraction parking is an issue. Buy your tickets in advance on the Internet to avoid the queue.

Exhilirating and memorable.. Not to be missed - breathtaking views and experience. Book tickets prior to avoid delays and best time to visit is early morning. Panoramic views over coast and city are spectacular..

A must if you visit Cape Town. Recommend you visit early in the day as cloud and winds swreep in often later on. A great way to ascend Table mountain, cars have a rotating floor so you have a 360° view.
Table Mountain Cable Car. This is an old but high quality system.The cars are large and take about fifty people. As you go up or down the floor revolves so everyone gets a good view

Fantastic Cableway. The best thing about this cableway is that the "car" rotates slowly so that everyone gets a great view - not like others where you need to rush to be in a certain area for pictures. And being handicapped, I was shown a special elevator and given good access to the car. Lovely views of the entire area.

Easy to Come Down than to Climb Up but Views either way are Spectcular. This is a must if you are in Cape Town!! My husband and I climbed/hiked up Platteklip Gorge to get to the top of Table Mountain and would suggest taking the cableway down. It gives you a different and much easier way of taking in the views and glory of South Africa, specifically Cape Town and Table Mountain. It was worth every dollar for the ticket! The shop/cafe/cable house at the top of Table Mountain is lovely and provides mostly everything one could imagine or want after a hike up or around Table Mountain. The cable car itself turns and gives ample time and views to everyone in the car. So don't fret if you aren't facing an opening when entering the car, you will get a turn! If you are scared of heights, don't worry, it doesn't take long and was about a 3 to 4 minute ride down. I assume it's like that on the way up as well! However, if you can handle a fun hike and are fit, take the trails up! You'll be glad you did!! I promise!!

Bit dingy, but well worth it. The cable car is easily accessible by bus. They will close it for moderate wind, but the mornings are usually good. The floor of the car rotates so everyone gets a good view.
Spectacular, revolving cable car!. Magnificent and speedy way down (and up if you are not up for the hike up, which pie family loved but would be challenging for some.)

what a view!!!!. A must see when you are in Capetown!!! Excellent view of the coastline and the city.. Amazing!! The cablecar moves around when you go to the top, so you can take pictures from every angle.

Don't miss one of the new seven wonders of the world!. Book beforehand and avoid queing up for the fabulous cable car. The view from it, rotating all the time, is breathtaking. Just imagine the challenge when they first built it...

All round view. Pick your time carefully. Went one day following poor weather at 11am and there was over 1 hour wait. Went next day at 8.30am and went straight onto a car. Efficient and the inside rotates slowly all the way up. Once at the top the views are awe inspiring. Tip if you cannot see the mountain from Cape Town due cloud don't go.

Incredible Mountain. What a must do experience.Weather is the deciding factor as the cloud cover can obscure your view from the top. If you see it is clear, make a dash for it although the view from the cable car station at the top often stays clear even with cloud.The rocks and vynbos at the top are phenomenal and a must to see.The view across Cape Town and to the sea and beaches is wonderful.Highly recommended

Use it for the way down. If you can only climb up by foot - DO IT!!! It's a great experience, if you do it right. But since it is a very intensive one, and one that involves MANY HIGH 'stairs', it makes a lot of sense to use the cable car on the way down. The views on the top are truly magnificent and a must for any Capetown visitor, if only the weather permits. The place is closed under high winds, and the Table Mountain top is often covered with mist. So find the right time and get up there. On the top there's a great restaurant with something for everyone. You can also take shorter and longer walks and enjoy a great deal of fantastic views. One more comment - since we climbed up on foot, we had to purchase our ticket down, at the top. But then we were exposed to some South African humor, which wasn't really THAT tactful: After waiting some 45 minutes on the line, you finally get to the spot where you're being sent to purchase the ticket. The two ladies at the desk made it very clear, that "there are no more tickets to go down. We now give only children. You'll have to go down by foot. We're sorry but we'e sold out." I'm all for humor, REALLY, but it took several minutes, and my wife who stayed on the line, had to let many people pass her, and we missed our turn of the cable down, and had to wait for the next one. After such long time at the line, it was quite annoying and much less funny.
A must when in Cape Town!. Most amazing view of Cape Town, beaches, stadium!Walk the different routes each one is a jewel on their own!Just soak up the sun or have a nice meal in the restaurant.

A must do in Cape Town. Every visit we take the children up to Table Mountain. Incredible views and a great ride up the revolving cableway. Good facilities when you reach the top and some great walks.
