Best to check online before you go - often the weather conditions are bad on the mountain and the cableway is closed, even if the weather is great elsewhere. Not cheap but definitely worth it.

great views!. this is the first cableway that I have been on that turns around 360degrees while moving up and down. the views are obviously fantastic. there is a snack bar on the ground level and at the top. get there early so as not to queue. the hop on bus stops just in front

Amazing. We booked this through the hotel who booked online for us.Upon arrival the lines to get tickets were very long but as we had booked online we didn't have to wait that long. While we were inline the guys kept sending people up in the lift who thought they could just join the que when they got out of the lift, ( this is bad planning and should be looked at) anyway it's our turn to get in the cable car and they fill it up ,it holds 65 people, it takes aprox 6 minutes to get to the top . The views are amazing it's a must do even if you don't like heights it's worth getting to the top ! We had a lovely sunny day so it was clear at the top we spent 2 hours walking round and saw lots of dassies.Just make sure you check the weather as the cable car closes if it is too misty or windy

Worth the wait. We had 3 days in Cape Town but the Mountain was closed due to high winds while we were there, only reopening when we were headed out of town. We decided to chance it and stood in the long line wondering if we had made the wrong decision. It wasn't. The cable car ride is fun with the rotating car and there are wonderful views at the top. Allow at least an hour to explore the top of the mountain - there's good walking and views from every angle. The clouds shift constantly and change the atmosphere. Highly recommended. Two cautions - take a jacket (it is windy) and beware the photo package - it came with a download which we haven't been able to access now 3 weeks later.

This is what Cae Town is all about. Make sure that you go up the cableway while you are visiting Cape Town, but book online in advance and don't leave it until the last day as they may close it if there is high wind and there is no point if it is cloudy and overcast. It is a must-visit attraction in the Mother City

'Must do' experience. We did not book in advance but just waited for a 'Table Mountain' day. Did not have to wait too long in the queue as we were fairly early in the day. Loved the rotating cable car, and the pathways etc at the top were quite a surprise - don't quite know what I had expected!Would highly recommend a drive to the top of Signal Hill to see Table Mountain from a different angle.
Nice view and so what. Too windy, not feeling safe. The view is great all around but the ticket to ride is far too expansive. Not worth for the value.

quite lovely and beautiful. This is worth it, take a jacket as it can be windy but it gives you a great panoramic view of Cape Town, looking down at the beaches is amazing, take your camera without a doubt.
Awesome!. This was such an amazing experience. The weather wasn't great but it's such fun to take the cable car and the view for the top is fantastic.
See note above on the National Park. Watch out for incoming clouds. The path on top is marvelous. Stay on it and you won't get blown off the mountain.

THIS IS A MUST-DO!. You can't go to Table Mountain, without taking this cablecar, which has a 360degree revolving floor. Fabulous views. We had a really fun 'driver' who sang us down with 'My Bunny lies over the ocean'! Made us all laugh. At the top, it was well worth the trip-fantastic! There are guided tours before 3pm, which we missed. Time is to catch one of these and you won't be disappointed. THANK YOU!

A devastating view. The revolving cable car itself was brilliant but the view it took us to was heartbraking. From the magnificence of Table Mountain we saw the belching smoke and raging flames of one of the worst bush fires the Cape has endured in years. It did somewhat take the edge off an otherwise truly magnificent and enjoyable visit

Amazing views, not to be missed.. We did not book tickets in advance as the cable station was one of the stop off point of the round Cape Town bus tour but no major queues as it was lunch time. Whilst the temp down in Cape Town was warm enough for shorts and t shirt the temp has dropped considerably by the time we reached the ticket station (so much so I ended up buying a fleece from one if them hops next to the bus stop.The journey up and then back down the mountain is amazing., don't worry about a view as the cable turns on it journey so that you get to see the whole vista. The view from the top again was amazing but is nothing if the cloud role in which they can easily do. We had clouds and then a perfect view. A wonderful way to spent a few hours.

Amazing view from top of a natural wonder. The aerial cable way takes you on top of the table mountains in a convenient way. Some people also trek to the top. But a cableway is an easy and fun way to reach the top with your family. You can also book passes for the aerial cableway online which can be very helpful as queues are very long and can consume significant time. You can see the lion's head from the top of the table mountain which is a real treat to the eyes.

A Natural Wonder!. No vacation in Cape Town would be complete without a trip to the top of the iconic Table Mountain. Try to go early in the morning because parking can be tricky later in the day and also the top of the mountain gets more and more crowded later in the day. The cable car provided a quick 5-minute ride to the top of the mountain and rotated a full 360 degrees. The views from the top were unrivaled. Once you have been to Table Mountain you will understand why it is considered one of the new 7 natural wonders of the world.

True wonder of the world!. Beat the crowds. Get here early for the first cable car. Travel up and have a breakfast at the cafe sitting on the terrace with the amazing vista in front and all around you. You will never look at the view from any other restaurant in the same way again!

An enjoyable ride. Although we did not make reservations we drove up to the lower station and were able to park easily. After which bought our ticket and made the ride and down with out any delays. It was truly enjoyable and a must for those visiting Cape Town.

Not to be missed. Likely to be a queue for tickets but these can be purchased on-line in advance. We even managed to do it whilst waiting in the queue using a local cell phone. 200 Rand each seems a bit expensive for the cable car. I couldn't help calculating that at their own displayed data of 800 passengers every hour, they are making a cool 160,000 Rand/hr! Not bad! However, it is well worth it to go to the top. I would recommend taking one of the last trips of the day for sundowners. The view must be even more spectacular with a drink in one's hand :)

Breathtaking 7th wonder of the world. Despite a drizzle and fog we went up there with Enrico our guide, whom is a native and knew a lot of history and 'geography' of Capetown. A rainbow over camps bay, Clifton and seapoint was a magnificent view. You could see the lion's head, back and tail at Robbin Island. Devil's point and many others from Table 'Top'.

Up,Up and Away!. We took the cable car early in the morning, so didn't have to wait in line too long. I was amazed at the number of people waiting when we returned down from Table Mountain. I'm sure people near the end of the line were waiting for hours. Make sure you go early to avoid this!The view going up was terrific! The higher up, the wider the view, taking in the beaches and ocean. I was lucky to stand by the window, which rotates with an open space so that when it comes to you, you can take clear photos. Getting on and off were easy and quick with good instructions. Loved the trip going down as I stood in a different spot and saw a different view. Well worth getting up early to experience the ride and the magnificent views from Table Mountain.
amazing view. Amazing view of the city from top . Beaches and other places from table mountain make you marvel at the beauty.

Breathtaking views. Nunber 1 thing to do in Cape Town! Views are amazing and the cableway is so much fun. Was lucky enough to go up on a clear day and be able to have a perfect 360° view of the entire Cape region.

table. mountain a far cry from my childhood. In my time we had to stand almost all day to get up the mountain. This time was great no que as the cable car is bigger takes about 50 people at a time. The cable car also turns 360 degrees hoiw cool is this not. Views to die for well done and also all fascilaties are Eco green

Table Mountain Cable Car. A popular attraction and a must must whilst visiting Cape Town, the views of Cape Town, Camps Bay and even the whole cape peninsula are utterly breathtaking from the top - weather dependent of course. There are several walks of varying difficulties and a refreshment outlet. Make sure you buy your ticket online before, saves queuing. Also might be worth looking into a bus as parking can be quite a way down the hill involving a long walk up to the cable car station. The 360 degree rotating car lends itself to some super views.

Wonderful views. A must for everyone visiting Cape Town, much quicker and easier than walking up the mountain. Amazing views from cable car and from top of mountain on a clear day. Weather can change quickly so check weather forecast before visiting and take a warm sweater. Cablecar closes on windy days, we had to wait 3 days for it to open in late February due to high winds. Several walking routes on top of mountain.

Spectacular views of the Cape. This is well worth the trip to ascend the cableway.Go very early in the morning or towards the end of the afternoon when crowds are lightest. Consider hiking up and taking the cableway back.Views are amazing.Remember to bring a sweater, since it is cool at the top even when it is 28 degrees in the city.

Don't miss it!. Its got to be on top of your must do list when visiting The Mother City.Book online to get jump the queues, the system works well and it's easy to get a refund if you can't make the trip because of the weather.The revolving floor in the cable cars give you a great 360 deg view.Try and give yourself to get away from the crowds at the top and take a walk on one of the many foot paths.Always try to walk in a group though for safety reasons.
Unmissable. Absolutely fabulous views. Do not miss the opportunity to go up Table Mountain. Get there early as it gets really crowded waiting for the cable car.

Spectacular Views. I wish it hadn't been 108F the day we visited, but it was a nearly windless and cloudless day and the views were spectacular going up the tram. I recommend getting the concierge at the hotel to get the tickets on line for you to avoid the long line for tickets. Lines for the cableway are long, so having your ticket in advance saves you one long line.
Surprise. We expected a normal cable car. In this one the floor next to the window rotates so you are carried around very smoothly ensuring you get a wonderful view as you travel up (or down).

Easy to see why it's a modern wonder. After a long que even though we purchased our tickets on line (saving about an hour) the trip up was spectacular but the view from the top was utterly breathtaking. This is a must for anyone young or old if visiting Cape Town and if your not then put it on your bucket list!!!
Tonie's review. Too expensive. Windy and cold even on a hot summer day. We bought jackets on top of table mountain also very over priced
Amazing. The cable car rotates as it goes up to the mountain, providing a 360 degree view of the entire city. It is amazing and totally worth the experience.

A must do in Cape Town. Being a Cape Town resident we do a trip on the cableway a few times a year. This is one of our favourite outings when we have visitors. Buy you tickets online as the queues can be hectic at times. Also a good idea to get the Mycity bus or a cab as parking and traffic can be a challenge during the summer months. Walking up Platteklip Gorge and getting the cablecar down is greatly recommended, but you have to be reasonably fit, if you have a fear of heights this walk will not be a problem unlike some of the other walks on the mountain. If walking up you can buy a one way ticket on top for your ride down. Be warned to do the walk up early in the morning, starting after 6h00 in summer can leave you exhausted and very hot, take at least one litre of water person for the approx. 2 hour walk.

Short ride but worth it.. Best way in my view (pun intended) to get the top of Table Mountain. Saves a hard climb which is sometimes a bit risky. It was crowded so the views were a bit compromised but all in all the best way to get to the top.

Up Up & Away. We had originally booked to do our Cable Car up Table Mountain on Tuesday 24th Feb - but the Table Cloth decided it would come over and the winds picked up. So that day didn't happen, but someone was looking after us later in the week and the winds died down and the cloth dissipated and we made it up on the Thursday. The queue didn't take to long to go down. Once at the front you get the option of which car you would like to take. One that does a full 360 as it's going up or one that doesn't. Of course I chose the 360 'why not eh' great choice, as although the car was busy at least you get to see everything. The view from the car itself is amazing - tip 'Stand by the open window' as the screens are a bit scratched so photos look a bit cloudy if you try take them through it.Excellent experience & well worth the drive up there.

You spin me round....... This is a great short ride up to the to of Table Mountain in a rotating cable car that carries about 65 people. The ride is smooth and the turning is very subtle but gives everyone a great view! It doesn't run in windy conditions, and when open it is best to try and go early or late to avoid the crowds in peak season. It does take at least 15 mins to queue to get down so allow enough time. There is a photographer at the entrance , and your pictures are available at the end to purchase if required. Bit gimmicky but I travelled alone so it was proof I was there! Definitely a must do!

Fun experience. Table mountain is one of the main tourist attractions in Cape Town and the cable station can get very busy. That said, staff are friendly and the entire experience was seamless. The cable cars are fairly new and the floor rotates so as that everyone can get a good view on the way up and down.

Tour to the Top Table Mountain. This is the way to travel to the top of Table Mountain when you are on this cableway you can get some excellent pictures.And when you get to the top of Table Mountain the view is even better.DM.WB
table mountain. cable car up and hiked down almost 3 hours had to keep on stopping for a drink of water at 66 years of age and a bad leg never again
Long line, buy tickets for cable car online....best time to go , after lunch!. If you go on a Friday, expect school groups to crowd the lines. The views are fantastic so bring your camera.

Steep climb with stunning views. If you are frightened of heights the cable car may not be for you but the views are outstanding and I got the impression it was well run and very safe. All enjoyed the ride to the top very much.
On a good day, nothing beats the Mountain. Waiting is minimal when prebooked. Staff courteous and helpful. Cable system clean and well managed. Information clear. Mountain well marked for walks.
Awsome xperience!. The cliff walls only a few feet away and a kilometer down...rotating car floor - just neat, amazing.

A jolly good way to spend a couple of hours.. Check before you go to make sure it's open. The weather may look perfect but the cable car may be closed if it's windy up there. We were lucky, although the views were somewhat misty, we were able to see everything as the mist kept moving. We expected it to be wild up there so were surprised to find concreted paths, viewpoints with information boards, cafe, shop etc at the top. There's a good 45 minute walk, and shorter and longer ones. Plenty of fynbos, dassies, red-winged starlings.

Just transportation to the top. Take the walk to the top (approximately 1.5 hour) instead - requires a reasonable level of fitness. Then take the cable car down. The cable car isn't exiting in itself. It's just the way to the top of Table mountain.

Great Views of Cape Town. This is a quick and great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. It is a very quick ride on a very interesting funicular as it turns 360 degrees as you are going up/down Table Mountain. I would recommend going before 9am to beat all the crowds so you can get some great pictures.

The best way after walking to get to the top.. AND most of us don't have the time or inclination to walk. Do it. It is worth the investment. Try to go early in the day and spend lots of time, but try to be there for sunset. BRING A CAMERA!

table top mountain . What a great day out easy to drive too, parking on site, park on the way up then walk the final bit. disabled friendly. ques to get in long but moves very efficient and quick, cooling mist sprayed over you to aid your comfort. Small shops available at the base before you go up the cable car. here you can get ice cream sun cream small tourist trinkets etc. thier is also a place you can sit under shade above the ice cream parlour with steps ? you can book your tickets online, this puts you in the priority que and is cheaper option. This is no good if you suffer vertigo, as the mountain cable car rises vertically to approximate 1085 metres or 3058 feet above sea level, with spectacular 360 degrees views of Cape Town. This is also a great place to propose to your loved one to be ? thier are refreshments at the top cafe with alcohol. also toilets and souvenir shop. thier are also tour guides if you need them. inside the cable cars can get at least 40 people at a time which rotates slowly inside the cable car so everyone can get a great view on the way up and down. Please use sun cream as it gets hot . also at about 7 pm it's a great place to watch the sun go down out to sea. hope you enjoy as we did lots of love from wayne and Amber
An absolute must in Cape Town. I highly recommend going up early in the morning. The line was very short. It's not a surprise it's listed as a 7 Wonders. Breathtaking!!

Must see. Another 'mustn't miss in the Rough Guide. Get there by Red Bus Tour and save time queuing. BUT, choose a fine day; if it clouds over, the cable car won't bring you down and yuo'll have to walk. That could be very difficult.

Breathtaking !!!!. It's a great ride up to the top of Table Mountain . Amazing views , the Car rotates very slowly so everyone gets a great view . Chance to take some good photographs . A " must do "
while in Cape Town .

Simply amazing. The day we visited the weather was just perfect. Cloudless, warm and the must important, early !We arrived at 9.30am and we hadn't pre booked but there was no queue. The cable car was easy to get onto without waiting too. The views are magnificent from the ground but going up in the revolving car you see the enormity of Table Mountain and I was in awe. We spent over 2 hours walking along some of the designated paths and because there are so many it never felt crowded. If you are visiting SA this is a must visit and if you have time, go twice!
Views, views, views. The Cableway rotates allowing for even views for everyone. One drawback is that it is packed too full.

great view from the top. GOOD1. majestic views. great photo ops.2. great support staff3. march seems to be a quite time as the queues were not long which is great.BAD1. overpriced shop at the top of the mountain which can be expected i suppose.2. Toilet facilities are a bit dear3. Parking is a bit of an issue
nice view. a little crowded but the view is great. there is a short walk around.recommended to take some warm stuff with you as its usually windy

Great trip to the top!. This is a great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Certainly beats the hike! The car revolves as it ascends and everyone gets the opportunity to take in the breath - taking views. It does pay to purchase your tickets before hand as it cuts out the long wait in the queues!

Table Mountain RIP-OFF. I have been to Table Mountain on 28 Feb 2015. Firstly I want to complain about the tickets. Too expensive. Arrive at the top I need a drink ant go to the shop. To my surprise a bottle of God giving water as almost 20.00 *(^*(%^&*%^&*%&*^%*&%&*%&*% rand. Because its the only place you can get a drink the charge as much as they like. This is a rip off. How on earth can the average citizen in South Africa afford any of this. And yes they also want to view from the top. This is absolute discrimination against South Africans and a rip off against all the foreign visitors. And I must say this is not the only place. All SA attraction sites do the same. I wish no one visit these places at all.
Fun To Watch the Clouds. The views are incredible and watching the clouds change as you rise/desend it breath taking. Must do!

Great Way To The Top. This a great way to go to the top of Table Mountain. The car revolves during travel so all passengers get a chance to look at the view even if it is crowded. We brought our tickets in advance which was helpful as we did not have to queue for any length of time. The staff was very friendly and very efficient. One tip is to rearrange your plans if Table Mountain is clear and the weather is sunny as the clouds come down sometimes so there is no point going to look at the view or it is windy and the cable car doesn't run.

Best time is early. It is a great trip to the top of table mountain although you do have to be aware of the weather forecast as cloud is likely to bubble up at any time. Rather than a day ticket we booked a ticket which allowed us access at any time over a two week period which gave us flexibility with the weather. A good tip is to go early in the morning, we arrived just after 08:00 and were at the top by 08:30. At that time of day the air at the top is really fresh and well worth getting up early for.

go for the view. Plan your in Cape Town around this amenity as the weather often forces closure -the website is updated very 5 minututes. There's nthing special to see on the top, but the view area wonderful.
The Views are worth the cable ride. The cable car rotates so that wherever you stand you get great views on the way up and down. Very slick operation.

Must do in Cape Town. If you are staying in Cape Town for a while make sure you do this first if the weather is calm. It was closed for a few days due to the wind but luckily were able to go up on our last day. We saw a little of the view before the clouds rolled in.

Stunning. We were lucky to have great weather on the day we visited Table Mountain. The cable car service was efficient and professionally run. It felt totally safe and we were quickly at the summit. The views from the top are stunning and the cafe has a delicious selection of food and drinks. A great place to visit while in Cape Town!

A crowded cable car. I used this cable car about 2 days before.I do not know , why operator do not pay attention to number of people who arrive. About 30 people arrived and too crowded. No limitation in number of people. Its so awful.
GREAT!. The Aerial Cableway was comfy! It also rotated so you were cheated out of any good views of Cape Town!
Fantastic trip. The wait to get onto the car was a bit long but it was worth it. Spectacular views on an iconic mountain. A must do!

Table Mountain Trip March 2015. As we were in CT after the Cape Town Cycle Tour with nothing to do on Monday, decided to go up to Table Mountain as I had not been up for over 25 years! The Aerial Cableway was amazing, so well organized and the wait was not as long as we expected.Once up at the top, 2 members of our party did the Abseiling which they thoroughly enjoyed.The food was very good and I left my handbag in the restaurant by mistake and it was handed in with nothing missing.The only slightly off-putting thing is the smell from the ablutions but inside they are neat and clean.A highly recommended visit!

Must do !. At first, we tried to go there in the AM, and the line of cars parked by the side of the road was miles long, so we turned back. Then we booked our visit online (very good site), and came back mid day: no queue at all, we were up Table Mountain in a breeze (no pun intended). Wow, is what comes to mind. The views are simply spectacular, and the whole area has a lot to offer: whether you want to take it easy and walk around, or want to explore further along the trails, it is all there, and all the time with stunning views over Cape Town and the bay. Bring your own water bottles as the shops at the top have prices as steep as the slopes, but other than that, definitely a great, and easy trip...
Cable car to the top. Nice cable lift to the Top of Table Mountain. The car is rotating so allow a 360° view of the mountain to the ocean. AWESOME

Great Ride to the Top of Table Mountain. The cable car up to Table Mountain is quite large, holding about 50 people. What is so great about this car is that the floor actually rotates so that you get many different views as you ascend the mountain. The ride is quite smooth and not too fast. A great way to get up to Table Mountain with its breath-taking views.

Amazing 360 degree views.. You feelAs though you are on top of the world. As u take the cable Car you don't have to worry about missing anything as the floor moves. When you get up you are on top of the clouds. Worth it Thanks,
Amazing trip. An excellent cable way, especially the revolving floor that enables every body to see a 360 degree view on the way up and down.

Siehe Table Mountain National Park. Siehe Table Mountain National ParkSiehe Table Mountain National ParkSiehe Table Mountain National ParkSiehe Table Mountain National ParkSiehe Table Mountain National Park
Excellent. The design on the Cable way is incredible, the floor underneath you rotates without you even feeling it.Great design and smooth ride up
A must Do in Cape Town.. We really enjoyed the Cableway ride There is so much to explore on top. We are a couple traveling with our nine year old grand child, and had a great time.
Love it!. It was my second visit to the Table Mountain. This place is amazing! Staff friendly, views amazing! Even the restaurant here is fantastic!

You'll love it. Even if you're afraid of height you will love this ride up.It looks a long way up from the ground. It is. But once you get on the car itself the ride if smooth and wonderful. The car actually rotates so everyone gets a view of the scenery..The car holds some 55 people but is very comfortable even though you are standing. The view from the top is spectacular and you can walk around the whole top to get different angles. There is a cute gift shop and restaurant at the top.To me ,this is a must do in Cape Town.

The best way to get to the top. The cable car is the fastes and more trilling way to get to the top of table mountain. If you like trekking there are plenty of routes on the top of the maintain so by taking the cable car you are not missing anything!
Fab views. This is a must when in cape town make sure you get a clear day it take a while and the queues are long so take water

A long hot wait..but worth the view.. You can't go to Cape Town without going to the top of the mountain. Get your tickets on the red bus.Get there early or in the middle of the afternoon or you will wait. Don't eat on top.Save your Rand for Camps Bay. Make sure to get a picture in front of the plaque at the top to prove you made it. It's a box you have to check so enjoy it.
Great view of CT. I loved everything about it . The steep climb up and the view of the city . You can stroll around and get down through the botanical garden

Fantastic even if you have no head for heights. I knew I had to go up Table Mountain on the cable car (walking wasn't an option due to time limits) even though I have no head for heights, and I'm so glad I did. Visiting the lower cable car station is no substitute for the real thing, so I had to grit my teeth and enter the cable car, but it really wasn't a problem as there is no sensation of movement at all, it felt more like an elevator. The operators are used to people like me and offered me a seat in the middle of the cable car, but I was fine standing on the way down. Too scared to look out though and waited till I got to the top. The views from the summit down to Cape Town and along Table Bay and False Bay are amazing.My husband followed the advice to book tickets as soon as you see blue sky above Table Mountain and by the time we went up at about 9:30 the morning slots were all fully booked. By the time we left the cable car was closed due to high winds, so we were very lucky to have gone when we did. We saw lots of disappointed people arriving as we waited for our taxi back - no excuse really as there are lots of signs along the access road saying it was closed, but I guess they didn't believe it as it was lovely and sunny with just a light breeze down below.
Surprising.... You step in and have the first interesting experience... The cable car is turning arround so that erverybody could see in all directions

Definitely do it!. I usually avoid tourist traps like the plague but would strongly recommend this experience. It's pretty pricey but in my opinion 101% worth it. The cable car ride up itself is brilliant (the floor inside the cabin solely rotates meaning everyone gets to see all views which is clever). The walk around the top is easy and views are stunning. Also get up see loads of dassies and other wild life. Definitely do this if you are in Cape Town!!

Very efficient and a surprise!. Like many of the others who go to the top, we opted to take the tram. It was well organized, efficient and almost too quick. Unbeknownst to me, all the jockeying for position getting loaded onto the tram was pointless. Almost as soon as we started up the mountain, the floor started to turn. I don’t usually read reviews before I go somewhere so certainly others mention it but I was surprised. In the very brief ride up and again going down, the floor rotated a complete 360 degrees and we all saw the same beautiful views at least once. Very unique in my experience. BE SURE TO TAKE YOUR SUNSCREEN if it is a sunny day because you really need about four hours to completely walk all over the top. There is some wheelchair accessability but not over the complete top of the mountain.
The way to the Table Mountai!. Most popular way to the top. During nice weather long queues before you enter the cableway. Best times therefore are in the morning or in the late afternoon. TOP!

Breathtaking views. Go early, book online, and look out for the dassies on the terraceI was impressed that there is disabled access across the top of table mountain from the walkway for a good 200m in every direction
Must be done!. Wonderful experience, great staff and surprisingly a quiet day for a Sunday. Amazing views and photo opportunities. Really enjoyable morning out followed by lunch in Camps Bay.

The Only Way to Travel. This is a moden and grat way to travel to the top of the Mountain. The cable car goes round as well as being an efficient way to get up and down the mountain. The views are spectacular!

Don't miss it!. If you pick the right day you will love going up Table Mountain in the cable car, especially when the alternative is to walk!Don't worry about the queues they have it all sorted to get you up and down as quickly as possible! Well worth the £15. The cable car is smooth running and even though I am scared of heights it is bearable and worthwhile when you step out on top.The views from the top are breathtaking!

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. It is a modern cableway that is popular so on many days in the city when you want to visit Table Mountain, be prepared to wait a bit. The cableway is open from eight o clock and it is quite a good idea to arrive early. Capetonians say, if the sky is blue above Table Mountain, do it immediately.When ascending, the car turns to give you a good view of your surroundings. Make sure you have a good camera handy.

Easy way to the top. It rained when we went, but the cable car was still going. You see beautiful views as the car rotates on its way up the mountain. I'm very glad we did this. It was worth the money to see Table Mountain from the top, get the 360 degree view of Cape Town, and to not have to hike to the top in the rain. Parking is limited - I can imagine it would be hard to find a spot on a normal busy day.

Great Experience. We arrived early so it was a breeze to get tickets and enter the cable car. It was a lovely ride to the top and with the rotating car the view was varied and fantastic as it was a beautiful clear day. After a short walk around up top and absorbed the view, the trip down was again smooth.
Go...the view up is worth it.... Table Mountain is a must do when visiting Cape Town. The ride up is spectacular...the floor of the gondola turns so everyone gets to see the view of CT down below...
A matter of luck. If the weather is good, the view is awesome. But when it gets foggy or rainy, of course, you don't really see much. However, experiencing the cableway is good to go too!

The "must do" activity in CT. A fantastic experience. Although the trip is only short, or because of taking photos it seemed so, it was amazing with the rotating floor. The views from the top were fantastic and the walks laid out were well done and signposted.The cafe on the top was excellent value and served good food.
Stunning . We were in two minds whether to bother or not but so glad we did. The cost is about 225R each but once at the top on a good day the views are breathtaking- if in Cape Town it is a must

A bit of a disappointment. It was very busy and we had to queue for 40 minutes even though we had bought tickets in advance. The ride up and down were good fun but the view from the top is not that much better than at the base station and it was very busy at the top. You have to do it if you go to,capetown but don't expect too much

a real nature wonder of the world. We visited table mountain as part of our trip to cape town. Here is a quick tip, check their website for average waiting time and rather go in the afternoon. Great views from the cable car and its a quick trip to the top. Once on top you can enjoy ice cold beer and even sparkling wine and fine food. The dassies in the mountain is so cute, a must visit.

Nice, but queuing not so nice!. This is the only way to get up Table Mountain - don't try and walk - the risk of getting mugged is way too high.Yes you have to queue - but don't worry about which place you stand in the Cable car - the floor rotates so everyone gets a good view.The cable cars don't run in high wind, so if you are at the top and the siren sounds, make sure you head back quickly in order to be able to get down.
Fun. The cableway rotates as you go up the mountain which gives everyone a chance to see different angles. Worth going up on the cableway if you haven't got a long time to walk up.

Amazing Views. We went today on the hottest day ever since we arrived over a week ago. The line up was long but moved quite efficiently. However, because of the number of tourists, it still took us over an hour to be able to ride the cable car. At the top of the mountain, you could see the Lion's Head and the Table Mountain. It is mostly rock formations over millions of years of existence. With erosion, the actual height of the mountain is lower than the original. It is one of the new 7 wonders of the world.There were supposed to be animals, but we didn't spot any.Entry fee is cheaper if bought online. Currently charges R225.00 online, but I believe it is R250.00 if ticket is bought at the site. The cable car rotates, so one can see different views from different angles. There is no designated area for parking. One has to park along the side of the road. It is a long way to walk if you come in a little bit later than 9:00am.
Queues, queues and more queues. Be prepared for a very long wait. Nice journey up to the top, floor rotates so you get to see all the view, with nobody getting prime spot.

breathtaking. Simply breathtaking !! Provides full view of the city. One of the most beautiful places I have ever visited. The Aerial Cableway is very organized, and the crew are very friendly. Must see !!
A Must Do in Cape Town. Anyone visiting Cape Town must take the Cable Car to the Top of Table Mountains. Pick a clear day as the views from the top are sensational.
Very fast & efficient.. Up & Down gondolas' are on separate tracks so people don't mingle which is good.Beautiful views on the way.Have to make sure you are on the outside if you want to take photos.

Great views on a clear day. If your are in CapeTown and Table Mountain is clear of cloud grab a taxi and take this amazing trip on the revolving cable car to the top station. There are good facilities at the top, toilets ,an ATM a good cafe and clear well marked walking trails. The views are stunning in all directions, over to Robben Island, along the coast to the Cepe, False Bay etc. some folks choose to absail down !.

worth the wait. Table Mountain is one of Cape Town's main attractions so expect the lines to be lengthy, but this can be worked around if you book your tickets online, go early and are prepared to stand in the lines.The views from the cablecar are well worth the wait and the panoramic views from the top on a clear day are incredible! Check the weather forecast on the day you intend to go as the mountain is closed when the wind speed gets to high. Be patient, pre-book and enjoy this wonder of nature.

Beautiful views. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is the only way to go up to the top of Table Mountain unless you plan on hiking up (approximately a 2.5 hour hike). Lines can be long so do buy your tickets on line before and check to make sure the Cableway is operating. The Car rotates slowly giving everyone a 360 degree view.

What a view!. Get there early to avoid the crowds as there will be many arriving when there is a clear day. Rotating cable car gives plenty of chance for views and photos. We did buy the pack with the photo in which we do not normally do. It is worth the money and a good souvenir.
Revolving View. Buy tickets in Advance as queues can be long ! Surprised by the revolving cabin so no need to push for the best view !!

You must go but watch the cloud. The cloud at the top of TM aka the Table Cloth is something you have to watch but on a clear day you absolutely have to take the cable car up. The views and the wildlife at the top are totally worth the queues!
Breath taking. everyone who visits Cape Town has to do this trip, we did it to watch the sun go down, so romantic. I had to pinch myself and considered myself very lucky to be there.
Book in advance. Avoid the queues and book tickets on line, cafe at summit offers a good range of reasonably priced refreshments. Must do in CP
Spectacular!. The cable car floor is rotating, so everyone takes turn to view all sides. That's a fun experience. Best to buy your tickets in advance.

It takes too long and so what...go!. The cable car itself is not a problem. The ride is remarkably quick and the car rotates as it moves up and down the mountain, allowing everyone in the car to get a chance to see the remarkable views. The real pain is waiting in line to get to the cable car... and that's just a function of time of day and the type of day. Still the trip is worth it to get to the top.
Great view. As the topic says it was amazing also easy to go there by bus and take the cable car :).. Would recommend going there and you will also be bale to see lions head..

Captivating views. This is a VERY popular destination. Prepare for long lines if you go later in the day. It's best to buy your tickets before you arrive. The views over Cape Town are breath taking and phenomenal on a clear. Well worth the ride up or if you are athletic the walk up.

Nice rotating cable car. Its a rotating cable car, so everyone gets to see the views on all the sides, no need to rush in to get a good place. The system is efficient, but the queue are very long during peak summer days, which can be a very long and tiring wait.
Spectacular. The trip in the cablecar is, in itself, worth doing. When you get to the top the views are spectacular. This is a must

An amazing aereal experience. The aerial cableway is a must and is all part of the experience of Table Mountain. Book in advance if you can as the ticket queues can be very long especially if the cableway is closed the previous day; it means you don't have to stand out in the heat in a queue for up to two-3 hours.Access is by lots of stairs until you reach the cable car entry point so wear sensible shoes. Once on the cable car you get a bit of a surprise. The cable car rotates slowly through 360 degrees as you go up the mountain so you get an amazing panoramic view of Cape Town. And it only gets better when you reach the top. The best place in the world to have lunch and take in the breath-taking views.The only thing to be aware of is the weather. If high winds blow in the cableway shuts for safety reasons. If this happens when you are at the top of the mountain you have to be prepared to walk down.
Top of the list. this is fabulous trip,in the rotating cable car, so everyone gets to take on the view. Loved walking around at the top on the pathways. Excellent highly recommend

Eating on the Table with a view. Wow! There is little more to say. At the time of my visit, the queues were short & the weather was great. Following a relaxed walk around the summit taking in the views of Cape Town from a hight of 1085m above the city & watching the antics of the Dassies, a visit to the restaurant is worth while to enjoy a light meal or just a good cup of coffee etc. The cable car down as it is on the way up is smooth, quick & efficient as it revolves to ensure all passengers get to see the mountain or the coast. Wow!A good tip would be to get there early in the morning as queues & parking can be frustrating later in the day.

Up up and away!!!. Decided to walk up to the cable car and then take that up from there... well it further than it looks. it was about 4 or 5km with a steady incline. I enjoyed the hike, others in my group did not. The busses and taxis are cheap. The ticket line was short, we got strait onto the car without a wait. The car is not crammed full of people there is enough room for everyone to see(if they want to). Once the car starts going up the floor moves. it rotates around 360 degrees so everyone gets a chance to see both the mountain and the view of the city going up. Getting off was super easy and the top was amazing!
peak experience. A wonderful place to see the whole of the city--spectacular! Well worth the effort to get there and the wait for the tram.

Easy way up the mountain. We had talked about hiking up, but having just gotten off two 11 hour plane rides, we were very happy to have a cable take us! The cable was not crowded, efficient, smooth and quick. We were surprised to see that the floor rotated. Nice view all around!

What a view!. Great excitement the winds that had been keeping us off the mountain cleared and we were able to book our tickets on line and not have to join this very long queue to go up the cable way. Definitely have to book your tickets on line as this enabled us to join a much shorter queue to go up the stairs/elevator to the cable car. As we travel up to the mountain the whole cable car slowly moves around so you have a full 360 view of Cape Town and all the surrounding areas. On arrival at the top we are almost immediately greeted by little rock rabbits or dassies as they are commonly called who are so used to all the people show no fear at all. The beautiful winding paths and rocky trails show only more exquisite surroundings including the big blue ocean all around. In between the rocks are little summer flowers and very lazy lizards with here and there a dance of the most colourful butterflies. You feel so close to the wide expanse of sky which was completely clear from the previous days gusting winds. The little restaurant serves the most delectable pizza slices just enough top up from breakfast a few hours before. Their coffee was also very good. Amazing, awesome, a must place to visit!
Enjoyable. Very well organised, quick and easy access. Just remember to take something warm, it is always cold and windy up there. Spectacular views
Up in the air. A must for any visitor to cape town. Just a wonderful place to visit in safety. Viewing platforms, good place to eat at the cafe, take warm clothing it get cold up there.

Very windy up the mountain but worth it!. Amazing views!!! Bring a jacket or windproof gear as it gets very windy and chilly up the mountain. Also be prepared to wait it they close the cable car in case of strong winds.

Miss this and you haven't seen Cape Town. We normally walk up and take the Cable Car down. ( You can walk up from Platteklip Gorge - takes us and our children about an hour, then across the top to the cable station - 10-20 min, take the Car down then walk along the road back to your car) If you going up and down by cable car book in advance, or arrive early - the queues get loooong...but having said that it's well worth the wait coz up there the views are spectacular. Check the weather before you go. I would recommend you only to go up if it's clear or clouds are high because if a 'tablecloth' cloud decends on the mountain you will have to leave immediately and cut your site seeing short, besides you can see nothing in the cloud and it's freezing. If you go very early you can have breakfast up on top, and if you go late in the day you can have supper up there. For locals you get a free trip on your birthday, not sure if that applies to foreigners - ask when you book, and families get discount - again not sure if it applies to foreigners so, if you are a foreigner ask when booking. Do obey the signs and warnings, it's not like Europe where everything is fenced and guarded, you will fall off if you go too close to the edge. It's got chain guides and fences in some places and because so many tourists do go too close to the edge and get hurt or worse, there are security patrols now, but really, it's just not worth your while ignoring the warnings. Don't take your eyes off your children....they don't tend to exercise caution, I've seen one little boy run off the path so close to the edge my knees turned to jelly. It's big up there so take some time and explore, you can walk far and go to the reservoir, or you can just stay on the actual 'table' part - either way it's an experience you won't get anywhere else.

A GREAT WAY TO GET TO TABLE MOUNTAIN.. Its worth taking it just because of the breathtaking views you see from there. Although if you do not want to wait hours queuing you should book your ticket online and pre-purchase it. In general great service and efficiency and the staff was quite friendly.

Visit up Table Mountain. I was privileged to go up Table Mountain on 14 February 2015 with my Dad. The organization and facilities were excellent.As it was Dad's birthday on the day and he wearable to provide proof he got a free ride on the cable car .Only I had to pay, something to remember when you go.A delightful day out.
Fun cable car ride. Cable car rotates very slowly 360 degrees on the way up to the top. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Great views and enjoyed the visit to Table Mountain.
Arrive early to avoid the queues.. Tremendous views from the summit, walk along the paths and at every turn a new photo opportunity presents itself. Possibly a photographers heaven.

well worth the wait. We queued for 90 mins and I was fearful; that it would be overcrowded when we got up there! However, i was proved wrong. The plateau of the mountain is so large that the crowds are spread thinly and the cafe huge which meant we had no trouble (and we were a party of six) finding seating at the busiest of lunch times.Tip - book your tickets online and beat the queues! This can even be done on the same day if you are prepared to use your smartphone. Just be wary of your plan and the data costs.

You must take the cable car ride up to Table Mountain!. The cable car ride up was amazing- the car rotates and the views are to die for. Staff are really friendly. The car are good size so you can move about to see the views! Table mountain is majestic when you get to the top!!

Wow! Enjoy panoramic views of Cape Town and the area.. Wow! Enjoy panoramic views of Cape Town and the area. This cable car revolves while moving so that all occupants can see the surrounding area. It's impressive.

You need a head for heights. If you aren't good with heights stand in the middle of the cablecar, however if you want to enjoy the view and take photos stand on the outside. The floor rotates within the capsule so you get a full 360 degree view.This is the third generation cablecar, check out one of the previous versions by the road near the ticket office.Buy your tickets online to save queues, online tickets are valid for 14 days from your chosen date. Go in the early afternoon when the morning coach parties have left. The weather at the top has to be good for the cableway to operate so check before you go.

Cable car - Cape Town. This is a fantastic place to go. Pick a nice clear day with not too much wind and get there early OR go there early and get tickets for later so you can get a sunset from up top. Wheelchair friendly, we took my aged mum up and she loved it so much we took her again. The go have a meal at Rhodes memorial but make sure you have a booked table there or you will not get one.
Amazing views. Go early in the morning. Book tickets through the website before hand to avoid long lines. Outstanding views. Gets cold up there but an absolute must see in CapeTown.

Awesome! Wonderful!. The ride up on this cable car was amazing. It was first thing in the morning-to beat the tourists and possible cloud cover. The higher you went the greater the view. Reaching the top was something else. We wandered around and Dad showed me where he had to climb up with a full pack when he was in the British Army way back when. I was amazed as I couldn't fathom trying it now with no pack as it looks pretty steep and rugged. It was a beautiful clear day and we could see for miles. A 'don't miss' if you visit Cape Town. Enjoyed the ride down, although by then getting crowded as you could see things you missed on the way up. Wonderous!

Best views in the world!. I had booked ahead online in a rather complicated way, having to pay for and pick up a voucher at a Pick and Pay, but despite it being a Saturday I needn't have bothered as there was no line-up at all. The funicular ride is great, the car revolves as it ascends the steep granite face, so wherever you are standing in the car, you get 360 degree views. The view at the top is of course stunning, and there are trails to walk along. The usual touristy shops, but no junk, and a self-serve restaurant where we had a slice of very decent pizza. But go for the views! Birds and dassies at the top, and you can get away from the milling crowds easily by walking even a short distance along one of the trails.
Unless you are fit, its the only way up!. Great organisation means the queues move swiftly. The cablecar rotates so you get a 360 which for those with fear of heights, might be a bit daunting.

Good view, safe and enjoyable. I have been in other aerial cableway but this was particularly interesting and exciting because is high, floor rotate so you have chance to take photos from different angles, and view is inspiring (in a sunny day at least). Is worth to do it.

Just Do It!!!. Was visited a few years back.When u in Cpt and the weather is good, grab a jacket, your camera and head for the Table Mountain Cable Way. Its a MUST... Once you on top of the mountain, then only will you understand what the hype is all about! Take a jacket with ... Dont let the weather at the bottom fool you!

If weather clear - it's a must. We only had a few days in cape town, and it was my 2nd visit, (the first time we missed the only cloud free day on a pre-booked excursion). So this time we knew to take advantage of any time it was cloud free. We got a taxi from our hotel, but by the time we got there, the clouds had covered the top, so we hung around for an hour to see if they would clear. They did not. So we walked from to the waterfront (not advisable - takes well over 2 hrs) we ended up having a late lunch there, and looking back at the mountain it looked like it was clearing so grabbed another taxi back to it. Luckily most people had given up on it for the day, so we immediately bought 2 tickets as there was no line, and literally walked into a car as its doors were closing. The views from the top are fantastic, and well worth the effort.

Seen the changes over the years. I cannot rave about it enough. The cable car has changed over the years ;-). The first time I went was 8 years old lol. Today there is a high tech cable car with a revolving floor. So you see a panoramic view as you go up. I can't rave about the view of the Lion, including Lion's head enough. Just go and see :-D.

Just go there. Do it - go up there and don´t hesitate !You will remember this for the rest of your Life. It cost some Money, but it Worth it, we promise.This is one of the things you have to do in Cape Town
A bird's eye view of CPT. Definitely a wonder of the world! An experience not to be missed when in CPT. Hold thumbs the wind does not blow too badly but the views are just awe-inspiring.

Spectacular - a must!. The journey to the top of Table Mountain is a big part of the experience. Spectacular views as you ascend, the revolving floor helps you get the full perspective of the mountain. Well organised by a friendly and efficient team the wait is much less than you expect when joining the queue. It's important to pick the right day so not convinced of the advantages of pre-booking the trip before you arrive in Cape Town.

great views. Costs 115 rand each way ! but worth the money for the great views and a stroll on the top of the oldest mountain in the world ! The Hop on hop off bus stops here and you could then take the cable car up....

A must!. This is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. The view is spectacular and the "ride" up, awesome and smooth! I am a bit afraid of heights but felt great! Remember to take a jacket with as it can get chilly up there! You can choose to go to the restaurant if you wish but we preferred to take our own little picnic in a backpack. Take your time, walk around and enjoy the spectacular view.

Super Views. Take the trip to the top of Table Mountain early in the day. The queues are less and the early morning sun makes the scenery even better. We were very lucky to go on a clear fine and sunny morning. The walks on the top are very good - just give yourself time to take it all in

The Table Spread. Book online and avoid the long lines and take a light jacket for just in case. Views are spectacular so have your camera ready and if the weather is good spend hours and venture further along paths and you will be rewarded with views few ever get to see.

A Must See in Capetown. The ride up the mountain in the cable car offer s spectacular view of the surrounds. The car rotates so everyone gets a chance to see on the ride up. Once on top there are trails to follow and points where one can see spectacular views. Allow time to explore and enjoy the views. Make sure to include Table Mountain in our plans when visiting Capetown.
A must do when in Cape Town. Spectacular views of Cape Town and coastal areas at the top of Table Mountain. The cable trip up and down was quite fast, nice views from the cable car.

Amazing views over Cape town. The cable car turns 360 degrees as you go up to the top of table mountain so you don't miss any sights, the views from the top were fantastic, just make sure you go up before the clouds come down

Simply Stunning. Table Mountain is amazing. The top of the mountain offers some of the best views I've ever seen. Great place to take photos. The line can get long, so buy tickets online for a shorter wait. Also, make sure to check the weather beforehand, as the cableway closes in even slight rain or wind.
Great view!. Well worth the time to get to the top. I would have loved to hike it but that was not in the cards. It is another bonus of taking the On/Off Red Line Bus.

Table Mountain a must-see in Cape Town. I live in Cape Town and love to walk in the mountains, so I have often been on Table Mountain. It is a special place, with wonderful views in all directions and plenty of `fynbos' ,the species-rich vegetation of the Cape. Take the cable car up early in the morning and see the sun rise over the distant mountains, or go in the early evening for a summer sunset picnic. In the high summer tourist season it can get very busy with long queues, but you can save hassle by booking online. An important word of caution though - even though it is in our `backyard' a trip up Table Mountain needs all the precautions of any other mountain trip - sturdy footwear, awareness of weather conditions and appropriate clothing, water and sunscreen. I

The view !!!. By far the best view you can imagine of Cape Town and surrounds.....if there is no fog :-) Watch the mountain, look at the forecast and ask the locals. Also, if you are visiting during peak tourist season, be prepared for a very lengthy queue ! Take the hop on hop off bus. Parking is VERY limited. If your knees can handle a modestly sloping downhill walk, consider walking down instead of returning to base via the gondola.
Breathtakingly Beautiful. Just do it! It will take your breath away. The views are absolutely gorgeous. I spent my birthday on top of Table Mountain and it was amazing.

Well Organised /cant get better view than this. No one can predict weather , waited 2 days to go on Cableway due to weather & technical issues.. Hence , waited over an hour to que up to the cableway as it was packed with sightseers.. the staff are very friendly & helpful and well organised. THe view is truly breath taking from the cableway and up on top of the mountain.. you cannot get better than this .... great value and one of the best way to see CAPE TOWN

Spectacular sunset. Viewing the sun set from the top of table mountain is a must. I have been up the mountain during the day and it is a wonderful experience to have a birds eye view of Cape Town and surrounds. This was my first trip up the mountain at sunset and there is something magical about this experience. Sunset trips are only during summer for a limited period and at half price. Go early, order a drink and supper, find a spot and enjoy.

Congestion of a different kind. At first sight, the cableway company appears to be in control. Once the tickets are purchased, there is a slight reconsideration. The methods of getting to the cable car on a really busy day are somewhat congested and unruly.The trip up is spectacular and the rotation of the car allows for a perfect view. Initially the cost for the trip is considered reasonable, but once you are at the top, it is worth every penny.

A first world experience to kick your Cape Town stay off. The cable car has come a long way since I travelled up the mountain as a child in the 70's. The new cars carry 65 people and travel up the mountain in 5 minutes. The interior of the car rotates so that all passengers are afforded a 360 degree view. Wait times on weekends are longer, but don't be put off by the long lines, the whole process is very efficient. We were in a line from near the ticket office outside the building and were in a car after 20 minutes. Good people watching in the queue as there are visitors from all over the world. Take a jacket regardless of what the weather is like on the ground, it can be cool and windy on the table top. The views are spectacular and it is a good way to start your Cape Town visit as it gives a good orientation of the various parts of this amazing city.

Breath Taking Table Mountain. The first Blue sky ,make a bee line for one of Cape Towns most precious possession .The weather in Cape town is changeable and extreme,very hot,very windy .Take the cable car up and if you are up to it walk down ,it is amazing and no trip to Cape Town would be complete without pictures from Table Mountain.Wear good sturdy walking shoes .I believe that anyone with a birthday on the day can take the cable car for free .

Table Mountain cable car. A great way to spend an afternoon or morning. The cable car revolves so don't worry about facing the mountain when you get in. Views are fantastic and once you get to the top there are paved walk ways very flat and suitable for even the elderly. There is a very nice restaurant that serves inexpensive good quality food and there is self serve section which is pretty efficient.I would allow at least 2 hours for this visit as you can spend some time either in the immediate vicinity of the restaurant taking in the spectacular views of the city, oceans and mountains or you can walk a little further out along the pathways. Sometimes there may be a queue to the cable car especially during peak season so factor this in for time as well. I would also suggest getting an update of the weather condition to ensure you go on a cloudless day!
It was a great experience.. The table car Experience was awesome. We had nice opportunity to see the beauty of capetown with a view on Top.

Great Day Out. Having not been to Cape Town for 24 years, the new cable cars are very pleasant and the moving floor amazing. Even if you get into the cable car last, you get a chance to see 360 degrees!n

The best way to see Cape Town. Everyone should go up Table Mountain on the aerial cableway at least once, and having done that they will surely want to go again, if only to descend more gently after a vigorous walk up the mountain. The new cable cars (some of us remember the old box cars that used to go up, carrying just 10 or 15 passengers at a time) hold a lot of people and rotate slowly as they ascend and descend so there's no need to hurry on boar to get the best position. The trip is not cheap however, and the assumption seems to be that all the overseas visitors will not notice how expensive it is. The stunning views make up for any misgivings about this however.

Up In The Clouds. You can walk up Table Mountain via one of many paths; it takes up to three hours one way. Much easier though is to take the aerial cableway up from Tafelberg Road. Once on top though, it's a whole new world with a network of paths that covers the entire mountain. It's easy to get lost up there, but most intersections are signposted.Be sure to take warm clothing as the weather can change very quickly. The further you venture from the upper cable station the more exciting it gets, and less crowded. The adventurous can consider a trip up and then walk down to Kirstebosch and return by taxi, or reverse this route. A local guide is recommended as the going can get tricky. It's a great green lung at the centre of this great city, and maybe its single most appealing feature.

A must for tourists.. Table Mountain, one of the wonders of the world, provides a platform or one of the sights ofthe world !The Swiss built, slowly rotating cable cars provide a breathtaking view of the city, the harbourand the northern suburbs of this great city.At the top are viewing platforms and one can also see the Atlantic suburbs from up there.There is a restaurant near the upper cable station. Two notes of caution. If there is a wind blowing in the city, check if the cableway is operatingand take a jersey or windbreaker as, even on a warm day, it can be chilly up there.

A must-visit. Get up early in the morning so as to be first in line to get into the cable car to travel up the mountain. The views of the peninsula are awesome and this is definitely a good place to start when visiting Cape Town.

Always a joy. You cannot visit Cape Town and not experience one of the 7 Wonders of the Natural World.Taking the revolving Cable Car up or down or hiking up or perhaps even a combination of both are all possibilities. Best to check the Table Mountain Aerialway website to see what the conditions are on the mountain as well as any special deals which they frequently run.For South Africans who choose to celebrate their birthday on the mountain, the cost of the ticket is free !The Dassies are always a happy sight and the views over the Peninsula, out towards the sea and 12 Apostles are all unrivalled!

Going up for a bird's eye view. I love visiting places where you can get up high and look out over the city - like the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the cable cars in Barcelona and even Grenoble. But none of those offer the jaw-droppingly spectacular vistas that Table Mountain and its cable car do. The booking/ticketing process is efficient, as is boarding and disembarking - and the fact that the car can accommodate so many people and offer them all great views courtesy of the rotating floor means no-one loses out on a single view. Once up top (having remembered to take along a jacket because the weather can be much cooler up at 1086m above sea level with cool winds often a factor up top) you realise what a marvel of nature Table Mountain is. The views up north towards Blouberg and Melkbosstrand with Robben Island prominently situated in the middle of Table Bay are rivalled only by the views eastwards, over the city, Cape flats and towards the distant Hottentots Holland range behind Somerset West. A short stroll over well paved paths and you can look south down the rest of the Cape peninsula, overlooking Camps Bay and its beautiful crescent of palm-fringed white beach - or even further to the south-east where Simonstown, Fish Hoek and Muizenberg lurk.Yes, it can be crowded because this is one of those "must do" things when in the Mother City but it's easy enough to head off down one of the many well-marked paths and get away from your fellow tourists. A walk to the Platteklip gorge edge is recommended, for the sheer entertainment value of watching more intrepid hikers plod their way up the trail from the road below. One word of advice - keep an eye on the weather, particularly the wind because it can become quite brisk and bring in the distinctive cloud 'tablecloth' rapidly and can be somewhat disorientating. Stick to the paths and don't be tempted to wander off and find a shortcut should the cloud come in.

Cableway trip up Table Mountain. It is always great to do the Cable Way trip up the mountain. The sunset special (half price) in Dec and Jan each year makes it great value as well. The queus are never too long and the views awesome. i recommend packing your own picnic and walking along the mountain top to one of the lookout points.
Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. World Class trip with magnificent views - just check before you go if the weather looks doubtful. Sometimes cableway closed.

An Unforgettable experience!. A once in a lifetime experience. When in Cape Town you have to go up the cableway. It is spectacular. Your first day of no cloud, no wind and good weather must be used for this experience!

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway a must for all. This is a must for first time travellers and locals alike. I hiked up Platteklip gorge with my wife and 8 & 10 year old sons and took the cable car down. The views are spectacular up there. The hike was fun and took about 1.5 hours. Do be careful as there are plenty loose rocks!

Table mountain and cable car. As a local its simply the best way to show off our beautiful city to visitors from neighboring provinces and overseas, it also helps to book online and to check the weather, no better value for money and a great day spens exploring, as a local I love it both the climb and the cable car.

COLD, WINDY, BEAUTIFUL TABLE MOUNTAIN. This is by no means the first time my husband and I have been up Table Mountain, and we almost did not go, as they had it closed for HIGH WINDS. We were about to leave when they opened it up. So up we went in the revolving cable car, which was a novelty, as the last time we went was a long, long time ago in the old lifts. We got to the top, and I'm terribly afraid of heights, but this trip seems so safe, you forget all about it. We had our walkabout, took some pics, went to the souvenir shop and bought my son a T shirt. He has them from the strangest places. We did not stay long as it was very windy, and bitterly cold, so we headed down again. So many tourists with cameras the size of canons. The next day I had fibrositis in my neck. Cover up well. Wear a thick scarf. And walking boots. Thoroughly enjoyed it, and a well worth trip in Cape Town.

Hike up, cable down. Kick your own butt. You can do it. Two hour hike up, restaurant on top, then cable down. So good. Worth the hike. Seriously please do it. The views are amazing but do it way before sundown so you don't miss the cable car! Because it does close. Plettiklip gorge is the easiest route to hike.
surprise. A beautiful ride up the mountain and have a fantastic view of the entire Cape Town. There is special assistance for elders and disabled too. Worth the ride and has a small ticket .

Very good!. Overall very good. Extremely busy when I went. The cable itself is incredible (maybe cramped though). Im not a fan of heights and it was testing. At the top it was very good. High winds brought our trip to premature end as the sirens rang out to leave the mountain. Would recommend
Amazing veiws. Very fast way up a mountain!!!!!,views stunning,but yo must check the weather conditions for wind and low cloud.

Table Mountain Cape Town. This was a fantastic excursion, no queues, splendid views, not expensive and good value for money.Remember to check the weather as it is subject to change quickly at the top.

Beautiful! Don't miss! . Table Mountain is incredible and even from the ground speaks for itself. Some tips for making the most of your trip up the cable car, be there before it opens to get in line and choose a good weather day, as Cape Town can have unpredictable weather changes. We went up second car on a beautiful blue bird day before the wind picked up and the clouds rolled in. Absolutely gorgeous view of table mountain, would highly recommend this experience!

The clouds and rain stopped our tripp. I am sure it it worth Going thereWe were just unlucky it startes rainingThe staff called i taxi and was were helpfullyWill comeback backDont go there og you cant see the Cable car from town because Them the view is limited evt not her the full view

top-notch experience. it's amazing being on a rotating cable first and have a 360° view of Cape Town. When you arrive on top, the view is really breathtaking - I've been there on a sunny and slightly windy day and I really loved to be on top of this great and sacred mountain.I walked around and I met dassies: beautiful cuties. It seems that they're not afraid of humans, except that you don't have to touch them because they bite, but it's so easy to take pictures of them. I loved this experience a lot

Do not miss this.. We were lucky and picked a quiet day, it can get very busy. good pathways take you around the mountain top lots of wildlife and flowers to see and the views are spectacular. Good cafe and small gift shop.

Watch out of for th Clouds. If you see clouds on the top of the mountain then don't go, if its a nice sunny morning then take the bus to the Cable car ( the only way to travel) not scary and very quickYou will be amazed at the views and the ease of walking aroundA great restaurant for either a proper Lunch or for sandwichesA must for every tourist

A bucket list item. My wife is afraid of heights. However, friends convinced us to go with. An amazing experience. Do yourself a favour though - only go on a good day (around February) and try to go when there is a sunset-special, i.e. half-price after 18h00. It is way too expensive to go any other time.
Great View. Highly recommend but make sure you check the website before heading there bc winds can shut it down.

Beautiful Views. Seeing the gondola at the top of the mountain from down below is a bit scarry, but once you are up there, it's awesome. It's a quick ride to the top of the mountain, and then you can spend whatever time you want looking and walking around. We had one of those 5-star days with a 360-clear view, so just spectacular. A must do!
Great experience. Great visibility and views. Get there early to avoid queues. The cable car revolves so you don't have to worry where you position yourself.

Best View in Town (if the weather is good). Travelled up in the rotating cabin after a long queue (nearly an hour) get there early before the coach tours, however well worth it. Yes it is expensive 225 rand(£22:50p) for return journey. I did the same trip 40 years ago in an open cab you will see at the bottom (that was scary) Spend time at the top (if weather good) and walk to Maclear's beacon about 1 1/2 hours each way and if you have a head for heights come back via the Dassie walk for some fantastic views,. (do not attempt in strong winds)

Walked Up, Took The Cable Car Down. A great way to see the area from the clouds. We had walked up, which made us enjoy the easy and pleasant trip down even more! Not the cheapest four minute trip we have made (approx £13.50 for a single trip for two people) but when you consider the feat of engineering and the novelty of the ride, it was worth it.
Best Views of Cape Town. The tram to the top of Table Mountain gets you to the best views of the city and surrounding areas. Well worth the trip!

excellent cable way. Climbing the hill is not a very welcome option for most of the people and therefore,cableway provides a good means to reach the top of table mountain.it is quite efficient and one is at the top in 5 minutes.Advance booking is required at certain times.

Must do for a great view. It's a quick 3 minute ride to the top and the view is totally worth it. Bring a light jacket even in summer because it can get pretty windy up there and it's definitely cooler at the top. If you take the City Sightseeing bus up there buy your tickets from them ahead of time so you don't have to wait on line.

Fantastic views. We were lucky with the weather, clear skies and no wind. Also as we were there early no queues! The view from the summit is amazing, there are trails to stroll around offering 360 degree of panorama. I would recommend the mornings to visit as the wind gets up in the late afternoon plus the clouds start to form the tablecloth about the same time. Watching the clouds roll in from the city is also not to be missed.

Ride Up Was Great, Walk Down was a Challenge. The line to for the cableway is long. If you can buy tickets in advance you should. The ride up and the view at the top is spectacular, as reviewed by many others. There is a cafe so you can have a bite to eat or drink. I highly recommend this if you are planning to hike down. The hike down was very difficult with very uneven terrain an no rails to hold on to and all down, no level areas. It took me 3 hours and I was exhausted, I am a bit older but not in bad shape. Just saying, eat and take lots of water, wear good shoes and enjoy the amazing views on the way down. It is about a mile hike on the road back to the entrance after you get off the mountain.

Expensive, fast, and easy. Buy your ticket online before you go.It's a cable car, and the one interesting feature is that the floor turns as you go up. The ascent and descent is very quick, but you get turned 360 during the ride so you can see out in all directions.When we went the queue was short and we hardly waited, but there are reports of long queues, so pick your time.

Spectacular and a 'must do' in Cape Town. The best advice I can share is to take the cable up the Table on the first clear day you have as Cape Town can have all seasons within days! It is also closed during inclement weather.Our hotel concierge booked our tickets online which saved on waiting in a long queue. The rotating cable car provided spectacular views on the way up and down. Despite going in the summer it was cold at the top but the 360 views, landscape and wildlife (we saw lizards and Dassie) made up for any discomfort. Be prepared to spend at least a few hours of you want to walk around to all the viewing areas.

Great attraction. Was a great experience to go up to Table Mountain again. Very well organised and clean. One tip I would suggest is that you buy your tickets online. It saved us a very long wait in a very long line.

Don't miss sunset. Obviously table mountain is a must. Even if you aren't a hiker, willing to hump it up two hours for a spectacular view, you should still do table mountain. The views are stunning and the tram is fast and entertaining. One the the best features is that the tram's floor rotates so that everyone gets a good view during the short ride to the top. We took the evening tram ride and were amazed the the beauty of watching the sunset. However be prepared for a longer wait due to everyone wanting to head down once the sun set. If we would have done anything better, we would have brought a little picnic. And don't forget your jacket, even in the summer it got chilly.

Must do. Taking the cableway up to Table Mountain is a must when you're in Cape Town. Although we had to wait a long time in the queue, it was well worth it. You have an excellent view over the city, its surrondings, the ocean and Robben Island.

Gotta do it!. Really fun ride up in the cable car - it rotates slowly so that all the passengers have a chance to see the views from all sides. Spectacular views from the car and once you get up top, of course. We didn't have time to explore the paths but there are walking traills to explore once you are up top. The only tricky part is timing your visit so that the mountain isn't socked in with clouds, obscuring the view, or planning a ride up when the wind is high and the cable car has to shut down for safety.

What an experience. For a tourist to Cape Town this should be compulsory. It is so educational and the most beautiful views over the whole city and mountain range, such an exciting experience in cable car and rider of car must be commended on his fun character. A must for everyone.

Incredible. It was my first time up the CableWay and yes I was a little bit frightened as I looked up the mountain and saw how high it was.But, it was an amazing experience. The Cable Car ride up was incredible, the car rotates so that everyone gets to see the view. I did not expect it to go up so quickly.Table Mountain is spectacular and the views are never ending (on a clear day).
Superb ride. The most amazing views, and as the car rotates everyone gets a chance to see them all. Very quick transfer time, so if you're scared of heights it's not too long to suffer.
