Awesome Ride. The queue is always long but it moves every quickly. Before we knew it we were on the way up. The driver was very friendly. The view was fantastic. We were there over the Christmas period and we even had Father Christmas is our Cable car on the way down.

On a clear day you can see forever!. Table Mountain has been rated on one of the natural 7 wonders of the world and is worth a visit whether you are a visitor or a local. The cable car takes 65 passengers and does one full revolution on the way up or down so everyone gets a full 360 degree view. The mountain is covered in local vegetation and has beautiful pathways that traverse the top. The lookout points are spectacular and provide views across Robben Island, up the West Coast, across the East Coast and along the 12 Apostles. A must for the more enthusiastic is a walk to McClears Beacon which should take about 30 minutes that takes you past Platteklip Gorge and onto the wetland area on the mountain. Pathways have wooden walkways above any wet areas to keep your shoes dry! If you want to walk up the mountain, take Platteklip Gorge which is about one kilometre past the lower cable station, as it is the easiest route and should take the average person about an hour and a half to two hours. Leave early to avoid the sun against the face of the mountain and take sunblock and plenty of water. At least two litres per person. You will never tire of Table Mountain. I have climbed the mountain using all the various pathways and did a birthday trip up the cable way recently. Magnificent. Remember, you get a free trip up and down the cable way on your birthday but don't forget to bring your ID documents! Have fun.

Save steps!. Unless you really love to hike, this is an amazing way to get to the top of Table Mountain. The views going up are fabulous and will give a great perspective of how far you have traveled. But do watch out because if the wind picks up, the cable car will go back down and you will be stuck (didn't happen on our trip, but heard all about it). The ride is also great because the car makes a slow circle so you can get a view out of each side as you go up and down. Just make sure you are by the outside for the best visibility.
Fab. Was dreading the cable car as I have a fear of heights but it was so quick and I felt really safe. It revolved around as you go up but I really enjoyed it.

A MUST DO…….. It must be on the top of every tourist list to Cape Town. The day we went there were no queues, although we had a tour party in the cable car, who thought it was their right to post people out of the way! but it was truly amazing at the top, had a nice walk round, then sat at the Table Top cafe for a nice glass of wine.

Cape Cableway. The stunning table mountain is sheer awesomeness. To those who are short of time have the cableway as a blessing. We were hoping the weather is on our side, as the table mountain can be closed due to bad weather. When we finally got an opportunity we realized that we had little time to waste and took a two way ticket, at the table mountain center. The aerial cable is world class in construction and its 360 rotating axis gave the view an even more awesome twist. Surely it was crowded, but oddly i did not find it annoying. It zipped past pretty quickly. Found it fully worth, specially we were really short of time.

Always a stunning place to visit!. Our family booked online to avoid the holiday crowd. Worked well. Always a stunning ride and view. Well kept and clean not withstanding the holiday crowd. A 'must do' when the weather is nice.
Great Views. One of the best attractions in Cape Town, the views on the way up and down are stunning and the rotating floor just adds to the experience.
overrated. overated crowded expensive and full of merchandise. I took it only down after climbing up but a next time I will definitely also climb down and enjoy it twice as much.

Great view of cape town.... The cableway is great.Awesome view of cape town.It is a 3 minutes ride and is a great experience.Just before boarding the car they take a picture which they sell it later.It is a rotating cable car,just like the one in Titlis in Switzerland..Must do..
Cable ride. The cable way runs frequently and turns as it ascends and descends so that all visitors get a 360 degree view.

The Star Attraction. What is there to say about Table Mountain that has not already been said. The simple fact is, if you are a tourist in Cape Town, you HAVE to go up Table Mountain.The tips to avoid disappointment and long queues during peak season are simply to book online at www.tablemountain.net and print your tickets out to take with you - this one act will save you hours in the queue to buy tickets. Furthermore, make sure you get there early in the morning - around 7:30 should do. With my trip, I did this, and waited less than 20 minutes before i was at the top of the mountain. People that arrived after eight, and didnt buy tickets online looked like they were in for a good two hour wait.Secondly, regardless of how pleasant the weather seems to be on the ground, TAKE A WARM JACKET. If you dont, you will more than likely be paying a hefty sum to buy one from the shop at the top cableway station!Of course, you always have the option of walking up or down - make no mistake, this is no leisurely stroll - you need to be quite fit and able, as there are bits that are more serious than walking a trail.Thats it - Make a plan to get there!

S Africa 2015. This is a very efficient operation, we walked straight in. The walks at the top are amazing, but the cafe up top is a bit commercial. We experienced sunset which was truly dramatic. Must be done if in Cape Town.

Best cable car. After our hike up the mountain we come down by the cable car, best one that I ever travelled in, IT rotates gently 360 deg which allows you enough time to take in the beautiful sights and off course get great pictures, another must do.

Don't worry if your scared of heights. I hate heights. Not ashamed to admit it, but there you go I hate them.As we approached the cable car I got a little uneasy. Our picture was taken before boarding the car. As it ascended the car rotated, allowing everyone to view Cape Town below and the mountain above.Once on top, well you will just have to come and see for yourself!!!

A must do in cape town. The place with the best view that I have ever seen. The 3.5 minutes ride was a great experience, the rotating floor made everyone see the climb all around. The picture that they have taken of us was then sold to us with variations of photoshop with the mountain view and a disk with information about the mountain

Completely worth doing!!!. The view and tranquility at the top of the mountain were fantastic! Table Mountain has been on a bucket list for a long time and with good reason.Very reasonable cab ride from downtown, and the Sunset Special of half off made it even better!Definitely recommend for anyone!

Come and see!. Unforgettable experience. This must the one of the few attractions that everybody would love... Even thise who are too scared to open their eyes during the whole ride. Amazing to see people climbing the mountain somewhere half way...

On a clear day you can see forever. Spectacular views of Table Bay and Capetown. Great ride and scenery in every direction. Buy tickets in advance if possible. Lots of walking paths at the top. Much bigger area than you would think.

A must in Cape Town. A bit of a turist trap but absolutely beautiful! You have a stunning view of the city and its surroundings, if you have the time you should take a longer walk along one of the paths and experience the nature and the silence away from the area around the cable car station and the restaurant.
Revolving floor. We really enjoyed the cable car. The views are amazing and the revolving floor makes sure that you don't miss anything no matter how crowded it is or where you're standing. .
A bit expensive. The food was a bit expensive and obviously aimed at tourists. Next time we'll pack our own snacks for the kids

A must see even for the most jaded traveler. This is one of those places that even the most jaded traveler must see. The view is spectacular and the attraction is very organized. It doesn't take very long to see this place and the dining options are not that good but then again you're not going to for food here going to for the view which is hard to surpass
Great expirience. Well worth doing can hike back down if you want and are fit..................................................................

What a view. A great way to see the whole of Cape Town spread out in front of you. Fantastic views from the top, lots of safe footpaths, and plenty of other paths for the more adventurous to get away from the crowds. Book your ticket online before you go to avoid yhe queues and get there early if you can to have the place to yourself(ish).

Fantastic. This is a must do for anyone visiting Cape Town. do go at your first opportunity because it closes when there is cloud at the top or bottom of the mountain and also when it is too windy. The two cable cars hold 65 passengers each and the floor revolves to give everyone a view in every direction.It is 225 rand return in a morning and 250 rand in the afternoon.It can be easier to take the shuttle bus from the main road at Kloof Nek than having to park the car up to half a mile away at the side of the road then walk up the steep road.

Easy Access to the top....if..... it's open! Also, the line up during peak times can be over 2 hours long. Be sure to buy your tickets on-line before you go, it will save you lots of time. Be sure to go early in the morning too, as the clouds come in around lunch time, and the lines are painfully long by then! The best way to the top is to hike it - Platteklip Gorge is beautiful and only 2 hours to the top. Wear good shoes and carry water though.
Excellent!. A must do in Cape Town. Well worth the visit. The trails are easy and the views just precious. If it's got take lots of water to drink!
Fabulous experience. Amazing views - very steep! And great walking around on the top. Didn't do it on my last visit, and glad to have made it this time.

Visiting Table Mountain. This place is one of the modern day "Wonders of the World" and despite the "taxi scam rip off" that goes on in trying to get up to the cable car station, it is deserving of that inclusion. Views from the top are stunning and spectacular so take your camera. The restaurant on top is a disappointment,as you are a captive audience. So unless you're starving to death or dying of thirst, ignore. The service is poor and seemingly begrudged.Fantastic mountain though and having been up there twice, that's enough for me.

Don't underestimate the walk!. It is something you have to do if you are there, but the cable car was a little disappointing - there were so many people in you can only really see the sights from the top. Take a note if you choose to walk up or down the mountain - this is not an easy walk either way and is physically demanding (down as well as up).

Bucket list. This is a must do on the bucket list. The view from the top of Table Mountain is amazing. We did the sunset trip. The colours of the sky from way up high is incredible. You feel as if you could touch the sky. This is one trip everyone should experience.
Love How It Rotates. GO AGAIN: Yes, it was a great way to end the day after a rigorous hike up and around Table Mountain.

Cable Car up Table Mountain. Amazing! A must if you are in Cape Town, get the right weather though to see the best views, and don't forget, it is closed when the Table Cloth descends (which happens often) as people have apparently been known to blunder off the edge

A "must do" in Cape Town. A really wonderful outing in Cape Town and a must do if possible. It's not always possible to make this trip as Table Mountain can be affected by the vagaries of weather. We were lucky the day we chose to go as the mountain top was clear promising excellent views all round. The mountain can often be shrouded in cloud (which the locals call the tablecloth) in fact the next day the top was covered in cloud all day. The cable cars also stop if the winds are excessive. All that being said, if you get the chance to go there grab it. Views are spectacular and the revolving cars give a panoramic view of the Cape area. The café at the summit is good with a decent if limited menu and reasonable prices.
Awesome. BEAUTIFUL, Gods creation at its best, the weather was a little cold on top, but it was worth freezing for. must see in Cape town.
Easiest way to get to the top. Book online to avoind the que. Only regret is that it ends too fast; the 360 degree rotating ascent/descent means breathtaking views all around.
Amazing views. Another must do while visiting cape town you will never forget the day you spend on table mountain. we all loved it and the views are unreal..

Just hope it's open for you. Fabulous , we were lucky, weather perfect for us but noticed following morning covered with cloud and closed , no queues at 9.30am so we were VERY lucky , loved this place and I hate heights ! You cannot miss this if visiting Cape Town. Enjoy

Will not be disappointed. The organization is excellent, the lines and waiting are processed very efficiently. Having said that, it is important to buy your tickets in advance online. Once at the top, prepare to be amazed. The views are spectacular, the hiking is amazing. We were originally, not so excited about doing this, so glad we didn't miss out, truly one of our highlights of Cape Town!

Absolute peace. This is a must do in cape town, the wait for the cable car isnt that long and once your at top the view is absolutely incredible. Walk away from the crowd and it is so peaceful once you find a spot to relax.

Table Mountain. It was amazing, ultimate experience would love to visit once more It was amazing, ultimate experience would love to visit once more It was amazing, ultimate experience would love to visit once more
Breathtaking. Stunning views, good food and beautiful neat terrain with a view over Robben Island, Kommetjie and the City og Cape Town

Stunning Views. The cablecar rotates to afford everyone a great view. It only takes a few minutes to get to the top, so take your videos and photos when you have that shot. Buy your tickets online to avoid long lines.
An experience you must do when in Cape Town. My title says it all, just do it ! The views are fantastic and despite the queues the wait didn't seem very long.
Cape at its best. Being a pensioner we got a special rate and went up just before dusk what a wonderful experience To see the sun setting over the sea .It was one of our special moments. A must see
Great experience. We hopped off a Red Bus & thoroughly enjoyed are time at the top with lots of great photos Lucky with the weather the clouds descended for 15 minutes but clear otherwise.

This is a must do!. If possible, go in the evening before dusk. You ascend the mountain in daylight but can grab a bottle of wine, enjoy the amazing sunset and marvel at the beautiful Cape Town nightscape as you descend. Book your tickets through your hotel to avoid queuing.
Table mountain cableway. A "must see" for Cape Town Bring a coat, cold and windy at sunset Spectacular views of Atlantic and Cape Town Nice walkways on top Some people hike to top of table mountain

“Awesome views”. We used the cable car on our trip in Jan 2015 to CapeTown. It really is Great with awsome views from the cable car were amazing and we only had to wait more than 5 min to either embark or disembark as we booked tickets on line before going up you can easy spend 3 + hourse up there walking have a meal some great SA wine..

Best Sunset I have ever seen. First let me answer the question "When is the best time to go up?"The answer......whenever it is open. Trust me on this. Don't wait until tomorrow if it is open today. We arrived back to our hotel around 6 and were exhausted and hesitant on dealing with a crowd or just go the following morning. But our tour guide from earlier in the day (Cape Convoy....Rob is awesome) said....if it's open, go. I have to say it was probably our best decision all trip. I have never seen such an amazing sunset as we did that night. Stunning, truly stunning (see photo). In addition the next morning (our original plan) was crappy and overcast. Due to that they were not running the Cableway. So we made the right decision. the only other suggestion would be to buy tickets ahead of time. I think they are good for a few days or longer. that will save you about 30 min of waiting in line. Oh and you can bring your own food/drinks, just be smart about it.

World Class. We used the cable car on our recent trip to CT. It really is phenomenal and world class. the views from the cable car were amazing and we never had to wait more than 5 min to either embark or disembark.

Go Early!. The large cable cars offer stunning views on the way up and down. On clear days the cable car lines back up so that a very long wait time can be expected. My advise is go as early in the morning as weather is permitting.

Awesome. They have really improved this over the years. Online tickets are the way to go- sped up the queuing considerably. Go early evening to get sunset - so beautiful and you can get the full range of photos. It's also half price out of peak season!
Absolutely beautiful. What an amazing view from the top of Table Mountain, we had a wonderful afternoon watching the sunset and then the city lights a definite must

Must do. Not much you can say. When in Cape Town .........must do....simples. This is probably .....definately the most important visitor attraction in the Cape. I have to write 100 characters to submit a review, but 1000 characters will not convey what you will experience on your trip to the top of Table Mountain and the views from up there

A "MUST" when in Cape Town!. I spontaneously decided to take the cableway up the mountain while on the sightseeing bus (red line) the que was long but it went quite quickly to get a ticket. Very friendly staff on the cableway and of course amazing views from atop! I recommend a visit to the mountain to all Cape Town visitors, it is after all one of the 7 wonders of nature!

Brilliant. I've been to Table mountain twice before albeit when I was much younger and thought about giving it a skip. However it was absolutely brilliant. We went up at about 6pm it was still bright and warm. We stayed in the queue for just half and hour- with wonderful light water mist keeping us comfortable. The cable car can take 30 people and is an amazing 4min ride with a rotating floor. The top of the mountain has been expanded for walking trails, and wonderfully integrated decks and view sites. We saw the sunset and many people came up to picnic. Stunning and pristine. Well done Cape Town. I would definitely recommend.

Steep but fun. The cable car takes about 4 minutes from top to bottom and the gondola actually rotates 360 degrees whilst going up and down. When you enter the gondola at the bottom - everyone rushes to the right to get the best view. Turn left (facing the wall) as when the gondola reaches the top it is facing the coastline and has the best view. Be prepared to queue during peak times especially sunset on a clear day.

Great experience. We traveled to the top of Table Mountain via the Aerial Cableway instead of hiking up the mountain. I am scared of heights but decided since it was weather permitting and I am in South Africa, why not?! I am happy I went. It was a great experience and the aerial cableways are well organized!

Must do experience.. Pick the day to do this and check out their website http://www.tablemountain.net - it will tell you if the cable car is open or closed (they close the cablecar on windy days). The view from the top is stunning and, if you like walking, wear a good pair of walking shoes or boots as there are plenty of trails to hike. Remember to take sunscreen, a hat and water. There are easier walks ranging around 30 minutes where you can see the views from either side of the mountain. The cablecar is great as it revolves and gives you a 360 degree view. As previous reviewers have said book your tickets beforehand as it saves time. If you book through the red/blue city bus tours you have 14 days in which to use it. Tickets cost R225 return for adults. You can choose how much time you spend here from about 1.5 hours upwards. We will be back and take a picnic at sunset if we have time (tickets are also 1/2 price after 630pm).

Table Mountain - A must do bucket list item!. We bought early-access tickets at R300 online the day before so we could go up with the Cable Car between 7:30 and 8:00 am and not have to stand in a queue to buy tickets. We saved the electronic tickets on a phone so they could be scanned on entry, which worked fine. It was a good move to go early as people started queuing by about 7 am in the morning. We made it onto the first cable car of the day on 3rd Jan 2015 and it was a great experience! The cable car takes about 5 minutes to reach he top cable car station and does a 360 degree rotation of the cable car floor, so that everyone can see all around without having to push and shove to see out the various sides. What a great idea! Once we reached the top, the mountain was shrouded in mist with a light rain, but this did not dampen our spirits as we grabbed coffees at the restaurant and waited for the mist to clear. What a sight when the mist finally cleared at 10 am and we could see all around, down to the City and all the way to Robben Island! One of the best experiences in the world and now also one of the new 7 Wonders of Nature. Enjoy!

First revolving cable car I've been on. A treat once you get onto the cable car to head up the mountain, rotating floor means everyone gets a chance to get a good picture. Great fun and a good way to get up there and then hike on top. Book a ticket beforehand, either through the city bus tour, or online or anywhere. The queue for non ticket holders is always twice as long and moves twice as slow.

Do not leave Cape Town without doing this. You must pick your day as if there is a north wester blowing then you will not be going up. What is good is that you can buy your ticket and have 4 days to use it in and they do let you change dates if some thing comes up. The view is breath taking and the geography is stunning. A real must do but be prepared to have a few days to get the right one. You will not be sorry.
Amazing. Great experience . I loved all the views as the cable car was turning. I ave never seen any thing like it and was ver thought out. The price was great to ..

Well organized and beautifully laid out. We made two trips because when we first got up there in the middle of the day the line was so long to get tickets that we decided to go down, and reserved tickets on line for the next day, early morning. Even then we had to wait in line to get on the cablecar, but it was very well organized. A lovely walk at the top, with interesting information on occasional very nicely designed signs. Wonderful views and interesting plants. In one spot where signage was not clear we found ourselves heading off on a steep path that we realized eventually was not part of the circuit, so turned back. It was much cooler up there, quite chilly in the morning; and the sun was very strong, so we ended up sunburned where we weren't protected by long sleeves, long pants and hats (the back of our hands!).

A must visit when in cape Town. amazing place and amazing views glad i did it worth every penny for those views, just make sure you go first thing 8am before to many people are they and dont go up if they have cloud cover the top of table maountain

What a great value experience!. As a Capetonian,it is easy to forget what a treasure we "own". Luckily, we had family from overseas so we took him up the cable car (having enjoyed several ascents on foot!). The real pleasure was that TMAC has kept the price affordable to locals. Foreigners must think it a gift!

Amazing View , a must see when in Cape town. If you visit Cape town , then the table mountain and cable car must be on your list of things to do in cape town . the wait in the line to get the cable car is worth it . the view is breathtaking and amazing . Taking the cable car up the mountain is a good experince, it rotates as it takes the climb giving you a 360 degrees view as you move up . the whole adventure is well organised and felt safe . the only downside i found was the food quality on the top ( could be just me) .for those going late morning or afternoon , carry some warm colthes as it gets windy and chilly. All in all a great experience

Spectacular views. we've been up to table Mountain on a number of occasions and still the views from the cable car as you ascend the mountain are still spectacular. The car rotates through 360 degrees at it goes up so it does not matter where you stand you will get all the views, but it is best to be at the window if you want to take pictures. The ride gives you views of Cape Town, Cape Flats, Robben Island and close ups of the mountain side. It is best to get there early in order to miss the crowds, if not you can find your self in a waiting for some time. It is also best to check out the weather conditions as well, due to the fact that high winds do cause the car to be stopped. The ride up to Table Mountain and the views from the top is the must thing to do if in Cape Town so make sure you have at least one day for this.

A clear day is what's needed!. Great experience for my guests (I live in Cape Town), they had a clear day and really enjoyed the Cableway to the mountain, it rotates slowly in circles and gives a full 360 degree view. Open window so you get a breeze!

Fab views. Have been twice, once October 2014 and once Sep 2012......best to go early as gets very busy and Can get very cold in the late afternoon as well. Views fantastic as expected and a nice choice of routes to walk. Cable car is good fun and goes very regularly

" Magnificent wonders". We took the Red route bus and bought our tickets from their office in Long Street. What an exciting and enjoyable moment to be on the cable car and in a short space of time, you are at the top of the mountain. Magnificent, Spectacular views!!

Great way to get up Table Mountain. The Cableway was extremely quick and efficient and felt very safe. The cable car rotates as you ascend up the mountain giving you some pretty spectacular views of Capetown. The only downside to the Cableway is that it only operates when there is good weather due to safety concerns, so you should try to go up as early as possible before the winds pick up. You can buy your tickets in advance, and they have a very good website which continually updates you as to whether or not the cableway is open.

Must see!. If you ever visit Cape Town this is probably one of the bucketlist items. Taking the cable car up to Table Mountain is a fantastic (if a bit expensive) experience. Once on top you can look out over the city and see the clouds roll of the flat topped world wonder. There is also a restaurant at the top. Profile pics aplenty an be taken here.

up up and away. Tip purchase your tickets before you make the trip as queues are horrendous, we bought ours at the hotel.The organisation was very good considering it was a busy period(new years day) The journey to the top doesn't take long and the views are spectacular

Fantastic views. This is a great way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Take the red route tourist bus and buy your ticket on board and you beat the queues. Not for everyone though; the fact that the cable car rotates as it goes up was enough to put my wife off!
A must on a clear day. An amazingly shaped mountain with breathtaking views. Worth th lines if you make it on a clear sky day
A room with a view!. A must to do but book in advance as the queues are long in high season. The attendant always has a few funny quips on the way up and down.
very expensive. $25 a ticket...and you might see nothing as the weather changes very rapidly...check the meteo well before you leave...
Table Mountain. Very well organised and good views over Cape Town. Main rule for Table Mountain is if you have a good sunny day go because it may be the only chance during your stay.

Unmissable. We were lucky enough to go up on a beautiful clear and sunny day. We went up in late afternoon to avoid the crowds, and we were only queuing for about 5 minutes before we got into the cable car. The views from the mountain top are nothing short of breathtaking. It's magical, just go.
really quick. A really quick and easy way to reach the top of Table mountain. However it can be very croudy especially during the summer holidays and the parking can be a pain in the ......

Great view-excessively long queue. Well worth a trips the mountain, the views are amazing. Unfortunately, we had to queue for over 2 and a half hours to get on the cable car. This was in extreme heat. Maybe something could be done about the long line, maybe more staff are needed in the ticket office, or another set of cable cars. We feel it would be a good idea to tell people when they join the queue how long they are going to have to wait. Would definitely recommend.

Modern facilities and excellent staff. We visited the Table Mountain a month ago and used the aerial cableway both way. After a very long queue, when we were about to go through the barriers we realized the tickets that had been booked by our travel agency were only valid from the following day. One of the staff members kindly offered to help us, he went all the way down the queue with us and explained the situation to the person at the ticket office. We were able to get a refund and buy new tickets instead. We were then taken back to the barriers so that we could get through very quickly without having to queue again.The cableway cabin rotates for the whole journey, enabling you to enjoy the full view, without having to push your way through the cabin. While the Cableway experience was great, it would be valuable to have a few sun umbrellas to be protected from the sun when queuing as this can be fairly long.

Amazing. The sunset is fantastic up at the top of the table. Take a cardi or something extra to put on as when the sun starts to drop the temperatures drop down very quickly. The views are amazing! The other point to note that after 6.30pm its half price.

What an awesome experience'''''''''''. I really enjoyed my trip to table mountain. It was fun full of exciting experiences, it was my first time to ride on a cable car and I was so so excited. The trip was fantastic, superb. It was so awesome riding to the top and viewing the beautiful landscape of capetown. It took only 3 mins to the top. If you are to go in the morning you need to have a jacket as it is a bit chilly or cold in the top. The view is so perfect when you are already at the top, it is really awesome. we were given three hours to view or to be at the top but one can always go back down at any time he or she wishes to as the cable cars are always moving to and from the ground to the top. just try table mountain and you will really enjoy it. You really ought to take care of your ticket because it is the same ticket that you use when you go back down because if you loose it you wont be allowed to ride back.

Upgraded facilities a pleasure. I took a Chinese tourist up and was pleasantly surprised myself. Very professional arrival area and the rotating cable car was a treat. I had not been there for a long time. The restaurant was rather expensive, like most tourist spots but clean and well run. All other pathways and viewing points very well kept. How amazing would it be if they had staff that walked around and could take tourists own cameras to take pictures for them?

great views. this is a must the iconic Table Mountain spectacular cable car ride and then lovely walks and views of cape town robbern island and beyond, check your weather and book online for speeding up the queue work
Awesome. There was a bit of a line of people, but the wait was worth it! The view from the top of the mountain was speechless. It was fun riding up to the top too.
amazing views. Fantastic views, Great way to see as far as you can of cape town,Little nervous at first going up in the cable car,but it was only 3 mins to get to top.
No line, amazing view. Cheap beers at the top and worth a visit. We didn't wait at all and this was because we bought tickets online, that is a must!

Sort of a must do for Cape Town tourists.... Table mountain is a sort of must do while in Cape Town. The views are of course quite spectacular and nice leisurely walks can be enjoyed amongst the fijnbos environment atop the mountain. More energetic visitors can climb up or down though going down by foot is not fun given the steepness, and combine with a cable car journey either way.The queue can get very long during the summer months so try to show up early - taxis can bring you to and from the site with a taxi rank there being convenient for your return. It is best to go in the morning as the weather is less predictable during the afternoon, with the typical 'tablecloth' of clouds more likely to appear in the afternoon.
Scary but beautiful!. This initially freaked me out... the floor rotates!! After you get used to it you rotate 360 while going down so you can see everything!!
Wonderful experience. I has visit this place a few years ago It is still a wonderful place The views are out of this world ! A must visit for Cape Town

Table mountain. Queues for cable car on the way up long: once there obviously spectacular views but if sunny remember your sun block: queue on the way down spent longer queuing than time on top of mountain.Also if booking in advance be aware if weather bad it will be closed but overall a must do.

World famous Table Mountain. Aerial cableway is easiest way to reach the top. Platform within the cable car rotates as it ascends or descends so everyone gets a chance to observe the mountain & the ocean. It is a world heritage site & rightly so. View from the top is spectacular & to be remembered for a lifetime. Top of the mountain is smaller than you would think. There are about three walks you take around the summit. Fairly easy walk with the correct footwear, i.e. not flip-flops. Walks vary from 30 - 75 minutes. Natural plants & flowers are beautiful & there lots of birds, harmless tiny black lizards etc, to be seen. Our good advice is to buy & print your tickets in advance, on-line. This will save the huge line if you purchase tickets at the Cableway entrance. Cable itself is over 1000 meters in length. Originally built 85 years ago, but of course cables & cars have been updated and replaced regularly. Don't miss this attraction.

Beautiful aerial view of Cape Town in spite of bad weather. We had booked online for the Aerial Cable way to the Table Mountain & fortunate to spend about 2 hours between 3 pm and 5 pm before we were asked to return due to heavy wind. It was spectacular view of Cape Town & the ocean with little cool breeze & sunny weather with the clouds so close to us. This was the second time we visited Table Mountain & in our previous visit the entire Mountain was filled with cloud and we could hardly view any thing though we stayed the whole day. I would suggest visitors to be prepared for all kinds of weather, sun, rain & cold weather. You may experience all of them same day!

long wait. Although the queue was not particularly long we still had to wait some time. It seemed one of the elevators to the cable car was not working well. Apart from that it was well organised, and the obligatory photo with faux backdrop was made a fun experience by the photographer.

Spectacular views. Ride cable cars to top during mid morning. Ticket line was short and moving fast. Got on first cable car. Depending on the weather might want to take a sweater or light jacket with you to top. It was a bit chilly, even on a sunny day. The views are amazing.

Top of Cape Town. Must do for everyone, absolutely beautifulThe restaurant is a tad bit pricey for the locals in my opinion, considering the quality is average and bulk made.During peak hours the staff tend to get more irritated and less friendly, however I guess this is due to the cableway being very busy and they repetitively have to explain the same thing.Queue's are long over the festive period, be sure to get there early!

On top of the world. Everyone told me that I must go to the top of Table mountain on the cable car. When I saw how steep the Arieal cable car was, and how high, I was rather apprehensive. I wasn't sure if I could do it! I am not particularly afraid of hights, but it did look formidable. Anyway, we had booked on line, so thankfully didn't have long to wait in line, and once on the cable car I just had no time to be afraid because the views were just spectacular. Wow! I loved it! Once at the top, again the views were stunning, and we got a nice table at the restaurant and had a chilled bottle of cape champagne. What fun! After that I was looking forward to the ride down. Again spectacular!I agree that this is a must do in Cape Town. Just do it!
Hike up if you can. Then take the cable car down. Much bettor expereince. The views from the top are spectacular. Must do if it is your firts time in Cape Town.

WOW. Loved the whole experience. Friendly staff, real ambassadors for Cape Town. All facilities neat, tidy and well kept. Views of course were breath taking. Although they were very busy, we got good service at the restaurant on the mountain, as well as from the curio shop.I will do this again and again and again.Also saw some nice hiking routes up the mountain for those who prefer some exercise with the view.
Very good. A very good operation and due to the rotating capsule the view on the outer side is fantastic. I advise to do a online booking for the tickets to prevent standing in a long que.

What view?!. We pre-booked early tickets for the 1st trip up so as to avoid any queue which worked very well and the wait for the cable car was well organised. Unfortunately it was a really foggy day and we could only see about 10 metres in front of us. We still went up but couldn't see any of the spectacular views promised. The cafe at the top opened early since it was cold and wet and all of us wanted to get inside since we couldn't see anything of table mountain itself. Unfortunately, the cafe clearly isn't set up for early morning business. The breakfast buffet wasn't open so we had to have sandwiches for breakfast and then we had to order coffees at the kiosk to collect after. The coffee, just a simple filter coffee, took over 20 minutes to be ready. This is simply unacceptable. How on earth can filter coffee take 20 minutes to make?!The problem with running the cable car in all weathers apart from extreme wind if problematic when very foggy. We booked tickets and missed out on all the sights after travelling all that way. Still, it's a natural wonder so I can't complain about nature taking control and doing what it does. Overall, we had back luck with the weather which can happen to anything & anyone at any time, but the cafe was a shambles.

Long queue under the sun, but the view is worth it!. Consider to queue for a long time in high season, maybe you can save time by buying tickets online (or even on the Sightseeing bus or at Pick'n'Pay) but not too much...The cabin rotates by 360 degrees while ascending and descending so you can enjoy a full view. And when you get on the top, well..the landscape is simply amazing and you can make the whole walk all around the mountain in ab. 45 minutes. When it is too windy, cablecar stops.
Just one word - Awesome!. Can spend hours here. Views are amazing and can't express in words. You ought to be here to experience it. Start early as it gets bit crowded after 10 am

Best views of Cape Town and vicinity. The ques and parking places are a bit of a problem, but once in the cable car, you are in a different world. The walkway on top of the mountain are well laid out and there are lots of things to see, from plants to animal life.

Advance tickets a must. MUST SEE . We made a booking online which allowed us to jump the 30 minute queue. The cableway itself is amazing especially the 360 degree rotating floor to ensue that everyone gets to see the amazing view. There are free guided tours at the top every hour which I would highly recommend as there is a lot of interesting information.

Worth it at the Top. One of the Natural Wonders of the World.Unfortunately we had to queue for the best part of an hour to get on the cable car but when we eventually got to the top of Table Mountain it was awesome.The car itself rotates 360 degrees inside so on the way up you have the perfect photo opportunity.A MUST SEE!

SO BEAUTIFUL. Do NOT miss this if you go to Table Mountain! We actually started to hike up the mountain before we decided we didn't have enough water to make it all the way, so hiked back down and took the cableway up to the top. We spent at least 2.5 hours hiking around once we got to the top. The views were incredible and I think we would have stayed longer had we not had other parts of Cape Town we wanted to see. It was amazing - don't miss!!

Amazing!!!. I think you should go there Very early in The Morning (U should arrive there at 7.30 am) and buy The tickets on line( U can buy Them even The DAY before)Advise: buy 1 single up (r.115) and 1 single down(r.115), so U pay r.230 for The 2 rides, instead of paying r.250 for a return ticket.The sights upon The mountain are amazing... Look for the Dassies among the Rocks... They're so nice.Don't go up if there are clouds or fog!

Not to be missed. You can't miss a trip to table mountain while in Cape Town. The weather can close down the mountain at any minute(wind, clouds, etc). Going early seems to be the best bet as the afternoon often is cloudy and windy. Check the Facebook page or phone weather line to know it's open. The cable car ride is very short maybe 4 minutes and the floor spins so everyone gets to see all he angles as you are ascending and descending. After exploring the top and taking pictures we settled in for some sparkling wine and the cheese platter they sold at the cafe. Beautiful way to spend a morning/early afternoon.Don't worry the line moves very fast. 65 people per car and 800 people per hour so don't be turned off by the long line there is sure to be.

Over-crowded. Although this is a great experience going up and down the mountain, in my opinion they cram too many people in the cars which means that you are most certainly not guaranteed any views, but you are guaranteed a nicely claustrophobic few minutes. Hope that the people that share the car with you have not been on strenuous hikes!For the price that is charged I'm not sure it's worth it.

Natural Beauty at its Peak. It is a wonderful experience to visit Table Top Mountain. One must see the vast mountain with such a natural flat top. Superb experience of serenity with 360 degree view of Cape Town and Waterfront scene from a bird's eye view. What an experience!! One can enjoy nice restaurants. Best would be to visit in the morning hours as one can enjoy sun in the breezy top. Weather has to be clear in order to avail cable car. Very well managed place indeed and worth the money.

Buy your ticket in advance. We got to the cableway using the hop-on hop-off bus and had purchased our thick through them. So glad we did because when we arrived there was a huge line (during Christmas holidays). There were actually 2 lines, 1 for those with tickets and 1 (very long) to purchase tickets. That said, we were lucky to have a perfect day for viewing with clear blue skies. Views were spectacular. The cableway cars rotate once completely as they ascend and descend, so everyone gets a complete view. There was a restaurant on top, but we just enjoyed a glass of local wine while admiring the view.We were glad we did this on our first day as the last 2 days of our stay the mountain was surrounded by clouds for most of the time.

A must. Going up to the top of Table Mountain is a "must" when visiting Cape Town for the first time. However, it is all worth the long wait in line (over an hour even with pre-paid tickets) for the ride up. The view is spectacular - as long as the clouds are not in your way. The weather changes quickly and the beautiful view in one picture may be gone in the next.Avoid the café/restaurant on the top. When we were there the lines were long and it was not well organized.

The early bird enjoys the worm!. Get there early. It opens at 08h00, but be there by at least 07h30 and stand in a shortish queue and be up the mountain on the first few cars. This way you'll arrive on an uncrowded mountain top for a more intimate experience. The ride up is great with the car doing a full 360deg rotation by the time you reach the summit. Great walks on top with a selection of distances and timing. There's a self-service restaurant with a fair selection, but it gets full quickly. Great little outdoor bar too. And the view!!!!! go and see for yourself!!!! #lovecapetown
Loved the ride. Loved the cable car route..the suspense in it was the rotating floor..you get a spectacular view of the whole city once you reach the top....

4th attempt and well worth the wait. After a couple of false starts to go in the cable car due to the crowds and then one late afternoon trip up only to find it closed due to high winds we made a decision to book the online only option booked the day before to go up at 7.30am. This turned out to be a brilliant idea. Yes you pay a little more, but no queues, 1st car up and no crowds at the top. We were all done and back at our hotel for breakfast by 9.30am. At the top the air was calm, no noise and views which were unbelievable. The car itself is very smooth on the way up and down. However feels a bit weird as it rotates you and everyone else around 360 degrees. The online app to check prices and book was easy to use.

Stunning views!. We visited the cable way in peak season. On arrival we were charged R50 by a meter taxi to travel to the departure point as we had no card to use on the shuttle service bus. I would reccommend getting one before you go or refuse to pay more than R30. We were then told that there was 2 queus...one for people with tickets and those with no tickets. The row of people with no tickets (where we ended up) were endless. A guy then told us we should buy online with our smartphones as we can just show them on the phone then when we get to the front. We were also allowed then to get into the shorter queu (which easily saved us an hour in waiting time). We eventually got to the top...and it was soooo worth it! The views are amazing. Just make sure to pack in sunscreen and a hat as it gets really hot and the waiting time to go down again is really long (without any shade anywhere). Nowhere else in the world though will you get the same views as from the top of Table Mountain. It was absolutely stunning!

Wonderful. I was amazed and speechless.I have phobia for height and was scared before going there,but everything changed when I got there bcos the experience was wonderful. I'll advice everyone to experience it.
Nice start of the day!!. Going up to the Table Mountain by Cable Car is really nice. Apart from taking great pictures, the car moves round and gives you the possibility of a 360º view.
What an experience. It was worth the wait - queues move very quickly and the service and staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. the whole experience was amazing and the view out of this world

Walking on Table Mountain. The walking paths on the mountain is clearly marked and allow for easy walking on "Top of the world" . The whole cable car experiance was easy and well organised. Everyting is clean and staff and people were friendly. It is a must to visit for anyone!!

Table Mountain Cablecar. Very good way to access the top of Table mountain but expect long queues and waiting time if this trip is done in summer at peak hours from 10:00 - 15:00. Cars rotate giving visitors a 360 degree vista on the way up and down. Very well organized with a good restaurant at the top.

Cable Car with Spinning Floor. The cable car is a great experience, its the way to get up and down. The cost is R230 per person and the start is on Tafelberg Road. Get there early or risk huge queues to get onto the cable car.
Remember if its your birthday you can ride for free on the cable car.

The Zenith of your Cape Town trip. The aerial cable car ride to table mountain is an exhilarating experience that caps one's trip to Cape Town. It didn't dissappoint, tje ride was smooth and we were received heartily by the Table Mountain restaurant which serves some fresh and tasty curry, pizza and other dishes. The 1000m+ altitude walk at the table top is chilly but refreshing, opening some stunning views of Cape Town. You can't visit Cape Town and omit the cable car.
Glorious!. A well-run operation. The lines move pretty quickly, and the views are gorgeous. The turning floor gives you a unique chance to see in all directions, despite a crowded cable car.

Go in the afternoon!. We went in full high season (Dec 20th) and arrived at around 1.30 pm. There was no queue at the counter nor at the entrance to the Cableway, and the view was just as spectacular... We took a stroller and were able to do a nice walk around the wheelchair-accessible path. Highly recommended!

First time visitors to CPT. I was told by many, book online..and that's exactly what I did. Turned into a blessing. Excellent facilities and really structured procedures. We really enjoyed the experience. Parking is a problem so arrive early

Not to be missed, a hitch up the cableway. Such a unique mountain, such steep cliffs and great views while on the cableway: something of an experience for sure. During peak season, roads upto the cableway station can be congested. It worked for us: wait until about 15.30pm and then take a cab (50 Rand approx) and have you dropped off. Walk the table mountain top (short stroll or slightly longer), stay for a few bites in the restaurant (reasonably priced) and wait for sunset (or not) and head on down before the masses, by now convened on the top).

basic info you need to know. I went to table mountain as part of my tour with Gate1 Travel company.The tickets were already purchased in advanced by our tour guide so I cant comment on the process of getting the entrance tickets.Here are my thoughts:1- bring a warm sweater or fleece. It is quite chilly up on the mountain and it is a shame to see people uncomfortable and cold. To truly have fun and enjoy the experience, please remember to bring a light jacket or sweater. 2- need about 1 hour on the top. bring a camera to take some really nice pictures.If you are in cape town, this is a must do activity.

Get your cableway tickets beforehand. Don't make the mistake of getting your tickets when you arrive at the base station! You could be faced with two long queues - one for your tickets and then another for the cable car!
birthdays free for SA citizens. My daughter, husband and mother in law all share the same birthday :) Free return trip on your birthday if you produce your SA ID!

Sunset Views. It was my first time in the cable car. We decided to take a drive up and were discouraged to continue further to queue for the cable cars due to the very long queue of people and lack of parking for the cars - this was about 10am and it was a nice sunny day.Nonetheless, we went back on that same day around 19.00 and was pleasantly surprised. It took us about 5 minutes to park and pay for our tickets, literally no queues!The ride up was fantastic. When we were on the mountain we were able to get a good view of the sunset and see all of Cape Town. I took a light jacket, but the temperature really drops in the evening when on the mountain so remember to carry a jacket and beanie.Overall, such a lovely experience and something all South Africans should try out!

The worlds worst restaurant.. Went up on Saturday after climbing for two hours on a misty cool to chilly morning. The restaurant was choc a block and couldn't cope with the numbers trying to have breka and coffee. Food was wimped standard at best at Lord Nelson prices, should have chucked it over the side. The coffee was available after a half hour wait. The servers need coaching in fundamental human inter changes. The prices for gifts etc is nothing short of day light robbery. This is a grotesque rip off experience and I don't recommend anyone using the lift thing. Walk up and walk down and take your own sandwiches and flask. Stuffem.

Spectacular view. amazing view can see all of Cape Town and beyond. Easy access to the mountain. The biggest disadvantage is due to fog the mountain the mountain has to be closed. Otherwise well worth a visite

Great View of a Great City. If you are travelling to or staying in Cape town, then it would be a crime to ignore this attraction. You will probably be told to book it by many which I found unneccessary, so I didn't. We arrived about 9:00-9:30 in the morning and literally walked up to the desk, paid and were on the cable car in 5 minutes. Cape Town is such a beautiful city it really does deserve to be seen from its iconic Table top view.

Amazing views. Grab the chance on a sunny day to head to the top of table mountain the views are stunning with a nice cafe you can get a glass of wine and relax while taking in the sites it's often cloudy so go the first clear day you get

nice trip up. What can be said about one of the new seven wonder. When in Cape town you have to go on Table mountain, but beware, it is often closed because of the wind, stay connected on http://www.tablemountain.net/ to see if it is open or not, buy your ticket before getting there! there are two queues at the cableway, one for ticket holders (smaller queue) and one for those who don't have tickets.I bought mine while doing hop on hop off, and it was valid for 14 days.The cableway has lesser queues after 2pm, and there often are deals if you go there after 5pm

Spectacular views. After hiking the challenging TBle Mountain was delighted to ride the cable car back down. Spectacular views. Open ended cable car which enhanced views. Floor of cable car rates so all passengers get to admire the views. Queues were extremely long with not cover from the searing heat.Worth a visit

to do this properly you will need at least 3 hours.. To do this properly you will need at least 3 hours. There are a few walks once you reach the top. Each with many unique photo opportunities!If you are getting a taxi up you may want to first check with your hotel consierge that the cablecar is running (they close it down when it is windy).If you are using the City Sightseeing bus to go there, get there early, as there can be very long queues, and depending on what time of year you go, you will probably want to be back town from the mountain before it gets too hot.The top of the monutain in not very wheelchair/buggy friendly. I feel they should offer some kind of half-access ticket for users who cannot hike the full range of the mountain top. Other than that it is a great.A good day out for nature lovers.

One of the great views of the world. But it can be a hassle to get up there because of crowds. Go early or late for shortest wait times. Otherwise you can easily wait 2 hours or more.
Also,go the first nice day in Cpt,as the cable car is often closed because of wind conditions.even if the weather looks great,wind can prevent cable car visits.

Very nice but hard to get on the top. Beautiful view and nice hike on top of this very special mountain. In the new years period it is some times hours waiting and as this is Africa, if the boss wants to go home, he stops loading people even probably close to 500 people 17.00 on 31st of december

Top of the world. Arrived in Cape Town for New Year period and attempted to take the cable car 3 times but it was cancelled once due to weather and twice I left due to the incredibly long wait in line with bazillions of other people.Riding a scooter allowed me to park right at the point of entry which was great. I finally arrived early on new year day with the mountain under cloud. I was on the cable car within the hour.The whole experience from cable car ride to walk along table top was amazing. Beautiful to see the whole mountain under cloud, initially no city views but with time the clouds disappeared opening up stunning city and coastal views.So glad I persisted to get up on the mountain as it is well worth it.

short but enjoyable trip. As table mountain is major attraction go early.if you buy tickets from hoho offices and then up there with bus it will go quite quickly(Ticket price at offices if same as table mountain) .take the first hoho buses to cable way out as later it gets the worse the queues get .Cableway journey is quite quick and staff are great

Great management in peak period. We went during peak time and booked online. the very friendly and helpful staff got us onto the mountain in under an hour. Well done!! On top its well organised and clean and the restaurant is well stocked with good food and even good beer. This is a must see experience and well worth the effort

Endless Horizons. Fantastic New Year start to 2015. Prepaid tickets saved some time. Excellent views, great weather. Celebration of a memory with our Italian Spanish friends with a good bottle of bubbly made the long queue down worthwhile. Table Mountain is the heart of Cape Town.

One of the Natural Wonders of the World!. For me, this was the highlight of the trip to Cape Town. It was mesmerizing. It was very, very crowded though because of the holiday. I would like to visit at a quieter time and I would actually like to hike up and down rather than using the cable car.

Long Queues. We went during the peak season and waited over an hour in the queue. The service and professionalism of the staff were satisfactory. The cable ride was a great experience. It may be worthwhile to pre-book your ride.

A must do activity. Table Mountain is the most iconic feature of Cape Town and the views from the top are breathtaking, especially if you have a clear, sunny day. Take a warm top with you if it is cloudy or windy.
Short lovely ride. Short but lovely ride to the table mountain top. The cable cable car rotates 360 degrees (which I found quite cool).This a great way to get to the mountain top.
Totally spectacular!!!. The view from the top is breath taking but make sure you go on a clear day and avoid the long queues by booking online.
Scarey. I'm a coward but was worth it for the view liked the experience will go another day when not. Too windy

Amazing. Wonderful cable car ride to the top of table mountain. The car will turn 360 degrees. Great views and great photo ops. Get to the mountain with the on and off bus.
A must to see, the views are amazing. Photos of Cape Town, the beach area and much more.
Very good view. It was brilliant going up the views to die for,but it does not go up if windy so pick a good day.the shop and cafe where quite good but a little expensive but well worth a visit.

Speedy way to outstanding views. The view of Cape Town and surroundings is amazing from the top of Table Mountain. The cable cars only run when the weather is good enough, but fortunately, you can buy a ticket online in advance that has some flexibility as to when you use it - up to 14 days from your selected date. That way, if the cable cars are shut down, you can still use your ticket another day. Purchasing your ticket ahead also saves you some time in line. It's crowded at the top, especially immediately around the visitor center area. Once you move away from there, it gets better.

Cable car to the wonder of the world. Table mountain is rated as one of the seven natural wonders of the world and the cable car ride makes the approach very exciting. It is run by a Swiss company and the cable car rotates 360 degress to allow a complete view to all passengers. The only downside is that the cable service will not operate when there are strong winds - and this happens very regularly. You should buy a ticket online ( 225 rands) to avoid ques during rush hours. Going up the mountain during anytime of the day is wonderful but I would recommend going after 4.00 p.m. -- you can then get the view of the sunset which is a very sublime moment - the sun setting in the vast ocean.

bad info. only online tickets allowed to go on first so irrespective of whether you get to the line at 6 you will only be allowed to buy your ticket after 8. The queue does not end there you will queue up endlessly to get up the coffee shop at the top is most disorganised. There is insufficient space and for visitors queuing from early morning hoping to get a hot beverage beware you will wait for a good twenty minutes and may be lucky to get someone else's drink the buzzer system issued when you pay does not work always wear warm clothes it's always cold and windy up there always wear sports shoes it is very uneven nature reserve means very little done to make it easily accessible Keep your return ticket safe because if you loose it you have to buy another it seems that by all reasoning you can miraculously appear on top of the mountain and equally miraculously need to then buy a ticket to get down the cloud cover sweeps across the top very swiftly hold onto your children in a blink visibility is down to arms length and it is dangerous up there

trip a a mountain. We started our day going to the v and a waterfront which after all the building work has now been finished look fantastic, all new hotels shopping centre, football stadium round the corner We caught the BIG RED BUS which took us on a journey around the peninsula and allowed us to get off at 16 different tourist attractions and jump back on again when we wanted.I decided we will get off at table mountain base camp and go up in the cable car it was fantastic 360 view all the way round and as we went up the car turned around I loved it and I would highly recommend it to anyoneThank you cape town I had a great time

Definitely worth the trip. Not only an amazing view of Cape Town, but a surprising amount to do at the top! The cable cars run quickly and efficiently, although worth buying your ticket in advance during busy times. (Tip: if you do the Hop On, Hop Off bus, you can also buy a cable car ticket at the same time, to save the queues). Don't worry about getting a good spot in the cable car - the floor rotates, so everyone gets to see out the main window and take their photos. At the top of the mountain, there are 3 marked paths of varying length, OR you can choose to hike 45 mins to the very highest point. And/or hike all the way down to the base. For the less athletic, there is a cafe, loos and you can even buy a beer! It's surprisingly easy to spend 2-3 hours up there. And don't forget to look out for the Rock Hyrax - funny little guinea pig type creatures, that are actually the closest living descendant of the elephant - it's true, look it up!
Stunning views !!!!. The cable ride is quick and the fact that it rotates allows for 360 degree photo opportunities. On a clear day the views are mind blowing.

Great experience. I can highly recommend taking the cable car. I would still suggest you hike up the mountain to experience the nature, but when coming down take the cable car. It rotates and give you a very cool view of Cape Town.
Table mountain experience. Everything was a smooth transition, the experience is ineffable and I would like to revisit Table mountain.

A five-minute journey to the most striking views of Cape Town and Table Bay. After an eight-hour flight from London, I knew I had to take advantage of the first opportunity I could seize in getting up Table Mountain, and it turned out to be the afternoon we arrived. It was a beautiful day without clouds, and as it turned out, Table Mountain was shrouded with clouds from that point afterward. My partner and I checked our bags into our hotel in Green Point and immediately took a cab to the site. It costs R 250 for a round-trip or R 115 for one-way since many people like to hike up or down. Luckily it wasn’t overly crowded, and we got up in about five minutes, enough for the tramcar to make one full rotation.There are only three rotational trams in the world, and the Cableway has slightly smaller compartments and runs up to a lower elevation than its counterpart in Palm Springs, California. At the same time, I find the panoramic view much more breathtaking here because you see the splendor of greater Cape Town and Table Bay below from a far greater number of vista points. There is a restaurant, a café and a souvenir shop, all of which are too crowded to enjoy during your brief sojourn here. Instead, I would take in the uniquely beautiful topography of this part of the world set against the Atlantic seaboard. Sunset is the best time to be here, but be mindful that you will face longer wait times.
Great Experience.. Get there early in the busy season as the lines can be long. We arrived early and had no problem but could see a long line on our return journey. Wonderful experience.

Best way up!!!!. We got there early and had no wait to take the cable car up the mountain. The car has large opening enabling fresh air. The interior floor also rotates so everyone can enjoy the 360* scenic trip. Just don't get too comfortable because the car moves quite faster than I thought it would. Comfortable trip, well worth the cost of a ticket.
Perfect. The only way to go - fast and efficient with a moving floor to give you a superb 360 view. The views are spectacular on the way up and down.

Unique and photo-worthy experience. 2 minutes to travel 1 vertical kilometer suspended from a cable. The inside of the car rotates so that you have photo ops of the the city, the cableway stations, and the passing cablecar. Didn't enjoy the 25 minute wait at both stations, and the giant VISA logo painted on the cars.

quick way up. The cablecar is a quick way to get up the mountain but you need to be there early otherwise you'll stand in a que for several hours. The ride it selv is fast with nice views over Cape Town.. Its better to hike up but be prepaired With good hiking shoes an plenty of water. Take the first car and have a breakfast with a view!
Beautiful Table mountain. Get a trip to one of Cape Town best atracttion Table Mountain............The clouds acting as the table cloth You will love it

Seems a "have to" but it was pretty average. The wait time to get up the mountain was 1+ hour, and when on top, the visibility was terrible. It was a clear, beautiful day on the bottom, so trust the signs when they tell you that visibility really is poor. The clouds covered much of what we attempted to see. It was an experience you almost "have to do" while visiting Cape Town, but it was not my favorite

Overrated mountain. Whilst I appreciate the new wonder of the world's significance to Cape Town, I was a bit underwhelmed by a visit to this mountain.The views before I climbed the mountain were the same as the ones on top except for Robin Island and the other side of the mountain.The queues to get into the car were very long , with the queue for those who booked online way shorter than the one who did not book . Give yourself an hour or more if you booked on line.The major highlight for me of the visit was the journey of almost 2 km upto the summit on the cable car. The rest was pretty ordinary. There are plenty of photo opportunities. ADVICEAlways book on line. Do go without a booking or you will be miserable

A must do in Cape Town!. We went the day before Christmas, on local holidays, and we were on the qeue for more than 2h before getting in the cable car.Anyway all the organization and queues to buy tickets are very good and, despite of be waiting so long, it worth it.I recommend to buy the tickets online, there is amdifferent line for those who already has the tickets and is faster than buy it there.It takes only 5 minutes to the top of the cable car and you have amazing views while you are in, the floor inside turns 360º so you are able to see all around.In my opinion the rates are quite high, regarding pther prices in the city, but it worths to go. We pay 225zar per person.

Hold on for a Great Ride. The Cable Ride to the summit is stunning. The process for tickets and embarkation is easy and the cars themselves are modern and most importantly, felt safe. The floor of the cable car revolves giving everyone a 360 degree view of the ride up the mountain. Loved it!
Birds Eye view. What an awesome experience once again! I must also share that after 18:00 during summer you have the best views with sundowners on this most majestic mountain top ;*)

Cableway experience. Wonderful experience but be sure to buy your tickets on line. Our first attempt had about a 2 hour wait just to get tickets (no shade) so we forfeited and tried the next day with already purchased tickets. Parking was a problem and after a steady pased walk we easilywent through and entered the cable cart. The floor is revolving and the staff in the cart very friendly. It was a enjoyable expereince.

Top Cape Town sight !. Whats not to like, a great experience, fantastic views over the city and a must do for first time visitors to Cape Town. I would suggest that you book tickets on line as it does save some time when arriving at the cable way.

Fun and easy way up/down. I hiked up the mountain, but took the cable car down. There was not a line (queue) at the top to buy tickets to go down, so buying tickets was quick and easy. I did see a huge line at the bottom to buy tickets to go up - a LONG line a and there is no shade for those poor souls. I later met some people who got sunburned from standing in line. I recommend buying in advance!!The ride itself was neat. The cable car spins around as you ride it. Spectacular views!
Well worth the wait!. Unless you hike up the mountain, this is the only way to get up. Get your tickets ahead of time so you can wait in the shorter line!

Quick and Easy. The cable car was very quick to get up and down and it was very well organised when busy after sunset. It was great that it rotates so as everyone isn't pushing for the good spots. The views on the way were great.

Quickest way to the top. If you aren't up for the hike to the top of the beautiful Table Mountain when you visit Cape Town, then the cable car ride is the way to go. The cable cars are very modern and the whole process is run quite efficiently - nothing like the old days when the lines were really long.I would recommend going early to miss the crowds and also so you have time to explore the top of the mountain. There is plenty to do up there and there is a decent restaurant too. Prices are in line with what you would pay for attractions of this nature around the world, but it is money well spent on a visit to Cape Town.

Stunning Views. A must for all travelers, locals and nature lovers, the views are breathtaking and the plant life is like something out of a movie, interesting little flowers and things. It does get a bit chilly up there in the wind so take a jacket.

Book your tickets online for fast and efficient entry. Book your tickets online or through your hotel as you can go through the fast track pre paid line, go at the earliest time as the Table plateau is quieter. One of the must do's in Cape Town!
Table mountain. So different from other cable cars because it revolves and you get the full view no matter where you stand.
Wow. Epic views - we booked the tickets in advance and went late in the day, which meant we only queued for 15 minutes despite it being peak season.

Beautiful mountain!. The mountain is spectacular! If you're young or fit then hike up Platteklip Gorge. The cable car itself is efficient, and clean, nothing special. There's a canteen at the top food is decent, although pricey.

The most wonderful experience......time after time.. It's a couple of years since first doing this visit. I suffer from Vertigo and didn't fancy the Cable-car thing much! But since my Daughters were visiting.....I divided to 'face my fears'.Been back a few times now and it is such a glorious experience......and transcends expectations on each occassion. A friend, who was celebrating his Birthday, 12/08/14, went on his own and called me from the summit, whilst I was shopping at PicknPay, Plettenberg Bay, my former home town. He was caught up in the atmosphere, in Winter and just had to tell someone!A really great place......peaceful and unique. Now World Famous, I hope the experience never changes or is diluted by too many Tourists.....maybe that is selfish, but that fear is real. Go while it is as it is.

Revolving awesomeness. We used the cable car to come down from Table Mountain after hiking up, and in some ways I was more anxious about the car ride than the hike!The ride's unique selling point is that the inside cabin revolves as it descends or ascends, and so no matter where you are in the car you get a glorious view of the bay and the mountain.Only thing to watch out for is that if the wind picks up then they close the ride, this happens quite often in December

worth the trip. Seemed very safe and secure. Platform rotates so everyone gets a 360 degree view. Good facilities for handicap access via a lift.Buy your tickets ahead of time. Waiting lines were not very long on a beautiful day.
What a scene. This place has no words to describe it's beauty. Make sure to try some South African bubbly while up there.

"ONE OF THE WONDERS IN THE WORLD". Handed been up the Cableway in years, we go to Cape Town every year but always regret when we leave that we miss it again. This time we did no miss out. We bought the tickets on line took the last Cableway for the sunset, all I can say is just what a awesome ride with beautiful view's all the way up & down. Once at the top we got us a drink & took a walk around at all the outlook points it gives you a 360 degree view of the Mother City. All I can say after spending 2 hours on the mountain it's breath taking. We are blessed in SA to have this wonder of the world.

View the whoke of Cape Town Aerially. A visit to Cape Town without visiting table Mountain is incomplete. This fo me is most certainly a wonder of the world. The cost is reasonable considering the most awesome view of Cape Town especially on a Bright summers evening. The walk is really gud. Restaurant and suvenior shop are pricy but gud considering resouces hae to be transported up. A must for every person. Sunset touts befor the 15 of December is half price.

cable car revolves to give everyone a view. We were lucky -- the clouds blew away by the time we arrived at the cable car. I'm not fond of cable cars - heights are not my thing - but this particular ride is nice because the car revolves & no one can "hog" the view windows. The view is best at the top, but the ride up & down is actually worth doing.

Cable Car to top of Table Mountain. This is a must for every visitor to Cape Town. The views from the top are fantastic, You need to book a trip early for if the weather changes and the Cape is famous forits winds the Cableway shuts down. Easy to get to. The tourist bus the red one I thinkwill take you up to the station and when you return catch it again and visit the beachesat Camps Bay before returning to the town.

Scared of heights. I went up table mountain a while ago now but I remember the rotating wall around the outside, offering everyone a chance to look out the open window... and also eliminating your ability to hold on to anything as you rise up the side of the mountain. I highly recommend it and would do it again next time I'm back.

Spectacular views. We bought afternoon tickets online and took the Hop on Hop off bus to the cable car entrance. It had been very windy all week so the cable car was closed, fortunately an afternoon was calm and the cable car was opened -worth checking on line several times during the day to see if it is running.  The trip was worth it, the ride up the mountain was smooth and the view over Cape Town incredible! The car rotates on the way so you see all around! The views from the top of Table Mountain are breathtaking! There are several walks that can be taken when there.There is a cafeteria style restaurant at the top, adequate food catering to all budgets. It was very hot and sunscreen, hat, cover up needed at the top on our trip. I understand it can also be cold at the top.

Provides a great view!. Loved the ride up in the cable car. You really get a good view of Cape Town and an understanding of the geography. Be sure to go as soon as you can on a sunny day, because if it gets windy or socked in with fog and clouds the cableway doesn't run.

spectacular. We did it all: Come early to avoid parking problems en for shure there is no queue for using the Cableway. That became true and we spend a lovely day on top.The Cableway is modern and safe. When the weather is no rough is wil not operate.During the appr. 10 minutes uphiil or downhill it turns slowly around so everybody inside will have a perfect view over Town and on another moment will be close to the rockside.

Fun at the Top of the World!. If you find yourself in Cape Town you must go and check out Table Mountain. The lines can be long to get on the cable tram but once inside the fun begins. The cable tram rotates!! so as you ascend the mountain you get a full view of the valley below. It is a glorious view! Then you are on top of Table Mountain...Top of the World Ma!! It is truly a high point in your visit! There is a cafe that serves some buffet style food, nothing special I suggest eating before you go and just have a glass of wine and enjoy the magnificent view! They have some easy trails that allow you to view different sides of the mountain top. Loads of viewing spots for pictures. *Be Aware* the lines to get back down the mountain are longer than you'd think! plan accordingly!!
Amazing5. A must visit place if you happen to be in Cape Town and trust me you will not be disappointed. I could do it everyday if i was living in Cape Town.
Long waiting time. If you are able to, do the Platteklip Gorge walk (2 hours). You avoid the long waiting line (over an hour). If you take the cableway, buy your tickets in advance online.

table mountain. wonderful rotating ariel cableway to top of table mountain with spectacular views of whole Cape Town area. Very windy during our visit and cableway was closed for most of our visit but we finally made it to top on our last day. E tickets booked for day could be used within 2 weeks

Well organised and no problem for one frightened of heights. I was lucky in that there was no queue and I got on straight away. The floor of the large car rotates so that everyone has a chance to look at the view which is very clever and the staff are friendly and helpful.
Disappointed. Travelled all the way to the entrance, only to be informed that the cableway had just been closed because of the wind. Bear this in mind when. Thinking of travelling.

Literally "breath" "taking". So indescribable. Takes your breath away. Pictures and video can't possible do this justice.
