However, as other reviewers have said, and as with anything in Cape Town, you must check the weather. The winds will shut it down, or if it's foggy, don't bother. BUT, if you have a lovely day, you will really have an unbelievably memorable experience and see a view of the mountains and surrounding city. You can walk around the top and also have a chance to look closely at the geology and some of the animal life on the mountain. It spins! So don't lean on the sides.

Thrilling Experience!. One of the top 5 attraction of Capetown is Table Mountain Aerial Cable way. Usually closed during bad whether and i was really lucky to experience it. Enjoy the breathtaking views. A must do activity in Capetown. Carry proper gears as sometimes its very cold and windy. Best place to click memorable pictures. Must Try!

Must visit.... Unfortunately I did not have enough time to climb the Table Mountain, but I did cable tour up and down. The area on the mountain is beautiful, and there ar walking paths that can make you 'busy' for the while day:) Be sure to wear proper shoes and sqomething with long sleaves as it can get quite windy upthere!
Beats walking down. I was tired, cold and miserable until I got on the cableway to get down. It rotates so you get a view.

Awesome ride. The Cable Car ride to the top of Table Top Mountain will be one of the most memorable experiences if you are visiting Cape Town. It starts from the base of the mountain and takes you all the way to the top. It is just a 15 minutes ride from the heart of the city to the base of Table Top Mountain. The cable car rotates as it rides up, presenting you an amazing view of the harbour, the oceans beyond and the mountain side. The most important thing before planning a visit to the Table Top Mountain is to check the local weather, since the Cable Car service will be shut down during foggy and windy climates.

Another must in Capetown. Check the weather ,there is no point in buying a ticket if it isn't clear on top. Views are spectacular, restaurant up there so you can spend time walking around and have a snack.can be extremely windy!
RIDE HIGH. Queuing, and management needs to be improved.Better services could have made the ride pleasurable.Restaurant is very limited space for so many visitors.

Never ceases to thrill. To go up Table Mountain should never be a once in a lifetime thing! It is the best way to experience the full beauty of Cape Town. I would advise fellow travellers to get to the cable car by 8 am, week days less crowded. Buy your ticket online to join the quicker line. I am not s huge fan of the cafe at the top so I would recommend taking a picnic. Wear good walking shoes to enjoy the walks at the top! Prepare to be amazed.
fast and efficient. the best way to go ge to table mountain top and appreciate the amazing view of Cape town.Make sure to bring a wind breaker and a raincoat

What a View!!. Fantastic views from the top of Table mountain. Beautiful, stunning views, Great experience and you can meet Daisy at the top, they are really cute animals! We pre-booked the tickets and skipped the line for the tickets but you still need to wait as there are 2 cars going only. Liked the rotating feature of the cabin so everyone had a shot taking great pictures (not recommended for people who have issues with highs). My wife has an ACL issue otherwise I would have hiked up to the top instead but if you do not have the time or the physical abilites to hike up, this is an excellent option.

Easy way to get fabulous views. The cableway gets to the top station surprisingly quickly and rotates as it goes. This gives great views on the way up and down and, of course, access to the fabulous views from the top. The authorities have a difficult dilemma here because more people want to get to the top of table mountain than the cableway can accommodate, but to increase capacity would create overcrowding on the top threatening the fragile environment. This means that you either have to ensure you get up at a time when queues are short or resign yourself for a long wait. Seize the opportunity as soon as you can on a nice day - you may not get another chance to experience the stunning views.

Super View!. Easy booking online, smooth drive uphill and very courteous staff at the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Very good experience going up, loved the feature where the car rotates 360 degrees so that you get all views and don't have to fight for a place to stand. Overall a great experience. One of the must-dos in Cape Town.

stunning. fantastic views from the top of table mountain. The flora and fauna were outstanding and there is even a cafe there too. Beautiful, stunning views. Great experience. We even walked all the way back into the town square afterwards.. Stunning.Pre-book your tickets to aviod long delays during peak season.
Rotating Cars. The cable cars rotate on the inside as you ascend and descend. It's a great way to get photos of the mountain from a unique POV and occasionally of the cape.
Great trip. Well organised and simple to get tickets. Beautiful scenery at the top. Great way to spend half a day.

Cable car fun. if you dont like heights dont look down....but what a view....we were lucky - a 20 mins wait before we boarded....made even the more memorable as we gave 3 mins clapping and 3 mins silence for Madiba on the 1st anniversary of the man's death!
Revolving viewing platform. Excellent ride and views as you are turned in the cable car . Smooth ride and landing a journey worth taking. Get there early to avoid the queues.

A Must Visit. Absolutely breathtaking view. you would want to stay for a longer time if time permits. A lovely cable car ride. a cosy restaurant where one can sip some hot coffee. one must be well equipped with a camera, walking shoes and a jacket, as it tends to get windy at times.when we visited our group could do mountain rapelling and that made the day. Yes , but its a long way climbing back up.Many trails for the people who love hiking.

Fabulous view. I took the cable car up Table Mountain. Very helpful staff everywhere. No queues on the way up, but a wait for the car back down again. A chance to get 'up close and personal' with the mountain - the cable car goes frighteningly close to the rocky mountain side. Marvellous views from the top, and excellent trails with good paths. We even saw whales out in the distant bay. My husband took the track up the gorge, 1 hr 30 mins of hard walking. I definitely recommend the cable car!

Absolutely amazing!. Up and down this was one of the greatest experiences of my life...it took me 30 years to finally get to do the cable car...with stunning weather and just after sunset!Maybe just work on the photo skills and next time I might just buy the booklet as well!

Breathtaking views. On a clear non-windy day on your trip in Cape Town, drop all your plans and head for the mountain. Every time I'm in Cape Town I keep my schedule flexible so that I can go up Table Mountain if the weather permits. Atop there is a small little restaurant with quick service and some nice snacks. The view is just fantastic. You can ascend or descend the mountain by foot alternatively to the cableway, quite do-able even if you are not super fit.

Weather needs to be on your side. We booked our tickets at our hotel and were lucky with the weather. The cable ride doesn't go up when it is windy or cloudy. The view from the top is breathtaking and you can even go trekking for 30 mins and for the eager, there is even a 90 min trek. Cannot leave Cape Town without visiting this site.

great views. An excellent way to see Cape Town and its surrounds. Try to pre-book tickets to minimise wait time and be flexible with dates as the high winds can result in the cableway being shut down. Don't forget your camera, the views are spectacular.

TAKE A TRIP TO THE TOP OF THE WORLD. We love the Cable Car - it is extremely efficient and goes up and down ONLY if the weather conditions provide for it We sometimes climb up Skeleton Gorge and take the Cable Car down the mountain which is the most AMAZING experience!!
Great fun. Make sure you book in advance and go early. Exciting journey with great views as you go up. Rotating floor!

PICK A GOOD clear day. Staff were very present , floor revolves as you go up . Times are good to go up and during summer you can. Get a discount if you go later in the day , last one down ,check first could be as late as 21.00 hours. best to go after 14.00 hours to miss most of those you go by bus or coach trips.If you pick a good day the views are fantastic.
The TOP thing to do in Cape Town. We did the sunset tour - 50% off any day of the week. This great adventure was hosted by friendly and knowledgeable staff. Excellent value and magnificent views.

Not to be missed. I am afraid of heights so I was worried that I wouldn't be able to go on the cableway. I had nothing to worry about, the journey only took about 5 minutes and I kept my eye on the mountain all the way up as I found a place to sit that didn't move round but the views from the top were so fantastic I stood on the moving part on the way down, got a good view of the area and I didn't feel uncomfortable at all. I'd go again.
amazing view. Made for an excellent afternoon. The views were just amazing looking down at Cape Town from a top table mountain. Pre by your tickets to visit.january 2013

What ride and view, the floor of the car revolves so you get a 360 degree view. The car operators are friendly.. Mainly I liked the view from the cars and the very amusendly operators.The view from the top was fantastic as the day we visited there was no cloud.
Cool!. It's really cool since it rotates while going up and everyone gets fantastic views. The tickets are 50% cheaper during sun set tours.

Breathtaking View. The view from the top of the Table Mountain is simply breathtaking. Has to be the number one go to place on your list for Cape Town. Carry warm clothes coz it gets very chilly on top. You get a panoramic view of the entire city as well as the coast line.

Our first family trip to the table top. From the word go it was great. We redeemed my wife's free ticket as we were going up on her birthday. the kids were exited (2 and 4 yrs old) This world class facility was awesome. The operator in the Cable Car was also very professional. However, I have to note that this tourist trap is unfortunately victim of over greedy management when it comes to selling memoirs and snacks. R20 for a bottle of 500ml water is absurd. R300 for our photo afterwards, even more so. As a local, I have to object to this. otherwise, the whole experience was awesome!

Sunny day destination. Beautiful landmark in Cape Town , a must see. But...be ready to wait in line for the cable car. We purchased tickets in advance but that did not help since the line to get onto the cable car took a good 40 minutes. If you can avoid the weekends as the locals do visit it as well.
A Fun Ride. I love doing aerial tramways and this was another good one. It is fast and you get a good view of Capetown.

Probably best in sunny weather?. An expensive experience, but unless you're up to a very vigorous walk, the only way to get to the top. In low cloud and mist, much of the view is lost, but still a fun experience. Book on-line first to avoid the long queues!

Ride one way and walk one way. We had only a few days in Cape Town and this activity was at the top of our list. I had been watching the weather and the status of the cableway to see if it had been open or not. It wasn't the clouds that kept it closed for several days but the wind. We drove up anyway and tried to do the hike up since the cableway was closed but it was just too windy and so we turned around. Luckily on our last day the weather cooperated and we tried it again and wound up riding the cableway up and hiked down. It was foggy at the top and the maps aren't the best but eventually we found our way to the Platteklip Gorge hike down the mountain. It was very steep and rocky and took us about 75 minutes of walking slow and carefully but the views were worth it! I highlight recommend walking at least one of direction either up or down the mountain for the views and exercise.

Excellent views of Cape Town and beyond. Definitely the highlight of visiting Cape Town, the cable car is excellent as the floor revolves during the 4-5 minute trip to the top of the mountain giving excellent views back over Cape Town. Only had to wait 10 minutes either way for the journey, but have heard there can be long waiting times. Once on top of the mountain the views are excellent, you can see out to Robben Island, great views of the coast and the mountain ranges.

Must visit, regularly. It's easy to grow jaded by all the talk about natural wonders, etc. The trip up (and/or down) is sensational every time. What's more, if you're a Cape Town resident the Cable Car Card makes repeated visits for a whole year almost as inexpensive as a single return trip!It's worth going late in the day when the tour buses have all left - queues are short and the summer heat is moderate. Remember though that the weather at the top cannot be predicted from below, and it can change in the time taken to ride the cable car to the top. Treat it with respect.Once up there select one of the many beautiful walks - flat or undulating - but listen out for the siren alerting to changing weather: get back fast or be prepared to undertake the quite demanding walk down. Enjoy!
Best Experience,Clear blue skies and no wind.. I loved going up to Table Mountain ,it is something I always wanted to do ,The views are amazing the vegetation is very different .
Plan for weather!. Stunning views, but always hard to tell if you can actually go up the cable way. We had to try 2x before we were able to get on - keep an eye on the weather...

Great views of Capetown but very weather dependant. Our rented apartment had great views of Table Mountain however for 3 days all we saw was the mist hanging like a tablecloth. Eureka the fourth day was a bright sunny day so off we went unfortunately so did the rest of the tourists in Cape Town. It was not pleasant having to queue for 2.5 hours in the heat of the day with no shade. However we steadily progressed to the Cable Car which took us to the top. The views of the Cape were wonderful as it was such a clear day so after all well worth the wait.

Must see, but move quickly when the mountain opens. This is THE major attraction in Cape Town to our minds, and the cable car is the easy way up to the top of Table Mountain, when the wind isn't too strong. Unfortunately for us, for the first 2 days we were in Cape Town the mountain was closed because the wind was too strong. Each morning we checked if it was open, and on the 3rd day - Success, the mountain was open and we immediately bought our tickets on-line and headed for the lower cable car station. Thank god we bought the tickets first because when you get to the station there is one queue for those with tickets, and a second enormously long queue for those who needed to buy tickets first. Tickets are valid for 14 days so buy one first so you're ready to go as soon as the mountain is open. The cable car takes many people at a time and does one complete rotation as you ascend or descend so everybody gets to see the views. On top there are shops, toilets, a restaurant, and a choice of 3 routes round huge top on clearly marked paths, ranging in time from 15 minutes too re an hour. We liked the views in all directions, and particularly the "Dassies", small approx 2 foot long animals native to the mountain and rumored to be related to the elephant!We chose the middle length route but unfortunately had to cut that short as the cloud came down and visibility reduced dramatically. Even so, it was a great excursion and well worth the wait and the visit despite the weather. When we got down, we found the mountain was closed again!
A definite must in Cape Town!. A very efficiently run operation and spectacularly beautiful. The rotating floor of the cable car is genius! Take a jacket as the wind is icy up there!

a must do, if you visit cape town. this is a must do. can go up the cable car and hike back down. or you can hike all the way across to the McLear's Beacon. i went up at 5pm which was perfect, no queues, hiked all around, watched the sunset, came back in the cable car (too late to hike back)

Definitely, worth the wait.. Firstly, I recommend you buy the ticket online to save up to an hours wait. Next, BRING A GOOD SWEATER! Overall its very organized but crowded on a very good day. I went at around 11am but called the service (number found online) before to make sure the weather and visibility are fine. The sights start on the way there and end when your back in the city. Once your up there, the sights are truly a wonder. Words cannot express how wonderful they are so im not going to even try. Up there, they offer loads of food and deserts and coffee so you dont have to eat before. Though our trip was cut short by expected strong winds, every minute was enjoyed being in the clouds.

Incredible. You must make time for this while your in Cape Town. You will regret not seeing the view if you don't. One of the most scenic views I have ever seen, it really gives you a great perspective of Cape Town and makes for some incredible pictures. Try to go just before sunset for the best pictures.

Don't miss the view from Table Mountain. It's a nice fast ride to and from the top of Table Mountain - and it's great that it rotates, so you get the full view, and don't have to "fight" for a good spot. But actually it doesn't matter much about the view from the cable car - once you get to the top the view is just amazing - don't miss going up there if you are in Cape Town.

Truly one the 7 wonders of the natural world. Cape Town is blessed with a bounty of scenic wonders. One of these is Table Mountain, with it's iconic table top shape. The best way to take advantage of the unbelievable views of the City and surrounds is to go up the Mountain on the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway, one of the longest single span cableways in the world. Built in 1929, the Cableway is celebrating 85 years in operation in 2014. During this period many thousands of locals and international tourists have enjoyed the trip to the top and back. The views in all directions are breathtaking, a photographer's paradise! When on top of the Mountain the sounds of the City below drift up in a hushed whisper, reminding one that even in the midst of a civilization there is peace and tranquility. The Cableway runs all year round, but please check the operating times and weather conditions. These can play havoc with the operation as strong winds and cloudy conditions usually halt the trips. The new cable cars are safe, state-of-the-art, with wonderful open viewing and do one complete revolution before reaching the top. You do not need to move around the cabin to get your perfect picture therefore. One cable car goes up the mountain while the one descends similtaneously. There are frequent trips every day with the number depending on seasonality. Make an advance booking/s, so that you ensure sure that you don't have to stand in a long queue in the hot sun! Avoid certain times of the year if possible, such as the December/January holidays and Easter, when the Cableway can get crowded. There are plenty of dining options on the Mountain top, or you could take your own refreshments up with you. There are also curio shops at the Upper and Lower Cable Stations. For the fit and adventurous amongst you, try climbing the mountain and coming down on the Cableway or do it in reverse. Travelling on the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a 'must' when visiting Cape Town, one of the most beautiful cities on the planet. Go up, get away from it all and marvel at what nature has provided, with a little help from us humans.I've been on the Cableway many times, from when I was small boy to the present and never tire of it!

Fantastic. The trip to Table Mountain was amazing, taking in the views and a walk around the top can take up to 2 - 3 hours (can be shorter if you do not want to do a full circuit of the "TABLE". Also be warned that the cable car is cancelled if the weather is not right. We pre booked the tickets to skip the line to the ticket booth. This is a must if in Cape Town.

Far easier than the climb!. An efficient service up and down. Views from the cable car are okay (the slowly-rotating car is a neat idea), but the number of people means you can't move around to see what you want when you want. The views from the top are better, anyway.The cableway does shut when the winds are high, so be sure to check on-line before travelling there from the centre of town.

Trip to the top of Table Mountain. Who can visit Cape Town and not rave about Table Mountain? The backdrop to pretty much any photograph and never out of sight (unless you are unlucky enough to be there when it is covered in cloud). However, just looking and gasping at its majesty isn't enough, you really need to get to the top and see the most beautiful views (possibly) in the world. The Aerial Cableway is safe and modern and a wonderful experience in itself. It runs smoothly and efficiently and if you buy your tickets online, there is usually only the shortest queue or even no queue. (This may be different in December though). The price was very reasonable for British tourists and you can stay at the top as long as you like where there is a cafe and shop and lovely walks. However, as safety is always important, the cable car will close if the weather is bad or windy (and it can get VERY windy in Cape Town), so you may have your visit cut short at these times. You can check the status of the cableway online and the tickets are valid for 14 days from purchase so you should buy them at the start of your holiday and keep them handy for the day when the sky is clear and the wind is light.Parking can be a problem as there is limited parking available and at busy times you may end up with quite a long and steep walk in the heat. I have used the Hop On Hop Off bus before to get there (From the Waterfront or Town) and I believe there is a local bus and taxis as well.The top of the mountain is a protected nature reserve and if you are lucky you will spot some wildlife. We saw the famous "Dassies" and lizards. I would never consider a holiday to Cape Town complete without a trip up the mountain. This is another Must Do attraction in South Africa. The mountain isn't named one of the 7 natural wonders of the world for nothing!!

View from the top. This is a must do in Cape Town. If you want to uses the hop on hop off bus, it takes you right to the ticket booth. I advise spending a whole day here so you can hike, or just relax. It is awesome!

A must for first timers. As soon as you get the chance head up to table mountain... The cable car only runs when the weather is good so, rain, wind and cloud means it won't run...The views are out of this world.

Be warned - book ahead. The queues at this attraction can get to be very long in summer. Book online if possible and save yourself some time.Allow for parking issues which can cause further delays when you finally get to the Cable Car.However, once you are there, the experience, will overcome all those challenges you had in getting past the queues.Once on top, you have the option of a quick stroll, a 30 walk, or a longer walk along well laid out paths.Before you leave check what the weather is like on top of the mountain. You could find bright sun at the bottom and a cold breeze on top of the mountain.Enjoy spectacular views of our city.

Touristy? Yep. Worth it? Absolutely.. This is a typical trip "Must Do", like visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris: everyone knows about it, everyone does it and underlying that is a very good reason: these places are grand and totally worth seeing. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway was a great trip up and down, properly organized and featured great staff. An additional plus: the car slowly rotates as it rides so everyone on board can get a view in all directions. Someone was thinking when they designed this. I can't say enough for the view up top, the obvious ecological efforts that have been made to preserve the natural flora and fauna. The cafes are not oppressive and you can put up with the fact that your descent includes a mandatory walkway through the gift shop (I bought a postcard). Buy your ticket on-line to get a little head-start. There was a lineup with a wait, but good things come to those....I took the Red Tour bus to the base of the cableway, which was very easy and a cheap ride. Make sure the weather isn't bad so you don't arrive and find that it is closed.I would recommend this trip up TableTop Mountain to everyone.

Part of world cruise. This was a fantastic visit to Table Mountain. We were taken up on the first gondola of the morning and that made our visit so much better. When we arrived at the top the place was covered by a slight mist and we were the only people there which made the place feel eerie, but wonderful the sun soon came out to reveal a beautifully blue sky and some spectacular views. We were able to wonder around and see some of the little animals that live there. Once the crowds arrived it was so much different and not for the better so my advice would be to get up there as early as possible. We had lunch in the cafe which was very good. It is a place not to be missed on a visit to Cape Town. I visited in April 2012 but the When did you visit won't let me put the correct year so I have put April 2014 so as to submit my review.

Amazing! Once in a lifetime experience.. This was great. The service was friendly, fun and energetic. They were helpful in making this such a great experience. The cable car was amazing and allowed us to see everything and the view was out of this world. Definitely a recommendation.

Picture Table Mountain. We live in Cape Town and recently took our son (4) up the mountain. He loved running in the pathways and jumping over the rocks. We showed him the spectacular views and he enjoyed every moment!! They learned in school of Table Mountain the previous week and we have a little girl who takes a lot of attention, so it was a great experience with only mom, dad and son time.

Professional and efficient. The whole cable way experience and all the staff are great. The process is smooth and organised.The views from the top are spectacular and a 'most do' for all tourists and Capetonians alike.

What a view. We stayed in Cape Town for three days, the Aerial Cableway was closed for the first two days due to high winds and a "tablecloth" over the mountain. On the third day, we were able to go to the top of the mountain. It was beautiful!

Excellent service and well maintained. Cableway is very well maintained with courteous staff. Ride itself is worth enjoying for the good views it offers and once you reach the top, its whole new world.

sunset on Table Mountain. this is a great Cable car, but you should be warned that if there are a crowd of tourists, they can get a bit pushy on getting on or off, or getting the frontrow of the view--Just be prepared to defend your space if need be. Sort of like getting on the skilifts in the alps--
A must to do in Cape Town. Very impressive natural wander of the world. High speed gondola up to the top. Great views and walks around the area. A must to do in Cape Town.

Great experience. Beautiful views. Be wary though as it is closed if too windy or to foggy. You can do guided tours if you have the time. The food in the cafe was very cheap and very generous size serve.

A "Must Do" in Cape Town. A tourist trap, to be sure, but well worth it. Just as few Parisians climb the Eiffel Tower, and even fewer New Yorkers scale the Statue of Liberty, Table Mountain appears to be largely a foreigner magnet. Few South Africans to be found. Still, absolutely beautifulVery glad we did it on our first day, when the sky was clear. Every other day, Table Mtn was closed due to high winds/clouds. Be prepared for lines. One tip: Avoid the Soviet-style queues for tickets by purchasing cable car ticket via the Hop On Hop Off bus ("Red Bus"). Another tourist trap, but a good (and cheap) introduction to the city, transportation, and a way to "skip the queue." It saved us a good 45 minutes.

Fantastic Farewell Outing. The cableway was amazing as it slowly rotates as it goes, giving you views from all sides. The two men we took had never been before, and the one was leaving SA to go home. They were entranced by the view, and also interested in the historical descriptions written on plackards in the various areas. It was a very special farewell and a moving experience for us all.

Beautiful views. Reasonably priced and the restaurant on the top of the mountain is not at all expensive. I've been to Table Mountain several times, and it's just as magical every time... try to avoid going around mid-day during summer as it can get VERY hot!!

An Essential Cape Town Tour. Table Mountain is an essential 'must do' on a visit to Cape Town. As soon as the weather allows, drop all other plans and go up Table Mountain on the Aerial Cableway. The Cable car floor rotates to give passengers a 360 degree view on the way up and down. The views at the top are spectacular - though a jersey is recommended as it can be a lot cooler at the top. You can purchase tickets in advance, and it can be part of your Red Route Tour of Cape Town on the Hop on / Hop off Bus, which saves parking. Highly recommended.

Make Cape Town , Cape Town. No trip to Cape Town would be complete without a trip up this majestical mountain! I have lived at the foot of it for the last 25 years and have still been up a gazillion times.There are also some great hikes up but you ABSOLUTELY must be taken by someone experienced.During tourist season the air medics are CONSTANTLY called out to rescue a tourist off one of the trails.If you take a wrong "path" it is almost certain that you will have problems. The views from the top are both endles and spectacular and will give you a great layout of how the city works. For obvious reasons, try go on a clear day... Bearing in mind it is very common for Cape Town to have 4 seasons in one day! Beware the tourist restaurant at the top , TOTAL RIP OFF!

A MUST do in Cape Town. You must not leave Cape Town before you've done this trip. You will regret not doing it. The trip is smooth and the views are awesome. Being on the top of Table Mountain is an extraordinary experience. I never tire of going up the mountain.
Beautiful views. The new cable cars are great, there is lots of space and the view is stunning from the top. Make sure you dont go when it is cloudy and take warm clothing with.

One in entire World!. Always stunning views wherever you turn your head. Fun to get to the top, no matter how you do it. Our beloved treasure! When hidden in fog, all miss it. Beautiful to wake up each and every morning to see :-)

Views for miles. Newly classified as one of the 7 wonders of the world, Table Mountain is a must see attraction if you visiting Cape Town. The panoramic views is unparalleled and the fact that the cable car rotates while ascending is an added bonus as you get to see more. The facilities are of world class standard and extremely safe. For locals the price is steep however for the travelling pound or dollar it's a decent price and well worth it.

Beautiful experience and amazing staff. We visited the cableway for my mothers 60th birthday and took my 90 year old grandfather in a wheelchair with. The staff was amazing and so helpful. The views from up there are so special and the cable car ride up and down was a lot of fun too. I would recommend buying tickets online to avoid the queues.

Lazy way to scale a mountain. Safe , quick and easy way to get to top of Table Mountain. Views of Cape Town from car are spectacular and even though it is not cheap , by local standards , it is well worth the trip.

a wonder of the world with cause. The excitement commences as one searches for parking which hightens expectation. The welcoming smile of the staff prepares one for the exotic view at the top.Dominated by overseas visitors...staff members a wealth of informations and adopt one as they are eager to share the info.For the energetic, there is the option of hiking up or down. set aside 2-3 hours for this but take weather into consideration. and weather changes quickly around this mountain.
Spectacular Table Mountain. The trip up or down Table Mountain on the cableway is simply spectacular. Not to be missed by any visitors to Cape Town (or residents for that matter)!

Awesome!. The cableway to Table Mountain is fun and exciting. The views are simply amazing. Always check the website to see if the cableway is operating before heading out for the day. The cableway is many times closed due to high winds or poor weather.

Highly recommended. As others have already proclaimed, this is a must see attraction. Be careful, however, that the tram closes during periods of high winds, so a call in advance is recommended. If on the mountain and the winds pick up, a siren will sound alerting people that they have only a few minutes to get on the cableway before it descends and stops operating. This can be a problem if you have hiked some distance from the upper station -- you'll probably not have heard the siren and will not have time to return before the cable car descends. In any event, the hiking is great and highly encouraged.

Fabulous Views!. This attraction is very well organized. Buy your tickets from your hotel concierge and you won't have to stand in a separate line. I liked that it is a circular cable car and the floor rotates so that everyone can have a view on the way up and then back down.
A must do. The cable car turns 360 degrees. So every place is the best place. Great views of Cape Town and on a clear day can even see to Cape Point.

Worth to take!. It is safe and easy way to the top. Recommend it. Beware queue time. We purchased the ticket online ahead of time. We were lucky went there when the cable car just opened it's daily operation and no queue.

Spectacular. We walked up the mountain with my teenage daughters and found it quite easy going; it's definitely not difficult climb and when achieved it's something to be really proud of. Stay for a bit of lunch at the top, enjoy the spectacular views and then catch the cable car down to the bottom.

View the Mother City. The view from the top is outstanding!!! The ride up and down smooth. expect long ques if the sun shines and when there is no wind. Unfortunately the present going price to use the cable way is expensive and a family of four and more can expect to pay more than a thousand Rand just to use this. At the rate of visitors using the cable way one wonders if the price cannot be lowered. Anyway the outstanding view is worth it.

Breathtaking. We couldn't go up in the cable car the first time we tried due to high winds. However, on our second attempt it was a wonderful hot sunny day and the views are amazing. Didn't have to wait too long to get in cable car as we had bought our tickets the previous day. Also some good walks from the top of the mountain if you have time. Staff friendly and helpful.
Its Amazing..... The views which u get while going up above d mountain are amazing.People do Trek, to reach up.Its one of its kind.

well organised. Well organised but we had a 2 hour wait as the mountain was closed the previous day. The red tour bus stops here so probably not worth taking a car as you'll just have to walk further when busy. If the weather closes in then they close the cable car so do keep that in mind as you might have to walk down. Estimated walk up around 2 hours for the energetic. Good cafe at the top too.

Great trip. Very interesting bit of engineering how this thing works and how the restaurants & everything work on the top of that mountain make sure you visit the views are amazing and its worth the money you pay, theres nature all about up there and you can walk a fair way go take a trek and wonder around

Heady...... Even if heights are a problem for your, you can tuck yourself away in the middle of this cable car and the 3 minute ride doesn't sees quite so daunting. Just focus on the end of the line and the magnificent 360 degree views you'll remember forever.

Breathtaking. Tourists, you cannot go to Cape Town and NOT go to Table Mountain! It's an 'out of the world' experience that cannot exactly be explained in words. No words can do justice to the experience. It is something that you have to do yourself to feel it and experience it like other people that have been there before. Beautiful, breathtaking view of Cape Town and the beach. You literally feel on top of the world.
great experience. go early if not you stuck in waiting linestoilets are astonishingly clean up there, breathtaking views

Be prepared. If you plan on going up the cable car in the morning, by tickets on line or from the hop on bus. There were very long queues if you didn't have a ticket. When we came down around in the afternoon the queues had gone.

table mountain. in order to have a stress free visit, get your ticket on the internet before visit the table mountain. the tickit is valid for 2 weeks. we were lucky to go up the first day. all other days the weather was bad and no cable way was going up. if you have your ticket you can go and stand in the row for ticket holder, which is much shorter. when bying the ticked at the office, you have to stand in the row for purchising a ticket and then again in the row for ticked holder. this is frustrating and can take up to 2 hrs in a queue without benches to sit. if you unlucky, if your turn comes to go up, the cable way gets closed because of bad weather.

Be sure to book online. I was so glad I had read other reviews before heading to Cape Town - I booked online before we left Oz and avoided the queues entirely! I understand that weather hadn't been good in the weeks before we visited and this Sunday was a lovely sunny day, making the cableway very popular, but the lines for those who didn't have pre-purchased tickets were ridiculous! 2 hour wait - no thanks!We breezed through the express line and were in the cable car in no time - what a view! This is the way to get to the top, unless you are an avid hiker of course, then by all means trek a few hours to get that spectacular view
Wow!. This is one of the most spectacular views on the planet. I live an hour away from the Rocky Mountains and this blew my mind. If you do nothing else in Cape Town this is it!

The best view in the world. Don't take too young children with you. It makes it challenging to walk around. I am sure that the view is one of the best in the world. The view is breathtaking and you can see different angles of the Peninsula. It is an experience to watch the sun setting.There are different path ways that you can follow. At times the restaurant is quite busy. I f you plan on staying long on the mountain, pack in water and a few snacks to avoid the waiting.

Amazing Views. When we finally went the scenery was amazing. Handy place at the top for something to eat and drink. Well worth a visit, I ordered our tickets on line before going, but still long queues when we arrived.

Fantastic experience. A must-do when you're in Cape Town. Be early or expect long queues at the base. The afternoon is more quiet, but visibility usually deteriorates after noon.
Parking at the base can be difficult, so expect a walk or take a cab or bus.
Outstanding but prebook tickets. Unbelievable. Make sure you prebook tickets to avoid first ticket queue. And go for the long walk to devils peak. Very worthwhile.

Takes your breath away!. If you visit Cape Town this is one of the must-see attractions. You just cannot leave South Africa if you haven't been on top of Table Mountain! I've been their probably more than ten times, but I never tire of the spectacular views from the top. Take your family up there and have a picnic. There's a lovely restaurant should you not want to go through the trouble of packing a picnic basket. A curioshop for the shopperholics is filled with all that is Cape Town. There are lovely pathways to follow. You'll be absolutely mesmerised by the views of the Cape Peninsula from the top. Hope for clear skies and you'll agree with my title, "Absolutely breathtaking!"

Have a visual display for visitors to see at booking office. Whilst we thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Table Mountain and the aerial cableway, what would help in times when its windy at the top is to have a visual display (tv) at the booking office for visitors to see who are waiting. During our short visit to Capetown, for 80% of the time, this was closed due to high winds. A visual display could show the wind speed at the top of the mountain, next review time of when the assessment to open or close the, what the tolerances are for opening or closing.

Great experience incredible views. I recommend you go early in the morning if you want to get the most of it. To go from the cable station to the end of the pathway takes a few hours but it's 100% worth doing. I got great pictures but didn't have enough time to go till the end. I don't recommend to take the baby with if you want to enjoy walking around.

Worth the Wait. Our first trip to Cape Town had to include a ride up to Table Mountain. The day we went was beautiful but the three days prior had been very windy so there was a lot of pent up demand. We had to wait about an hour but the ride and the views were worth it.

Amazing!! . One of the new 7 wonders of the world and it is easy to see why... Breathtaking views from the cable car and from the mountain. It's the easy way up and down and must do even if you're not a tourist! The cable car rotates and this means you get the full 360 view on the way up and back down. Really great touch, something I am sure many more cable car systems would love to have installed.

Spectacular views. The queues can be terrible and sometimes those who don't have prepaid tickets get up faster. Weather can also change fast. But once you are up there in good weather the views are spectacular and everything is well organized. A must see when you are in the area.

"W-O-W". The whole experience is awe inspiring, unfortunately it was cloudy when we went so seemed strange going from views with clear skies to the cold and restricted view at the summit but it did not spoil our enjoyment. The cable car takes a few seconds to get used to as it is the floor that revolves not the whole carriage but gives wonderful 360* views of the surrounding area. Worth all the queuing up for just for the experience, and would recommend to vist if in the area.

must do in Cape Town. Beautiful view from above on Table Mountain. A lot of people. Make sure you look at the weather before you leave because this can really change in 5 minutes. cable car stops working with strong winds. Worth doing
Wow!. Anything more is superficial. The views are amazing. The ride is just 5 mins but it seems like forever.

Need a head for heights!. Even at the bottom of the cableway, you feel very, giddily high, and the views over Cape Town are spectacular on a clear day. It's worth buying tickets online in advance, firstly to avoid the long queues on the day and, secondly to save a bit of money. The car itself is very open, with windows on all sides and a revolving floor, which is a bit alarming and means you can't hold on the side. On the journeys I did, the chap operating the car was a real entertainer with an amusing turn of phrase! Before taking the trip, it's worth checking if there is low cloud cover over the table top, because it's really cold and damp if you're up there in the cloud, plus the view disappears. There's a restaurant and a small shop at the summit.

The easy way up. A great piece of machinery which helps the less energetic of us who go up the mountain. The cars rotate as they proceed up to the upper station giving everyone on board the opportunity to take photos.
Beautiful views. Gorgeous views and we got there just in time! Great ride up the cableway! Very efficient and lovely coffee shop at the top.

It is a must when visiting Cape Town. The whole experience was wonderful. We had to wait a few days as the cable car doesn't run if it is too windy. Almost ran out of time, but on our last afternoon it re-opened. We went straight there by taxi and got on to the first car. We were very lucky as we were told you can queue for an hour or more. The restaurant at the top serves good food. If we had had more time we would have enjoyed a walk but just to see the views from the top was enough, it is magnificent and not to be missed. Buy tickets online.

Table Mountain Experience. We were lucky when we went there was no queue and the weather was glorious. The journey up and down was great, no need to worry about it if you are afraid of cable ways. It does not take long and the views will completely absorb you. The floor does rotate very slowly, which again is no worry and it does mean that everyone gets a full 360 view.Once at the top you will be amazed at the views over Cape Town and the Bay. Walk a few yards and look at the view in the other direction, again breath taking!A very well stocked restaurant at the top provides a good range of both food and drink.A real 'must do' when in Cape Town, but only go if you are assured of no clouds!
Spectacular. Beautiful views of Cape Town. Cable car rotates whilst ascending and descending, you get to see much more.

You can't see Table Mountain without it. Unless you're a super fit athlete type, you'll need to ride the cable car to see the views & the views are breathtaking. The cars spin slowly giving everyone a chance to see different angles on the way up & the way down. Very clever. Depends on the weather. Closes for strong winds as it should. The winds can be powerful. Can be a very long wait, but totally worth it.

Cable car is great but have time on your hands. It's scary, standing waiting for the car and looking up at the steepness of the ride, it is also a very slow queue so work out the quiet times, when we were there in November it got really quiet from 3pm and there were zero queues.

Must do activity when in Cape Town. I haven't been up Table Mountain since being in primary school about 20years ago and then I had German friends who came to visit in June who asked me to go up there with them. I must admit that I thought it would be pretty boring at first but after going up there and looking down over the beautiful Cape Town and surrounding area I abso loved it. I can highly recommend it to everyone to go up there at least once in their lifetime!! It's a great experience

Worth the wait. We went early in our holiday but found after parking and walking to the station that it was closed for the day. The excuse was it was windy but it did not really seem to be and there was a lot of maintenance activity. We tried again the next day in the morning but the queues were large so drove elsewhere and came back a few hours later about 4 pm. This time there were minimal lines for tickets and we were on the second car out. Views on the way up and at the top were stunning and the restaurant is good too.My advice is, probably not worth pre-booking, choose a good day with visibility, no cloud and little wind, go mid afternoon. I think the halfprice at 6 PM causes traffic to drop off toward that time; it certainly picked up afterwards.

Swift , smooth and rotating. The idea of a rotating cable car is a very interesting and smart one. It gives everyone a chance to see a bird eye view while travelling up the mountain. the ride was smooth with the staff explaining the facts about the mountain and the cable way. You can also boom your tickets online...how convenient.

Wow!!! beautifull natural wonder in the world we enjo. yed a lot on top of mountain the way was vrry exited through cable car we had took too many pictures....enjoyed to see diffrent view on top ....realy it was great experiance
Table Mountain Cable Car. Great ride -- beautiful views and it sure beats walking to the top if you have time restraints. This is a don't miss activity for Cape Town

Spectacular view :-). Sacred of heights but not scared at all on this cable car!! Rotating floor giving everybody a view. Half price after six. We went up to watch the sun set and it was great, very few people and no queues at all.

Wow. The most memorable view that I've ever had in my life is from the top of table mountain. When the weather is clear, all you can see is the most intense, breath-taking blue for miles and miles. You can't see where the water meets the sky and you're reminded of how beautiful our earth is. Make sure to do this while in South Africa!

Breathtaking as per usual. No matter how many times I go up there it remains breathtakingly beautiful. Being scared of heights, the cable car makes little stress of nipping up to the top in a smooth and quiet manner. What makes it better is that you can have a gorgeous latte when you get to the top and not stupidly priced either. We walked around the top for about two hours. Many walking routes to choose from. And you don't HAVE to get a lift on the cable car either, you can walk up/down if you feel fit enough. Buy a ticket online if you are going in peak season or on weekends otherwise you might have to queue for hours!

Cabling up the Mountain. An easy way to get to the top of Table Mountain. We pre-purchased our tickets so that we didn't have to stand in line. We timed it so that we could watch the sunset over the water. Breathtaking. It's slow line to come back down on the cable car as everyone leaves at the same time.

If clear don't miss it. Even got my wife who is scared of heights up she looked at the driver all the time missed some views but was happy to get to top and relaxed coming down. Great cable car and then summit is something else. Lots of walks well fenced and 360 views terrific don't miss
A wonderful cable car ride. A special cable car ride with great views. Tried to pick the hour you go as the crowds going up and coming down can cause long waits.
Cable car. The gondolas hold 65 people and has a revolving floor so there is no panic to get in first as the operators on board give clear and concise instructions during the transit...

Safe, stunning views - visit at sunset on a clear day. We fought through traffic on a weekday evening after days of the mountain being shrouded in cloud for the sunset and it didn't disappoint. Here are my top tips to visit Table Mountain via the cable car. Do go on a clear day, and at sunset for simply stunning views. As soon as the sun started to set there were very long queues in cold winds for the descent, so plan your visit accordingly. Get there early to have time to enjoy and photograph the views, then to enjoy a glass of wine watching the sunset. Book your tickets online in advance to skip the queue and get there early as parking is on the road, which isn't lit at night. Stand near the windows on the cable car journey to enjoy the views and dress warmly as it can get very cold and windy at the top.
Landscape unparalleled. With a group of a staggered ages, it was indeed a wonderful experience . Though it is advisable to carry medicines for vertigo prone elders. HANDS DOWN A MEMORABLE TRIP.

A ride out of this world.. Get to the ticket office by 8 am, The taxi fare was 60 Rand. After that time the line for tickets gets longer and longer. We first went up there at 2 pm and was told we would be in the queue for about 2 hours, so we came back to Cape Town.The journey in the cable car is stupendous. Don't worry if you are not by an open window as the floor turns during the journey up and down, so at some point you will be by the open window. Just make sure you are at the outer edge of the cable car to take advantage of this view.

long queues but worth the wait. brilliant views but make sure you check the weather before as it can be poor visibility. I got the local bus and id recommend getting the driver to tell you when to get off (although the extended bus journey allowed me to discover beautiful camps bay so not all bad!)table mountain is stunning and offers lovely views and a cafe for food and drinkstunning views of all the major city landmarks and good for a bit of climbing or walking!

Wonderfull views but precook your tickets!. The views from table mountain are absolutely lovely and the great thing is that there are several beautiful lookout spots, not just one. You can take a nice walk up on top and take beautiful pictures from different viewpoints and see some of the wildlife like Dassies. Do get tickets online in advance to avoid standing in a long line.

Breathtaking. Table Mountain is a true symbol of Cape Town. This is a must visit if you are going to Cape Town. The downside is that it is very weather-dependent. If cloud cover; the tablecloth of the mountain, is present, or if it is windy, the cable car will not run. Be sure to get your tickets through the hotel you're staying at, if you are staying at one, as you can get them for much less, and they will also tell you whether or not the cable cars are running. All-round though, this is a place I highly recommend visiting, if you are in Cape Town.
Only runs on a clear day when it's not to windy. Only takes a few minutes to whip you to the top of Table Moutain and the view is great. The cable Car runs runs every fifteen or twenty minutes
Stunning. If you do nothing else in Cape Town, take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The views are stunning with many paths to walk around the top. A great way to spend a couple hours.
Beautiful view!. You can't go to Cape Town without seeing Table Mountain. The cable car revolves so everyone has a chance to see (if you have the desire).

one of the wonders of the world. this is really a wonder of the world. once up the mountain especially on a beautiful summers evening one could see the beauty of the mother city. without a trip to table mountain ones trip to cape town is incomplete. a beautiful restaurant is at the top of the mountain where very enjoyable meals or snacks could be found. this is definitely a highlight of ones trip to cape town

Amazing sunset from Table Mountain. The facilities are word class very user friendly. The sunset scenes from Table mountain are fantastic. There is a fully licensed restaurant at the top and walking trails. No wonder this is a world heritage site and one of the seven wonders.

Great experience. This is a must do on your list when visiting capetown. The only real problem is that the cable car is very weather dependant . If there is a cloud layer on top of the mountain , it will not run. Also it might be very sunny and clear, but if it's windy it will not run either . If you are staying in a hotel, get the tickets through them, it is cheaper. They will also let you know if the cable car is running. If the weather does stop you trip, make a trip to signal point. It gives great views also of the surrounding area and robben island. It's the highest point you can get by vehicle, and is a close second to the view from table mountain. Either way enjoy

Amazing. We took he cable car up the mountain, but if I'd had the correct footwear, would definitely loved to have walked up. It was pretty chilly on the summit, so be prepared. Initially the cloud obscured the view, but have a little patience as it does lift and he views are amazing.
What a view..... Awesome view if you pick a clean day to visit the mountain. Arriving early helps to avoid queuing and ensure a place in a cable car without too much of a wait.

A view from up above. Get there early, the queues are long, particularly during the summer season, and once on board, try to stand near the window. The trip to the summit of Table Mountain (as well as the descent) provides a 360 degree view of Cape Town, due to the turning floor of the cable car. The landscape below is absolutely breathtaking. It is well organised and good value for money. Will definitely do this again on my next trip to Cape Town, one of my favourite cities.

Facilities not up to standard. We arrived shortly after 8am and the queue was short which was great. However the ladies toilet behind the ticket office has such a strong unpleasant odour I didn't want to enter. While queuing to decend there was a foul smell coming from the disabled toilet. While there appears to be many staff milling around in the cafe there did not appear to be any cleaning staff.
Fabulous way to see the city. Loved the rotating cable car so everyone got a good view. Spectacular view! Lines can be long so be prepared.

Outstanding Wonder of the World. Table Mountain, an iconic sight to olden time sea farers - how impressive it must have been and how it still is today. A ride up the mountain in these modern cable cars with its revolving floors is an outstanding treat to all visitors.I've been up the mountain many times (generally by foot), but this was the first time for my youngest daughter and she was mesmerized with the revolving floor - but I guess it was more getting the panoramic view that made it so special.We made use of the special after 6pm discounted price. The queue was not that long. The car took about 60 people up every 4 minutes, so the lines moved fast. It moves at about 10 metres per second and can transport about 800 people per hour. Just a pity that it goes so fast as it is so enjoyable. What is astonishing is that the cableway has been running for over 80 years with no accidents.Table Mountain is about 1000m above sea level with its highest point being Maclear's Beacon at 1085m. It's believed that Table Mountain is at least six times older than the Himalayas having been formed under the sea some 600 million years ago.The original inhabitants of the Cape called the Mountain the "Hoerikwaggo" meaning Mountain of the Sea. Today there is a popular hike called the Hoerikwaggo.What is good is that the website of the Cable Car company gives the weather indicator which can save one a trip for nothing. The Weather was just perfect when we went up - good views all around, nice balmy weather for a picnic and the mountains was full of people coming to enjoy the view.There are 3 free guided walks from 09h00 to 15h00 ranging from the Dassie Walk (15 min) to the Agama Walk (30 min) to the Klipspringer Walk (45 min). The mountain top has been nicely paved making it a pleasure for the visitor to walk around and view the sights.The Mountain boasts over 1460 different species of fynbos and vegetation and it is a World Heritage site.Tickets can be bought online which allows one to avoid the queue's - unfortunately the special priced ones have to be bought there which can take some time.There is a souvenir shop which is not too pricey and a restaurant for those wanting to "eat" out.
A Must. Brilliant views over Cape Town. So impressed with the revolving floor so everyone gets a great view on the way up and down. Late afternoon the time to go!

A must see in Cape Town. The trip up to Table Mountain via the cable car is well worth the cost and sometimes a long wait. Many days are too cloudy or windy and the cable car does not operate. We were fortunate to have a clear, wind free day. We took our first opportunity and were so happy we did. There is a trail at the top that allows you to get breathtaking views of Cape Town. You can see the views with little walking, but there is also a loop trail that takes at least 20 minutes to complete at the top. The loop trail offer several lookout points. For those in really good shape you can skip the cable car and walk up. Purchase your tickets ahead of time to avoid lines. They are not timed and you can get them the same day.

Great way down. We hiked to the top of the mountain, which was actually pretty challenging and took us almost 3 hours. After a bite to eat and a glass of wine, we took the cable car back down. The line was short and it's nice that the car slowly rotates on the way down so everyone has all views and can take good photos.
Enjoy the ride!. It really worth! Unless dangerous windy weather, you can enjoy the ride to climb on the magnificent Table Mountain. I loved every instant of the ride.

Must do in Cape Town. The cable car is the easiest way to the top of Cape Town's iconic Table Mountain. The weather on the mountain is very changeable so make sure you go on the first available day it is open. You get a great view of Cape Town and the Twelve Apostles. As the weather can change in a matter of hours, don't put your visit off if you know the cable car is open.

Table Mtn Cable. No trip to Cape Town is complete until you go up Table Mtn on the Cableway. Purchase your tickets early via website if possible to avoid the lines. Great views of Cape Town and the peninsula if you are lucky with a clear day. Take a change of clothes as the weather can change quickly up top.
Okay but... staff need training.. Automated recorded response when phoning in: voice not very clear. Cable car operators are not friendly. Toilets are not clean. Great views!

Worth the wait...but it was really long.... It had been cloudy and windy for a few days so when this Sunday morning dawned bright and sunny, we headed straight for table mountain. It was a two hour wait in line to get up on the cable car and then an unorganized 30 minute wait to get back down the mountain. Also, if they could have been clear upfront (before loading) about the fact that the car floor rotated so everyone would be able to get the open window view, it would have prevented the pushing and shoving by rude tourists to get the best spot in the car. They are all good! Having said all that, it was a short but spectacular ride and very stable. Table Mountain was worth it!
Amazing. The people who built this cable car had imagination! It's great, though even with tickets we still had to queue quite a while but once up there you can easily get away from everybody else.

What a view. The cable car is fast and efficient but buy your ticket online to avoid the queue. We did not have to queue to go up but I guess this was just luck and depends on the time and day you visit. The views are going to reward you anyway so dont worry about the wait. There is a restaurant at the top and free toilets too. The area is very well maintained and the price is reasonable at 225r. The cable car rotates so everyone gets a chance to take those all important shots.

Great ride up Table Mountain. The Hop On-Hop Off bus takes you right to the entryway. Purchase tickets at the shop and then walk up to get on a car. Go early and go as quickly as you see that the mountain is clear. The lines can be 2 hrs - so go fast and early. The floor of the cable car revolves so everyone gets a view. Good free tour on top. Excellent and brand new restaurant and snack bar on top. Excellent restrooms. Very well run. Rejoin the Red Bus for a city tour.

Book online to avoid a hot queue. Turned up the day before to find a very long queue, so moved on to signal hill instead. Booked online that night and came back early the next day and went up in one of the first cableway cars. Had a very enjoyable and pleasant breakfast in the restaurant, before spending an hour exploring the mountain top.

Aerial views all round. Once done, not necessary to repeat. But it is quite spectacular to sit in the cable car and be winched up to the top of the mountain.Best obviously when there is no cloud, as if Table Mountain has her tablecloth in place, the view is nil.Worth doing once.
Better than walking !. Very smooth ride up and down, the floor rotates so that everyone can get a good view during the trip.

Refund Process is Simple and Efficient. This is an unorthodox review since we unfortunately weren't able to actually use the cableway due to windy weather while we were in Cape Town. We bought tickets in advance on-line since we had read about the inconvenience of having to stand in a long line to buy tickets on site and then stand in another long line to actually ride the cableway. Due to windy conditions we weren't able to use our tickets, but we got a refund (credited back to our credit card) with no hassle at all. We just sent an e-mail to the company (refunds@tablemountain.net) within the 14 day window after the initial date on our tickets. Very simple. If we're ever lucky enough to visit Cape Town again we will undoubtedly buy Cableway tickets in advance to avoid the queue (tickets can be used any date within 14 days of the date that you initially specify on your ticket). If we strike out again and are unable to use the tickets, the refund process is no problem at all.
Worth the price for amazing views!. The views are so impressive during the ride up the cableway and of course, when you're on top of Table Mountain, the views are unbeatable.

Loved it!. Finally the mountain cleared enough for us to go! I would suggest prebuying, even if it's the morning of because the queues can get long, but the line does move fast. Fantastic views, all facilities very well maintained, if you go to Cape Town, you must try to go to the top of Table Mountain, you will not be disappointed!

up, up and away. This ride is a trip in itself..........rotating floor gives everyone a fabulous view while riding to paradise. A short 5/6 minutes and you are there. Very crowded in the cableway but not a bad seat in the house. Captive audience, either ride in this or hike up.
True world wonder. A great day out with the family. A bit expensive for a local but affordable for people with forex. Awesome views over the Cape Town city and Table Bay area.

Great view and experience!. We recommend to buy the tickets online and than you enjoy everything. The journey up seems to be quite demanding but can be done! However, thanks to the cableway we could spend more time up and it was worth! The weather was beautiful, cloudless and we enjoyed the view all around.
Nice experience. A must see! Very nice experience! You shouldn't go to Cape Town without having a trip on Table Mountain

WOW the car rotates as you go up!. Buy your tickets at your hotel or through your travel agency. The lines to buy tickets was blocks long and several hours wait. We had our tickets and was in the short line, that was still an hour wait!

Crowded. If you want to go up to Table Mountain but don't want to hike, this is a great option. However, when we went it was very crowded and hard to get a window spot. The car rotates so you will get 360 degree views but if you aren't at the window and you are short it will be tough to see. Also the ride only lasts a few minutes and you have to pay. If you can, I would recommend hiking up as you get the wonderful views more much longer and without the crowds. The trails are easy to follow and well maintained. Just make sure you don't go when it's really foggy.If you do take the cable car, make sure you call the number before you intend to visit as they often shut the car down due to high winds. Parking isn't too bad (it's right along the road there) but you may have to walk a few minutes.

If the weather is good it is worth the lines. The lines manage to move quickly as the tram holds about 65 people. You may be lucky enough to see baboons on the track on your way up the mountain. The view is spectacular. There is a cafeteria and the line moves quickly . A slice of pizza and ice tea worked for a quick lunch. Salads and other foods are weighed at checkout and are pricey for the quality. Take your camera and enjoy.

Table with a view. We went up in the late afternoon, which seems to have less people, we saw huge crowds in the mornings.Wind can play a part in shutting down the site.The views are awesome and plenty of places to look out from.The cable car floor revolves, a bit weird but it lets everyone a fair share of the views.Plenty of food at the tops as well.The HoHo bus goes there but we took our rental car up and parked past the site.
A nice ride but very long lines. The Cableway is state of the art Swiss machinery but you need to take into considerations long lines even at low season

An old Capetonian revisits the Cable car ride on the mountain....... We chose a superb ,windless day so that nothing could deter us from the best ride and the endless captivating viewpoints up top........It was amazing gazing down on "Parker Cottages" at 3 Carstens street which was our best ever B and B, Gordons Bay, Muizenberg Beach, the twelve Apostles, the Cape Point, the Grand Synagogue in the gardens(also worth a visit) area and so much more..............Once on the top there are endless paths to follow which move you to any given viewpoint. Take a picnic basket -as there are many private spots to enjoy it it! This City beats all else in the beauty it offers - not forgetting the Hottentot Holland mountains which face you over Table Bay.

Check out the website for more information before going up!. One of the best way to look at Cape Town city is to go to the top of the Table Mountain. The ride is very safe, but the view is really dependent on the weather there - which can change by the hour! Check out their website before going up!Definitely worth your time if you like aerial views!
If you're in Cape Town, you don't miss this.. Suitable for everyone - except people that suffer from vertigo ; )Nothing more to say, the review name says it all.

A real wonder of the world. We decided to go up the mountain at about 16h00, which gave us the best of both. We spend some time walking on the mountain and exploring the beauty. Then at the same time we waited for the sunset and also enjoyed when it turned dark and to see the mountain and Cape Town from the mountain in the evening. This was the most beautiful sight. Will recommend this attraction to everybody to see.

A "must see" in Cape Town even with the long lineups.. I had heard about the long lineups for the Aerial Cableway and so had bought our tickets online before left Canada. The tickets were good for 14 days and so I booked it for our first day in Cape Town. We had met people who had been in Cape Town the week before and unfortunately for them it was closed every day due to high winds. The day we arrived and the next it was closed and we were getting pretty worried. We hung around the hotel in the morning of the 3rd day and the minute we saw that it was open we got ready to go. My husband pointed out that the web tickets I had purchased were for afternoon only. I am not sure how that happened as I had been advised that when it is open you go quickly as the Cape Town weather is so changeable, especially in the spring. I chalked it up to a bad experience and we got there and stood in the absolutely huge line for tickets. There were workers who came down the line asking if anyone had purchased tickets online. We piped up that we had but they were for afternoon only and they said “It doesn’t matter. Get in the other line”. This is the line you go to when you have tickets. We stood in line there for an hour. I am sure if we had to wait to buy tickets it would have been 3. The cable car had been down for two days and we were there on a Saturday…go figure. It was however well worth the wait. The ride up is amazing on the cable car with a rotating floor and the view from the top, on this very clear day was incredible. We felt so lucky that the weather had cleared so that we could visit. This was also one of our first experiences with the wonderful attitude towards tourists that we experienced in Cape Town, when no-one batted an eye when we used our “Afternoon Only” tickets on such a busy morning.

Must visit. A 'must do' whilst in Cape Town. Make sure you visit Table Mountain on your first fine day. The mountain is often covered in a cloud (the tablecloth), or in strong winds the cable car does not operate. There were long queues the day we visited

Worth It!. We waited a little bit in a line, but it was totally worth it. Breath-taking view. My travel mate was crying because it was so beautiful and magical feeling. Very fun and affordable. Great photo opportunity.

easy way up the mountain. you should walk up on the many paths that are available and take the cable car down. Much more authentic than just going up and down the same way. But it's a great way to get a view on the way up!

Cape Town Gem. Nothing compares to the view from the top of Table Mountain. A ride via cable car to the top of the mountain is great having a view of all sides of the city because of the revolving floor of the car.In summer sunset trips to the top of the mountain is extremely popular and the sun setting over the horizon is fantastic. It seems as if the sun is dipping into the sea. I have experienced sunset in Oia in Santorini but I think this is more beautiful. A restaurant on top of the mountain serves a buffet as well as snacks. A lovely stroll on top of the mountain is really a connection with nature.

Wondrous views. I just loved the ride - and I have a fear of cable cars as I am convinced that travelling along ropes is not really a wise way to be transported!The floor rotates during the ride so you get to see every aspect of the spectacular view from up there.Note of warning - be there VERY early, otherwise those who trekked up the Mountain would likely be at the top before you get there! Yep, the queues, as other reviewers mentioned, can be quite long.

Efficient Cableway to get to Table Mountain in Capetown. When in Cape Town and with the weather permitting, Table Mountain is a must see and do attraction. The best way to get to the top of Table Mountain is by the Aerial Cableway. The Cableway does not operate when it is very windy for obvious reasons. There are two cable cars, one going up and one going down. The cable cars are round (which we thought was odd) and not rectangular as is normally the case) We found out why - the cable car revolves on the inside affording everyone a clear view of the mountain panorama as the cable car goes up. One caution though is for you not to hold onto the window railings. If you do, you will be drawn circularly along as the cable car revolves. The operation of the cableway is fairly efficient. Some hardy travellers can decide to hike all the way up foregoing the cable way, but that option is not open to most tourists.

Plan and enjoy the experience. I was impressed with the service and quality of this attraction. It needs to be planned, as there can be challenges during peak periods. I was visited on a Friday, and arrived early afternoon. Parking can be challenge so be prepared to walk a bit. If you can arrange a drop off and pick up during peak times then maybe do so. remember there is parking along the road on both sides of the lower cable station. There are "guards" around and acknowledge them as they assist. For RSA seniors there are discounts on Fridays. At the lower station, all the staff are dressed in uniform and easy to identify. They will guide you to the ticket office, get you across the road and answer queries.I only had to wait for 1x cable car on the way up, so a few minutes to enjoy the surrounds, look at the car coming down, and anticipate the ride. When boarding the cable car, do not rush for a particular spot, as the floor rotates once the climb starts.Once at the top, there are many paths / view points to enjoy, not just Cape Town and Robben Island, but also views to Cape Point. Take water if planning a reasonable walk. There is also a restaurant at the top, so great to sit and enjoy the area with a snack.The return trip may also require a short wait, as people return. The later in the afternoon, then usually the wait is a little longer.If visiting Cape Town, then try to plan a day early in your visit so that you can have a backup day, should there be winds that prevent the cableway from operating on you original planned date.Take sun tan lotion and enjoy the experience.

Breathtaking views. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a trip to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car is designed so that every one gets a great view as you ascend. The floor rotates ensuring everyone sees the view on the way up. And once at the top, the views are incredible. A beautiful walk at the top adds to the visit. Highly recommended!!!

Jewel of the Cape. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a visit up our iconic Table Mountain. Appreciate the Fynbos, indigenous shrubs blanketing our mountain whilst the spectacular views of the Atlantic ocean, take your breath away

Majestic, beautiful, powerful & awesome to look at!!. Having lived in Cape Town my entire life, I feel I am privileged to have this majestic mountain to look at every day of my life. I stay in a leafy suburbs at the back of her and get to watch her many changes of tablecloths day in and and day out. Always feel protected around her, you can drive all over Cape Town not feeling lost as you know where you are as soon as you see her. If you are visiting Cape Town, please don't leave without a visit to our beautiful Table Mountain. You can go up early evening in summer for a picnic or just to see the magnificent views of Cape Town when you are standing on top of her. There is a cheaper ticket available if you go up in the evenings but you need to queue up for this - either way it is worth every cent!! I can really recommend this ....... even in winter the views are awesome!

A Must see in Cape Town. Table Mountain is such an icon and a "must see" when in Cape Town.High winds like the South Easter do stop the cable car from running so don't delay your trip up the mountain - go up as soon as you see sunny skies with no "tablecloth" - the famous bank of cloud that covers the top of the mountain when the wind is howling!The cable car rotates so that everybody gets a great view and, once at the top, the views are simply stunning.As with all major attractions world-wide, the queues can be daunting during the summer months.Don't let this put you off - the experience is well worth the wait which can be from 15 mins to 3 hours at Peak times. Get there early!There are well marked trails at the top of the mountain - take time to wander and truly enjoy your mountain top experience.Highly recommended.

Long queue .... and up we go and what a view!. Best to get your tickets online, not only because of the small discount but because you can skip the main ticket queue that can be extremely long with very little shade.Unfortunately we could not book on line as we were using a locals newspaper discount voucher (us and hundreds of other Capetonians), so we queued for 2 hours, often in the sun. It would have been nice to be offered some more shade and for staff to come around and talk to us about the wait time and to police the few people that were jumping the queue!But we knew the wait would be worth it, the ride in the cable car is great for kids and adults alike and once you are at the top, the view is breathtaking. Avoid the crowd at the exit and by the restaurant/toilet area and walk about as far as you can go. Bring a picnic (take your trash home with you) and enjoy some quiet space. Alternatively you can queue again and taste the cafeteria style restaurant. The place is beautiful and very well kept and managed, clean (although a few smokers are dumping their stumps on the ground) and safe; it is an amazing visit.
