STUNNING CABLE CAR EXPERIENCE. Been up with friends and also been with family. The Cable Car ride is smooth and the views are awesome. Once at the top on a clear day you can see from Atlantic Ocean to Indian Ocean. Truly magnificent. There are lovely walks and you can also climb up or down. There is a restaurant and cloakrooms and good information on the locations at the top. Being one of the 7 Nature Wonders of the World it is a must for all visitors.

Are you afraid of Heights!. I have to share this with you. I am a person who is so afraid of heights. With a feeling of apprehension, I accompanied my family to do the cable car ride up Table Mountain. On our way up the steep roads , turns and inclines included , there is no safety railing like normal roads so you will be so daunted because I know I was. But any case with all the fears and shouts and screams going up the road we finally arrived and parked on a spot with no safety railings. All you could see was the bushes and stones and town below. We got off the car and went to buy our tickets. It was a cloudy day so the attendant mentioned that we will not see much today. Any case, we waited about 15 minutes in the queue and then it was our turn. I must mention that the cable car is safe - there is place to sit for the squeamish like myself and rails to hang on to. It was a quick ride , you could see the sprawling, gigantic mountains - no wonder it was chosen as one of the Seven Wonders of the World - Table Mountain. On arrival on top of Table Mountain - which of course took my breath away, we were in awe with the beauty. The visibility was poor for a while due to rain and mist but seemed to disappear after the walk around the mountain area. I should mention I stayed away from the edges - due to my fear but want to say when the sun came out through the mist and rain - the sight was spectacular. If you want to live your dreams, now is the time to do so. Put your fears aside and live a little and enjoy the wonders of nature obviously at a price. We paid off peak price of R99.00 per person during January month - please ask for specials or you can log on to the internet and check it out.I had the time of my life. No more fear of heights. There is a quaint little restaurant if you are peckish and there is toilet facilities. Very clean and hygienic. I enjoyed every little moment and I know you will also. The staff at the restaurant are very friendly and you can take lots of photos. And I guarantee that you will thoroughly enjoy the experience.

Spectacular and breath taking. The Table mountain experience remains one of my best! This is the perfect outing for the whole family. We enjoy the restaurant as well as the beautiful scenery from up there. Great historical value and information for tourists.

Incredible. Bought tickets on line then waited about an hour in line to get up which was faster than expected. Floor rotates and two sides of the car are open and the wind felt so fresh!! Incredible views absolutely breath taking. You need about 4 hours to do the walks at the top and just to admire the views, restaurant is good and prices very reasonable big pizza slice £4 etcWhile up there very scary klaxon went off and we had to go back down as high winds on way but staff were singing and making us laugh as we queued. Incredible wonderful amazing

Visiting the top of the most beautiful mountain in the world. Well run facility. If you pre-book online your wait to get up the mountain will be a pleasant one.The cable car equipment is modern and safe. the staff assisting are helpful and friendly. The paths on top of the mountain are well signed posted and the walks are all manageable.You need to plan your trip with respect to parking as if it a busy time there could be quiet a walk from the available parking.

Need I say more???. This is one of the natural wonder of the world and it is really wonderful to stand on the edge of the mountain overlooking the city and just marvel at the beauty of God.There is a cafe at the top and a volunteer guide is always available. There are hiking paths on the mountain and lots to explore. It is an outdoor adventure that everyone should experience once in their life time. Definitely a must-see!!

See Cape Town from Above. The view from the top of Table Mountain is incredible. Even if you're thinking, "Oh this is too touristy", the view is well worth it, even despite the crowds. If you're adventurous, in shape and have a compass: hike up and take the cableway down.* I hiked up Table Mountain and then took the cableway down.

Excellent trip up the mountain gives you panoramic views across the cape.. If it's your birthday, the cable car is free! This is a must do. The views are spectacular.For the energetic, walk up platteklip gorge (1-2hours) and come down the cable car (for R115) - you can start at the bottom station and land up doing a complete loop. Be warned, only do this in good weather, take water and cool weather gear and don't go at midday in summer! We often do this as a walk/run before work in summer.

Best sundowner spot in Cape Town. You can also take the cable car to watch the sun set, buy a glass of wine or take your own. There are taxi's down at the cable car station to take you back home.Tip: Find out when the last car is going down and listen for announcements.
Magnificent. Walking across the top of this magnificent mountain, taking in the view, one feels like you can see forever. Truly a wonderful experience.

Breathtaking. Breathtaking views while going up or down, and of course from atop the mountain itself. And you get a free cable ride on your birthday. In cases of bad weather (rain, wind, etc) the cableway gets shut down...just call ahead in such weather to make sure it is operating.
Cableway. Sadly the weather on our scheduled visit meant the cable car was not running. Visibility was also poor so not an ideal time to have visited the cablecar.

Magnificent view. We decided to take our chances and drive to the TOP of the hill from where the cable car departs. Very lucky to get a car space that meant we avoided the arduous walk up that hill!The cable car ride provides a great view but nothing compared to the 360 degree vista from the top. As well as a beautiful mountain top walk and garden in its own right, it provides the most stunning views ..... the town itself, the beaches, those amazing mountains. The cafe isn't bad either particularly given the logistics of getting its supplies there. You haven't seen Cape Town until you have been to this site.
Awesome Views. This was a great ride to the Top of the Mountain. The Cable Car rotates as you go up so don't worry where you are facing - everyone gets a view.

A great experience. The perfect way to get to the top without having to hike up. A revolving floor means you get a great view in both directions. Need to be aware of the weather and possible closure due to bad weather and strong winds

Stairway to Heaven!. This is an excellent way to get to the top of the mountain! We had a limited amount of time in Cape Town so we decided to take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain and it was an excellent choice! I booked the tickets on line prior to the trip just to save the time and hassle. The nice thing is if you book on line and end up not using the tickets (sometimes inclement weather closes the Cable Car), you can get a refund (there's a time line restriction on refunds so just check your travel dates). You also get a discount by booking on line.We only spent about 10 minutes waiting for the cable car and the banter from the operator was amusing! The cable car rotates so it gives you a great view as you travel.See my review of Table mountain for more information.
cable car. see nature reserve review,which covers the bus ride and suitable conditions to go up in the cable car

The view from the top is spectacular. A trip to Capetown must include a ride to the top of Table Mountain. It's ranking As one of the new 7 Wonders of Nature is well deserved. Take time to walk the trails on top of the mountain and enjoy the beauty of God's creation.

Such nice staff and a cool ride. I don't like heights but I felt perfectly safe on this modern cable car. All the staff are so friendly on the car and in the shops at the top. By going at 3pm we didn't have to queue at all, and we stayed up till the last car down at 7pm.

Least favorite. We spent 2 weeks in South Africa and this was by far the least favorite of our adventures. In fact we thought it was a big waste of time and money. First, don't believe the "parking attendant" when they tell you there's no parking up top. It's a grueling hike up to the cable car if they catch you low enough on the hill. It's just a cable car ride up to a tourist trap on top. Save your time and Rand and skip it.
Great views up and down!. Loved the excitement of queuing up for the cable car! Missed it the last time in Cape Town due to high winds-not this time! A beautiful day for an amazing experience!

Amazing experience. After your easy ride up the rotating cable car, you will experience a surreal feeling. The view over Cape Town is breath taking, seeing for miles and miles over the ocean. The pathways that take you on your tour are easy to navigate and you can easily get around. There is a hushed atmosphere almost spiritual. Don't miss out on this!

What a view!. There is something about this majestic mountain. We did a sunset ride and it was worth it. Being able to watch the sunset and the clouds roll in was amazing. There is a special price for the after 6pm car, but you can't pre booked as all this is very much weather dependant.. I hate heights, but the panoramic view of Cape Town was worth the White knuckles. The food is not to pricey considering that nothing is really cheap in the country, but it's a good price and freshly prepared. I'll be doing this every time i visit and its certainly one attraction I can't compliment enough.

Fast. Since we walked up Table Mountain it was a fast way of coming down. After the beauty and stilness of the mountai this felt very touristic. The gard tried to make some jokes, but we could hear he did so every time he made the ride.The vieuw is very nice! A great way of getting up Table Mountai for ones who can't do it walking.
Nice views over the city. Lovely views and great place to visit. Gives a great view over the Cape Town area incl. harbour. Take the H/O bus up and then join the Cableway.
Fantastic. The experience of a lifetime.Definitely a "not miss".The 360 deg views were amazing.We were so close to the magnificent terrain of the table mountain.

On a clear day, you can see forever. We lucked out (we were told) because of the gorgeous clear day and the temperate weather...also the lines weren't too bad (though they tripled behind us, so getting there early was really a good idea). Best part of the morning: my 15 year old getting to rappel a few hundred feet down the side of the cliff, then seeing him climb back up to the summit--though the whole thing took only 25 minutes, it was one of his highlights for the whole trip.
Ride is great. Views are fantastic.............take your camera and be prepared for some lovely shots both on the ascent and descent.

Terrific. Efficient, modern and rapid. Staff amazingly helpful and friendly considering the crazy number of people going up and down every day. Love the rotating platform in the cable car - gives everyone a view.
Opportune trip. Very slick operating system, we were very lucky with weather as we were in Capetown fro a short time only.

Heart ride. The cable car.think it takes a load of 68 passengers per trip and mind you the queues are long.The base of the car revolves for balance and adjusts for the strong wind.Extremely well maintained ,comforting to know as we rode up in seconds with our jaws clenched tight .The attendent was clear and courteous with tinges of humour and- the ride was over before we knew it.I don' t have to explain the view from the cable car.It was awesome though.Great restaurant above too
Spun around!!. Like going skiing but a different view and it spins as it goes up giving a 360 view of the whole area. Fantastic trip

The Best. I never been to such a cable way before....it rotates as we go up, so no matter where you stand after sometime everything will be visible, as the whole car rotates.The car is well managed and the wait time doesn't increase more than 30 mins or so.Car Parking is a bit of an issue, as parking gets full easily and you have park on road side.

A must attraction in Cape Town.. Table Mountain is not always easy to see as cloud covers it quite often so if it's clear do the aerial cableway straight away or you might miss the chance. Well worth the ride and the views are spectacular try and get there early so there is less crowds. Enjoy.

Book tickets online. Loved table mountain but I highly recommend booking tickets online as the two days we drove by, the ticket line was super long. The third day, we bought tickets online and took the email with us and we were let right in.

A must do. The challenge with going up Table Mountain is that you have to pick your day, as such one should not approach visiting Cape Town for touristing with a fixed itinerary - first chance the weather is good (clear and not too windy) you should head up the mountain. The views from the top are spectacular and the trip up in the cableway a great experience.

Prodigious. Its just that: remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree. It was everywhere you looked. From all over Cape Town you can see this mountain. And the sunset from here is amazing. There are lines to get into one of those ariel cars, but it does not really take that long and it is well worth the trip. Table Mountain is one of the 5 natural wonders of the world, so don't miss out.

Awesome attraction in Cape Town. A must do.. Super fast and efficient outfit that brings you to the top of this famous landmark in a flash! Prices were extremely reasonable (although I don't recall the rates, they can be found on the website) There's a very nice and clean cafe with a huge array of available food, snacks, drinks etc. up top with gorgeous views and also a well stocked souvenir shop nearby. A definite mist do when visiting Cape Town.

Incredible views at the top!. Parking is a little dicey--you drive part way up the mountain and then park along the narrow road where you can find a spot. Men in the probably-self-created job of parking attendant will help you maneuver into a spot for a tip. At the time of year we attended (September), lines were longer in the late morning (when we arrived), and nonexistent by the time we left (early afternoon). We lucked out with a clear, cloudless day, and the views were astounding.
On top of the world. Queues can be very long but they do move. Take a jersey no matter the weather at the bottom. The new cableway is a real treat as you spin around to see everything

Don't Miss Cable Mountain on your visit.... You do not want to miss visiting the top of Table Mountain. The views are absolutely spectacular. The fee to take the cable car to the top is about $20 USD and I can tell you it is well worth it. Make sure to check the table mountain website before heading that way. Even if you have a clear day, they will close the cable car if there are strong winds. If you have a day with good visibility and low winds you need to use it to go up there! There was poor visibility or strong wind during most of our cape town visit and we almost didn't get to visit. So if you see an opportunity take it or you may miss your chance. You can also get your tickets in advance on this same website http://www.tablemountain.net. We went first thing in the morning so we didn't have any trouble, but if you can get them ahead of time why not. Note that if you get a hop on hop off pass it will take you to the base of table mountain. Otherwise, it is a pretty cheap cab ride if you are staying near the V&A waterfront. There is a great little cafe at the top of the mountain. We had breakfast here after walking around and taking some photos. The food was very good and not too expensive. I suggest about 2-3 hours here if you're going to take in the views, snap some pictures and grab a meal or some coffee.

Awesome!. Visited Table Mountain Aerial Cableway recently & found the experience awesome.The queues are quite long, & must be even longer in high summer but the wait is well worth it.The views from the top are stunning over the whole of Capetown downtown waterfront & coastal districts.The sides of the cable car rotate, so everyone gets a good view of everything!Ingenius!Word of warning to those intrepid travellers who want to climb the mountain though!Our friends who did so, found it a much steeper harder climb than they imagined & wished they too, had taken the cableway especially on a hot day!
great. I am claustrophobic so was a little worries but the rotating floor in the cable car keeps the air moving and access to windows and the car attendant kept chatting which distracted me.

Great ride to top of Table Mountain. The cable car ride is smooth and quick. The sides of the car rotate so that everyone gets a chance at a good view. Once at the top you can walk the trails, which aren't very well marked.

Amazing!. Absolutely amazing! we pre-purchased our tickets and went early in the morning, first thing, as we had been advised it gets busy, the line was already quite long but we got through quick. Up top the views are absolutely stunning, We walked along the path and got to see the view from every side, just indescribable. On the downside, the cafe was confusing and the staff very unhelpful. Cant order your coffee until after you have picked up all your food and go to pay which meant we had to wait a while for our coffee and we had finished eating well before it was ready :( On the way back down at approximately 1130 am the wait line to get in was ENORMOUS, it looked like at least a 4 hour wait for some. Definitely go early!

Nice Ride. This is for those who would like to experience pure adrenalin. It was 5 minutes of sheer pleasure. I would recommend that when you visit Cape Town, take the Cable car. it is very nice with the 360 view of the Magnificent Cape View

Book online!. I think the best advice for the Table Mountain Cableway is to buy your ticket online! The queue for normal tickets can mean a wait of a few hours, whereas the online ticket queue is almost a straight walk through. Unfortunately this does not allow to you to bypass the other queues. Due to the gondolas having a limited capacity there are queues to board. Generally, the earlier you can get there the better as the wind can start picking up during the day. The gondolas rotate a full 360 deg so no matter where you stand in it, you should get great views on the way up.
It rotates. I was unaware that the cable car carriages rotate 360 degrees on the way up and on the way down so there is always a good spot for viewing

nice :). the experience of taking the Aerial Cableway is amazing..you can see almost Cape Town !!! Perhaps, because it is a short distance, could be a little expensive, but anywsy...If you go to Table Mountain you can't go down without taking the Aerial Cableway!!! amazing !!! :) :) :)
A Must Do!. This was a really majestic experience with a 360 degree view of Cape Town....truly breathtaking. One could the abseiling or just chill with an ice-cream while taking in the view.
Beautiful. I got to see one of the world wonders!!! Totally amazing experience i will never forget! This is a must see...

Book in advance if you can. You need good weather to do this, which means that when the mountain is clear, queues can be very long! If you buy a ticket in advance online, tickets are valid for 14 days from the initial date you choose, and it means you can by-pass the queue to buy tickets and move straight on to the one for the cable car itself. Still long, but not as bad as having to do both! Also, you can get a refund within the 14 days if you don't manage to get up there. Be aware that there will also be queues to come down so you might have to wait a while - we got to the cable car around 4.30pm and I think it was about 5.30pm by the time we got to the bottom.Brilliant views, and some nice walks on the top.

Amazing views. The trip up Table Mountain in the cable car gave you 360degree views of Table Mountain, Lion Head and Capetown. everybody gets a good look because the car rotates and gives a great view from every angle.

get your tickets online. get your ticket on line to avoid the queue and watch the weather for the area. the cableway will close if high winds for mist is expected so if you intend to visit for a couple of hours or more you could be disappointed.
Amazing place, priced for tourists. A unique experience and something you just have to do, but if you're local, it is expensive. Save 10% and avoid the queues by booking online in advance.

The Mountain. Table Mountain is lovingly referred to as "the mountain" by locals, and when you travel up by cable car you will feel like there is no other mountain in the world. Views to make you gasp, services to be proud of and energy that will leave you completely happy. Book in advance to avoid spending too much time time in the line.

Scary great ride.. The cable car is one of the newer rotating ones - but there are no cable support towers. The ride is straight up the mountain. Views are great - with some good long and short paths at the top.
Great views. This was a great thing to do in a clear dy! The view from the top are fabulous! It is cool up there so don't forget to bring a jacket! Clouds roll in quickly so keep an eye on the sky?
Lovely views. Be advised the cable cars frequently shut down due to high winds. The best time to go is in the morning. It was a bit crowded, long lines to get tickets and to go up on the cable car.

Quick Trip Up!. The cableway to Table Mountain was great. It fits so many people in this one cart and the floor rotates so no one can hog the views! The line can get long going up and coming down but well worth the wait! Also the cableway is pretty fast!
Fly away!. Get there early, the que can be quite long. Find out about the weather coz sometimes they close it down when it's so wind. It's amazing!!!

Most extraordinary Views. No trip to CT is complete without a visit to Table Mountain. Two pieces of advice 1. Book online ahead of time. 2. Go early! (Like 8:00-8:30am). If you have a clear day, race to go because all the tourists will follow you. A queue of 3 hours is not uncommon! The 4 minute ride to the top is definitely worth it. The views go forever! If you suffer from vertigo, be aware....it's very high up (1076 metres or 3000 feet). Enjoy!!

so romantic. a visit to cape town isn't the same without doing this trip. Breathtaking views and even better we got engaged! Makesure you go when the weather is fine and go as soon as possible as the weather changes very quickly. If you have time we wish we had hiked up as hat looked wonderful but go with an organised guide

long queue but worth it. Here's my tips:On your first clear day get up very early and head to the mountainBefore you set off check the website (not matter how good the weather is in Town) to make sure the cableway is openMake sure you have plenty of time - you WILL have to queueBuy your ticket online before you set off - this will save you loads of time queuingTake water, sun block and sensible shoes - the African sun combined with the wind will dehydrate and burn you very quickly.The red line on the city sight seeing bus will take to there if you want to avoid taxi fares and problems parkingThe gondola rotates so don't worry about where you are standing you will get a mountain and a city view and some great picturesTake a picnic so you can have a walk on one on the trails up there and enjoy the view at leisureBe prepared for the fact that the 'Devils Table Cloth' and the 'Cape doctor' may conspire against youGood Luck

Showcase of Africa. Table Mountain is amazing. The views are breathtaking and sells the City for all it's beauty. It's free for your birthday and children under 4, so we saved a bit. Always take a jacket, sunblock and comfortable shoes. The experience is spectacular so take a good camera. Nothing else comes close to this in terms of tourist attractions.

Buy tickets in advance and bring a jacket!. You really should buy tickets in advance to avoid a potential long queue. Remember, if you drive yourself you will probably have to park far away. Also remember that if you take a taxi they will over charge you. If not on the way there, then definitely on the way back! Check their website before you head there and bring a jacket nonetheless. The tablecloth came rolling in as we reached the top and the temperature there is significantly lower than in the city. The winds do get quite strong very quickly, so trousers are advised just in case.The views ARE breathtaking and you should visit! The cable car ride is also very enjoyable.

The way up. We took a taxi from the CBD to the cableway. Lines can be very, very long but we encountered none...the wind was whipping the top of the mountain and the "tablecloth" was settling in. The cable car rotates so you get a 360 view on the way up and down which is just wonderful. You could hike, but then you'd miss this exquisite 5 min ride of a lifetime.

Great but be prepared to queue. We had ordered tickets on line but still had to queue for almost an hour. Really long queues if you wanted to buy tickets there. However an incredible experience and you can't really miss it if you go to Cape town. We went using the hop on hop off bus tour which saved any parking problems. They also sell tickets if you have not booked them on line
Wonderful experience. Amazing trip to the top and the most wonderful views of Cape Town and surrounding area. Make sure you have tickets in advance to avoid long lineups.

Mountain shrouded in cloud. We arrived in Capetown and could see Table Mountain clearly, wish we had gone up straightaway as the next two days it was shrouded in cloud. We decided to go up on our last day and although cloudy and windy, it still was worth the visit!

Amazing view. Buy tickets online and avoid the queue! You can even download your tickets on your smartphone and they just scan it, so you don't need access to a printer. When we got there it was more than 2 hours wait to purchase the tickets. Having bought our tickets online we went right through. Just make sure you go to the correct line.If you don't want to walk too far I also suggest that you park at the information/ entrance to park, at the bottom of the mountain, and take a taxi or the citybus. Just be aware that you need a card to use the bus and you cannot buy it on the bus. Taxi cost R30. There is not a lot of parking available close by if it is busy. The view at the top is incredibly beautiful. There are a few walks at the top of the mountain and you see the area from all sides.Going up, the bottom of the cable car rotates and it gives everybody a 360 degree view. The operator is very friendly and quite witty.The restaurant at the top is also very good with a nice selection of food and drinks.I think it is something you must do and worth the effort even if you have to wait for some time.

great views, pretty location on the top. There was not as much of a wait as I had feared, and it was definitedly worth going up, walking around (the shorter route) and looking at the views. Indeed, felt like being on a table at the top of the world. Great service, made one feel comfortable.
What a view. cablecar rotates as you go up or down; ride approx. 3 mins; weather dependence so if it is a nice day go up the mountain

Worth doing. Unfortunately on the afternoon I went on the cableway there was a lot of mist around that affected the view. On the plus side there was no queues. It was still very enjoyable and I liked the way the cable car rotated as it moved. I also enjoyed the walks at the top of the mountain with the good quality paths. I got to the cableway station using the red hop on/off city sightseeing bus which has a stop there.
the best cableway so far for me. cableway is excellent. it is very fast. takes you to the top in no time. base of the cable way rotates to give 360* view.

Great views of Cape Town and the ocean.. Excellent walks on the Table Mountain with great views and opportunities for photographs.Book your cable car tickets in advance if you dont want to wait the better part of an hour in the queue.
Must do in Cape town. Great views, lovely walks on the top, weather can close in quickly but that's all part of it. Get up there early, have a coffee at the cafe/restaurant.

Views to die for. The trip down the gondola was quick but worth it. The gondola rotates and gives every traveller a 360 degree look of the peninsula. Be aware that it is an EXTREMELY popular destination and it would be good to get their early in the morning. My advice would be to climb up Platteklip Gorge and ride down.

Do not miss it!. We were lucky that the weather/fog cleared up as we were up at the top. We used the cableway around 3pm, which seemed a great time because the line was much mush shorter than the crazy morning line we saw passing by with the bus.

so far the best place i visited. Cape town is by far the best place I visited so far. It is a must see. Table mountain is just beautiful and scenic. There is wild life and rooibos tea bushes everywhere. The view of the cape from the mountain is breathtaking.
You can have lunch and have a look at the gift shop up there as well.

Mountain top high. Very comparable to Monserrat in Spain, but the view from the top was even better, as you could see the city and the curving bay...really a special site. The only funicular that i have seen that has a floor that rotates, so that everyone has a front row eat for a part of the trip up. Come early and avoid the crowds, wear layered clothing, because a the bottom, you may be hot and at the top, expect to be cooler to cold.

Up Table Mountain. Well worth the cost - and even worth the wait. This is a major tourist attraction and so you need to appreciate that there will be queues and we were probably waiting for over an hour from arrival at the bottom ststaion to getting into the cable car - but the ride was more than worth the wait.

Don't miss this!. We thoroughly enjoyed our day on Table Mountain. The views are incredibly beautiful. We had a delicious lunch at the restaurant and enjoyed browsing the gift shop which had some very unique and delightful treasures. There were lots of dassies lounging on the rocks as well as many beautiful birds. This is a must see!
3 hour waiting. you bettter hike because it is faster.To many tourists, just to less elevators.3hours is to long.vieuw is nice

If the weather is good you must do this!. A fantastic experience and given the changeable weather conditions, it's well worth taking the opportunity to visit if the weather is good. We went on a crystal blue day with no breeze and it was awe-inspiring. DO BOOK TICKETS ONLINE as you'll save yourself a lot of time in queuing. The view from the cableway is fantastic and whereever you are in the car you'll get a 360 view as it rotates.
Do not take the walk / steps. This tram is so cool. It spins on the way up and down so everyone gets a great view w/o moving around. Great idea!

Awesome experience. Was an overall thrilling experience. Nothing bad to say except the weather ruined visibility on one side of the mountain, which was fie as we were still able to see the fantastic ocean and city.

An absolute must. We were lucky to be in Capetown just after they had had a number of days of strong winds (the cable car won't run on those days). The day was also crystal clear and the views were spectacular! Allow a bit of time to do this because you need to queue to go up in the lift, then queue to go up in the cable car, then spend some time walking around at the top (we only had about 20 mins ... not enough!), then you have to queue to get back down again. There is a restaurant at the top which I'm sure would be lovely to eat at, and I noticed that you could also organise to abseil down part of the mountain (I didn't have time unfortunately). But no matter how much (or little) time you have, make this one of your stops in Capetown.

Table Mtn Cable. Highly recommend this Natural Wonder. The cable car rotates so everyone gets a great view during the ride. Nice walking/hiking on the top of the Mountain and the views are absolutely breathtaking. Don't let morning clouds deter you - I waited until 1PM and grabbed a cab. Had the best afternoon viewing.

Head in the Clouds?. The cable trip is great but check forecasts and start early to avoid A) disappointment if the cloud is down and B) A long line in the heat if others get there before you. Views are fantastic and the variety of plants due to its climate are amazing.

Feeling Like Your On Top of the World. The aerial tram ride is quite an adventure as the tram car revolves to offer views from all sides. Upon arrival at the top you are offered good walking paths to view Cape Town and the beautiful shore lines and mountain vistas all around. The restaurant and gift shop are well equipped and we were lucky to have beautiful weather. We highly recommend buying your tram passes online to beat the ticket lines. Parking is a hassle because you have to park on the side of the road. The hop on/off red bus comes by often, as do the tour buses. The tram cars hold 65 people so you don't have to wait too long once you have your ticket.

My visit to Cape Town. Visit this beautiful mother city, the view from the top of table mountain is awesome. Do not miss the V & A Waterfront and a trip on the hop on hop off touring the city.You will love it. Njoy the great food at the lovely restaurants from curries to fries, bunnies, rotis, etc.Most definately will go back there. A city never to be missed on your holiday trip.

A unique experience. After being on many gondolas, this was quite a treat because it held 64 people and you don't have to worry about who gets on first or last because the floor of the gondola rotates as you are ascending to the top or bottom! A thrill!

Breakfast on Table Mountain. A must for all visitors to Cape Town. We were lucky to have a beautiful, clear and sunny day. We arrived fairly early in the morning, so the queues were not too long and we didn't have to wait for more than a few minutes. The restaurant was adequate and we enjoyed our breakfast outside on the top. The guide was knowledgeable and interesting. Parking was restricted and must be a problem in busier times.

Great service!. We bought the tickets a part of our Hop on Hop Off sightseeing tour, it's a great service. The queues were not too bad but we visited midweek and I would recommend going early if possible. As the cable car rotates everyone gets a good view. ts so quick up and down - great amenity!

Awe inspiring. This has to be on everyone's "Bucket List". Try to get there early in the morning to avoid the long queue's and beat the wind before it builds in the PM. The views will stay with you forever.

Mind blowing view. I have to say I was surprised at the view from the top...expected great view of city, which I got, but view south towards cape point was breathtaking! Give yourself plenty of time to hike the trails on top!
A special place...... This is truly a beautiful way to get a panoramic view of Cape Town. The facilities on top of the mountain are adequate - it was very busy though. A must for all visitors.
Fun. Treat yourself and take the tram to the top. Keep your camera ready as the rotating tram will give you spectacular views.

Worth the wait. The line to get onto the Cable car was massive on the day we went because the mountain had been in cloud for a few days prior. Just a tip - the queue is divided into those that have purchased a ticket prior online and those that haven't. The 'have-nots' line was a 45 minute wait to purchase a ticket and then another 40 minute wait to get onto the cable car. We just purchased tickets on our phone and skipped that extra queue. If you don't have phone data over there then I highly recommend purchasing at the hotel before you go! After the wait the actual Cable Car was pretty good. Nice views and a rotating deck so that everyone got to see all angles. Overall, the cable was nothing compared to the actual view at the top of the mountain - it is so beautiful. You can wander around here or sit on the edge for hours just soaking it up. Take a jacket though because it was about 10 degrees colder at the top than it was at the bottom!

Cable Car Rotates. I hiked up Table Mountain and rode the cable car down (I would recommend that to anyone especially as the wait for the cable car up was easily over an hour, going down 15 minutes). I liked the fact the cable car rotated so there "wasn't a bad seat in the house" so to speak.

fun way to the top and great photo opportunities. Unless you are an avid hiker, I would recommend taking the cableway to the top of Table Mountain. The car rotates so everyone gets the same view opportunities. My only suggestion would be to start your day with this as the crowds are overwhelming. We had perfect weather when we went so the view was incredible.
Well run!. The employees work hard and the crowds are well controlled with friendliness. This is a good thing because unruly crowds would not be liked by anyone at all!

Book in advance - even then the wait is long, but well worth it!. We arrived at the Lower Station by cab. Other options are the Red Hop On/Off bus, other tour groups, or by private vehicle - but be warned you'll have to park miles away and walk up to the station. The Cableway starts at 8 am, last car down is at 7 pm. Our pre-paid ticket was for a morning trip (between 8 am and 1 pm) although I don't think they're very strict about beind back down by1 pm as there are often lengthy waits. You will want to spend at least a couple of hours exploring the top - more if you elect to take the longer walks slightly off the main walkways.Booking on-line is highly recommended, as you will find yourself in a much shorter queue - but a fair wait nevertheless. Crowd control and organisation is good. There are shady umbrellas and water vapour sprays to keep you cool, but even so we saw a lot of people without pre-paid tickets forced to wait in a long line in the hot sun. Each cab can carry up to 65 people. The floor revolves very slowly (about one revolution each way). It is steep, scary and spectacular. Iconic Table Mountain can be seen from every part of Cape Town, but believe me seeing Cape Town and environs from the top Table Mountain is an experience you shouldn't miss! It's awe-inspiring.We watched enthusiastic groups of young tourists electing to abseil down the mountain - great viewing experience but I certainly wouldn't want to do it myself!There are wonderful walking paths, viewing decks and terraces all over the top of this massive plateau. Excellent information plaques about flora and fauna, topography, climate, history etc etc are scattered along the way. You can participate in a free guided tour - we listened in to snippets and they seemed informative. However using the information provided along the way should give you an excellent insight into Table Mountain.There is a very pleasant cafe/self service restaurant with inside and outside seating, as well as the ubiquitous gift shop (top and bottom of the Cableway).
An attraction with cable. Vieuw is magnificient. I liked the turning car system which allows you to see 360 degrees around you! I disliked the crowded atmosphere.

60th Birthday treat. What a pleasure to visit Table Mountain for my birthday treat. My only gripe was that my husband got his free birthday treat because the cable car was closed for his birthday, but when we went for my 60th a day after my birthday I was told it was past the date and they were open on that day so had to pay pensioners price - I finally qualified for some discount!
An all round experience. Especially liked the 360 degree rotation so that everyone was able to take the best view photographs.

capetown. Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark overlooking the city of Cape Town in South Africa, and is featured in the Flag of Cape Town .city views from top is very good. best place to take photograph of capetownTable Mountain's status as one of the New7Wonders of Nature .

a little scary, but.... Yes, a bit scary , but well worth it once you get to the top! Beautiful vistas in every direction! Then whether you take a short stroll or a longer hike on the top(as we did)..be prepared for the weather to change quickly, as it often does!

Christmas Day visit to Table Mountain. I got up early on Christmas morning and drove to Table Mountain to secure a good parking space and avoid any queues. I've visited Table Mountain on two other trips to Cape Town, but this was more special as it was Christmas Day. If possible book your tickets in advance to avoid queuesThe cable car may be closed due to bad weather, and as Cape Town is prone to strong winds, this can happen quite frequently. You can always go on line or phone ahead to check if the cable car station is open. It was the perfect day on Christmas morning, not a cloud in the sky or a breath of wind. The staff wore Santa hats and it wasn't as busy as on normal days.The views are great from Table Mountain in all directions and you can spend as little or as less time as you wish. Sunsets from there are breathtaking and particuarly if the cloud comes in like a tablecloth.A perfect start to my Christmas Day.
Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. World class facilities, magnificent views, lovely walks and views to die for!! Pre-booking a great advantage!
Must do. We were unfortunate in that it was very misty when we went there....be aware it often is and you see very little. It can be very cold up there even in spring, mufflers and jackets are a must

Great views!. Get your tickets online in advance to avoid the queues. Hiking up to the top would not be for the faint of heart. Beautiful, panoramic vistas of the entire area as well as ovely flora and fauna. A must see in Capetown. I would do this at the beginning of your stay to get an overall orientation of the area.

Get it right people. As one of South Africa's premier tourist attractions it would be fair to expect a little more in the way of customer focus. Don't go on a busy day or a hot day or a Sunday or a holiday because if you do you will stand in the sun for hours waiting to get on the cable car. To add to the frustration, anyone who has had the foresight to buy their ticket online or any one of the crowds of people that get off the red hop on hop off bus will simply circumvent the queue and go in front of you even if you have been standing in the ticket queue for hours. Lesson. If you are going to go, buy your ticket in advance. You will still have a LONG wait but you can thumb your nose as the poor sods in the queue on the other side of the road. Once you do get to the top the restaurant is second rate, there is not enough seating and the toilets are disgusting. Disappointing really. Pick your time. A cool day, early morning or late afternoon, take water, enjoy the spectacular view. If you are young and fit try walking down. Not for the faint hearted though, thee have been deaths form heatstroke. A better booking system sorely needed. A quota system or something similar would make the experience more pleasant.

Great views!. Cable car rotates while you go up which gives you incredible views no matter where you're standing. We got there around 8:30am during the week and did not have to wait to buy tickets nor to get on the cable. The views from the top are breathtaking and totally worth the $10 or $20 that they charge. Table mountain cafe is a little over priced compared to other Cape Town restaurants but still pretty cheap when putting it into perpesctive as to such a tourist area. Definitely check website the day you plan on going as the cablecars do close often due to wind, etc.

Stairway to heaven. Well worth the time. Get there either early or late, and prebook the tickets, the queue has sign posts for up to 2 hours wait! The revolving gondola lets everyone get a view over the town as you climb up but the experience at the top is magic. You could spend a day here, watching the clouds roll by, the panorama of the city, and the walks are great- good shoes, wind breaker and water, but really worth it.
beautiful. efficient cable car, friendly staff and amazing views, definitely on the must see list when visiting cape town

Glad we pre-booked!. Pre booked open tickets online, glad we did, queues were very long for the ticket booths. Waited approx 1hr to get on cable car, but coming down only about 10mins. Had to park about 1/2 mile from the car park as it was full but not a problem as we were able to walk. View from the top were great, could have spent hours following the trails.

Great, but book ahead.. Buy your tickets before you arrive!The best advice I’d give about this otherwise wonderful attraction is to buy your tickets beforehand. And if, for some reason you can’t, buy them on your phone while you’re in the long queue.Also, check the website to see if it’s open because often it’s closed due to high winds.We first drove past at approx. 10am and found a massive queue so we drove into the city and did a few other things. We then returned at about 3pm and found a shorter (but still long) queue. There’s one line for tickets and another line for people who’ve already bought them so we quickly bought some online and jumped part of the queue.The views were amazing and there were plenty of walks up on the ‘table’. There’s decent food and bathroom facilities up on the top although be aware that it can be quite hot (and cold) up there so bring a hat, sunscreen and a jumper.

Tourist thing to do that is worth the effort. Get your tickets online before you travel to beat the queues. Once on the station the process is quick and you are whisked up to the top of the 1100m mountain for stunning views, beautiful flora and a crisp wind. Lots of people up there but still worth seeing the whole Cape Peninsula from one vantage point.
You must do this!. The Table Mountain Cable way is 'n must experience for every Capetonian and for every visitor. If you wasn't on Table Mountain yet- You gonna miss out on the beauty of the Cape.

A must do. If you get a clear day, it is very beautiful and informative to go up to the top and understand the lay out of the area, see many wild proteas and other flowers and a bit of wild life. The Cable ride is brief and not worrisome, even if you have fear of heights.
Buy tickets online. We waited 45 minutes in line to get tickets and you could have walked straight in if you bought them online first. Amateur mistake on my part!
Clean and well organised. The car rotates slowly so that all passengers get a great view. The cableway buildings are clean. The ticketing process is well organised

Now easier to get to Cableway. There is a new MyCiti bus service directly to the lower Cableway station.The buses are modern and comfortable.So you can save yourself taxi fares and parking problems by using this.For more info : myciti.org.za/en/routes/tourist-routes

A traveller's must. A wonderful experience, the cable car floor rotates so that the magnificent views in all directions can be seen. At the top are a series of short and longer walks with good explanatory information. The shorter walks are paved making them wheelchair accessible. Obviously attracting huge numbers of visitors it is good to go early to avoid the crowds. Visibility tends to be better in the morning too but pick a sunny day if you can.

Stunning views. Visited the Mountain drove with Hop on Hop off buss. Amazing views and lovely restaurant on top. Enjoyed a delicicious mug of Hot chocolate.. Safe transport with cable car..and luckily no long ques for tickets.

Amazing views. We postponed our arranged morning trip up the mountain because of low cloud and went later in the day. We were electing a big queue but were pleasantly surprised to more or less get straight on board. The revolving feature of the cabin ensures everyone on board gets a good view during the ascent. Once on top there are clear pathways with excellent vantage points for lots of photos!
Good Value for Money. Huge queues and difficulty parking but a magical view. The revolving floor allows everyone to see the view as the gondola travels up or down the mountain.
Watch Your Change. Be careful of the charming ticket officers. Ours used her friendly nature to put us off our guard and short-change us by 40 rand.

Spectacular views. Plan on several hours for this trip to the top of Table Mountain with stunning views of the city and the Atlantic coastline. Best way to get there is to take the red line on the City Sightseeing route. They deliver you right to the cable car terminal. Also, best to buy your cable car tickets from the bus company in order to avoid standing in line at the cable car terminal. You can spend an hour or a day exploring on the top of the mountain. Excellent history and natural information available on signboards along the trails. Cafe and restrooms available at the top of the mountain. Cable car may be closed in bad weather. Check first.

From the Table Top Via Cableway. We were able to get to the top in calm winds and with the exception of one tablecloth cloud we could see down. We were with a private guide who was well informed. Vegetation on the top of the mountain was very interesting. We only hiked a few of the many mountain top trails. There are many trails to hike up to the top from easy to very strenuous. We chose the cableway for time and easy. Well worth the cost and time to see the mountain and the views of Cape Town and the coast.

Only on a clear day. You have to time your trip up as if there is too much wind the car doesn't go and if it's too cloudy you won't see anything. It is a steep ride to the top and the floor of the car rotates 360 degrees during ascent and descent so there is no need to make a rush for the front or the back. There's not a lot to do at the top except walk a bit and have something to eat in the restaurant, which is good value. You get excellent views over Cape Town from the top and watch out for the adorable little dassies.
Such fun and extraordinary views!. This is a must do when you visit Cape Town! The views are amazing!! Allow time for long lines if it is a clear and sunny day!

Must see. Like all the travel books tell you, if the weather is good, don't delay. Go. It's all that the books tell you. Very crowded and parking is tough. It's a long walk to the cable car sometimes. Ticket booth ladies said that 3 pm is the best time to visit for crowds but you chance the weather changing. Even moderate winds can shutdown the cable car.

Awesome!. The ride up was exhilarating but be sure to carry warm covering as it can get very cold and windy at the top of the mountain at least in September when we visited. The views are just breathtaking. Definitely must do.A small tip - buy your tickets online in advance to avoid the long queues to purchase the tickets as you have to queue again to board the cable car. The whole process can take up to 2 hours on a very busy day. The earlier in the day the better too.
Don't miss this. The lines were long but this is so worth the ride up and the view while up there! Take time to just sit on a rock and look out over the sea in every angle.

Awesome view from the gondola!. There can be quite a line for the gondola so you want to be sure & get there as early as you can in the morning. It's probably best not to go on a weekend also if you can help it. That said, you really should go on it if you are in Cape Town & the weather is good. The view while you are going up is spectacular! It rotates around so that you can see more than one angle of the view. It is terrific. They take your picture just before you get on & when you come down you can buy it if you want to see what you look like in a gondola. It's a fun memento. We went & I thought it might be crowded & claustrophobic but it was not like that at all. We were on the outside edge by the windows looking out & that is absolutely necessary for the view. When you come down there will be much more room in the gondola.

Gorgeous views of Cape Town. Although it was nice and sunny when we visited, the temperature dips at the top as the sun goes down. We went up around 5.30pm and came down at 7pm. It was a truly magical experience watching a gorgeous sun set at the top of the mountain and enjoying the twinkling city lights as we were coming down.

Must do in Capetown. On a clear day you can get great views of the city bowl of Capetown. The day we were there there were a lot of clouds, but they started burn off as the day went on and we were able to get some nice photos.There is a restaurant up there, as well as some gift shops to buy souvenirs.

worth the money. we were struck for time and partly too lazy to walk up, so we opted for the cable cars. well worth the money if you can hack it. 360 spinning cable cars allows for views all over. well worth the extra bit of money :)

great views. We were visiting on a tight time frame so chose not to walk up. The cable car rotates as you go up which is an excellent idea as everyone gets to see the 360 degree view. There are sections of the window that are open which is also a brilliant idea especially for photographs.

Best cable car ever!!. Just brilliant. The floor rotates so everyone gets a 360 view. Another must do. We took it up in the afternoon and down at 7.00pm so got the benefit of seeing the vista in the great afternoon light and then the lovely night lights.

What a view. Take the Cable Mountain Cableway for a late afternoon visit. The sunset from the top of the mountain is brilliant. We normally take a cheese platter and some of Cape Town's fine wines with us and then you can experience best of both world's on top of the mountain. While enjoying a nice wine you can see the beautiful Cape Harbour, the city of Cape Town and the surrounding towns in day light as well as in the evening when all the lights are switched on. This is a must do trip for everyone visiting Cape Town.

Spectacular!. If you do one thing in Cape Town, you have to go to the top of Table Mountain, and using the cable car is by far the easiest and most comfortable way to do it. The views from the top are totally breathtaking, undoubtedly a photographer's dream, and you could easily spend a while at the top taking in the view out to the Ocean.

A must in Cape Town. The cable car revolves as it moves up and don the mountain, Great for everyone to see all round. The view from the top is really good and something not to missed. We went on our first full day in Cape Town as the weather was good. The other two days the weather was cloudy and the Cableway was not operating, well you can not see anything in the mist. So go early in your visit. We took the Red Tourist bus that stops at the cable way, so had a great view of the city then carried on around the city.

Don't hold on to the sides!. We arrived to Cape Town on a perfectly cloudless day, and wanted to take advantage of the views from atop Table Mountain. Our son and his friends hiked up, but we knew we would not manage, so we bought our tickets for the cableway. It is an engineering marvel! Be aware that you do not need to scramble for position in the car, as the floor rotates throughout the ascent. I do not have great balance, but the rotation was slow enough for me to manage with absolutely no issues. The views were spectacular, and photo ops abound (especially as you rotate past the open windows).
Great Experience. Best to hike up and take Cable down. The way the cable car turns with open windows part way is perfect so everyone gets a great view.

Excellent. What a spectacular view.
We managed to get a gap in the terrible weather the day we decided to go up table mountain.
Thankfully we decided against the walk up and got the cable car, it was very worthwhile!
It is a must do! Would visit again no problem!
A Wow From All Perspectives. The ride to the top is worthy of the walk up above! A rotating floor and open windows make the viewing quite exciting...everyone gets a great view in the circular car.
Stunning!. Can't go to Cape Town and not visit Table Mountain! Sun was shinning and mountain offers views and photo ops in all directions.

A must do!. It’s a must visit in Cape Town. Two Revolving cars provide transportation to the top of the Table Mountain. The cable car spins at the time that goes up. This way you end up seeing everything. The trip takes approximately 4-5 minutes and meanwhile you enjoy spectacular views.
amazing view. The cable car rotated so you had a view from all directions. There is a pleasant walk, gift shop and restaurant at the top.

Great views. We went midday in August and the line was not that long. We had purchased tickets online in advance but it was not necessary. We were told the line was very long first thing that morning. It was very cold on top on the day we went but we have heard that other days it was much warmer - best to bring a jacket/hat in case in is a lot colder on top as compared to at the bottom. Wonderful views of Capetown if there is a clear sky. We caught a taxi when we came down as it had just dropped someone off. We didn't see an area where taxis waited to take people back.

Beautiful views. We went midday in August and the line was not that long. We had purchased tickets online in advance but it was not necessary. We were told the line was very long first thing in the morning. It was very cold on top on the day we went but we have heard that other days it was much warmer - best to bring a jacket/hat in case in is a lot colder on top as compared to at the bottom.

Amazing views on a clear day. Buy your ticket on-line in advance, or get there early. It's easy to understand why this is a not-to-be missed attraction in Cape Town. The views on a clear day are amazing!

the easier way to get to the top of table mountain. love the fact that it rotates so that everyone gets a 360 degree view while going up or coming down. try getting in first to get a place near the window

Birds eye view of a Cape Town. Catch the cable way up to the top of the mountain , walk along the many trails and look down on the Mother City. Always take something warm as it can get surprisingly cold, wet and windy up there.

spectacular. We arrived on a very busy Saturday after a previous cloudy day. Although a long wait to get to the cable car, the car ride and the views made it worthwhile. Incredible scenery. One small criticism of the cafe was how difficult it made buying food! Nothing explained and we were left wandering for a while trying to figure out the strange queuing system. And being British we normally know how to queue really well!

One of the Natural wonders in the worlf. What a view from the top of this mountain. When you reach the top via a cable car the top of the mountain is flat and you have breathtaking views of Cape Town, etc. Must include this in your trip to Cape Town.

If you are in Cape Town and haven't been to the Table Mountain then you are missing something!. The best way to reach at the top is through the Cable way. ZAR 215 for both ways is not too expensive and super convenient as well since it takes just 5 minutes either way. The cable car rotates as well so that no one misses any particular view from any angle while you onboard. Respect the nature when you are up there and keep it clean and do not pluck flowers etc. For me, it was certainly a great experience .. dont miss eating at the Mountain Cafe too :) If the season is not busy then you can cover the trip and come back within 2 hours as well.

Fantastic, beautiful a must see!. Unbelievable experience. Beautiful clean and very safe. A must see for young and old. Well kept gardens and restuarant very affordable and lots of different food to choose from. Very friendly and helpfull workers. Night time visit also very good and beautiful to see sunset.

cable travel. This is a very relaxing way to start your amazing day to the top of the mountain. The cable car slowly turns 360 degree giving all clients that incredible view on their way to the top. This overall view can only be seen from the cable car. A must
A spining cableway...who would have thought. All thought the line was long, it was well worth the wait...Because the cable car spins (slowly) while you are going up, everyone gets an amazing view!
The easy way to Table Mountaid. A very nice first time trip up Table Mountain. The floor rotates so you get a view from all directions on your way up and down.

Almost missed the last one!. They should tell visitors about the time of the last cablecar! you can't know how much time u gonna spend on the mountain (and u can spend a full day! belive me!).. 2 hikers told us there was an announcement but we didn't hear anything!lucky for us we made it... If u miss it it's a 2 hours walk down! (in the dark)..

Packed but worthwhile. The crowds moved fairly fast and the floor revolves as you ascend so everyone gets a chance to see the view. That is unless you are short and stuck in the middle. Value is ok and a discount for a Wildcard. It's something you are unlikely to miss in Cape Town.

Lucky to Walk Right On. We were very lucky to have a clear day to ride the cableway to the top of Table Mountain. From other posts it seems that on clear days the lines can be quite long but we must have just hit it right as we walked up - bought our tickets - and boarded for the top with no waiting.

Revolving Floor Great Reviews. Great Views for all as the floor revolves 360 degrees. I love this city, the weather was fantastic. We love to walk and hike, so this was an unexpected surprise to be able to get some walking in while on this type of holiday, great trails from the top.
wheelchair accessible and great views all the way.. Lift staff were very helpful when our guide forgot the tickets! Be aware of the turning floor for all round visibility.

Cableway car turns around. The most interesting thing about this ride up to the top of Table Mountain is that the floor of the car turns 360 degrees during the trip. So everyone has a view of all directions! Makes for a fun ride up and no pushing or shoving for a view!

Breath-taking Views Await at the Top. On a sunny, clear day there is no better outdoor activity in Cape Town than to take the Aerial Cableway to the top of Table Mountain! There are countless walking/hiking trails once you get the top that afford you uninterrupted and spectacular views of Cape Town and the surrounding environs. There is a free 30-minute orientation tour of Table Mountain that is offered every hour and is a great way to get some basic background and lay of the land. There is a self-service restaurant with pretty decent food options at reasonable prices. Also, the souvenir shop (if you are so inclined) is reasonably priced (we saw many items elsewhere during our visit for 50-100 Rand more per item). Parking is relatively easy to find on the hillside drive en route to the Aerial Cableway. Overall, a great experience.

Moving floors. You can't argue that the views from the cable car are amazing. And everyone gets a chance for a photo opportunity as the floors rotate 360 degrees which for me was mildly terrifying! The easiest way to get to the summit of table mountain. Next time, I might try the hike down.

Why Hike Table Mountain. ...when the aerial cableway offers such a beautiful (and breath taking) ride to the Table Mountain summit??? This ride offers 360 degree views of beautiful Cape Town and the ocean ...and to get 360 degrees you don't even have to turn your head because the cars themselves revolve! This ride is well worth the wait ...with only one problem: it's too short!! You're on the mountain before you know it. Don't visit Cape Town without a trip on the Cableway!

Panoramic, Outstanding views. Whether the weather is spectacular, or moody and misty, Table Mountain is a must on your trip to Cape Town. There is a charming restaurant/tea room at the top, or you can take your own picnic. We walked up the mountain and took the cable car down - so we had the best of both worlds! There is a good reason that Table Mountain has been voted one of the new world wonders - it is wonderful.

Table mountain. Awesome views from Capetowns most noted attraction. High number of visitors considering it is out of season so suspect long queues in peak tourist season but the wait will be worth it. If you are here, it is a must do.

A great experience. A truly magnificent ride with spectacular views of Cape Town and its surrounds (even Robben island can be seen). Try pick out the the various attractions of CT from above. The cableway is quite high and the journey takes under 10mins - not for those afraid of heights. The cable cars rotate for a truly panoramic view, it is reasonably priced at R250 per adult and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

No cloud!. Fantastic experience - Day 2 after annual maintenance. Calendar card with revolving floor was excellent - an all round view on the way up and on the way down. No cloud and incredible views.

Spectacular View. We were told that the view from the top of Table Mountain was an absolute must-see in Cape Town and that advice was certainly no exaggeration. We decided to go there before lunch as the day was very clear and although there was a slight wait to board the cable car when we arrived, the lines moved smoothly and were well organized. The cable cars have a revolving floor, so on your way up you have a 360 degree view of the surrounds. Upon alighting the choice is yours. We wandered the paths for about 2 hours and enjoyed the breath-taking scenery. We were extremely fortunate as well as we were treated to seeing a group of inquisitive dassies scampering quite close to us on the rocks below. Advice... If at all possible choose to go while the weather is clear.
Cable car. Unfortunately, the weather was against us, the cable car was cancelled due to the high winds, and it was icey cold that day.
splendid. A magnificent ride , spectacular views of capetown , a world famous cableway , reasonably priced , very efficiently run .

Panoramic, fast way up the mountain. If you are not up for hiking up, you could take the cable car. It was very nice, and the views were spectacular. Everybody get the chance to see everything, as it rotates inside. You could pay with cash or card, one way or round trip tickets available. They were organized neatly.
Fantastic view of Cape Town. What a great view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. I'm afraid of heights but it didn't stop me taking the steep cable ride to the top. Well worth it
Beautiful view. Gorgeous view of Capetown from above. Cable ride was quick and windows were open to take pix of bottom and top

Nice ride. This is a great ride which to take on the way down after a hike up Table Mountain. The cabin rotates to give all a good view of the surrounds. Slightly expensive perhaps - it is often much cooler at the top so take some warm clothes.

Magnificent Sunset. We were told that we must take this cable car ride to the top because it would be a Magnificent Sunset, the best we have ever seen. Well, we grew up and live on the west coast of Florida and have seen hundreds of beautiful sunsets. We love going to California, and making sure that we enjoy the sunset. So it was with anticipation, but yet skepticism that we were going to see the "best ever". Well, they were right, that is the best sunset we have even seen. Do it. Enjoy. Just don't miss the last cable down.

You spin me round. We used the cable car as part of our visit to the top. The cable car rotates which is a little odd to start with but means everyone gets a chance to take photos or just enjoy the breathtaking views.

Best view in Cape Town. The cable car is something out of this world, the rotating floor is great because you get a 360 degree view of the city and the mountain! A must do for all visitors and locals!

Very smooth. Great both up and down. Sit on one of the two black benches if you don't like heights or the movement as the rest of the inside rotates so everyone can see the views. It was very smooth and quick.
Ride up the mountain. The revolving cars are the best.Safe and fast the ride is very smooth and beautiful,not to miss in capetown

Mountain topo. Very efficient and views superb. If you have a clear day take it as cloud can be a problem so you cannot guarantee being able to visit.Out of season no queues for tickets or entry but by the length of the queue instructions assume in season a bit of a wait so buy in advance online though you still may have to queue.
Worth standing in line for 40 minutes. Views from the top are fantastic. We visited on a clear day and an hour wasn't long enough. We could have spent more time at the top.

Great way to travel to the table of the world. Fantastic 3 minutes of my life. Its safe, the rotating cabin gives you a 360 view and it's a very professional service. Feels like your leaving the earth on a space ship up the table.

Rotation? wow. This cableway was really cool. The floor rotates, and allows everybody to get a good picture of everything around. you don't have to worry about getting a good spot when you get in. It's better than the cable car in Rio de Janeiro (though Rio's view is considerably different, tbh... :-) I am partial to THAT VIEW!)))EXCELLENT CABLEWAY! GOOD JOB GOOD SERVICE TOO. funny staff!

Excellent views. The cable car goes quite high and rotates while ascending to give everyone a full view. The staff are very professional. At the top, there is a restaurant and many viewing areas. There are longer hikes to the other side of the mountain, but the best views were right at the cable car station.

Great for views. Love that the cable car moves internally 360 degrees while transporting you to the other side. Unless you wanna brave it and hike! It probably would be nice if the weather is warm but Table Mountain is so high up, its bound to be colder than lower down in the city. Or wear loads of layers! So we decided to use the cable cars. Great view!

once in a lifetime experience!. Of course the cableway is fun, but nothing beats the views from the top of Table Mountain! Give yourself plenty of time to do the hikes on top. Each one is unique and beautiful. Bring layers of clothing- it can be quite chilly at the top! There is a lovely cafe where you can get coffee or hot cocoa if you get cold.Tip: buy your tickets online so as to avoid long lines. Many people get there early in the day, so if you wait until late morning the lines will probably be shorter.

A most see in Cape Town. Clearly a sight you have to visit in Cape Town, if it runs as it only run if weather permits it. The view from the top of the Table Mountain is excellent. Just remember it is colder on the top than down in the city.

table mountain view from the top. The ride to the top is breath taking great views with a rotating cableway best photo shots can be taking on the way back down tickets can be purchased online to avoid waiting in lines
Excellent. We came down with the cable car and we saw the beautiful view of the Table Mountain. It rotates 360 degrees and you don't have to move around. A lovely experience.
Loved the way the Cable Car turned. the views were amazing, the ocean and seacoast was beautiful from that vantage point. I would totally recommend taking the cable car to the top of table mountain

If you are in Cape Town.. You gotta do it. If you are here you have to do it. Its a good alternative to hiking up which also looks cool if you have the time. Here is a tip: the line for the tickets can get long. Pre book your tickets on your mobile phone through the website. When you show up you can go straight to the lift and skip the line. HOWEVER, IT TAKES 15 MIN FROM THE TIME YOU PURCHASE TO LOAD IN THE SYSTEM. We had to sit and wait for a bit but it still saved us huge! Enjoy
Cable cars. Absolutely a 'Must do' excursion to the top of Table Mountain with these amazing views across Cape Town and surrounding areas.

Breathtaking and Calm. The most amazing sight from on top. Plenty of space to walk, sit and explore from all angles. Sight makes beautiful pictures and memories, amazing for kids as they played I spy.

Table Mountain cable car. A must. for travellers to Capetown. The view of Capetown is magnificent and clearly visible is Robben Islands.If you are interested in a bit of walking once you have reached the top you can tahe a walk to Mclears Beacon about an hour from the top. Be prepared to wait in line to get onto the cable car especially on sunny clear days and public holidays.

Not a good experience. Very expensive for locals. On very hot days the standing in lines are very long with no airconditioning avaialble anywhere. Restaurant expensive and not good value for money. food was terrible. Dirt all over the mountain.

Most Beautiful City Ever!. There is nothing more spectacular than the view of the city of Cape Town and the harbour from gorgeous Table Mountain! The food at the restaurant was excellent at was the service! People in Cape Town are most friendly and helpful with directions and the ride in the cable car was lots of fun with happy locals and tourists alike. I would go back there any day! A marvelous trip to be experienced by everyone at least once in a lifetime!
Stunning. We went by cable car and the view going up and down was amazing. Felt it should have been longer to take it all in.
Ride. Worth the ride, view is outstanding, professional in operation, call ahead for reservations, or lines will take hours.

Table Mountain a must-see. Lovely views on the cableway and at the top of the mountain! Would recommend public transport (taxi, bus) as parking can be quite far. Also strongly recommend layered clothing as it can be cold and windy on top.
great views. we got our tickets online and avoided lines. Spectacular views, nice walk at the top. Dress warmly in winter!

Table mountain cable car. Amazing views. Well worth the cost for the Cable ride. Go up on a clear day and you wont be disappointed. I hear going near sunset is amazing as well. If you take little kids hold on to them it is easy to come close to the edges wi very steep drops.
Family outing. Enjoyed the experience! Stunning view's from cable car and on top of Table Mountain. Nice walkway's on top of Table Mountain and big restaurant.

Just cannot be ignored!!. Table Mountain, Cape Town, South AfricaNo visitor to Cape Town can ignore the lump of rock towering over the City. Table Mountain is said to be six times older than the Himalayas, having been formed under the sea some 600 million years ago. And I for one would not argue or even doubt those facts – it looked old to me!Get a cab up to the base area, buy your tickets and go up on the lift aerial cable car, which can carry some 65 people. That would be too many for me – I like to breathe and 65 others in that cable car would stifle me.But when you get up to the top – take time to walk all around and soak up the panoramic views from over 1000 metres above sea level.Then take a closer look at the flora and fauna – some 1,460 different species make up part of the Table Mountain National Park, which is the single richest floristic area in the world! Also look out for the Rock Hydrax, a dassie -the mountain’s most common animal. And also the Cape Sugarbird, with its long grey tail and beak. Occasional sightings have been made on top of the black Verreaux’s Eagle.Views that are sweeping really impress your eye. However walkers are in for a delight – three different signposted strolls take 15, 30 or 45 minutes to complete whilst up on the Table Top.There is a souvenir shop on the top and also a quite good buffet style restaurant where your self-selected choice of food is weighed and then charged – a unique experience for this fat traveller!I would certainly return to Table Mountain – a visual experience.
Table Mountain Cableway. Lovely outing and the cable car is lovely. 360 degree view of Cape Town CBD while going up. Staff friendly and helpful. A must see.
Loved it!. I Thought I was going to be scared and freak out. But it wasn't scary at all. It was great! It went smoothly and I will go again.

Must see. This is one of the most spectacular views in the world. Wait for a wind free day with clear skies and you wont be disappointed. It was fun for our entire family and whenever we have foreign guests we take them up and enjoy it ourselves just as much each time.

Chilled and Beautiful. The views from atop table mountain are unlike anything you will ever see! As a local and as an international tourist. During peak season it is packed, but that doesn't take away from the beauty and amazing walking trails. The tours are cool and insightful. Over all, a nice way to spend a few hours on a mountain.

Table Mountain. Magnificent - with a sense of peace whilst you feel it's magic and realize it's height and awesome size.
Surprising viewpoints as you walk the path with dynamic vistas all around.
Unsurpassable views that have you go silent in awe.
Very good service throughout.

A must see/experience when in CPT. You cannot visit CPT without a trip on the Cableway. The experience and the views are simply breath-taking! Perfect for sunrise, sunsets, romantic date nights or for a good hiking trail. The staff are friendly and helpful and there are so many people to meet from all over the world.

High up. I am not a fan of heights at all, but this was an amazing time going up the cable car and spending New Years eve on top of the awesome Table Mountain with friends, looking down at the fire works.

Tourist in own country. Superb view of the mother city of Cape Town.Was a bit chilly so next time I must bring something warm along to wear as the weather is really unpredictable.I really disliked the long wait to the restaurant's access.

Just Sensational. A must do whilst in SA, Cape Town is an amazing City The views are second to none, A group of us timed it at the ticketing area with some help from Tour guide, to be the last through the gates & the very last Car Runs down the mountain, the sunset just awesome...

The easy way up.... My first trip up the mountain was in 1983 with the old Cable Car, it was about the size of a loaf of bread ;)I've been up in the new Cable Car and what a pleasure. I have a slight fear of heights but not once did I feel nervous on the Cable Car. It slowly rotates 360 degrees while moving up the mountain. Without a doubt a MUST DO when you are visiting Cape Town.

A Once-in-a-lifetime experience...... Madeira(Portugal)tourists and my wife and I went up Table Mountain on Valentine's Day....We only ended up going up at 13H30 because of strong winds earlier.....The costs of food on Table Mountain seem high but you can find a cheaper alternative....Ask any member of staff who are generally friendly and helful.....Alternatively pack a picnic lunch of inexpensive food bought at a Supermarket....As a Cape Resident,I would recommend this Tourist Attraction very highly....One lucky lady in our group was proposed to at a beautiful natural setting on the mountain......
