Great view. Liked the rotating cable car. Liked the all round view . The days sis were really cute. It wasn't too crowded

Watch the weather. The local hop on hop off tour bus will take you to the base of table mountain. From here you must purchase tickets to take the cable car to the top. If there is low cloud round the top of the mountain you will have poor visibility from the top and do not bother going up. The locals say the " table cloth is over the top of the table " we saw people coming back down to complain to the ticket sellers they had seen nothing up top, showing them a digital photo of the view ( what view ?) but being refused a refund. The cable cars are very well thought out. Make sure you get a place on the outside edges irrespective of which way you are facing, as the car rotates 360 degrees during the ascent so everybody has a chance for an all round view. Once at the top, there are mapped walks around the table top. It was very very windy on the day we were there and sometimes they close the trips due to the wind. We were very cold up there. A sweater is definitely needed.

Breath Taking view!. One negative point - Rows can keep you waiting for a very long time.
Further more the best views ever, a must go!!

A quick & easy way up. On your arrival you may need to wait in a queue to get onto the cable car. The turn around is fast and so the wait is not as long as you would expect. The minor wait is well worth the exceptional views you will be rewarded with once on top the mountain. Leave plenty of time to walk around and see more of the mountain as it is well worth it.
Spectacular. As a local I never get tired of the views from the top. It changes very time!!! The service at the restaurant was excellent.

Great experience. Arrived by car of friend who lives in in SA. The cableway had been closed for a few days due to high winds. There was a line of cars all along the road from the turn off. Nearly turned back. On reaching the entrance our friend who has mobility issues alighted from the car. As she did one of the attendants near the ticket office came over and offered to escort us to the lift and we went straight in and up to the top. Amazing view of Cape town et al. Thank you so much. Great experience. Get there early especially if there is a ship in town.
Table Mountain is breath taking. I would go up table mountain everyday if I could. The view is awesome. Being a South African I don't think there is another country with a view like Table Mountain

A Must for any visit to Cape Town. You can't visit Cape Town without going to the top of Table Mountain. Weather permitting it is an absolute must. Try and book online first so you do not have to wait in a queue.
360 Degreees. Well-organised, reasonably priced, fabulous vehicle, 360 degree treat.....nothing to dislike but get there early, it is so popular the queues can get very long.

Awesome. Yeah definitely come here if you're in Cape Town or in South Africa at all for that matter. It was full of people but the queue moved quickly and we were up in no time. The view up there is like nothing I've ever seen before and describing it here wouldn't do it justice. You'll get some great views and photos up there. The cable car is quick and once you're up there there is a lot of ground to cover if you want to walk around and the cafe has loads of food space to sit. The staff are all friendly and helpful. You really have to come here if you're ever in South Africa, it's incredible and I loved it.

360 degree view. This was a very convenient time saving option which is also very scenic. We enjoyed going up and seeing the 360 degree views on account of the turning floor of the gondola. If there are many people try to stand next to the windows if you can.It was relatively inexpensive to purchase the round trip tickets.Good value and experience.

Good but often doesn't run. We wanted to go on the trip to the top of the mountain but everyday for three days the mountain had a table cloth and the cable car doesn't run when its covered in cloud. We went on day 4 and it was wonderful.

Big queue but worth the wait.. Big queue but worth the wait. Be careful to check the weather before booking as it can close in bad and windy weather. Also be aware that booking in advance still means you have to queue when you get there.

Great way to get to the top quickly and easily. Book on-line to reduce queuing for tickets. The cable car rotates so that you can get various perspectives of Cape Town as you go up/down. Get there by using the Red-Bus. Great views from the top of Table Mountain.
Breathtaking and romantic. Amazing, beautiful, romantic but over busy and not always well controlled. Cars were being overloaded to a point where the staff were voicing concerns.
Table mountain. A fantastic experience, rotating all the way up for superb views. Recommend buying tickets on line before you go to avoid queues. On a clear day "you can see forever" or so it seems.

Rotating View up the Mountain. This cable car takes you up to Table Mountain for an utterly breathtaking view of Capetown. As you glide up to the mountain top, the cable car rotates to give you a 360 degree view. Try to wait for a clear day, but this attraction is a must.
Not to be missed.. Not to be missed at any rate. A view over the southern hemispheres' Magnificent Sunsets & a sterling view of Cape Town Bowl & Harbour.

Views, views and more views. The whole experience is fabulous. The views are breath taking. The cable car is world class. We went on a day when the weather was close to perfect. The views were endless. The queues are long but do move fairly quickly. A highly recommended trip. We were also pleased to go over a weekend where we made use of their special, children went up free. The only disappointment was the restaurant on the mountain. The service levels and readiness to assist customers were poor, it seemed as though they had not quite completed their preparation prior to opening on that particular morning. Lovely souvenir shop on the mountain. Purchased some great gifts. This experience is every photographers dream.

What a view!. This is a very touristy thing to do but well worth doing - although we could see many people coming up on foot! The view is astounding and the process is efficient. We bought the tickets online before going to South Africa and I think that it was well worth it.

Breathtaking. Although I was afraid of the cable car (it is extremely safe; I'm just terrified of heights), the views are the most beautiful I have ever seen in my life. This is a MUST DO if you are in Cape Town.
Spectacular Views. Likes - One of the most spectacular cable cars I have ever been on. A must for anyone visiting Cape TownDislikes - None.

A big mountain. The day started out cloud free so we thought a trip up the mountain would be nice, but alas you can not control the weather. There was a long queue but it move quite quickly. We got up the mountain and what a beautiful view when the clouds let up for a few seconds. Recommend this as a must on...


More

Terrific Way To Reach The Top Of Table Mountain. We were lucky enough to visit Table Mountain on a spectacularly clear day in late June. The entire setup at the base of the mountain and the top is well thought out and designed to move large numbers of people as efficiently as possible. Everything we noted was clean and in good repair. The best tactic for a visit is...


More

Wary of ticket sellers making a buck from tourists who are not used to Rand notes. The ride up and down costs 215 Rand, which is approx. €15.
Be careful who you buy tickets from as the employee by the name of 'Lucille' (her name is printed on my ticket, tried to short change me at the counter.
Everything that has already been said about the view, rotation etc is true and it is a great...


More

Buy tix online. I was hiking up the mountain so wasn't affected by the queue, but the line was HUGE for people to get their tix to go up the cable car. I think by the time I hiked the mountain the last person in the queue probably was served. You can buy your tix online so best to do that and I...


More
The only way is up. Buy far the best way to the top of Table Mountain as its the only mechanical way up & down. Queing can take up too 2 hrs when busy.

a must in cape town. we were very fortunate with the weather in Cape Town in August when it was still winter. We had clear blue skies and took the Red Bus Tour stopping off to take the cable car. the trip takes 3 minutes to the top and note that the floor of the car rotates as it rises and descends. what a view...


More

Spectacular views (peroid). To be honest i expected something different at the top. The view were spectacular no doubt but the walkways were uncomfortable and to rocky at some routes. it is also much bigger than expected and will take time to cover all sides so be prepared.
Cramped but spectacular. The cable car is a bit cramped and not for those afraid of heights but it is safe and the views are spectacular. There is a great restaurant at the top for lunch.
Revolutionary. Big difference from the old days - car actually revolves allowing everyone a view, with two open windows, to give that thrill

Best attraction in Cape Town. This was one of our highlights of our trip to Cape Town in April. Chose a clear day and arrive early to take advantage of better parking and queues. We had lunch on the mountain and found the restaurant very busy during lunch time. It is a self help but we had no complains on the food. It is just...


More
Book tickets online and avoid the wait!. Love that they had the tram rotate so that everyone had a chance to see. Look for the Dassies. Bring a picnic and stay a while once you are up there.

Up(s) and down(s) at Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. We decided to have a visit to Table Mountain and to avoid the queue early morning we tried to book our tickets online on www.tablemountain.net which is a good thing, however as we are having ''Wild Cards'' for the South African National Parks and are entitled a discount on the fare for Table Mountain aerial Cableway it was not possible for us to buy tickets online - the system does not accept Wild Cards.We arrived at the ticket office early at 07.30 and had 12 persons already in front of us and slowly more and more visitors arrived, lots of them in tourist buses. It says that the first trip up is at 08.30, however the guides let the people in at 08.40 and at that time only counting the buses which had arrived a couple of hundred persons stood in the queue behind us and they must have purchased their tickets online as they all overtook us and rushed upstairs to the entry of the cableway. The walkway up to the entry was full of people within minutes. We still had to buy our tickets at the ticket counter and when we finally got our special tickets at the tariff of a Wild Card Member we found ourselves at the back of the queue with hundreds of other visitors in front. Very frustrating as waking up early and waiting wasn't the right thing. When we finally arrived at the entry someone from the staff members wanted to take a photo of us, couldn't understand whats going on, they did it with everyone and when asking why they want to have our picture we were told that we can purchase it when we return from the top. Sorry we refused as we do not like other people taking photos of us and the staff should inform visitors accordingly and not just say to stand still for a photograph. That's obviously a money making point in their business. We finally went up just before 10 and had a good time on Table Mountain as usual. Returning down to the station all visitors were now guided by the staff members and channeled through the souvenir shop which caused a jam and people really couldn't move. When complaining about this type of exit strategy as it is another money source to sell souvenirs a closed barrier was opened and we could leave.Management should address their staff to be polite and how to greet your customers, the first good morning was said by the man in the cable car and by nobody else, not even the ticket officer said good morning to us. In the cable car the few sitting down places close to the driver were occupied by your staff and elderly people had to stand - not good and not acceptable.However the employees at the Cafe on top were very friendly.

Spectacular view!. The Table Mountain Cableway offers spectacular and emotional views of Cape Town. It is a very crowed attraction so it is better to book the tickets in advance in order to save time. It worths to take the cableway.

What an exhilerating ride!. This is my third trip to Africa and Cape Town and yet once again, I had to return here and zoom up the top of Table Mountain in that cable car/gondola and have a coffee in the cafe and feel the clouds around me. It's well worth the trip and the fairly long line to buy your tickets (for visitors I feel you should buy your ticket on the day in case it is too cloudy or windy for your liking). Great value. Animal and plant life is interesting and varied, and the rock formations have to be seen to really appreciate raw nature. Highly recommend this for families and couples, and keep a tight rein on little ones.

Beautiful even on a cloudy day. We booked our tickets online before our trip and it was a very easy process; the web site is well constructed and functioning.The day we had chosen turned out to be very cloudy, windy, and cool in the afternoon so we had some reservations about going up. Would we see anything? And, since the last Big Bus tour departed before we would come back down, what would we do for transport bcd to our hotel? Undaunted, we elected to go ahead anyway.The line looked awfully long but staff processed everything efficiently, so the wait was quite acceptable. Going up and through the clouds was fun, and popping out into sunshine was great. On the top we could see only the tops of mountain peaks and clouds basking in bright sunshine; what a view!!! There were good explanatory plaques at strategic positions and excellent places all around for photos and simply admiring the beauty around us. I wonder if we did not get the best conditions after all?There were plenty of cabs at the entrance/exit, and just be sure that the one you pick is metered. I don't think there is an exact, 'going' rate but our experience was that all cabs got you around within a couple of bucks of each other. The Rand has taken such a pounding that a cab ride in Cape Town is often no more than the starting fee in Toronto, Canada.We were definitely glad that we took in this attraction.

Many tourists, quite expensive, beatiful view. It is sort of a must when you are in Cape Town to go on top of the Table Mountain. It is as expected an attraction that attracts plenty of tourists en access to the parc in combination with the cableway was quite expensive. It was very cold on top of the mountain and an icecold wind, but the views where beautiful.

What a breathtaking view!. We are touring South Africa from Germany and had to go see Table Mountain. Going up the Cableway was simply breathtaking and more than what we ever expected! Especially for the price, it was a fantastic adventure. The plantlife is just amazing and even the restaurant food is top quality.

How disappointing. We arrived in Cape Town on the last day of our holiday to glorious weather so knew that Table Mountain was a 'must do' activity. How disappointed we were to get to the top of the hill to find that the Cableway was closed for two weeks for maintenance. I know that this was unfortunate timing for us, but how easy would it have been to have put signs at the BOTTOM of the route to explain this so that people would not have had to make the trek up unnecessarily. Also, if we had known this earlier in our stay, we would have made sure that we had enough time to walk up instead. What a disappointment
An excellent view. Weather is a big factor - the first day that you have clear skies, cancel all your plans and go up the mountain as you are never guaranteed another opportunity

Great even if cloudy. The day we went there was a cloud layer between the summit and the Town, juts below Lion's Head. Although a fully clear day would be better, don't be put off if that's the conditions that you have too. The summit was very sunny, and some of the views were still clear (esp to the rear of the mountain) and well worthwhile. We did the free 45 minute ranger tour, very well led and informative. Well worth it.

Too short!!. The views in the 360 revolving cable car were simply stunning. The only bad thing is the journey is too short! Just 4 mins plus and it's over! We've reached the top!! Wish it could be longer!!

The Easy Way Up. This is so easy and relatively cheap to go up and down the Table Mountain. If you do choose to use it instead of walking up, make sure you allow at least an hour or two up the top doing some of the walk along the top of the mountain. the scenery, rock formations and plant life here is gorgeous.
WOW. Not enough words to say how amazing the experience was. The staff are extremely friendly, the restaurant was nice and all other facilities are in great shape

Wonderful Experience. Fortunately we went on a day when you could see forever - The views were unbelievable! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the revolving Cable Car was an experience in itself, with a driver that had a sense of humour! The queue went very fast and the cafeteria was worth visiting. A must do for anyone visiting Cape Town.
safe. I am too scared of hights but the cableway seemed safe enough! you dont have to wait much because it goes up every 5 minutes
Eye in the sky. This is a must do when visiting Cape Town. You will get the real feeling from above. The mountain is magical and the scenary was fantastic.

Beautiful!. If you get the opportunity to visit Table Mtn. Near Capetown, S. Africa GO! If you hate heights, walk up but watch for snakes. The cable car is a great experience for the brave. I loved it!

weather beware. it goes without saying, and whatever book you read, Table Mountain visibility and adventure is stoked on Mother Nature's whim. We happened on a day with a mix and warmth of comfort.What I disliked was many "tourists" and some who thought it was "cute" to get in a center area and sing their praises to all. I happen to love nature and enjoy serenity of just being there! Was pleased that the shop options were not taking up too much space so most of the nature abounded. What views-YES! Sorry, this was supposed to be about the cable ride? it was fine.

Great experience. Each car holds up to 60 people apparently. The revolving car gives everyone a good all-round view of the coast and the mountain as you go up and down which means that you don't have to jostle for a good position for photos.
Enjoy a good view. The cable car floor is rotating so it doesnt matter where you stand you will get a panoramic view spinning slowly during your ride up.

Watch the eagles below you!!!. Have been up here a few times and every time, it just seems to get better and better. The cable car is really excellent in that it turns through 360 degrees from bottom to top and therefore it doesn't matter where you are within the gondola as you will get a full view during the ascent or descent

Amazing. Something every cape town visitor has to do !!!
The scenes from the top of the mountains are unbelievable
Great view. Even though it was slightly cloudy the ride and views are worth the trip-----if you are adventurous a hike up the mountain looks like a great adventure

Amazing. Visited September 2011.
One of my favourite things I did in Cape Town! A fun cable ride up the mountain which spins (not fast) so everybody can get views from all angles.

Great view. Although the wait was long (over one hour), the view was worth it. The wind was very strong, and the tram was closed the day before due to high winds. Also, fog rolls in often about 5-6 pm, so go earlier in the day to see the ocean to the southwest. Bring your camera! Worth the price!
Amazing. The cable car had a circular floor. It was a little disconcerting as the floor spun around, but really neat to get all views.

Most Stunning Views for a Lift - Goes in a Flash. sometimes in life you wish things did not progress and get so fast as is the case with the cable way, you wish you could go slower like the old cable cart but have all the open glass structure of the new cart. All in all just enjoy the moment and if you feel it went too fast, then do it again.

Thrilling ride to the top. The ride up to Table Mountain in the Aerial Cableway was stunning!The views are amazing, as you can see right across Cape Town and the harbour. The car itself turns as you ascend, to give everybody the chance to view the panorama around and below you. The guide in the car was very informative.On the downside, there was a very long wait for the cable car and whilst the owners have tried to make the wait more pleasant by installing a shaded walkway and some sprinklers / misters to keep people cool, the walkway does not extend far enough and not all of the misters were working when we visited.If visiting, make sure that you have: - Sun tan lotion, especially for any children - Hats or other forms of shade - Water or other drinks to keep hydrated while you wait.There are drinks and ice cream stalls available but you have to leave the queue to get them and they are a little more expensive than in a regular local shop.

Beautiful overview of the city. We went in the July school holidays on a slightly overcast day, the weekend after the snow on the mountain. There is a special on during the winter holiday where one adult pays and two children can go for free. Plus if it's someone's birthday they can have a return ticket free. We arrived at 10h00 and were fortunate to not have to stand in a queue. On the way down near mid-day there was a very long queue. The facilities on the mountain are well maintained and the view is beautiful. We quickly browsed through the shop which is priced for tourists and didn't venture into the restaurant. Be sure to dress warmly even if the weather looks good.
Nice. Very close to the ocean and it looked beautiful. Loved and enjoyed the restaurants up there. Was very cool.
Great Views. We walked up Table Mountain from Kirstenbosch and took the cable car down. Great view and rotating cable car which was pretty neat.
Adventure. Wow!Breathtaking!Safe!Definitely recommendable!,Staff very helpful!Beautiful view!A must see!Def going back!,

Always a good idea on clear day. Another of our days out in the July school holidays. We took advantage of a gorgeous sunny winter day & the Kidz Season Special - pay for an adult & two accompanying children go free. If you split it 3 ways, it costs roughly R70 per person, not a bad deal!Getting there early is a must, we were lucky there were no queues. The views from the cable car are fabulous (there is a rotating floor so you do get to see a bit of everything, but nothing beats the views from Table Mountain itself! The children had fun looking for clues to answer their quiz sheets and picked up a bit of general knowledge along the way. A bonus was the free candy (from the souvenir store) & free "dassie" biscuit (from the restaurant café) that they could pick up after handing in their vouchers. If you live in Cape Town & have never been, shame on you ;) As a tourist, Table Mountain is a must! You won't regret it.

Still a stunning experience. Despite having done this trip several times before this remains one of the best things to do when in Cape Town.Restaurant at the top is not great, but when the weather is fine and you can see for miles, who cares?

limitless. the experience was breathtaking.. went on it for the second time.. enjoyed every bit of it... the ride was fascinating and the view while riding up and down the car was picturesque -- looked like a photograph from above... i definitely go again ...
Tips. Take a jacket or sweater. Don't go if the weather is too cloudy, you will not see anything. Photogeapher? take a wide angle and be there either as early or as late as possible, but not mid-day.
Stunning views!. Easy and well worth the cost... The 'driver' has a sense of humour and are well versed in the story.

Magnificent views!. We hopped off the open-top tourist bus at the Table Mountain stop, and seized our opportunity to take the cable car up. The cable car zooms up the mountain, rotating whilst it does so, so everyone gets to see the magnificent views. At the top is a cafe, and fabulous greenery and wildlife. It is really stunning,Be warned though, we were there in SA's winter, and were not prepared for how cold it gets up there! There are icy winds, and sometimes a little snow. If you want to stay a while to admire the view, and wander the paths at the top of the mountain, then be prepared and wrap up warm!!

Great trip - Grossly priced, but it's a monopoly!. Amazing views - and grossly (or should I say grotesquely!) overpriced, but what can one do? It's a pure and total monopoly and everybody is gauged! :-)

Don't miss this on a clear day. We took the funicular to the top and walked around to take in the 360 degree awesome views. Great for pictures and truly breathtaking. But seize the moment to do this when weather permits because it's no good if its cloudy, foggy or rainy.
Indispensable facility. The important thing was in place: safety, and we reached our destination quickly and efficiently. Nice bit of humour from the guards on both journeys.

Too Many people into the Pod. They put too many people into the Pod at once, and even though it rotates I would have loved to be able to walk from one window to another or be able to move. I did the cableway up and hiked down, it was a really nice hike down. Well worth it.

Of course you have to go see this. This was a nice view but I was totally under-dressed even in the summer months. Please make sure you wear long pants and take a jacket. Also make sure you look at the weather and go when the car is open. Also pre buy tickets

Must Visit to Table Mountain if you in Cape town. Must Visit to Table Mountain if your in Cape town. It is indeed good and had great experience visiting this place and clicking 360 deg views and pictures of Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain.

magnificient and high standards. i remember very well that the cable way was closed for atleast 5 days prior to our visit in Capetown due to adverse weather conditions.We kept on praying even the day we left our home country that we found it open.The day we arrived it was on the 19th July the cable was closed due to winds and mist.We did not despair and we rested.Our accommodation was so excellent and of cus within budget thank you road lodge Capetown international airport.On Sunday 20th July we were up early and thank our god it there were clear skies outside.we immediately headed to the mountain.This place is so clean,well maintained and even if you have a fear of highs you will board the cable without any fear.there is nothing wrong with the cables and by the look of things their equipment is services and of high quality...thank you table mountain national park......

A must do. The cable car trip is well worth doing and the fact it rotates ensures you get an all round view. Well organised and able to cope with the volume of visitors. Don't be put off by early morning cloud - it should clear affording spectacular views.
Amazing place. I've been to Table Mountain 3 times. Can't get enough. Always beautiful. Amazing view. The cafe there is also nice. Great place to go.

must do!. awesome experience! worth doing many times. A must do activity in cape town.Take the cableway and if possible hike down. A full day is recommended on top. Although I could only spend 3 hours which just flew and could only cover half of the mountain because we had to take the last cable down.carry a very good camera to capture the awestruck views all around of the city and the ocean.good walking shoes must as road on top are rocky.its windy on top so avois loose clothes but be warm.

Best view of Cape Town!. Table mountain is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. Best views of the city. Pick a day with little wind and no clouds on the mountain. Between 9-11 is best in summer months. Cable car is the quickest way of getting up and down.
World class. Great service, great facilities, cable car is fantastic. Wear good walking shoes, and be aware the weather can change suddenly. Parking can be a bit of a challenge.

Table mountain Cable Car. The ride to the top of Table Mountain. On the cable car that rotated on the way up and down so you saw the views 360 degrees. The view from the top was awesome. You could see all of Cape Town and Robben Island. We went up in late afternoon so we were there to watch the beautiful sunset. If you go up later in the day, be sure to take a jacket. It gets chilly.
View out of heaven. Remember to check with your hotel on weather conditions as it can get windy, cold and misty in minutes. Go early in the day.

Bit costly for the time. Too fast to enjoy the scenes! We went up hiking the mountain and came down the cable way. Check the local weather before you make the trip to Table mountain. Cable car is closed on days of showers and wind.

Amazing view of an Iconic Landscape. The Cable car journey up Table mountain is a must see! Always take a Jacket. Was not prepared for the beautiful views. Have a glass of bubbly and enjoy one of the most amazing views in the world

Gorgeous 360 Degree Views. I would have preferred to hike up Table Mountain, but it is a 3-4 hr hike one way and I just didn't have time given my short stay in Cape Town. (I hiked up Lion's Head instead.) The views are magnificent on a clear, sunny day. The R200 is definitely worth it. Be sure to allow time to walk the paths at the top.

World Wonder- oh yes!. We took the hop-on hop-off bus to Table Mountain and prebooked our tour online which saved us a bit. Everything is well sign posted. The staff were friendly and efficient. The bathrooms on top are clean and modern. The restaurant and curio shop are beautifully presented but a littlepricey - to be fair that was expected. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Bring a jacket and good shoes!

Excellent!. Buying ticket was easy, it is swift and gives you a great view as it turns as you go up. It's great! The view is stunning, wait for a clear day and go!When you're up there the cafe us surprisingly good too.

Spectacular views. I loved the cable car to the top of the mountain. When you first arrive you think the lines are huge however each car takes many people. So the lines move quickly . The national park at the top is interesting. With a rocky landscape & great plants to photograph. There are places to purchase food & drink at the top . It's easy to spend a few hours at the top

Spectacular views. We went beginning June and had a beautifull clear day, little chilly but the view was spectacular. I havent been up with the new cable car yet rotating one so it was a nice experience to see a 360 view. The restaurant has also improved alott in terms of quality and variety. Overall a must do if you want to experience Cape Town in all its beauty.

A great way to view Cape Town. A visit to Table Mountain is an excellent way to see Cape Town and the surrounding vistas. Our visit to Table Mountain had weather that was so perfect that we would have paid for it. The cable car on the ride up and back rotates 360 degrees to give a good view to all of the passengers. A visit to Table Mountain is a great way to spend an inexpensive half day in Cape Town. This is a must visit site in Cape Town.

Phenomenal view of Cape Town. Such a beautiful view of Cape Town - captivating. When I visited, there were a group of men on their walk singing a cappella - A superb accompaniment to one of the world's most stunning scenes. I couldn't help but fall in love with Cape Town after my visit to Table Mountain. A wonderful experience - A must see!!

Worth it. Well worth the ticket price to avoid the hike! Buy your tickets online in advance to avoid the lines. Get there early as well and you'll not have a very long wait to get on the Cableway and up to the top of Table Mountain!
Great panoramic views. Rode on the cableway in early July. Great panoramic views during the ride up and down. Small port holes above the windows allow you to take unobstructed pics of the area.

Great views on a clear day. When we woke up to a clear sunny morning our first day in Cape Town we knew we should make our visit to the top of Table Mountain right away. We had debated making the hike to the top, but with only a few days in Cape Town we opted to take the speedier cable car, and I'm glad we did. The cable car was fast and easy with great views. We did not book our tickets in advance. Once at the top we enjoyed a hot morning beverage in the cafe which has a lovely view. If I had known there was a restaurant up there we'd have arrived sooner and had breakfast up there. I also think drinks before sunset there would be fantastic. There is also a gift shop up there. We took the guided walk at 10 am, they are offered hourly. It was all of 15 minutes. Some good tidbits about the mountain, but very skip-able. After the guided walk we walked the long loop ourselves, which was great. Very flat easy walk, but spectacular views and lookout points. All told we spent about 2 hours from the time we reached the mountain to the time we got back to our car. I don't see the need for anymore time than that, at least in the off season. Parking was very easy when we arrived, but it looked like it backs up a bit as the day goes on. Just be prepared to have to park a bit further away and walk.

Breathtaking. Table Mountain is a gift to the world. The table top is an incredible way to see the city but a hike to the top truly showcases the wonder of nature. The streams offer the sweetest water which is an absolute treat. The lines for the cable car can get very long (hours) and there is limited seating and shelter during that wait. The summer sun gets very hot. Go early or book your ticket online.
Fast trip. A beautiful and rapid climb to the summit! The platform revolves so everyone gets the "good view" during the ride up and down!

Superb experience. Great way to see Cape Town with breath-taking views. Ample parking provided on the road leading up to the start of the cableway. Inexpensive and efficient. Café and shop at the top. We spent about an hour on the top but you could spend longer exploring the summit further. Weather permitting.

Gorgeous View!. We chose a lovely day to make our way up to the top. The cable car rotates, so you get to see all angles on the way up and back down. While on top, we witnessed gorgeous scenery while the clouds moved in. It was really cool to watch the clouds move in and take their "tablecloth" place. We did purchase our souvenir pictures, and along with that comes a code where you can get digital prints as well online. So, that was nice only having to purchase 1 package (3 pictures). It was well worth it. Go up early and beat the crowd. We didn't stand in line and had plenty of room at the top to take photos without a ton of people in the background.

View from the top - weather dependant. Beautiful views from the top of the mountain! Go early, don't book tickets in advance as it is weather dependant. The cable car is smooth and efficient and the floor moves 360 degrees so there is no need to fight for a spot. As always though, they crowd people in which is somewhat unpleasant.
What a view!. Be careful of clouds and also the crowds. It may be no clods in town but there may be clouds at the top.! Don't prepurchase tickets too far ahead.
Loved the Cableway..... Very Systematic, Spacius, Revolving and secured. It was revolving whily goiing up & down, thus offered a 360 Degree view of the entire place and the ride quality was Superb...
Go early!. A unique way to reach up the Table Mountain, as it rotates as well. One tip though, reach early as the lines can get very long towards late morning/ afternoon.
A view from the top. One of the modern wonders of the world. A trip to Capetown wouldn't be complete without taking in this awesome vantage point. Remarkable views of city and ocean

Breathtaking. Simply fabulous. So well organized, seemless navigation on the mountain, a chance for some adventure. Absolutely a must see for anyone visiting Cape Town. Could be a little pricy for some families, but watch out for specials. Take your time, make sure you have water with you and don't forget the camera.
Must do. We went to table Mt. it was a great clear day and we had incredible views. I recommend taking your time and walking all the way back. Have some snacks at the cafee up there as well.

Worth doing when in Cape Town. You really need to pick your day when heading up the Cableway, so aim for clear and not too windy.The lines and parking can be a huge issue, so try and make it first thing, or late in the day.It's a great experience and the cable cars feel very secure. It's a great idea that the interior rotates a full 360 degrees on the way up so you get to see Cape Town from each vantage point.Take good walking shoes as it can get slippery on the top - and pack hats, jackets, gloves and scarves on the cooler days as the air is nippy!Unfortunately missed out on seeing the dassies, but great photo opportunities from the top and a good way to get your bearings.And of course, there's a cafe, gift shop and amenities when you get there.

Amazing Experience. The cableway ride to the top of Table mountain is just the start of an amazing unique experience.There's a great history behind the cableway and is interesting to read.Photos are available to buy in a lovely pack with a DVD history of the cable wayOnce at the top it is an amazing experience, views right across Cape Town. There is a restaurant and shop and post box! on Table Mountain.Do not miss the chance to visit Table Mountain when in Cape Town

Not to be missed. Great experience and not to be missed when in Cape Town. Get there early to avoid the queues and keep your day to visit flexible to enable you to choose the best weather possible... The views are awesome on a blue sky morning!

must do. Table Mountain is spectacular from the bottom and stunning from the top. The top can be misty so buy your tickets online before you travel and go up first thing in the morning(to avoid the crowds) on the first clear day you see. It is chilly on top so bring a jacket

Great View of the City. This is not to be missed if you are in Capetown. The ride is fun and offers panoramic views of the city below. The cable car schedule is affected by weather - high winds and fog will shut it down, so be prepared to fit it into your schedule. The car itself has a rotating floor so if you rush to get on to get a specific view you will find your view changing as the floor, and you, rotates through 360 degrees. In this way everyone gets to see the city on the ride. If you have mobility problems and are concerned about a rotating floor, there are a few seats at the center of the car by the operator area that do not rotate. Your picture will be taken at some point and you can purchase it superimposed on the cable car. Once purchased they can also be downloaded to your own computer from the company"s website.
Great views. And taking the cable car up is a great way to save a pretty arduous hike. But the walk down is easy and worth the effort.

Well worth a trip. Beautiful views over the city at the top and walks well laid out around the top. Fantastic views on the other side over the ocean. Cafe too with drinks and lunches. Be mindful only run the cable car in good weather to visit at first opportunity to save disappointment.

Not to be missed. Give yourself some days in Capetown because Table Mountain can be fogged in or it is too windy to run the cable car. It was three days before I could take the cable car and enjoy a spectacular view. Stunning.

360 degree view on the way up. As the inside turns you get to see each side of the car. When you get to the top you can see Capetown one way, Robben Island another and the Mountains toward the south as well as beautiful sea views. At least until the "tablecloth" of clouds rolls over the mountain. It didn't totally cover the top while we were up there but it makes it a little eerie. There were paraglider or parasail riders on Lions Head that day so that was fun to watch. It is beautiful and we were glad we had a day the view was pretty clear.

World Famous Must See Item. Table Mountain is world famous and no visitor will miss this site. We were quite fortunate to visit Cape Town twice therefore we did our Table Mountain visit on our first arrival. The aerial cableway did added excitement to the whole visit and enable visitor of different physical ability to enjoy this important site. Once reached the top, the view of Cape Town and its surrounding were captivating and great for photograph. The top of the table also provided interesting walkway. Plan to spend around an hour exploring on the top.
Breathtaking. This takes you to the top of the Mountain and the view is great going up the mountain. You can't miss this.

Quick ride with a 360 degrees view. The recently installed cabins taking about 60 persons take you up and down the top of Table Mtn quickly and the view can be shared with all passengers because of the cabins turning 360 degrees around their vertical axis.
Great view of the city. Great view of the city while you enjoy this 7th wonder of the world. It is good attraction for children and the walk at the top of the mountain is easy.

Worth the wait. Have been meaning to do this trip for years, tip is that you don't walk up as it's not that safe, the undesireables hide in the mountain knowing that tourists have money and cameras etc. When they have mugged you they get rid of a layer of clothing so they aren't recognised. So take the cable car. Magnificient reviews. Take a walk, don't just stay around the top where the shops are.

World class infrastructure and efficiency. A trip today made me proud to be South African. Truly a word class facility, well run, clean and friendly staff. Tip: book online at Webtickets - 1) you have a shorter queue to stand in once at the lower cable station 2) you save a little money as tickets are marginally cheaper - good for large groups 3) it is valid for 14 days from date of issue and can be refunded if you do not use it The trip itself is smooth - you barely notice the exit from the station, up or down, and with the revolving floor, everyone in the car gets to see every possible view during the fast trip.If you just want to go up, meander on some short pathways, enjoy vistas, then 2 hours would be sufficient. Add another 1.5 hours if you want to walk to Maclears Beacon and back - the highest point on Table Mountain

Quick and efficient. A rotating cable car ride with excellent views and plenty of space! There are only two cars however each one packs more than 20 pax and there is still plenty of room inside. The ride up and down doesn't take very long so not too much waiting time or queues
Great time nice view. It is a good opportunity to go fast and comfortable to table mountain, with and explanation about the different points you can see.

Only way to get up really. Amazing, the cable car revolves as it goes up to the top given great views, staff very informative. felt safe Great views. Saw some people climbing, wow rather them than me!!
A Must. Incredible views of the bay and city. The rotating cable car gives your a 360 view. So don't worry about getting the right position inside. Do book online, it will save you hours

Must Do. If you have not had the opportunity to go up the cable car in Cape Town to the top of Table Mountain it is a must do. Choose the first perfect day when the weather is fine. A late afternoon trip and watching the sunset is also special. If you are energetic a walk down from the top is also memorable.

Table Mountain Cable Aerial Cableway a Must in Cape Town. My husband and I toured Table Mountain by way of the cable car the latter part of May, during our four day stay in Cape Town. We had our private guide, Zakkie Parker, who knows all the ins and outs of what to see, what time to see it and knows what the weather will be like. We could tell that tour buses were lined up in masses, from below, so waited until 1:30 that afternoon. We got right in without a wait. We knew the weather near the end of May is unpredictable and the "table cloth" could shroud the mountain, but we had the perfect day on May 22! I cannot remember the cost but it was reasonable for what we saw on the top and the quality of time we spent. The cable car turns 360 degrees going up and you see spectacular views, but for me zip lining in Costa Rica was easier!The views of the city are gorgeous, you can see the VA Waterfront, the World cup Stadium, Robben Island, and so much. Zakkie pointed things out as well. It well worth the trip up and enjoy Cape Town from up in the sky!

Stunning. On a clear day, you will see the most stunning views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas. Check their website first thing in the morning and the scoot up to the tram. Buy your tickets online if possible. If you arrive earlier in the morning before 9:30, you should have only about a five minute walk from parking your car. If you wait till later, it will be a long hike, if that's the case, I would take a taxi. Hang on to you round trip ticket because if you toss it after you head up, you'll have to buy another ticket. Dress in many layers as the weather changes quickly. Don't forget to bring your camera. There is a gift shop, toilets and a restaurant at the top as well. Enjoy the views.

Definitely recommended. The cable car ride was very scenic and highly recommended. It really gives you an overall perspective of Cape Town and you can see for miles. Go early as it can get crowded. Check weather as it can be closed during in-climate weather. It was closed for 2 days while we were there so be prepared to adjust your itinerary.

The view is amazing!. You cannot beat the view! We were lucky to get to go to the top. It was too cloudy for several days before we there and it was cloudy again the day after we went. If you get a chance to take the cableway, you should definitely do it.

Excellent views. The floor of the cable car rotates so that each person in the car gets a variety of views as she goes up the mountain. There are many walk options (with different lengths and animals) at the park when you get off the car at the top. Great views if you have a clear day; we were lucky in that regard.

Great day to see a great city!. Prior to our arrival in Cape Town, we were warned about the fickle weather, particularly the unpredictable clouds that rolls down the side of Table Mountain - we were prepared to be disappointed but......a picture perfect day! How lucky were we to experience such wonderful weather in Cape Town. Our great tour guide Tracy took us up the Mountain early on a perfect afternoon. The cable car folks got us onboard quickly and efficiently and we enjoyed a relatively quick trip to the top. Love the way it rotates to provide a full view of the city below us. Price (41 rand = 4 Aussie $$s) was exceptional value.

Have to do this one!!. If you're in Cape Town, you must get to the top of Table Mountain and see the view, the cable car obviously is the easiest sway to do it. Don't need to book in advance and would advise against it, cus the experience will be based on the weather. Check in the morning and if it's clear, get a taxi straight to the cable car early. The cable car itself rotates on the way up, so there's no need to rush to a good vantage point. Once up there the views are spectacular. A must do!
A "mus"t of cape town. A "must" in cape town, with marvelous views from the top of table mountain. It gives you a hole view of the city, a 360 panoramic.

Spectacular. There are many cable cars and then there is the Table Mountain cable car, which is one of the most super-duper cable cars I have ever seen.Just the engineering of the cable car is amazing due to the roughness and remoteness of the area, and the cars are perched in the sky, like floating. Seeing the cable car from afar is an spectacle of its own.  The ticket is about 20 Au/USA Dollars, but well worth it the price. Why? Because you get to Table Mountain, one of the natural wonders of the world (tick), the cable car revolves around itself, so all passengers have a view of the spectacular surroundings (tick), one of the window panels has no glass so passengers can take a picture or enjoy the scenery without barriers (tick), the guys driving the car are very welcoming, lovely and informative (tick), and there are cars going up and down every five minutes (tick). If you go to Cape Town you MUST a) take the car. b) see the car from afar and take the very sought photo with the the two cards crossing. Just saying.

Great view !. Great experience ! Climbing up the Table Mountain with the Cableway you can have an unforggetable view of Cape Town and the surroundings. Just make sure you do your reservation through Internet in advance, to avoid the crowded lines ....
Worth a ride. the cableway itself is a funny experience, as well as a walk on the very top of the most popular Cape Town landmark!
What a view!. Relax and enjoy the ride. Waiting was not long as it can be sometimes. Revolving car gives all round view.

Top of the world - but not for long.... Tried for three days out of the five we were in the Cape Town area, to get to the top of this amazing place - and it was only thanks to my cousin - who lives there, coming with us on the third day and talking the guy into letting us onto the elevator, that we at last got there - on our very last day! We got the tickets, climbed the stairs, and for the third time, were told that the wind was getting up and cable car was cancelled - thankfully there were 17 of us waiting and my cousin stepped in and said 'who wants to go?' Everyone put their hand up, so the guy relented and off we went..When we got to the top, the wind, compared to the car park below - was incredible and it is easy to see why they have to be so careful. However, I am so pleased we were allowed up, and got an amazing unforgettable half an hour taking stunning photos and taking in the views - which were breathtaking...All I would offer as advice - is try, try again - it is well worth it. The weather may look perfect on the ground - or on the web - but believe me, it can change in an instant - you can book online but be prepared to be disappointed, and have to re arrange - so if you only have a couple of days there, prepare in advance - and take a coat!
Great experience. Cable car turns as you travel so everyone gets fabulous views on their trip. Efficient service. Would recommend if you get a clear few hours without too much cloud.

A must do in capetown. One of the better highlights when I travelled to Cape Town, one recommendation would be to pre buy tickets if you can as I had to wait in a line up for about 30 minutes just to get to the cable cars, although the wait was long and frustrating, the views once you got up there were amazing, there is a buffet at the top for you to feast on while you're up there as well as! Many look out points and heaps of little areas to venture in. Make sure you get photos because you won't get a better view of Cape Town anywhere else!

Breakfast on Table Mountain. Queues were long so get there early, parking can be an issue. Keep your itinerary flexible so the first good day Weather wise seize the opportunity. Not to be missed. Breakfast in the cafe was excellent and the views unbeatable. There are some great brochures about Table Mountain by Iziko Mueseums, worth a read especially if you are going to do your own thing and not join a tour.

Well organized cableway. Hop on the Red bus to the cableway. Easy to purchase tickets through several booths. Very little wait times to board the cable car to Table mountain summit. Nice area to explore the mountain top with great views of Cape Town and beyond. Good value for money.

A must in Cape town. Breathtaking views of Cape Town and the water. If you have the time and are able, hiking up the mountain is a good option. But if not, the cableway is an easy way to get to the top of the mountain. Bring your camera and drink in the stunning scenery.
Stunning. Amazing view, just hope there is little or no clouds as one really wants to see the beautiful city of Capetown
Visit. A must it is as spectacular as it looks and not expensive. Take your time when you are at the top. Enjoy.

Beautiful Views. My cousin and I went here one day, amazing views! We didn't spend any time waiting in line. We were told to go up early and sometimes the cableway isn't always open, but with our luck, it was and well worth it.

Table Mountain. Table Mountain is a must when visiting Cape Town !!!! Me and a group of chums took a visit. The initial opinion of it was that the queuing to get the cable car up, was a little slow , about 30 mins from start to finish. And when you arrive at the top of Table Mountain it does fell like there are too many people! however there is more than enough space to explore , and the views are stunning at the top ! And much worth the wait !!!!!!!!

Without problems. The cableway worked very well without long time waiting, it is quite big, so everybody went in and it goes around a full turn, so you are able to see the complete view of town and mountain. It is enough quick so you feel always safe in it.

Cable car Table Mountain. I don't like heights but wanted the experience of doing this attraction, because it was so busy and plenty going on around me I didn't feel too bad about the height. It did not take long to get to the top and once there it was very clear and had amazing views from every angle. Would do it again in a heart beat, well worth it. We were with a group and doing another visit so we didn't have much time to see everything, would recommend 1.1/2 hours to see everything breath taking!!

Excellent views. Make sure you pre-book your tickets if possible when it is a school holiday or bank holiday as your have to join a queue for people with tickets and one for without, if without you get to the top of queue purchase and then have to join the queue of people with tickets.if going out of season you should not have to queue, I have been in November and no queue but at Christmas/New Year time massive queues.Once get up to the top, the views are outstanding. Worth the wait, take your own picnic up with you and enjoy looking out over Cape Town

View from the table. If you do one thing when you are in Cape Town you must do this. If you can avoid the worst of the queues then you are in for a treat. The ride up and down is impressive ( if you have a head for heights). And the views from the top are spectacular. I am still amazed by the photos I took.Do not miss this attraction.

Great Experience. It's a great way to see Table Mountain and the surrounds as it rotates 360 degrees whilst ascending or descending. This is the second time I've used it and this time we took the cableway for both trips. The first time we went up in cableway and walked down. Allow about 3 hours if you want to do this. We took the hop on hop off bus to get the bottom station, which is a great way to see Cape Town in itself. The whole experience was very efficient. Allow plenty of time up there as the views are spectacular and it's good to have plenty of time to walk around and find somewhere quiet to just sit take it all in and enjoy it.

An amazing experience with superb views of Cape Town. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience even though the weather wasn't too fantastic. Got there using the hop on hop off bus. Definately a must do when in Cape Town.

Must do in Cape Town. If you could only do one thing in Cape Town this would have to be it! The 360 degree views over Cape Town are spectacular, and you can really appreciate the staggering beauty of this coastal city.

The lines can be long. The lines get longer as the day progresses. It is not unusual to wait an hour to get your ride up the mountain. For some reason, coming back is not as back. Perhaps more people walk down than walk up.
Different. This cable car is different than others that we've been on. It rotates as it moves so that everyone gets a view in all directions, and several of the window panels are open.

Table Mountain Cableway. The cableway to the Table Mount is a unique experience - it rotates 360 degrees while going up or down making it possible to all passengers to see those breath-taking views of the mountain and Table Mountain bay. The only problem is parking your car - lack of organized parking and at times one has to walk for a long distance to the place where parking could be found. The other problem is the long queue get to the cable car. The splendor of the views is much above all that!!!
Very efficient. And the only way to get to the top. Best way to get there early in the morning as it gets crowded and the clouds settle in blocking the view of the town

Wonderful experience. Taking the cableway is part of the experience. It only takes 5 minutes and the views from the cable car are incredible. If you are planning on walking the trail I recommend you take the cable car up and walk down the trail. Then you have both experiences.
Smooth friendly ride.. The cable car moves quickly, but not so fast to make you miss any crazy mountaineers on the cliffs. The operators tell corny but funny jokes too. Make this mountain a priority!
Just one of those things, you have to so.. Wonderful experience and stunning views from the top. Rotating floor in cars, affords everyone with a perfect view on way up and down.

Don't bother booking in advance. The saving to book in advance, is R10 less than one US Dollar ... If your plans change or so does the weather... Ticket is timed and dated....no question when we visited on a Sunday Afternoon

Good way to go table mountain. Although we can just walk through to Table Mountain, taking cableway is always recommended. Using this convenient technology, we can get there at 5 minutes. Also feels thrill and terrific view.

Beautiful area. The cableway made it easier for my parents to join my husband and I on a day of light hiking and sightseeing. The views from the top were incredible, the trails well-marked and well maintained, and the staff friendly. My husband and I then left my parents to relax at the well-equipped cafe and did a slightly more challenging hike in the afternoon. A great day!

Choose a nice day. Wear a jacket. We had booked the trip, and had no choice but to go up there on a cloudy, rainy day, but it was interesting with the guide anyway. Wear a jacket, no matter what, and be prepared to pay over 200 rand (over $20) for a cable car ticket. But on good days, the view is spectacular.

Such a great view!. Brilliant cable car - the floor rotates so everyone gets to take in the view. No queues when we were there but I could image the lines could be longer in summer (consider booking on line).
Wow. The price is excellent value and the trip to the top amazing in a revolving cablecar. It doesn't get any better.

a ride upp. at the foot of table mountain the table mountain aerial cable way awaits you to take u up table mountain ,bring your camera along and shoot a video and noy pic .one may buy a good foto later.good . professional and friendly help is on hand . a safe way to get to the top

a comfortable way of getting to the top. if you been in the alps for skiing then you should know the feeling of hanging in the air. if you are not fit enough to climb the mountain up by the many paths the cable car is a perfect way of getting to the top. during the off peak season they often offer half prize on trip up after 6pm. but during peak season you have to stand in the line for a long time so be early if you have a chance

grand tour. its a magnificient cable car. very modern. floor slowly rotates 360 degrees to give the passenger every possible view. A bit costly - as per Indian standards. The more adventurous might want to go up the cable and then walk down- which I might have done myself had I been alone :)
Stupendous. The rotating floor of this cableway is incredible and the views of Cape Town and country surrounding were beautiful.
revolving car. Interesting ride up to Table Mountain. The car rotates so you get to see all the area around you. The cars are always full but if you're lucky, you can get a window view.
Great view. Be there early or late. 9 am seemed to be the peak time. Avoid that and you will find yourself more productive.
Fast and safe. We got there around 3-4pm, not too crowded (about 15min line). The cart turns 360*, so no matter where you stay inside it, for sure you'll get a great view!

Must do. Arrived only to find that there was a three hour wait for cable car, due to bad weather two previous days and more numbers than usual, 3 hour wait or 2.5 hour climb ?? well worth the effort, really good path, loads of people using it, but stick to the path, excellent views on way up and fantastic panoramic views from the top, plan on spending at least 1 hour on top just to get the most of it, chickened out and took cable car down, good facilities on top, reasonable priced food etc, all very clean and very helpful staff, consider that box well ticked.

A must do while in Cape Town. Weather depending, for obvious reasons so do prepare to have the chance of being disappointed in the summer months. Awesome experience though, very smooth ride up, especially the final ascent! Beautiful on top with panoramic views everywhere. I don't say this often but it is a literal 'must do' when visiting this beautiful city.

Great view, but overcrowded in the cabin. I had only two full days in Cape Town. As the online ticket was specified either morning or afternoon, I chose the morning ticket. But due to the bad weather it was cancelled for the first day. On the second day I couldn't make it in the morning, as the Robben Island ferry was delayed so much. Thankfully I was allowed to join the queue without online tickets in the afternoon. Fortunately the queue was very short, as it was already 4pm. It was a new experience for me to stand in a cableway which floor rotates. It was very good view but was rather overcrowded in the cabin and some people were pushing to get closer to the window.

The best view in Cape Town.. Friendly staff greets you on arrival. The trip up and down was amazing. The view from Table Mountain is amazing. The cable-car have rotating floors and offers 360 degree views whilst inside. It is weather dependent, but on a clear day one can see the whole peninsula, Robben Island and during the Winter the ice-capped mountains around the Winelands. Try to visit Table Mountain as soon as one arrives in Cape Town, to avoid disappointment due to bad weather.

A bird's eye view of Cape Town. On a clear day it is a great day out! Going up to Table Mountain is an exhilarating experience, The staff was friendly, informative and very funny. You are able to see different views no matter where you positioned in the Cable car as it rotates as it ascends. When you return you can buy a photograph or dvd of yourself going up. Quite pricy though!!Very safe so have no fear. An experience that's well worth the money. Lots of walking and photo opportunities once you reach the top. Food available to buy as well.

An eady way to travel. Friendly, quick and worth the experience. Of course one should hike up, and only return this way. The rotating car saves the pushing to get a front spot as soon that has changed.

A view to Thrill. We had journeyed along Chapman's Pass to Camps Bay. I checked the conditions on the mountain and the time on my watch. As the warmest part of the day approached we went into action. Car parked and our car attended engaged we made our way along the well worn road to the ticket office.'4 return tickets please'The cable car ride is great. The car rotates as it climbs the incline, allowing a view of CapeTown, the surrounds and the craggy mountain faces.Exit the station and it's another world. It's a Blast, literally. The wind is strong and cool to cold. Be prepared.We tramp all over the tabletop and are rewarded with clear views from all aspects resulting in excellent photos.We dine at the Cafeteria on the mountain. Good fun and wine.As my party make our way to the station for the return cable car ride the cloud moves in and the view is gone. We pass through the cloud on the way down to the base station.A truly great experience.

it helps. the online booking was very easy. we did it at the Airport Counter itself. the staff are very helpful. the rotating car gives everybody a chance to get 360 degree experience of the cape town view.

don't be fooled by the temp on the ground, it was very +++ cold and windy at the top but worth every bit of it.. No dislikes, could have stayed and walked the tracks all day. You can even walk some tracks from the ground up and cable car back but you would need time and fitness.

Crowded but so worth it!. We went during off season and it was still crowded. We hiked up (recommended) and it took us an hour and a half to hike it. Easy trail to follow, then it is nice being able to take the tram back down.

Pricey and not really an attraction in itself. The cableway is a pricey way to get to the top of Table Mountain. The ride itself is not really a thing to put on your bucket list. The view however is amazing and going to the top of Table Mountain is a must for everyone that visits Cape Town, but I prefer the climb. I did go during easter and the queues were not really a problem.

Great ride up Table Mountain. The ride up Table mountain is one of the best. The Aerial cableway rotates all the way as you are going up and down to ensure that everybody gets to see all the great views.

Out of this World Views. Cape Town is known for fickle weather.....soon as the clouds clear the mountain, head for the Cable Car to view one of the most incredible and breathtaking vistas on the planet. The cable car rotates 360 degrees so everyone on board isn't glued to one window. It can be extremely cold and windy at the summit, and the "table cloth" or clouds can roll back in minutes. From this height you can see Table Bay, Cape Town, False Bay and most of the entire peninsula - make sure your camera is fully charged - you will want to take dozens of pictures! There are hiking paths around the summit, along with benches to sit and admire the startling scenery. As the cable car is closed frequently due to inclement weather, make sure you check via their website or with your hotel before heading up there.

What A View..... The clouds finally broke... and we hurried up (with advance tickets) to catch the cable car to the top.....It's cold up there... FYI. The wind is brutal.... However, the view of the sea and of Cape Town cannot be beat......When the clouds finally did roll back in..... it was other-worldly to say the least.Worth the time for a ride up (you can also hike it, it you like).

GHreat views and a great way to get to the top of The Mountain. We booked tickets online in advance to avoid the queues but we were able to walk right through to the cable car as we went up in the morning.The car rotates through 360 degrees so there is no need to rush to a window.The ride is fast and smooth.

spectaculair!. Of course, you can hike up the mountain (as my husband did) and arrive at the top of the mountain completely wet of sweat or you can take a relaxed trip with the cableway. On the way up the cabin turns 360 degrees. The views are stunning and being so close to wall of the mountain is a very spectaculair experience. On top of the mountain are many paths to walk as well as a lot of view points.Going down the cableway went at full speed: within a couple of minutes we were down again.

Very fun way to get up and down the mountain!. Enjoyed a beautiful, sunny afternoon on Table Mountain and were so happy to take the cableway to get up and down! Parking is right thee, along with an organized flow for tourists. The floor of the cable car spins as you're ascending and descending so everyone can take in all of the views of the city and Table Mountain during the short ride up and down. Very nice!

No fear, this is a must do. My wife was unsure about taking the ride as she is a little unsure of any cable ride however when she actually got in the gondola all fears went away. Very smooth ride up & down, great views and the very safe construction allayed her fears. It's only a short ride to some of the most spectacular scenery in the world
Quick ride to the summit.. Good planning and interesting engineering with a rotating floor to give everyone a look at the changing scene.

Fantastic. This has to be the top of everyone's list of places to go and see.This will be my 3rd time and the ride and the view never fails to excite me. Go early, I repeat go early if you want to beat the coaches and the crowds get up early and check the weather before you go. Warning be prepared for a little wait no matter how early and the centre inside the car rotates so it does not matter where you stand the view is wonderful.
Escalating Wonder. I simply loved every bit of my upward journey to the table mountain's top with Aerial Cableway. Cooperative staff and efficient service.

Finally made it to the top!. After years of trying, I was finally able to make it up Table Mountain! When the weather is poor, the cableway will close, so be sure to try often when it Cape Town to ensure you can make it up. It's a must-do when in the area with breathtaking views. Great for all ages.

Breathtaking. We had great weather which made views enjoyable. Staff were great. The restaurant was disappointing as they need to organise this better when they have large groups of people. Other than that it was wonderful experience.

Long Wait. A great cable car ride up to Table Mountain. Although we had a 1 1/2 hour wait between purchasing tickets and waiting our turn for ride up to top. The ride up is spectacular and the floor spins(slowly, like a roof-top restaurant) so one can get a 360 degree view in a jammed cable car. If there are several non-operating days, do to wind or bad weather, once the weather is conducive for riding, the wait may be intolerable for some folks. The view at the top may erase any and all wait problems, it is spectacular. There is a place to eat at the top, so one could go a lunch time. If you're in Cape Town this is a must do.

Best place to celebrate your wedding anniversary!. We went up to Table Mountain via the Aeriel Cableway during September last year. At that time, there was snow on Table Mountain - a rare event as that happened not often. The sky was misty, so we could not see as far as we would like to, but it was never the less a wonderful trip. I love the fact that they took pictures of you before the trip that you can buy if you want to. It was expensive, but a wonderful something to keep to remember this experience. The ride was lovely and the mountain spectacular. When we arrived on top, it was bitterly cold and soon thereafter it started raining. Everybody scattered towards the restaurant and it was very busy inside. But, after a while we found a table and enjoyed a warm cup of coffee. When the rain was gone, we explore the mountain and saw several pouches of snow. Then we went back with the cable car.We want to go back there on a sunny day to see more of the spectacular views.
A MUST!!!. An amazing experience! It would be a real shame if you did not do the cableway while you visit Cape Town.
So much fun!!. We rode the cableway up and down the mountain. It rotates 360 degrees so it doesn't matter where you are standing you will get to see everything.

Spectacular. An absoulte must for visitors and locals alike. The view from the cable car and top of the mountain is breathtaking. Can get chilly on the top of the mountain, so take a jacket especially if later in the day. Twilight time is beautiful and watching the sun setting was very special.Definitely a must to visit this wonder of the world.

Very good experience but depends on your luck. We have been told by those who were lucky to take the ride that the experience is very good. The first day we found the ride closed due to gusting winds. We tried gain in the afternoon with no luck. The next day we landed up at the attraction by 10 am. we found a loooong queue for the tickets and an even loooonger queue for the entrance. After waiting for a half hour in the ticket queue we decided to call it quits when our guide told us that it would take us an hour and a half to get to ride to the top and that the queue at the top for the return ride would be even longer.
Endless views. A must do event when visiting Cape Town don't forget your camera. Book first and take the red bus from the waterfront,
Great view of the city. It was rotating 360 degrees so had great view all around. It was one of the early ones and not crowded, so was good.
If you miss this. you really missed the best of Cape town. Hope you have great weather to appreciate the view. Take a great camera, the photo ops are great

Great Expereince. The Aerial Cableway is large enough to accommodate many people. Once inside, you get breathtaking views each way. The best thing is the revolving cabin so dont bother looking for the ideal spot to stand. You will get a 360 degree view.

Amazing views and adventure.. Adventure for the family a great experience. Plan ahead for a clear day pack warm clothing and camera. It is a great way to see table mountain and the city with 360 degree panoramic views. Enjoy a warm drink before or above the trip it will help with the chills.

Beautiful !!. One of the perks when visiting my home country is visiting this magnificent tourist attraction. Ques were not long, trip up was magnificent. Everything is well signposted and lots of interesting fact panels on top of the mountain. Don't miss the opportunity to visit when you go!

This is a must when you visit Cape Town. The views from the cable car are great as you ascend. The car revolves, so you have a panoramic view of the city. You can see a huge part of Cape Town from the top. In summer, it is fantastic to take a picnic with and watch the sun set at 8pm, then it looks like fairyland over the city.
Great views. Since we were there in May, there were no lines and only a very short wait for the next cable car to come down. Breathtaking views of Cape Town.
Table Mountain Cable Car. It was a fantastic experience but felt for a local resident the fee was quite steep. The view was breathtaking and having a 365 degree revolving floor was awesome.

FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. June 2012....I am afraid of height to some extent, but this I could handle going up.....down a little panic, but awesome thrill, rotating floor made it all the more exciting. Great, great adventure experience for all was had.
Dramatic Trip. Starts half way up and climbs steeply. Enter through the exit to get to the lifts to the base station. Cabin revolves as it rises and takes you right to the top.

fantastic view!. We loved the cable car, it was such an amazing view and really lovely experience, even though I'm not fond of heights.The car that you go in is large enough not to feel clautrophobic, and the 360 degree windows are fabulous!I wouldn't have taken my daughter who was in a wheel chair though, as I felt it wasn't quite wheelchair friendly - but she wasn't with us at the time.
TABLE MOUNTAIN. Nothing beats the cable car trip up the mountain and then that magical view from the top. Absolutely awesome ! ! ! !

Cape Town's most stunning attraction. The cable car is a inexpensive and amazing way to get up or down Table Mountain. With my 3 kids age 9, 11 and 14 we were dropped off at bottom of Platteklip Gorge, about another 5 min drive along the road from the lower cable station. We walked up the mountain in just under 2 hours, had a very much deserved break up top, took in the views and took the Cable Car down. It was easy to buy the tickets up top, with only 2 people in the queue ahead of me. When it came time to go down, the wait was about 10-15 min, and then we were in the cable car on the way down.Tips: if you are climbing the mountain take double the water you normally would think you'd need. allow for 2 - 21/2 hrs. Bring a jumper - the weather can change unexpectedly.

Go on a sunny non-windy day. Get up early and buy your tickets for right then and there or buy them and return later. Suggest early ascent as parking is a bugger, you have to walk a great distance if you get there after 1030am. The cable car ride is spacious and terribly user friendly. It's a fabulous view of the entire Cape Flat and City Area. The walk among the fynbos and plant species only found in the Cape is a marvel. You can spend hours just slowly taking in the smells, view and chatting to other visitors. A must see if you've never done it before.
Do it!. Great views, great experience! Get there early to avoid queues - check if open first, can get windy then they stop running.

Great fun. My wife and I took the red bus round the city and jumped off at the Table mountain stop for a trip up the cableway. At the entrance staff take a photo that is later super-imposed onto a view of Table mountain that you can collect for a reasonable fee on the way out. We had great weather and therefore great views on the way up and down - the revolving floorway meant that visitors did not have to jostle for position.

Must do in Cape Tow. You must take the Cable car to the top of Table mountain (or you can climb it). The view is wonderful! There was a small queue but the line goes fast. The floor of the car turns so if you can get a window view you will be able to see 180 degrees. The Red line of the Hop on - Hop off bus stops at the Cable car.
Early the better. Amazing views when clear. The best time is in the morning. To our surprise it was cold when we got to the top.
Beautiful view. Even to the very nervous about heights (me) - this revolving cable car ride was quick and made one feel safe. The view going up and down is worth it -- take a camera!

Best Views. The views from the top is just amazing, the staff are quite friendly as well and it is amazing the amounts of people that they can handle. When the weather is clear and there is no wind, GO, the weather in Cape Town can change quickly and you don't want to miss the view!
Table Mountain Cable Car. Only came down it. Bit of a queue to get on but the cars are big and carry a lot of people at a time - and they go up and down very quickly.

Gotta do it - go first thing in the morning if it's operating.. If you go to Cape Town you need to take the cablecar to the top. It's windy as heck and very cold, but there is a coffee shop at the top where you can get something to warm you up while you wait for the clouds to blow past. Snap your pictures and walk around a little. Standing on top of Table Mountain looking down over Cape Town or over False Bay offer breathtaking views. And, the cablecar, which is round, rotates slowly so you get the full 365 degree view on your ride up and back down. I think the cost was $20 or $25 US per person.
