Go early if it is open...as the weather can change very quickly and they will close the cablecar due to high winds.

Up up & away. Having spent a wonderful first week of our Cape Town holiday at Winchester Mansions (reviewed) we transferred to The Bloomberg apts at Camps Bay (also reviewed) We did the Cape Peninsular & Winelands tours during our first week, leaving Table Mountain until the second, for two reasons - firstly the Bloomberg is located at the foot of The Twelve Apostles, therefore only a short taxi ride away & secondly, we had been advised to pick our day, based on the weather.On a beautiful sunny morning, with a light breeze, we booked our taxi for 11am, only to discover, half way there, signs stating that the cableway was closed, due to strong winds at the top.Undaunted, if a little surprised, we opted to try again the next morning, although we did not book the taxi until we had checked the status on their website (by then we had discovered, this is regularly updated)We did not book our tickets online, hence we had to queue for about 20 mins, before joining the actual queue for the cable car - not a problem as we were in the shade. Once in the main queue it's a different story, you are climbing steps as you move along, in full sun with nowhere to sit. It's interesting to see the original old cars, positioned along the way & helped to pass the 40mins or so,waiting.Once you reach the point where the queue goes inside, you are offered the chance to have a photo taken ( with a false backdrop ) which you can then purchase on return - cost about £10, includes 2 photos plus a DVD, good value for this type of thing.The queue then divides into 2 for the lifts, then everyone seems to be milling about waiting for the next car, meaning that on boarding people are appearing from everywhere, so you have to just get on, as & when you can (same on return)The car holds 60+ people, it does not revolve - the floor does! You cannot stand close to the sides so if you are short & in the middle, you probably won't see much during the 4min ride, worth bearing in mind when you board.There is a small souvenir shop on exit & a larger identical version next to the restaurant.If you intend to eat in the restaurant you spend another long time queuing & have difficulty finding somewhere to sit.There are guided tours at the top of various lengths - 30mins up to 90mins, depending on how far you want to walk ( obviously uneven & perhaps unsuitable for people with walking difficulties or pushchairs) We just wandered around, taking in the spectacular views,then queuing once more to go down. Other reviewers have already posted amazing photos & I am particularly grateful to those who did the tours & allowed me a peek at those I missed.Plentiful taxis available for the trip back to your accommodation after an unforgettable experience - well worth the R215pp
A fabulous experience. I strongly recommend that you take time to go to the top of table mountain. The views are great and the ride up with its rotating windows are amazing...

Always a Treat!. I had friends visiting from the UK and could not wait to show her off! And she was as impressive as always!! Couldn't fault a thing!! Wear comfortable shoes so you can walk around on top and enjoy all the vistas of the peninsula. Worth the R315 return!!

Wonderful views. This is a "must do" when traveling to Cape Town. The tram had beautiful views. We felt that it was well maintained and the though it was crowded, the line was handled effectively and we did not have to wait long to get on the tram going up or down. The walking paths at the top offer spectacular views and is definitely worth visiting.

Up, Up and Away. Waited on line for about 20 minutes before boarding. Cable car climbed up through the clouds and the experience was similar to being on an airplane. Very exciting. Once upon Table Mountain there were varying degrees of clouds and when they broke, the views of the harbor were magnificent.

Brilliant, but scary!. Loved South Africa and Cape Town, so couldn't leave without visiting Table Mountain. Sure you can climb, but the cable car was irresistible.
As the cable car goes up it also goes round to take advantage of the spectacular views, and just before you arrive on top, it lifts straight up!
Wonderful if you have the stomach for it.
Funny Cable driver!. The cable driver/guide we had was funny yet awesome. He made the tourist laugh ;) and get more comfortable as we go up to the Table Mountain.
Loved it. It was brilliant ,faster than it thought and very well executed. It also had a floor that turned so everyone got to see the great views going up and down

Spectacular!!! Amazing!!!! Incredible!!!. As a returning Capetonian, I am always awe-struck when I look at the majestic, towering, regal natural icon that is Table Mountain. The views of it and from it are breathtaking! The Aerial Cableway do a magnificent job of making a visit to Table Mountain pleasant and memorable. Sadly, my daughters were disappointed that there were no dassies (rock hyrax) in sight on the day we visited, but their clambering up and down the rocks and seeing a few lizards more than made up for it. The revolving floor in the cable car is a fantastic innovation. Just a wonderful experience.

Wow - World-class heritage site. What a fabulous attraction, haven't been up the mountain for many years. Took the kids for a family outing and we had a fabulous time. This is truly a world class attraction in SA!

A must do & see. I scored a clear day as the cloud was lifting. Short queues, limited crowds so easy to get around.The scenes from the mountain top are fantastic, but this would depend on the cloud cover.

Memorable experience. Loved this experience! What a view! You must do this when in Cape Town. We were lucky and bought our tickets on the day without waiting long, but others we know went the next day and it was chaos so prob best to prebook. The ride up/down really didn't take long at all, so even if you are afraid of heights you can just look at the floor and after a few mins the cable car arrives. There is a coffee shop at the top for a quick refreshment and some photo opportunities. Don't miss this.

Worth the trip. This was def worth the trip up and stay as long as you can. It was absolutely breathtaking!! The cable car was fairly quick and clean but I would suggest getting there early before the lines.
Brilliant experience. Great experience, the service was punctual. No issues at all. Luckily the weather was good. You have to visit if you are there.

Spectaular View. The wait can be long but it is worth it. We did not have to wait long as our guide had already purchased tickets for us. A nice feature is that the floor revolves letting you see all the views. Our guide told us where to stand so that we were one of first off.

Easy access to Table Mountain. The cable way is fast and allows 360 degrees view as you go up or down and allows everyone a chance to take photos. The photos taken just before you board can be collected when you return from table mountain. Its definetely easier than walking to table mountain.
Great Views. The views from the cable car are great you can see so much. Allow plenty of time as it can get very busy and check before hand if possible as it does close if the weather isn't good.

Awsome View. This was just brilliant. Travelled up to the top in the very big Gondola. Views were just stunning. Bought lots of memorabilia from the great gift shop at the top. Took some amazing photos.
Just the right speed. The turntable inside the car means everyone gets a chance to see the views from the cable car as it travels up/down. Definitely worth the ride.
It spins. The view is perfect as the trams spins. Everyone can see and there are open windows. You might have to wait in line so it is better to go before 10am.
Amazing views. Spectacular views on our way up to Table Mountain. We were like little kids just going Wow!!!! & giggling. This is a must do when visiting Cape Town

What a view. A must do for Cape Town. Table mountain is a fantastic visit. You can spend a couple of hours strolling around. Great views and photo opportunities. Make sure you book tickets in advance .

What an experience. Luckily we had good weather in Cape Town to make the most of the cable car and the views at the top of Table Mountain. Being a weekend it was busy (we went as part of an organised trip so didn't have to worry about queuing up for tickets thankfully) but it was really spectacular. The views as you go up and come down are incredible not to mention the views on top as well. Don't forget to keep a look out for wildlife at the top - particularly the cute dassies (the local name for rock hyrax).

Amazing Views. We managed to pick a bank holiday and glorious weather so there was a wait of around an hour to go up the cable way but it was well organised and most definitely worth the wait. The revolving car means you get to see all the views on the way up and when you reach the top you can enjoy even more spectacular 360 views from the top.

What a view. The view from the top of table mountain will amaze. The cable way to the top is definitely the best way to reach the summit. The operator gives a brief commentary on the way to the top and the cable car rotates to ensure everyone gets to enjoy the 360 degree views. A great experience!

A very long wait, but worth every minute. The day previously the cableway was closed, so it was jammed with visitors. However the whole cableway was well organised and the staff very helpful and resiliant. One on our way the trip was wonderful, the view from the top of the mountain is stunning, and we felt privelidged because the cloud kept drifting in, but we did have clear times. Intersetingly the cableway is identical to the one at Palm Springs in California, but Palm Springs seems to be much, much higher. If possible, visit both it is a real bucket list comparison.

Exquisite!. Exquisite site - the quick ride up the mountain provides unsurpassed view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Although on the expensive side, a well worth trip.Remember a jacket, even on a warm day - it is much colder up there that you think!

Worth a visit. Book in advance and you get some queuing advantages over those who show up on the day. Bring some water, a hat and sunscreen. It took us about an hour and 15 minutes queueing to get to the cable car. The trip up only takes a few minutes with the view from the top is quite spectacular.You can walk!

Fantastic views!. I am not a fan of heights, and I was a bit frightened initially on this cable car. But the driversaw my fear and invited me into his driver area and told me where to look. A must seeif you are in Cape Town. I was actually there in 2008, but the drop down menu heredidn't go that far. I recently realized I had not reviewed any of the places I hadvisited in Cape Town! An amazing place with a huge mixture of sights, people and emotionsas I visited.

Cozy and fun way to ascend. The two cars can be quite full but never over-packed. You might have to endure shot-hungry camera holders who bump and nudge to get their perfect photos but the experience is overall a good one as the trip offers stunning views. The cableway is well managed and felt safe. Arrive earlier in the day to avoid the long lines to board.
PICTURE POSTCARD VIEW. Easily accessible, well organised and of course fantastic view. Interesting facts on flora and fauna. Try to go towards evening, the last car and if you fit why not walk up?

Nearly missed it.... ...we didn't think it could be as great as it was. Don't miss it. We were advised to book online to avoid queues, and if we got a sunny clear day, to change our plans to fit this in. We did, and it was AMAZING!
Cable cars. Beautiful view going up and even better at the top.The cable car holds 65 people.Make sure it not a windy day.
Cableway to top of Table Mountain. A great experience. Well run facility easily accessed by SIghtseeing bus or taxi. Book in advance to save money and skip queues. Doesn't run when windy

BREATHTAKING TABLE MOUNTAIN!. Abolutely amazing views, even for me as a local, i appreciate our beautifull city. I have seen many amazing places but Cape Town has many natural sites. Easy accesable for people with special needs with a resturant and bathroom facilities. Very nice to take a picknick basket and enjoy a light meal or sun set and absorb the beatifull sights that we as Cape Towens are blessed with.

Worth the trip. We bought our tickets in advance after hearing horror stories about queing up for hours. As soon as the weather looked good enough we decided to go and we were not disappointed. There was no queue on our way up and we had an amazing view on a pretty clear day. You can walk around there for hours and really get lost in the scenery. There are a lot of information plaques you can read along your way, which makes it a very educative and interesting experience.The only thing is you need to be very patient with other tourists who are taking their time to stand in your camera's view. Most of the time 'oblivious' to the fact that you want or trying to take a picture without them in your holiday memories.On the way down there was a huge queue, but they deal with this fast and efficient and we didn't stand there too long.

Cable car. This was one of the most scenic views in cape town. The floor actually rotates. Its amazing.....The que is very very very long so plan ahead. Its not always open. The gift is over priced. At the top you see beauty...

Everyone gets the best view, eventually.. The gondola cars are large and carry many people. The unique feature is that the floor makes a complete circle as the cars ascend or descend, affording all a great view.No one should visit Cape Town and miss this feature!
Good, safe and professional. It was a very nice experience and having fear of hights, I was a bit scared. But the cable is solid and I enjoyed every moment of my 360 degree view

Great experience. While in the Cape Town, don't miss the cable car ride to the top of the Table Mountain. The view is spectacular. One way to beat the long queue at the ticket office is to purchase your ticket(s) on line or in advance at your hotel. The price is the same as at the ticket office. Dress well for the top. The the high elevation means lots of strong and cold/freezing wind. On some days the top of the mountain is covered with heavy clouds. The locals call it TM tablecloth.

Book first if you can. Plenty of trips but big queues if you have not booked. Queues are pretty well managed but the numbers can be huge if a cruise liner is in! Worth checking out the Mountain is clear and then book on the internet just before you go up there. Take the hop on / off bus it's cheap, frequent and a sight see as well!
Great views. Great views from the top, no queues or waiting when we visited going up. Small wait coming down but nothing major. Staff were friendly.
Not to be missed. All positive - lots of photographs up and down. Buy your tickets in advance to save queuing. A great experience

Great Views. The cars rotate and provide a great view of the city. It is by far the most convenient way to get to the top of the mountain. The climb is really for people in very good shape. Our 25 year old son, who is in good shape loved it. If you are not in good shape, I dont recommend the climb. It is very vertical and rugged. The cable car is safe and well run.

Best view of the city!. I love the cable car, and I have a yearly travel card which allows me to do the trip as many times as I like, which is great. However, one downside to the cable car is that during the summer they have a sunset special which is half price to do a return trip (this is a great deal), but you are unable to book the tickets online. Which means that when you arrive, you have to join a queue, which we stood in for over an hour. If you have a membership card, you don't have to stand in the queue, but as we were with overseas guests, they needed to purchase a ticket. The point being, the special is supposed to begin at 6, and at 6.10 they still had not opened the ticket office, which delays the whole process. People still have to cross the road and get into another queue which is altogether a timely matter. This meant that we only got on the cable car at 7.15, which didn't leave much time to enjoy the sunset. I therefore think they can improve the efficiency of the whole process.However, I love the cable car and the staff are fantastic, as they are always really friendly and enthusiastic about you coming to experience Table Mountain. You are allowed to take your own picnics up the mountain which is great, as once you have found a good spot at the top to watch the sun setting, the views are incredible- you won't get a better view of Cape Town!

Fantastic experience. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip to South Africa. Fantastic views with good interpretation to add to the visit, the whole experience was well worth the wait in the queue ! Suggest you get there early if you can as you can be about an hour or more in the queue from 10.00 onwards.

A BIRD'S EYE VIEW OF THE CAPE PENINSULA AND BEYOND. Being Capetonians we love our mountain and always take visitors up the cableway to enjoy the panoramic views of the City and its surrounds. We prefer to go up in the late afternoon (weather permitting) and come down in the early evening. This allows one to not only enjoy the scenery during the day, but also to watch the sunset and to see the lights of greater Cape Town switch on.I would recommend that visitors do this earlier rather than later in their stay as it enables one to get one's bearings and put the City and its surrounds in perspective from an excellnet vantage point.

Up and away.... A must do in Cape Town, the cableway trip to Table Mountain was a great way to spend a couple of hours. We went early in the day when the winds were calm, and had purchased tickets in advance through the hotel concierge. This eliminated disappointment due to wind closure, and avoided the relatively long lines. Still, there is a line and it takes 30 minutes or more to make it on to the tram, even on a good day, I understand. The views from the top are great, and afford a nice perspective on Cape Town and the surrounding area.

Its a must in Cape Town. Its a must in Cape Town and I would love to go again and again. It has a large platform which revolves 360 degree and give a chance to view the beauty of the surroundings to everyone.
Wonderful views. Beautiful views from all atound Cape Town and its region. Funny giant hamsters passing by and nice perspective on Cape Point. A must do in Cape Town

Interesting revolving cable car. I don't think walking to the top of Table Mountain is an option for most of us so we take the cable car. It is very large and holds a lot of people. Interesting in that it revolves around so everyone gets all views.

One of the best places in Cape Town. When in Cape Town there is one stop you have to make.The Cable Car is one of the most popular attractions in the Mother City.I live in Cape Town and have been up about 10 times just because it relaxing and you can never get tired of the views.The car itself is modern and the floor rotates so you will always get a 360 degree view. At the top there is a nice restaurant and if you are the picnic type, there are tons of rocks you can go sit on and get a great view of the city.I can go up again and again and will never get tired of being on Table Mountain and seeing those views.

Cable Car. Views are great and exciting to experience a revolving cable car. Unfortunately, a little expensive I feel, especially for local South Africans. That is the problem with most tourist attractions in SA, they don't give a more affordable rate for locals, quite sad actually!

Great way to get to the top!. The best time to go up to the top is about an hour before sunset, then you can get the sunset special - two tickets for the price of one. It doesn't seem to be too crowded at this time of the day and you can take a picnic and a bottle of wine and watch the sun sink into the ocean. There are spectacular views out over Cape Town also. Well worth a look. The cable car rotates so to get a good picture of the city just stand on the edge of the car. Take up a good camera with you!

Go on Red bus Sunday morning. If you don't have a car, the next best thing is the 1st Red bus (Sunday morning very quiet) which only stops in the city 3 times then travels direct to TM. OK, this place will always be busy but only waited 5- 10mins from buying ticket to getting on the cableway. Views are stunning but if, like me, having the floor moving at the same time is not your thing, stand on the central part.
Good efficient service.. Easy to book online before you travel. Cheaper as well! Very efficient, quick and great views! Well worth it.

the only way. If it's clear of the tablecloth, this is a must-do. The walk looks pretty tedious and steep and is very exposed and life is too short. Initially put off by what appeared to be long queues actually they move very quickly, and you don't even need to jostle for position in the car as it rotates giving everyone a chance for a nice view. I mean they could rip you off as you can't go to CT and not get to Table Mountain but they don't and it's all done very well and efficiently and up top there is room to spread out and lose the crowds as most people just hang around the upper station.
What a view !!. This is a to do that you will never forget , see and feel the majestic ocean , the surrounding mountains , robbenisland in the distance , Feel the cold up there ,
Day trip. One of the best things to do in South Africa. Not pricey at all and a experience you will never forget!

We go Down Down and Down :). The Cableway from Table Mountain is pretty new and offers a nice service. The queue is normally pretty long to go up and I can recommend to once climb up Table Mountain and to take the Calbeway only for your way back!We made it this way and it was just awesome to have the beautiful nature and scenary on the way up and then the fantastic cableway ride on the way down again when you are anyways exhausted and tired :)

Be early. Weather is a factor here we were held up for 4 days by winds and cloud,I was wanting to absail the moutain,When conditions like this happen you get a build up of people all awaiting to travel by cableway hence the large queues so be early, pity they don't forward the absailing people as it can take over one hour to board the cableway,It is a fun trip take a hat sunblock and weather can change later in the afternoon cloud hence table cloth moutain,Trip is amazing with fantastic views you will have great pictures enjoy.

Queues are long - ask yourself why!. Why? Because it's worth it! Try to arrive early if you plan to spend a half day up top, walking and exploring. Otherwise, later on the queues shorten, and you can enjoy a couple hours doing a bit of wandering, and even have a sundowner, with spectacular views. This is a "must do" when coming to Cape Town. Depending on weather, it's best to plan this early in your visit, so you can get a visual map of the whole area - the views are stunning and vast - all the way down to Cape Point. Hint: we have wind here. If you wake up and it's windy, avoid disappointment by calling before going to make sure the cable car is running. The sun is vicious here - wear a hat and slap on that sun block frequently!

An absolutely must when in Cape Town. To understand the unique structure of Table Mountain, which one can't see from the frontal approach, one needs to take the cable car to the top of the mountain and walk along the safe pathways to get an almost 360 degree view of the city and surrounding suburbs as well as Robben Island. The Dassies (closely related to the Elephant) are cute, but bite, so beware.Depending on the season, the change in temperature between the lower cable way and the top of the mountain can be quite different, so always take something warm. As the weather in Cape Town can change quite rapidly, (four seasons in one day) my suggestion is that on the first clear and windless day, your first trip should be the Table Mountain cable car. Walking up the mountain is only for the very experienced.

Stunning views. Table Mountain is now one of the wonders of the world and it is definitely a must for tourists to Cape Town . The easiest way to get to the top of the mountain is by Cableway which turns 360 degrees so everybody can experience the fantastic views over Cape Town.Be sure to wear sunblock and be prepared to wait in long queues during the peak season but it is well worth the wait. If the south east wind is blowing hard give it a miss on that day.For locals the entrance is free on the day of their birthday.
Cableway. A trip to Cape Town is not complete until you've taken the Cableway to the top of Table Mountain. Awesome views of this beautiful city.
Indeed a seventh wonder of the world. Its a must see if you in cape town. Breath taking view from the top. Your trip is not complete without a a trip

Well worth it. Although you will have to deal with waiting in long queues, the staff are friendly and try to get you up the mountain as soon as possible. Remember your hat and sunblock and something warm. Old and young will love the stunning view from the cableway,made extra special thanks to the floor that turns 360 degrees. Arriving at the top you will be spoilt for choice with spectacular views and it is well worth it.

Take a hat, and plenty of sunblock. Great organisation, but there are liable to be queues, both at the bottom and top. Don't worry about where you stand in the cable car - it turns 360 degrees during each trip, so everyone gets a good view.

Good fun.. The whole Table Mountain area is stunning. The trip up and back on the Cableway was very cool. The floor rotates so everyone gets a good view. The driver had a great sense of humour and cracked some good lines.Great views and a great way to get to the top. Hint is get there early. It's very popular so the queue can be very long.

Terrific Views-A Must See!. The ride up the mountain was not scary. It moved quickly and smoothly. We had a beautiful day. I would think it would be a waste of time when the mountain top is covered with a cloud. The views are spectacular. You can see out both sides of the mountain. The rock is sedimentary and the mountain was formed by a fault. It runs several miles up the coast of S. Africa. There are several paths to take for different viewpoints on both sides. We enjoyed finding the little furry Dassie, rock rabbits, among the rocks. They and the birds were readily available for pictures. Besides the views, there are numerous kinds of plants to view. A Must See on a good day!

Amazing view. We took the cable car later in the afternoon so there was quite a line up but the staff and service and running of the cars were very efficient we were onour way up in no time .The views were tremendous and the ride was very smooth.Anyone afraid of heights would feel quite comfortable.The windows rotate so photos can be taken and the scenery when you reach the top is incredible worth the trip .

What a spectacular attraction in Cape Town!. This was my 2nd time in Cape Town and it is a breath-taking place to visit. The first time we were there in June and Table Mtn had a "blanket" on most of the time. This time the prominence of the mountain couldn't have been displayed more beautifully, with crystal clear, blue skies. I had been reluctant to take the cableway to the top because of the long lines and the time involved. However, the lines moved very quickly.Having purchased my ticket on-line, saving both time and money, I got directly into the queue for the aerial cableway. It took about 30 minutes to get from start to the cable-car loading area. Once at the top there were all sorts of areas for viewing the Cape peninsula in all different areas. The view of Cape Town and V&A Waterfront was spectacular. There are lots of beaches that can be seen from the top. There are wild flowers, a huge variety of Fynbos, over 2000 species on Table Mountain, making it a joy to walk on the paths.Because I was also visiting the Victoria and Albert Waterfront area that day, I allowed about 2 hours on the top before heading back to the cableway for transitioning down. That was not enough time, as one could easily spend several hours there enjoying the views, plants, birds, and other critters. It was very warm on the top as there was very little wind to cool the area...and this was in March!It took about 30 minutes to wind through the lines to get back down. I would recommend taking some snacks and water along with you. Fortunately, I took a private driver and car to the entrance so didn't have to hike a long distance up the hill. Much more time needs to be planned if you don't have a driverI highly recommend making the time to visit, particularly on a clear day. You will not be disappointed.

Best Views in The Cape. Ticket office moved fast as did the loading of passengers into the cable cars. parking was a bit of a nightmare but you could always take a cab there and back. Curio shop afterwards felt a bit like a gauntlet but the small negatives were far overwhelmed by the brilliant views, flora, etc.

great experience. I had heard a lot before I travelled to Cape Town about the Table Mountain and the view from there, etc. And I actually was pumped up to be at one of the modern 7 wonders is an experience in itself.
Veery very steep.. This is the steepest cable car ride I have ever taken, some people may find it a little scary. The ride is well worth it when you get to the top of this magnificent mountain.
"Breath taking views from above". The cable car ride was absolutely amazing with the most beautiful views of the big blue ocean & the city.

On top of the world. We went up for the sunset, and the weather was perfect, just the odd cloud for colour, a cool breeze and not a drop of rain. However, we booked online and paid the full amount, what we were not told was if you go direct to the mountain and pay there after 6 pm it's heavily discounted, (but be aware I think we struck it lucky and there were no crowds).
quick. for 215 rand two way ticket up the mountain, been there twice during my stay, mustsee in Capetown. Go there before 18.30 h, cable closes after that

Table Mountain Cable Car Ride. The cable car trip was exciting and the views were beautiful. The inner part of the car slowly rotates, so you will get to see 360 degree views as you ascend and descend the mountain. Go early so you have plenty of time at the top and use sunblock, as it is BRIGHT up there.

A Ride With a 360 Degree View. The aerial cable ride gives you a close up view of the mountain and a complete view of Cape Town as you ascend to the top while the floor of the cable car rotates a full 360 degrees during the ride to the top. Anywhere you stand affords you a complete view. Unique way to see everything without even turning your head!
Nice visit. Go there in the afternoon to avoid que. Nice to walk up on the hill. Cable car is easy and quick. Fantastic view
great ride.fabulous view. The cableway actuslly rotates to give you 360 degree views of cape town and table mountaim.fast ascent and decent.price was reasonable
Awesome. The service is very efficient, the view was breath taking and well worth the money. Just remember to take a jacket with you as the weather can change at any moment.
Excellent scenic ride. The revolving cable car enabled all passengers to get excellent views. Unfortunately, the ride was a bit short and we would have preferred a slower, longer ride.

Great View!. Staff at the Cableway were very nice and very efficient - moving people along the queues well. The Cableway ride itself is quite spectacular, even for someone like me who is not a fan of heights (look straight out - don't look straight down). The floor of the cable car rotates, so everyone gets a view of everything.There are lots of walking trails once at the top of Table Mountain and plenty of opportunities to take some beautiful photos.We visited the souvenir shop after the ride back down on the Cableway. It gets very crowded when a cable car arrives (the exit take everyone through the souvenir shop). But we found many of the typical souvenirs (magnets, shot glasses, shirts, postcards, etc) here. We purchased a magnetic bottle opener here, and unfortunately, it broke after the first time we used it! Very disappointing.We found the Cableway to be a great way for us to visit Table Mountain in a few hours.

Go up early!. Visited Capetown in February 2014 with family and not being a fan of heights was not looking forward to this ride. It's a bit like Visiting Paris and not being able to say you went up the Eiffel Tower so you have to do it! We arrived early taking one of the first cable cars up. Clear, cloud free morning and the ride up was not that long or scary to be honest. Up top the views are breathtaking but I won't say I ventured too near the edge as did the family just to wind me up. We had good breakfast in the restaurant and spent some time and Rand in the souvenir shop. A morning was long enough and spent much of the last week looking up from the beach with a sense of achievement saying "See that, I've been up there!"

Amazing. An amazing attraction that reminded me of my town, Rio De Janeiro.The cable cars are a great way of seeing the whole of Cape Town! And you get to walk (a lot) around the top of Table Mountain. Just be sure to take a coat with you, otherwise you might freeze up there!

worth using. It was really tough to get a change to go on this cable car due to excessive wind, we got the change on 3rd day. The cable car itself is very scenic. as it goes up you start enjoying the really feel of the place. it was quite spacious also.
A scary ride up to the summit. It was a little scary to take Cable car up to the summit. I’m a little afraid of high places, but if you dare to look, you have a good view.

Thrilling Ride with Spectacular Views. This cable car ride was really well done - the smooth ride, the gorgeous views, and the covered sides (most of them) make for a great way to get to the top. The brief time you're exposed to the air is enough to be exhilarating, but not too much wind. The car rotates so you get to see everything from every angle!

Up in the Clouds. This is an amazing experience. You cannot go every day as it is dependent upon the weather. the top of the mountain is covered with clouds. There is a nice restaurant on the top of the mountain and the food is very reasonable. The cable cars rotate 360 degrees so everyone gets a good view of the areas. amazing Views.

360 Degree Vies :0). What a wonderful way to travel up the Mountain. The cable car floor swivels around 360 Degrees so everyone gets an opportunity to see the entire trip up and down. Fabulous trip and one not to miss but watch out for windy days as it closes early!

Great pothole free ride to the top. enjoyed the rotating floor of the cable car giving an opportunity to view all sides of cape town. amazing that it can take up to 65 people. bump free, smooth ride to the top
Just amazing. If you're in Cape Town, this should definitely be on your to do list!!! The cable car rotates 360 degrees and the views from the top of Table Mountain are amazing!!

One of the Best Cablecars. This is one of the best cablecars that we have been on. It was fast, efficient, safe and comfortable. It rotates so that all may see in every direction. The views are fantastic.
We had a warm, sunny and clear day to visit Table Mountain. On such a day the views are wonderful - well worth a visit.

Awe-inspiring. Everyone gets a chance to take a beautiful shot of the surroundings with this cable car since it revolves 360 degrees. The ride to the top takes only a couple of minutes, and it's worth every penny going up. Choose a clear, sunny day to go and you'll be rewarded with awe-inspiring views of Cape Town and the mountains. You can even see Robben Island. Totally recommended. If you miss this, don't even bother visiting Cape Town.
breathtaking. The view you see ,is just breathtaking,majestic what a beautiful country we live in.The place is absolutely amazing and amazing staff too.

Starting point to get your bearings.. A must do if you are visiting Cape Town for the first time! Go early morning and miss the crowds. Take a jacket as it can get cold up there. The restaurant is clean and has a variety of foods but don't make this your lunch stop! Views are spectacular and the staff are friendly. well worth the money spent.

Rotating to the top of a wonder !. A fantastic experience if you have a sunny day. Efficient and really good with the rotating floor so you could take it all inn. Not crowded, or unpleasant even with more than 60 people.
MUST DO. ABSOLUTE MUST DO! If you don't do Table mountain in your Cape Town Trip, you might as well not come.

Easy ride to the top.. We arrived early in the day, before the crowds. The tram turns while you ascend and descend. That enables all to see the views. Not being able to hold on is a little disconcerting. Always felt safe. Would definitely riding at least up.

an experiance of a lifetime. The best way to see the mountain is by using the cable-car. If you get up in the morning and the weather is great its a must. Do not delay it until the next day as the weather can turn and you may not have the opportunity again.
Go in the afternoon. Queued fro 2 hrs in the morning from 10-12am spent 2 hrs on the mountain came down & there was NO queue my advice go mid afertoon & avoid the rush

Fabulous views. There can be VERY long queues. We got there at 8 30am and queued for about 30 mins. By the time we came back down the mountain at 11 30 the queue was horrendous! The revolving floor is brilliant, ensuring everybody gets a good view for photographs.Make sure you go on a clear day for stunning panoramas.

It was worth it. Pros: great views of cape town, lots of pathways to explore the top, which is actually larger than one might think
Cons: long waits to go up and down - in the sun
Spinning!. The cableway was spinning around, that was awesome, we could see the whole environment. And it just took around 2 minutes to get up to the top.

Go Early. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a must see when visiting Cape Town. The important thing is to be prepared to set off early when the mountain top is clear as the famous 'tablecloth' can appear very quickly and there are many days when the cable car doesn't run due to winds or poor visibility.The view from the base station is great but the view from the cable car and at the top are even better. Do take time to explore the fauna and flora at the top. We say many rare indigenous flowers and animals. Be prepared to keep your eyes open otherwise you will miss the important part of the Table Mountain experience.

On a good day, best thing you can do in Cape Town. The views from Table Mountain are sublime. On a good day this is the best thing you can do in Cape Town.Consult a website like windfinder or www.yr.no which gives you a detailed weather forecast. This will allow you to plan your visit. Maybe it is cloudy in the morning but if you know it will clear up later you could plan your visit accordingly and might get lucky with a beautiful sunset.

Turn around, around, around and around again. It's a cabe way with a cabin that turns around while going up (or at least the floor is turning around). At the beginning you see Cape Town getting smaller and Table Mountain approaching and we go down its just the opposite.

I understad why this is number 1. Brilliant view over Cape Town, worth the time and money. We where lucky to have no queue and came up quite fast. It is worth spend some time walking around on the mountain on the landscaped aisles.
Table Mountain, Cape Town. long lineups but moves quickly.well worth the trip!Can get very windy on some days so dress prepared

Much better that climbing. Worth using. The car turns 360 degrees so that all passengers get a view of the bay and the mountain. If you're a short person just make sure that you stand close to a window.

The Best view in the world. The view from the top of Table Mountain rivals any view elsewhere in the world. The cable car is really busy but the queue moves very swiftly. Safe and exciting - ride to remember

Beautiful views. This cost us around £10 each to go up the cable car which really was worth it for the views alone. You can potter about up there for as long as you like.The floor of the cable car rotates so you also get a 360 view on your journey up the mountain which stops everyone claouring towards one window.We went up around 6pm for the sunset and stayed up there for about an hour. There is a bar so you can buy a bottle of wine and enjoy the views or have a walk about.You can walk all around the summit so you get 360 degree views which are astounding.Look out for the dassies which are like little guinea pigs. Very sweet.A trip to Cape Town is incomplete without visiting Table Mountain.

The "only" Way to get to the Mountain. The cable car has a revolving floor that makes it different from any cable car we've tried before. It's only a short trip but goes up very steep, much better than walking up! Some stunning views on a clear day and the café at the top is excellent.

Views can't be beaten. Its very true how quickly the weather can change in Cape Town.....we were there for just under 5 days and on only 2 of them was the weather good enough to warrant going up the mountain.Buy your tickets online and they are valid for a week which means if the weather is good you can dash up the hill at any time.Buying online is also slightly cheaper than in person and will avoid some of the queues but a lot of people can't really be avoided particularly if the weather is good. However the further you walk away from the cable car area the quieter it will get.If you want to go for a walk or walk down then make sure you wear comfortable shoes...there are paths but you may want to clamber onto boulders for better views and photographs.The cable cars take 65 people at a time and are quick so queues quickly go down but its one car up as the other comes down. You may also experience queues to get down particularly around sunset a very popular time to be on the mountain.Remember to keep your ticket for your return journey and to keep an eye on the last car down otherwise you may have a long walk back...Parking is available on the road but its pretty chaotic and maybe not for the fainthearted so you may want to get the HOHO bus or take a taxi. The first car park you come to may have spaces but remember its a long walk uphill to the lower cable car station.You get amazing views of Cape Town from this road anyway so if you are short of time/money this is always an option...you just won't get the views of Camps Bay and down the penisular.
Worth the wait in line!. A great cableway ride followed by spectacular views of Cape Town and the ocean. Definitely worth the wait in line.

Cautionary Note. Straight away let me say that when you get up there Table Mountain is brilliant, particularly if you are one of the few who make it further than the footpath around the visitor centre. My cautionary note is about the ground station. We had to wait 3 days for the cableway to open due to wind/weather and had very little option but to go the following morning. Well, so did just about every tour company in Cape Town due to backlog! A 2 hour queue in high temperatures followed with little shade in places. There is a 2-queue system for those with and without paid tickets and I can say without doubt that it made no difference if you were in either as you end up in the same bottleneck. Staff were even allowing large pre-booked school parties to queue jump and were pretty dismissive of complaints. Moral here is go later in the afternoon if you can!

im not too good with height, but well worth trying to over come your fear, the view was amazing.. If you are like me and not good with height the cable car does revolve, to allow everyone a fab view, stand in the middle of cable car much better, enjoy the view when you get out on top.

Top tourist attractions. Table mountain cable car was well worth the effort and money for a big family outing. It was a anxious but safe time with the revolving floor offering a complete veiw of the city bowl.

Stunning views. Easy to get to, particularly if you take the Red Bus, can buy tickets online and skip the lines, tram was high-tech including a revolving floor so everyone gets a view, the vistas from on top are stunning. Gorgeous.

A must!. I originally was going to climb Table Mountain, but circumstances prevented it, so I took the cable car. Once you get up top, there are all sorts of walks you can do...and a very nice cafe! Stunning views in all directions.
Great views. Easy to find, easy to get up, lovely walk at the top and a great cafe at the top. Recommend you there early (8) to avoid lengthy queues.

Great way to ascend the mountain. The table mountain cableway provides excellent views as you ascend the mountain. Especially great on a clear day. They won't operate if it's a windy day. Once at the top there are nice walking trails to explore.
A 360 degree view. Well organised queues which seemed to move quite quickly. Liked the revolving cable cars so that everyone gets a good view.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. The service is good and no queues if get tickets online. But if there are clouds on the Mountain they can drive you up and immediately down, as happened with us, so we wasted the tickes.
The rest is good

A must see. Ideal to go when it's clear but should the clouds come, a very interesting visit is in store with great photo opportunities.The unique gondolas rotate while travelling affording each traveller a panoramic view. Even the gondola departure or base yeilds beautiful views. Some unique wildlife up top provide additional photo ops. Easy to spend hours exploring trails. Good food for reasonable prices at mountain-top cafe. Good beer and wine also available.Tip: buy tickets online to avoid queues during busy season.Tip 2: come prepared with a jacket as weather up top can change quickly.Compliment: our online tickets did not print well and bar code would not read but staff were very helpful, patient and friendly while sorting it out for us. Even called hotel concierge where tickets were booked for us to get necessary info. Very impressed: Thankyou!

Breathtaking landscapes and views. The entire journey is a fun. Reaching there by taking the ride on the City Bus (open top double decked).Next the trip to the Table Mountain wit a cable way, watching the most amazing landscapes along the ride. And finally taking those fresh breaths atop the grand mountain, surrounded on one side with the 12 Apostles and in front lies the mammoth ocean.

Great way to get up table mountain.. Very neat tram to the top of Table Mountain. The floor rotates giving everyone a great view of the city 360°. Simply amazing experience at the top and I would hope everyone has a chance to experience it.
Fun Ride. It is a fun ride up the mountain and not a bit frightening plus some very nice views if you can get close to a window as there are always lots of people in the Cable Car.
wholesome experience. it what everybody should experience before you die,i never regretted it,love to go back again&again.

Awesome. What an experience not to be missed. We went up the mountain in January wonder views I am a bit scared of heights but wasn't frightened at all .The cable car feels very safe it is amazing how it turns to let everyone on board get a look at the wonderful views. It was a very clear day you could see for miles. On the top you can see all round at the most amazing scenery, a lovely cafe and gift shop are at the top. So glad I did this would do it again as there is such a lot to see .
Exhilerating!. The ride up this funicular is fabulous and the views as you go up are unsurpassed...until you get to the top, then WOW!

What a view. Lived here in 1986-89 and the trip in the cable car is well worth the wait. The view over Table Bay to Robben Island is stunning. Although the cable car has been updated i'm sure the view will remain the same.

Breath taking. Breath taking views from the revolving cable car and from the top of the mountain, this is a must do when visiting S. Africa, it was unexpected but at the top s a beautiful little cafe with great food and beer!

Spellbounding Experience on Rotating Aerial Cableway. This Cable way will take you to heaven and this place Table mountain is fantastic and Really Natural 7 Wonders of the Nature.Amazing to touch and feel the clouds on top of Table mountain and had an excellent time out on the top.

WOWW!!!!. this cable car trip up to what seems to be the top of the world is breath taking!it is well run and simple --the bus drops you at the cable car office and then you re off---there wasnt any queue when i went .it was busy but didnt feel like that once you are on the top---you can walk away from the crowds and feel totally free!
Not for the faint-hearted. The most seen in the least amount of time. Not for the faint-hearted, but a must-do bucket-list item in the Fairest Cape

Beautiful scenery, excellent experience. Cable car was fun.. Guess my trip was the right time of the year as there were no long lines and the experience was really wonderful.Phenomenal views going up and at the top. You can see Cape Town and outer Townships. The view of Robben Island and the coast is fantastic. This was a wonderful experience not to be missed if you are traveling to Cape Town.

Revolving cable car..!!. Concept remains the same as mount Titlis. You have a big cable car that also revolves, offering you a 360 degree view while going up and down the cable way. One difference though, would be the amazing sense of humour of the operators of this one. Both of them ( up and down ) were funny, friendly and good natured. Your probability of gettin the view depends on the weather. Just pray that you group on a sunny day. Brilliant view of the city below. Spectacular.
Better Than Walking.. I am glad we had vip queue service, because the line for this cable car was very long and very slow. The weather can be chilly, so bring a jacket. Be prepared for a great view.
A world class experience, not to be missed. Views are fantastic. If you are in cape Town and wish to go up the Table then take the first cloudless opportunity, don't put it off!!

Spectacular views ..... This is a great attraction but you are at the mercy of the weather as to whether or not it is open. Even on the sunniest of days the wind can be too strong so take this tour early at the first opportunity that you get. The views are amazing and the fact that the cable car revolves means that everyone gets to see the entire panoramic scenery.

Breathtaking Panoramic Views. Fantastic scenery when one is on top of the mountain. Pity there are still some disrespectful visitors not adhering to the "bin your rubbish" signs!!! Beautiful flora and rocky walkways where proper footwork is a must! An extremely hot day in February with 38 degrees C. I did not like the Cable Car operator squeezing as many passengers as possible into the Cable Car.

Spectacular a "must to visit" if in Cape Town. Wow, what an afternoon out.....The weather was amazing when we visited a fabulous clear and sunny day. We drove up to the mountain parked up, plenty of parking keep going to the top car parks although when in high season can be very busy, but you can drop off anyone by the main ticket office and shops if walking difficult before you park, the drive up is great. We already had tickets booked by our hotel guest relations on the web for us and no extra cost. But def recommended to do this if you can or pre book on line before you fly out as saves another queue at the sales/ticket office. Having a pre booked voucher means you can join the queue for the cable car straight away.The queue can look a bit much but it really moves quickly. There are shops before you board for water refreshments etc.The cable car is fantastic, and great staff on board giving information. The cable car rotates so you get great views on the way up. Get straight to the windows on the cable car for great photo opportunities. Once up on the mountain it is fantastic you get an amazing view over Cape Town, lots of walks and paths to take to take in the views.Great photo points too. If adventurous you may want to take try and do some abseiling...We went in March and quite warm even up that high on the mountain , wear sun screen as can easily get burnt without knowing. There is a restaurant up on the mountain easy to get drinks and food if you need and still very cheap and plenty of places to sit down and relax.Guides available that do walking tours to give you lots of information no cost.Truly a great place to visit, the mountain is really big and very relaxing taking in the lovely forms, flowers and the awesome views. We loved it! :) so much :) :)

Unorganised chaos. Queue for tickets ok and organised - queue for cable car a shambles with no thought for people queuing first actually getting on the cable car first - stairs were opened up to all as a free for all which resulted in families and parties being split up - needs to be organised properly

Up and away. This is the only way up to the top for travelers. The view at the top of the mountain is spectacular, but be prepared for a long, long wait. The best time to go is after 3 pm, when the crowds lessen and the wait is shorter.

Superb, but do get your ticket before joining queue. The obvious suggestion is only go when the mountain is not covered in cloud and on a very hot day with many queueing do buy your ticket before find out you need one when you reach the cable car !. We didn't. The cabins revolve as the accend and decendy thus everyboby gets full vies of Cape Town and Cape Bay. The views from the top are superb. Do go.
Prepare to queue. Amusing attendants when you get on. Warned of queues but we were lucky. Temperamental to the high winds.

Good. Good for kids, and if you're lazy, or both, or have lazy kids or all together. The nice thing is that the cablecar turns around, so it doesn't really matters where you are you get to see everything.

Don't miss this experience of a lifetime. quick tip, buy your tickets online so you don't have to wait in the queue as in season you could wait up to an hour or more just to get a ticket from the ticket office. I have been up many times but the experience is truly a once in a lifetime thing. The guys who drive the cable cars are very professional. It has the most amazing view going up and it is truly deceiving how high it is. the rotating floor is a bonus and if you are a little scared of heights never fear because you can stand in the centre by the controller and the ride is quick, it will be over before you know it. And the view at the tops worth every bead of sweat :)

Definitely worth it. It was efficient and fast on the way up, however there was a power failure while we were at the top and had to wait for almost two hours to get down!! They got the generators working but then had to test them ....However we were kept informed, we were given bottles of water and the staff could not have been more helpful
Rotating floor!. Its teh first time I've ever been in a cable car with a rotating floor! What an excellent experience and one that wil have you shouting 'Again, again'! highly recommended
Must do!. The view that you get from the cable car is breath taking. This cable car rotates s that everyone inside gets the opportunity to click pics and enjoy the view.

Magnificent views. Going up on the cableway is a fantastic way of seeing an aerial view of Cape Town. The car rotates as you go up so you get a 360 degree view of the area much better than the old fixed car from years ago.

A walk in the clouds. A walk in the clouds. Literally! Came for a sunset visit and was awe struck at the magnificence of the sunset on the blurry horizon and the streaming clouds through the jagged, rocky edges of the mountain. The experience was profound especially when you can't tell where the ocean ends and the sky begins.

A must-visit every time in Cape Town. My husband is from Cape Town and left 10 years ago. The mountain is probably what he misses most so we will always include a visit up table mountain on every visit. He used to hike up the mountain but that's a bit beyond me so together we go on the cable car. The views are lovely, and even if you head up there with the mist clouding your view it's still a fantastic experience. Take a jacket - it's generally cold up top. Head for a walk to the other side and sit near the edge and watch the view of the rising mist. Take note of the plants that survive up here. It's a truly beautiful place and you can't go to Cape Town without going up Table Mountain in my view!!

Waste of time. Table Mountain is great, but the Cable Car Operator is pathetic. Prices to go up are really expensive. The cost of a bottle of water is super-inflated, as is the food at the top in the restaurant. The restaurant at the top is appalling. We had to queue in the sun for ages to get up, you think they could shade the waiting areas?? Up top there were just too many people, and although they tell you how valuable the flora is, there are no nature conservation people telling people not to walk wherever they wanted to. Lots of damage to plants seen. Then when we wanted to come down we got stuck, supposedly due to an Eskom power failure, but you would think this was the first time this has ever happened as they did not seem to have a clue what to do. We were half way down, when they sent us back to the top, and then had to wait an hour, although to their credit they did hand out free bottles of the most expensive bottles of water. Just very poor service, and disappointed. Would not recommend this to anyone.

Great start to our Cape Town holiday. We went up on the cable car on our first night to watch the sunset. We loved the way the cable car turned as we went up so our views changed. It was very busy coming down at night but well organised to everyone got down without too long a wait.

Great customer service. We visited Cape Town in February 2014, and thought we wouldn't get the chance to go up Table Mountain as it was extremely windy and cloudy, so it wasn't possible to hike, and the cable cars were closed for 3 days! Just before we were due to fly home, the cable cars re-opened - we dashed across and managed to get tickets. We had to wait for over an hour to get up the mountain, and by this time we were very concerned that we would miss our flight. We spoke to the staff, and they rang up to the manager at the top, who arranged for us to skip the queues coming down to ensure we made our flight.....great customer service, and what a view!! The rotating floor is also very cool! Recommended!

Book ahead and come early on a clear day. As many know, this is often clsed with strong winds, and of course that is wise. I have been up twice in my life and I would say: by all means, book ahead online, will save you time. But even then, go early, it can be very busy. If the mountain is covered in clouds, there is not much to see up there so make sure you go on a clear day if you can...

Don't miss out. Buy tickets in advance to save a lot of time. Wonderful experience. Purchase tickets online or from your hotel. The line is long on site and you will wait in the line for tickets and then the line for the tram. Parking can be difficult as well there. Check the weather first, if you have the option to go over several days, choose the best day to avoid experiencing the "table cloth". The view obviously is best on a clear day without the clouds rolling over the top of Table Mountain.

Easy way up to the best view of Cape Town. We had to wait in line for half an hour because the half price sunset special brings the crowds at 6 PM (why half price at the most beautiful time of day to go to the top of table Mountain???), but it was well worth it! The views are spectacular in every direction. Give yourself a couple of hours to explore the entire top of the mountain.

simply to transport. the cableway brings you to the top of the table mountain. Technically ok, seems to be safe, but it is by far not as efficient as equivalent Cableways are in the Alps. Rated simply as a technical Equipment.

Check the weather on top!. It is very well organized so the queue moves fast. The floor moves so you can see everywhere around.Take warm clothes because its really cold on top. Check before you take the cable, how s the weather on top , because unfortunatelly we could see little about the wonderfull view you can enjoy on a sunny day!

Doing the best you can with what you've got!!. What to do when you have seemingly THOUSANDS of tourists who want to go up a mountain?? Get VISA to sponsor! There folks do the best they can given almost unsurmountable intangibles. This IS a never to be forgotten experience!!
360 degrees of awesome. Definitely beat hiking up the mountain. The views out of the cable car are stunning and the rotation ensures that you don't miss out. An experience before and experience!
High. Costs to use, fits about 40 people each trip and you get a great view from the top of the mountain. Food and drinks available at the cable car station
very long queues in the morning. It took us 1 hour and 20 minutes before we could get onto a cable car - and we had purchased advance tickets
Pick a clear day. A must visit when in Cape Town, but pick a clear day, and take something warm to wear as the wind can be quite cool.
Excellent cable car. Great system, well run and the cab rotates so everyone gets a view going up and down. Arrive early, be aware of the changeable weather and enjoy.

Fantastic experience. Any visitor to Cape Town must include a trip to the top of Table mountain. The view on the way up in the cable car is spectacular but nothing compared to the views of the Cape from the top. There are pathways leading to different side of the mountain where the beauty of the Table mountain nature reserve can be fully appreciated. If the top of the mountain has cloud cover then it can be quite cold up on top. The best time to go is early evening when you can enjoy the magnificent sunset. Take your snack and champagne,relax and enjoy the views.

Fantastic views, great learning environment.. Table Mountain certainly is the "hub" of Cape Town viewing and activity. The tram is very modern and takes only a few minutes to get to the top of the mountain [there are hiking trails, but only for the fairly skilled and adventurous.] Cost is moderate, views spectacular. Weather changes rapidly, so watch the weather report and bring layers to put on/take off. A "must do" part of a visit to the Cape.

Fabulous views, plenty of hiking, take hats and water.. It may look flat from far below, but it is not in actuality. Great hiking...just be sure to bring sunscreen, hats and plenty of water and snacks. We took the Red city bus to avoid having to park there and sure glad we did. Binoculars are also key to really enjoying all the amazing views. Plan on an entire day. If you are in really good shape, you can ride up on a 1-way ticket and walk down. Might want a walking stick for that one ;-)

A must do experience!. A visit it Cape Town simply must include a ride on the cable car. The whole expedition is so well organised although it is worth pre booking your tickets on line to avoid extra queuing. Allow plenty of time at the top to marvel and photograph the fabulous views from the cafe and to enjoy the little pathways which have been so tastefully built. There is nothing commercial about what has been done here and great attention haas been given to water preservation and conserving the vast range of flora.

Must do if weather permits. Table Mountain is often covered in fog so if you have the chance to go, be sure you do. We used a tour guide for the 3 days we were here and saw everything without waiting in queue. He knew exactly where to go when.

Worth the queue. Much busier now than when I last visited 12 years ago, but still well worth the queue as the views on a clear day are spectacular. best option is to take the red city sightseeing bus to the cable station as car parking is very limited and unless you're there very early you'll have a long walk.
A MUST do for any visitor.. Brilliant views of Cape Town from the cableway. Don't go if cloudy or windy. Don't be put off by the line of people waiting for the able car as it moves very quickly.

If the tablecloth is not there go up quickly!. We had the most fabulous views. The weather was calm and clear. As the locals say if you can see the top go up quickly! The cable car ride is quick and we were impressed with the efficiency of the operation. We went there via the red route bus...very handy and the journey up to the cable car point in the bus was quite something. We avoided any queues by getting our hotel to book online. The ticket is valid for a week so there is no problem if the clouds come one day.At the top we were absolutely stunned with the views. The views to Camps Bay and down to the Cape were wonderful. This outing alone made the holiday worthwhile. At the top there is a very good restaurant/café. Take good walking shoes as you can walk a long way along the top.
Pick a clear day!. Fantastic, but do not think about going up for to long, the weather changes so fast its unbelievable.

A MUST DO in Capetown. The day we arrived in Capetown it was a clear sunny day so after dropping off our bags we headed straight to Table Mountain as it can be cloudy a lot here.We had pre booked our tickets online which was easy and in expensive so we took a cab (again inexpensive).We had no wait. Once you got in the Cable car which was a fair size the internal floor rotated so everyone would be able to get a good all round view.The views from the top were outstanding and the walk around picturesque. A MUST
Table mountain cable car. Best cable car I have ever ridden. Don't fight to get on, it makes one revolution on its way to the top...how sensible..you see everythingCan't wait to go back

Disorganised. I am loving Cape Town but would advise against wasting time and money on the cable car. You'll queue for 2 hours in the unremitting heat and when you eventually get to the front find they have closed due to high winds which are very common here. But there's no allowance for all the time you have queued , they just expect you to do it all again tomorrow. THEN you find your ticket is ONLY valid on day of issue so you have to queue for 1.5 hours for refund!!An internet ticket avoids the latter problem as it's valid fof 14 days, but I still wouldn't recommend it as you'll have the initial queue and chance of it being a total waste of time!

Much easier than hiking up!. Get your cable-car tickets online to avoid long slow queues. The journey up is efficient and there's plenty of stunning views. The journey takes perhaps 10 minutes. Souvenir photos are available at the gift shop when you reach the bottom again.
What a great view!. If you see Table Mountain open , take the opportunity to get up with the cable car. The cars rotate on the way and the views are just amazing.
Everything its been promoted to be. Excellent Cable Car - and very well organised - crowds but little waiting time either for tickets or to get on a car

Timing is everything. To get to the base station is quite a hike so take a bus or cab. You need to choose the timing of your visit with an eye on the weather which can change, at least at the top of the mountain, very quickly. Thick cloud can quickly develop and obliterate all. It can go quickly too so check the forecasts. The cable car hold quite a lot people and everyone tries to get positioned for what they perceive is the best place to vie up or down the mountain. Don’t bother, the cable car does a full 360 degree turn as it ascends and descends so you will get your views and pictures. A five minute ride with an amusing operator and you are at the top. One tip, buy your ticket in advance, queues and waiting can get quite long sometimes.

Great views on tablemountain and Cape Town. It is a bit hard to reach if you go by foot, better take a cab. The Cable-car is a marvel, probably the best I have been to. Unique features are:- continuously rotating cabin allowing passengers to scan the whole 360° view- very funny cable-car "driver" making comments and jokes during the boarding and transfer

What a fantastic view!. An incredible experience! Fantastic views from the cable car and also from the top of Table Mountain . It would be good to say 'don't miss it' but it is dependent on weather conditions and even if the wind appears Ok at sea level the cable car can be closed. We left really early and managed to get a place, but it was crowded.
Great. Loved it all, we bought tickets in advance so did not have to wait to buy tickets, amazing views on the up and down

Long waiting period. As a local tour guide I would like to see that Table Mountain will be accommodating the tour guides by letting us wait much less than the usual person. We waited more than 1 h 45 min to go to the top and then still do a Cape Point & Boulders tour after we come down. The tourists feel that the long wait is almost not worth it. Can't we have a 'tour guide' car going up and if it's not used for tour guides then take anyone else? Just a suggestion, Anel from African Wonder Tours
A great way to view Cape Town. A fun way to reach the top of Table Mountain if you don't want to hike it. 360 degree views are great,

Veiw. The view from the top is outstanding. The food is lovely and you can see right across Cape Town from the top. Even if sightseeing isn't your thing you must go. The cable cars are lovely and give you enough time to take in the view of the Cape. I think this is a very obvious must see!!!

Must see!. We took the aerial cableway to the top of table mountain, what a great, smooth ride to the top of the mountain with amazing views of the area. We did have to loosely plan this adventure, as high winds/bad weather can close the cableway. We asked the bus tour guide if it was open, and turned out was open in the afternoon. There is no better way to see this piece of heaven then going to the top of Table Mountain and looking down at the beautiful city of Cape Town and the ocean. Must do while in Cape Town.

nervous but fine. I get a bit shakey with heights and closed spaces, so was dreading this, however, it was not overcrowded and did not move too much in the wind, so felt very secure. A quick and efficient way to the top.
Table Mountain - a must see. Pre-purchased tickets so no long lines. Quick time up to the top. Funny employee who 'hijacked' the cable car on the way down made us laugh.

Wonderful. What an experience. Go early in the morning to avoid the heat of the day and the queues. It is also an idea to go on a clear day at the beginning of your holiday, as winds stop the cable car running. Wonderful views from the top over Cape Town, the 12 Apostles and Robben Island.
Have to go up the Mountain. Stunning experience. A bit pricey but well worth the view. Try the evening ride up with sunset drinks! Sun sets late in summer so hours are extended

Beautiful way to see the mountain. Don't have enough time to hike up Table Mountain? Take the cableway instead! I strongly suggest purchasing tickets ahead of time at your hotel or even before you leave for SA. Most concierges will help you print your tickets. During peak seasons, the lines to get tickets can be quite long.The cable way tram is unique in that the floor rotates a fully 360 degrees during the transit. No need to wrestle for the best view, because you'll get to look all around during your rotation.The ride is smooth and the staff friendly. Also, if you hike up, consider riding down. One way tickets are available.

Trip to Table Mountain via Aerial Cableway. Beautiful trip to Table Mountain started with a drive up the mountain via a stick shift (another adventure in itself). We arrived around 10 a.m. and was surprised that the line was relatively short with a wait time of appox. 15 mins. The cableway offers a beautiful 360 degree view as you ascend to the top. Once at the top, there is nothing but an awesome sight of Cape Town from all angles. At times some clouds may get in the way but just keep walking and you're find another spot for good photos. Absolute must do if you travel to Cape Town.

The Cable Car. The wait was the only bug bear , but each car takes around twenty five bodies in it plus it rotates so you get a 360 view on the way up and down car , take water as its expensive to buy at the top
Stunning views, Long Lines. View and walking paths at the top were well worth the wait, not to mention the fantastic ride to the top of the mountain. Restaurant poorly organized, food ordinary.

Revolving Floor - 360 Degrees View. The floor of the cable car revolves so everyone has a chance to see 360 degrees, all the amazing views, regardless of where you place yourself upon entry to the cable car you have an opportunity to see ALL the incredible views since the floor revolves. We took the City Sightseeing Cape Town Hop on Hop Off, so it was easy to get there, easy to pay and not much of a line even on Sunday! They have the system down to lessen the wait and transport everyone safely to and from the top of table mountain which is beyond amazing!!

what a view. We were so lucky that the first day of our 17 day Smartour of South Africa,Botswana, Swaziland, Zimbabwe and Victoria Falls had perfectly clear weather so we could take the funicular up Table Mountain. The cablecar is huge and it rotates as you go up the mountain so everyone gets a great view. From way up you got a very good idea of the layout of CapeTown below with the different areas like the waterfront pier area, inner city, outskirts and beach areas a little out of town. At the top we found many little dassies sunning themselves on the hot rocks in the sun. They are like guinea pigs on steroids. This attraction is a must if you have cooperative weather while you are in Cape Town.

Amazing. This is a must do attraction when in SA. On the first fine day you must do this as if its very cloudy or the wind gets up they stop the Cable Car.Parking on the roadside can be difficult when its really busy, we went early in the morning ( it opens at 8am ) the queue time can be long but we only waited about 15 minutes to our early start.The Cable Car has a revolving floor giving you an all round view as you go up, once there the views from all sides are amazing, breathtakingly so. there is a nice restaurant at the top and toilet facilities which were very clean. This really is a Must attraction DONT MISS IT.

World-class service. The Table Mountain aerial cableway is a first class operation - from the friendly staff to the smooth operation of the cable car itself.Due to the popularity of this attraction the company sometimes have to manage long queues but in my opinion they do this very well. I also think the ticket cost is very reasonable for the thrilling experience of the ride - especially considering the weak rand.This is a definite must-do when in Cape Town!

If you can walk up, do so.... This review is about the cable station and the car, not the mountain itself (which is amazing an should be experienced by everyone who comes to Cape Town). Please understand that most people on here mix these reviews up which does not give an accurate picture of both experiences.The trip is very over-priced and has unfriendly and unhelpful staff at the ticketing offices with very long lines beforehand. And if you want to use a student card for a discount - you can only come on a Friday (seriously!). I dont know what logic there is in that, but you will need to pay as an adult even if you have that concession.The best part of this torture is leaving the station at the top for a walk around the 3 plateaus and other trails (something which most people do not do). The worse part is knowing that you may have to use the car again if the weather becomes bad and the walk down cant be done.I know not everyone can do so, but seriously...avoid this place and climb the mountain instead (even with a gammy knee like mine, the climb is less torturous than the cableway). ...Or bring an mp3 player, so you have something to do during the long, long wait.

Stunning view... it gets full. If you want to go up the table mountain to enjoy the really splendid view you can hike up/and or down but if this is nothing for you the only way to go is the cable car.As many people come to Cape Town and not that many do want to hike and as the cable car valley station is just next to a stop of the hop on hop off bus... there are a lot of people who want to go up and down. And even with the large cars that can lead to considerable waiting times and a longer hike to ge there if you come with your own car. Try to get a place near the window, the views are breathtaking, come evry early (before all the tourists get up) or try a late ride for the sunset. In case you do not like crowds, queues or are afraid of hights... sleave this one out.

A real must-do!. As I don't have a hire-car, I used the open-top sightseeing bus to get here, as it drops you off right at the door.The tickets are 220 rand return, and I got straight on the cable car - no queueing at all.At the top, there are restaurants, shops and toilets. I made sure I went on a crystal-clear day, and the views were spectacular. You can spend as much time as you like at the top, then it's an easy 2 minute ride down to the bottom in the cable car. Lived up to my expectations, enjoyed the experience!

If your in Cape Town its a must!. The views are amazing!!!! This is deinetley a must if in you are in Cape Town. My advice would be to purchase your tickets in advance from their website. Queues at the mountain to get tickets can be very long so by doing this you effectively bypass one of the queues. Also keep an eye on the weather forecast as you don't want to go up there when there is low cloud as you wont see anything!

An almost compulsory. With the Table mountain casting an impressive rise over Cape Town, it is almost compulsory to visit the Table Mountain. And what better way than the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway for an unforgettable experience.

An amazing view - Watch the weather. We decided to go to Table Mountain to celebrate a birthday, however due to high winds the cableway was closed, so do check the weather and online web site before heading for the cableway. That said we booked our tickets online the day we eventually decided to go (that will save you time queuing for tickets when you arrive and you can go straight to boarding) as this will save you up to 90 mins in peak times. The cabin holds about 50 people and I recommend getting on first or last so you are at the edge of the cabin. The cabin rotates so great views of the surrounding area as you proceed to the top. On reaching the top there is a walkway around and gives great views of the coastline around Cape Town and beyond and plenty of photo opportunities. If you have binoculars, take those too.
