There are some cafes on the top for a beer or soft drinks and some food. I would allow up to 45 mins to tour the top and then head back down to the Waterfront for drinks/food. A must in Cape Town

TOP CLASS ATTRACTION. Its always such a pleasure visiting this amazing mountain and experiencing the ride on the cable car !!!! This time was in brilliant weather and - as usual - wonderful views from the top and well worth going up !

Must-do in Capetown. Our adult children did the 3-4 hr hike from Kirstenbosch, but we chose the easy route and took the cable car! Lots of trails and fantastic views. Do go early in the day as it is often closed due to winds. Also great soft serve ice cream in the lower refreshment stand!

Probably the best way to the top!. You can walk up to the top of Table Mountain but I didn't have a huge amount of time so opted for this faster route. The car revolves as you go up so everyone gets a view of the city below and the rock face of the mountain. It can be very busy particularly at weekends so parking is often a challenge. More by luck than judgement I timed it to be able to see the sunset which was truly stunning but keep an eye out for the time of the last cable car down. I bought my ticket on line before I left the UK just in case the queues were as bad as I'd read, but it was fine (if you don't use it you can get most of your money back). It closes for bad visibility and high winds so worth keeping an eye on their website <http://www.tablemountain.net/> If you're the last ones down and hence dark when you get to the bottom, look up at Signal Hill and watch the lines of walkers coming down with their head torches on. Awesome!!

Soar to the clouds.. Nothing to dislike. The cable car is very smooth and it's floor revolves 360 degrees ensuring everyone inside, and it holds up to, I think, 65 people, can all have a good view as one either ascends or descends. The trip up is only the start of a marvellous experience.
The Easy Way UP. For R215/person this is not the cheap way up but soooo easy.Watch out for the rotating floor in the car
Provides great views, fast ride. The lines for the cable car moves quickly. The ride itself is great with a revolving floor allowing everyone to get a great view all around.

Great place. This is a must do trip in Cape town ,the views of the city and surrounds are fantastic, the cable car is good fun with the rotating floor. Go on a sunny day early to avoid queues, bring a hat sunglasses and lots of water and take your time, there are lots of walks and trails to follow.
Cable to top of Table Mountain.. Spectacular views, and the opportunity to walk around the moountain. Go early in the day before the winds prevent the use of the cable cars.

Never Fails To Impress. Once again we took some friends up here..... it was slightly overcast with low cloud & we were doubtful that the views would be as good as previously experienced but in fact it was perfect & not only were our guests (first time visitors) impressed so were we,..... it gave us a whole new perspective on the views as the clouds lifted & fell & exposed Cape Town then covered her in a blanket again. As usual we saw several passengers on our cable car gasp as we approached the summit.... it really is an experience & looks like you are going to hit the mountain face as you make the last ascent..... great experience time & again.
Fanastic. Only one Table mountain with fantastic views of Cape Town and surrounds. Book on line to avoid queues.

Long line for a magnificent view. We took a cab here from Green Point (100 ZAR) and arrived at about 10-10:30 a.m. There was already a very long line and it took about 1,5 hours until it was our turn to go up in a cable car. The view was well worth the long wait. There were a few different trails at the top and we walked the one that was 5km. It was an easy walk.The line was shorter when we came down at around lunchtime, so maybe it wasn't the best idea to go there in the morning. Many tourist busses seemed to be there in the morning.

Go for a ride. The cable car wait is relatively short for the number of people it transports. No need to rush to get a good place to stand to be able to see - the inside rotates so that EVERYONE sees ALL the views.

beautiful views from a rotating cablecar. there is a view from every angle with the most beautiful views. safe and well structured. there is another queue to board the cable car but it moves quickly. you can also take personnalised photos with a professional photographer to purchase when you return to the bottom.

good experience. We hiked Table Moutain on January, 2nd, a really hot day, and we were very tired when arriving at the top. After refreshing at the restaurant, wandering on the top and have seen the gorgeous views of Cape Town, we decided to go down by the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway,’cause we were exhausted.We bought our tickets at the souvenir shop, near restaurant (R$110 (something like US$ 11.00) for adults, R$55 for children). Then we went to the line, a long, long line to take the cableway. We stood at the line for 45 or 50 minutes, under a hot sun. When we entered the car, it was good, the car is modern and the temperature inside was good. I did not counted, but I believe that the car bear more than 50 persons each trip.The descent was fast, a few minutes, and the car rotates, so you get a 360º view of the town and the mountain.The cableway is fine, but to wait at the long line was tough.

Stunning views. Great option for those who don't want to do the walk up or down the hill. It is quick and easy. Now they have a special offer, after 6pm it is half the price. Totally recommend to go there for the sunset.

must do it. you have to take it once in your life. amazing panorama! you will never forget it! the interior of the cabin turns on itself to allow everyone to see the view without moving and from every angle.
Great views over Cape Town. We took the cable ride up the mountain early during our trip to Cape Town. Helps orientation. Easy access and nice for families.
A must see. great view of cape town, book your ticket on the internet to avoid standing in line-be sure to take a metered taxi back into town-great flowering bushes-
Very quick and easy!. We booked tickets on line so didn't have to queue. These are valid for 2 weeks! Cable car is quite quick and fast and very smooth.

Proudly South African!. After postponing our trip with the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway due to poor weather, we decided to take our European tourist friends up the following day. This was a typical perfect-weather day in Cape Town in December and a Sunday to boot. The queue was enormous; Luckily we had booked our Cableway tickets online (a few easy clicks) and were able to skip a large portion of the queue. An additional bonus: We took a taxi, which was only able to reach the bottom of Tafelberg Road (which had been closed off due to heavy traffic). As we started our slow, long walk up the road, we were intercepted by small Tuk-tuk-like carts, which gave us all a shuttle lift up to the lower cable station - at no charge!The queuing still took us approximately another two hours - I assume thousands of people moved through those gates on that day. Staff was moving about the crowds queuing, who managed the flow of the crowd (always with good humour and lots of patience) as well as a Clown making balloon animals and a Faerie princess doing face-painting, to keep the young ones entertained. Heat was controlled by refreshing mist-sprayers. A little temporary kiosk had also been established inside one of the old Cable Cars on display, and we were able to buy some refreshments to keep up our energy and good spirits.At the top, we spent most of the time at the restaurant while our German friends roamed the majestic mountain top, admiring the views from all the different angles. We had a lovely lunch and some crisp wine (both food and drinks are offered in a decent variety and the "self-service" concept is brilliant, as it seems to be the best way to accommodate very large numbers of visitors).We were very proud to be Cape Townians on that day, showing off not only our beautiful city and it's surrounds, but also the superb service and facilities available.THANK YOU to the entire Table Mountain Aerial Cableway team that made that day unforgettable! Looking forward to doing it all again soon!
CHECK IF CABLE CARS ARE RUNNING. We had the perfect timing to go to the top. Make sure you take a jacket can get pretty chilly we were there in January

Excellent, a must-do in Cape Town. Traveled with the family and loved it. We went in the peak season after Christmas and avoided the lines by going at 6 pm. No line, walked right in. Tickets are also half price at that time. The view of the sunset is spectacular.The only negative was the walk back from the bottom to the car which has to be parked a distance away. No lights, a bit scary. Suggest not lingering at the gift shop below but head to the cars with the whole group in the cable-car with you.

Great experience. It was very busy but well worth the wait. This was an excellent way to experience and view table mountain, the surrounding area and robben island. I think its really good value for money and would be a great trip for a family or a big group. Great views for photos.

Breath-taking experience. We were in South Africa to visit some relatives and were recommended to take a hike up the mountain. After days of bad weather, we decided to take a cable car. We booked in advance so as to avoid the three hour waiting time. The views both on the way up and from the top are simply to die for. You can either take a walk around the laid out paths, or you can be a little adventurous and climb around with safety ropes. It is beautiful and relatively cheap to do. If you do decide to go, I most wholeheartedly wish you the best of luck and I hope that you enjoy as much or even more than I did!A. MasterP.S. - GO EARLY IN THE MORNING
The cable car journey is excellent. Though you have to battle with long line of human chain, it will not mar the cable car journey. the cable car is a big one. it moves and let you see all the sides.

SCARY BUT WONDERFULLY EXCITING. Loved this experience and the trip in the cable car certainly got the adrenalin going. A true lifetime experience not to be missed.The car slowly revolves so everyone can get photographs o the way up. If you dont like heights you have the option of standing in the middle of the car which doesn't revolve and you are unable to see the precarious drop.

Make sure you go early!. The views you see from atop Table Mountain are absolutely gorgeous, just make sure this is one of you first stops of your day in Cape Town because the line waiting to both go up in the cable car and to come back down will get long and you will have to wait!

Good fun, beautiful view!. Cheap, safe and fast way to get up the mountain.Spectacular view, a must do!We took the sightseeing bus to Table Mountain and the Aerial Cableway up the mountain. We had chosen a nice, calm day and have felt very safe and had no problems to go by ourselves, not in an organised tour. If it is too windy the cable station is not operated. The weather is always changing in Cape Town. So don't wait too long to go up, just do it!

BREATHTAKINGLY BEAUTIFUL. You cannot leave Cape Town without going to the newest addition of the 7 Wonders of the World. You never tier of the view that you have in the Cable Car which is operated throughout the year.
Smooth sailing. I was a little afraid but had nothing to fear. A very professional operation and so fast I only had to shut my eyes until I reached the top. World class.

You'd be silly not to!. Another highlight and sure to be a lasting memory!We were blessed with perfect weather (hot, though) for our assault on the great mountain, and seemed to have timed our arrival perfectly - South African schools had just started again after the long Christmas holiday, and the tourist hoards had not yet arrived, so we had no waiting either for tickets or for the car itself.Plenty of room inside and majestic views EVERYWHERE!But the real treat, of course, is the mountain itself, and I have to say it has NOT been spoiled up top - the usual cafe and shop, but not tacky in any way and certainly not a rip off as some are. Better than this, though, are the trails that have been set up for visitors - safe and tasteful, and suitable for ALL. We trekked to the very top (allow up to an hour each way max.) and were glad we did.If your not a HARDENED hiker or climber, jump in the cable car and then make a bit of effort once your on top; you won't regret it.

wow!. Cape town is one of the most beautiful cities in the world, natural and scenic , breath taking views from the revolving cable car on the way up to the table mountains,spectacular sights from the top....just loved the place....cable car ride is similar to the one to go up the Swiss Mt.Titilus...

Cable cars are always fun.. Built & installed by the same Swiss firm that installed the cable ride in Palm Springs, CA. This is a shorter ride with one rotation as you ascend giving all a chance at the spectacular views below.
What a view!. Loved the fact that the cable-car revolved slowly to give the panorama of the bay and mountain, watching some climbers on the side was a bit scarey!!

Breathtaking views. The view is absolutely breathtaking...it gives you a pretty good bird's eye view of the city...of the mountain and the ocean....
However be prepared to wait for an hour or so to board the cable car to back down....
TMtn cable car. Thoroughly enjoyed the ride up. A little disappointed by the VISA advertising. I would highly recommend doing this if you are in Cape Town and weather permits.
Beautiful views of the city!. The cableway is a really great way to see the city - from above! Always clean and professional service, and the view as you go up is really amazing!
Excellent. Bit pricey but had to be done! Very fast up to the mountain and back. Waiting time was less than 10 minutes.

Must Do In Cape Town. We were in Cape Town for five days on our holiday, and this is the one thing we almost missed. Everyone knows that they are going to take the tram up Table Mountain during their visit to Cape Town, but what we did not realize was that it can be closed for an entire day(s) due to wind. In our case, two days in a row the tram was closed due to wind. We were lucky on the third day that it opened back up, and we were able to go up at sunset. I would recommend getting this activity done as soon as possible during your visit, as it may be closed due to wind or cloud cover.

the views on the ride are awesome. other than for the long lines to get on to the cable way which moves reasonably fast the ride up is fantastic the views on the ride up are fantastic to say the least the alternative is walking up the mountain but the cable way id definitely worth the ride up

a must. well operated and amazing if its a clear day but even if the day id misty on top like it usually is the experience s worth it.go up if its open and you will not regret it even if visibility is bad

Fabulous and breathtaking view. This is a Cape Town main attraction. The view and the experience on the cableway to the summit is not to be missed. We didn't get the chance on our first visit (too cloudy) but our return was marvelous. We did a hop on, hop off (HOHO) bus from the V&A to Table Mountain. Well worth the wait for the cableway (both up and down). Marvelous experience. Don't miss it!
First World Technology and service. Brilliant technology and very well serviced by the staff. Its a must...The narrators are witty and amusing adding to the experience. Great value at R215 per adult.

A must to see the whole area. Even though it was very windy on top, the trip up and the entire panorama was well worth the splurge. The floor of the tram rotates so you get a good view no matter where you are.
Fast&Comfort. We made all the way up on foot and took cable car down, exactly when we were tired and cold. And we were so happy to catch it.

great views. We decided to hick to the top of the mountain and then take the cable car to come back. It was simply amazing. It took us 4 hours, in spite of the 3 hours indicated in the signs to the trail, but it was totally worth it. Once you get there you won´t regret all the effort to finish. The view on the way and up there are simply stunning. You can see all the city, the stadium, it is totally worth it. By cable car it takes less than 5 minutes,

Very Expensive!. Zar 110 per person for a one way ticket - I thought at least the journey would be enjoyable. We were there on New Year's eve, and had decided to walk up and get the cable car down. It was mobbed! Half of CapeTown had decided to visit the mountain that day too.. To be fair the organisation of the staff was excellent, and bearing in mind the number of people they had to shift, it wasn't too long standing in the queue. Only about 1 hour 40 mins.. (People we spoke to had waited 3+ hours to get up!) However, the ride itself for me was a complete let down. I was expecting a 20 min ride, but it was about 2 mins. I know the cable car rotates as you go down, but the views aren't any better than you get from the road or the top of the mountain. It is a perfectly good form of transport, but certainly not the tourist attraction I had thought it would be. (and it's very expensive!)

Enjoyable ride!!. We went up to Table Mountain on Boxing Day 2013 and used the cable car to get to the top. The ride is quite short approximately 3 minutes and the floor of the car rotates so you get a 360 degree view as mentioned by all other reviewers. I personally would advise that you book tickets in advance online to avoid the ticketing queue so that you can head straight to the cable car queue. We were lucky that we managed to get to the top on the day that we had booked on a bright clear sunny day and did not experience any cancellations due to high winds etc as experienced by other reviewers but do check the forecasts before going to the base station.The queues were long on the day of our visit - we arrived at 10.30am and we waited for 1.5 hours at the bottom and 45 minutes at the top so be prepared for the waiting/queueing.Otherwise, do not miss this opportunity while visiting Cape Town.
Spectacular views!. Booked online when we saw the long line. Worked well. The overall experience was seamless and the views are always breath taking!

A top wonder of the world - needs some fans though!. Table Mountain is a great place to go. I am not going to expound on this more than millions have over the years. Just want to make a recommendation:----Went on January 3rd - Temperatures and humidity very high. They had sprayers in place, but without air movement, these just added to the humidity. Suggestion: Add fans to the system so that the air blows, evaporation is more effective when heat is removed....

Spectacular views!. Worth it to give yourself enough time for parking as it gets quite full. Really amazing to see this at any time of the day as the views are amazing and so beautiful. Also good to pack a picnic and some snacks to relax there and wait for the sunset. Just keep in mind that the queues get quite long after sunset, so be prepared for the wait. Seems quite safe and there are quite a few routes to walk and places to sit.
Go early. First cable up was amazing - great guides and not too busy. Views incredible from the cable car that rotates and from the top. Leave time to get down as it the lines get long.

Long wait and no shade. While we had pre-booked the tickets for the cable way, the wait to go up and down the mountain was by far too long, especially as there was almost no shade. The views from the mountain itself are breathtaking, however, so we recommend to go despite the inconvenience.

If it weren't for the view. Table Mountain itself is an absolute beauty & the view is phenomenal!! BUT the service from staff is absolutely appalling!! Service & quality of food at the Table Cafe was a complete dissapoinment and a let down of note. The cafe was dirty, food and drinks were outrageously overpriced, no food descriptions of what was avaliable and the cafe staff were anything but friendly and helpful. Bathrooms were dirty and could be smelt from a distance!! As a World Wonder, the service standards provided needs some serious attention as it is nothing but a poor show and embarrassment!! First time visitor.... I will return for the view ONLY!! And take note, their is no correct and clear communication with the photo packs being handed out for sale!!

Need to get lucky with the weather. We arrived in Cape Town assuming getting up Table Mountain would be easy. The weather was beautiful in town but every time we tried to go up the mountain, the Cableway was shut due to high winds. You do need to be patient and work other things around it being open but we were rewarded on the last day with absolutely perfect conditions. After a long wait due to the cableway having being shut for the last 3 days, we eventually set off and it was definitely worth it. It's pretty vertical at the end but it's much more stable than other cablecars i've been on in the past so I was fine despite being a little nervous of cablecars in general.The view at the top was fantastic as it was so clear and it really is the iconic view of Cape Town. It's not cheap though...

Don't hold on - The Floor Spins!. Its neat that the cable car spins so that you can't hold onto the side railings. (The spinning is slow, there's no risk of falling down and there are windows so no one falls over.)But, Table mountain isn't high enough to really make the cable car ride memorable or worth it. I suggest hiking up this mountain and saving the cable car rides for Europe.

Best thing to do in the City. The ride is almost to quick to enjoy! The old slow cable car was more scary but went much slower. At least the queues move faster now. The top of the mountain is best at sunrise or sunset. Can be very hot now.

Long wait, chaotic parking, but worth it. Unfortunately we didn't book tickets in advance so we arrived at 12:00 on a busy holiday so a long wait was inevitable. We had to wait 30 minutes for the ticket office (mostly in the shade), then another 50 minutes for the cable-car in baking sun. Even if we had online tickets we would stil have had to wait for the cable-car though. The parking was chaotic - I don't understand why they haven''t built a car-park rather than relying on parallel parking along a narrow road. Anyway, we eventually got to the top and the setting and the views were truly spectacular. There is a reasonable self-service cafe at the top, but it was very disorganised and by the time we paid for our food it was cold. Based on my experience, my advice would be to buy tickets in advance, try to avoid busy times if possible (early morning and late afternoon are much quieter), but this is an opportunity not to be missed.

Excellent View (as expected!). I was advised to book on line to avoid the queues which was sound advice. It was also discounted! When I came down about 12.30 the queue for non ticket holders was about 80 yards long. What I don't know was how long it took to process the folk through.The views were stunning and the facilities were excellent. I did enjoy my breakfast overlooking Cape Town!
Magnificent. Unbelievable views. The viewpoint is incredible and we'll worth the trip. Don't miss this Cape Town highlight!

What fun. I have not been up the mountain in over 30 years and was very excited to get the opportunity during December.The fond memories I had, were replaced by better one's, even when the clouds started coming in covering us all in a thin mist.A wonderful experience, a must for all visitors to the Mother Cithy
Fantastic view. All travelers has to take the cable car to the top of the mountain but when us get there it is really worth the trip.beautiful view even u can see robin island if it is clear

Great view!. A trip up Table Mountain is a must for visitors to Cape Town, and the Aerial Cableway is the easiest and fastest way to the top. The car rotates, so everyone gets a look out as you ascend and descend. Lines can be very long as others have noted, and weather changes rapidly, so I'd try going early in the day and buying advance tickets if you're going at a popular time. It's very very important to pay attention to the weather when you are up on top. The fog comes in blindingly fast and the cable car stops running - so listen for the klaxon. They remind you about this on the way up, but it's amazing how many times people get stuck - which is not fun as others have noted.

One of those "must do that while I'm there". Spent a lot of time working in CT and I arranged many education visits from UK to SA. Obviously every visitor wanted to go up Table Mountain, so I have made this trip many many times.Parking nearby can be tough but I always use a taxi as it gets you close to buy your ticket. Most offer to wait so you have a ride back ready. For UK visitors the cost of the taxi is minimal.The queue can be a pain and my very first time I stood in the sun quietly burning until a lovely local came along and dumped suntan cream on my face, said "take care" and walked away!At the top I always make my way way to the cafe and buy local "champagne", The rest of my trip is sitting outside enjoying the views and the wine.The Cableway is often closed because of fog on the mountain or high winds, so if you are only in CT for a few days don't leave it until the last minute or you might miss it.Same goes for Robben Island. I didn't manage a ticket the first few times I tried

Loved it!. Table Mountain is a MUST see when your in CApe Town, or from overseas visiting South Africa in general. Please just even go to Cape Town because there is so much to see and do!! And table mountain is such a lovely place. Should be on a bucket list!

Magical views of Cape Town. If visiting the Cape a ride up to the top is a must. The views are unforgettable. Hike along the well marked paths, but be prepared to return to the cable car station when the fog warning sounds. Getting stuck "up top" is no fun. Long queues during the high season so pre-booking is advised.

Beautiful Views..Visit in the Afternoon or Non-Holidays... We had intended to visit this on Monday, our first day in Cape Town. Due to windy conditions, it was closed for a couple days straight. It was also Christmas season, which didn't help. We decided to do the afternoon time slot as we had to go to Christmas mass. We bought tickets online thinking this would guarantee admission as tickets do sell out..But that it may be also faster. When we arrived at 12:20 PM, the line was already all the way to Timbuktu. There was two lines, one with tickets and one without. The web site says "why wait in line when you can buy tickets online." This may hold true during non-holidays but the lines for both were long. The line for the non-ticket holder seemed to be moving faster. In the end, both line merges so you wait regardless.Now when we get to the top of the mountain, there is a cafe. The food was pretty good, but the experience was less then relaxing. It was mayhem to get into the lines and food was "made to order." Why can't they just have things ready to go? This made the wait longer. When I was ready for ice cream, I had to get back into the long line again.On to the experience at the top: It was for sure a breath taking view. After you get out of the crowded cafe, there was different walks (or hikes) you can take. You see views of the city, of Lion's Head, of the Twelve Apostles and Devil's Peak. I recommend getting a better picture of Twelve Apostles during the drive to Hout Bay. The cable car ride was fun and it rotates so you get a different view as you get up. My whole visit took four hours for this attraction and after it was done, we had no energy for anything else. It was a must-see however, so if you come during the busy season, be ready to endure the long lines and crowds.

book online - go early - on a clear day ... fantastic !!. Yes, book on line , if it is a clear day and go as early as possible to beat the crowds.The cable car is very enjoyable, even for someone who does not like cable cars !! and not too many peole are "pushed" in.Room to move around inside for your short journey to the top and because of the revolving car, everyone has fantatic views over Cape Town.Once up there's a marked parthway guiding you to even more spectacular views and a very welcome cafe for refreshments .Allow at least a morning or afternoon to take full advantage - remember - book on-line, check the weather and go early !!!!
must see!. If you're in CapeTown, you MUST take the cable car up to Table Mountain; it is wonderful...has a great view of pretty much everything, including Robbins Island.

Convenient way up Table Mountain. For hardier folks perhaps they could hike up Table Mountain, and there are quite a few of those. However, for the unathletic and less fit people like me, the cable car is the only way to go up to the top.

Table mountain a magical moment for life!. I was lucky to be born in such a great & diverse colourfull city, that offfers so much. It has some of the most extensive flora n fauna in the world in such a small area which engulfs the two oceans - cold Atlantic on the west coast and the warm (Benguela) Indian on the east coast (satelite feed would argue Cape Agulhas is the most southern point of Africa, of which they are corect) but it is here in the Cape Point that the two sea Godesses dance.Our mother mountian watches other them with open arms & to enjoy the great views she offers, one has to get up real early. During the high season, the cable car ques are long (pre-booking on the internet).The 2 cars will take just under 20 minutes and will do a full 360degree turn before it reaches the summit. Once on top, walk along (stay on the guided/ marked pathways) as one can stray & believe me, if the fog horn blows, it is time to take cover at the entrance. There are 'dassies (relative to the..yes it is true - Elephant) small to medium sized looking moles. Don't feed nor touch them as they do bite! You can also walk up n down the mountain, but i would advice that you do more research before trying it out.The view over the city bowl and harbour, stretches from the west to the distant Hidelberg mountains (stunning famous wine land-Stellenboshc, Paarl,Franschoek, Somerset West to Strand and Gordans Bay) over False bay towards (back of the mountain) Cape Peninsular/Point with the famous Navy base-Simons Town, 12 Apostles and the very wealthy Clifton, Sea-Point with its million dollar homes..There is the famous Eagles Nest restaurant that offers food n beverages on top. I was once stranded for 3h due to thick fog, but endured it well as the food n wine flowed. You will never forget this magical moment. Everyone that visits Cape Town must visit Table Mountain & Stellenbosch. The capital of wines in Africa. End May-August is our wettest season with a sub-mediterranean scale! The mountain lights go off at midnight during high season. Enjoy and let me know if this has been helpfull!

A wonderful ride and view of Cape town from the Table Mountain. Wonderful view of a beautiful Cape town city. this city is so un African with so many nice buildings and wonderful infrastructure. Also the natural beauty of the flora and fauna is astonishing.Prices are low so it is quiet a bargain. i would say between europe and africa visits this year this is the star attraction.

A view of Cape Town. Considering I really don't like cable cars this was not too bad!! I managed to stand in the middle, faced inwards, shut my eyes and stayed there until the car reached the top and did the same on the way back down.Can't comment on the car, or scenery (didn't look) though the mechanics of it all must have been ok - we got there and back in one piece!!

Exciting views as you ride to the top of the world. Watch out for the rotating windows - the attendant will tell you when the floor is about to open up! Seriously though, the lift can be very busy at holiday times and the queues quite long. They do seem to move fairly quickly.

Table Mountain on my birthday. We went to the cable way on my birthday and a very nice gesture from the staff, on your birthday you get a free trip. We were also fortunate to be the last car going up the morning due to the wind getting stronger. We managed to spend an hour ontop and then the siren went off as a cloud was covering the mountain and wind getting stronger. The personnel are so efficient in there concern for the visitors, they make sure everyone gets to a safe place and encourages one all the time till you back safe down the mountain. What a lovely day, what a lovely shop on the mountain and well done to all staff for making this a memorable day.

Must do!. I guess this is Cape Town's must-do. On a good day, the view from the top in all directions is stunning. The area around the top station has been beautifully laid out with safe walkways and informative panels all the way around. There are walks of varying durations for those who feel inclined. The cableway is quick and easy and the rotating floor means good views for all on the journey.Book online (tickets are valid for 14 days in case tour chosen day is windy) and beat the queue.

Stunning views from the Top of the world. My group enjoyed our mad dash to get there on a wind free day earlier this month. Of course being in the know, I had booked on line. We did the 45 minute circular walk then had an espresso before embarking on a half day city tour. Management needs to address traffic access back on to Kloof Nek Road at busy times. Cape Town drivers in their rush home to their families or in the mornings to office make for extremely difficult entry. A few appropriate yield signs or humps may help. Surely something mutually practical could be worked out with the traffic department planners? This is a major money spinner for the mountain company and Cape Town, lets put our heads together.

Wow. You need to go up on the cable car on a clear day and no wind. Some people ride up on bikes. But which ever way you get up it is worth the visit. Do not use the sugar on the outside tables the tiny animal do get into them. But well worth the wait you will have to get up to the top.

Up-n-Down. A convenient, safe and comfortable means to visit the top of Table Mountain, a world Heritage Site.It's quick, but the rotating floor gives you a stunning 360-degree exposure of all the views available.Buy tickets on-line to comfortably by-pass the possibility of long ques at the local ticket office. If you self-drive, do consider parking at the bottom parking-lot (just as you turn up to the cable car facility) and take a taxi from there. Parking close to the station is very limited and almost guaranteed not to be available.Patience is needed, especially queuing to come back down.

A "must do" when in cape town. No visit to cape town would be complete without doing this, unless you're intent on taking a hike up the mountain instead. Very quick and efficient and with the floor rotating you're guaranteed a good view even if the car is packed. It goes without saying that the best experience and views are on a clear day, so as long as you check the weather forecast before heading out you'll be in for a treat.

Pre-purchase tickets online. We took the hop-on/hop-off red bus to the foot of Table Mountain. It pays to pre-purchase your tickets, which we did online. Our wait in line was nothing compared to those who were waiting to buy their tickets. Be sure to wear sun screen and dress comfortably. We decided against hiking after reading reviews. Unless you're an expert hiker, just enjoy the gondola ride. We purchased a bottle of sparkling wine and some munchies to enjoy at the cafe. Watch out for the birds. They are sneeky and quite bold. We then walked around to explore and take our pictures. It's breathtaking!

Truly worth it. if you are not a person who can hike for 3 hours to go to the top, then this is a must. Excellent service and the inside of cable car rotates when moving. This is great, as everyone gets a chance to stand next to the window. watch out when the cable car is about 2/3 of the way up as the view is just amazing. If you are on a budget travel, then try the sunset cable car(after 6) as the price is halved then. During summer this is a very good offer as the last trip down is at 8 PM. And you can catch the sunset as wellHowever if you want to visit during the day only, then please prebook as it will save you 10% of the costalso there is a free walk around tour at the top (every hour from 10:00 to 3 PM) everyday , where the guide can tell you some interesting stories

Pricey but definitive Cape Town experience. If tickets aren't pre-booked there can be a lengthy wait at the ticket desk (especially if the cable car has been closed for weather the previous day). There might also be a rush onto the cable car to get window space facing the best direction - but fear not (!) the cable car rotates 360 degrees on the way up enabling all window-side spaces to get a great view. Its possible to get a one way ticket and walk down, either back to the base station or across the 'table top' to Kirstenbosch.

Spinning your way to the top. From afar, Table Mountain is beautiful; but to be truly amazed, take a ride to the top via the cable car. The approximately 3000 feet trip to the mountain top is accomplished by a cable car that can hold about 65 people. The number of people, though, does not hinder one from the seeing the sites during the +/-10 minute ascent thanks to the car's revolving floor. As a passenger, you are guaranteed a 360 degree view. Once you exit the car, you are free to walk along the many trails atop Table Mountain. The views are spectacular, from the Atlantic Ocean to the hustle and bustle of Cape Town and even the distant snow-capped mountains. There is a restaurant; a place to pick up a drink or snack; and several places to sit and relax during your time on top. The cable car only operates during optimal weather, so don't "save" this for the last day of your Cape Town visit. If the weather is good, GO! While a clear day will always afford you spectacular views, the best time to go is around sunset when you can watch the sun slowly disappear below the horizon.

Rotating cable car!. Excellent cable car experience! Although it wasn't a private cabin built with small groups in mind, the cable cars accommodating around 50 odd people rotated 360 degrees, ensuring that everyone was able to get stunning views on the way up and down Table Mountain! Do buy tickets online if you get a chance as the queues can get quite long on a clear day when a tablecloth of clouds has not descended on Table Mountain.
what a ride!. as n south african, i understand why Travelers from over the world que up for this exsperience!! it is just a MUST DO!!!

What a privilege!!. Be it friends, family, my kids or any first time visitor...going up the Cable car leaves everyone spellbound, mesmerised and in sheer awe . Approaching and summitting Table Mountain this way is nothing short of amazing and fun. Try stand by the window and let the rotating floors do the rest. Great photo opportunnities of the city below, the stretching West coast, Robben Island, Lions head and signal hill. A huge asset for CT and a proudly Cape Townian asset. Just one word of advice, beware of the queues, get here well in time and don't bother going up when a gale is blowing.

Cable car. This is the best cable car ride I have ever taken. Its spectacular holding about 50 people and spinning as it climbs the mountain. There are excellent photo opportunities all the way up and down.

Second only to the Mount Titlis cableway!. The cable way takes you to the Table Mountain from base in flat 5 mins. In those 5 mins, the cable car revolves 360 degrees to give all occupants a breathtaking view of the entire Cape Town city! A must have experience! I found this cable car second only to that of Mount Titlis in Switzerland.

Amazing views. The views over Cape Town on a clear day are absolutely amazing. You can see the whole of Cape Town in all its glory and also Robben Island. It is important to buy your tickets online to save some queuing. Throughly enjoyed this.

Great views, watch the weather!. It is a must while in Capetown. Just remember to watch for the weather as the cable cars won't go up if it is too windy or conditions aren't good. Once up there, go around and explore, you can get great photos. There are some little squirrel looking things, original from that region. Nice plants, you can see all of Capetown from the top, and the new stadium that was built for the Soccer World Cup. Enjoy!

Be prepared to queue. There was quite a long queue(30 minutes) when we arrived but it was worth it for the views from the top. There is a bit of a squeeze to get on the cable gondola but interestingly the floor revolves as it travels so you get to see a 360 degree view on your way up and down. The climb is quite steep but felt totally safe even if you don't like heights.

Very Safe .... I knew the old cable car....but I just loved the new one. Quite practical to take pictures up very close.The cable care has a 360° spin,making your photo shoot, just awesome.I also appreciated the refreshing water sprays as you tow the line to purchase your ticket,a clever idea. Bravo.

Must Do List. A compulsory visit for all Capetown visitors. Be aware of the weather condition before making the trip cause the mountain will close due to high wind condition. Wear something warm as it could get quite chilly and windy up there.
Big area to explore on foot so expect to spent at least an hour.

Impressive. A must when you visit Cape Town and the way to get to the top really. Very steep, fantastic views. Make sure you give yourself time as the top is on a regular base covered with thick clouds and very chilly!

Well organised. These gondolas are quite new and a great experience as they revolve whilst ascending and descending great photographic opportunity, don't buy tickets in advance as the mountain is closed regularly because of low cloud

Table Mountain, Cape Penisula Tour, Cape Town. Our trip was fantastic due to African Sun Tours and Trek Direct. Joleen did an excellent job in planning our events and Sean did a fantastic job showing us around Cape Town and the outskirts. We were a group of 11 with 5 small children, so flexibility was a must and Sean was gracious enough to accommodate all of our needs. Every site was gorgeous in Cape Town will never be forgotten. Table Mountain was so gorgeous as well as the many other views that we were shown (Cape Peninsula Tour, Chapmans Peak, Simon's Town). We went on a day where the wind or rain wasn't a factor and had the most amazing time. We didn't have enough time or energy to take the hike up but I'm sure it would've been an unforgettable experience as well. Lastly please take advantage of learning of the great history and culture in Cape Town (District Six Museum, Slave Museum, and Bo Kaap Museum, Mama Africa and a soccer game). We are forever changed by our experiences in S. Africa. Thanks again Joleen and Sean!
Watch for the Wind. This is simply a must, but plan to go ASAP - the wind stops the cable cars very often. Once up the mountain the views are breathtaking

buy your tickets upfront. nice 3 minute ride. buy your tickets online upfront to avoid the crowds. if there is no crowd - ask the question why? (most probably they know that visibility on the top is very low....)
Long line up. But well worth the wait. Very good value for the money and the views are unbelievable. A nice hiking trail on the top of the mountain.

Cablecar to the stars. You will be scared when you're waiting...it looks so steep, but once you get in, you'll have the ride of your life. I love that is turns, oh-so-slowly so you will have a full 360 view before you reach the top. Awesome ride!

On top of the world!. This is always an amazing experience, living in Cape Town I have been to the top of Table Mountain numerous times, and yet it still stuns me how beautiful our city is from up there.Some tips:- buy your ticket online beforehand and miss the queues!- also make sure to check on their website whether the mountain is open or not before planning your trip there- if you are afraid of heights, on your way up in the cable cart, sit in the middle, where the conductor sits, that part doesn't rotate and will help you feel secure- take a really super warm jacket, even in summer it can get freezing up there!- wear flat shoes, the mountain, contrary to appearances, is not that flat- put sunblock on, because even if it's cold, if the sun is out you are sure to get sunburntTake lots of photos and enjoy this breathtaking and unforgettable sight!

Beautiful views. We decided to take a trip up Table mountain and had to queue an hour just to purchase tickets, then another hour to get to the top. But it is all worth it, the views are spectacular as you get a 360 degree vantage point of Cape Town. We took our own picnic lunch with us and we had that on the mountain. I would suggest this, as the cafe at the top of the mountain can be pricey. When we got to the top it was pretty windy, so I would suggest always take a warm jacket and pants with you, even if its 27 degrees celcuis below, on the mountain it can drop to 18 degrees celcuis. I recommend wearing sunblock as well. To avoid some of the queuing time, I suggest you buy your tickets online at www.tablemountain.net, you'll only have to queue to get the cable car up the mountain. But it is definitely worth the views and scenery of Cape Town. I would also suggest you go early in the morning, as the weather tends to change in the afternoon. We were one of the last groups to make it up as the wind was getting to much to allow more people up.
Cape Town Cable Car. Loved the experience.The ride up was excellent and at the top it was majical,we had clouds all around us...superb..
Beautiful view”. Table Mountain in Cape Town is one of the official New7Wonders of Nature. it is very beautiful place you can take a full view of cape town from there ...............

Long queues 11.00 to 1.00. Loved our trip on the cableway to Table Mountain but we queue'd for 1.5 hrs, started at 11.00am. By the time we came down at 2.00pm there was no queue. It is advisable to book online, cheaper and you bypass a big part of the queue.

What a view!!. We booked on line tickets at our hotel, which saved us some time at the venue. If you can do this we would suggest you do. We still had a long queue over 1 hour and it was a little bit chaotic, but well worth it. The views are just wonderful, we spent about 1 hour on the mountain, and would suggest this is about right (unless you are an avid walker). Wear sun block and when you arrive in Cape Town go as soon as you can. The winds are very strong and for the past 4 days it has been closed! The restaurants are very good and you can get an enjoyable meal with a FAB view. Really have to do this while in South Africa.
Long wait expensive merchandise. If you can get past the frustration of the very long queues it is worth the view. Remember that anything you purchase is overpriced.
Big queue but had to be done.. And well worth the wait. the views are great. Do this when open as it can close due to cloud or wind.

Beautiful view. You have to go on a good day or the cable cars don't run. We checked on the Table Mountain website prior. There's a bit of a queue unless you go early 8am I think it opens, but its ok & worth it. The cars take around 65 people so you move through fast enough. The floor in the cars rotate to give 360 degree views on the way up & down, it's a very steep climb. The views from the top are spectacular and you can take your time exploring the top of the mountain to get all the great scenery shots over Cape Town, Robin Island & the Atlantic Ocean.I think you have to visit Table Mountain if you visit Cape Town

Great views, nice walks at the top. We were lucky to have a clear day to take this trip. The view is breathtaking, and the combination of the rotating floor and one or two of the windows removed gave good opportunities for great photos. Once at the top there are charming walks amongst the boulders and wild flowers, to different and dramatic views on every side. This is a must-do in Cape Town - such a great view of the city laid out before you on every side. Then for a contrast, from somewhere below, watch the clouds pour over the mountain in the afternoon.
It's high up!. Great, quite a queue to get on but worth it. Spinning centre so you all get a good view but it is high so if you don't like that, maybe not your idea of a great day out.

Breathtaking view. Deserving to be one of the seven natural wonders of the world! Once you are at the the top of the mountain, you will be mesmerized by the breathtaking view. Its a photographers haven. You will see the whole view of Cape town and the surrounding mountains and clouds.
spectacular view. We were lucky it wasn't crowdy so we could go on straight away. Rotating platform in the cable car, good picture opportunities as 1 of the plexis was taken out.
Table mountain , worth a visit. This is one of the Natural Wonders of the World. Lots of tourists go to the top, either with the Cableway or climbing upto the top
A cableway with a twist. No matter where you stand, you will always get a change to photograph the amazing views. The cableway slowly rotates...

Great. Usually I am stuck at the back wanting to take photos of the views but people next to the windows with the views are more interested in their mobile phones, but here everyone gets a chance of a good photo without the glass or perspex windows glare because the floor rotates as you go up or down, Why aren't all cable cars like this?!!

Steep, fast and fun. Just take the cable car down as the hike up is fun but the views from the cable car are stunning and it's a steep descent which is quite fun. Don't jostle to get a spot by the open window as it revolves!
Wow. Unbelievable to say the least. The views are great..the ride up and down is quick...remember you are on a gondola, high up. So if your afraid of heights close your eyes
A Must Venue. Well worth the visit and the views from the top are spectacular. Would not hesitate in recommending it.

Its a wonder but the Ride is too short!. One could say its good we get to the mountain so fast but the Cable car Ride itself it too short. Its revolving so standing at one point of the Cable Car, one can get all the views going up & coming down. I would never be able to trek up, as its tedious & time consuming... The Cableway is the best way to get up there - fast & quick to see Table Mountain!
Nice Experience. A nice way to reach the top of the table mountain national park. On your way to the top, the cable car will turn 360º so you can see all the view.

Table Mountain Cableway. Great mode of transport, glorious quiet. Speeds one up the 3500 ft. great panoramic views. 360 degrees, so one can see Lions Head, Signal Hill, the beaches beneath and even Robbin Is.The route down was fun. we were the last to leave, and had the car with a couple of staff members to ourselves. it was surreal, the descent off this great mountain that reigns over Cape Town City.
Iconic Table Mountain. Absolutely fantastic experience. The cable car rotates as it goes up to give everyone a great view.Make sure you book on line to avoid big queues.

A great way to experience the height and views. Do plan your visit with the weather and even then; be prepared for a cloud. That happened to us...it was beautifully sunny and the mountain was clear. We started up on the cableway and a cloud poked its' nose over the edge...by the time we reached the top, the cloud covered everything. Nevertheless, I am so glad I did it! This huge mountain is visible from just about everywhere in Cape Town!

A must when in area.. Booked tickets online with a two week window a little cheaper but so glad we did as no need to queue in the hot sun. Amazing views from both cable car and from top a must visit when in Cape Town.We have been up before a few years ago but worth going up again and would probably go again it is so fabulous.

Well you couldn't not could you?. I would advise going there as early as you can in the morning. As soon as it opens really as it gets awfully hot queuing to board even once you have got your tickets. But once you are on the cable car it really is a great thing to do. The ride isn't actually scary incase anyone is worried. I am not good with heights but this didn't phase me at all. Not half as scary as the Funchal cable cars in Madeira. Brilliant views all they way up and then great walks at the top. I was disappointed not to see a dassie or some more interesting birds but hey what can you do. The views are amazing.

Unsurpassable views. Most tourists don't have the time and/or fitness to hike up the mountain, so taking the cableway is definitely worth it. The two cars run like clockwork - the only hitch is the immense queues that form when the weather is good. We arrived at 10h30 and were totally daunted by a "two hour" queue in the hot sun, so instead we went off on the red bus, did the city tour then returned to the mountain at around 15h45 - perfect. A short queue, a cool breeze and we had a lovely visit.

Bit expensive but worth it if you don't fancy the long walk up. Not too long to wait and the crowd soon disperses at the top. Unless you are planning a long hike off the paved areas you just need some trainers - not flip flops as some wore! A bit expensive but worth the tick in the box for the views
Lets Be Honest, Your Not Going to Hike It. It's cheap, quick and spins so everyone gets a great photo while going up. Souvenir shops at the top and bottom. Definitely worth it.
Be ware of the moving floors!. Yup - the floors in the cable car rotate - so you get a full panoramic view of the area - perfect - but do hang on to someone!
not to be missed. great views and an experience not to be missed - if its a clear day just go. Access to lower station by Red bus but be aware there can be long queues - but worth it

Avoid it!. If you like being herded around like a tourist, then go for it. Otherwise. equally good views from Lion Head or even Signal Hill (& for free!). Not only that, they don't actually tell you what the weather is like at the top. IN our case, it was in cloud, so frankly a waste of time & money.

Go for SUNSET not sunrise. If you arrive in CapeTown and the sun is up without clouds in the sky, go to Table Mountain right away! Do not risk missing the incredible views because "people" tell you to go in the morning... go at night, go for sunset and stay to see the city lights come on! simply incredible view, well priced if not cheap, but worth every penny and second spent on the mountain -- if you have the time pack a picnic basket and take it up with you :)

Spectacular! Book on line.. Recently voted one of the natural wonders of the World Table Mountain is a must see for all visitors to Cape Town. The cable way is by far the best way to get to the top. The other being on foot. Queues can be long and I didn't know about booking on line. This is a good idea. it can still take a while to get on a gondola but at least you want have to line up to get to the ticket office. Each gondola takes about 20 or so people standing up. The floor gently rotates so everyone gets a good view.

Be there early!. Just some advice from my experience:Be there EARLY! The station opens at 8am and there are already some lines when you get there. If possible, get an online ticket up front, otherwise even being there at 8 means a wait time (but bearable, we waited about 20 min in early November). When we came down around 12, the lines were amazing!Check the weather! Even going up on a clear day can mean you are covered in clouds in no time. On days with mediocre weather the cable car is often even suspended. So check the weather up front and check the cable car’s website for updates on the weather at the top.Do the summit hike! Although we used the cable car to get up there, we still wanted to get some exercise, so we tried the hike to the summit (Maclear's Beacon, about 2 hour round-trip), great!

Great view and fast lines. Line for tickets move quite fast. Line for cable car moves quite fast. Great view and well worth the time. If you prepare, buy tickets online and print at home/hotel.How can you visit Cape Town and not check out the view from the top?

Seeing Cape Town with Wonderful Guide. Linda Cass from Amazing Africa Tours made seeing Table Mountain and the Wharf in Cape Town, Cape of Good Hope, and Hermanus so much fun and stress-free! She is extremely knowledgeable and attended to every detail, including pick-up and return to airport, booking our hotel and reservation for dinner on the Wharf, escorting us to Table Mountain, driving us to dinner and ensuring that our table was perfect and taking us back to our hotel, all the first day. Table Mountain is spectacular! We saw it with the mist, clouds, and with a clear view of the city below--was great to experience it with all those elements. The cable car was convenient and safe. The Wharf is a buzz of activity for shopping, dining outside and walking around. Linda drove us to Hermanus for whale watching the next day. What an experience to be on a catamaran in the Atlantic Ocean and see many, many whales, followed by a marvelous lunch in Hermanus on the water!! She also drove us to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope, with stops at an ostrich farm and a penguin colony! Linda ensured that we saw what we wanted to and stayed as long as we wanted . . .for a very reasonable fee! Take camera, walking shoes, binoculars everywhere as much of the sightseeing mentioned took full days. Cape Town is beautiful with both the mountains and ocean and Linda will help to make it an unforgettable trip!!

Fantastic. Got their early so do not wait to long in the que, also got my free ticket as it was my birthday. Staff where extremely friendly and the trip up and down was breathtakingLove the fact that the floor turns so that everyone gets a chance to see the view from all angles.A must do!

A Cape Town must-do (especially on your birthday)!. The Aerial Cableway is a really great and exhilirating experience. For someone is teriibly afraid of heights I managed this one without too much fuss. They have an extrememly secure pod that takes you from the base of Table Mountain to the top in a not-too-long-but-not-too-short-that-it-becomes-pointless space of time. The view is phenomenal and the service is world class. If you're going, take heed of two things: 1. Check online to see if the car is operating - the cable car will be closed if conditions are too dangerous. 2. Book online so you don't have to queue in the ticket line.If it's your birthday, the Aerial Cableway company will give you a complementary return ride on the cableway within a week of your birthday passing (to account for dodgy weather conditions).The pod revolves so don't get to comfortable knowing that you're not sitting by a window. It will come arround to you at least 3-4 times before you reach your destination.The only reason this attraction is rated 5 is that it's objectively a little expensive for locals and definitely seems geared towards deep pocketed tourists. That being said, locals can get an annual pass if they want to. It works out a bit cheaper if you plan on going fairly regularly.

coming down through the clouds. As everyone says it's the view as the car rotates , we only came down as we hiked up from the gardens and across the top, with the cloud rolling in we had a very short wait to come down, the view from the car as it comes out of the cloud is impressive.
What an amazing view. I loved the cable car where you could move around and see all the different views. It is spectacular!

Awesome view!. We did have to queue for a long time so it is definitely recommended to get here EARLY! But it is definitely worth the trip up although if you're scared of heights it may be worth not standing on the edge of the cable car. The car rotates as you go up so you dont need to worry about having a bad position when you get in!

Smooth and comfortable ride. The ride up to Table Mountain is smooth and quick. Being up on the mountain is wonderful with amazing views of mountains and coastline. There are nice walkways with wildflowers. It's an enjoyable way to spend a few hours.

Smooth Ride!. The ride to the mountain top was smooth, i look the way the cable rotates, it gives you an almost 360 degree view of the town and the mountain without moving an inch. The picture quality of the photographer at the base station is not too good, i will suggest a better application to superimpose picture be used and the price of the pictures is too high. Also, a very brief history of the cable car can be shared with guests on their journey to the mountain.Overall, the ride was smooth and worthwhile.

Quick ride down. Rotates on the way down so you don't feel one spot is better than the next. It took maybe 3 minutes at most to get down there so it's a little silly and the view is not as great as when you are at the top of the mountain. I would only take this for convenience, not as an attraction.

Experience that shouldn't be missed. On a clear day, the view that you have from the top, of the city below and the paoramic view of the ocean is breath taking. If you happen to be in Capetown, this is a must have experience. Then, you must be very lucky too, as on a very windy day, the table mountain is closed for visitors
Unless you plan to walk! It is the best way to get to TT. Unless you plan to walk! It is the best way to get to TT. Give it a go and be prepared for some great views. They do pack you in however!

Must see in Cape Town. The moment there is nice weather you have to go quickly because you never know when it will be fogged in. Make it the first to do on your itinerary upon arrival. Give yourself at least three hours if you really want to hike around. Nice café for grub ect. You can purchase your tickets online to save yourself from having to wait in line for a ticket. Best view I have seen in a long time.

What a view! What a time. I was not prepared for this experience as I had no idea what I was going in just that I was going to Table Mountain. It was funny as people started to take photos while in the cable car but they were too late as you had to be quick to click as the car revolved so we saw heaps.

Great for a sunny day. Surprisingly interesting place, copes well with the crowds, although parking can be a little frantic, there is always someone pulling out.Cable car is great, but I would be tempted to walk next time. We arrived about 11 am, but those coming after 3pm seemed to have far less crowds. There is a very busy but good cafe and taking the longer walks up there gets you away from the crowds and offers excellent sightseeing over places likes camps bay.

easiest way to climb:). If you want a comfortable way to climb TableMOuntain Aerial Cableway is for you.It is round turning and very fast. But crowded !The price is reasonable.If the weather conditions allow you to do this do not hesitate .

up up and away. This is the best way and the safest other being u walking all the way up. In case u do pl do it with sumbody never alone as the path is treacherous.The cable car revolves once it is in the air so givegood view to everybody and the window on one side is open for people with lens to take a good click. Go early to avoid rush during holiday season, rest of the time its pay n hop on.at the starting station their is clean toilet and drinking as well as refreshment facilities.

Very enjoyable. We thought the view from the lower cable car station of Cape Town was stunning. However, after the journey to the top, we realised that the view from up there was even better. The cable car journey is quite short, and you are packed into a car with around 60 people. However, the floor of the car rotates so it gives a chance to see different views. Two recommendations: get near the window for the best views, and try to go in the late afternoon (although do check that the weather looks OK since it can't run in high winds).

Don't leave Cape Town without experiencing this!. The trip up to Table Mountain in the Cableway is a different experience as it doesn't matter where you stand in the cable car as it slowly rotates as it ascends to the mountain top. The views from the top are spectacular. We went up just before sunset and got some very good photographs of the sun behind the evening clouds.Check the website for times of cable cars and if the cableway is open.

Magnificent Views. Excellent value for money (you really, really don't want to walk up!) and the rotating cable cars mean that, even if they are packed, everyone gets a 360 degree view of both the mountain and the spectacular panorama across the city to Robben Island and beyond.But be warned, get there early or the queues can be daunting.

An absolute must...just saying. You cannot leave Cape Town without seeing the amazing views that Table Mountain has to offer. They are absolutely stunning and well worth the trip. If you are afraid of heights, do it anyway... You won't regret it.

THE VIEW YOU MUST SEE. no visit to cape Town is complete without a trip up the mountain on the Cable cargreat views in Every direction, though the crowds can be a bit of an issuebest to go Early morning or late afternoon, Best to book on line to avoid the ticket queue.
Great fun. It rotated as you went up and down affording great views of the city and beyond. Book in advance to avoid any queues.

Must visit. How could one visit Cape Town without going to the top of Table Mountain. The Cableway cars are HUGE and revolve so that everyone gets a view. We headed up for the sunset, which was very nice. Took one of the last cars down when the "hooter" (love that term) went off.
Long line ups. Frequent cancellations because of wind, long line-ups, lots of shoving and pushing. Luckily about 60 people per gondola, turning floor.

Spectacular!. Within two hours of arriving in Cape Town we took advantage of a clear blue sky and took the Cable Car up to the top of Table Mountain. The rotating cable car gives everybody a fantastic view on the way up and down. The views from the top are just spectacular and there are plenty of walks across the top. The café and gift shop are good and all the staff friendly. The best advice we got about visiting Table Mountain was "When you wake in the morning - the first thing you must do is look if the table has a cloth on - if it hasn't go straight there" In other words go first thing on a clear day and you won't be disappointed.

A must do - no matter what the weather. One of the most visited sites in South Africa. City tour buses call very regularly so you don't have to walk. Always a queue but the wait is never too long and it really us worth the wait. We have been up the cableway to the top of Table Mountain in both sun and rain and both experiences were magnificent. Weather permitting the view from the top is obviously magnificent but if you find yourself shrouded in cloud or fog there's always the restaurant and the Shop at the Top selling souvenirs and warm clothing!!

Cracking. We were fortunate to arrive Cape Town Sep 30, 2013 - apparently the first beautiful day in eons according to the locals. Because of this, and being a Sunday, we had a several hour queue - but the wait in the hot sun was worth it. We took the 2 hour abbreviated walk at the top and was rewarded with magnificent views. Also, our first time in a revolving cable car and it afforded equal views to all in the car.

don't forget the camera. On a clear day you can see forever...... this morning it was chilly and very windy. Come prepared for changes in weather. You may even need gloves and a rain coat and protect those cameras. The views are breathtaking on a clear day and most days. Resist taking photos inside the rotating cable car, the windows are badly scratched and will haze up your photos. Save your amazement and snapshots for the top and enjoy 360 degree views. It is worth the wait so go early in the morning. Don't miss these pics for your album. Truly a must when in Cape Town.

Going to the top of Table Mountain is a MUST!. If you are in Cape Town, going to the top of Table Mountain is a MUST! Hiking is awesome but it takes time and you need to be fit enough to do it. The cable car is an easy way to get to the top. On the day, check if the cable car is open as it is weather dependent - the wind is unpredictable and gets hectic here in Cape Town. Plan about half a day for this visit. You can do it in an hour or so, but it's nice to spend some time relaxing and enjoying the views from the top. There are 2 queues one to buy the tickets and one to actually get on the cable car. In Summer, these queues are quite long, so plan carefully, be there early or try for later in the afternoon. If you're a local I recommend getting a cable card so that you can go up regularly. To the visitors, I recommend buying your tickets online in order to avoid the queues to get the tickets. The cable car takes 65 people up, so during peak times it was be a little full in there. The highlight of the trip up is that the floor rotates so you actually see quite a view on your way up. I like to spot the hikers, joggers and climbers as we go up. It takes 3 minutes to get to the top. Wear comfortable shoes, so that you can walk around the top. The one section is neatly paved. Another section is more "rustic" but still easy to walk. It takes about an hour to walk the whole top section - this includes all the stops to take photos. There are shorter routes. Take a warm jacket, even if the weather looks great. The weather is slightly different on top and it changes very quickly. I also recommend taking a hat & sunscreen. Obviously take your camera, the views are incredible. The sunsets are amazing. You may even see some smaller wild life (dassies). If you're hungry and didn't pack a picnic. The Table Mountain Cafe is nicely situated. You can get sit down meals or take away meals. I recommend the milk tart. If you packed a picnic, there are lots of interesting spots that you can enjoy your meal and the view at the same time. One for my favourite spots is the Shop at the Top - they have interesting items especially to buy as gifts. I really like that they are so reasonably priced. At the bottom, there is a kiosk where you can buy water and food - handy if you have to wait while in the queue. It's just been revamped so check it out. There are also a few shops at the bottom where you can buy gifts, etc. The staff wear bright green tops making them easy to spot and are super friendly. So if you need anything or have questions, just ask them. Their website is very informative and has some specials too. Enjoy the ride and the views.

A great ride but. it closes frequently in adverse weather (mainly high winds) so take the first chance you get to go up the mountain on the cable car. Don't just jump in and position yourself by a window because the car rotates as it goes up so that everyone gets an open window chance for taking pictures.

Excellent views!. Well organised & efficient operation - the cable car rotates as it ascends & descends which ensures everyone gets spectacular views. We walked for hours on the top & took so many photos!!

high in the hills. the views are extraordinary. you can see all over beaurtiful capetown. the cable car is only one of three in the world. it is very very well organized and it is a must if you visit capetwon. the cafe is good, the souvenir shop is a little pricey but ok. remember, if the weather is really bad or the wind is too strong, they wont let you go up, so check first and take the first opportunity to go or you may not be able to go again.
Cable Experience. Great experience and a wonderful view. The turning platform in the cable car was a new experience. Waiting to get to the cable car was bat, had to wait almost an hour.

Breathtaking views. The modern cable cars fit 65 people and there is space for that, plus the trip to the top is quite fast so you don't feel uncomfortable. It's also good that you have a 360 view since the cars spin around. The structure at the top is pretty good and the views... amazing! Not to mention you can see dassies and birds. Even though a lot of people went up, we were lucky enough not to face queues and we didn't have to battle tourists for a picture up there. Observe the weather before, as it changes fast and the place might get closed.

excellent. My husband and I visited Table Mountain on Wednesday 9th October. We used the city sight-seeing bus to get here, which brings you right up to the cableway station. We hardly had to queue at all on arrival at about 10.20am as it is out of peak season at the moment. The cablecar to the top was fantastic, it rotates so everyone gets a view both up and down the mountain at some point. The views from the top are amazing, although remember it is windy at a height so bring a coat. We had a lovely light lunch in the café up there, sitting looking out over the bay. We were able to post a postcard in the postbox on top of the mountain which was pretty cool. No wifi which was a shame, would have been brilliant to be able to ‘check-in’ to table mountain. There are a good selection of reasonably priced gifts for sale in the café/shop at the top. Definitely worth a visit – the views are amazing.

Cattle class. Only do this on the way down to save your knees (assuming you are able bodied) as the queues can be horrendous (1.5 hours for us but admittedly one car was broken that day) and you are rammed in like cattle for a 3 minute journey. Very much the anti-climax compared with the exhilaration of some good hard physical effort on the way up and the breathtaking views* and beer at the top (*on a clear day of course).

Best trip ever. We visited Cape Town in February 2013... It was my second time on the Cable car and my Fiance's first time on Table Mountain.... The views were amazing and the staff were friendly. The food in the Table Mountain Cafe couldn't be better... And to top it off, my fiance went down on his knees and asked me to marry him, on top of Table Mountain.... What a great experience it was. Can't wait to go again

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. If you want a spectacular view you must visit the table mountain. The aerial view is superb. Please do not miss seeing this. Just ensure that the weather is good thats all.
Table Mountain cable car.. Great cable car, fine looking gondolas ...... and luckily we didn't find queues when we wanted to go up!!!

Cable car. During the festive season (Nov-Dec-Jan) the cable car does get very busy, so do book your tickets in advance or get there early. When visiting the Cape Town, visiting the mountain is a must!

360' View. The cableway floor actually rotates 360' so that you are able to get photos up and down of the scenic views. For some it may make you a little unsettled but you can sit near the controller to be more stable.
Smooth operation. Well thought out in ticket sales and queuing, very polite staff, good smooth ride up and down. Amazing feat of engineering and fantatstic views!

Get tix beforehand. I cannot imagine going to CT and not doing this. The view is great and nothing not to like. While on line kids in school groups sang songs together. Nice walking on top. There was a line both to buy tickets and then to get on. So my advice is: see if it is a nice clear day on top of the mountain and if so have your hotel buy the tickets on line and go over before it clouds up. Really great way to start our trip to SA

Certainly Worth A Trip. This was a great experience. My only advice is to book online before arriving. When we arrived, the line to get tickets (busier in the morning) was about 1.5 hours. The line for those with online tickets was 1 minute!

The weather should be your only excuse for missing this.. A visit to this stunning landmark (visible from just about everywhere around Cape Town) is not to be missed. It's easy to get to, not overly expensive and could literally be the high point of your holiday. Weather conditions can cause the attraction to be closed. But if it's a spur of the moment visit and you can see the top from the ground, you should be ok.The journey to the top is via a revolving cable car which means everyone gets a good view of the surroundings. Clever thinking on that one.Once at the summit you can stroll at leisure and take in superb views. There is a cafe if you're in need of refreshment and pricing is very reasonable. God knows how much you would pay at a similar venue in good old 'Rip Off' Britain.Once you're done and back at the base the pre taken photos of yourselves are available for viewing and or purchase. (No pressure though) a little expensive I thought, but well shot and packaged plus an accompanying disc containing the digital copies and other info.Walking/Hiking up or down is an option but should be carefully organised as the conditions and weather are key factors to the success or otherwise of the venture.All in all an absolute 'must do'

Great way to get to the top. Amazing views. The cable car slowly turns so everyone gets to see the whole view while going up the mountain. And not scary at all which I was worried about. Once on the mountain it is very beautiful. Worth the trip!

Easy way up. This is the cheats' route up Table Mountain but the way most travellers do it. And it is quite a feat of engineering with the rotating platform within the cable car. A word of advice. Buy your tickets on line to save one of the three queues you are going to have to endure before enjoying the experience.

Short but spectacular ride.. We rode he cable cars on a cloudy, sometimes rainy, sometimes snowy day, but even with the clouds and showers moving through the area, the views were spectacular. I think that the ride gives you a good sense of the geography and beauty of Cape Town.
Revolving cable car!. Great views! Plenty of space in the cable cars. Make sure you stand by a window with your camera ready.
Got,to be done. If you go to only one place in Cape Town and the weather is clear this is where you should go. Stunning views.

great view. For people unable to hike the mountain the cable way is a great alternative. It offers fantastic views of cape town.
However anyone who can make the hike should al least do it one way. It's a great experience.

Cable car. Smooth and informative. Liked the revolving car. No delays.
No wait at top or bottom. Kept informed. Plenty to look at - inside and out. Would recommend it to anyone planning a visit.

A must do in Cape Town. It's not as easy as you think getting to see top of table mountain due to changeable weather conditions unless you are there in summer. So take the 1st opportunity you have to visit we were there 3 days & couldn't see it due to poor weather so had to return at end of our trip when we luckily got to go up the cable car & spend some time at the top in brilliant sunshine. Pricey as there was 4 of us & long queues to get back down but was worth the experience
