Table mountain cable car amazing. Well organised but can be very busy on a clear day. Booking on line prior to your visit will give you access to the fast lane. Commentary on journey very witty felt we were in the Starship Enterprise! Thankyou to the Scots person who gave us his fast track tickets, as he'd run out of time and would not take any money.

Great value, pre-book online for express lane. The most relaxing way to ascend/ descend from Table Mountain! If you are a first time visitor, be sure to book online so you can collect tickets at the "Express Lane" windows and head straight for the mountain. Ticket queues can range 30min - 1.5hrs in peak season!The Aerial Cableway company has preserved old carriages, which you can take photos in on your way to the deck. Amazing to imagine how the cableway was originally built, and that visitors used to ride in wooden carriages...!
car. You must take this to the top. Its 360 degree view is the best. Theres nothing like this in the world.

Go Up, Stay Up. Amazing other-planet-like views/terrain at the top. The ride up is fun, not scary in the very large horizontally rotating car which provides a 360 degree view on the ride up/down. I was surprising how much walking (optional) one could do if so inclined to explore the top. I wish I budgeted more time for that since it was beautiful up there. You allow some time to sample the nice casual restaurant for a drink, meal, snack, ice cream. There is a big deck area with tables that overlooks the amazing view in most directions.

Walk is the best for experiencing Table Mountain.. Me and my wife walked all the way up to the table mountain. Its been complete change of weather from where we started and on the mountain.We walked at a slow pace and stopped for some drinks and photos.Overall its a great experience.

Fabulous views and a quick trip up. Going up the mountain by Cable car is great. You have to go to the top of Table Mountain while in Cape Town and this is the way to do it! I understand you can hike to the top, if you want.The car is large and the floor rotates so that everyone gets the views as the car ascends and descends. It is quick and clean.The views from the top are fantastic and you can walk around to see all sides. I was on top for 30 minutes (I had to go down as the last car for the night was departing) but could have spent more time.There is also a cafe at the top and clean toilets!

A must do!. A great half day thing to do in Cape Town. Do check the weather as if cloudy it can be a let down (and you just need to use your eyes - if you can see the top, you'll be able to see down when at the top...). The views are stunning - make sure you don't just stay round the cable exit/entrance but take time to walk around the entire top area - great views and escape the crowds.

Superb views.. The cableway itself is fun and provides an excellent view of the city and beyond. The cars rotate as they ascend to allow everyone to have this view. Table mountain is quite amazing both because of its wildlife, and flora and fauna, and because of the stunning views from all sides. It is a great way to gain an understanding of the geography of the area. We would suggest it is an experience not to be missed. Take care to choose the day to visit to ensure you have the best possible weather. Remember even on clear days the cableway can be closed because of strong winds. We thought the restaurant offered pretty good food at a reasonable price. Much better than you often find at visitor attractions.

Table Mountain Cableway. A great way of seeing Cape Town from above! We parked at the base of the cableway and walked up Table Mountain which took around 2.5 hours of quite steep paths but the magnificent views made it worthwhile! We felt we'd earned our beer in the café at the top! Be prepared for crowds on clear days!

Good experience for all visitors and locals. As a Capetownian i went hiking up the mountain many times from the time i was about 11 years old. I will advise if fit enough and have time, then take the 3 hour route up Platteklip Gorge to the Upper Cable Station. Once up there enjoy the views and have a bite to eat, then take Cable Car Down, Cost R110 (approximately $11). If unfamilair with hiking route rather go with a group or with a guide. However, if you don't have enough time or not much into hiking, then take the cable car up and down, Cost for return ticket R220 (approximately $22), discounts possible for children and pensioners. Some Advice; always take extra warm jacket or coat with, as there is always temperature diffirence below and on top, thus even if its a very warm day, still take warm clothes with in a bag.
Good. Views. A bit disappointing when reached the top must always make sure u visit on a clear day as the mountain gets a lot of cloudIt's called by locals the tablecloth

Excellent way to get up the mountain quickly. Stunning views. It’s an excellent way to get up the mountain if you haven’t the time or will to walk. The centre of the car rotates, so everyone gets an all round view.... it’s a little stomach turning at points with stunning views of the vertical cliff face and of Cape Town. I’d book in advance online to avoid queues for tickets.
A quick fun ride. Cable car spins on the journey so everyone gets a good view. Tickets available at either the bottom or on top of the Mountain and online

Oh you have too !. You cannot come to Cape Town and not go up the cableway. You feel like the King of the World. Cable car has a rotating platform to allow everyone to see the great view. Staff are friendly and helpful. Man made structures cannot compare to the natural beauty of nature. You can spend as long as you like up on the mountain just re-charging your soul. Children free with an adult so not that costly at all.

A must see in Cape Town. One thing we cannot stress more about Table Mountain is choose the day you go wisely. My husband made a rule regarding this- go one the first day of good weather. We went on our second day, not a cloud in the sky, perfect temperature and wow it paid off. It was my first time on Table Mountain and what a spectacular experience. It was amazing.
What a ride. The only way to describe it is breath taking. You must find a good day weather wise but make this a priority.
Super Cool!. The cable car has a rotating platform in it, so no matter your position in the car, you get to see a panorama.
Great views. Good way to get up the mountain quickly. Book online to save money and avoid queues. One way tickets are a good option for those who want to hike up but don't fancy the walk down.

Best way up - and down!. My first ascent was in 1953, but having since become a Capetonian (and lapsed into their ways) the cableway has almost become out of bounds, so bless the visitors who arrive and look for "local knowledge""The website told us that the cableway was operating and allowed us to book our tickets. Even though we thought we'd made an early start, parking was 500m from the cable station and the queue to get into the car reflected this. The queue itself was a virtual United Nations (perhaps with more singularity of purpose), and well controlled. Loading procedures were smooth and practised, and we were soon off. A few turns of the revolving floor, the changing views and close examination of the mountain, and then we were there1
A must do and see in the cape. That was one of my best trips in the cape. The view from the top is the best. If you are in the cape, this is the place to visit or you don't know what you are missing

Must do if you are in Cape Town. Be sure to take the cable car to the top for wonderful views of Cape Town and the ocean. This was the first time I've ever seen dassies. These cute little animals sun themselves on the side of the mountain, and occasionally walk around in the park area. The whole area on top of the mountain gives you a time to stop and take in the 360 degree views. They are all beautiful.
Good Fun. A great experience, over 1 klm above sea level. You won't get a better view of Capetown. Souvenir shops aren't a rip off either.

Up to the top and back!. Loved the rotating cable car so all passengers got to see the view.
Moves very smoothly a d you are up before you know it

Quick. The cable car takes about five minutes to get to the top. It holds 65 tourists. The floor moves around in a circle as the cable car goes up and down the moutain. If you don't want to take the car, you can walk up. I am told it takes about one and a half hours to walk up.

Amazing stuff. This was my most funkiest cableway experience. Let me describe - Around 50 people get in this round contraption. I went to the side to stand where i can get the best view to shoot. No worries as once it starts to go up the whole base rotates. So anywhere you stand you get a 360 degree view as you go up. Very cool. If i had time i would have taken a one way ticket up and then walked down.

The only way to get to the top - except for walking!. This is an amazing ride and the views spectacular. Don't bother jostling for position, as the floor revolves as the car goes up - to give everyone the chance to see all around.You can, if you choose, get a one way ticket and walk down - good luck!!
EFFICENT SERVICE. The Cable car worked efficiently. i liked the fact that the cable rotates, thence giving you a 360 degree view on ur way up

Beautiful views. My friend & I decided to hike up the mountain insead or riding the cable cars up. The views from the top are all simple amazing. You can see for miles and the views of the ocean are also amazing. The food at the top of the mountain in the cafe was also very good & reasonably priced (which was a pleasent surprise). We rode the cable cars down which was fun becasue they spun around giving you a good view. The line to board the cable cars down was a little long however the line moved quickly and gaves us more time to take in the views.
Wow!!. We never took a cable car that had a floor rotate 360degrees. Everyone gets a great view and its fast. The view from the top of the mountain is fantastic. A nice walk with a small shop.

Cable Car. We booked on line but when we arrived there was no queue. The floor to the car turns full circle so everyone can get a view [car stays still]. The car goes quite fast and we had a great time even on a misty mountain.
Highly recommended. Very nice view, beautiful walk, very well reserved national park. Highly recommended! Check weather conditions before you plan to go there since it is very unstable...

Great cable car and service. Just for R$205 or US$21 it is a great experience to ride this 360 degrees rotating cable car where the views of the city are spectacular. This is a must see while in Cape Town.

Has just got better. The last time I visited the cableway was a good 25 years ago, when the cable cars were still open and nobody actually knew what health and safety stood for. I was expecting this visit to be over touristy and the mountain top to be over developed now with the recent flux of tourism to the country since the world cup. I was pleasantly surprised, the "new cable cars" are much more spacious, faster and safer than the older ones, and to my surprise the mountain top facilities and hiking trails are the same as they were 25 years ago still giving a certain wildness and authenticity to the trip to the top, the ticket price could be cheaper considering the amount of people they are able to take to the top of the mountain in each cable car but all in all well worth the visit!

Table Mountain is a highlight. The top of Table mountain affords a beautiful view of the Cape Town, the surrounding mountains and the ocean. It is well worth the visit. The weather changes quickly and it can be cold at the top, so be prepared. Also, the queues can get quite long, sometimes taking an hour to come down. There is a café, a gift shop and restrooms at the top. Another option: you can hike up and take the cable car down. That gives you many stunning views on the way up. We did that. We took the easier trail, Platteklip Gorge, and it took about 2 hours. It's not particularly easy - there is some scrambling involved, but if you like to hike, take it slowly and enjoy it.

Table Mountain. Hello EveryoneTable Mountain is one of the most beautiful places.It is very famous for the cable car.The cable car is an very exiting ride to experience.It has an amazing and beautiful view.There are just an certain amount of people who can go in.Many people are scared because they have an fear for hights.It is actually not so bad you must really try it out.It is an something valueable you paying for.At table mountain there are such an amazing nature enviroment aswell.It so fresh.Being surrounded in such an enviroment in the nature can be a stress reliever for people and it can be a very relaxing place aswell.Many people dont go for the cable car but stays at the bottom to picnic or enjoy the nature.It is also used for photoshoots,solo shoots,weddings ect.Go and try it its awesome and tell your friends and family thats outside Cape Town to come visit.

Fast and Efficient. Getting to the top of Table Mountain couldn't have been easier with a ride on the cableway. At a cost of R205 per adult, the charge was not too unreasonable and the staff were all extremely pleasant.
Great ride to the top of Cable Mountain. Great views as you ascend the side of the mountain. Unfortunately due to rude tourists vision was a little difficult

high flying. if you are afraid of heights this may not be for you but the ride is short and inside the cable car everyone gets the chance at a good view because the floor turns 360 degrees and no it is not nauseating, it was amazing, did buy the picture at the end of the visit, 180 rand + $18.00 canadian worth it
Cable car. Good, well organised queues , good value Amazing veiws. Last car down is 7 pm so you can catch a once in a lifetime sunset
Brilliant. Do not leave CPT without going on it. Great experience, fantastic views of CPT and fast efficioent service

A must if you visit Cape Town. We visited Table Mountain late in the day, arriving at 4.45 and the last cable car down is at 6pm. We booked out cable car tickets at our hotel and saved a few dollars. The drive there was well signposted and it was a clear afternoon so we took advantage. There were no clouds at 5pm but you could see them coming in by 6pm. The view is awesome. It's cold and windy so take a jacket. I would advise allowing more time than we did if you enjoy walking. There are plenty of walk tracks up there and I would have liked to have spent at least two hours exploring.

Beautiful views on a clear day. Table mountain has beautiful views, but is almost always covered with a cloud (which is often referred to as "The tablecloth"). If you get a rare clear day - I highly recommend it. The cable car to the mountain is spacious and pretty cheap.
Historical View. Provides a fabulous view of Cape Town and Robben Island. Very windy so if it is cold be sure and take a jacket.

Sky High!. This was a great way to spend a day away from the beaches with the greatest view you could ever ask for! Go early in the morning before you can't get a parking spot and before the clouds roll in and spoil the terrific view. It's reasonably priced and the tram spins around so everyone gets to see the view all the way up to the top. Plenty of places to stop and chill at the top, so it's great for everyone of all fitness levels.
Terrific Views. Not expensive, and excellent views of Cape Town. Tram cars rotate so everyone gets a view on the way up. Large variety of flora on top. Easy to park.

Fair view for everyone. A view from below may be deceiving, the cable car ride didn't feel as scary as it looked from below, with a great view it offers as it ascends to the top, the ride feel just like only a minute, and the unique of the table mountain cableway is that the floor of the cable car is rotating, given a 'fair' view for everyone.

Table Mountain South Africa. The cablecar is interesting because the floor also rotates as you move up or down the mountain, allowing for a good view no matter how many people are in the car. I went the first part of September, and although it wasn't raining, it was very cool and extremely windy. I wore a parka, and would have worn a cap had I had one. There is shopping and food where you get on the cablecar as well as on top of the mountain. Allow for plenty of time to walk around and don't forget your camera!
Wear a Hat. Excellent trip to the top, great views are so special and make the trip worthwhile it is truly amazing.Remember to take a sun hat it is so easy to burn.

Impressive views. The cableway exceeded our expectations. Although the queues were a quite long - it was worth the wait. The fact that the cars spin around so that everyone can see 360 degree views as you go up. The views at the top are worth waiting for, although only on a clear(ish) day.

Amazing view. I would definitely recommend a visit to table mountain for anyone visiting Cape town. I paid 205 rands for a return trip using the cable car up the mountain. It's really cold so you have to be adequately prepared. There's a restaurant and shops where one can buy souvenirs. Toilet facilities are available also. The pathways for visitors to use are well demarcated and you can see and take pictures of the birds and plants around. From the edges, you'll see the clouds below as well as the whole city. It's best to visit early and while the sun is out. Cable cars stop going up at around 5.30pm and last one down comes at around 6pm. It was an amazing experience and totally worth it!

What a view. The cable car is frequently unable to travel up the mountain due to the weather.. Be sure to take the first opportunity you have when it is operating or you may miss out on the wonderful views.

Make sure is a clear day up on top. In the morning, we were told it is too windy and the cableway is not open. At 3 pm, they said it is open so we went. It is only clear until you got to the top, totally foggy and not able to see anything. The ride is still cool though at $20 per person.

A place you must go!. Amazing view from the top of the mountain. Usually, you have to hire a taxi to go there. Then you have to buy a cableway train ticket to go on top of the mountain. From the top of the Mountain the city view is just amazing!!

Beautiful views. Beautiful views going up and from the top as well. This is really a must do with any visit to South Africa. Prices are reasonable and a great way to experience Cape Town. You can book online in advance but if it is not school holidays or weekend there should not be long queues. Worth it!

Table mountain. Table mountain is a wonder to see in south africa. The aerial cableway is a wonderful experience. The cabin revoles up and down during ride. beautiful place. The cabin rotates and it is wonderful to watch the scenic beauty. There is a light house to go by stairs it should not be missed. On reaching you can see the indian Ocean and atlantic ocean it is stunning. There is direction board of ever country with distance. Hats of to the engineers. There is also a compass. Nice place to visit.

A Cape Town Must Do!. The cable car is a fun (and slightly lazy) way to get to the top of the amazing Table Mountain. If possible book in advance online (you get a ticket that lasts for 1 week from your specified date) as it saves an extra queue.Main advice is to go as soon as you can in Cape Town, particularly in the winter as bad weather can shut the cables down very quickly. Also take warmer clothing than you need at the bottom - it can get really cold at the top (we ended up in a hail shower!!).
A stunning view during ride up & down Mountain. I loved the view where the Indian and Atlantic Oceans meet while dining at Two Oceans Restaurant.I don't like heights but the view is stunning.
Get up when you can. This gives the very best views of Cape Town and the Bay. And everyone gets a view, because of the revolving floor. Book online to avoid the Queues.

A great way to see the city. Ask your hotel manager for the best times to go. When we went ,the line was about 5-10 minutes, when we came down, it looked like at least an hour's wait.The platform turns slowly as you ascend so everyone gets a chance to have a great look.

My Table Mountain Cable Ride Experience.. It was a cool breezy day at the bottom of the Mountain. My wife and I join other tourists to cable ride to the mountain top. The first lap was the uphill walk to Cable take off base. After that, the cable arrives to take us on an upward slide. The aerial view is waoooooooooooh and the experience and view on the top is simply fantastic. Will be there again.

Amazing View!. The cable car rotates as it ascends and descends the mountains so you get a full view of the city and surrounding areas. When we got to the top the view was astonishing. Would definitely spend more time.

If it's a clear day, go!!!. Table Mountain is beautiful. The Cable Way is great. I was traveling in June (winter in South Africa), and my advice is if you have a clear day and can see the top of the mountain GO!!!!!! A must to anyone. I'm heading back in October, and plan on going to the top of Table Mountain again, time permitting.
See all of Cape Town and Get a Thrill to boot. Even if you are only in Cape Town for a day or two, this is a must-do! Get there early as crowds form later in the day. It's an amazing view!

Great Cape Town attraction. Our visit to the top of Table Mountain was great. It was very cold and windy even though it was a warm calm day in Cape Town. Wonderful views! Totally worth the visit. We went at the earliest morning time and were very glad we did. When we came down the mountain, the line for the cable car was HUGE!

awesome. A must visit in Cape Town, the most beauful city in the world.The view is breathtaking, hope the weather is great for you. You can get rain in winter [ July time ] but the sky is fatastic on a good day.

Fantastic views. The new cable way is really wonderful. The rotation of the floor allows for great photo opportunities and the views are magnificent. We walked around the top and the mountain was well kept. The sun was shining and it was a little cooler on the top than at the bottom. The downside was the waiting in the queue for almost 2 hours. The concierge at our hotel arranged the tickets for us so we didn't have to wait to buy our tickets. When we arrived there were no ticket queues because everyone had done what we had done. When we were almost in the front of the queue a school group passed everyone and went in the cable car lengthening our wait. Some tourists in front of us were not impressed and I thought it didn't give them a good impression.
really astonishing views!. I loved the fact that the car turns on itself so everybody gets a chance to take a good look at the city and can take good pictures too!

Table Mountain. We absolutely loved Cape Town. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway was great.When we arrived at Table Mountain, the clouds started to come in. The cable car was great, it rotated as it climbed the mountain, so everyone had a great view. When we reached the top, the wind blew the clouds away in patches, and we had some fantastic views of Cape Town. It was cold when the sun went in, but it was well worth it.

The nr1 thing to do in Cape Town (but check for clear sky b4 you go up!). We got lucky as it just opened after the yearly maintenance period. This is a must do if you are in Cape Town. The travel up Table Mountain with the cablecar is an experience in itself. It lasts about 4 minutes and the floor rotates 360 degrees in the car so everybody get a chance to see all the views. Take note of the early editions of the cable cars (you'll pass them as you cue up) and also when going up see if you can spot some climbers on the last bit up. Table mountain itself has some beatutifull views for you in store if you visit it on a non-cloudy day. Again this is a must do if you're in Cape Town

Wow wow wow.... If the weather is good, change your plans and go. Buy your tram tickets on line, which are good for a two-week period from the first date you set and avoid the line for tickets, which can get rather long when one of the hop on/hop off buses stops.The food in the Cafe was surprisingly tasty, good portions and very reasonably priced.Gift shop had some items not seen elsewhere.A cab ride from De Waterkant area was 70 rand.Note, the cd we purchased hasn't been able to be played back in the U.S. not sure what is the problem ;

My ultimate experience. Table Mountain Aerial Cableway opened yesterday. I booked online, and went on the ride up the Table today. The experience was just wonderful. There was a long queu which was very well managed at timely manner. The service was good, the staff good.... Getting on the top, was arriving in heaven, close to the Lord Himself. The sight was so spectacular. The was intermittant clouds but it enhanced the whole beauty and experience. my kids enjoyed it. Next time would love to hike, with no cable.I give the Arial Cableway and the Park Authority and A++Kambale

Breathtaking!. The cable car re-opened after its annual maintenance shutdown on the day we left Cape Town after over three weeks in SA. Although the cable car opened late, we managed to get up before the cloud rolled in.Amazing!(Remember to use your Wild Card discount, though note this isn't available online)

Closed mid-July to Mid August. The cableway is closed for maintenance yearly for about a month. We were disappointed to miss it. I'm sorry to give it an 3-0star review, but giving stars is the only way to include this information. The double-decker site-seeing bus usually goes to the cable-car station, but with it closed the bus goes up Signal Hill, which is very nice and gave us a bit of an idea of the view we missed.

A Quick Trip. If you want to explore the top of Table Mountain, take the cableway to the top. You could spend a few hours at the top hiking on the trails, at the visitors center or restaurant, etc. If you hike up it, you may not have the energy to do much exploring. It goes fast and is a little scary at first, but if you don't like heights, stand in the middle of the car and you'll be ok.

Great trip. Hadn't done this trip for nine years and had forgotten how good it is. In fact I think it is even better now. We went up with the children during the school holidays amd they had fantastic offers for the children and lots of things to do. The views are unbelievable and this is a must do if you are a visitor to Cape Town.

Enjoyment is After the cable-way trip arrives table mountain. The Cable way trip it self is a bit short and normal trip.The cable is not what we enjoy, but the Table mountain is the one we enjoyed , and the cable is the only way apart of climbing to reach the top of the mountain

Superb views, but can be crowded. Kind of a must-do for most tourists passing through Cape Town. The views are all 5-stars (providing no mist or cloud), but it can get crowded. Highly recommend walking up, and taking the Cableway down.

The number one thing to do in Cape Town. This gives you a great perspective of the city. You can see it's uniqueness better from up high. Make sure that you take a warm jacket up with you. Preferably go upon a clear day.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. The Cableway is safe and convenient to use. It takes 4 minutes to the top with a rotating floor so you have a fantastic view of Table Mountain and the City. At present the Cable way is closed for mainenance until 25th August. I would like to stress the following to prospective visitors that want to hike up and down Table Mountain: Not only is the Cable Way closed, but the Restaurant, toilets and water supply as well. Thus without the Cable cars nothing is functioning. Normally they deliver personnel, supplies and water to the top Cable Station.Please take at least 1.5 litres of water for the hike up and down, plus sufficient food/snacks. Wear sturdy and comfortable shoes/boots. And please carry out your own rubbish, as the bins at the top of the mountain are not being serviced while the cable way is closed. Take note the sun sets at 18h10. So if you start late take headlamps.

Ok if you are in a hurry and have money to spare. The cable car is a wonderful thing to do when you are in a hurry and money to waste.Everyone else should take one of the gorges going up the mountain. If u are lucky you can see some rare birds and you can see the beauty of the mountain itself. Rather take the time and hike up the mountain... yes it takes longer... but once you are up, the view is even more rewarding...
Loved it!. We purchased our tickets online before we visited South Africa. I loved the ride and the view. Restaurant and gift shop worked for me too!

Closed for annual maintenance. Note that the Cable Car closed on 22 July for a months annual maintenance.You can still drive up to the lower station and along the road parallel with the top of the mountain, but it is closede half way along due to a landslip. Visit Rhodes monument near the University, Lion Head and signal Hill.
A spectacular ride. The cable car can hold 65 people, and has a rotating base so all can enjoy the scenic view on your way up to Table Mountain, a must see in Cape Town.

Stunning. A stunning experience awaits you when you board the Aerial Cableway up Table Mountain.
As the cabin rotates and ascends to the top,provided the weather is kind,you will have an amazing view over the mountain,the city,the sea and Robben Island in the background.Get your camera ready!

Amazing!. This was honestly a wonderful moment in my time at Capetown. It was so beautiful and felt so surreal. It was a little scary at first getting in cablecar but it went away once I begin ascending to the top and could see that entire area that surrounded me. You could see the town, the docks, stadium, robbins island and so much more. Felt like you were truly on top of the world! MAke sure you go early because it is a good line and hopefully the weather is good so you can see. It was great.

ROTATING CABLECAR FLOOR FOR 360 VIEWS. The Rotating floor of the cable car insures everyone has a 360 view of Cape Town ascending or descending. There are no reservations because it is dependant on the weather. Queues can be long in Summer so it is simpler and cheaper to book online. You can buy a return ticket or a single and do the other way by hiking.The views of Cape Town and surrounds are breathtaking. Please note the car will not be operating until end August 2013 due to annual maintenance work

Go when it's clear. You can climb up the mountain, but for most of us, taking the cableway is the only reasonable option. The car turns 360º as it goes, and the sights are cool. At the top there are great views of the city, if the clouds aren't surrounding you, and there are also trails at the top for up to 90 minute hikes. It is closed for a month mid winter (July-Aug).

Revolving Cable Car?. Exactly what it is - for optimum viewing and a fun ride. First one I've ever experienced. Very enjoyable little trip up and down and no overly long waits. Table Mountain's table cloth is invigorating to hike over and the views speak for themselves. A modern Wonder of the World.

Such a treat ascending the mountain in the cable car!!. The cable car journey is one I have made many times and I always am exited and look forward to the next trip!! Very professional, they will only opperate if the weather has been declared totally safe! The cable car is stunning, it takes up to 64 passengers standing. Best of all, the floor rotates!! You get a wrap around view standing in one place!! Take a bottle of bubbly and some snacks and take the late afternoon car up and watch the sun go down!! Not to be missed, its a happy mountain and the cable car makes it easy for everyone to get up and down safely!!You will love it!!

The only way to get there - apart from an arduous hike. For people of my fitness level, hiking up was not an option. Having said that, I would not have missed the ride for anything. Yes there are queues but this transportation is highly efficient and the wait is never long. The views are of course stunning - though if you suffer from vertigo close your eyes on the way up or just stair a the mountainside. It is easier on the way down because with each passing second the drop lessens. Be brave, I was and I'm pretty bad with heights. You won't regret it.

Table Mountain Cableway. Highly recommended. Stunning in every way. Just watch the weather, if its cloudy or windy, they close the cableway. Going in the summer months with the extended hours is also recommended.

awesome and will take your breath away. The cable car is a must do.You can see the whole of cape town.It is best if you do it on a sunny day.There is a restaurant on top of table mountain and a place where you can purchase souveniers(a bit pricey though).

Table Mountain - the guardian of Cape Town. This is a must for any visitor to Cape Town.Look to the weather for cloudless weather and make a trip. Preferably early morning before the wind is up. Take some warm clothing in case - it can get very chilly. Take some packed food if you do not want to eat at the restaurant on top.For those who are energetic, there is lots of place to walk.

An easy way up. Offers an easy way up and down Table Mountain in a revolving cable car. Queues can get long in summer, causing delays but well worth the wait. The option is to walk up....or down...if you are fit. But go prepared...water, windbreaker, etc.

Table Mountain cable car. The best way of orientating yourself regarding Cape Town, the Peninsula and Boland! A MUST!!! Enjoy breakfast on top of the mountain and walk around to get 360 degree views of the region in good weather.

Staff. The Aerial Cableway, being fairly unique for South Africa, rotates 360 degrees, for all people to view.The staff are professional and courteous. Nothing is too much to handle and are always willing to assist, especially for wheel chair bound people, thus very user friendly.
Amazing Views. Experience the the cableway to the top of Table Mountain, the revolving floor gives everyone a view. Makes getting the best space easier.
Beautiful view. Nice ride to sêe the whole beach view of Capetown. Once in the top you can enjoy the coffêe shop, take breathtaking view of the town below.
View to the world. On a clear day , definitely the best place in Cape Town to be. Beautiful views of the entire penunsula and a great place to go for a walk. Lots of birdlife.

Highway to heaven. Us locals find the price a bit expensive but for foreigners, it's a great way to see one of the newest wonders of the world. Walking up is not safe, many unexperienced hikers have had to be rescued off the mountain. Weather conditions in Cape town can change many times during a day so be careful of strong winds and cloud cover. The cable car doesn't operate if it's too windy. Sadly Cape town gets most of its wind, the South easter in the warm summer months NOV to FEB.
walked up the mountain and rode down. the cable car is great - revolving whilst descending ---- offering good views of the city and the mountain on the short journey down

nice views for a rotating cable car. Not as exciting as the revolving cable car to Mt Titlis in Switzerland, but still quite impressive. A short taxi ride takes you the foot of Table Mountain from where you take a short journey to the top. Views all around, but the excursion is weather related. Please check before you decide to go up.

Great way to the top. The return ticket was R205 and the cable car took about 5 minutes to reach the top, it also rotated 360 degrees in these 5 minutes. The views were great and we pitied the people who decided to walk!

Go in the winter. We went last week and it was lovely! No line at all to buy a ticket, or go up. Few people at the top and no wait to come down. Very clear sky with the winter sun made for some great pictures.

convenient and helpful. at first i was surprised that there are only one set of cable cars that transport visitors. But the ride is wonderful ( alittle too short) and staff very helpful and considerate.
Cableway. This is the first cable ride we have had were the cable rotates 360 degrees while travelling up and down. This allows you to have a perfect view of the country.

South Africa's must do!. The ride with cable car was fantastic ! The floor rotates so you can see 360 view! Wonderful and Amazing experience ! We were
Lucky that day ! No clouds
Or nothing to cover the table mountain ! Breathtaking view! Love it !

Worth the wait. Despite the apparently long queues it flows relatively quickly as the cable cars take a good capacity. Early morning and late afternoon seem to be good times. It certainly is quicker than walking up the mountain and the views from the top make it all worthwhile..

A wonderful ride up. Liked:
1.You can check on their website if the cableway is open.
2. Can buy your tkts online at a ZAR20 discount
3. The check-in is smooth & efficient.
4. Entertaining commentary
Disliked - Nothing at all

Definitely worth a visit, but quite pricey. We had a team building activity which ended with a trip up the mountain with the cable car. Being a Capetonian I've done this numerous times before and will probably do it again a few times. It is always a lovely experience - you basically have a 360 view around Cape Town and surrounds. I just find the ticket fee quite pricey and the food in the restaurant is also pricey. but I guess that is the tourist thing. My advice would be to pack your own picnic basket and enjoy it there. Also, go up around 4h00 so that you can spend some time walking around and then watch the magical sunset!
Extremely scenic. Something that literally takes your breathe away.A must see when in Cape Town! Try to go towards sunset as you get family of 4 discount if with family.

Tour of South Africa. This was the start of out three week stay in South Africa and what a beautiful start it was. To get to the bottom of the Cable Car we purchased tickets for a hop-on hop-off red bus, which in it self was a great way to get to know Cape town. If you can pre-purchase tickets at your hotel then there in no waiting time when you get there. We arrived fairly early on a perfect clear day. The aerial car revolves as to goes up and down so no matter were you stand you will get a city view.Wear good hiking boots and light sweater and take the trail across the top of Table Mountain - 45 min each way, to get a view of the mountains and country side, we sat watching the planes take-off and land from the international airport, well worth the hike.

The floor rotates!. A must do on any sunny day. Buy tickets online and save USD$5 and the wait in the ticket queue. The rotating floor of the cabin means that everyone gets to see a full perspective of the view.
Awesome View from the Mountain. A place that shows you the nature's best. Vast Mountains, Mist settling along the horizon, Beautiful beaches and the quiet city below in the valley.
Awesome Trip, Too Crowded. Lovely trip to go on, rotating floor was nice so that everyone had a nice view of both Table Mountain and the Sea. It is pricey but worth it...!

The Only Way to Visit Table Mountain. The arial Cableway offers a relaxing and very scenic way to visit Table Mountain. The views of the city are spectacular. It's a little pricey, but worth the expense.

Highlight of our trip!. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway was truthfully one of the highlights of our trip to Cape Town. The technology of the cable car is awesome (it turns 360 degrees) and the views are magnificent!

Worth it. You can hike up to the top of Table Mountain but this is a much easier way up and down, and the views are wonderful, in part thanks to the fact that the car rotates and allows everyone a good view. Tip: book the tickets beforehand online (even just before you come) to save you a bit of money; just make sure you write down the booking reference number or have the ticket page open on your smartphone. Also don't come over without checking on the weather first: if there's cloud covering the top of Table Mountain try again another day!

Loved the rotating floor!. I'm only in Cape Town for a short while, so I wasn't about to hike up and down the mountain. The line was not that long, the trip itself is only 5 minutes and a roundtrip ticket is R205 (about $20.50 USD). The best part was the rotating floor so that everyone gets to see the 360-degree views!

Exhilirating Experience!. Definitely the easier way up the mountain! (way better than hiking! Although we did see people attempting it)Dont worry about not having a view as the floor spins inside the shuttle as it rises up the mountain, plenty time to snap a few pictures and have a heart attack from the height!!

Loved our trip at Sunset. We took the cableway to the top to watch the sunset. The ride is pleasant and while they cram many people inside the car, it wasn't uncomfortable. The only thing is I wished they had cleaned the windows more as they were quite dirty which somewhat affected the view.

Gorgeous views of a beautiful city and harbor. Bring your camera and enjoy walking the paths at the top. The cableway ride is great too. It's very smooth and you rotate as you ascend and descend. There is a small gift shop and snack bar at the top also.
great view and easy on the knees. A great way to get down from (or go both ways) Table Mountain in Cape Town. The car is very safe and the floor revolves to make sure everyone gets a good view.
Stunning. Stunning, a real must do as it rotates as you climb, only takes a few minutes and if you go to Cape Town and you miss this then you miss out!!

Breathtaking. If you are in Cape Town and it's sunny don't miss the chance to go up to Table Mountain. The view up there it's stunning and you can see the whole city from the top. The staff are very kind an friendly. It is a must see!

Must Do When In Cape Town. A must do when in Cape Town ! Buy your ticket ahead of time and avoid the ticketing line. The interior floor will rotate so everyone can get a chance at the window for a picture. Be sure and walk around and don't just stay around the facilities. Bring a jacket as it does get cool at the top. from the top of the plateau you will be flanked by Devil's Peak to the east and Lion's Head to the west, and enjoy an epic views of Cape Town. The flat top of the mountain can be covered by clouds that gives the mountain a "table cloth" of cloud. Legend has it this is a smoking contest between the Devil and a local pirate called Van Hunks.

Panoramic View of Cape Town. This is the best way to see the Mother City in all its glory. Take the aerial cableway car and at the top you will have great views of Cape Town and on a clear day, all the way to Robben Island.
Fun but expensive. A fun trip up the mountain however it is on the pricey side and if there are clouds your visibility might be zero (like ours was) which was disappointing when we reached the top.

Don't miss this!. Although it was a lovely day, we did take jackets, worthwhile. The most awesome scenery. The table top walk is amazing, don't just sit in he cafe. Be careful on the rocks. It felt like being on top of the world, a wonderful way to see Cape Town. The cable car gave me a fright as it was so high and steep, amazing the technology that has been used. If or when I go to Cape Town again I will definitely do this again.

This is the only way onto Table Mountain - a must. Don't be spooked by the height. The last time I took it was in pretty high winds and it was quite stable. The floor rotates, so it doesn't matter where you stand just try to start on a different side on your way down.

Best Way to See Table Mountain. Although there are many hikes to the top of Table Mountain, I recommend the cableway for a more relaxing visit, or one involving groups with some less than fit members.It does tend to be very crowded, so be prepared to be jostled in the queue and in the cable car, which slowly turns so that you get a 360 degree view of the mountain and city. Sunscreen and a hat is a must for the queues.

How far can you see?. This is a must do attraction in Cape Town. The mountain is often under a cloud. Sometimes the mountain is under a table cloth (cloud over the top of the mountain). Wait for a clear day and take the cableway. There are great views on the way up as the floor of the car rotates so all passengers get a great view. From the top you can hike around and view unlimited great vistas. We were forced to go on a partly cloudy day and got partial great views and pictures. The mountain can be socked in totally, at which time you need to plan a return trip! The best way to get to the mountain is on the "Red Bus" which allows you to hop on and off at sites throughout the city. A taxi will also take you to the mountain at a somewhat greater cost. You can also drive or hike if you are a real adventurer. Check out all the possibilities and choose the one you like best.

Up, up and away (round and round) you go. Background: Starting from Tafelberg Road, this aerial cableway ascends the side of Table Mountain, a World Heritage Site and South Africa's most famous landmark.PROS: Location... location... location is its best asset. It sits adjacent to Table Mountain, fits about 5 dozen people and takes roughly 5 minutes for it to climb to the top. After queueing for about half-hour, we got to ride. Fortunately, instead of lining up, tickets can be pre-bought online and at a cheaper price, too, like £12/person round-trip or £7/person one-way. (Minors are about half-price, while kids under 4 years old are free.) No need to fight for a specific window view either because, as it ascends, it does a slow 360-degree turn to offer riders an excellent view overlooking Cape Town and a panoramic view of the surrounding scenery. There is something for everyone. For the shutterbug, at the summit are unbelievable vistas and countless photo ops. For families, the place is kid-friendly. There are free guided nature walks and the guides are very knowledgeable. For the famished hiker, there's a small café at the top. For the shopaholic, a souvenir gift shop, of course.CONS: There could be long lineups at the ticket counter as well as the parking lot, both of which we experienced. That's 30 mins of lost time. (In hindsight, I should've bought tickets online.) Although typically Mediterranean in climate with hot, dry summers (Dec-Apr) and cold, wet winters (July-Oct), the cablecar ride is local weather-dependent. Operating only when weather permits, it may close down on very windy days. Needless to say, if you are acrophobic, take a pass.Tip: Some people have opted to hike up and down Table Mountain rather than use the cablecar. That's fine, too, but the 3km posted distance can be misleading as the terrain is steep. The climb is physically challenging but the hike is worthwhile, and the excursion is within the ability of most reasonably fit people. The monotony of the hike is offset by the number of panoramic vistas along the way. As a viable compromise, you can take the cablecar up and then hike down.Verdict: One of the best views I've seen, maybe ranked just behind the Peak-2-Peak Gondola between Whistler and Blackcomb Mountains in Canada, and ahead of the cablecar between Italy and Switzerland. I'm not sure who has the best views: the riders or the hikers but, in either case, it's a win-win situation. Recommended. Grade A-minus..

Excellent Views Of Cape Town!!!. Excellent views of Cape Town. We went up on a cloudy drizzling day. Visibility was initially very limited. However, the weather gradually improved. Lovely flora and fauna up the mountain. Loved the endangered species of dassels which look like little fat rock rabbits.Parking can be a bit of a nightmare tough.

What a View. The cable car ride to the top of table Mountain was exhilarating and beautiful. It is reasonably priced and doesn't take long to get to the top. There is plenty of room to explore on top. You can get food and drinks up there as well. This is a must do while in Capetown.

Table Mountain Capetown, South Africa. Wonderful place to visit!!Amazing weather.Don't forget to take your jacket along:).i reaaly wish to go there again.Restaurant on top serves mouth watering food.The journey with cableway is breathtaking.
Best view in Cape Town. Can be somewhat crowded, but really a magnificent way to look over the whole city & the view from the top is spectacular!

Panoramic View of Capetown. Must visit place when visiting Capetown. On a clear day it has amazing view. Must check weather forecast before proceeding to Cableway, you may have to wait for long on windy day.
Table Mountain, Cape Town. It is a must to see Table Mountain. You will get full view of Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain. We really enjoyed our visit there.
Excellent!. We went up the cableway and were delighted with the view and the fact they sell Peroni at the top!Well worth doing!
Stay near the window. This is a revolving cable car. As long as you are near the window you will get a good view when your turn comes around.

Circular rotating cable cars give great views. The cableway was the first time I have been on such a transport that rotates as you rise up the mountainside. It gives everyone a chance to enjoy the views equally. The fact that some of the windows on the car were open added to the experience.
Good views. I like the cableway as you get a view of the city as it rotates, do yourself a favor and visit, try to visit in autumn or spring

A quick ride up with amazing views.. A large cable car that slowly spins so you can see both the mountain and the water view. We saw climbers (crazy!) on their way up. At the top there are more view, hiking and a marvelous cafe.

Gorgeous views. U cant come to cape town and not see this amazing landmark. I was amazed by how big of an area youre allowed to explore. Exquisite views of the city and camps bay will amaze you. A little pricey with the cable car but climbing instead for no charge is also an option.

360* view. For those not wanting to sweat it out (and you will if you climb - up or down), it leads you right to the top, and the top is a huge place to explore, with many plateaus. It rotates around, so that you get to see all around, but it can get very packed, so try to get standing space near the huge windows.
In the new 7 wonders of the world.. The view is well worth the time and effort. Really amazing 360 view from something like 1600m to the city and the ocean.
Up, Up and Away. Get in line early so you can leisurely enjoy your stay at the top. The trip provides great photo opportunities as the car rotates as you ascend and descend.

One of the best. I've been on quite a few cable cars around the world and this one is spectacular. It is the first time I've been on a rotating one and this is great as it gives everyone a view. Holding 65 people, it could seem pretty jammed and probably is but on the day I went the numbers were very manageable and we all got a great view. The gradient is really steep and it goes quite close to the mountain but I didn't feel even slightly vulnerable.The commentary is a lot of fun. Makes a real difference from some of the stuffy automated messages you usually get. And it was efficient too. Simply a great experience
The only reasonable way to the top!. Memorable experience - hold tight if you're scared of heights! Loved that the platform revolves, giving everyone all-round vision.
Costly for locals, but a Cape Town must-do. Very cool 360' rotating view, but quite pricey! Especially for locals! I suggest walking up the mountain and then taking the cableway down.
Nice Ride. Wouldn't want to do this in bad weather (don't worry - they close it!) but we had great views and the 360-degree turns made it nice for everyone. Blue-screen pictures were a fun addition!
Fun. Fun trip up table mountain on rotating cable car. If you have clear day this is not to be missed. Enjoyed by all.

Unmissable.... If you are visiting Cape Town, taking the cableway is unmissable.I am terrified of heights but felt perfectly safe in the cablecar and loved the rotating platform on ascent/descent.The view from the top of Table Mountain is almost without parallel in the world - allow at least 2 hours to explore the top and take your time... it is worth it.Sunset is beautiful and worth waiting for.

Cable Car was Overrated. The cable car going up table mountain is quite overrated and expensive. There are over 60 people in one cable car (quite cramped). Until and unless you are near the window or tall enough, you cant really see much. Plus, there isn't any excitement of being in such a big cable car. I think had there been a seating option and a smaller cable car carrying around 5-6 people, it would have been more enjoyable and personal. However, the scenery around Table Mountain is beautiful. It was more beautiful at the top of the table mountain than the ride up.

A must on any visit. We went up shortly after arriving late afternoon. Excellent trip up in the cable car despite initial fear. A must for any visit to Called Town. Be aware that it closes in bad weather.
Just do it!. Fantastic experience. Clear or cloudy - just do it!I have managed to avoid this experience shying away from long lines. Now I understand why there are long lines. Amazing beauty.
A must do in Cape Town. Only do this in very good clear weather as otherwise the mountain top will be under a cloud! Fantastic panoramic views on the cableway and it's lovely at the top too.

Cablecar to an outstanding view.. Your trip to Cape Town is not complete unless you take this experience. The cable car is unique and very safe. We experienced both sunshine and cloud-type rain. Our group had a small snack at the café on the top. We did not have 'rand', so we used our credit card.

Scenic experience. We used the cableway after hiking up the mountain. Table mountain is a must for any new visitor to Cape Town. Hiking up takes ~2 hours and make sure you are relatively fit (I am not). The view throughout is magnificent. Had a nice hot drink in the well equipped restaurant at the top before taking the cableway down. Doing a 360 degree rotation during the trip really gives everyone a chance to see the views of Cape Town.

Good cable car and useful info. Well set out tourist attraction - good and safe cable car, lots of useful and additional info for the walk on the top of the mountain about the history of the mountain and the incredible floral kingdom. Reasonable snack facilities up there... altogether quite a nice trip.... but I'd still prefer to walk than catch the cable car - better viewing and better for ur health. :)
was not going to do it, but..... Dont't miss it, it was really a relaxing way to spend an hour, enjoy, I was told there could be long lines, but allw as smooth and efficient.
An awesome view of beautiful Cape Town. Plan to spend a few hours hiking around once you get to the top & have a snack, beer or wine at the Table Mountain Cafe.
No other way to travel. If you like hiking this is not for you. What we loved was a rotating floor (never saw this before). Very comfy ride. Highly recommend it.
Table Mopunstain. Was i scared the first time i went up ten years later i still get goose bumps everytime i go to the top of this Mountain breath taking

Makes the trip to the top easy!. So, we went to Cape Town with the intention to hike roundtrip. However, upon arrival, realizing it would take almost a full day out of our other siteseeing, we took the easy way out.
Fast and easy. Book online for discounted prices & to skip the queues.

Quick and easy way to get to the top. We were lucky to have clear weather during the off season. We saw the spectacular mountains and enjoyed going up by the cable way. It is an expensive way to go up ... but when one is short of time and stamina... that is the only way!!

Up in the clouds. For SA citizens, the cable car is free on your birthday. I decided to take advantage of this opportunity this year, and went up by myself, as my girlfriend and all my friends were busy.The view up there was so amazing that I took several photo's of the same views, just because of how the clouds were changing. At one point the whole of Cape Town was covered in a low, thick cloud, which made it seem like we were floating above the clouds or something. I took one of the longer walks up there too to get away from the crowd of tourists.Now I can see why this is the first thing most tourists do when they visit our country.
Spectacular Views. Seeing in every direction with written guides as to what you are viewing. There was nothing that I disliked

Great weather, great views. When you travel sometimes you hit the weather perfectly, and the day we went to the top of Table Mountain it was one of those days. Killer views! If it had been windy or foggy, maybe we wouldn't have been as impressed, but it was a great way to get the lay of the land.
Cable to Table Mountain. This is very inexpensive and quick. I saw people taking the hard way with ropes, etc. No thanks, the Aerial cable is a lot more scenic.
Awesome. I loved it! What more is there to say. I have been here many times and I am always awestruck by the stunning views, great scenery and the peacefulness. I cannot wait to visit again.
Awesome views from the top.. This is another "gotta do it" in Cape Town place. On a clear day you can see so much and the walk along the top is really beautiful.

spin your way up the mountain. Excellent way to save your legs and get up Table Mountain without walking, get there before 9 and there should not be too much of a queue. Chuckle whilst watching the fight for the front, which is unnecessary as the car spins whilst moving

WOW.. Can miss that, go explorer, drink a hot chocolate seeing all cape town from above.
Very very nice, choose a good weather to go up there.
Go early.
Enjoy it

Excellent views. The cable car rotates as it ascends and descends the mountain so an excellent way to see the view. Note it is possible to walk up the mountain but only if you are sure footed and it is not wet.

On the Table TOP. When you visit Cape Town in South Africa top attraction is to visit Table Mountain. Those who are lucky to have good weather conditions can enjoy the fantastic view from the top of the Mountain. Its Amazing! You cant forget the Cable Car Ride where Cabin shutters i.e. outer portion -spins and all of them can enjoy the aerial view . one should not forget to visit the same.

Spectacular views. This is a must-see spot! Will never forget it. We stopped here as a part of our City Sightseeing Bus tour and could not miss the opportunity to ride the cable car to the top of the mountain. It was really cool that the whole ride to the top the cable car rotated so that you could just stand in one spot and see it all. That day it was very foggy so we were informed that we may not get good views at the top, but God must have known how badly we wanted to go up there and gave us a long enough window to tour the top of the mountain and get some awesome shots of the city below. There is a really nice restaurant where you can eat and also two souvenir spots that you can get cool items to buy. There are picnic benches/tables where you can lounge around and just enjoy the fresh air. Loved every moment of it and would love to do it again. Also, it was fun to see a kiosk there that took a photo of you and automatically posted that photo to Facebook. Creative!

When in Cape Town......... ....you really must experience Table Mountain. The only sensible way to do this is to take the cableway. But the queues can be gi-normous! So the best way to avoid a 3 hour queue is to decide that you'll go on the very first fine day (when the cableway will be open-sometimes it's closed due to the weather). Get there nice and early, 8 or 8.30 if possible, having already purchased your ticket on line, which means you can jump one of the queues. Get a taxi (not very expensive) or drive yourself. Don't rely on the Jump On Jump Off bus as you'll get there too late and you'll get caught in a traffic jam. Then have breakfast when you get to the top. The food isn't fantastic but it's great to sit and look at the sights while you eat (be careful the birds don't steal your food!). Then you can take your time to wander about - allow several hours. The cableway down doesn't seem to have long queues. I went in peak season so the queues might not be so bad off season, however the chances of it being closed are greater.
Wow!. The revolving floors in the cars guarantee everyone a full panoramic view on the way up and down. Very exciting and not at all scary (and I suffer from vertigo!).

Affordable and Tourist friendly. Very affordable and tourist friendly.On your birthday you can get 50% discount after 6pm if you show your ID or Passport to prove it is your birthday.The restaurant on the top of Table Mountain is very reasonably priced and the food is fantastic.

Great 360 degree views as the cabine spins round offering great sights for all on board.. We arrived midweek, mid afternoon in November and could get on to the first car that came along. I gather that at peak times queues can be a problem.

Well worth the money. Well worth paying for the short trip up the mountain. The spinning booths give you a fantastic 360 view and stop you feeling ill as you go up. Well worth using these if you are short on time or are unable to hike up

Well run Cableway to the top of Table Mountain. A wonderful alternative to hiking up that mountain! Cableway moved quickly and efficiently. Highly recommend unless you absolutely have to hike the mountain.

Amazing Views. We were lucky enough to visit on a clear day with no lines. The staff are friendly and the cars arrive within a fair time so that you do not have to wait too long. The cars are clean and well maintained and having them rotate makes it easy for everyone to get good views of all the sights. i was very impressed

Have to do it!. This is as you can imagine a tourist scene but the view is worth it, watch the weather bring a jacket!Fun but a lot of people. be prepared to be pushed watch out for the tour groups!!!!!
On a Clear Day. However it was foggy the day we went up. It did add to the mystery and we caught glimpses of the promontory. Nice gift shop at the top. A good experience.

brilliant!. what a pleasure to visit.the footpaths and well laid out lookout points make this a wonderful experience not to be missed. breathtaking and relaxing all at the same time. i can only compliment the management. it is run in such a manner that you don't really notice anything being run at all. very low key and effective so all your attention can be on enjoying the mountain and the views.
Great Ride. Lovely idea that the cable car revolves giving everyone a turn to see the surroundings on the way up.

View of wonder. There is nothing more beautiful than scoping the horizon of a place such as Cape Town. To see the expanse of the city to the outer laying areas. Two oceans on both sides and the hustle and bustle of the city that hugs the mountain in all its glory

A really great view of Cape Town. The cable ride is very impresive and the ride is worth it as the view from the top of the mountain is outstanding. In the area all you see is this mountain that looms over the city so a ride, in lieu of a hike, is worth while doing.
Amazing. A must if staying in Cape Town. The views are breath taking and a must for every traveller... I loved every minute of it....
Stunning views. The cable car rotates, so you get a 360 view. Really worth doing after a hike up the mountain. Go early to avoid massive queues.

Glimpse of heaven!!. When you transcend in the cable car, it feels like heaven!! The cable car and it's slow rotation gives the 360 degree view of table mountain and cape town and it feels like heaven!!A stroll at the top and a hot chocolate at the cafe at top... life seems so perfect!! This was the most memorable experience in our entire trip!!

How else do you get up there ? !!. No problems with waiting in line as we are in African Autumn, so less tourists we suppose, but how else could you get up there unless you are a climber ? !! Cablecar host was witty. R200 expensive, but once in a lifetime experience !
A must to visit. On a good clear Capetown day, this cableway is a must visit, great views and once you get to summit of Table Mountain the view is breathtaking.
excellent customer care and communication. Excellent customer care, communication and humour in the cable car by the cable car attendant/conductor.
Not at all scary!. Don't be scared of the height, it's not at all bad and the revolving car means that everyone gets a share of the views. Stand next to the open part to get some great photos!

Expensive. It was cool going up table mountain, but it was just so expensive for the cable car. You pay R200 just to get up there. I wasn't able to hike up, other wise I would never have paid so much money for it

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is tops for young & old. This is one of South Africa's top attractions. The cableway takes you from the lower cable station to the upper station in a few minutes in a large cable car that takes up to about 60 people (be sure to position yourself near a window). The floor revolves, giving you a 360-degree view of Cape Town and the front face of Table Mountain.Once at the top, there are lovely walkways which are suitable for prams and wheelchairs, but also longer routes through the fynbos if that's what you're looking for. There's also a restaurant with breathtaking views, and a lovely little "Shop at the Top" for a special Table Mountain or Cape Town souvenir.You'll probably be thirsty at the top - so take something with you or buy it there. A lovely thing to do is to take your own picnic, find a spot with a view behind a large rock, and spend as long as you like. The weather can change quickly on top and can be different to the rest of Cape Town, so it's usually a good idea to take a jacket with you.And the best tip of all - buy your tickets online beforehand at www.tablemountain.net. Not only do you get 10% off, you also stand in a much shorter queue, which can be a huge advantage on a busy day.
Modern and organised. Very well maintained but can be on the more expensive side. Well worth the visit after all that is one of the many reasons we go to Cape Town.

an unforgettable experience. there are 2 routes to the top of tabletop mountain.- the first is a strenuous climb of many hours,, the second an easy climb - just take the cable car by the aerial rope way,taking only 5 minutes! we , being tourists and also seniors , chose the latter! It was an unforgettable experience. At station one you get into the cable car with glass doors and revolves through 360 degrees giving you a spectacular views of the city, the sea and the neighboring areas !

Fantastic!. The cableway takes you from the car park to the top of the mountain in a ratating car with an open window. YOu can see all fantastic views of the bay and the mountain from the car. DOnt hold on the sides of the car though, as it rotates!

360 Degrees!. This was a FUN ride to the Top of Table Mountain - and well worth the long wait. The cableway turns 360 degrees so everyone can see from all angles. It highlights incredible views as well!!

The only way to scale a mountain. Traveling to the top of Table Mountain was only overshadowed by the beauty of the surrounding views once you reach the top of the mountain. The ride was smooth, secure, and extremely pleasant. I thought it would be a little frightening, but the entire experience was just one awesome moment after another.

You have to wait very long even with tickets bought in advance. You definately need to buy your tickets on internet in advance,but still then you have to queue for at least an hour, an hour a half.Some people are queuing, others are not and just walk past you. There is nobody checking the queues, so people complain, and sometimes even get aggressive.The cable car ride itself was super! The views are stunning, and when you are on the table mountain itself, you feel as if you were in heaven. Not to be missed!
like the Mountain - Brilliant. Whats there to dislike? speedy trip - amazing views and humorous operator. I thought it was cheap at twice the price.

Definately a world wonder. Great facilities, spectacular view. The cafeteria at the top is not great and would have liked to have a really nice meal up there like at Two Oceans at the Point. We took the Hop on Hop off bus which is best if you don`t want to hike from your parking spot. Avoid the rush at around 11:00 - when we came down there was no queues.

Wheelchair friendly. The staff made sure that I was we'll catered for in the aerial gondola. My wife had to keep her eyes closed throughout the 4 minute journey but even she admitted that the views from the top were well worth the journey up.

NEw cable car is amazing. What better way to see the city and mountain from one view point. With the new cable car that rotates and gives you the perfect vantage point for pictures. They even have sundowner specials from time to time which are well worth it.

Views are breathtaking. The tram rotates as you ascend and descend so you can see everything. While it is was warm at the bottom of the tram it was very cold at the top, so be sure to take a jacket. The views of the harbor are wonderful.

Not bad. Just a little queue in the morning, we waited approximately 20-30 minutes before boarding the cable car. The ride take maybe 5 minutes if not less. Pretty crowded and everyone is trying to get a place next to the window. 105 rands one way. If you change your mind and wanna take it to the way down too, you might buy the tickets in the shop on top. Same waiting time on the way back.
360 degree view. It rotates so you can see the view from any location in the car. Certainly an easy way to the top and the views are fantastic!
The only way to see Table Mountain. A most enjoyable and scenic trip in the rotating Gondola. I would recommend this way to the top! The price is modest and the view is phenomenal.

Wouldn't like to do in height of summer. Quick and efficient, but wouldn't like to do in summer as I'm sure the wait would be a nightmare, but staff were great, closed in July for maintenance so check before you go

Efficient, but costly. Usually I walk up Table Mountain, but I have used the Cable Car before. The trip itself is really great, the floor rotates so as you ascend / descend you are graced with a full 360degree view.The driver is friendly and polite. The ride is very gentle and yet quite fast, it's only a couple of minutes from one end to the other.But it's costly for locals. I'm sure those with Pounds, Euros, Dollars, etc will have no problem affording the trip, but those earning Rands see this as quite expensive. Good maybe for the experience, but rather walk up after that.

Push through your fears. Even if you have a fear of heights you have to push through it for the fantastic views on the way. Each cable car holds a maximum of 65 people and has a rotating internal floor so everyone gets a good view. It is extremely smooth and only a short 5 or so minute trip to the top. It doesn't operate in windy or poor weather and so there is no need to worry about it swaying or rocking.

Our visit to the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. The cable way was awesome to be lifted to the top of the mountain. The view from the top was really a sight to see. A bit difficult sometimes to climb but definitely worth the effort.
Nice views. It is a quick ride up to the top, but the fun part is floor in the cable car slowly rotates as you go up. It gives everyone in the car 360 degree views on the way up.

Breath Taking Experience. Going on the cable car is quite exhilarating; you get the nervous drop feeling in the pit of your gut feeling but soon the view soon takes that feeling away and you just amazed at the beauty and calm. Since I went during the week and a little of season it wasn't as busy as going in the summer time. You truly get to enjoy going up the cableway. When you finally get to the top, the view is just awe inspiring and you imagine you can see all the way to the end of the world:-) You have not experienced Cape Town unless you've gone to the top of this great wonder.

Expensive but worth it.. When I saw the climber as we almost reached the top of the mountain my knees turned to jelly. This happened frequently as I looked over the top of the mountain and gazed down on the clouds from the top of Table Mountain.Everything about it was fantastic. The restaurant on the top is very good with lots of variety of foods at very reasonable prices. A nice place to rest and enjoy the beautiful views.A must see in Cape Town!

Popular Route. The cable way is a very popular route if your not hiking it up. I would recommend booking your tickets in advance as some of the lines can get quite long. Some people can get quite pushy because they want a photo in a certain spot but take it as it comes. The cable car actually slowly rotates around so everyone gets the same views. There are camera peep holes and vents your can use. Also on some cars and weather dependant there is usually one window open which allows great photos on the trip up or down.

Table Mountain Cableway...awesome!!!. On the 15th March was my 21st Birthday, so I decided why not visit Table Mountain, because its free on your birthday. I've been there several times, but never went on to the Cableway. So I went on that day, and what can I say. It was amazing, scary from the top, exciting and exhilarating all at the same time. I really had a great experience, since it was my first time. I live in Cape Town all my life, and have visited many attractions before, but this was the ultimate experience.And I'm doing it again, soon! Can't wait...

Stairway to heaven.. Fast and efficient way to get to the top. If you are feeling energetic you could choose to climb but this is the way to travel. Views are amazing and the way the floor rotates everyone gets a good view.
Table Mountain. A great experience. Well organised and smoothly and pleasantly run. Most spectacular views imageable. The rotating cable car is a stroke of genius.
Panoramic Views. The cable car spins as you ascend and descend allowing you to see everything, a very unique experience.

Feel like you are top on the world. Cable car up and back was great fun. Completely mesmerising when you walk out on to Table Mountain. We enjoyed a birthday lunch for my 7 year old in the restaurant. Food and service was excellent. Do not miss it.

Great view - chilly though!!. Take your sweater or rain jacket - assuming the cloud has cleared sufficiently to allow you to go up at all? Great view of the city and coastline. Bit of a queue to get up and down at 'peak' times!

Table Mountain Cableway. Looking at what it does - that is to take people on top of one of the most remarkable natural wonder of the world, the cable way is not treated as part of the enjoyment of going up the Table Mountain. The reason I say this is that due to the high demand by people wanting to go up, it is resorted to getting people up and down the mountain as quickly as possible. It travels 1 Km at a time but the journey lasts only 10 minutes and you are there from the bottom to the top in no time. It does not allow time to take the view of the city, the mountain and the valley in. Fair enough, it rotates as it climbs but it rotates so quickly that you can't "take the view in". A nice slower journey would have been better. Still, it is the only way up to the Table Mountain for most of us.
Zoom to the top. Although some people hike to the top of Cable Mountain, I would take the aerial cableway to the top. Your choice to hike down or ride down.

Faster way to get to Table Mountain. I recommend to go early in the morning to avoid crowd and to have cleaner air to see farther to the horizon. Rotating platform inside the cabin to see every direction while you are ascending/descending. Small restaurant at the top if you feel hungry.

Not to be missed.. If there is one thing you should not miss in Cape Town then it is going up Table Mountain! We were lucky that we went up on a perfectly clear day and one can see so far from up there. It blew our mind. i almost became religious up there... hahahahah

Best views ever. The aerial cableway was the easy way to the top of table mountain. It was efficient, quick but a bit crowded. The floor of the cable car revolves so you get all the great views. If you are afraid of heights you might have to close your eyes for some of it as some of the windows of the car are totally open.

Fantastic Views. be sure to allow time to walk the trails once youre up top---next time we will walk up from the bottom. great views. we loved the post card pack from the photos that were taken as we arrived!

A Must See. Make sure you buy your tickets on-line, at your hotel, before you leave. It saves a lot of messing around at the Cable Station. The views are spectacular, and the cable car rotates so you don't have to fight for a spot to take photos.

fantastic. well worth the wait take a tip book on line to avoid to longer queues,if the day is clear can wait for up to three hours but well worth the bother,can be very unsteady take good walking shoes,look out for base jumpers what a fantastic sight that is to see a human soaring from the top of a mountain fantASTIC

Smooth riding to the Top!. The cable way rotates 360 degrees!!!! What is left to say?? An experience watching the world turning at your feet :) Could not resist. Overall going up the mountain is an experience in itself. Be there EARLY, wear comfortable shoes and if you not prepared to splurge $$ for food at restuarant then pack your own goodie bag to enjoy at the top of the world.

Worth it. This was a long-awaited visit to arguably Cape Town's biggest attraction. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The cable car's platform rotates as you go up and down the mountain, so there is no need to find a 'perfect' spot for taking photos. Everyone has a chance to see it all. The views from the mountain is breathtaking, but make sure that you go on a cloudless day, as very often the clouds are quite low and it is not possible to see everything. Wear comfortable shoes as you can walk quite far on top of the mountain, and remember to bring something warm to cover up. The weather can change very quickly towards the afternoon (as happened with us). We had a delicious lunch at the restaurant with some having pizza and others having salad. There is also a wide variety of beverages available. We chose to sit outside and enjoyed the view so much that we actually spent longer at the restaurant than intended. It was a very enjoyable trip and we will definitely go again.Tip: Go early in the morning as it can get very crowded.

new wonder of the world. This is a fun way to visit this site named new wonder of the world--cable car ride. I did not find photography to be good from the car. There are plenty of opportunities elsewhere. The car ride is taken standing and the windows rotate around. No grabbing on anywhere is allowed due to the rotation needed. It is a really unique system. Up at the top are a souvenir shop, restaurant, and look-out points. Be sure to walk all around for sea, Robben island, and city views.Recommended.
