Car ride. A good trip to the top with the car rotating so you see all the sights of Cape Town. The car was not to crowded but could be on a busy day.

Very smooth ride!. The view in the cableway if fabulous when you are going up or down the mountain. Some side of the cabin have no windows, so you can take fabulous photos. Try to go ther very early, because the problem is sometime the overcrowding

Table Mountain. I visited Table Mountain once about 15 years ago. I visited again the other day, and how it has changed! I was impressed to see the systems all working...from the ticketing to the layout on the top of the mountain. It was good to see that a world heritage site is being taken care of :)Free cable car ride on your birthday!!!!!!!

Buy tickets on the day. get your tickets on the day you wnt to use the cable way. it gets busy so get there early. did esperience the rude staff on the mountain. next time will push them down the mountain... ops thats harsh :)

Brilliant. The whole mountain experience was fantastic, even if being in a cable car isn't my favourite thing ever. The views, if you're brave enough to look out of the windows from the rotating floor, are really something to behold.

Smooth and easy. It offers great views, is easy to get on and off :) Like any cable car it's the best way to see a city ... and when it's the Mother City then you'd better get to this cable car!I remember using the OLD cable car (probably about 20 years ago) before they revamped it ... I knelt down on the floor and could see the ground beneath me through the holes in the floor (courtesy of the rust)! This one is much better (no rust or holes) and faster too :)

Table Mt. Cableway. It's beautiful. Best time to go is just before sunset. You will see the most amazing sunset in the world and I live in Hawaii where we also have beautiful sunsets, but I've never seen anything like this. I'm afraid of heights, but this aerial is smooth. Be sure to not stand in the middle but stand at the edges. The tram rotates while moving up and down, so the view changes. When you get to the top and start walking around its rugged and rocky, so wear closed toed shoes.
Nice experience.. Get your tickets online, seems it's cheaper.Be prepared it will be crowded. The cable car spins slowly for a 360 view.
scary!!!!!. A rotating cable car with most spectacular views - if you open your eyes to see it! Means to an end in my case but rest of family love the experience

Must do. A bit pricey, but definitely worth it! The views from the top are awe-inspiring. Make sure to check the weather in advance before booking online! And go early, queues can be insane on nice days.

Brilliant - just get there early to avoid the queues. Friendly operators and the rotating cable car means you get a 360 degree view as you travel up and down.The green screen photography, where they try to sell you a very kitch set of photos with your image superimposed in a cable car are just naff. I'm sure some people buy them simply because they are so bad, but it just seemed an incredibly wasteful exercise to me - they insist on taking photos of everyone and then printing the pictures, only to throw most of them away - a real shame and waste of resources.

Highly recommend on a clear calm day. We were fortunate to go when there were few lines, earlier in the morning, and had perfect weather. The cable cars revolve, to give everyone views of the Mountain and scenery. Once at the top, you can take as much time as you desire walking around and looking at all the incredible views. We were fortunate to see Rock Dassies (sp) little brown animals.

Well maintained. This review is about the cableway. The view from Table Mountain is another review.I just wrote that the Table Mounting is a MUST. If so, the cableway is a mustmust. To walk up isn’t an option to most people. The cars are quite new. They’ll give you a smooth ride, if it’s not too windy. But if is is, they won’t run. Don’t be anxious, this is well maintained!I think the cars take 50 people, so that’ll help the queues.The cars are revolving, which means that you’ll see it all when riding!Some tips:1. Don’t book in advance. You could chooes a foggy day, or ”a table cloth day”.2. Be there right when it starts. Then there will be NO queues (unless everyone reads this review). Also between 2pm and 4pm are less queues.3. If you are retired, go there on a sunny, beautiful Friday! Then it’s half price for retireds. The home page says ” SA senior citizens”, but we were told it was for everyone. TA doesn’t show the home page adress, but it is: http://tablemountain.net/

revolving cars give a 360 degree view. If you want to get up to the top in about 3 mins then jusmp on the cable car and enjoy the views. I would advise booking tickets in advance as queues are very very long.
Wow!. Very well run - staff are superb. We could also finally cross this off our list of touristy things to do - great experience! Beautiful on top of the mountain - always take something warm with!

Stunning views. So lucky to arrive in Cape Town by ship on a perfectly clear day. The tablecloth was nowhere to be seen. People told me they had visited 4 or five times and tablecloth always on to ruin the view. Once up there after a stunning ride up with car rotating through 360 degrees the views are spectacular.

Too crowded. It would have been a much better experience if the cable car was not so packed. The views from the mountain it self were to die for. There was a small queue to get tickets which moved fast. Check if the cable car is operating before you go as it does not operate in bad weather.
Wow!. What an experience 360 degree view of mountain! If busy they do cram you in make sure you get to the window or edge! For the views!

Guests to Table Mountain not to be missed. Booked online but it still took about an hour to get to Table Mountain after arriving about 9.30am but it is still worth the visit an outstanding experience even although this is not my first time never cease to be impressed.

Views for miles!. If you want to see Cape Town at its best make sure to visit Table Mountain. Make sure that if the day is clear to get up there! Change plans if you have to because you never know when the clouds are gonna roll in!

Gorgeous views. We sure to arrive at 9:00am to beat the buses and you wont be dissapointed. We booked our tickets on the Internet to save a few bucks but specially to avoid big lines. The rotating platform makes it very special and give you the full view of every corner.Is really worth it because you want to spend time walking in the different paths up at the top and is the perfect opportunity to take magnificent pictures and enjoy amazing views.Don't forget to take a light jacket because it gets windy and you want to enjoy it all.

be smart to get the most value from this attraction. We arrived at 11:30am and it was very busy - would definitely recommend that you pre-book so that you can avoid the queues. Take plenty of sun block and a hat if you anticipate having to queue - the line exposes you to the sun at some points. Look for discounted vouchers if you are attending an event in Cape Town - we were part of the Cape Argus Cycle ride and we found a "2 for 1" offer in the brochure - a really good saving although you might have to queue to redeem it. Ensure you stand close to a window in the cable car and be prepared for the floor slowly rotating so that you can get a 360 degrees view - awesome. We regret that we did not make enough time to take advantage of a guide - these guys know their stuff and will help you to make sense of the panorama in front of you. C'est magnifique, by the way. We were disappointed that the official photograph was not ready for us when we descended - i guess we didn't loiter at the top long enough. You need to give it about 1 hour between ascending and descending. If you atre wheelchair bound, there are decent pathways that are wide enough for a chair. if you need a loo break at the top, I only spotted one and that was not at the entrance/exit to the cable car. it is situated at the restaurant. If you are getting a cab back to town decide in advance if you want to hang around in one of the people carriers whilst they attract more fares - it is probably cheaper than a standard cab but you might have to wait up to 15 minutes whilst the drives tries to persuade others to join you. Choose your day to go by becoming a bit of an anorak with the weather reports - mist and fog are a big "no no". if yu have flexibility, Carpe Diem when the weather is good;

Pricey but a fun way to get to the top. This is a pricey way to see the top of the mountain, but it rotates and is a beautiful view for anyone who has a short period of time to get to the top or is unable to hike the steeper trails to the top.
Wow. Thought I would be scared out of my mind but it was a smooth ride with fantastic views. Trip down was also great.

table mountain with Margaret Curren. Margaret is a great guide. We loved table mountain and we highly recommend hiking with Margaret.
We had a nice small group of 7 and we hiked for 5 hours. She is a really friendly, easy going person. We had a fantastic experience.

Up Up and away. thrilling cable car ride up to the summit of Table Mountain, and the views were awe inspiring, Don't forget your camera's,the vista from the top of the mountain will take your breath away!

A wonderful experience. Although I spent many years living in Cape Town, I wanted to take my three granddaughters up Table Mountain over Easter. Unfortunately, the weather wasn't very kind to the tourists over this weekend, Easter Sunday was a very mild morning and we went up. Although we had booked online (just in case) for Easter Monday, the weather forecast wasn't very promising, so we rebooked at the cable station. Although it was obviously very busy (from the weather restricting tourists from going up) plus the extra tourists over Easter and runners who had run the Two Oceans Oceanarium, the wait to get up the mountain wasn't too bad at all and the wait was well worth it!!!

Essential if you don't want to hike!. The cable car is genius; the walk up the mountain is not exacty a walk in the park, so this little cable car take everything up and down and does not stop! it feels very safe but if you are scared of heights then stay in the centre and do not look down, though you will miss the amazing view, youo can always see that from the top without feeling vulnerable! not cheap for SA standards but it is a must do/see!

Not to be missed when you visit Cape Town!. The Cable way at Table Mountain is of a world class standard. The views from the mountain is breathtakingly beautiful. The only downside is that they close the cable way when the weather gets too rough (which is understandable from a safety point of view.)
Fun!!. The cable car turns slowly as you go up or down the mountain offering you beautiful views of everything around you.

So worth visiting...and more than once!. I continue to suggest Table Mountain, or Mother Mountain, as I like to call her! This is not just a once visit...it is an ever changing landscape, depending on the Cape Town weather - you may like to do a first time with cable car down....maybe next time a little abseil?!!Highly recommended - tho take your own picnic as the food offerings are not great and rather $$$$

Awesome experience. If you are on holiday in Cape Town don't plan your trip to Table Mountain too early. It's the weather conditions that decide on whether the cable car is going to operate. Always best to wake up n the morning and if possible look for any cloud cover. Locally this is known as the table cloth.If it looks clear enough get straight up to the cable car station early to avoid long queues. Don't forget your camera or you will regret it.

Nice ride. Takes four minutes and the floor rotates, so make sure you stand near the edge to get the best views. The queues moved quickly. Your picture gets taken as you go in so you can buy the photo-shopped version at the end - it was cheesy but we bought it!

Heaven on Earth. Stunning views!! Definitely recommend it! The only thing is that I had bought tickets online and people who didn't have tickets were being let through to buy their tickets and go straight in while those with tickets had to wait?

Spectacular Views. The cable car ride up can be a bit scary for people afraid of heights, but it is well worth the journey to the top. On windy days (which happen often in the Cape) they close down the cable car. However if you are feeling adventurous and have all day there are several trails that you can hike to the top. There is one restaurant on top and some bathrooms. During the height of summer both can get pretty crowded and dirty. Bring water, wear a hat and sun screen. Don't forget your camera - as the views are what you come for. There is easy flat hiking around the top of the table if you feel like stretching your legs and the trails are fairly well marked.

Breathtaking View. This is one of the most beautiful views I've ever seen. Remember Cape Town can be windy so check the weather before you go because the cable cars don't run in high winds. Definitely a must see & do!

Inconsiderate, staff closed the cable car early out of spite. My group had been so excited to go to table mountain. It was a glorious evening and the weather was calm. My friend rang the official tourist board to find out that day's operating hours, as they can be variable depending on weather. A nice gentleman told her last car up was 630pm and last down was 730pm. We were thrilled to get to see the sunset. We all bought tickets online @205 rand per person.When we arrived at the base at 5:35pm we were told they had shut it down we asked why, they said closing was at their discretion. we asked to speak to a manager and a duty manager, Craig Hotnaut (sp?) came and angrily told us there was no chance we could be taken up, that our tickets were worthless and that we should "just get over it". He said he had tweeted the earlier closing time (why would tourists check that??) and that the man we spoke to on the phone had been wrong. His attitude was egregious, his lack of compassion astounding and his arrogance almost overwhelming. If Craig is the face and manager of one of Sth Africas most important tourist attractions, then it will be very hard to recommend ever visiting the country, despite all of its charms. We were not the only group to be left high - sorry low- and dry and his lack of empathy and general disdain for excited tourists ruined the entire day for our whole party. Shame on him and shame on Table mountain management. Lets hope the staff at robben island tomorrow are not so disgusted by having to do their job. If they are we might be leaving SA on the next flight home.
Table Mountain. A must see in Cape Town, Very beautiful!! is a full day out though as a lot of people want to get up the mountain. Also very cold when you get up there...

Don't even think about missing this!. As the weather was turning we decided it would be quicker to use the cable car than hike up. We weren't disappointed, with a variety of walkways you can choose your difficulty. Superb
great view and easier than walking up. its 23 dollars, has a rotating floor, was way quicker and easier than walking and even takes your picture for 25 dollars
fantastic views on a good day.. a very quick and efficientway to get to the top,but not especialy cheap.if youre feeling fit you can walk up,but it takes an awfully long time

TM Ariel Cableway. We hiked up Table Mountain, but thought the panoramic ride down would be yet another highlight of the day, it was. Saw the rappelers belaying down TM, will maybe try that next time!

360 degrees views of Cape Town and surrounds. Wonderful views, peaceful walks, animals like rock hyrax and lizards visible close-up. The cable car offers a breathtaking smooth ride up and down and provides great photo opportunities. Fresh, cool air. Access to restaurant and tourist shop on top of the mountain.

Amazing View Of Cape Town. Enjoyed this attraction while visiting Cape Town. Lunch at the cafe on the mountain was good. You can walk at your own pace. You can capture great scenic photos of Cape Town.

Arrive later in the day. We arrived at 09:15 which we hoped would miss the early morning rush but I guess we were a bit late. The wait was about 40 mins which isn't a great pain. When we came down at 12:00 no queue at all. Not sure if its the same every day. Next time were going for the walk up looks a good challenge.
What a view!. Neat cablecar that revolves as it goes up. Open sides so the wind comes in. Quite a sight as one ascends the mountain.
smooth ride to the top. the rotating cable car is part of the fun of visiting Table Mountain. everyone gets a good view as the car goes up. try and go early to miss the crowds
Wonderful experience!. Smooth operation, turns 365 degrees while travelling up and down mountain. Spacious and in excellent condition.

Great Views. A must for any Cape Town tourist. Great views of the entire city and cape. We dined at the restaurant on-premise. Food could have been fresher and a wider selection. Don't go on the Cable Tour really hungry otherwise you'll be settling for the mediocre café food.

One of the most beautiful sunsets in the world !. Went up late one evening to watch the sun set and see the city lights from up above. Brilliant experience, the view is unbelievable and even more so at sunset, would love to give it a 6 out of 5.

You must not miss this. Very efficient rotating cable car with breathtaking views, one of those places everyone should visit, goes with Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House and other world places of renown that you mustn't miss.
Breathtaking. Did the sunset half-price trip, great value, spectacular views. Take a picnic and don't forget a warm jersey as it can get chilly.
Quick and efficient. I did wonder what the ascent would be like. No worries, quick, efficient, revolving so we could take in the views, no jolts just a smooth ride to the top.
Quick and efficient. I did wonder what the ascent would be like. No worries, quick, efficient, revolving so we could take in the views, no jolts just a smooth ride to the top.

You can dance on this table to your hearts content. Parking the car at the bottom of the cable car station was a mega problem but, in the end, the very friendly and outgoing parking attendants proved their worth. Make sure you give them a small tip (R20) they will make sure you find your car on the journey back, or help you out.We found the cable car ticket price a bit on the expensive side however, cable car travel is anything but cheap elsewhere in the world - especially Switzerland! Packed like sardines into the gondola, we set off at reasonable speed, making one revolution on the way - great! everybody on board can take decent snap shots on the way up (or down). What's the alternative? A long, arduous climb taking several hours, among baboons, goats, dassies and other wildlife:))

A revolving floor means you get a good view. The queuing can be a pain at peak times, but it's a fun experience. And as the floor revolves inside you wil always get a good view on the two minute ride.

unforgettable. Amazing experience with views to die for. Lots of info and lookout points at the top. Only downside, as expected the shop at the top is VERY expensive (a bottle of wine that will cost you about R40 in a normal shop costs R140 here) and with a disappointing selection.

Stunning...must do!!. Well organised, friendly staff....wonderful experience.Floor of car revolves during trip so everyone gets to see the views.Once at the top the scenery is out of this world! Different stunning views at every turn!It really was so beautiful and breathtaking.Some of the most amazing sights you will ever see and photograph!No visit to S.A. complete without doing this!Buy tickets from website to avoid queues.

Iconic mountain, iconic views. Table mountain is a must do in Cape town, and the cableway offers a quick and efficient way of reaching the top for those unable to tackle the many hiking routes to the top. Weekends and public holidays you will probably have a bit of wait to get a ticket, but stick it out , there are usually plenty of vendors touting cool drinks and ice creams. For those without a head for heights this is a good way to go as you can stand in the middle of the cable car, which rotates affording great views of the city bowl, the surburbs below Signal Hill and the harbour. Its a whole lot quicker than walking

bleh.... It's really great for saving you the chore of walking up/down the mountain. Otherwise, no big thrills wrt the cable car itself. The real treat is being at the top of the nountain itself.I always feel that the cableway is overpriced - especially the photos they offer you as you leave!Table mountain is the must-do. The cableway is pretty lack-lustre according to me.

Table Mountain Cable Car. I found the operators of this cable car company professional in their operations and their staff were friendly and polite. Just a pity the Restaurant at the Top of the mountain is such a Disgrace as far as Food and Service is concerned (this may noit be part of the Cable Way Company, however???).

Top of the world.... A great family outing, it is very exciting to see the cable car descending from the mountain and to stand in line, knowing that it will be your turn soon! The revolving car adds to the attraction. The top of the mountain is beautiful, there are many areas to explore and the view is spectacular. The kids enjoyed watching the dassies and we saw lovely plants and flowers. Bring sunblock and a coat, the weather can change quickly. Table Mountain is one of the new 7 wonders of the world.

An experience not to miss. This Cableway is so efficient, and take 65 people (I think) each journey up to the top of Table Mountain. The view going up is amazing!Buy your ticket online before you leave home and it will save lots of lineup/waiting time the day you go - it is an open ticket within 14 days of your date of choice - just because weather (the top covered with the tablecloth of cloud) means the Car does not run. Make your decision to go up the Mountain the first clear day of your stay in Cape Town

Fabulous way to travel. The cars take 4 mins to traverse to the summit of the mountain. During this time the floor makes a 360 rotation so views are magnificent for every one in the car. They are not overcrowded and very stable even in strong winds.
Quick trip up the mountain. The cable car rotates so you see a 360 deg view which is great. Get your tickets online to avoid the long lines.

Best place to view sunset. Did this early evening to view the sunset which was fantastic. Enjoyed the gift shop and restaurant at the top as well. Enjoyed our glass of wine watching the sunset. Great for photography.

Fantastic views and very smooth journey. Just returned from a visit to my birth city Cape Town and went up Table Mountain using the new cableway. Spectacular!!The journey is very smooth with the rotating car allowing all occupants to have a full panoramic view.The view from the top is spectacular. Very well service with restaurant, cafe, gift shop and restrooms.At R205 for a return journey it is real value.

Panarama of beautiful Cape Town. Many people walk to the top of Table Mountain. Good for them, it must give a real sense of achievement. Not for me, though, I prefer the easy route, via the cable car.A tip - buy your ticket online - you save money and won't have to queue at the cable head. Each car holds around 65 people and, as it travels, the floor revlves, giving passengers wonderful and changing views of the mountain and cityscape. You don't get that keeping to the footpath!

The only way to the top!. We got to the entrance at 9 in the morning on a Sunday and it was already busy! The queue is fast moving and each car can carry a large amount of passengers. There is a cafe and 2 shops at the top and the views all round are amazing. If the winds are high it doesnt operate so check first. Well worth a visit!

Table Mountain Cable Car Ride - Awesome!. It was a great ride up and the cable car rotated to give everyone a terrific view. There was an opening in the upper portion of the car to let in the breeze and to take clean photographs, not through the aged glass. There were too many people packed into a car though maximum capacity is 65 - I think it would be nice to have lesser number of souls in one car at a time. I had a leg injury and had full elevator access to the cable car entry station, so quite friendly for PwD. The captains of the cars keep the announcements funny and engaging. Note - 1. Check the Website to see if the Aerial Cableway is open or not , they might close down due to strong winds - http://tablemountain.net. Buy the tickets online to save 20ZAR per return trip straight away and you can utilize the tickets anytime within 14 days.
table mountain. exelent place to refresh marveles view of simons town ,lions head and the see u will ur the top of world

Stunning views. The cable car was a very smooth trip to the top. Pick your day..... No wind. It rotates and everyone gets a great view from all sides. The walk around the table top is an amazing experience. You really feel you are on top of the world. We had amazing visibility all the way around. No wind and a clear day...... Just go

Views. Another must do ... But can be cancelled at short notice due to winds or adverse weather . Some people don't get up their if only visiting Cape Town for a short time. Even if there are long queues ..... It's worth it ... The views are magnificent.

Amazing!. Our trip by cable car was amazing.The view as we went up was spectacular its beyond words. We then had a scrumptious breakfast on top of the mountain it was unbelievable we then took lots of pictures. Would do it again given another chance!

Table View and Beyond. Our trip in the Cable Car and the walk across the plateau was superb; from watching the paragliders descend away down to camps Bay to trying to count the dozens of ships queing up to load with all the newly harvested cape fruit to resisting the temptation to stroke the queer little dassie (rodents) scurrying around in the rocks.We later walked with (local) family away down across the top of the mountain to Silvermine towards the east of the mountain and had a picnic on the way, keeping a watchful eye out for the baboons wich are known to scavange from unwary tourists!!A greta day out for families with older children

It rotates!. Great ride up and the cable car rotates to give everyone a terrific view. A portion of the upper car is open for photos and fresh air. Could be breezy on a windy day. Pick you day by checking visibility. The view was limited at the top of Table Mountain when we arrived but did clear later.
Fantastic Experience. A great experience, all glass circular revolving cable car so everyone gets the same views. Took some amazing pictures on the journey up.

Very efficient even when crowded. These cable cars carry quite a few people and have a revolving floor which provides everyone an opportunity to see the views as they go up and down Table Mountain. The cost is about $20 each for a roundtrip ticket. You will wait going up unless you get there really early. Just make sure it's actually open. If the weather gets bad they close it. You should check before venturing there unless its obviously nice out without too much wind.

great views great system for viewing. The novelty of a revolving cable car makes this an interesting and breathtaking experience not to be missed if the weather is good. Views from the top are as good as the views from the bottom-if you know what I mean!

Long way down!. Well, without the cable car, it's also a "long way up" but there are many who walk it. The cable car is a superb way to get to the best of the views in short and safe time. It is a smooth and steady ride and also provides some great views. One feature is worthy of special mention - as you go up and down the cab of the cable car slowly turns so that all on board can get those views and any photos

Round and Round. Everyone usually tries to secure the best spot by the window when riding in a cable car. Well you don't have to worry about that in these cars because you stand on a turntable the allows a panoramic view all the way around the car by the time your ride is finished.

Overpriced, but best option for "lazies". Table Mountain is a required point to visit if you are in Cape Town, so if you are not willing to take three hours for a radical hiking, that's your unique option. It takes five minutes to go down or up, and the view is a good taste of what you will see on the top. There is also a nice restaurant in the end of the tour.

Be very careful not to get mugged!. We are a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 teens in high school from USA. We're very street savvy and have lived in Johannesburg a number of years back. We went up on table mountain today and it was incredibly foggy and cloudy but we decided to hike on the marked trails anyway. We went on the marked trail on the top and went down some steep steps, but all still on the trail. There was a young black guy and a woman in her mid 40's that looked out of place. We greeted them and he wasn't friendly at all. She acted as if she was really struggling to get down the path. They moved on ahead. When we reached them, he came up behind my daughter and we realized that we were in trouble. Fortunately, another couple came by and we got out of there quickly. Please be aware that people come up the mountain on foot with the sole purpose to mugg people. It's happened quite a few times with knives. Otherwise it's absolutely breath taking views!!!
Its a must. It got very busy, the revolving floor was interesting. You need to plan the times carefully, and watch the cloud cover.

Great views. The cable car turns 360 degrees so everyone shares the view. Bit expensive as we could not get senior rates but as it is something you only do once we just had to do it and it was worth it

Great view but winds can be very high. We were in Cape Town at the end of January and the winds were very high almost every day....to the point of almost blowing me over at times. It took us several day before we were able to take the cable car because it was closed due to the winds. We did finally make it and the views were tremendous. Get there as they open in the morning to avoid lines. The mountain had been closed for several days and when we arrived first thing in the morning the lines weren't too bad. When we departed, the tour buses had arrived and I suspect it would be an hour or two wait to go up. Definitely worth the trip though.
Exhilerating. Great views on this safe and secure ride to dizzying heights. See the mountainside, the bay, the city as you glide smoothly to the top.

Please thing about it .... it's urgent. The most modern cable car. The most incredible view on the Cape. And the most longest time to queue waiting for ! It's going by hours lost waiting for. A tourist is here for too short time to waste a day ......Please thing about it ....
View is spectacular. If you want photos of Cape Town, this is the place to be. If you're looking for a sunset visit there will be a long line-up.
A bit Hairy but.... well worth it! The floor of the cable car revolves 360 degrees so everyone can see the amazing view.

An excellent ride. The cable ride was quite an experience. We were blessed that there was no queue when we got there. We weren't keen hikers so the cable car was the perfect option for us and we were not disappointed. The views were great!

The Floor Rotates As The Tram Car Moves? Like A Microwave Oven?. -This is one of the two ways to get to the top of Table Mountain...and we guarantee...this is the fastest, and the easiest...unless you are a good hiker..then you may enjoy the hiking path better, as long as you have 2 or 3 hours to hike the trail..-But we digress..the tram ride is nice, clean, and pretty short, start to finish. The operator gives a short, informative speech about the construction of the tram and its history.-Amazing views if you pick the right day to ride, and the weather is clear.-The floor actually rotates as you ride it, so that everyone has a fair chance to get a good view, which we thought was a nice touch.-The tram cars are pretty heavy when fully loaded, and as such, are pretty stable when moving, even in moderate winds....not a lot of swaying back and forth as you ride up, and the trip is short enough that you should be OK....if they think the winds will get high, they will shut down the tram system....if you are on the top of the mountain, a horn will sound, alerting you to head for the tram system, to get a lift down, prior to them shutting down the tram.-If you get there early, you will have a short wait....if you get there in the middle of the tourist day, you will probably have a longer wait...seriously, did I have to type that.?..and yet I read people complaining about that..-Check for half-price ticket sales on their website, or call them...some months, they have half price tickets to go up and watch the sunset from the top of Table Mountain....well worth it, the view is incredible..We give it a two Yooper thumbs up guarantee.....our only drawback was that they should have a better explanation of the floor rotation thing prior to the start of the tram moving....there were a lot of people starting to freak out when the floor starting spinning...I thought it was that weird bottle I bought at the duty-free store, but, it turns out that this time, it was not my fault....at least this time..-Mahalo

A scary way of reaching the top. Not looking to hike up, we took the cable car . A very difficult ride for those with height issues. My advice just stare at the front ! Seems to be few options as to how to get up there, but when your up there it's worth every scary moment!
View from everywhere. Take the day, as you could be standing in the cue for up to 2 hours( if it is peak season). But, so much to see and well worth the visit.

View was amazing but restuarant was not. We visited the Table Mountain Cableway during July 2012. Although the queue was long to get the tickets, we waited and when we came to the window we realised that there was a fault with their debit/credit card facilities, hence the wait.The trip up is nerve racking at times but that is because I am a bit of a wimp but what really disappointed me was the coffee shop/restaurant at the top. It was packed and so noisy! We will definitely not go to the restaurant again but instead pack a picnic basket as tables are provided.The view was amazing and that definitely made the other small irritations worth while.

An Absolute MUST!!. This is the first time we have taken the "Sunset Trip" up the mountain - no pre-booking allowed but you must arrive and buy tickets after 1800hrs. The views from the top during twilight and the eventual sunset are stunning. Although a pleasant experience, we recommend the daytime trip to enjoy the many walks available on top of the "Table"

Brillian Sunset View!. We went there during the sunset and the views are just amazing! From atop the Table Mountain, on one side you can see the entire city and other side you can see the ocean. Its 3500 feet and can be cool in the evenings, although you get to get up there only on clear days. Otherwise the rope way is not open to go up. The charges for the rope ways are R205 but if you go post 6pm, its R100! You may have to stand in the line for 30 minutes for your turn for the cheaper pass. Make sure you have some food, camera, pullover and you are set! Its a romantic place and a magical moment when the sunset is happening. If you plan to go for the sunset, make sure you check out all the points first before the sunset then settle down at a place with a good view for the sunset. The food and drinks available up are expensive so advisable to carry your own.

Always a winner!. It's one of the New 7 wonders of the world, and truly deserves this honour. Breathtaking views & great facilities makes for a world class experience. Do not leave Cape Town without "doing" the mountain! (Wind permitting of course ;-)

Incredible panoramic views of the Cape Peninsula. A must to get a better perspective of this special Cape Peninsula at the edge of the African continent. Newer updated cable cars - try visit early in the mornings- huge lines & wait. Check if cable is open - maybe closed on windy or cloudy days.

Brilliant Views. Go early to table mountain before everyone gets up. We did a an organised trip but would definately do my own thing if I go again next time. The cable car is really quick to get to the top and it doesn't matter where you stand in the car as it rotates so it doesn't matter where you are as you all get really good views.

The Best views of Capetown. if you are planning on going to table mountain go as soon as you have the first clear day of your holiday - even if it is your first day there. Throughout my holiday the cablecar was closed due to windy conditions and a blanket of cloud over the mountain I think that it was only open 2 days of my 8 day stay in camps bay.Take a jacket or something warm - it is quite cold up there. There is a guide who will take you around the top of the mountain - plan to spend a couple of hours at the top.

Get there early!. We were unable to go up the two times we tried as it was too windy and we wanted to take the cable car up (they don't recommend you walk up if the cable car's are closed, as they deem it too windy), but third time lucky and luckily we went early! We already had a little wait but after seeing the queue as we were leaving, we were so grateful we went when we did! Try and aim for when it opens! Come midday, there is a good amount of time spent waiting to buy a ticket alone!A must see when in Cape Town!

MUST do!. It's more than obvious that if you going to Cape Town, you can not miss going up Table Mountain in the cableway.Tips:- Take a picnic basket and your own drinks, this is allow and you will enjoy having a snack, a sundowner or whatever it is up there!- If you book online you get discounts- There's a promo running (not sure for how long) that if you go up after 18h00 you pay half price! Quite honestly, I would pay double the price to go up at this time!!! You get to see the city with light, then you get to see the sun go down behind the see and then, you get to see the city in the night, with all the beautiful lights on! 3 in one!!!- If you are in CT for a few days, try schedulle Table Mountain for the beginning, as it can get windy frecuently and then, the cable way closes often. If you can't do it the first time you try, you can postpone for next day and so on. If you leave it for last and happens that day is closed, you'll miss out!

A must do in Cape Town. how else would you get to Table Mountain without loosing too much time, comfortably enjoying the views and not putting yourself at risk of being mugged while hiking your way up? Spectacular views, state of the art cable car - worth every penny and even more!

Cable car great - cafe no so much.... We walked up the mountain - great - and then came to the cafe before descending by the cable car. The cafe is tatty, with very poor quality food, poor choices and high prices.

TM Aerial Cableway. I hate queues but since the new Rotair Gondolas were introduced in around 1997 this has improved dramatically, however you can still queue for a good bit nontheless. Always take warm clothing and if you plan on walking around on the table take water with you and stick to the designated pathways at all times. Beware of sudden drop offs and remember – it’s not the fall that kills you, it’s the sudden stop!!Great views of Cape Town, Table Bay and Camps Bay. The restaurant can be busy and the food is not what I would call Haute Cuisine so consider bringing your own and having a picnic instead. All in all the Cableway is a well-run and well maintained operation and is a credit to the Cape.

Expensive wonder of the world. The cable car experience is pretty amazing but it is so expensive compared to other countries. We did enjoy our trip but we found there is not much shade when it's really hot and the restaurants are way overpriced.Beautiful birds and wildlife can be seen on the rocks.

Stunning day for a trip up the mountain!. When the weather is good in Cape Town, everyone seems to want to go up. I strongly suggest buying tickets online and jumping the que. The views are worth the wait though! We enjoyed a snack,(bubbly and pizza slice;-) and fabulous views. You can take your own picnic basket or purchase a good variety of eats and drinks.
Smooth ride to the top. The gondola rotates around its axe during the ascend/descend giving you a 365 degrees view of the surroundings. Smooth and fast!

Overrated. Table Mountain is a great thing to see in Cape Town but the Cableway is just an expensive public transportation to there. If you cannot hike the mountain, or you wanted to go for abseiling, that's fine. At least it takes you on top of the Table Mountain.

excellent. a must see in cape town go up for sunset but on clear days every man and thier dog goes up there so be prepared for the crowds. if you hear the siren up there that means it is time to get down due to high winds. we lucked out and the views were great and sunset spectacular.

Terrific views. We booked this before leaving the UK, knowing that if you can't go you can get a refund.Pre buying tickets cuts out the first queue which can be pretty long but we still had a short wait to get on one of the cars.We were in Cape Town for four days but the cable cars were only running on one day due to the high winds so make sure that when they are running you take the trip, as winds are the apparently the norm in Cape Town.The views from Table Mountain are amazing - it is well worth the cost and there are walkways and pathe to take you to the various viewing points. It is all very well organised.

Table Mountain Cableway. Went up the mountain from the Red Bus Route to the Cable Way, into the Cable Car. Really enjoyed it. Room for Wheelchairs and electric scooters in Cable Car. Very smooth ride. We went on a baking hot day (over 90 degrees), no wind, and no clouds, so the top of the mountain had no "cloth" on. We were extremely fortunate to choose a clear day and no winds. It is wise to contact the mountain staff before you go, as winds can often force closure. When we got to the top of the mountain, (my parents, carer, and I) were told that had we contacted them the day before, I would have been able to abseil down part of the mountain in a wheelchair, but obviously, we couldn't guess at the weather in advance on the top of the mountain. When the africans saw a wheelchair (for my mother) and my electric scooter, they carried them (yes carried) up some steps to the top of the mountain! We did not expect that!Yes, you are packed in the Cable Car, but there is a fair amount of space. Table Mountain is not wheelchair friendly (and probably never will be) but it was an experience I would not have missed. grab the opportunity when it comes!At the bottom of the mountain, there are souvenir shops and toilets. As my carer spoke Afrikans, he would often get the price knocked down, which was very handy!

Better than walking. An excellent experience. And, re the better than walking header....it was close to 40 degrees the day we went and I just couldn't imagine walking up. Some, no many, brave souls did though. For us, well worth it. Tips: as others have said....go the first chance you get as winds often force closure. Also, you can purchase your tickets from the tourist bureau, have them printed out, still get the on line discount AND......the tickets are good for 14 days out from the purchase date.

made life easy. this helped a lot as we were on a whirlwind weekend trip from joburg and short on time, and there was no way we could have climbed all the way up and down. would prefer the windows/glass to be more pristine, for a clearer view. also, they shouldn't pack in too many people so that one can walk around. The tickets are pretty expensive at 200 rands!

A great trip. The cable ride takes about 4 minutes and for me who would be a little nervous of heights this was very smooth ride. The floor rotates 360 degrees so every one in the car get to see the spectacular views.

Zip to the top of Table Mountain!. The Aerial Cableway is so easy! The only issue, and it is an issue, is that it is closed on days with high winds. I have been to Cape Town a few times now and more than half the time I was there, the cable car was not running (the high winds cause safety issues). SO, make sure to see Table Mountain when you can...so you are not caught traveling half was around the world (for Americans), and not being able to see this wonder of nature. Especially in the summer (their Summer, Jan-Mar), the winds are an issue.

A Nice Way to See the City. I loved it! Going up while this thing spins slowly allowing you a 360 degrees view of the whole site, so you can easily take pictures of every angle of this climb up to the top, will never forget it

Don't miss it. Go to Cape Town and miss the visit of Table Mountain by the Aerial Cableway is unthinkable. The magnificence and omnipresence of the mountain is just fully understandable if you go up there. A must visit in Cape Town.

another planet. We did this as part of a private city tour. Our guide informed us that about 50% of her clients are able to go to the top, due to high winds and visibility issues. So, we lucked out. The ride up to the top is fantastic. I would highly recommend doing this as a full day excursion. We only had an hour to explore the top. Not long enough to hike the many and long trails- plan to do some walking. It is well worth it! It is quite chilly and extremely windy so I would wear long pants and bring a light jacket. Our guide advised us of this and she was right! We saw tourists walking around in shorts and high heels!! Unbelievable! No doubt they were cold.The flora and fauna are spectacular and very unique- please be respective of them and stay on the trails. It was appalling to see how many tourists ignore the regulations.We didn't have time to explore the cafe-would have been nice to before descending. The cable car is fast going up and going down. The longest part is waiting in line to go up.This is a must see while in Capetown.

A must do in Cape Town. I'm told that the queues are normally long - we were very fortunate to arrive just as the cable car ride opened, having been shut all day because of high winds. The car revolves as you go up which means that everyone gets the view down to the city. The view from the top is breathtaking and if you can stay for the evening sunset, do so
Overpriced, but the only real way to get to the top.... The cable car itself wasn´t anything special and was quite overpriced, but the view from the top of table mountain is beautiful

Gives you a lift. A good way to get up the mountain. It feels safe and is comfortable and as it revolves the views are great. It looks slow but as the other car passes you can see they move pretty fast

A Must for Cape Town Visits!. The top of Cable Mountain is one of the highlights of Cape Town. The views are spectacular! There are lots of food options at the top to enjoy the evening sunset. Wines by the glass and cheese, along with really good custom made sandwiches. The walking trails are many and easy for elderly visitors. The views on the other side of Table Mountain are just as spectacular as the Cape Town side. We chose to use the cable cars, as the walking trail looked a bit tough even for the downhill climb.

Safe and Sensible. If you are not an experienced walker - it's the only way up! I hate cable cars and heights! I loved this one! They take no risks at all, It doesn't swing about, before you know it you are there and back and the views on the way are unbelievable. Don't second think it - if it's open, just do it!
Spectacular. A MUST do ! Go alone / with friends - just GO! After 6 you pay 1/2 price. One of the Wonders of the World.

Great View, but ask questions. We spent 3 days trying to get up the mtn during a major wind event. Finally, the cableway was open for about 5 hours on our last day. By the time we got to the top, the wind started again and the clouds were rolling across the top, making it both eerie and beautiful up there. The cable car is certainly unique in that the car rotates so that you get a 360 view while en route. HOWEVER, these folks are not good at communication or running a line (please hire Disney). When we first got in line, we had to stand in the queue across the driveway from the ticket office. When they paused the rides for weather, we got out of line for a while and had a soda, etc. When we returned to get back in line, we went back to the same queue which is under cover (and confusingly has 2 lines embedded there). After sitting in that line for about 30 minutes and not moving, we noticed other people were walking right up to the ticket counter and skipping the queue. I asked the staff why those folks did not have to be in line. At this point, the staff said the covered queue was no longer the ticket line, but the delayed ticket line for half price evening tickets...despite the fact that there was no signage and it was the same line we had been in previously where they lined up all ticket buyers. After fuming a few seconds, we jumped into the regular line and were going up the mtn 5 minutes later. Just be sure you have patience for both the weather and the staff.

A Must-Do. The gondola up Tabletop Mointain is a must-do while in Capetown. The gondola rotates as it ascends and descends giving 360 degree views of the city below. Once at the top there are hiking trails with even better views. If clouds are coming in, go to the right first. We were here the very end of January and were told it is often fogged in or closed due to high winds. The mountaintop is often covered by a cloud "blanket."

Great views. The Table Mountain Aerial Cableway is a great way to see much of Table Mountain without the climb, especially if you are traveling with younger children. The floor rotates on the way, so the view from the cableway is constantly changing. The top of the mountain has a gift shop and restaurant, so you can relax with a cold drink or lunch, if you so desire. The flowers are beautiful, and you can see far down the coastline on a clear day. If you are planning to use the Aerial Cableway, plan on a couple of alternate days, because the tram will be closed if there are high winds. It is a great half day trip. The views are splendid in all directions. If you enjoy climbing, climb up, and take the cableway down, and get the best of both worlds. If you are planning this trip during the summer, arrive early. The lines can be staggering. Definitely a must while visiting the Cape Town area.

Fabulous view of a fabulous city. This popular funicular is not able to run many days because of wind conditions. We were very fortunate that it was operating on the day we were scheduled to ride it to Table Mountain. A great ride!!! We so enjoyed this famous cableway.

Stunning views!. Prepare to queue, but it wasn't too bad when we were there. You need to get in the car early if you are short like me as not everone will get a window view. The floor of the car rotates to give everone a 360 view but it is a little disconcerting as there is nothing to hold onto. Amazing viewson a clear day. Apparently it is often closed due to high winds so keep your fingers crossed!

Be early or you will wait. On our first attempt to use this method of getting to the top of the mountain we arrived at about 11:00 a.m., only to find queues over 300 meters long of people waiting to get on the cable car. We gave up, and went to Cape of Good hope instead. the following day we arrived at 8:30 in the morning, and had no trouble getting on and up the mountain. One note. the floor rotates to give everyone in the car a chance to look out the open section, but some people will walk against the rotation and try to stop you getting a view.

got to do this. I got to there by riding red bus and couldn't enjoy more! " This was hilarious" you get many feedbacks that hicking is never good if not in an organized group thus best alternative option is to go on aerial cableway. "drivers" are gracious and the fact the floor rotates while moving up/down made the ride amazing.

Like Heights? - You'll LOVE this!. Everything you'd expect from a cable ride to a famous mountain top. It's pot-luck about how it all goes. We were lucky. The mist cleared at the top. The weather was brilliant. No queues for tickets and only a few in our car. how cool was all that? Wonderful experience but I agree with other contributors - watch the gift shop. It's so expensive you could pay of the Nation Debt buy just purchasing a Tea Towel.

Tourist attraction the locals even enjoy. We planned a trip up the cableway for the sunset special (half price tickets from 6pm 1 Nov - 21 Dec and 7 Jan - 28 Feb). Not our first visit so we were expecting the crowds and long delay for ticket sales. Turned out the experience was great and wasn't too busy! Kids loved it! Could have spent a little more time up there but that would have meant full price tickets. Remember to pack your own picnic basket as the prices at the top are quite hefty. Will definitely be back for a third visit.

you've gotta do it. we booked the trip the day before - we'd heard of so many delays over the new years- people who had travelled and couldnt get a ticket for about 4 days...so luckily it was later on in January. Got the ticket, and think we were very lucky no queues on the day - so strange its a lovely day in the city but its so different when you get to the top. We got the cable up - beautiful views. Walked around for a while, little gift shop up there, but the views is what your spending your time at, and walking through the clouds - its just amazing, will never forget tasting the moisture - its worth the trip

Excellent. Well worth going up in the cable car,the views at the top are stunning.You can see robben island. Watch out for the pricey gift shop though. I bought a tea towel with table top mountain on and it was £8,wont be drying dishes with it I am framing it. Ha!Ha!

Marvellous experience. If you go to Cape Town you MUST go up the cableway, it's exciting and you'll get the best view of all the Cape. Atlantic and Indic Oceans, Lion Head, everything is beautiful from up there.It's a must in the city.
Must-do!!. Fantastic experience and gorgeous scenery of all sides of Cape Town. Book your tickets online to avoid the queues!!

Going up and down the Cableway at Table Mountain, Cape Town, South Africa.. You will usually have to wait in line for some time to buy your tickets for the cableway but it's worth it. Try to go on a day when the sky is clear so that you can enjoy the spectacular views from the top of Table Mountain. There are many paths to walk along at the top of the mountain and you can look down over Cape Town from the top from several view points. There is a nice restaurant on the top of the mountain and you can buy food and drinks. The sandwitches we bought there were delicious and you can even buy a glass of wine. There is also a nice shop on top of the mountain so that you can buy some items regarding Table Mountain and Cape Town. I bought some nice T-Shirst with pictures of Table Mountain and the Cableway as well as Cape Town and South Africa. You can buy some nice souvenirs at the shop on the top of the mountain or another one at the bottom next to the ticket counter. Don't forget to bring your camera and video camera to take pictures while going up and down the cableway and also the stunning pictures you can take from the top of the mountain. We spent five hours there, taking our time, walking along several paths at the top of the mountain and looking down from the top from several different spots. If you come to Cape Town this is a must go to place when you visit Cape Town as a tourist. The Cablecars floor actually rotates 360 degrees while you are going up and down, so that you can see the view from different angles. When you get into the cablecar, try to stand at the side facing the glass windows, so that you can get a good view while going up and down. Don't rush while you or up at the top of the mountain, try to walk along all the different paths at the top and enjoy the scenes looking down from the top to the bottom from different angles. Try not to go when its too cloudy otherwise you won't be able to enjoy the view as much. Try to choose a day when you have clear blue skies or mostly clear skies so you can take advantage of the view while you are looking over Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain.
Sure safes on time!. Be warned it is quick and vertical but the ride is smooth and well worth it. The staff were freindly and help full.

A fun ride up to Table Mountain. We visited Table Mountain and had the choice of the Aerial Cable Cars or walking up. While a hike up the mountain might have been fun, we chose the cable car. It was a delight.

Great Place to visit. Table Mountain was more than I expected. Before getting there, I just thought it is a small and low mountain located in Cape Town and the view from the top of it would be normal sightseeing of the town. But, when i arrived there, it was totally different. i could see not only town but also the Atlantic Ocean. The Ocean was very beautiful and blue. Furthermore, the stiffs of the Mountain was amazing. The entrance fee was around 50 Rand, it was worth for paying. The mountain was very impressive and unforgettable in my life.
what a way to go!. Great view. Recommended to go when it is clear and if you can, in the afternoon when it is not so busy.
Breathtaking views and a great ride up. This is a must-see in Cape Town. The views from all perspectives are great, at some points stunning.

a trip to the clouds. A great option for those who prefer not to hike up. The staff was courteous and the cable car rotates (slowly) so everyone gets a chance to take in the views. Words cannot describe the views from atop the mountain. This is truly a must visit if you are in the area
Revolving Cars. Great way to ascend the table! Good price but book in advance on internet to avoid queues. It seems to be closed quite often due to high winds - check forecasts in advance.
Exciting and beautiful. The cableway was exciting and the view is beautiful. Don't hesitate if the wheather allows it. Enjoyable.

An amazing experience. This was probably my 10th trip up the mountain, but this one was special as the rest of my family went up for the first time in the latest cable car. The queues are long and in teh son the kids were not so happy about the standing and waiting. It remains an awesome experience for young and old, especially when the weather is nice and warm.However, as South Africans we don't enjoy a discount as in other countries and my parents, who are pensioners were disgusted that they can only get a discount on a Friday. This is not the first time I moan about this and something should be done about it. We always encourage locals to be tourists in their own city and country, but how can it be affordable when local and international tourists pay the same price.I hope this plea doesn't fall on deaf ears again!!

Spectacular. This is not to be missed but it is best to go up and catch the sun going down over Cape Town, it is truly beautiful. Do not go up on a windy day because the ride back down might be cancelled.

What views. We were advised to get tickets for the Aerial cableway before we arrived in South Africa as they are valid for several days. This means that we missed some of the queuing to get the cablecar. The car turns as you go up the aerial cableway so you dont have to push to get to the front. It also allows you to take shots of the mountain and the view across to Robben Island. The tablecloth kept coming and going sometimes obscuring the 12 apostles, but the views were magnificant. The temperature at the top is cool so be prepared. Another potential problem is high winds, which mean that the service stops.

Table mountain. It's an absolute must on the list ,not to be missed. On a clear day the view is outstanding and even when it's cloudy and misty it's still worth the trip. Once at the top there is various walks to do and explore various unique to the cape flora and fauna as well as little animals ..take a bottle of chambers up there and chill out .

A must. I think for any person visiting Cape Town, a trip up Table mountain is a must. Its all weather permitting, but the view is superb. It can be pre booked, so that saves some time. My first visit was as a little girl, so went recently, well the cars have been upgraded. There is a restaurant on top. But well worth the visit

worth the long wait. with it being 40 degrees in the shade and almost the whole of africa deciding to visit Table Mountain on the same day - needless the queues were endless. When it was our turn eventually, loved the way the cable car swivels around giving you a 360 degree view .
Table Mountain Cable Car. Quick, clean, fast with an amazing view. Go early in the day before the tour busses arrive. Walk on both sides, as the vistas is most special. Enjoy!
Efficient. Go early to avoid the long lines of people, book online so that you don't have to stand in yet another line. But once up on the mountain, it is grand!
Awesome vistas. Cape Town is proud to show off the mountain, but the restaurant disappoints with variety and prices.
Must do!. Go there at sunset and whith à clear sky. It will be one of the most beautiful sunsets you have ever seen!!!

Smooth trip great views. The floor swivels so everyone in the car gets a great view. This is best seen first thing in the morning before the crowds hit. Call the attraction first to make sure it is open. It closes due to wind. It is very moist and cold at the top so bring a jacket.

Innovation. Loved the cable car ride upto the mountain more than the mountain itself! The floor rotates 360 degrees so wherever you stand, you will still see the full view of going upto the mountain. The ride up boasts of a fantastic view of CT

The view makes the wait worthwhile.. The line is long but they try to keep it organized and moving. The journey up offers a marvelous impressive view which is hard to describe. It allows you to try to recognize the sights below. You will enjoy the slowly changing altitude and widening of the horizon.

enjoyable. the journey upto Table Mountain is truly enjoyable though it lasts only 5-6 minutes. but the waiting in line is tardy. They have only 2 cable cars. Both rotating; 1 going up and the second simultaneously coming down. in any case its worth the wait.
The only way to get to the top. Unless you fancy a long walk up, take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car rotates so you have plenty of great photo opportunities.
Breathtaking experience. This experience alone would warrant another visit to Cape Town, the scenery and views are breathtaking. For the nature lover a must...

Race to the top on a clear day. Table Mountain dominates Cape Town. On the first opportunity you have race to the cableway and get to the top to gain a completely different perspective. The cableway itself consists of a rotating cable car so everyone gets a fantastic view. A tip is to get your tickets on line in advance - that way you avoid all the queues. The ascent is over very quickly and you soon find yourself on top of the world (well the world in this part of Africa atleast). The whole area in landscaped beautifully and there are great walks of differing lengths - all very easy to do. We spent a couple of hours at the top & then made the wonderful descent.

A Must !. Our tour guide tried to discourage us from going saying that it was not necessary to go to Table Mountain. Wrong ! The views are breathtaking ! You can spend a little or a lot of time on the different paths up top. A must if you go to Cape Town !

Table Mountain Cableway. The queue moved very quickly and all was well organised. Its just a pity if you dont get to stand near the window or opening in the cablecar as if there is a tall person in front of you the view is limited or none. Also the kids could not see too. We had breakfast at the restaurant and the food was good as well as the prices.

View stunning, price not.. It is clear that cable car to Table Mountain has become a good business. And the only steepy thing with the ride is the climbing price of the ticket.Little use a tourist can do of the small online purchase discount, since the unpredictable condition of wind and cloud make the experience impossible to book beforehand, unless risking money. During our stay (January) the ascent was closed 3 days on 4. And the day of opening was assaulted by buses and cars to make it. Beside the high fare, there's an additional line people have to endure, not requested and useless. The line for the "mandatory" photo snap. You realize to have wasted 10 minutes only when it's too late. Nasty. From there, it's a piece of cake, with the view of one of the most beautiful city in the world.
In the clouds...... This was very nice.... The ques were very long and very hot.... This mist sprayers was a good idea and helped a lot to cool of...

Amazing trip. This was a real highlight of my trip , a lifelong ambition to stand on the top of Table Mountain. The trip up was great , no long queues, a roomy well designed cable car with great views over the city and harbour . At the summit the pathways around the table top provide great views of the many coves and bays of Capetown fom several angles. Well worth the effort ? Apparently you are allowed a free trip on your birthday - but do check this may be for SA citizens only.
Fun Ride. Great ride up the mountain 360 rotating gondola. Worth the R205. Walking / hiking up the mountain would take forever.

Aerial Cableway with a difference. An Aerial cableway is an Aerial cableway is an Aerial cableway...However this one is different from any others that I have used when Skiing in Europe, Why? because it revolves both on its way up and down, there are two opposed openings with rails plus two doors, so every one gets to be by the openings at some point, very clever idea, those with cameras immediately stand by the openings but then it revolves so that all get a chance at the openings. the journey takes between 4 and 5 minutes and is spectacular, taking you up an almost vertical mountain face to the top, you could walk up and then again you could walk down but the easy way is via the Aerial Cableway.

Pick a clear day. We travelled up Table Mountain at a very busy time of year for Cape Town, when all the out-of-towners descend on the city. Even so we managed to travel from Blouberstrand, park the car, travel up the mountain and back to Blouberg within 3 hours. The price is about £20 per person and the the cable trip lasts about 3 minutes, it allows about 60 people per run and once inside the floor rotates allowing everyone to get a view of the fabulous scenery. Once on the mountain there is a cafe/restaurant and shop and plenty of photo opportunities. There was also a guy doing abseiling if you're more adventurous. Make sure you keep an eye on the clouds as once they roll in you views are very restricted. Well worth the experience though.

Fantastic Ride. Great ride but queues were awful, Saturday am in early January probably not the best time to go, but we had little choice due to limited time in town. Views from top superb, no "table cloth" clouds in place.

An experience. An amazing ride. The cable car holds probably 30-40 people and the floor revolves so everyone gets a turn at the scary open window. Great for photographs though. At least no pylons to bump over so a very smooth ride. We were there in November when the weather is perfect and the crowds are a few weeks away, but I understand that at peak times the queues going both up and down can be long.

What a view at Sunset. If you have been on table mountain before and you walked the full mountain but is looking for something different, then I would suggest to do the sunset special they run until the end of February. It is 2 for the price of 1 and you basically can view the sunset over the ocean and Cape Town. What a magnificent view! You can also take brilliant photo's form up there... It is different to see the mountain at night than during the day.Amazing!
Encourage all vertigo sufferers to do this!. Not one to miss out on. The scenery viewed on the way up is fabulous. Don't forget to take your camera for this iconic mountain.
What a view. A must do in Cape town, good idea to have ticket on the internet and arrive early (opens 8am) to avoid queues, (if you are walking up it can be anytime)

You will believe you can fly. Amazing views shared out, with the 360° moving floor - cable cars. Smooth and just about the right speed I felt safe and protected. I could enjoy the views withotu my usual fear of heights. Whatever you do, book tickets online otherwise you can queue for up to 4hrs, its cheaper too. Do it online there if you like!
Great View. Go Early! Fresh breakfasts and smaller crowds are a bonus before the temperature rises and the ques get longer. Great views all round and fresh air makes one feel fantastic.

Fear factor conquered!. most exhilarating ride ever. this is a must do for visitors and locals. very safe 360 degree view. for someone who is scared of heights, I found myself on that cable car several times:-)

It frightens me to death!. BUT it is soooo well worth the trip when you get to the top. I know it's just me and my fear of cable cars etc but if I keep my eyes closed and stand looking in I can get to the top. It runs very well but it is a huge shame there are only 2 cars - they could have probably 4 and still have queues at the bottom. Definitely well worth the trip. Watch the weather forecast and take your first opportunity to visit the mountain - if the table cloth is over the mountain you won't be going up!

All day excursion. Be prepared! This is a very popular attraction, that means long lines and traffic. If you don't run into traffic getting there, you will have a long line to the top and vice versa. Also, if you have traffic and a relatively short line to the top, you will have a long wait in order to get back down. Parking is atrocious, and could result in a long walk to the cableway. If you don't mind setting aside a full day for the breathtaking views, then by all means, go ahead. Just so long as the weather doesn't dampen your day, and southeastern winds don't force a closure. My advice, drive up to the attraction and take your photos from the scenic lookouts next to the line, or if your feeling adventurous take the very long and steep hike up the mountain yourself; be careful though, South Africa has snakes!

Be aware of time required for queuing. Fun rotating cable car.
Allow at least an hour to walk around the extensive summit area.
Maybe even watch the abseilers throwing themselves off the edge!
Consider a one-way ascending ticket - walking down. It'll be a challenge, but so satisfying when completed.

Great experience. Too many people were packed in at once, so lots of pushing and shoving but it was peak season. The views are breath-taking and the cable cars are new, sturdy and revolving which was quite nice.

Incredible views. Wow ! The views from the top of table mountain are amazing. We were advised by a local taxi driver to visit before 9 as after this time the tour buses start arriving and the queue can be a couple of hours, we arrive just before 9 and only had half hour wait. The cars are really smooth - although it did take me a bit of time to get used to the rotating floor, which allows everyone a great photo opportunity. Put this attraction on you must do list for all first time visitors to Cape Town.

Excellent once you are up there!. The day we went it was extremely busy and altho we already had our tickets we had to wait in one queue for 1hr then in a second queue to get on the cable car for afurther 40 mins.,it seemed somewhat disorganised.Once on cablecar it was really good,avery enjoyable ride up the face of the mountain.
Great Views. When getting into the Cablecar stand on the outside edge, the floor rotates 360 degrees as it travels to the top of the mountain. Look out for rock climbers. The views are breathtaking.
Dramatic, with incredible views over Cape Town as you rise. I love that it turns slowly allowing everybody a chance to get the best views at some point during the ride up and down.

great, but get there early. amazing views and very much worth it, but get your tickets online beforehand and get there early - first trip up is around 8am i think. we got there around 10am and the line was forever long. about a 2-3 hour wait, which i guess isn't a killer, but not exactly how you want to spend 2-3 hours on a vacation!
Riding up to an international landmark. The trip up (and down) was smooth and effortless, affording us some spectacular views of the rockface as well as seeing rock climbers on the way up.

One of those life's experiences you will never forget. you will have to queue, but the Cable car rotates and the views are amazing. It's an efficient ride, and certainly made my stay in Cape Town memorable. TIP: have your camera handy, and don't worry which side you are, as long as you are near the window.
Worth it!. We had to wait for a clear day but enjoyed it so much, views are spectacular and we spent the whole day on the mountain
Wonderful views from the top. Parking is a problem if too busy, and I would suggest you buy your tickets online to save time and avoid the long queues.

Cable car. Buy your tickets online get a discount and no need to stand in a long Que as there is an express point if you have got your tickets.
Friendly helpful staff. Experience to use the cable car with the rotating platform inside. It gives all the opportunity to see different magnificent views.
Good. Was fun, although felt a little squashed on route down as late and I think they wanted to get as many people down as they could quickly

UP, UP and away!. It was great going up the mountain in the cable car, although a little scary.... I would deffanatly go up again if I went back it was beautful.... Just be flexable with your days to ensure you have good weather!

Spectacular tremendous. Table Mountain is one of those experiences that you never want to end. The views are unparalleled and on a clear day, you feel so fortunate and happy to be there. No wonder the Danish stole the land and enslaved the natives. Sad but true. Back to TM - it is now one of my favorite places on earth. It ranks right up there and above Sugar Loaf in Rio. Spectacular, tremendous, massive, and wonderful are just a few of the words that only suggest what you'll see. Being there simply leaves you speechless.
Table Mountain. Great view over Cape Town.Although its a very popular place and thus with lots of people, the ride in the cable is accessible, fast and comfortable.

Incredible Views. Enduring the long lines leading up to the aerial cableway were worth it once onboard. As we ascended to the summit, the floor of the tram rotated, allowing everyone a fantastic view of Cape Town below, and Robben Island off in the distance. Once at the top of Table Mountain, we enjoyed incredible panoramic views of the Western Cape to the East, and Camps Bay and the Atlantic Ocean to the West. Every lookout presented us with incredible views and photo opportunities. Certainly a must do while in Cape Town!

Be sure to get there early during summer tourist season. Be sure to get there early during the summer tourist season. Without tickets can cost you a 2 hour wait. Recommend to purchase online before you go.
360 view. i love that when you go up, you are not stuck looking at one place, you get a view of the whole city and going up at the same time! its amazing! definitely recommend!!
buy ticket online to avoid long waiting. Buy ticket online and get to the station at 7am (open at 7.30am) to avoid long queue in high season (Xmas/new year).

360 degree turn in the air!. It won't matter where you stand when you get on this cableway as long as it's near the perimeter...it rotates 360 degrees on the way up & down so you'll get to see everything...pretty unique!

A Great Experience!. The new Cableway is a massive improvement on what was previously available. It is completely user friendly and feels like an upmarket experience.I have never had long queues when going there and one can pre-book. Great photo opportunities on the way up. Some nice walking routes once one gets to the top and a very good restaurant to have a proper coffee or a decent snack lunch.Definitely an attraction the City of Cape Town can be proud of!

Pricey but worth it. We climbed up, and took the cableway down. Highly recommend this as a way to preserve your knees for the rest of your vacation. It's expensive, but for us, worth it. Surprisingly elegant cafe and spotless toilets at the top.

Pricey for the Tourist. It is a necessary evil. I found the cost to be high but if you want to get up there, you need to do it. You can hike up - the route is long and few people not young or in decent shape wont make it and will still take the car down. The hike is about 1.5 hours if steady, faster if you clip, sadly slower if you struggle, and no guarantees about the view once up.

An Experience. Been up many times in the old and new. The rotation of the carrier is so slight and well timed that by the time you reach the top you have done the full circle. Staff controlling very courtious.

Fantastic trip up to table mountain. The best thing about this is that the floor rotates so you get to see the whole 360 degree view as you go up the mountain while suspended above which means that no view is ever obscured.
What a view, from one of worlds new 7 wonders. Though queues can be long, the cable car accommodates 68 passengers, hence minimizes waiting time significantly. Great view to both oceans from the top.

A deserving 7th wonder of nature. Dont know why it took so long for Table Mountain to be recognized for its splendor! This is an amazing attraction. It is a sacred and special place. Flanked by Devil's peak, Lion's head and signal hill, it leaves you breathless and in awe of creation. It is a place to receive qui and retain it too. You will feel the balance of yin and yang and the vibrant energy on this mountain. Captivating views and the table cloth as the air condenses,the trip is somewhat a homecoming for the soul. A great restaurant and curio shop are both at the top. It can get very crowded and you may easily miss the spiritual essence of what this landmark has to offer as you may stand in queues exceeding 3 hours for a trip in a cable cart ascending and descending. A hike would be best but if you are short of time make sure to get your tickets online,this would save you an hour or more.
