loved the cable car. finally i got the courage to go up table mountain and could have rode up and down all day on the cable car loved it. i had a white jersey on that day and for some reason miggies were attracted to me so was covered in them which drove me mad but had a glass of wine up in the restaurant and a lovely walk and would recommend anyone to do this trip.....especially the cable car..
The most memorable experience. Wow, this was amazing. The cable car offers a smooth ride to the top. The floor of the cable car rotates, giving every person in it a chance to admire the view.

A must see. Be prepared to spend at least a couple of hours on the mountain. Very worth wile and a must see. Breathtaking views. Sun block a must, can be very hot on top of the mountain. Various mountain parths to take. The restaurant offer a lovely menu, although a bit pricy. Never the less, absolutely worth the effort..

nice ride. The operators of the cableway are very friendly and professional. The price is well worth the photos you'll get up on the mountain. It's an incredible view, and even the ride is breathtaking.
Tip: Get to the cableway early in the morning to avoid crowds.
Very cool ride!. The floor rotates and you get a 360 view of the mountain and the surrounding areas. Loved it! Two sides have open windows so there is enough ventilation. Go for it!

Watch the Winds. The cable car offers a quick and easy way to get to the top of table mountain for those who cannot do the hike up, or for those who have done the walk up but are too tired to trek back down. The car rotates, so as long as you are standing by the glass, you will get great panoramic views. However, be aware that the cable car closes regularly due to high winds and table mountain is often under heavy cloud cover. Check the table mountain website for updates on wind speed and visibility to avoid being disappointed. Get there early - as soon as the cable car opens at 8 a.m. - to avoid long lines and to enjoy the mountain top in some peace before everyone else arrives. Wear sensible shoes if you plan to walk around the top. Also, bring a windbreaker, you will be thankful. You can also choose to do a hike to McClear's Beacon for views from the other side. Beware if the siren sounds, that means the cable car will be closing soon due to high winds. There is a restaurant, restrooms, and a gift shop on top.

Crushing lift. On the way up, they crammed so many people into the car that we were continuously jostled & poked by other peoples elbows, camera bags, backpacks & totebags. I couldn't see anything except the back of people's heads. The way down was pleasant & scenic as there weren't as many people but the way down seemed to end too quick.
A journey to heaven. The staff were most efficient and accomdating. One can never tire of this sight and picture taking at this point is a must
awesome views, quick ascent. very modern safe and comfortable trip to the top.Awesome rotating cars give you a great view, and a very fast ascent to the top. Well worth the visit

Don't look down!. Awesome views but VERY VERY steep cable car journey! We had a beautiful day for our trip and so took thousands of photos. Photogenic from every angle and great views of CapeTown and the coastline

Table Mountain Cableway visit. Well organised and friendly personnel. One of the most beautiful SA tourist attractions. Thank you. We never visit Cape Town without a visit to Table Mountain, and it remains one of the few SA attractions that maintain an excellent standard. Although busy, all facilities are clean.
Huge queue but worth it. We queued for over an hour and were feeling a bit grumbly but then the ride itself was fabulous (revolving floor!). It's very quick once you're on board but it's great fun.
a true wonder. we feel very spoilt and blessed every time we go up the cableway...a true gem in our own city - service of the very helpful, smiling staff goes beyond expectation, everytime

Table mountain Cableway - wonderful experience. The 360 degree revolving cableway give everyone a magnificent view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. It is not for the feint of heart, but is a remarkable experience never to be forgotten. A MUST when visiting Cape Town.

Reserve tickets Aveda. We took the Red hop-on hop-off bus to the foot of the Table Mountain. We ordered the tickets ahead via internet. It saves money and you skip the lines. From the day you want to use the ticket is valid for 14 days. If you cannot use the ticket because of the wheather you get a refund. We had a great couple of hours. Take a hat, sunscreme and water along.

Enjoyable!. Although it was a long wait, we thoroughly enjoyed our trip up the mountain. We were rewarded with panaromic views of Cape Town and had a meal at the restaurant. Bit pricey, not so good but it had a lovely atmosphere.If you plan to take a trip up the mountain, make sure that you have a warm jacket as it can be cold up there! They do have small stalls that sell jackets at the bottom but they are very pricey! Unfortuantly, I had a hard lesson to learn.... R250 for the jacket ( aimed at overseas tourists with pounds or dollars) but a good quality never the less! :)

The View. What an amazing view - the city falling away beneath you and the Atlantic Ocean as far as the eye can see. If its a windy day, don't bother, it will be closed but on a still day it's a "must do" !!!
Amazing. A bit scary but breathtaking!! Amazing ride to the top of Table Mountain.Expect long queues in good weather

Avoid the queues and walk up. I have done the walk up twice now and it is a great way to avoid the crowds. The views open up as you ascend and once at the top you can orientate yourself with the entire area before buying a ticket from the gift shop for the cable car journey down to save your knees.

Fantastic Wonder Of The World.. Recently voted as one of the new Natural Wonders of the World, Table Mountain certainly earns that distinction. Its breath-taking views are just awe inspiring. The day I was standing on top of the mountain was such a clear day I could almost see heaven. definitely well worth a look when you're visiting Cape Town.
Queues. Queues can be very very slow moving indeed, Pre book your ticket online and make sure you are there by no later tha 08h30 that is unless you enjoy queues
Aerial Cableway.. a must. The prices jumped a lot since last year.. but the "trip" is worth it.. You may also choose to return "hiking" on well marked paths.. Its always windy up there..
Spectacular and great views. Great views on a sunny day. No wait at all, Taxi driver waits for your at the base station for the return trip.

Wow.... R 205 for a ticket is expensive....but it is worth every cent. The view while going up was spectacular. covering a distance of 764 m in a short time (~ 5mins). As its quite windy, the cable car gets suspende ofteen. It is advisable to check the status on the website http://tablemountain.net/ or call the helpline numbers. We were lucky that w took the ride on a sunny day with clear views of Capetown city. Weather on table mountain changes quickly. While going up it was hot and sunny and in just couple of hours the entire area was covered by fog with. Apart from hikes, one can also abseiling down. I would recommend spending 2-3 hours at-least.

Needs some serious customer service training. I can't comment on the cable way as we could not access it. I fully understand that the cable way cannot operate in adverse weather conditions. However, if it is decided to open the cable way, waiting customers should be given proper information. We were told that the cable way will open"shortly" - an hour later we were still waiting. I'm sure by now they should know how long it takes to prepare the cable way for opening.Well, we left very frustrated.......

Always fun. This is always fun and a fantastic experience being able to observe this beautiful city. I am always surprised at how quickly this cable car takes to get up and down! If a touch expensive!

WOW, what a trip. Quickest way up to the top. Great views but pick a clear day and enjoy the ride. Do pre-book to avoid the queues and DO use the Red Bus tour as part of the trip. Well worth the money.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Amazingly efficient. Celebrated the New Year there, there were hundreds of people in the queue after seeing in the new year & we were amazed to be down within 40 minutes, had expected it to take much longer.
Excellent. Great fun, the only quick way to the top. The cars are huge and be prepared for the revolving floor which ingeniously affords everyone the view!

An adventure. A revolving cable car to give everyone a chance to see the view. No queuing and all very organised. We enjoyed a morning on Table Mountain admiring the views. The parking was a little difficult, but that was to be expected.

Great experience.. Get there early to avoid the crowds!! They pack you in like sardines, so be aware if you are claustrophobic. The cable car has a revolving floor which can be an issue with some people.....(you can't hang on to the rail or the bars!!) but it is perfectly safe. Takes about 4 mins to get to the top. Love it..... great views.
It revolves. And you get a great view because of this. It is a smooth ride and takes only minutes. Quick, efficient & value for money.

Wonderful views. On a clear day, get there early or don't go until later in the afternoon as the lines are long. Once in the cablecar, try to stand near a window, doesn't matter where, as the car rotates 360 degrees while it moves up the mountain. You will see incredible views. Don't miss this.

Stunning scenery. This has to be one of the best views of any city anywhere in the world- and with the beaches to the side clearly visible as well as Robben Island the quick revolving cable car trip up is a Cape Town no brainer- just make sure you go on a fiine day where there is not too much wind.

Fantastic experience and one not to be missed. The cable car rotates as you climb up the mountain so you have 360 degree views. If you can see the top of the mountain go up as the mist/clouds can quickly cover it. This was advise given to us on our first visit and it has worked for us both times and we've been rewarded with brilliant views.
What a ride!. 5 min ride, but awesome! Usually windy at the top, bring warm clothing! There's a free guided tour at 10 a.m. and noon at the top station.
Revolving gondola.. This was a unique gondola ride in that everyone enjoyed a prime vantage point going up and down the mountain.

A Must Do in Cape Town!. Loved it! Do this trip on the cable car.It rotates internally as you move up the mountain- brilliant!
You will NOT be disappointed.The views are amazing!

Spectacular View. We went up mid morning. Clouds were hanging on the surrounding mountains. Sun broke through & it warmed up. The view of Cape Town area was outstanding. A must-do activity while in the area.

pricey, but worth it. The view from the top is amazing! I chose to hike up to the top & there was no way I could have climbed back down. They know this, and the charge a pretty penny for a ride down. They have good choices up top for food and drink (options and prices). Definately worth a trip up.

almost get caught out by the window. it is great but i didnt know it is rotating inside the car. i was filming with my smartphone behind the window safely and a few moments later the window disappeared (because the car has rotated to a section where there is no window), almost caught me out and luckily i didnt drop my phone!

Cableway. very good experience. cable car rotates to give different views. Book in advance to avoid queues. Closes due to winds even if winds are not experienced in Capetown. Dont leave till last minute.
Comfortable and Fast. The car rotates as the Cable moves so there is no wrong place to stand. The service is frequent. No dizziness

Great wonder of the world. A tourist must-do and even locals should climb the mountain once in their lifetime!! Or the cable-way is a safer and easier route. Amazing views over the most beautiful city in the world...

Needs a Park & Ride!. The views were magnificent and I loved the turntable so you get a panoramic view however at 10.00 when we arrived there was just no-where to park within about half a mile (we needed somewhere fairly close as we had an elderly lady with us) and in the end I had to drop the rest of the group off and park. By the time we left a few hours later the line of parked cars was well out of sight and of course it took quite a while to travel to and from the car as my mobility is not at it's best at the moment. Surprisingly, by the time I was back with my group it only took about 20 minutes before we entered the cable car as the queues were not overly long, and as there were not a lot of people on the top of the mountain, I don't know where all the cars came from.
What a view!. There were beautiful views and as the cable car rotated it was all easy to see. Everything was well organised but the queues can be very long so book your ticket in advance, on the net.

A great experience. We used the Cableway to go up to the Top of Table Mountain on a recent holiday to Cape Town. It is a great experience and the first time I have been on a cable car where the floor rotates so that you get an all round view. At the bottom station it was really windy so I thought it would be cold and windy at the top but when you get there it was calm and really warm and you can look down on the cloud. We spent almost 2 hours at the top walking round and enjoying the incredible view and phot opportunities from the top. Definitely a trip to do if you are in Cape Town.

Every day is a surprise. A must see for every traveller to SA. Tickets can be bought online at a discount to avoid standing in queues. Cable car floors rotate so everyone gets a 360 degree panoramic view going up and coming down. Only three aerial cable ways in this class in the world as far as I know. USA, Switzerland and SA. Take a sweater with you as the wind comes up quite quickly. The website is important to monitor if you are planning a trip up the mountain. Tablemountain.net Operating hours, weather conditions, specials, as well as whether the cable way is open (due to safety it is mostly subject to wind and weather conditions) The trip up is steady. The car hold up to 65 passengers. Curio shops and basic restaurant facility is situated on the mountain. You are allowed to walk up the mountain, enquire from the ticket station.

table mountain. i really liked the viws and the shops on the top of the mountain and my family and i really enjoyed but the only thing i didnt like was we were waiting for about and hour and people kept pushing in and i didnt like when my ears popped when we ascended
Well Run. Doesn't run when it's windy but very nice up and down when it's a nice day. Wonderful view at the top.
The quickest way to the top. This can get very crowded and queues can extended for an hour to get on the Cableway. Go early and ensure you have plenty of time at the top. Good value and great views.
Up and Away. The easy way to the top and the revolving floor is quite entertaining. Does not get as full as some ski lifts fortunately
Great experience. The cableway is one of only 3 in the world, the floor revolves whilst the car is ascending and decending so 360 view interesting to watch hikers climbing up the mountain.
If you want to get to the top. Beautiful 360 degree views as it rotates completely during the trip to the top of Table Mountain. NOT TO MISS....if only for the views.

Hope you like Heights. Well organised some book tickets on line but that is dependent on time of year. We had no trouble minimal wait and that was about mid day. Cable car rotates so all get a good view and ability to get good photo's, clean and fast
well organised. If you aren't feeling energetic, or able to climb the moutain, this is the way to go, it takes just 4 minutes, very welll organised, and great views on route!

Great Views and Queues.. The car spins clockwise or at least the floor does once its moving. Get a position about 1 meter before the window gap and you'll be in a perfect spot for taking pictures at the bottom and right at the top. Do not rush straight to the window opening. One meter around is the place to be so when it starts rotating your in the right spot at the right time.

Increadible views and friendly staff. I spent hours sipping wine and watching the sun go down from the cafe at the top. Amazing. I was one of about twenty people who sort of... disregarded the posted last-cable-down to stay and watch the sun disappear. About an hour after closing time, a very friendly manager came out and laughed about how we were the night's "naughty children" and shoo'd us out. Just be careful to go on a clear day and check the website before arriving to see if the car is even open. It closes frequently due to wind.

Breathtaking views!. Unless you are a keen hiker, do not hesitate and book your aerial cableway tickets! It offers a spectacular journey to table mountain with lovely views of CT - Lion's Head and Table Mountain. The best thing about it is that the floor rotates allowing all passengers to enjoy a 360° view!

Only way to the top. You could walk/hike, but lets get serious, we don't have the time. Visiting Cape Town for 3 nights, so when the tram is operating, take full advantage. Nice smooth ride and the rotating floor is a interesting feature. Nice views.

Pity the cableway does not match the mountains' splendour. Long queues...despite on line booking...difficult to estimate best time to take elderly overseas' guests to minimise their waiting to board the cable car. Pity as when up there it is magnificent!
Excelent Experience. A must if you are around. Great view including to Robben Island.You need be sure the sky is clean (you can see it from the town center).

On top of the world. Well, at least on top of Cape Town. Well worth the trip even if you suffer from vertigo, just sit in the centre of the rotating cable car and shut your eyes! I did and managed okay. The views from the top are spectacular and there are plenty of areas to walk around where you feel quite safe. I was most impressed with the effort that they go to in order to keep the environment in as pristine a condition as possible whilst making minimum impact with their footprint. Restaurant also to be recommended.

Thrill ride to the top. A great way to see the region. The last little bit of the cable ride is the most exhilarating as you break out above the rocks to see the beaches. It feels like you are floating!

What a view!. have been up this mountain more times than I wish to count. Only mountain that I know a wheelchair user can get to the top of, enjoy a fabulous meal, cross the top and enjoy the fabulous views.

Relax and take a ride. Don't feel that you have to be the first one one to get a good view. The gondola has a rotating floor that allows every occupant a 360 degree view during the journey. You can laugh at the people who jockey through the line to be the first one on.

Popular as ever. As long as you buy your tickets online, a wonderful experience.Efficient staff and a fantastic spectacle.A pity the parking and roads are being upgraded at the start of the busy season.

Friendly staff don't worry about the view the car rotates.. The line can be long at peak times but the car hold 75 people so it moves ok. We were with a group and one person lost his ticket. One of the staff ran back to the ticket office and got him a new ticket and refused any gratuity. When you get on stay to the outside. Once the car begins its climb or desent the floor rotates slowly so you get a great view all around. If hights are not your thing there are a few seat in the middle that are stationary.
The view doesn't get better than this!. Whether you live in Cape Town or visting from anywhere in the world, a ride up this cable car to appreciate these unique views is a must!
long lines. the wait at both the bottom and the top was over 1 1/2 hours. It was cold at the top and a miserable wait

What a View!. If it's a nice day, head up to the top of Table Mountain. The views are amazing! There is a nice spot for coffee at the top, a great place to take cover should there be a sudden change of weather. Dress warmly as it can be colder up top. The cable car revolves on your trip up which affords lovely views. ENJOY!

Worth it to go once. The cableway is quite expensive for South Africans, but it is a nice experience especially if you can't walk up or don't have the time to walk up. If the weather is not good rather go at a different time as it is unpleasant up top if it is windy and if it is cloudy you can't see a thing. It tends to be crowdy at peak times. But it is one of the wonders of the world go and experience it :)

Very well organised. the Cablecar system is very well organised, they always have very long queues to deal with, the staff is always efficient and friendly. The floor of the cablecar itself does a 360 degree turn on the way up and down, so no matter where you stand when you get on you'll get a view of everything.

World Class. We went up in the cableway with a base jumper. Thank heavens he did not jump out the cable car but we followed him along the top mountain path and watched him jump off. Was relieved to see his paraglider open immediatly.
Amazing!. Do the hike up Platterkoop Gorge and then take the cable car down. An awesome experience not to be missed!

You must do this!. The cablecars are very cleverly designed. Since everyone wants to face outward, the cars are designed so that the floor rotates slowly clockwise and the walls rotate slowly counter clockwise. That way, passengers stand in one spot but get a 360 degree view during the course of the ride to and from the top of the mountain!

A Must Visit Attraction. If you are in Cape Town and the weather is clear then you must head for the cablecar. The panoramic views are superb and give you a real feel of the surrounding area and the sheer scale of the mountains. We would recommend you book your tickets online in advance to reduce queuing and if you get a clear day of weather then go for it as there could well be several days when it is not open due to the cloud tablecloth over the mountain. Please arm yourself with all your cameras and be prepared for days of editing afterwards given the number of spectacular views available!
Very nice. Great view of the city and the surround...$45 for 2 adults..after walking around you can have a coffe, a drink or something to eat prices are reasonnable...very nice attraction
AMAZING!. Couldn't actually believe that a cablecar can actually revolve within itself. Great veiws, good price. Excellent!!

Rotating cableway. Yes, it rotates, so you get a 360° view of the scenery below you. The cable car staff was great there were no queues (May), and the view was fantastic. Parking your car can be an issue, we went along the road till a helpful guy showed us where to park (tip of course inevitable upon returning). But you can not put a parking lot on such a steep hill!

Great designed cable car. The easiest way to take you up to the top of the mountain. The inside of the cable car actually turns while you're going up or down the mountain so you don't have to fight for the window spot when you aboard the cable car, the best design ever!

Do it !. Once you are up there it is fantastic views and marvellous dining facilities too! Be careful , as all travellers must do, stay where there are other people around. Pick your days to go up as it is expensive so be sure there is a good view, it is OFTEN covered in clouds.

Worth the wait. A bit of a wait to get up but the cable car was fun and gave a great view, was clean and functioned well (thank goodness!).
Great way to get to the spetacular top!
The only way is up!. The way that the cabin 'rotates' to allow everyone a picture opportunity without taking their shot through glass is ingenious

Worth the trip. So, the cable car is teh way to get to the top. Worth getting to the top and the view is great on the way up.
I would recommend it as the way to visit the mountain. Certainly an experience !

Top of the World. You simply cannot visit Cape Town without going up the Cableway.
The new Cable Car is awesome and the views going up is spectacular. Lots of walks on top too. Very Special!.

Get in car either first or last. Excellent panoramic view as cable cars have revolving floors. Wonderful views if you are near windows not so good if lost in the scrum in the middle. Good service although by its very nature there is usually a queue. Often closed because of the weather - especially the wind. If your time in Cape Town is short take first opportunity to go up. Many people miss their chance and go home disappointed.

Super views. Wonderful experience in revolving cable car - tip get in last then this ensures a place by the window as you can get lost in the scrum. Once up there the views are fantastic. Take the first opportunity to go up as cable car often closed because of the weather
Cableway ride. We enjoyed the short ride, revolving floor, and free guided tour at the top. Limited viewing from inside the car due to crowds. Limited parking.

You can't leave Cape Town without doing this. The cable way has been upgraded a few years ago. The cart turns around 360 degrees when you travel up and down. You see the city from all angles. There is a very nice restaurant at the top. You also can do leisurely walks around and enjoy the Cape Flower Kingdom, also known as fynbos.
O for awesome..... excepting the whole queue thing to get onto it! Maybe that was just *that* day, of that time of year, but it did take forever.

Very good. Although it was always a long queue..it was worthed to ride on this.. Going up and down very smooth and quicky. But in a cloudy day itwas not advisable to ride this, or the even close it. On a sunny day it was very pleasant

Best way to the top. Best way to the top, buy your tickets ahead and be in the first group of the day. the Cableway does a 360 turn on the way to the top. If you are afraid of heights stand in the middle as the car does not turn there.
Great ride. There were long queues but they moved really quickly. The cable car revolved 360 degrees, so you had a good view all round - smooth and fast ride.

Fun trip up the cableway. Worth a trip to the top on the cableway, even though it's a bit pricey. It was cloudy at the top when I went, so didn't really have a view, but still enjoyed it. It was actually closed the first day I was in Cape Town due to weather, so check the web site before you go. If you go on a clear day, there are also some trails you can take on the top. The hop-on hop-off bus stops at the bottom of the cableway, and also provides a scenic trip along the winding roads that lead up to it.

Cable car at Table mountain. This is still a wonder of the world. A must see to everyone that visits Cape Town. This experience cannot be described it must be experienced and seen for yourself. From the top of the mountain you can see the wonders of Gods creation.

Revolves. I had never been on a revolving cable car. It gave everyone a chance to take pictures and get a lovely view of Capetown. We had tried to go earlier in the week but there wasn't enough visability. How nice of them to let us know and not waste our time!

South Africans ride free on your birthday!. A fabulous ride to the top of our world, and free on your birthday! What's not to love. Take your own picnic or have a beer at the restaurant at the top... Best views around!

Long lines. We had one clear day out of the five days we were in Cape Town, so of course we headed to Table Mountain. But the lines for the cableway were so long, we turned back and went to the beach instead.
Great views. Try and plan your trip on your birthday, because you can go for free if you take a friend. This trip should definitely not be missed, the views are spectacular.
Quick ride. Buy tickets discounted online. Save time. Quick easy ride to the top of table mountain. Lines move quickly .

Beautiful Sights. Really enjoyed the sights and views from on top of the mountain as it feels like you are on top of the clouds. The cable ride itself wasn't the most enjoyable because the floor rotates instead of the car which allows you a short window to take photos. The photo they take of you me superimpose onto a car is some of the worst photo editing I've seen. The gift shops are lacking also so don't expect to find much to bring back. The views are so stunning however once you arrive that it makes you forget about dry thing else. You're here for the view anyway. So enjoy.
Lucky with the weather. The cable car gives a great all round view and a pleasant ride. fabulous view at the top and nice walks.
Lovely views. If you visit Capetown you must go up the Cableway to the top of Table Mountain. The views from the top (if you are lucky to go on a fine day!) are spectacular.
great experience. table mountain is a must for everybody. When the weather is clear, do not hesitate and go there! Beautiful views

Parking fine spoilt the trip. We parked where several other cars parked. We were advised by a man in a yellow jacket with the word 'security' on it to turn the car around which we did. On our return every car along that side had a parking fine. I complained to the Table Mountain staff but they informed that the security man was not employed by them. In fact they don't work for anyone but rely on tourists for tips. Another tourist shouted it feels like a scam between the government office & the 'security' men ie let people park where they shouldn't. The government makes lots of money & someone gets a backhand

Table Mountain Cable Cars. This cable way is different from many others in that the ascent and descent are very steep. Still you don't realize this, because of the beautiful scenery and view.A very nice touch to the wagons is that the floor rotates at slow speed. This way everyone can and will enjoy a full, 360 degree view. Tip: start the way up facing the mountain and the way down facing the horizon.
great !. easier than walking up the mountain. Felt safe , modern and secure ! The prize being when you reach the top and enjoy the magnificent spectacle of Cape Town below you !

Careful but flexible planning is the key.. We bought tickets on line before we left the states, for both Robben Island and the Table Mtn Cable car. Both adventures are wind and weather dependent. Table Mtn was closed 3 out of 7 days we were here due to high winds or cloud cover. Robben Island ran each day and luckily we went on a day with mild seas.The cable car tickets are good for a 14 day period so your plan should be to be flexible enough to go as soon as the weather is nice. Mornings looked to be less crowded. Your ticket doesn't have a specific time. We took a cab from the waterfront (EBR. 021 424 9494) for about 60 Rand, about $8. We had an estimate of 150 rand from a guy who claimed to be a taxi. For the Robben Island power catamaran, (250 people - 30 minute trip), if the wind is creating dangerous conditions they'll call your hotel an cancel, but if it's only "sickening" conditions you'll have to decide on your own. Get in line for security 15 minutes early to get on the top, or outside decks. If you come late you'll be trapped inside the stuffy cabin. Using just the one cab company turned out to be a good idea. Restaurants would call them for us an they'd get us back to The African Villa where we stayed with no hassle. Going from the District 6 museum to the Clock Tower, an easy tourist path, turned out complicated for a cab marked "metered" on the outside but without a meter on the inside.

Wonderous Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. The cable car is very available and turns slowly as you ascend and so you get to see the most wonderful views of sea mountains and land. I have yet to be as impressed by other aerial cableways + I travel a lot
a bit disconcerting.. the inside of the cable car revolves to give you a 360 view which was a bit scary, but good as well.
Table Mountain Cableway. The best way to get up the mountain; but get there early on a clear, fine day, as the crowds can be horrendous. we had to queue for nearly two hours.

easier than walking !. If you don't want to walk or short on time. It is worth paying for the cable car up and down ! If it has been closed due to weather conditions, be prepared for a BIG queue on the 1st day of opening ! Still worth the wait, as it take 50 or so people per ride.
rotating platform - great idea. travelling up is effectively handeled. the idea of roting cable car floor us great - allowing every passenger to watch all direction views .
birthday.... I usually make a pilgrimage on my birthday to this gorgeous space in cape town. Awesome awesome and its free on your birthday (proof needed).
Fun!. Short but exciting trip up Cable Mountain in a rotating cabin that gives you 360 degree views! The best and worth every cent when you get to the top and catch the breath taking views.
Cable car is a must. we took the cable car to the top then did a walk.the views were magnificent.the wildlife (large rodent like creatures) were quite cute and posed for photos.

VIEWS FOREVER ON A GOOD DAY. I have been there several times and every time I am amazed at the incredibly beautiful views. You can see for many kilometers up the West Coast, towards the Drakenstein mountains at Paarl and the Hottenttos Holland mountains at Somerset West. This is one thing you MUST do when in Cape Town.
Adventure.... Great time,more than I expected,great view and great service.Great place to visit,will definately go again.

get in early and enjoy the views. The ques can realy get long if you do not get there early. Get to site before 09h00 , have breakfast on the mountain and take the walkway at the back that cirle back to the cable cart. The flowers and the scenery is breathtaking.
great views. Table aerial cable is the best way to visit the mountain, with a great view it is a must see for any visitors to Cape town!

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Even though we booked our tickets on-line, there was still an hour's wait before we could enter the cablecar. The parking arrangements were insufficient and we had to walk a very long way to get to the cable station. Might I make a suggestion of little golf carts such as those at the Cape Town International Airport to shuttle people from the far off parking spots at a nominal fee. A drop-off zone at the cable station would also be convenient for people to drop off their companions, go to park the car and shuttle back on the golf carts. This will eleviate the congestion that there seem to be at the cable station.

The way to the top. The way to the top of the Table Mountain. This is not the only way to arrive on top but the most confortable. The Cableway will spin during the way so you can have a great view without moving inside it.

a huge cable car with rotating platform. on certain days, you might have to queue a little but it is certainly worth it. once you get going, the cable car operator announces that he would spin the platform and you then get a panaromic 360 degree view of the surroundings.at the top, you can also plan to have breakfast (if you are early) or lunch. plan to sit inside and the outside can be windy and chilly

Cloud 9. This was a nice trip, except that the mountain was in cloud when we went up. We had joined a 1 hour tour guide who was very informative, just a bit of a pity we couldn't see much. Be sure to take very warm clothes with you if you go, even if it looks fine, because it gets VERY cold up there. Good alternative would be to go up Signal Hill and view the mountain and Cape Town from there.
must do in cape town. table mountain MUST be visited by any person in cape town.it is truly the best.the ride up the cableway is indeed a memorable one

World Class. It is an experience not to be missed. The whole process runs smoothly and the views on the way up and down are just breathtaking. I like to go after 6pm when it is cheaper. Also don't forget you go for free on your birthday!
Wonderful spinning view. iT WAS GREAT FUN! Spins as you go up, so everyone gets a good view. Not for the faint of heart or height phobic!

Photographers paradise !!!. panaromic view of the island , be there by 3 in noon so u can get 3 hrs to check the moutain. have adequate space on ur camera , mobile as u will be exhausted by tking pics ....beach view with moutains on top of it is to die for !!!

A Spinning Tram. Arrive early or go late in the day, as the lines on a beautiful clear day can be very very long. The tram, recently updated, has a floor that spins so that no matter where you stand you are getting total aerial views of the area
Loved the twirl!. As it rotates you get a good view on the way up. Queues can be lengthy but you have to accept that as it is such a popular attraction.

Well done - smooth and good service. went up to Table Mountain many times. Last time was October 2011 during (the Gauteng) holidays. Holiday discount turned out to be only applicable for CPT school holidays, nevertheless the manager charged school holiday rates. thank you. greatly appreciated. Other than that: all staff is clearly geared dealing with international tourists. Equipment up to scratch. When afraid of heights, make sure you stand in the middle of the car (it turns around slowly while ascending/descending).

Excellent views but you pay for the convenience. If the weather lucks out, Table Mountain is a MUST-DO. However, the only way to get to the top is to hike a rather steep and daunting trail for a few hours or fork over the money for the convenience of taking the cablecar. So be aware that because this is a top tourist destination, the trip up is kinda expensive for what it is. That being said, it offers unparalleled views of Table Mountain and the City Bowl as you travel up and down the cable. Don't worry about what section of the glass you're at- the cablecar rotates 360 degrees so everyone gets a chance to see the sights.Go ahead and get your tickets online in advance- it's good for several days in case of bad weather and worth it if there's a long line at the ticket counter. Also be sure to get a return trip ticket or you'll be hiking down!

Pray for Good Weather. After 3 days of cloudy, windy days, we had almost given up on riding up to Table Mountain. But, on the last day, the skies cleared and we were treated to a spectacular trip up the mountain. The view was fantastic. If it is a sunny day, don't miss this experience.

I hate heights!. I've done this once - you really have to! Just wish I didn't hate heights and cable cars so much. That said, it's a great experience, just be sure to check the weather as the cable car will be closed if it's too windy.

EXCELLENT, BUT EXPENSIVE. No one can fault the stunning views from the top of Table Mountain. It is certainly well worth getting to the top for this. However, the cable way is an expensive rip off and it is clear that the owners are capitalising on the overseas tourists and charging exorbitant rates for the short ride, exclusing the facility from locals. One could feed a family of 4 for some weeks for the cost of a similar ticket.For the fitter people, there are a number routes to hike up the mountain. Much cheaper and the views are the same.

a bit expensive but.... it is worthwhile! If you are a good walker or hiker, you could also decide to descend on foot, anyway the cable way is teh best way to enjoy the table mountain experience. Be careful to inform you on wether conditions because often the cable way is stopped because of strong winds or fog on the top of the mountain.

Very efficient - when weather right. Amazing how fast it manages to ascend - and descend - with novel 360degree turn for all to experience full views. No need to fear heights on this very well engineered vehicle.

Must do in Cape Town. You must go to the top of Table Mountain while in Cape Town. It is breathtakingly beautiful. The cable ride is short and secure and a nice way to take in scenery on the way up. The line looks long but moves quickly.

If in Cape Town do the aerial cableway, you won't be sorry.. The first experience I had in Cape Town was the cableway. It's a short journey on the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The views are amazing from every direction.
Cableway. If you like to hike you should hike up the mountain, but by the time you arrive at the top, you might want to take this down.

Visit on your Birthday for free ticket -proof to be provided. Can be hiked by the fit and adventurous. Cable car for the easy way up and down :-) If it is your birthday you travel for free ( proof to be provided) . currently one of the seven wonders of the world and on a beautiful day you will see why. Can abseil 112 metres down the sheer cliff on the eastern side side and hike back up ( for the adventurous) . Toilets were under maintenance construction as at May 2012 so use the toilets at the bottom cable way station. A MUST do for the visitor !!

Table Mountain Cableway, Cape Town, South Africa. Any visitor to Cape Town cannot fail to be awed by the majesty of its Table Mountain backdrop. Therefore, if the weather is favourable, it is an absolute must to take a trip to the top of the mountain and look down at the Peninsula spread out below. As Cape Town locals, our personal best is to wait until the summer months, when the Cableway runs until around 9 at night. We then make a plan to take the ride up in the cablecar, so that we're at the top before sunset. (A picnic pack is a cheaper alternative to the mountain-top restaurants, but to be polite, don't try to eat and drink your own stuff on their "turf", or they have every right to get annoyed.). The views are fabulous and as the daylight fades away, the millions of lights of the Mother City twinkle. If you are able to time this trip at full moon, then that's extra special!
Great trip. Awesome trip to the top of table mountain. Kids rode free as it was a school holiday promotion. Surprised by quality of cafe up the top. Must do if it is clear.
Great Views Up and Down. My wife went straight down after going up. She has a fear of heights but was able to hide in the 60+ group in the car both ways.Great views up and down.
Calm day. Fortunately we had a calm day so Table Mountain was open and our tour guide got us there first thing in the morning to beat the line ups, it had been closed day previous because of weather.

Interesting ride. Expensive, in Rand terms, but efficient and interesting with the rotating floorLots of people to help and guide and ultimately it did what it was meant to - get you from the mid station where yoo park to the top, without getting out of breath!

Crowded and disorganized but worth it. The line to the top of station (where you actually board the cable car) was very long. We were told the wait would be approximately 30 minutes upon our arrival around 9 am. However, the line actually was at least one hour long. Since the "line" is a very wide set of stairs, it is very crowded, disorganized, and unenjoyable as you are constantly being pushed by people trying to cut in front of you. Very frustrating! There absolutely needs to be a more organized system to get travelers to the cable car. Of course, the car is the easiest and fastest (albeit most expensive) way to get to the top of Table Mountain. In our time crunch, it was the only option and still really worth it for the amazing views of the city. Also, since it is such a popular destination in Cape Town, there is no shortage of taxis to take you back home or to your next destination (without wait).
You go free on your birthday!. Thats a bonus a free ride on your birthday. They could however lower the price for pensioners everyday and just on Fridays

Very cool, long wait. The cableway is a fun way to get up to Table Mountain. It even includes the extra feature of a rotating floor, so even though you may start on one side of the car you will still get the full view at some point during your trip. If you can, though, buy your tickets online before you get there and save yourself one of the lines to stand in. This applies even if you are outside of South Africa.

Best views of CPT. Make super you chose a clear day, and go early say the mountain closes when the wind becomes too strong or low hanging cloud comes over. Also make sure you're there early - it gets very busy.Apart from the practicalities the new 360 car is amazing. Consider hiking up the mountain through Kirstenbosch Gardens up the Skeleton Gorge Route (sounds much worse than it is), and coming down the cable car. Then you also skip the queue - note the start at a different point to where the cable car returns to.Enjoy our beautiful city!

Awesome!. Took my granddaughters for their "Date with Granny". Staff so friendly, happy, helpful. Kidz Season great (Free Dassie biscuit, whistle lollipop, humongous slice of pizza and soft drink for R30. Prices at restuarant reasonable (except coffees etc bit pricey). Educational fun day. No queue. What a treat. Big thank you to all the staff.

Fun ride up!. How fun! This was pretty cool but I did not give it a five because they CRAM people in like sardines. Literally, you are smashed between random strangers. but the floor revoles so you get a 360 of the view - assuming you can see over the person standing in front of you. The cableway was actually very smooth and a gentle ride for anyone nervous about going up.
What a ride. I have been on many cable cars in my life but this is the first one that turns 360 degrees while traveling up and down which allowed everyone a great view.

Fun way to reach the top of Table Mountain. Apart from all the sponsorship by VISA, the cable car is an easy and enjoyable way to travel to the top of Table Mountain. The rotating car is awesome and allows all visitors to share in the magnificent views.Tip purchase your tickets online and arrive early to avoid the crowds.
Fun. Fun ride to the top of Table Mountain. The base rotates so you get the best views. Really not scary.

exciting trip up and down to famous table mountain. 360 view, safe, thrilling, can be a bit busy during peak holiday season so get there early. Not operating on very windy days or very wet & rainy days. Good value for money for overseas visitors, but expensive for locals. easiets way up and down the mountain, especially with small kids.

The easiest way to see Table Mountain. Very nice way to see table moutain, not expensive and nice view. Cable has a uniqe feature that cables turing around during trip to the top so you can see all around. Definitly recommened.

Buy a ticket in advance at your hotel!. But only do that if it is a nice sunny day, the weather can change so fast it is hard to believe. The first time we went, it was gorgeous, we had lunch up there overlooking what seemed like the whole country. Just beautiful. The second time, it started to cloud over and got windy, we didn't even leave the cable car building at the top, the wind made you feel like you could blow off at anytime and it was truly freezing! What a difference a day makes! So glad we went the first day even though we knew we would be going back with our tour 2 days later.

Dirty windows!. Yes yes wonderful - amazing experience not to be missed!!But I demanded to see the operations manager! Why... just seemed obvious to me that the windows on the Cable Cars should be clean!! Why else take it if you can't see through them! Also I had to add to my list a lack of toilet paper!Such things are easily put right & needed to be brought to the managements attention.. She said she would take note! But did she listen & act upon the complaint! Pity one of ZA's top attractions lacking in good management!But otherwise a must of a visit! grab the first clear day!! (If the windows have been cleaned!!)
Up up we go!. Did not have to wait too long to get on; Loved the way it rotated giving one a range of views; Designed so every-one gets a good view

One of the Wonders in the world. Visiting the Table Mountain is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town, this will provide you with fantastic views of the city and surrounding areas. It is a wonderful trip up with the new cable car and a nice walk on the paths, take a pick nick basket with you and enjoy one of the best spots in the world.

Transport and Activity in One. Getting to the top of Table Mountain on the cable car is quite cool. It rotates while it is going up, so you are continuously seeing new views and all views as part of the ride.

Busy but try to stand near the windows. The cableway was really busy, it had been closed for several days due to the clouds etc.. check ahead that its open. Well worth the money and it revolves so stand by the windows if you want to take pictures but dont hold on!!

A great walk up the mountain rewarded with a beautiful experince down again. Nothing can beat this experience and the views in all directions with flowering fynbos available to suit all seasons. The restaurants have also been upgraded to cater for the many visitors this being the second most popular destination in SA. Truly a world heritage site.
Cableway. Get there early - the lines get long early and the cable car shuts down in wind and fog. Awesome views, a must.
views are amazing. Don't miss this ride to the top of Table Mountain. Cable car rotates 360 degrees en route to the top so no spot is a bad one. You'll get a great view!
Breathtaking. The entrance to Table Mountain. Staff is very professional, Cable cars go up smoothly, it rotates to give you a 360 view as you go up the mountain.
Nothing beats the view from the top. The view of Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain is outstanding. It would be a shame to visit Cape Town and not take in the Cableway.
very good. the sight is stupendous and turning the cabinovia makes you see to 360 degrees the panorama , it is very stable and salt to a correct speed to make the photos
with Children is it the easiest way. we booked our tickets online and so we didn't have to wait. It was nice especially because the Cableway turns.
what a view from the top. cant fault it. its a must. the views are spectacular if the weather holds up. can be busy so go early and watch the weather.
OK--but pricey. We walked up, but took the cable car down because of the rain--best deal is to do it both ways. The car provides a wonderful view of the city.

Table Mountain. OK - it's only open weather permitting and if you don't live in SA you can't buy tickets on the day (or so our guide told us). If you want to book online and save 10% that's fine. The tickets are valid for 2 weeks IIRC, so don't make my mistake and book for the first day when you know you'll be free and find you can't use the ticket when the mountain is open if it's earlier. I ended up paying twice and am still trying to work out whether I can claim the cost back (R195) as the mountain was closed on the day I had booked. Go really early. The queues build up very quickly. We went soon after 8am and the wait was quite short. Take extra clothes. The temperature is 6deg C lower at the top of the mountain than at the bottom station and it's windy. Don't try to stroke the rock hyrax. They're tame, but not that tame!Is it worth it? Oh, yes. Would I go back? Absolutely - and I'm terrified of heights. (You can hide in the gondola if you're me.)
a must do on your trip to cape town. a fabulous way to see both table mountain and the best views of cape town. a long queue but very organised and it moved quickly, we couldnt fault the service

360 view amazing. We spend new years eve on the mountain, went up 3pm Dec 31 and came down 1 am Jan 1.The view is just amazing. We watched the fireworks at the Waterfront from on top of the mountain, cool. Just take some warm clothes along as it can get cold even in summer.

Best seat in the house!. This is really a must for anyone in Cape Town. It gives you an unparalleled 360 degree view of most of the city and is a great way to enjoy the scenic beauty of this wonderful city. The cable car turns while moving so you don't have to keep moving around to see everything. It's a nice idea to take binoculars also. The queue for tickets is quite long most of the time.

a cablecar with a twist. I didnt realise i was going to rotate as I ascended into the heavens and it was lovely. Take a ride up to the lookout and you will have a lovely day. Finish it off with a "jam jar" down by the waterfront... perfect

Watch out it spins.. As you rise above Capetown you will be delighted as the world opens below you. A word of warning for those scared of heights, the cable car spins around and there is not much to hold on to.

Nice Safe way to get up and down. I have heard people complain about the lines, but we only waited for 30 min or so. Not bad for a 3 minute trip up a mountain. Tickets are relatively cheap - get them online so you don't have to waste time at the station.

Scrum. Best to purchase tickets online. The line was a scrum, people pushing, standing in queue whilst someone else bought the tickets then the ticket holder has to push through the crowd to reach them. U all get on in th ened but it is a long wait and not so friendly.
The ony way is up. A great way to go up Table Mountain at prices that are affordable. Everybody gets a great view thanks to the rotating cable cars.

Costly, but worth it!. The cable cart have become quite expensive in local terms, but the views from up the mountain makes every visit worthwhile. In summer they always ran a 50% discount special if you go up from 18:00 - 22:00, and most people take this option. Ensure it's not windy, and take a light jacket with you; for even on warm days it can be a little cool up there. There is a restaurant for serious eaters, but you can also pack your own stuff and make a small picnic up there.

Great way to get to the top. The cableway had just reopened after two weeks of maintenance, so it was reassuring to know it was in good condition. Unfortunately, that meant the crowds were huge, so we were packed into the cars like sardines so it was difficult to see out. The floor revolves so everyone gets a variety of views [potentially], but a few folks standing on the non-moving center had large backpacks that almost knocked you over everytime you revolved by. As it is either hike up or take the cableway, it is the only choice, so go with it.
If you do not want to climb by foot. Great experience, the inside platform of the car is turning around so do not be disappointed if you didn't get the right view spot after boarding.

On Top of the 7th Wonder of the world. Table Mountain is spectacular in every way. As you arrive in Cape Town, whether by road, sea or air, you will be confronted by the grandeur of this magnificent mountain. Making a journey to the top by cable car is a must if you visit the city. Make sure to check the weather to ensure you do not make the trip to the mountain in vain.
Nice but pricy. Nice! It turns on itself so you can actually see 360 degrees. A little pricy though and the line to hop on is huge !!!

Quick and Smooth. After having travelled on the Singapore cable car the week before, we were a little daunted by what we looked up at when we arrived at Table Mountain! The experience was very different and before we knew it, we were at the top!

Cape Town - Must see Must do. The ride up is quite a thrilling experience.The Cable Car moves upward while at the same time you rotate 360 degrees within the car to get a panaromic view of Cape Town.The view from Table Mountain is great and a visitor should not miss this experience while in Cape Town (Unless the weather plays spoil sport !).Dont miss the dare devils scaling Table Mountain on your way up and remember the 12 Apostiles !

On the must do list.... This is definitely on the "must do" list when visiting Cape Town. The rotating cable car afford everybody an all round view. The views of the city & ocean from are spectacular. There are great walking trail which is an awesome nature escape from the city, yet on it's doorstep. Don't miss this one!

Nice after a long hike. After hiking up the mountain, it was a nice treat to take the cable car down the mountain. Unfortunately, the last car coming back was at 6pm which didn't leave us much time on the top of the mountain. Also, the car was very crowded and it rotated. Normally the rotation wouldn't bother me, but after that hike it made me a little sick.
Great views. A great way to take in possibly the most scenic city in the world. Avoid busy periods though as there will be long queues and not much parking.

Annual Maintenance - be aware. Read several guide books & travel guides on Cape Town - not one of them mentions the fact that the cable car up Table Mountain closes for two weeks EVERY year for maintenance - the last week in July and first week in August. So if you are visiting Cape Town at that time and want to visit the top then you will have to walk! 5.5 hours round trip - still well worth it but hard work!
Mountain transport with 360 view. Loved the 360 rotating of the cabin which brings you in a couple of minutes to the top. You have to do some queing to obtain the tickets but goal serves the means!

Don't miss it!. All as it should be - Immaculately clean, simple ticketing system and good service. The operators of the cableway certainly don't take advantage of the fact that most tourists will use this access to the top of Table Mountain. The rotation of the cable car was an extra bonus we didn't expect.
Great ride and view. Not your average cable car, it revolves for a 360 degree view as you go up. Might be good to walk up (if you're fit enough) and take the cableway down.
Great! A must use on the way up and down. Great! A must use on the way up and down. Make sure you have good weather to maximise the view :)A must see every time1
Exciting. The cableway is a must do while in Table Mountain. It moves very often so you do not need to wait so long. It wasn't expensive as far as I can remember.

Thanks For The Lift. Loved it, saved me walking up and that was worth every Rand! The car rotates so everyone gets a piece of the spectacular view and there is no fighting for "the great spot" when getting in.

More to see than expected. The cablecars are already located from a fairly high vanatage point at the bottom and some good photos can be had at the bottom level. I wondered how much the "little" distance up the cableway would make....But, once at the top of the cables, there is so much more to explore at table mountain. Unreal views. The ride up and down is nice as well as the platform rotates so that everyone can get a good view. Very steep ride and amazing photos were taken. HIghly recommend if you go to South Africa to do this. One note. We had a really warm winter's day the day we went but at the top, it was much cooler and windy. Be prepared for weather changes from top of ride to bottom. Enjoy.

Magnificent view from Table Mountain. Pick a clear day, otherwise you won't be able to see the view of the Western Cape from the mountain. You will ride a slow-rotating cable car to the top. There is a restaurant and snacks available on the top of the mountain. Very windy and chilly the day we went (August). The view was breathtaking. There was a discount offered but it was for South African citizens. You have the option of a one-way ticket. We saw people riding up then walking down. Best to order tickets online and avoid the long que

Highlight of the trip!. It took a few days to find one calm enough to ascend the mountain but it was well worth the perseverance and wait!! I'll never forget it! We went in the late afternoon so that we could still be there for the sunset. Many people had packed a picnic and we wish we had done so as well since the food in the restaurant was steep and the line-ups long . The whole place is breathtking and watching the sun set over the Atlantic was unforgetable! We were ther for hours and only left when it got too cold or maybe it was the last car. Even the we didn't want to leave that magical place. the views of CT were stunning and the shadow cast over the city by the mountain was amazing to see.
NICE. You need to be lucky like we were with the weather. It's a short cable ride but well worth the view. But it does not run on windy days. Certainly easier than walking up the mountain.

Don't miss this despite the cost. While it costs $25 US to go up and down a short cable car ride, this is the only way to get up Table Mountain unless you want to do a very difficult hike (I prefer the cable car myself!). It's not just an incredible view from the top, it's a very zen experience to walk around in the unusual ecosystem of the area. We went first thing in the morning, which I highly recommend if you can do it since we avoided lines for the cable car and also it was not crowded on top. By the time we left, it was much busier and we were there off-season! I can only imagine what it's like there at the height of the tourist season in Cape Town. Although it was cloudy in town, we were way above the clouds once we went up the mountain and it was an incredible view although much of the city was blocked by the fog.

Wow wow wow! A must do!. Truly one of the most memorable experiences in all of my travels! The Cableway is run efficiently with an excellent system and staff, and even though the climb up is terrifying for those of us with a ear of heights, you still feel very secure and become easily distracted by the far reaching views. Needless to say, the views from the top are outstanding. If you only have a day or even a few hours, make sure you make this experience your priority!

Neat!. The cableway is excellent! Very unique - it slowly rotates as you go up towards the mountain peak...which allows everybody on board a chance to see the view from every angle! Also, parts of the car have no glass windows - the are open air - so you don't get glare from the sun or reflections off the glass in your photos!

wonderful facility. Love the cable car and the facility of being able to get up to the top of Table Mountain. Views Stupendous. Awesome facility. Pity the restaurant leaves a lot to be desired though!

Must DO!!!. This was a great experience. I am even afraid of heights and I still loved it. I do recommend that you book your tickets online in advance because the lines looked long. The cable car rotates so no matter what spot you get, you will see stuff.

A great experience. I am not good with heights but decided I would regret it for the rest of my life if I did not take the cableway to the top of Table Mountain. I did not have a moment of nerviousness. It was a great experience.

Creative Birthday Party option at the Summit Lounge. I planned my husband's birthday party with the Eventing Staff and we had a great event. Easy to book the whole grounds tickets online, hand them out at the bottom, meet at the Summit Lounge for sundowners and canapés. Had about 50 people up there, good service, and manager was accommodating from the beginning. An event we will never forget!

One of God's perfect creations. We went there for my hubby's b.day and the weather was cool and cloudy but we nevertheless enjoyed it.This is the first time I have been since the place and the cable cars were upgraded and it was really worth the trouble to visit. Generally everything was clean and one was left to explore on your own.The views especially were breathtaking all-round. My husband liked it so much that he went back the following week with the rest of the family!!

A must see (weather permitting). It is open only 80 days a year, so if it is just drop everything and make the trip. The walks are amazing, the view out of this world and the trip can end at the excellent restraunt for a coffee.
norma. lovely views and my husbaand was 80 so a nice way to celebrate

Great way to get up there. The cable car was fast and the views were great. We got there early in the morning and had gotten the tickets in advance so no queuing.
Dress warmly! It is very windy up there.

Panoramic View. Make sure you take a jacket/hoodie when venturing up Table Mountain, no matter what the weather is like down below. Winds are icy on top, and you can check the table mountain national park website on the day you wish to visit, to avoid disappointment. The website updates frequently telling you if the conditions are favorable enough for the cable way to be open. They can close at any time. Once up there, you can visit a restaurant, or even pack your own picnic basket and take it with (it's allowed) and enjoy the stunning views of the Cape Peninsula.

Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. It takes approximately 4 minutes and 30 seconds to get from the bottom to the top of Table Mountain. The ride is smooth and comfortable. Everyone on board is able to see all views because of the base of the cable car rotates. Staff managing the Cable Car are very friendly and are very safety conscious and are careful. I highly recommend the ride!Marcella Henry

Cable car to the top of the mountain. The weather was perfect on the day we went up on the cable car. The views were tremendous. We had to wait for approximately 1 hour to get on which was not so good.

My American husband felt honoured to be ontop of one of the Seven Wonders of the World. We took the last cable-car up and had dinner ontop, was overcast, but still an experience regardless of the weather. Haven't been up there in more than 30 years, so the revolving cable car is Awesome, give you a 360 degree view of the Mother City
A very pleasant experience. I think the cableway is overpriced. It lessens the experience.
Great experience. It moves around so all visitors get access to all views during the trip. First time I had seen this style of cable car..great.

awesome ride. we went to south africa for our 40th wedding anniversary, and toured this beautiful country, one of the highlights, out of lots more highlights, was the cable ride to yhe top of table mountain in cape town, it is a mixture of sheer fright and sheer excitement. the ride takes only minutes. do keep your eyes open if you can, the views going up are awesome. once you are on the top, you can walk round, there are no fences, so watch children closely,the paths are unmade, so wear flat shoes, high heels are not a good idea girls, not if you want to walk round. the cable car can get closed at very short notice, and if you are up there and the weather closes in, they sound a horn for you to make your way back to the cars.

What a view!!!. Arriving to the base of the mountain, you cannot imagine that a cableway can reach you to the top of the mountain. I was really impressed by the quality of this attraction as well as the security of this. Cableway is wheelchair accesible and takes just a few minutes to bring you at the top where you can eat and walk... or to shop in the small souvenirs boutique. The prize is fair. The only thing it could be improved is about who to reach the base of the mountain. taxi seems the only way to go if you are not with a group. taxis do not wait for clients at the base of the mountain. They have to go down. So if you do not want to have a very bad surprise, this is preferable to ask your taxi driver to return at the base at a time you will decide together. Otherwise, you will have to call for a cab and wait a long to get it.

INCREDIBLE. I last went up the cable cat 20 years ago. this is a new experience. So modern It turns so you have a view of the whole city How clever. It was an amazing experience. Not to be missed. Lots of lovely walks . Wish I had gone up earlier in the day to spend more time walking. Have heard stories of theft so be in a group or take care. Windy.

Cool way to go up the Table. Staff were very friendly. An amazing way to go up the mountain especially if you are lazy like myself. It is very smotth and very fast. An amazing peice of engineering and have huge admiration for those guys who dragged the first cables up there in the early 1900's.
Revolving cable car!. It is great if you are not afraid of heights. My friend had to stand in the middle so she didn't get dizzy. However, the views are great. Make sure you have your camera
Easy but beautiful. Only go if it is a clear day. We had a great day, the revolving cable car up gives a great view of the whole area.
No Better way to get to Table Mountain. A quick and efficient way to get to the top of table mountain. Cheap and it moves quickly. Almost like an amusement park attraction ride.

Airborne. What a magnificent experience to travel with this cable car to the top of Table Mountain - slowly and without really noticing turning so that you have a view on the whole Cape Peninsula and even as far as Du Toitskloof Mountains on a very clear day - the pre-bought tickets takes the pain out of standing in queues - unforgettable experience

Most Stunning View in the World!!. i could spend a entire day on the mountain just taking thousands of pictures and still it would not be enough to enjoy beautiful view!!! perfect for friends, families or couples!!
Cable Car to the Stars. This Cable Car climbs to the Top of Table Mountain. Don't Miss it!
Worth it. The views are amazing going up and down no matter where you are in the cablecar

Amazing Ride. One the best cable rope cars. At a time it can take 60 people to the top and down. Also good thing is that while climbing up and descending the platform of the cable car rotates so u get the 360 degree view while riding the car.

A Must-do in Cape Town. I have lived in Cape town and still get excited every time I go on the cablecar. It takes 4 minutes in each direction, can sometimes be cold at the top so take a sweater and the view is amazing. One should try walking up one of the beautiful paths up the mountain and taking the car one-way down- a cheaper and more beautiful option!

Nice, going one way. I recommend to walk up (about 3 hours) and drive down with the cable car. Check the weather forecast at cable car hotline. Its not going, if its to windy or cloudy. Try to avoid weekends- very full then!
trip up to the mountain. safe and the floor turns while your going up so everyone can see the view,fantastic!!

Quick and Efficient. The aerial cableway is unique in that it circles as it goes up the mountain so everybody can have a view. Would have worked too if a certain individual from a country which lost the War hadn't constantly moved with the platform.

Straight up. The cable car fits about 60 people and rotates around about twice on it's trip straight up the side of the Mountain. The view is deceptive from the ground, but once you hit the face you are moving at a 75 degree angle right up the cliff face. It's an amazing view of Capetown, the cliffs, and Devil's Peak.The cost isn't unreasonable, but be sure to alot yourself plenty of time to wait in line. We visited on the first clear day in 3 days, so we had to wait an hour to go up to the top. The line coming down isn't as bad, but gets worse closer to the closing time.
What a view!. Stunning, amazing views from the top - a must do when in Cape Town!

Up Up & Around & Around!. The cable cars to the top of Cable Mtn. hold 64 people in each so if you're lucky enough to go up on a quiet day you'll be able to take lots of pictures as you ascend. If not, there's plenty to take when you reach the top with some spectacular views all round. There's also a gift shop and cafe. Definitely a "must do'

Friendly staff. The staff were very friendly to us, asking where we came from and even suggesting local places for dinner! The cableway have this rotating ability therefore you are able to see the view 360 degrees. $$$ very spent!!

UP UP and Away !. Yes ..you can walk to the top pf Table Mountain...however, the best way is the Aerial Cableway which not only whisks you up but the floor rotates..so EVERYBODY gets the best camera views...Cool !

This is the way to go!. We were lucky and got right onto a tram going up the mountain. There are usually long lines, but our timing was perfect.The viw onh the way up and down is worth the price of the ticket
Cable Way. Panoramic view of Cape Town-whats not to like?And to listen to the awe of fellow tourists, very inspiring.

a must if you are in Cape Town. great once you are on top but we had to queue for over an hour to buy a ticket and then another 1/2 hour to go in the cable car, and although things were reasonably well organised, it was hot and could have been avoided; buy your tickets on the internet beforehand, well worth it!
more than 360°. On this cable car you do not need to fight for the nice view. During its trip it turns and you see all. Buy your ticket before on the internet to avoid at least part of the long cue.
super convenient. the most hassle free way to get to the top of table mountain, specially if you book online.( there is a saving as well on online tickets)
Awesome experience. The view from Table Mountain will take your breath away. A must see!!
Greta revolving platform. Super efficient service , friendly helpful staff and awaesome views make this a must have experience

Experience of a lifetime!!. Most comfortable ascent of a majestic mountain! Unequalled panoramic view that you will never forget. From the top of the mountain you can see forever! Have yet to meet the person who was not enchanted by this experience. The beauty of it all filled my heart with a song of joy!
Nice ride. The ride is great but do not need to buy the picture which is sold when you come back down the table mountain. It is not that worth.

Steep!. This is a much more fun way to get to the top of Table Mountain than walking!!! Make sure you have a good day. The views are simply spectacular and the ride up and down is great fun in a cable car which rotates so everyone gets the view.
A little pricey, but a good alternative to hiking. Fits up to 60+ people and the floor rotates. Definitely a bit scary if you don't like heights, but the views are gorgeous.
must do. I hiked up and it was tougher then I expected, cable car on the way down was nice.
Awesome. A must.....unless you want to walk to the top !!! The floor of the cablecar rotates 360 degrees giving everyone the opportunity to see the views which take your breath away
Super Fun Way to View Capetown. This was a lovely way to see an amazing view. Might be scary for those with a fear of heights; it felt safe for me and thrilling!

don't look down. The cable car is very safe, but frightening for someone who does not like heights. I found that by staring into the operator's eyes all the way up, I could distract myself. Be sure and check out the pictures at the end of ride. Photos are taken with a green backdrop when you enter the car, and then superimposed over a variety of scenes. Great souvenir!
Worth every penny!. It looks expensive but once you're on top it's a big area to discover.

Quite scary. Prob not the best choice with a hangover when you're scared of heights. Prob would never do it again but there was no chance I was walking up table mountain. A little unsure why the car spins around as it seems slightly pointless

This is a must with kids!. Kids are so in awe of this fast Cable-car. It is considered as one of the musts everytime we go to the Cape. Take a warm pulli, and good shoes if you want to venture a little.
Cable way. Execellent. It has some stunning views. The staff that operate it are so friendly and welcoming.Well Done guys

Breathtaking. Breathtaking views of the entire Cape Peninsula await those who take the cable car and it has to be a must for visitors to Cape Town. The cable car spins at it ascends / descends, so you'll get a view at some point if you're on the outside.Once at the top, you will have the opportunity to walk around at the top of the mountain, as well as visit the cafe and shop. The food and service at the top was disappointing, but don't let it detract from what should be a wonderful experience.Things to beware of:1. The wind can pick up quite quickly - check the daily forecast.2. It can be quite cold up there, so pack appropriately.3. Although it is Table Mountain, it's not 100% level, so for those who are not so nimble, or those travelling with prams / wheelchairs, you can still visit, but your ability to roam at the top will be curtailed.

Good Transportation but Closed too Early. This was a good value to get to the top of Table Mtn but it was very rushed to catch the last ride down and I had to skip the very end of the sunset or I would have had to hike back down.

Perfect weather for a ride up to the N7WN *-*. The view from the top is hard to explain one have to go up to expierence it for oneself...Unbelievable..!!Friendly & highly knowledgable staff operating the cable car..Smooth ride up and down extremely safe & secure...!!Restaurants, kiosks, all world class, interesting souvenirs!Staff very friendly and helpfull.Fauna and flora only found on this mountain...A must see for anyone visiting Cape Town whether from any local Province or from any country abroad.The ablution facilities are being upgraded but is been replace by very neat and well kept temporary units in very hygienic conditions.

The best views but not for the feint hearted!. What an experience. I have been up in this amazing technological experience on a few occasions but it never gets boring.No need to scramble for the best view as the cars revolve slowly. Astonishing views!
fun. after hiking up the mountain it was a nice option to go down. they are big, solid and they rotate which is great as you get to see the scenary all around
A Must Do. You have to do this in Cape Town. It gives the best view, and moving up the steep mountain on the cable car is great fun.

Wow...up, up and away. The Table Mountain Cableway is a "must see" in Cape Town but be prepared for cool or cold temperatures. It. S beautiful sunny and cool at the bottom but windy and real cold at the top. The revolving floor in the car allows everyone to have a " perfect" place for viewing.

Something not to be missed. The views from the top on a sunny day are outstanding. Once you get to the top you can walk for quite a long way and see the wonderful scenery in all directions. You need sensible shoes for this - we saw people up there in high heels! It was also very cold on the day that we went even though it was hot down at the bottom of the mountain so go prepared. The cold wind that day meant we didn't see a single dassie!We had quite a long wait in the queue to get into the cable car but you can buy tickets in advance. The downside of buying in advance is not knowing what the weather will be like - the cable cars do not run if it is too windy and if it is cloudy at the top you won't see much. You are a bit squashed into the cable cars if it is busy but it doesn't take very long to get to the top.

Cableway. Unusual system as I was not aware that the inner cabin moved round while the outside remained static - gave everyone a chance to had a 360degree view. Those affraid of heights, stay to the centre of the cable car

Wonderful experience. Travel up in the revolving cable car at sunset and see the most amazing sunset with views over the Atlantic ocean and the city bowl. Absolutely stunning to see the lights of Cape Town and suburbs slowly coming on as the sky darkens. It is really an amazing romantic experience never to be forgotten.
