An Absolute Must When Visiting cape Town. A fantastic experience awaits you when you take the cable car to the summit of Table mountain. The views are breathe taking and the walks on the mountain give spectacular views to all areas around Cape Town. The Cafe is also a nice place for a refreshment and reasonably priced. How this place has not be added to an extra wonder of the world amazes me.
Great must visit!!. You really gotta visit the famous mountain! Hike up in nice weather and enjoy nature and the ever changing views! very well signposted and not dangerous!
360 degree view.. Cable car floor rotates 360 degrees while assending and desending. Gives you great view of the city of Cape Town.
Wow..... Need a good heart. You can close your eyes if you don't, but you miss out on all the fun...
wow. ride up was great! it rotates and gives you the chance to see all around...
360 degree view. THis is a great way to design a tram. It rotates so that everyone gets all views. Since part is open-air as you rotate through, it really gives you an idea of the height.

Easy trip. The views are breath taking, would have loved to walk up but were on limited time.
A must see if you view Cape Town.

Great views. The weather plays apart in the cable car running book an open ticket on line and pick your day, the views are worth the queue. The cable car rotates, 360 degrees so photos are a possibility. Again check the weather if it's windy they won't go
Nice short ride and great long walk. Great view from the top and nice hikes on top and back down the mountain.

Fabulous!. The table mountain aerial cableway has a rotating floor which allows for a 360 degree view while you go up the mountain. Fantastic views of Cape Town, Table Mountain, Lion's head and the sea from the cable car.
Stunning views. The views from the top of Table Mountain are breathtaking and are a definate must see if you visit this beautiful city.

A birds-eye view..... It was an interesting way to see the city from above (but take a jacket - it gets pretty cool up there!! Im think most revenue comes from the gift shop selling polar fleeces as you get off the cable car!)The car itself slowly spins 360 degrees so you get to see everything from all sides - even the mad people climbing up the sides of the mountain - in the cold...and wind...mad.....Once again, its a tourist attraction. It is what it is, including the corny green-screen pics they take and superinpose over a scene of the cable car then try to sell them to you as you leave.It's the best way to get up there and the view is worth every cent!
Wow. Get near the window and let the camera roll. Its a spectacular trip up and down.
Long queues and missing the 'real experience'. Good for the elderly and people with babies and toddlers.
EXpensive. At $30 round trip, this is quite steeply proced. The hallmark is that teh floor of the cable car rotates 360 degrees and that makes the views alla round a bit more interesting.
EXELENT. Fantastic !!!! it's impossible to came to Cape Town and not experience the cable car to go to the top of one of the new worls wonders. higly recomended.

Expensive, potentially long waits and crowded.. I imagine it all depends on the time of year and time of day. Go early in the morning to get first place in the line and book online as this ensures you can skip at least one long queue.Be prepared to sell the farm if you have a large family as it is not cheap and it gets even more expensive on the mountain.The cable car is known for occasional maintenance issues and in high season you will be jammed in with plenty of people.View is fantastic.
Fun :). There a amazing view from the top of Table Mountain. You are able to see Cape Town in a different angle.This is a must do when going to Cape Town
Nice view, not crowded. I liked the 360 rotation. Otherwise a standard cableway ride but the views were great.

a modern and efficient way of getting to a very special place. the cableway is modern, efficient, fast, well organised. The rotating floor (1.25 turns during the ascent and the same during the descent) ensures that everybody can enjoy the view over the bay and the city - and the sheer rocks over you as well
Brilliant. Cableway is great, just keep checking the weather but as soon as it opens make sure to go for it.

Top of the Bay. Cape Town bay is in my opinion, alongside with Sydney's Naples and Rio de Janeiro's, on the most beautiful places in the world. The Cape of good hope peninsula on the back remembers you that you are close to the end of the world and robben island at its center is a natural monument to one of the greatest men ever and all those he represents....just make sure you don't make our mistake.....we raised in a fair cloudy day and we had just enough time to give a look around when a cloud covered the table mountain top, decreasing the temperature by more than 10 degrees.........
Efficient and safe - its whats coming here is all about. Cable cars are pretty frequent and the neat thing is the floor slowly rotates so everyone can get a good view both up and down.
Rotating is Best. Far better than the previous cable car and great views
Easy. We booked on www and saved time and money. lovely safe journey up/down spoilt by noisey people from China

Easy. We pre-bought tickets but in fact it was so well set up that we needn't have bothered. Easy in every way with incredible views and the rotating floor meant even the children got to see everything!
Incredible value for money. The floor revolves on the way up so everyone gets the pristine views!

Best way to get to the top with family and small children. Fantastic and fast access while you go through the long line... better to go on week days and early but if all you have is the weekend do not wait to the end of the day cause chances are you will not make it on time or you will have to wait hours to get in. Hike to the mountain is perfect but not recommended for small children

Great views - allow enough time and book online before you go. We drove to the mountain and parked a little way down from the entrance (there was the usual park attendant that you 'tip' on getting back to your car). The one thing not mentioned in any of the guide books was that pre booking your ticket online will save you time! Having said that, we arrived without a ticket and the queue was about an hour, despite the heat there are covered walkways to wait under and later in the day when we came down they had misters over the people waiting. There is also a couple of places to buy soda, water and ice cream while you are waiting.The cable car ride is disappointingly short but with the 360 degree roatation it works really well as everyone gets to see the great views. The information on the history of the cars is also interesting.Obviously the biggest draw is the views from the top - and they are spectatcular! The sides facing the city are definately more crowded and the inevitable cafe/shop had a lot of people outside them. Allow enough time to really spend time walking the very well laid out paths and walkways at the top. We only spent an hour or so up there and we could have easily spent more.Can definately see why this is such a great draw for locals and visitors alike.
WoW!!!. Experience history, great ride to the top and the tech details was something to remember
great views. cable car was clean & very quiet. The car rotates so that everyone gets a good view
Great view. It was nice that the car rotated so that everyone had a good view during the trip. Smooth ride.

An unbelievable experience. 360 degree view of Cape Town. A must for everyone.. Locals would also enjoy the walks as well as the sensational views of our city, surrounding mountains and beaches as well as Robben Island.

Crowded, touristy, expensive - but what a view!. It's one of these things that probably very few locals ever do - because of the crowd of tourist, and very expensive tickets, compared to other prices in CT. But if you are there for just a few days, and want to soak up as much as you can, you won't regret going - the views, indeed, are magnificent. I don't quite understand why they close so early that you can't see the magnificent sunset from the top but try to go as late as you can, for the golden light of the afternoon.If the visibility is poor, don't bother though - there's just nothing there to do if you can't see for miles.

Rotating Cablecar. gives everyone an opportunity to see the place unlike other cable cars in which if you don't get a good location you are stuck. It operates all year except when wind conditions are not permitting - which is something that happens often. So better get tickets only after checking the weather !
Very efficient. Even though plenty people, the cueing who looked bad actually went fast.

Wow -- what a view!. For us the trip down on the tram was the reward for having hiked to the top, and although it was over really quickly it was definitely worth the trip. This tram revolves around, so that no one is stuck at the back or gets to hog the front. Very clever! Nice ride -- a great experience.
So high. Amazing, the feat of engineering . Great view, but the view over Capetown is good without going up on the cablecar.

Easy way to travel. Ideal way of getting up Table Mountain. Cableway rotates so taht you can see all directions, and does not cause those with fear of heights any worries. Very regular so no issues queing!

Breathtaking. As you see the city drop away below you and look out over Table bay towards Saldanha, you slowly rotate and see the suburbs and then you see the sheer face of table mountain, what a sight
Interesting and surprising. The cablecar turns you around 360 degree , so you do not need to try to rush in to get a good place- everybody will get a great view
A floating bubble. Excelent service, similar to the one in Murren, Switzerland. a marvelous trip up and down with no column support in between!
brilliant. the rotating deck ensures a 360 degree view as you ascend
A good trip. This is a brill cable car as it rotates and gives all a view
Cableway. Just go there when the weather is good, because it can change any moment
Crowded. Its worth doing but get there early or hike up then take the car down its a lot less crowded coming down. Buy your tickets online before.

Cable car. Amazing view up the head, make sure your camera got space to take photos and videos.ahh, make sure to check with your tour guide or hotel the status of the cable car, as it depends on the weather if it'll operate or not, so check instead of wasting the time as it's a long way drive.You can either rent a car with a GPS to go there, or take a micro-bus, or the red cape town bus to go there.
Experience of a life time. It was so exciting climbing the mountain and then being able to watch as other cable cars came to the top. Disappointed we had to queue for so long to get on it.

Great views. We picked a clear day and arrived around 930am for our trip to the top of Table Mountain, having read that it can be very busy. Be careful of the parking as we only found parking on the road side which meant a long walk could be had. I was lucky to find a spot just vacated aboutt 200m down from the entrance and was able to park and return just as the family had purchased tickets. We were pleasantly surprised with the wait as we only waited for one cable ride before it was our turn to spin up the hill and enjoy the fantastic views at the top. Waiting time I think can be the killer here as I spoke to some locals who said they have been able to walk up at times quicker than visiting friends who took the cable car.The visit to the top is well worth it with comfortable walks providing dramatic 360* views.
Cable Ride. Very quick and smooth with rotating floor provides everyone with 360 degree view on way up and down. Fabulous views but expect a wait if several buses there.

Breath taking experience. Table Mountain was a must see on our adventure. It was a must do on our adventure. We went to the top even though warned that there was zero visibility. This was not true, the views were spectacular. The cost to ride the cableway was high and there were no discounts for students unless one has the proper coding on their papers, i.e. only for citizens of South Africa.

Must've picked a bad day. It is such an amazing experience but we must have picked a bad day because the queues were insane. We waited 20minutes for the shuttle to take us to the top as the parking marshals said we couldn't park closer. We waited almost two hours to buy tickets and then had to wait another hour to get onto the cable car. It's the most breathtaking 4 minute ride but I am not sure it was worth 3 and a half hours of my time and getting hot and bothered. Getting off the top was also an issue because we had to wait in line for another 20min odd to get back on the cable car. Then off course wait for the shuttle to take us back to the bottom. TIP: Do not go there on the holidays (it was the day before Good Friday); buy your tickets ONLINE!!!!
Top of the world.. This is a must if weather permits. A view that is out of this world. Don't miss it.
Multi axis ride with great views. The floor spins as you ride up to make it easy to take in the views of Cape Town from all vantage points without moving
Gotta do it. Weather permitting, of course. Quick trip to the top. Great if you can actually pass people hiking up the face. Eek! Views for days!
Table Mountain excursion. Amazing view and well organised. Opportunity for a really good restaurant
great fun. well worth the trip for the view and the exciting cable car ride
Fantastic view. We had to queue for over a hour to get our tickets so recommend booking on-line. The cable car floor rotates so everyone get a chance to see the views.
Awesome views. The trip up is not for the fainthearted. The views are spectacular. If you can take a picnic basket and spend a whole morning or afternoon the trip will be worth much more to you.

Great Experience. Hundreds of people pass though and it isn't a problem. The staff are very well organized and we moved through the ticket line quickly and before we knew it we were on the cable car. The floor in the car rotates, so everyone gets a chance to observe the views through the area where it is open (no glass). It was not scary at all.

Spectacular. I loved the ride, but OMG, if you are scared of heights this will keep your heart in your mouth all the way up...especially as you get near the top. Apart from that the views are simply STUNNING.:-)

better than walking. The cable car was an efficient, fast and easy way to get to the top of Table Mountain - plus the views from the car were excellent! This was better than walking to the top, especially since there are trails atop the mountain for the outdoor enthusiast. However, should you choose to spend the 2-3 hours hiking up the mountain, you must not miss taking the cable car ride down - for the complete experience!
A super lift to the top!. This is a quick way to the top of the mountain and everyone gets a good view both ascending and descending as the floor of the car rotates.
Check the website for weather conditions before you go.... High winds will close the cableway, so check before you go!

Amazing view on a clear day. Got to the cableway at 8:30 on a clear, windless day. No queues and went straight up to the top of the mountain to do some of the short walks at the top and stayed for 2.5hours eventually enjoyed a mid morning snack in the restaurant at the top.

Brilliant. We went during the local school holidays and it was very busy. However it is extremely organised and when the queues are long there are places you can buy water and ice cream etc. The cable way its self is amazing. Very fast getting to the top and the floor rotates once when you are on it so everyone can get a 360 view on the way up and down
Fantastic views!. And the cable car rotates around itself, so you get a chock when the floor starts moving under your feet! :)

A great ride. This is a terrific cable-car experience. It is extremely quick and the cars rotate so as you go up or come down you get a lovely all-round view. Very efficient service, no hanging around.
Great Views. Unless you are anxious for a long walk (which would be nice, I'm sure, but we hadn't the time nor the energy), the cable car is great. Breathtaking views up the steep incline.
Cable Mountain cable car. Operates frequently and well, and has rotating floor so all occupants can view both mountain and harbor.

Cablecar. The likes are it is fast, but being scared of heights, i was alarmed to find out the floor of the cable car rotates as you go up and come back down, but even saying that, the view on top is worth it

great :). Taking Cable Car and walking on Table mountain is a beautiful experience.I walked up all the way and went down by the cable car.But, if I've lived in Cape Town ,I would've bought a year ticket. It;s 500R . One ticket one way is 100R. So, u can see the difference. If you have the year ticket you could go at least once a week up to watch the sunset and enjoy the cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate ... It's amazing up there. It's worthy each Rand :)
Don't look down..... We had a very short wait, good quick journey to the top, but cheap it was not. US$50 for a couple seems kinda steep!....

Quick route to the top. For those of you with a little less time on your hands or no inclination to hike up the mountain, this is a great way to go up Table Mountain. The body of the car spins 360 degrees on the way up giving you a panoramic view of the trip up to the top. Recommended

Expensive But Essential!. All these people that keep telling us that they have walked to the top just don't know what they are missing!!A few minutes and you are there; our sort of journey!! It is getting expensive so not keen to go up each year we come but now and again is fine. Very cold at the top this time; last time it was blisteringly hot and the time before that we could barely see the hand in front of our face - an every changing environment. If told to take a coat - do so!!!!
Ride to the Top. Definitely would recommend taking the cableway to the top of the mountain. If you purchase the tickets online in advance you can receive a reduced cost.
Superb Trip. If you ever visit Cape Town you have to take visit up to table mountain.......it's tremendous.
This should be your first outing in Cape Town.. Great scenery. Interesting vegetation. Spectacular overviews of Cape Town and environs.

not worth it. waited long time in a baking sun to get on one , when finaly get in together with seem to be a couple hunded ( judguing by the noise) chinesse tourists , fast trip up the mountin -when you up there the views are not better of what you see from the starting point and to make a photo - forget it -too many people in the way. Save you money!!

Loved this!. We were super excited about Table Mountain and although we considered walking up the Cable car looked just like too much damn fun.I advise you buy your tickets online first and print them off to avoid the queue's up there (which can get crazy long)The cable car rotates so do'nt worry about clambering to get a spot at the front - but make sure you get next to the window.

Fun and rounding. You will like this experience.. but you might smell the people around especialy if it is hot in this day..Enjoy it till the extream and where ever you stand .. do not worry.. You will be able to pick your pictures.. but do it fast because it is taking 360 degrees round trip while you are there

Very disable friendly. There are some disabled parking bays near the entrance so you don't need to park miles away (as most cars have to do). There is a lift up to the cableway and plenty of room for buggy's and wheelchairs. The cableway revolves as it goes up so there are great views over Cape Town and the mountains. A must for every visitor to Cape Town
Cable Car. Great views! Get a taxi from Cape Town city centre for about £7
Good view all round. The cable car turns on the inside as it travels but from the outside it appears to be static. great views as it travels and certainly beats walking
The ride is great. Not cheap but worth the splurge for the ride and the view. Go early if you can to avoid the lines and the heat. Book online tickets to save standing in line.
Breathtaking. A breathtaking ride with dizzying heights - fantastic.
A revolving platform with views. Well managed system of getting travellers up and down the mountain. The operator in each "bubble" is full of information and very safety conscious
Efficient. You did not have to wait long and the turning motion gave you an opportunity to see the views from every angle
wonderful!. Updated car turns to 365 degrees! Go early if you can on a sunny day and pack your sunscreen and hat!
Fast way up. my husband and i usually like to walk/climb, but it was such a cool experience by the cableway. You get the 360 view of the city as you assend.
Great Views. Don't worry too much about where you're standing because the floor of the cablecar rotates so everyone gets a 360 degree view. Wonderful pictures from the cableway!
Stunning views over the mother city.. This trip is well worths it as it provides stunning views over the city and the Atlantic beaches.
One of the places to visit before you die.... Simply fantastic. I recommend going up in the afternoon so you can see the sunset. It's a religious experience.
Trust that the cables hold!. Loved it, fast ascent/descent so didn't have to worry about my vertigo. Very expensive but if you get the tickets online it saves a 15-20 minute queue.

Quick, efficient and a great way to get to the best view in CT!. We walked up and got the cable car down because we were under some time pressure. This worked well but it was more expensive than I was expecting. It cost R100 each, which with the current exchange rate is around £9 each. You can save by booking online in advance though.

Good. As I saw there are only 2 cars, one is coming up and the other is going up, but it can accommodate lots of people. The floor is rotating when you are up, so you will have all the views. It's very fast actually, few minutes and you are up (or down).
table mountain. cannot visit Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. Well I only managed to visit Table Mountain on my 3rd visit to Cape Town--it was clear and the views were very good.
Table Mountain Cableway. Very comfortable and informative. Beautiful scenery

Hike up instead!. We hiked up the gorge. It was strenous but rewarding. I would encourage this if you have the physical ability. Bring a hat, water and sunscreen. It took 2.5 hours to hike up. We took the cableway down (buy your ticket at the giftshop on top) and it took 5 minutes. We definately saw and experienced the mountain more by hiking.
Cable car bigger than they look. Very good service, car turns around inside so everyone get a view
Very good views of city coming down. Make sure you go on a clear day in morning - windy afternoons the cable cars stop operating

don't visit there while the weather is foggy. quite expensive actually. and i found the most beautiful place to see table mountain is somewhere north west of this mountain. taking the cable car to the top of this mountain is only for those people who wants to see the city from a top view!
A MUST!!. The wonderful views of the beatiful city and the sea after the breathtaking ride on the cable way!
Brilliant, just make sure you like heights!. Make sure you book online, you get a discount and it saves a lot of time when you arrive
awesome view of cape town. awesome view of cape town on the way up and down and when you are at the top of the rock..
Book Ahead. Book online, get discount, skip the queue (we did same for the Open top Bus) it worked out great
Great views. Pricey, but overall good value for unique (in my experience) rotating cablecar

A brilliant ride. We arrived on a cruise ship at the V & A Waterfront on a beautiful clear Monday morning and the first thing we did after leaving the ship was to take a taxi to the Lower Cable Station where we were lucky to only queue for about thirty minutes. It cost us 180 rand each for the return journey in the large, modern blue and yellow gondola. The slowly revolving floor meant we had 360 degree views and one window was open which made for better photos. The views from the gondola and also from the top of Table Mountain were awesome on such a clear day. We spent about an hour and a half at the top walking on the flat footpaths. Saw lots of wild flowers and birds and quite a few little rock hyrax. There were stunning views on all sides. After taking the cableway down we found lots of taxis and took one back to the Waterfront. The return taxi was a lot cheaper so it is worth trying to find out in advance how much the taxi fare should be.
excellent tourist site. well managed, new cable cars, everything runs with ease. The views from the top are just that! BRILLIANT!
Cable car ride. Brilliant views of the city. The kids enjoyed it very much
The floor rotates!. Once the tram takes off, the floor rotates so everyone gets a 360 degree view, thus avoiding the irritation of having people push and shove to get to the window for a view.

Sunny windy day on Table Mountain. Stepped into cable car as it rotated and climbed to the top of Table Mountain. Marvellous views if a little unnerving as you weren't allowed to hold onto the bars around the sides. Worth the experience just to go up and down!!

The only way..if your not a fitness addict. We pre-booked tickets from our guest house, and went at 10am hoping to avoid lengthy queuing. However, the pre-booked line was longer than that at the ticket office and no priority, save R20 but otherwise pointless ! Expensive captive photoshoot as you get to the gate layered onto Table Mtn backgrounds (but you don't have to buy on the way out if your mugshot is not so appealing). So after waiting nearly an hour we finally got on board despite some very pushy oriental tourists. Capacity on good days does come under pressure but unless you are fit enough or reckless enough, you don't want to climb the track.However, the ride was great .. the rotating shell of the gondola moved the open windows away from said pushy tourists to give a great photo opportunity. The staff are well-organised and helpfulQuite expensive at R175 return online (R195)but you can't miss doing it. It is Cape Town !

Now I've been there!. Our Ilios travel guide, Ashraf, was wonderful on the entire Cape Tour. The main thing on the cable car - nice to ride up and walk down. Great view of the southern Cape. Beautifully maintained.
Worth the money especially if you don't want to walk. Its not a long journey up but the cable car floor rotates so everyone gets a great view....make sure you stand by the window!
Unless you are going to hike it's the only way to the top. Cool way to travel up (a rotating cableway - not something those who ski would have experienced)

The quick way up. great experience. worth every cent. cheaper if you have a Wild Card or go after 6pm during their annual 'sunset special' promotions. Annual passes now also available from the gift shop (next to lower cableway station, closes 6pm).
Take the cable car!. Awesome view, professional service and a safe ride - what more could you ask for!
Loved the spinning Cable Car!. As you ascend/descend, the robust (Swiss Made) cable car slowly spins which affords travellers with 360 views which are spectacular - a must NOT miss attraction!
Amazing ascent. Cleverly the cabin floor rotates so that everyone gets a view of each vista on the way up

Nice. It’s was wonderful experience of freedom and inexplicable fun. The view was one of the spectacular highlights and the staff is very caring and helpful. They are really keen on answering ones questions and you really feel welcome and safe. Which I have to admit is very important when travelling so high above the ground. The souvenir shop at the top had an adequate size and some lovely gifts to remember the journey in the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Everything is maintained properly so there were no complications at all. On top of that I was very pleased to see that this ride is wheelchair friendly as well as some parts at the top. Though one should always be careful – it is a proper mountain after all! Nevertheless was this one of the finest experiences I ever made.

The best way to get to the top of Table Mountain. A short 10 min walk from ou car parked on the approach road a further 15 min queue, and then in no time it transports you up to the top climbing nearly 1000m in just a few minutes. Scary rotating floor and jaw dropping views as you ascend. An absolute must do or you could walk up - I know which I prefer!!!
A must do!. Great way to view table mountain. Stunning backdrops. Make sure you are first in line to catch the window views!

Amazing views. Once in a lifetime opportunity for most so take advantage of it! The cableway is a very quick ride and I definitely enjoyed the revolving car to get pictures from every angle. Well worth the price paid. We even took a person with a fear of heights in the car and he did just fine.

Essential!. Book online to avoid the queues and check its open before going as its often closed due to high winds. Provides stunning views of the city and the coast line, perfect! Wrap up warm though as its chilly at the top!
Awesome view. The Cable-car ride to the Table-Mountain top provides a super all-round view - don't miss the experience!
The greatest!. This has to be the #1 cable car ride on the planet!
Efficient but a little expensive. You have to do this trip, the views from the top are outstanding
What a view. The view is spectacular and the experience of the cable car and walking around at the summit is fab.

Amazing service!!. Excellent service! The hosts treat customers/tourists with respect. This is amazing to see (as a South African myself) that South Africans are improving their service standards towards their fellow countrymen.
I would do another cable ride the next time I visit Cape Town again!!
Smooth cable car. personally I'd have prefered to hike down the mountain, but that wasn't an option. However the cable car is a smooth, quick ride up and down the mountain.
only way to the top. Cost is kind of high but once on top you will realize the value! Well run operation and the ride up and down is a site to see
Great Ride. Car turns as you ascend and descend - spectacular -if the weather is right.
Great journey. Staff very helpful and the cableway seems impeccably maintained at all times, so no fears there !
Smoothly organised cable car trip. Definately worth booking on line ahead of time to avoid one of the queues.

Couldn't have seen Table Mtn w/o it!. Made seeing the mountain top view possible for a group with a physically limited member. We had to call and check a each morning for cableway openings as it frequently shuts down due to high winds, so advise to check before building into your daily itinerary. It offered great informational stations uptop along with wonderful viewing stations. It is possible to spend as little at 15 min to over an hour up top, so very diverse. You can also rock climb down or even hike.

Great views of CT. The whole experience is very efficient and professional. You can get to the bottom of the cable car by the red bus. Make it around 1pm to avoid crowds. 1 car takes 65 people and has a rotating floor so everybody gets the view. The ride takes aprox.10 min and its not too scary for those afraid of heights. On top there is a restaurant and a souvenir shop. Walking paths are well marked and you get the splendid views of CT.
"Awesome". It was awesome and the cable car carried aleast 40 people inside and the platform was rotating giving each person different view.
Wow. Was rather confused when it started turning but everyone gets to see the view so good idea
Good service. cable cars were fast and efficient. even though we were with a large group we were not rushed or cramped in one car

After the queues, views were good. Made the mistake of going up on a bit of a cloudy day but may have kept queues down. Took ages to park the car and walk back to the centre. The queue for the tickets was quite short but then it was the wait to enter the building. Up a series of steps and about 4 people wide. Even once inside we queued to be the next up the cablecar.Once inside the car it is quite good - floor turns so everyone has a view. Great views going up - takes 4 minutes and only two operating.Once on top there is a shop and a takeaway.eat in cafe. The wind on an exposed side was freezing but 24 degrees in the windbreak.No view from the top so we joined a smaller queue for the trip down.Not sure how it would be on a clear day.

Great Experience. I enjoyed the ride up and down the mountain. The cable way moves around so although it is packed inside you still get to see everything on you way up and down. I strongly suggest one pre books tickets on line so as to avoid the very long queue.The cableway closes if it is to windy or there is cloud on the mountain. There is a phone number one can phone to check if it is opperating, so I would suggest using that service just to make sure it will be working when you want to go.
nice trip up. This is the safest and shortest way to the top of the Table mountain. Since the car is rotating 360 degrees, be ready to take some photos and having a great view of the city.
Great View. The best view in the world, try go up early in the morning, then have lunch. You can't go wrong.

Spectacular views with a bonus at the top. Getting up or down Table Mountain is quick and easy with the cable car, but you do need to watch the weather. Weather reports and operating times are available on the website or by calling the cableway. I always hike up - mostly Platteklip Gorge or India Venster - and then take the cable car down. The last car down in summer is after sunset and beautiful views are guaranteed. Don't hold onto the sides - the floor rotates. It can get windy (including gale force winds) and cold, even it's warm at the base of the mountain. It's well worth spending a few hours at the top including a hike to Maclear's Beacon for views all the way to Simon's Town and Cape Point.
Wonderful sunsets. Really a great experience to go up. Lovely little coffee shop on the top. Lovely views.

The easiest and safest way to visit this iconic landmark. Even on a busy day, the queues move fast, so don't be deterred by all the cars parked along the approach road. The ride to the top gives one a close-up look at the spectacular rockface and at some of the intrepid hikers down below. Once at the top, the 360 degree views will take your breath away.One word of caution, though: it is weather-dependant and the Cape weather can be unpredictable. So hold thumbs for favourable conditions when you visit. It is simply unmissable. (I should know -- I live at the foot of this landmark!)

Great views, and saves walking both ways!. The cableway gives you great views down over the harbour. We walked up in time for the spectacular sunset, and took the cableway down - leaving just before the rush as I suspect we weren't the only ones planning to go down that evening.

Breathtaking views. Buy your tickets on line or go on an organiised tour so you don't have to stand in a queue to buy tickets. Don't let go of the handrail in the cable car until it has started moving. (they ask you to as the floor rotates, but the car starts with a jerk. Let go after it has started). Take your own picnic lunch, service in the restaurant is poor. Listen to instructions and you will enjoy your trip immensely

Easy access to the summit. The journey took about 3 to 5 minutes to the top.One of the cars does a 360 degree turn on both ways to give all the passengers a complete look at all vistas.Their web site will give you weather conditions at the top and advise you if the cablecar is open.
Spinning to the Top. A huge cable car spinning as it ascends giving amazing views of Table Bay and Robben island. Also the new Football stadium built for the 2010 World Cup
A "Must Do". Going to Cape Town and not traversing on the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway, is like going to New York and not going to the top of the Empire State Building. A Must Do.
Great Views. Felt very eerie as it was climbing higher. The floor also rotates so that everyone gets a good view.
Loved it!. Wonderful view and breathtaking trip up. Crowds handled efficiently, easily accessed by Hop On Hop Off Bus
wonderful views. short ride and not for the height conscious but worth it for the amazing views.
Awesome cable car ride. The cable car ride is wonderful. If I had more time I would have hiked down. Plan for a full day.
Soooo much fun. I love going up TM and especially since after 6pm the price is half. the views up there are unbeatable and it is a world wonder !

well managed and maintained. go in the morning as the mountain either clouds over in the afternoon or it gets too windy. We were in line about 10 minutes at a busy time of the morning, the flow is efficient and most of the time there is shade from the sun.

Hope that the Lady will allow you to ascend. The Cableway is a secure way to the top of the foremost viewpoint in Cape Town. GET YOUR TICKETS ONLINE and avoid the long queues. The Mountain is very temperamental and viewing conditions can change from excellent to poor in the time that you are caught up in a line.

AWESOME VIEWS. Ican't talk about the price or value since it was included in our package, but can I talk about the views - WOW!! Mother Nature is very particular, when it comes to the Mtn, so beware of bad weather. We were schedule to go up on Sat, but "the table cloth was on the table", meaning the top was covered in clouds, so are trip was cancelled. Our Driver, Graham, came back on Sunday and talked to the people at the lower station and we were allowed to use our ticket from Saturday on Sunday. Going up we were packed in like sardines, but the view made up for it and then some. the entire cablecar rotates very slowly, so there is no "bad" view. If you get in and stand on the middle, I don;t that section rotated, but you were standing on a little step, so you could lokk over people. Once on top, wander around and go crazy taking pictures, just like everyone else. It's like nothing else I've ever seen, simply awesome.
360* degree views whilst reaching the top!. Smooth ride to the top with plenty to keep you occupied on the way up

Cable Car. The cable is a great way to get up Table Mountain if you are not up to climbing. Alternatively climb up and use the car down. The views are fantastic. Note that the temperature on top of the mountain can differ a lot from the city. Take a warm top even on a hot day. If climbing take water and protective clothing as the weather can chnage quickly.

thrilling. Surprised how many squeezed in! The exterior revolves which adds to the thrill and enables photographing if you can get near to the open window. Smooth fast ride to the top.Exciting when nearing the entrance at the top! pity you have to queue to come down too...but it was peak season!
Special. Revolving cars give you an all-round view of the city. Can be crowded but a good view is guaranteed.
Worth the money. We did not allow enough time for being on Table Mountain. A couple of hours is really a minimum for making the most of the walkways and views.

I love the openings in the gondola. the pictures you can take as it rotates aren't marred by trying to shoot though plexi-glass. There are 2 sections where they have left it open so you get gorgous shots.
Fast and efficient.. Not a fan of cable cars but this was fast efficient and staff friendly. Best way to see Table Mountain.

Lovely views. the queues are quite long to get on it, but as long as it is a clear day on the way up the views are fantastic, make sure the fog (table cloth they call it) isn't covering the top or you will see nothing, it is weird being above some of the clouds and when your up there it is very noisy with the wind, you can wonder off and walk around and back down if you want to, make sure you don't miss the last one down as it is a long walk.
Best views. Great view of Cape Town and the oceans. The bar up top is a nice place to relax and enjoy drinks.

Stunning Views!!. We climbed Table Mountain a few days ago and by the time we reached the top we deserved a medal. We took the gorge route to the left of the cable car which comprises of a 1.5-2 hour climb up what can be described as a very long staircase. I would recommend this to the fit as its quite a steep and physical climb, especially at 11am in 28 degree heat!!! Take plenty of water and glucose drinks or sweets as there is minimal shade on this hike.  We did however pick a perfect day to arrive at the top as the views were unbelievable especially after our well deserved beer!! We opted for the cable car down which was of great pleasure after our hike. If you plan on taking the cable care up I would advise pre booking your tickets and arriving early or in the afternoon as when we started our climb around 11 the queues were very long. All in all a must see if visiting Cape Town.

A must!. The scenery, the experience and the trip are all outstanding. The restaurant at the top is good for pizza & a beer with a view to die for. If you are going to Cape Town, do not miss this experience as you will always remember it. Another one to tick of the bucket list !
Go early in the day!. Enjoy Table Mountain in the Morning, but mid afternoon it's hot and hazy. Bring water and food and enjoy a picinic at the top!
Great. Don't get there too early - that's when the biggest queues are - try for later in the day

Worth the long wait on perfect days. Amazing views and well worth the money. Cable car fantastic
just as good as any cable car in World
great view around sun set. there are long queues.. make sure to go early.. to see the sunset and night sky and city view is also great

Awesome experience. It was truly an amazing experience to take the Cable Car up to the top of Table Mountain. It was the most modern and largest cable cars I have seen. Loved the revolving sides of the cable car that allowed us to see different views every few seconds. The view of the city and the ocean from the Cable car was quite amazing.

Extremely well run and efficient.. We didnt book in advance, so found an hours wait at the ticket office. It was extremely well run, and the time passed quickly. The whole experience getting on the cable car was efficient, and we found the area at the top of Table Mountain, very well organised with fantastic views of Cape Town.
climb-up- and cable car down!!. Wow- this is brilliant - but you must either walk up or down, able car only allowed one way!!

Just walk. Use it only if you don´t have enough time, weather conditions are not the best or you can´t physically make it at that moment. If you can, walk it because it is quite easy and gives you more time to enjoy the whole views
The easy way. Whilst a hike is available for me there is only one way to get up and down quick safe convenient and one car rotates to give a 360 view the easy way also for me the only way

Read the tips: it will save you time and money.. - Buy the ticket in advance: it will save you 15 - 60 minutes waiting in line to buy tickets (in the heat).- Call in advance if the cable car is open: when there is too much wind it is closed --> the website is not always up to date.- For cape town-people it is half prices (100 in stead of 195 Rand) when you go up after 18:00. If you are lucky you might fix it as a tourist as well! --> you can still take you walk; bring you bubbles, wine or some snacks and have you pick nick there while enjoying the sunset!!!
A fantastic way to see the city. The cable car is a excellent way to see the city. The rotating floor in the car means that wherever you stand you will get to see a panoramic view of the city

Great views, but dont go to restaurant. A must when in Cape Town, but extremely dissappointed with service in the restaurant. We waited for over half an hour for 3 cups of tea to be brought, then when we asked about it we received rude response. Never got the tea as we gave up waiting after 40 minutes. Advice - take your own drinks and snacks with you!
It works ok. Not sure what to say. It takes you up and down in a safe and cost efficient way.

Prebook Ticket!. it is rightly the number one attraction in Cape Town and we are so happy that we had pre booked and printed our internet tickets. it was a beautiful summers afternoon in Cape Town which afforded great views from the top but it also meant that everybody had decided that they should go up the mountain. It is a must do in Cape Town.
Top class. A great way to get to the top. A great way to see the peninsula
Spectacular views. Scenic ride to the top of Table Mountain. Great views of Cape Town and surrounding areas from the top. Very windy - be prepared. Worth doing.
Fast Way Up The Mountain. The aerial Cableway is a nice fast and smooth way to get to the top of Table Mountain.

The Most Beautiful Place in the World. The table mountain already looked beautiful from the bottom but when I got to the top, it was absolutely breathtaking! I've never seen anywhere so beautiful. I literally, couldn't believe my eyes standing on top of that mountain, looking down onto the lovely town of Cape Town. You can see the amazingly blue horizon of the sea! Apart from the view, the flowers up there were gorgeous! Great for people who love to take photos. There is really nothing to complain about except how freezing cold it was! So put on layers of clothes and gloves because you will need it.The experience was magical! I recommend everyone to go to this destination, you must put it on your list of 'things to do before you die'. It is seriously, Heaven on Earth!

A must when in Cape Town. Very modern and clean. Cost R200 per person. Parking can be a problem so a taxis will cost about R50-60 from centre which is worth the hassle of trying to get parked and a long walk. Staff great and when you get up there you do feel removed from everything. Shops, cafe and even small bar at the top. A must if in cape town.

Walk up / Cable down. If you are adventourous take the trail from onstantia nek and walk to the cable car roughly 2.5/3 hrs , magnificent views, altenatively walk up Platteklip gorge 1.5/2 hrs. Have a drink on the tble top with views to take your breath away of Cape Town. Then cable down. Taxis are available for the walkers. Pre buy tikets online, cheaper and saves time in the queues. Views are spectacular!

Transportation with a View. You don't have to take it if you hike up and down. We hiked up and took it down. It is full of people but the floor turns offering everyone a view. Most people it is the only way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Although I recommend you climb!
What an experience!. Didn't know beforehand that it rotated. Great scenery and a must. Moves up and down so quickly. Very efficient. Buy your tickets beforehand online and skip the queue.
Best in the world. This has to rate as one of the best run and managed cable-ways in the world. Great experience.
Awesome!. Get your tickets in advance online to avoid the queues.
Cable car to heaven. Gorgeous, lovely beautiful a definite must do when in CT! Try and do it on a clear day!!!
360 degree viewing. No need to fret about where you situate yourself in the tram as the floor is actually a truntable, so everyone is provided with 360 degree views.

A 'must do' but be prepared to queue if it's been closed for a few days.. 'Queue rage' abounded when we visited in November, everyone trying to push to the front; and when you are queueing on stairs this is no joke. I was on the verge of giving up but was glad I stayed the course as the views from the top are magnificent and not to be missed. As we were on an organised tour we had little time to spend walking around as we'd had to queue for over 45 minutes. The cable cars are very efficient, don't be put off by the fact they revolve as it's so slow it's barely noticeable, although don't try holding on to the handrails as it's the floor that moves! Overall a good experience but a little over priced.
Cableway to one of the wonders of the world. Very organised.It is spacious and what a view while going up

World class. In years gone by we would have to queue for hours to get a ride on the old, slower, smaller cableway. But today's cableway is efficient, modern, safe and it rotates! Queuing is really not an issue any longer as the whole thing is super efficient and the staff are responsible and really on the ball in getting you up and down safely and with minimal fuss. Remember it can be cold up there, always take a warm jacket or a windbreaker. A pair of binoculars is also worth taking along if you have them.
quick and fast. cable car takes 60 people at a time and takes 3 mins to the summit, so dont be discouraged by the queues

Best views in the city. Be sure to use this on a relatively clear and windless day. Wind could be a problem, even though the cars have a lot of ballist. You will be swept from a large urban environment to a beautiful prestine setting that is Table Mountain. Very highly recommended.

Aerial Cableway is the only way to get to the top of Table Mountain. Unless you want to hike up the mountain this is the only way to get to the top of Table Mountain. One interesting feature of the cableway is that the floor rotates as you go up/down the mountain so you get a 360 degree. This allows you to get good photos of all areas.

Don't miss this!. As you look at Table Mountain from the city you'll see thin wires going to the top...and then you'll see these tiny little things going up and down the wires. And if you're anything like me, you'll think "they'll never get me on that thing"!!! Especially once you realize that those tiny things are actually huge cable cars that....wait for it....SPIN as they're ascending! The whole idea of going up an enormous cliff face in a spinning cable car terrified me, but I was more afraid of missing out, so I stepped onto the cable car....and never regretted it! Yes, the car does "spin" - but very slowly so that you're not stuck looking at the cliff while the other side of the car enjoys the breathtaking view of the ocean. Once you're at the top you'll forget all about your fears because the view (yes, it's really high up) is just AMAZING! On a clear day you can see all the way down to the Cape of Good Hope in the distance! Whatever else you do in Cape Town, going to the top of Table Mountain is a MUST!
Massive queues.. Go very early or pre-book online, unless you like queuing in the burning sun.

Cable Car - a must do in Cape Town. Both tourists and locals would be doing themselves a disservice not to travel up the mountaiun by cableway at least once. Unfortunately this can be quite costsly for locals expecially for a family with small children but I do believe there is a reduced rate for them once the main tourist season is over. No matter where you stand in the car, due to the gentle rotation you will eventually have a 360 degree view of the pensinula as yiou climb.
Best mountain in the world. The backdrop of Cape Town, which in itself is a fantastic place, the mountain is accessable to all people, being walkers, climbers, etc. with a fantastic cable car ride.

Out of this world. Weather permitting an absolute must. Put it at no 1 on the list of things to do. If weather does not permit a trip up the mountain, drive along to Signal Hill and enjoy the views from there.
Stunning views of Cape Town. A state-of-the-art Cable Car takes you to the top of Table Mountain, where you can see Cape Town from all angles.
Above Cape Town. Great modern cable car that rotates as you climb the mt. The views from the top are spectacular. Very weather permitting.

Expensive for what it is. Having walked up I expected this to be a total treat. In a way it was a let down this was no leisurely trip this was very quick last just over a minute. The cab does rotate to give everyone the view but the cost of the journey I think is a little steep - no pun intended
Scary fun!. The tram is extremely safe-and extremely scary. They do a great job of shuttling through huge numbers of visitors every day. The tram rotates so everyone has a good view.
Nice ride. Enjoyed the ride, plus it was interesting watching the gondola rotate.... However, tix seemed a bit pricey....
Mostly closed and info not up to date. very average service, you call, they say it is open, you arrive it is closed...a tad frustrating
too windy on 3 occasions!. Well organised cableway and effecient personnel...but up the Table Mountain it was too windy on the 3 occasions we went there to take the cablecar! :(

A little gem. Although the cableway is a little pricey, it is still worth it. For those on a tighter budget, an option would be to hike up Platteklip gorge (starting behind the lower cable station) and then coming down using the cableway. The hike up (better done in a group with 3 or more people for safety) should take a person of average fitness around 2 hours to do. The cable car trip is amazing as the car rotates as it goes and you get to see the entire panorama. A trip down at around sunset (on a clear day) is truly an amazing experience with incredibly beautiful views.

Nice experience. A nice experience however you have to pick the right day....if it's too windy it closes....also the tablecloth (cloud) can affect it as well.I would suggest an early rise...assess the weather and if ok then get there asap otherwise it can get busy....a very popular attraction. Also take some warm clothing as if the cloud appears whilst your are on top then it can get quite cold.

Great views - take a jacket!. We did this on a sunny day. Blue skies and down the bottom it was really warm. Going up in the cable car was crowded. The floor moves so you get a full 360 degree view no matter where you first stand. There are a couple of open windows - and it was windy so we ended up freezing at this point! Up the top was also really windy and sunny - it was a cold wind though and we didn't come prepared with a jacket!Food at the top in the cafe was OK - good selection and reasonably priced (big slice of pizza was 25 R).The views were stunning. I think we were lucky it was such a clear day!! I would recommend it.
Queue jumpers!. It all worked out quite smoothly but some people will always jump the queue!

Cable to the top. What's amazing is when your in the cable car the floor rotates, so everyone gets to see all the views. Make sure you purchase e-ticket before or you have to queue for 60 minutes. Only 2 out of the 4 boothes were open.

If you are fit then walk up and ride down. We had already decided to walk up (Platteklip Gorge) and glad we did when we saw the huge queue. The gorge is very steep and can be very hot, so only go if you are fit and take plenty of water, sunscreen and wear a hat.If you want to go up by cable car then I think you can pre book, which is essential as the queues can get to 1 kilometre long!If you walk up you can buy a ticket at the top to come down, only a short trip but the car revolves and gives everyone a brilliant view.Always check, because the cable car does not run in high winds or bad weather.
Capetown,Nov 2011. Its a must see attraction. Check ahead of time if its open as its dependent on the weather. Tickets can be booked online ahead of time.
Birds eye view of Cape Town. The new cable cars are excellent. Staff friendly and awesome views over our home town

Well worth the ride up. They say you can hike up to Table mount if you like, but the ride takes just a few minutes using the cableway. It's very similar to Palm Springs, except the car rotates around slowly so you get a full 360 degree view
Unusually good cable car. $$$$$ but worth every nickel. The cabin rotates. Views outstanding
On a clear day. This is a must if you are in Cape Town. It's beauty encompasses the city.

A World Class View!. This is a 'must do' activity in Cape Town. We chose a mostly sunny day, the first during our visit. The lineup seemed long, snaking down the stairs, but because the cable cars hold 65 people, the lineup moved very quickly. The view going up the mountain was a little obstructed because I'm not very tall and I got in later - so I had to peer through people. Not to worry - the view at the top is so much better and everything I hoped it would be! Like everywhere else in Cape Town, staff people were very helpful and pleasant and moved the crowds along without seeming to. Highly recommended.
Easy way to go up. Dont walk up Table Mountain - tak ethe Cable Car. Great experience and if you have a nice driver, they tell jokes.

Too busy to take in the views. The cable car it too busy to take in the views and get a rewarding experience. If I did Table Mountain again I would want to walk it. Still you are treated to wonderful views from the top and it is worth it just for that.
Perfect. Perfect way to introduce yourself to Cape Town. Would have loved to hke it but didn't come prepared. Call ahead to make sure it's open.
great views. The floor rotates 1.5 times during the trip up and down. when you enter the cab stay near the wall or window for a great view. It is not open everyday and the queues get be long
Fantastic. Well organized and the rotating cable car gives everyone a fantastic view.
Good. The easiest way to get to the top to cable mountain, also it has great 360 degrees views since the cableway turns around itself.

Another must for anyone visiting Cape Town.. Hope you have enough days in your trip to take this trip because often the weather stops the cable car running. Always call them to be sure that it is running. It is very safe and run very well. Try taking the open top tour bus if you do not have a car.

one of memorable rides. we purchased the tickets through net before leaving for Cape Town. Though there were not many people on that day in que but as the rates are same so it really gives comfort. The travel to/from table mountain was really memorable
Table Mountain Cableway. Unbeliveable, circling whilst going up and down, brilliant chances to see everything around
table mountain cable. wow, this would be one of the most amazing cable rides, views spectacular, terrain awesome.
Wonderful view of the whole city. We went on the 1st day school was on break and it had been closed for 2 days due to fog so it was very crowded. It took well over an hour to get on the cable car.
Amazing views of the city. The best views of Cape Town only from Table Mountain!!!

Fantastic. What an experience,great views over Cape Town.
A great feeling to stand on top of one of the wonders of the world.

Reliability not god. When we finally got a clear day we headed to the cable car by taxi only to find when we arrived that the cableway was closed due to wind. It seems weather plays a big key on stopping the cableway running - not many people get to go up!
Long Wait, but worthwhile. Get your ticket ahead, and go on the first day that the weather is clear. We were in Cape Town for five days and on only one of those was the mountain clear.

A Great Experience. Fantastic views. Expensive though and the cable car itself did not rotate on the way up, but luckily did on the way down! Don't pre book tickets as you are never sure if you will be able to go up the mountain or not due to wind, storms etc. Queues are usually very long. We pre booked our tickets the first time, but could not go up the mountain due to heavy winds. We were however refunded!

Great Ride.. This fairly short, but extremely steep ride to the top of Table Mountain offers spectacular views over the city. The ride takes about 5 minutes and is incredibly smooth. Oh, and the floor revolves so you have a 360o view as you ascend to the summit. Of course, the views from the top are sensational. Worth taking this ride, but try to book on-line before you go as there can be queues for tickets. And, remember to check if it is running before you travel there as the wind can interrupt the service.

Wow. Thought this was amazing! Having got in to the car I thought I was on the wrong side to see the view. Anyway shortly after the car started we were asked to move away from the edge. Low and behold the car rotated so you could view absolutely everything!
Up High. The Cableway was a great experience.The queues are a bit long but the views on top of Table Mountain were worth it.We enjoyed the ride both ways.
Hold on. Fast and the spinning is ingenious so every "seat" is a winner
what a view. an great experience - I love the rotating floor in the cable car giving you a chance to see all round. The views are breathtaking
Rotating experience. Fast and efficient with a rotating car which allows everyone to see Cape Town below. Only problem is the weather when the cable car closes.
very good, very safe. Cableway was great but to all those uncomfortable with heights the floor does rotate. Get on quick to get a view by the window!
Birds Eye View. The cable car rotates 360 degrees during the trip up and down so you can see everything!

A must even if you chose to hike the mountain. This is the most stunning aerial cableway trip we ever had. It is a 360 degrees revolving cable car which provides you with images that you can't see otherwise and at some point you literary have the feeling that you fly over the rocks. You shouldn't miss this experience even if you choose to hike the mountain.
Wow. Definatly beats walking up the Mountain, amazing how it goes up on that angle with 65 people inside!!
Nice!!. Interseting experience,and it's safe... the carts are spacious and clean ,but it's kind of scary for those who have phobea to heights,as it's partially panoramic
Pick a day when its not covered in cloud!. I'm sure its a fantastic Mountain but it was so cloudy it was like scene out of Lord of the Rings!
Great fun. If there's no cloud, it's worth going as early as possible to avoid the crowds. And even on a sunny day, take a jumper as the wind can be chilly.
Stunning View. Worth going on the revolving cable car for the stunning views
A must do in Capetown!. If you don't visit any other spot, visit table mountain. The views are unparalleled, and the ride to the top is smooth and fast.

A well managed tourist 'must'. Table Mountain cableway is no newcomer to the Cape but the revolving cable car is a vast improvement on the old cramped car. The operation is slick and although there were big queue's it moved very quickly. The coffee shop at the top served a wide range of snacks and it was nice to be able to buy postcards and stamps to post whilst at the top, to the grandchildren back home.Only downer was the fairly long walk from the parking to the lower cable station. Not an issue if getting there by bus.

A must for Cape Town travelers. It's one of those "wonders" of the world. Even if you are not intrigued by the natural aspect, the views of the entire southern penninsula are fantastic. It's often cloudy or fogged in up there so if you see blue sky in morning, schedule the trip right away.

A must-do of Capetown, with caveats. The trip up Table Mountain is a "must do" of Capetown. The cableway is efficient, taking just a few minutes to get you to the top and a rotating floor in the cable cars means people don't cluster to get the best photo spot. Views are awesome across the bay, to Robben island and beyond. Couple of tips may help improve your enjoyment:- Its often cold and windy up there. Take a coat, even if it seems hot down below.- The top of the mountain has its own micro-climate, specifically cloud can form on the top which means you cannot see a thing. This can happen in a matter of minutes. So look up before you go and make sure you can see the top!- Buying tickets can take time. Better to do online ahead of time if you can (in our case, the hotel was happy to do this for us and saved a 30 minute queue)
Table Mountain Cableway. Very impressive. Book your tickets online, print them out, and by-pass the quese of people waiting to buy them at the ticket office.

Romance on the Mountain. We have never been to cape town and being our first time we wanted to see it all, and we did!Fresh off the plane first stop Table Mountain, it was a beautiful day in the "mother city" being scared of heights I thought I would not be able to do it. But holding the hand of my beloved we embarked into the cable car. Going up the cable car we saw the breathtaking views of Cape Town, its breath taking.Being on top of the mountain wow amazing especially with my special man. The views and visitor friendly, being unfit I was able to "trek" around the mountain. I am glad I found the courage to go up
It takes time. It takes time to get on the cable car. Staff could be more friendly

The easy way up to the top. We took the tram as we were short on time, this was our one free day on a business trip. Tram is crowded but you get great views. I rated average as the price is high for the trip, and would be costly for a family to pay to take the tram. The views from the top of table mountain are lovely.
Cable Car is awesome. Seriously a great way to go up and down Table Mountain - it takes your breath away!
A must see experience. The view is awesome and one of the things you should put on your "to do" list when visiting Cape Town. There might be a long que so its best to go early!
Beautiful!. You haven't seen Cape Town if you haven't seen it from the cableway. A must - especially if you're taking to red City Tours bus!

Crowded, busy but worth it. The overall experience of the cable car was underwhelming, as expected when 60-odd patrons are crammed into the car. The revolving floor was clever to ensure most got views, but it really is only advisable as transport to the top of Table Mountain for those of us too lazy to hike. The destination is worth the journey.
What a view!. Table Mountain is a destination you should not miss and getting there is half the fun! The cable cars are huge and comfortable with a million dollar view!

MUST DO THIS TRIP IN CAPE TOWN. Definitely worth the trip and the panoramic views from this iconic mountain top. The cable cars rotate during the ascent/descent so all the passengers receive good views. There are several walks available along the mountain top which are easily managed by all ages. There is a restaurant and gift shop at the top with some really great ideas for momentos. Bookings for the Cableway are best made 'online' as the costs are discounted and there is no need to queue at the booking office. Be careful where you park your car however if you are self driving as the unofficial traffic wardens will allow you to park illegally and you will be ticketed by the vigilant traffic police - not a nice end to an unforgettable experience. The costs of the ride have escalated a lot and a return trip for a family of four is available as a discounted offer.
Wonderful view. A must do for every visitor to Cape Town, we went up early morning on a beautiful Cape Town morning.
This is a must do!. Take the time and do this properly. Go on a sunny day and enjoy!

Great - must do (if you can). OK - everyone had warned us that it might be the case but it was day 4 of our trip before we were able to go up in the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. It is often windy &/or cloudy enough to prevent you from going up or from wanting to go up.Our kids (10&11 were very excited & LOVED the whole experience. I'm not great with heights but I still did it (& lived to tell the tale). Bubbly & a postcard at the top were my reward for being so brave (& not looking out on the way up).If you can do it, you really should. It doesn't cost a lot & the views of the city & harbour are stunning (even on the way up to the cable car).
Great View. Early morning or late afternoon - if it is open make the trip, do not wait for the next day, it may never come in your holiday.

Lazy option :0). We hiked up the mountain and got the cable car down, we paid 100R and it was a steady,comfortable descent. the floor inside the cable car rotates whilst in transit to ensure everyone gets a chance to see all the views

Scary but fun!. I'm afraid of heights but did okay in the cable car. The floor of the car turns around so everyone can get a 360 view on the way up or down. You also can squeeze a seat by the conductor where the floor doesn't rotate and you're in the center if you don't want to be close to the edge. Call ahead to be sure the cars are running because they can stop and start on a moment's notice depending on the weather.
Scary but excellent!. I'm rather a lazy person, so couldn't imagine myself hiking to Table Mountain, so I preferred taking the cable car. I can tell you this much: it was scary but excellent!
Round and round. The first time I've been in a cable car that revolves. Gives you amazing views on the way up to the top.

Ascent to the Heavens. Although the ride is only five minutes, the views are spectacular. The floor of the car rotates, but you can also stand in the center, which is slightly elevated and doesn't rotate. This allowed me to control the views I wanted to see and photograph. Because of winds, whether the cable runs changes from minute to minute. But it's an experience not to be missed. And the destination (Table Mountain) is awe-inspiring!

The best way to see Cape Town. A must for tourists and locals!. Taking the cableway is a fantastic experience. The cable car is modern and feels very safe. Staff are professional and friendly. The floor rotates allowing you to get views of both the mountain and the city below. Walking on the top of the mountain, looking down on the city, is simply a must for anyone who visits or lives in the city.You wont regret your ride!I would take something warm to wear, the altitude does drop the temperature somewhat.

Expensive but worth it if you're on limited time or lack the shape to climb. A 5-8 minute ride up the mountain for 95 Rand (Feb 2011) is a steep price to pay. However, the rotating floor allows all a very nice view of the mountain and city as you climb. Not much discount for the return trip either 190 Rand but then what choice have you got if your on a short trip in CPT and just trying to spend some quality time at the lovely Table Mountain while you've got chance. We recommend climbing the mountain as part of a half-day trip instead of the funicular if you've got the time, energy and shape. Its not that bad but your feel the ole tired legs on the walk back down to the city (recommend taking taxi back to your hotel). Also, check if the Cable Car is running, can be shut down on windy days, happens more than you'd like to beleive.

Great Views and a fun ride. Loved going to the top of Table Mountain. However, we were in Cape Town for six full days and only made the trip on the last day because it is closed a lot due to winds. If you are told it is open, change your plans and go so you don't miss this experience! The rotating cable car was amazing and the views at the top were fabulous. We walked a long way and didn't even take all of the walking tours. You could probably spend hours just doing that- A definite must-do in Cape Town.

Stunning views and definitely worth a visit. We lucked out with the weather and made it to Table Mountain on our first day in town. The views are stunning. The cable car line was long and the ride was crowded but it's definitely worth the hassle to go to the top. I think hiking it might be a more pleasant way but I'm not sure how long that takes!

Higher the better.... I happened to visit CapeTown in summers..2008!Taking a cable way up the table mountain was one experience where you feel like in an escalator taking you up to the heavens...AS the cable moves up...you can see the cloud cover approaching you and gradually coming beneath your feet...The hiking route has its own adventure but a cable way takes you up soo quickly as compared to the hike...and the view from above is soo majestic that hours and hours of walking wont fill your heart enough !
